reviews.review: Extraordinary . The restaurant is in an actual cave! Very romantic, great service, beautiful presentation of the dishes. We loved it!

Absolutely beautiful. Having dinner in a cave was so cool, the food was wonderful!
Made sure you take a taxi to this restaurant !

Presentation is all. Once again, after I swore I'd never go back to Alux Restaurant, I had the unfortunate experience of having dinner there again last night. My wife's sister was visiting from outta town and my wife insisted showing her the amazing cenote. Well my comments are the same the menu remained the same as my last as there were only two things on the menu for vegetarians. If you're vegetarian pleeeease don't go there. Its not so much how much variety you have, but rather what. I mean I felt for a pasta and all the waiter could offer me with it was butter on the pasta..can you imagine? So guess what, I ordered the Lasagna which I had the last time. Even my wife and sister who's not vegetarians were not impressed with the menu and what they ordered. I guess this very expensive restaurant what you're really paying for is the ambience of the cenote…"thats it"

Amazing. The review beneath is not correct at all. Taxis in Playa del Carmen are the cheapest i have taken anywhere in the world. I never paid more than 3 USD. Perhaps the reviewer wasn't aware that in Latin countries one has to set the price before you get in the cab. One has to learn the customs of the country one is visiting or subject yourself to ridicule. Second, many cultures eat grasshoppers. its not the end of the world. Anyhow, this restaurant is lovely, it is a real cave, yes it is dark but our waitress made sure to shine her flashlight on all our dishes when they arrived and explained what everything on them was before we ate. This is a real cave, so it is a bit damp/humid, however the restaurant has AC and fans going on full blast so that customers don't feel hot. Everything was lovely, the service was attentive but not annoying, the music playing on the speakers was lovely-jazzy slowed down versions of popular pop songs- and then a live musician came out with his guitar (we went on a tuesday night) we made a reservation and good thing we did as the restaurant filled up quickly after 7pm. The food and drinks were expensive yes, however everything was of the highest quality. I never eat at fine dining locations because I'm cheap and not fussy, however it was a birthday occasion so we picked something "fancy"; the food and drink were worth the price. I ate the wild pig and it was insanely good, the mashed potatoes with cheese were next level amazing. My friends had the surf and turf and the cowboy steak, huge portions. Spent about 200USD on three people, 3 entrees, two drinks and two deserts+a generous tip. They gave the birthday boy a free desert. This is a complex and there are several areas, a bar, a restaurant, a lounge with a stage. During the week when we were there only the restaurant/bar were open. There are some folks dressed in traditional Mayan gear at the entrance and will take a picture (For money). Verdict: yes its pricey, but its not average food/drink; this is a "once in a lifetime" kinda thing, very cool to try/experience, worth the extra money for those that are hesitating due to price. how often can you dine in a legitimate cave?

Must See to Believe. This restaurant is amazing. The cost of the food is a little pricey but well worth it for a special occasion. You have to see it to believe the beauty of this place. The service and food was excellent.

OVER CHARGED. a party of two went to this place and was over charged by £200 and was told they cant refund the money and thet ild have to contact my bank to claim it back the young lads on the tills certainly knew they were over charging me which makes me think there is a scam going on here DO NOT...

27th Anniversary Dinner.. We were there on Friday October 7th, 2016. We were celebrating our 27th Wedding Anniversary with some Honeymooners from England that we met at our resort. The atmosphere at Alux is fantastic. The food is very good as well. A little pricey though. But well worth it for a special occasion. Here is a tip..... Get the ice cream for desert! Mmm.... Mmm.... Mmm.....

Amazing setting. Fantastic setting but food and service let it down,to start we ordered starters in a party of ten only nine came out was told other was on its was turned up as main course and no main course for that person.Three of our party ordered lasagne big mistake no cheese no pasta ??? Just tomato purée poured over veg and yes strawberries??? Those of us who had steak very tough and full of grizzle pity really as setting is perfect

Sooooo WOW,. While I have dined around the world this was the most exotic and unique place ever! The different rooms underground were expertly lit to showcase the stalactites and different rock formations. The drinks were good and so was the food. There was a guy dressed like a Mayan warrior outside we took a picture with that was definitely FB worthy.

Magical Dining Experience . This restaurant was recommended by a hotel concierge and we had no idea what to expect! The food, the service and the magical cave were something I will never forget! Rose petals were scattered around our table and the lighting was very romantic. We had our favorite champagne and ate from the exotic pleasures menu of Mayan influenced food. The meal wax amazing, the service attentive and sift instrumental old standard jazz wafted through the cave adding to the magic. I highly recommend this magical dining experience.

Amazing experience!. What a beautiful, exotic and romantic place! Service was slow. drinks very expensive.Molecular drinks were awesome!Beer was not very Cold.The place is too humid because it is a cave, not enough flow of air. one of The people in our group started with alergies so We had to leave and Could not try The food.We did make sure to walk around before We left and it was magical!We took some photos but they don't do justice to The magic of The place!For sure we Want to come Back and try The food, and have some more of those molecular drinks!!
Diner. Good food with an amazingly romantic atmosphere. We had the surf and turf for two. Generous portions more than enough for three!

Interesting interior. The cave experience of Alux is interesting. It is not for anyone unsteady on their feet as you go down uneven steps and low ceilings. It is a cave setting with upscale food. The menu is interesting but just didn't mesh with the setting for me. The service was attentive and then very slow. Our food was fine but the whole experience didn't match the price we paid.

Great dining spot. This is probably the best steak I have ever had in my life! The last time I had a steak so tender and juicy was in Ipanema Brazil! The drinks were great. The atmosphere was very nice and there is a tour after you eat. The price per meal is high for Playa standards, but comparable to Houston, Texas. I had the Cowboy steak and my wife had the Surf and Turf and with our multiple Mai Tai's and tip our bill only came to $100 USD. Must stop destination in Playa!

Different experience . I saw the reviews here and thought we'd check it out. It is a very nice restaurant and a delightful experience. Our waitress was super nice and answered all our questions. The prices are a bit high compared to the restaurants on 5th Ave. My husband and I had been eating for an average of $500 pesos on 5th Ave. Here we had no appetizers, 2 alcoholic drinks, 2 entrées (the less expensive about $350, there are some that are $1300 for 2 people), no dessert and it came to $1,144 with the tip which they include. The food was good, but it was not your usual large portion. It was fresh and hot.

Cool Experience. The restaurant is an experience that you should not miss. There are many rooms that would be great for large parties, a cool bar area, and water running throughout. If you have never been in a cave or like fun dining experiences, it is a must see. The entrees were excellent as were the drinks, and the price was reasonable.

Great experience. Awsome place, and ultimate experience if you one a have dinner inside a cavern. The food and the service is exeptional. Is not in the turist street. But if you come to playa del carmen you need to go

Dinner in a CAVE! Cool Experience!. Wife and I had drinks and appetizers at this unique restaurant nine years ago and said we have dinner when we returned, and we did. This time with our family - 10 of us total. Cocktails and appetizers were wonderful. Main courses - all were satisfied...they even accommodated my grandson with chicken fingers.... and, of course, the unique atmosphere of eating in a cave. If you go to Playa del Carmen, check out Alux.

Awesome Concept. I really enjoyed the atmosphere. It's a different dining experience. Not your typical brick and mortar restaurant. I loved it. The decor was really gorgeous. I liked the fact that each dining section gets a name. If you r looking for a private dining experience whether in a group or just your date, there r areas to fit the need. I came with a large group so we were seated in an area to fit our group. But I saw a little nook and it was for two. So romantic! There are sofas next to the dining area as well. So if you eat to much, you can take a nap on it lol As for the food, it was ok. I'd come for drinks but not for food.

Best kept secret in Playa del Carmen!. We would go back to Playa del Carmen just to go to this restaurant again, the ambiance, food and service were all excellent, it was one of the high points of our trip! Low points actually, as it is located in a subterranean cavern, beautifully lit with dramatic lighting, you feel like you are stepping down into another planet. There are various sizes of private "rooms" if you want to have a party, or romantic dinner just the two of you. So if you have a special event, or even if you don't, take a taxi to this place, it's not in the tourist district but is well worth the 150 pesos to get there, and they will have a taxi waiting for you when you get out.

Eh wouldn't go back. Communication with the reservation was awesome! Restaurant atmosphere was cool! But the food was not good😞 everything was bland tasting to include the alcoholic beverages. The pork chop was the only good thing. Would definitely not come back and everything is way overpriced!

Amazing place to celebrate our anniversary!. Wow, what a unique and cool place this is! Having dinner and drinks in an underground cave with a cenote and stalagmites is a once in a life time treat! The service and food were excellecnt. This is a must do for anyone coming to Playa del Carman. It is just a quick taxi ride from Playacar or PDC. Highly recommend!
a unique place worth a visit. I love to take people there and not tell them any details as it blows their mind overtime. It is not to be expected at all.

INTERESTING BUT TOO HOT!. Had heard so much about this place decided to try it. Went about 5-ish. A little on the pricey side. Drinks were 150 Peso. Was so hot and humid. D efinitely needed more ventilation! Atmosphere was very cool though, our party of five would not go back. Maybe later in evening would be much cooler. Give it a try you might like it.

"there isn't any". Although I've been to Alux four times having taken guests as the ambience is so amazing, I have to say each time I went I was disappointed. My last visit was the worst as everything I asked for they did not have. I am a vegetarian and looking at the menue was my first disappointment. There were maybe two options open to me which was Veg Lazzanga and some other thing, can't remember the name, but was supposed to be a chile stuffed with vegetables which the waitress highly recommended. However, when it was brought to the table, I was left looking for the chili in the dark as what was brought to me looked like an exotic Burrito stuffed with vegetables. In addition, when we sat at the table, a glass of water is yet to be served. After the meal, I asked for decaf coffee and was told "there wasn't any", I asked for ice cream and was also told "there wasn't any". I mean what restaurant doesn't serve ice cream? By this time, I had enough of the"there isn't any" and just wanted to leave. I believe the reason I have been four times, was because I had guest and wanted to show them the undeniable amazing ambience of the place..

Best Kept Secret!!. I saw a review for Alux on Trip Advisor and decided to make reservations for coffee and dessert one evening while on vacation. I could not believe that this place was in Playa del Carmen all this time and we never came across it before. My husband and i first discovered the caverns and cenotes in Mexico about 8 years ago. When I saw that this restaurant was in a cavern I knew we had to go.The menu online shows the wild game specialty dinners so I didn't realize they had other dishes. If I had seen the entire menu online I would have booked dinner too. The cavern has many private dining areas, romantic or party- both can be easily accomodated. You will never experience a dining atmosphere like this. I suggest you stop in for a drink, coffee, a meal, or dessert. It was a fabulous experiece. and the dessert was awesome.

¡Hola Ambience!. Alux is such a unique, lovely dining experience with beautiful food! We shared a surf and turf dish, selected the white wine from Transylvania, and received a surprise dessert! Waitstaff "Laura" was very personable with a Light that filled the cave. Such a blessed night in so many ways! Highly recommended!

Unique experience. Was a great experience. So not typical of my Playa del Carmen time. The food is different so be prepared and have an open mind. I highly recommend going if you want to experience something different or just to see the cenote.

Must see!. This place is gorgeous and a beautiful experience from the entrance to the deliciously crafted cocktails to the atmosphere! We went here for drinks and we were amazed by how delicious the drinks were. The place is gorgeous!!! You can walk around the cavern and they have the lighting displayed perfectly to make it a fun adventure to explore the beautiful surrounding! Just beware, there are bats! It's their home and a few may flutter by while you enjoy a delicious hazelnut cocktail:)

Go for the atmosphere, not the food. You would never think that there is a cave in the area of town this is in. We've never been to a restaurant like this. It's pretty amazing. We had a private vault that was covered with rose petals for an extra $30. The cocktails were so cool. The food was in the largest portions. The seafood salad was a full entire size. The lobster was overcooked. The beef was alright though. Walking around this place is very cool. It's very hot and humid inside.

A Must Go! . This restaurant is one of a kind, obviously! We got a table next to a Cenote with lights that changed colors to make the water in the cavern glow. It was just really perfect for a romantic dinner for my husband and I. They allow you to go around the whole cavern to explore, and man is it neat. They have private tables setup all over that are so exotic looking with extra large candles. There is a dark cave with candles lit that is almost spooky. So, it's not just a restaurant but a genuine site to explore. The food is excellent too. I got the beef medallions with potatoes and they put an incredible spin on it. I can still taste the buttery potatoes with a hint of tangy pepper, mixed with my rare bite of tender beef. The sauce was super yummy! Keep up the good work guys of making the food delicious. Service was excellent too by our polite English speaking waitress. I would have probably enjoyed hot dog in this atmosphere, but they really do their best to make everything perfect!

Unreal! A chamber of caves and food is good.. I was blown away by the atmosphere. The service was outstanding and the food was good. I had the Mayan Sacrifice. Chicken breast stuffed with herbs and goat cheese and the passion fruit cocktail. This is a not to be missed experience.

The Perfect Proposal. I came to Playa del Carmen for a week long vacation with my girlfriend. I was planning to propose to her and was doing a lot of research to get ideas of where/when to do it. We always try to go to one very unique restaurant on each vacation and Alux was unlike any place either of us had ever seen. I knew it would be the perfect place to propose. I contacted the restaurant on a Sunday and the public relations manager, Alejandra, got back to me almost immediately, asking what I was looking to do, when I wanted to do it, and the various options for dining areas that were available. I was recommended to rent a private room (very reasonably priced) and to let Alux Restaurant handle to rest. Alejandra told me "everything would be fine"; and it was. Actually, the proposal was perfect! We walked into the restaurant and the hostess brought us to the private room, which had been lit with candle light and covered in rose petals. I gave the ring to our waiter and we enjoyed a few drinks and dinner while taking in the amazing atmosphere provided by the restaurant. After dinner, the waiter and busboy cleared the table and brought out the dessert plate. He took off the cover and on one side was the dessert, and the other was the ring. He even took pictures with our phone so we would never forget the proposal. My fiance was SO surprised and we could not have been happier with the outcome. The next day, Alejandra emailed me to ask how everything went and was very happy to hear my response. Thank you, Alux Restaurant for helping to make this happen!

Stunning view!!!. We went to Alux because it was recommended by my sister and by others on Trip Advisor. Trip Advisor has never failed us :)This restaurant is beautiful from the inside. When you first walk to the very front of it, you think, "What? This can't be it?" But as soon as you walk in, you're greeted by Aztec warriors (yes, it's just a costume). And then you walk down the stairs into this beautiful place. The food was really good. I wish I could remember the name of the plate I ordered. It had lobster, shrimp, and steak with delicious vegetables and mashed potatoes. The drinks were pretty strong as well.As we waited for the food, we walked into the cavern and explored it. Make sure to bring a camera and take lots of pictures. It was breathtaking to see God's creations. I live in Houston, Texas and if this restaurant existed here, it would cost you at least $100-150 per plate. We paid a total of $85 for myself, my husband, and my son. Please note, my husband and I shared the plate because it was a lot of food. The price was completely worth it. I went in there thinking we were going to spend approximately $300 judging by the looks of this beautiful place, so when we got the check I was like, "Is that it?" Totally worth the price and the view :) PS: This place is located on a pretty busy street. Make sure to use google maps to find it. As mentioned before, you won't think you're at the right place when you arrive because it doesn't look this fabulous from the outside. Hope this review helps you. Please feel free to email me if you have further questions. Thanks.

Something Different. Went for the first time with friends. Atmosphere was amazing! Food and drinks not so much...it's ok, just not great. Didn't offer a lot of things on the menu. Wines by the glass tasted stale. Service was good. Must be having air conditioning issues. Hot & uncomfortable inside the cave. Standup circulating fans everywhere?

Magical Atmosphere. Must see cavern in the heart of Playa del Carmen! The atmosphere is so unique. Reservations suggested. Get there a half hour early and walk freely through the caves to explore each area. Food was okay. If I had it to do over we would eat elsewhere and just have drinks here. The food wasn't bad but there are better choices I feel.

Impressive as sightseeing- food not sure. The restaurant is very unique- it is in a cavern, the ambience and decoration is very romantic and quite elegant in a way. The service is fantastic and very quick ( some people had complained in trip advisor that they serve the main within seconds from finishing the starter. This is true. If you like a pause between courses I recommend you request this in advance).The cocktails are very good- I tried the rose petal martini and I recommend it.After dinner we walked around the caverns including the private rooms. It is actually a huge place with lots of potential!The food portions have a nice size but the food could be better. Starters were just ok. Mains.. A bit dissapointed.. The pasta was very overcooked and the chicken was undercooked ( they kindly cooked it further for us). We did not complaint as we went there already knowing from other reviews food was not great. We were there for the experience, not for the food. If the food was better this would be a massive hit in Playa del Carmen for everybody to talk about it!I would go back if I was to show the place to people who has not yet been there but we would probably just have a couple of starters and drinks and go somewhere else for dinner.I would give it a four star as an experience but a two star as a restaurant.

Just fabulous. This is the place that transport you to another place in the mythical world of the Mayans they do a fabulous show after you finish your meal and besides of that they have all kind of dishes from this region, its a must after a day in Playa

Unique experience. We went for dinner at Alux during our last visit to Playacar. It is really unique and great experience if you get the chance I would highly recommend going. The food was very good and huge portions. They had a specialty drink menu and the wine was also great. We had a chance to explore the cave following dinner. The service was fantastic as well. Overall it was a truly enjoyable experience!
Very cool! . The cave is amazing. Awesome experience. It can be warm, dark, and wet, but it comes with the territory. Food is ok, specialty drinks are good. A must see!

Experience. Food: fine - surf and turf is great
Cocktails: tasty - falling in love with spicy rosemary
Ambiente: magnificent, mystical, great... <3

Beautiful cave for relaxing with drinks. It's quiet and semi-dark, so you really feel like you're in a cave. Take a walk around the lighted pathway and return for a drink in the lounge. The restaurant fills up, so make a reservation if you want to stay for dinner.

Fantastic!!!!!. 5 stars all the way around!! The food, the decor and the atmosphere were all stellar.
You are literally inside a cave. There is a full bar and cool waterfalls and nooks for dinner.
There are a variety of choices on the menu. I chose the Duck and it was phenomenal
Great for all ages and tastes.

A Real Treat. This a very unique and interesting restaurant. It is underground in a cave. The food was excellent, I had the cenote duck and my husband had the beef medallions. Our server Enmanual was excellent, informative and spoke perfect English. We had an early seating so the restaurant was not very crowded. They do not allow children after a certain hour, which makes for a very quiet dinner. When we first got there they had just opened for the evening and there was kind of a funky smell, but that went away after a little while. It is very dark, we had to use our cell phones to read the menu. I had accessed their website before going so we pretty much knew what was on the menu. You are can walk around the restaurant and take photos and videos. It is very interesting. If you are looking for a unique dining experience, this is a definite.

Unique Atmosphere is a must see!. After reading about Alux on BuzzFeed, we visited last week and it does not disappoint! It was super fun to look around at the amazing unique spaces they have created. We had a wonderful waitress (I didn't get her name) who was very knowledgeable and we enjoyed hearing some background information and history of Alux. The food and service were great. Take time to walk around and you will be glad you did! So glad we visited.
Awesome Dining Experience. Read about this restaurant on a Buzz Feed quiz and just had to check it out. It did not disappoint!! The atmosphere, service, and food are not to be missed.

Cool place to eat and food was OK. Really beautiful cave and had fun exploring the many rooms. Food was good and the service was friendly but slow. Nice change from the all inclusive resort for one night.

Eating in a Cave....with bats. What is a cave? It's underground (no moving air), musty smelling (fancy basement). Food tasted very good (had to use my cellphone light to see it) Wait staff was just a bit inattentive.

Outstanding atmosphere, excellent food and drinks. Recommended!. This restaurant and bar operates within a natural cavern, making it a unique place for a special dinner.The cavern complex is quite large and beautifully illuminated. Tables are spread between the main dining cavern that features a Xenote, and smaller sitting areas surrounded by stalactites/stalagmites in current formation.Service was excellent and very prompt, despite the fact that there was a large group sitting next to us who ordered at the same time.Food quality and taste were outstanding, and drinks were well prepared.Owner Rolando Calderon was sitting next to us, constantly supervising that everything ran smoothly. He told me about the effort that had gone into setting up the restaurant, and it definitely shows that it is a work of love.Make sure to reserve with time. For a romantic dinner, reserve one of the intimate tables within the cavern complex. We didn't have wine, but the selection within the Cava was excellent. Walk the interesting cavern complex after dinner. Don't be surprised if you see a bat or two - you are a guest in their millennial home.Highly recommended! A definite must if you are in the area! I agree with the ratings showing Alux as one of the top bars in the world.

Most incredible dining experience ever!. We had heard about Alux from one of the couples on an excursion we did – they raved about it. So we took a Collectivo from the Barcelo Maya into Playa. We arrived on time and entered through the front entry down the stairs. The hostess in the beautiful lounge area walked us over to our table. I tell you, my mouth was wide open as she walked us to our seats. INCREDIBLE is all I can say.This is a truly spectacular venue and so unique. There are different colored lights the light up various coves and grotto’s throughout the cenote. There was also a lovely little waterfall. After we ordered drinks and our meals we were told we could explore – I recommend anyone going there should take the chance to explore. It seems to go on forever with tons of secret little lounge areas with amazing chandeliers hanging from the cenote ceiling. Our food was amazing. We had the goat cheese peppers to start. My husband had the stuffed chicken and I had the duck. It was all delicious. While we ate there was really funky lounge music playing.If you can only eat at one restaurant in Playa Del Carmen, I suggest this be your selection. One thing to note – it was very warm so make sure you’re not dressed too warmly. They have fans blowing but it was still pretty steamy!It's on the pricier side - over $100 for the two of us but well worth it.
Birthday celebration . Just amazing. Don't miss this beautiful restaurant if your in Mexico. Unique beyond your expectations. It's not expensive and food is of excellent quality .

The most beautiful restaurant I've ever been to!. The food, wait staff, ambience were above any expectations I had. Children under 12 are not allowed in after 6:30 pm. We had two young children and made our reservation for 5 pm. We stayed until 7 with no problem.

Atmosphere and Food. This is the second time we have been to this restaurant and the food was delicious the ambience was unbelievable! The service superb!
We have a time share in the area and we always go here well worth the whole experience!

AMAZING atmosphere and food. Need to take a cab here and need a reservation. This place is amazing. The cave setting is so unique. Food is fantastic and service too. No wine menu, but you go to the wine room and pick your bottle. After dinner make sure you walk around and self tour!

Unique dining. I've never been to a restaurant like this in all my years of dining. It's actually set up in a cenote, with tables in various areas of the cave. We were a party of eight and got a round table (a rarity in Mexico) and the service was fine, except our wait for coffee was prolonged. The food was beautifully presented. Flank steak was tough, but other dishes were very good. Prices were reasonable ($65.) couple without liquor. Worth trying for the experience.

A Must See Experience. Would rate at 5 stars for the experience -- eating at the bottom of Cenote. Very attentive wait staff (Anna). Lovely presentation of dishes.Chicken was delicious. "Beef medallions" very tough -- I think they were flank steak or something similar. Certainly not tenderloin. No wine list -- instead you get a guided tour of the wine cave to select a wine. Interesting cocktail menu, but difficult to select because of unfamiliar ingredients. Did not offer traditional Mexican drinks (at least on drink menu). Recommend:- Don't overdress. We expected to be chilly underground, but instead it was rather warm/ humid. Fans going everywhere. - Ask for a table near a fan and with good lighting - Take a cab (pronounce the name "Ah-loosh") for 100 pesos.- Walk all around the cave after your meal.

Cenote dining!. If you have the opportunity to visit this restaurant do. It was a very unique experience.An underground cave with stalactites and stalagmites and private intimate dining areas as well as main dining areas that were also intimate and tables were not crowded together as they so often are.The service was excellent! Our young server was delightful and attentive pouring or serving without any hesitation. The offer to choose our wine from the wine cellar was particularly unique as it was small but so nicely presented.Food here is very very good. The choices were varied, flavours worth savouring and beautifully presented.And surprisingly the tab was most reasonable for a meal and experience of this quality!!Would go again in a minute!

Amazing. You must go here. What a fun experience and great food and service. It is truly a unique place and reasonable. Only about 1 mile from 5th ave between two businesses so is quite a shock when you enter into a cave..try the stalagmite peppers with goat cheese!!

You HAVE to go to this Restaurant in a Cenote!. We came here on a recommendation, and were SO glad we did. As you walk through the labyrinth of rooms, each laid out in the individual rooms in the cavern, you are amazed and delighted. The food was Unbelievable - order the Sea Bass if it's available, and the price was Very reasonable. Highly Recommended!

Amazing Service, Local Wine, and Incredible duck and desset!. I took my boyfriend Nelson here for his birthday, without telling him at all what we were getting into. And he was absolutely blown away! I couldn't of asked for a better night out!Laura our Waitress was so amazing, attentive, adorable, enthusiastic and was clearly in love with her job. She explained the history of the cavern passionately. What an amazing place! Even if you are not spiritual you can't deny the magical aura that emits from this place!The Duck was the most amazing fowl dish I`ve ever had. And this is saying a lot as I am a total foodie! Tender duck served in a cranberry and strawberry sauce. Nelson had the beef and pawn dish. His steak was cooked perfectly, his prawn was massive! The presentation/plating was also DIVINE!Laura also treated us to an amazing display of fire when serving us our birthday dessert on the house! Flaming ouzo, poured over a lime crumble with starfruit and vanilla ice cream. Absolutely marvalous.Our Waitress also recommended us a fabulous local rose wine after listening to my preferences. (not too dry, sweet as can be) I'll be looking at all my specialty import wine sections at home for this. I'll be quite sad if I can't find it!Laura was the greatest <3 This place is so spectacular just on it's own, but Laura took it up a notch. If I could give more than 5 stars I would!Thank you Laura, and the talented chefs at Alux. I don't know how I'm ever going to top this Birthday surprise for Nelson ever again. I guess we'll just have to come back every year! ;)Love Krysta and Nelson

Coolest restaurant I have ever eaten in - great service too!. The atmosphere is unlike anything I have ever experienced and the service was beyond what we expected as our server provided us with a tour of all of the areas in the cave and provided us with some history to boot! The food was really delicious and we felt the value was quite good too. This is an experience not to miss - especially if you have a special occasion!

Alux, Don't miss out on this restaurant. We heard about this restaurant from our family who had been there previously. We were extremely excited to have a beautiful dinner there under some amazing geological formations. Scenery wise, you cannot beat the surroundings of this beautiful restaurant. The atmosphere was wonderful and the local entertainment from the guitar player/singer only added to the already incredible experience. Our food was "ok". we ordered the special and unfortunately, were not overwhelmed with the quality. The food was "warm" but not hot and the shrimps were extremely overdone and dry. Next time, I think we would choose something other than the special. Other reviews have said the food was amazing and I would definitely give the staff a second chance. The staff and waiters there were very attentive and kind. Our dinner with drinks came to just over $100 U.S.Don't miss out on this experience if you are in Playa.

Great experience . We went to Alux for Valentine's Day dinner and from the moment you walk in its WOW. This place is amazing. To have a 5 star restaurant down in a maze of caves is very impressive. Make sure you take the tour after dinner. They have the main dining room and a lot of private caves all dressed up for a romantic dinner. The food is also 5star with a wine cellar like I've never seen before. It's a once in a lifetime experience when your in Playacar.
very cool. what a great dining experience. a hidden treasure in Playa. If you haven't been....just go. It's worth the time!

Beautiful. A must see place for dinner. Good food. Great service and the whole thing takes place in a cenote. Do not leave without looking throughout the whole cavern. We went through twice and I still didn't want to leave. Take your camera.
Beautifu, hidden gem. Group of 9 in our party. Great service, delicious food. Wonderful ambience. The restaurant could share the history and a tour after dinner which can lead you to the lounge.

You have to eat here!!!!. At the recommendation of many locals and resort regulars, we went to Alux to celebrate my wife's special Birthday. (29 yet again) What an atmosphere right at the entrance and no fear of claustaphobia as the cavern is large and very brightly lit by candles and electric lights. Easy to get to, we were seated right away and in a secluded romantic area and enjoyed the most wonderful service and meal of our trip. We had the surf and turf platter that included many lobster tails, shrimp, 2 Fila and 2 flank steaks as well as all the fixings. Including wine, the premium seating and tip was less then half the cost of the resort surf and turf option. Service was in English and everyone was so helpful and pleasant. Only a small down point is the washrooms are in need of updating.

Very different & lovely. We had a wonderful experience at Alux. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was great. I would ask to be sat at an out of the way area in the cave to make it an even better experience. We had requested the cenote area and that was really the main room. Deeper in the cave are more intimate tables. It was our 40th anniversary and we were surprised with a really unusual dessert. We would definitely go back!! Thank you, Alux.
Put this on your things to do list!. This was a fantastic dining experience and everyone should go there not only for the great food but for the beautiful ambience.

Wow - so cool!. Stayed at Gran Porto at 5th ave and cabbed over to Alux for a cocktail before dinner one evening. Less then 10 min cab ride. Wow - very cool indeed. We never had anything to eat, but it was worth the cab ride to just go for a drink and walk around the cave and see all the nooks with dining tables or seating set up. Prices were reasonable when viewing the menu. Definitely one of the coolest places I've had the pleasure of having a drink at. Next time, hopefully will go for dinner.

Outstanding Dining in a Beautiful Cave. This is an outstanding dining experience in a gorgeous cave setting. We took a 10 minute taxi ride to the location from Fifth Avenue in Playa del Carmen. I would describe this as fine dining with surf and turf choices. The portions are quite generous and the price was approximately $125 US for two people and 3 courses and a bottle of wine. The food was expertly prepared with their own sauces and recipes. We chose our own bottle of wine from their private wine cellar. The service was very attentive. It was nice and quiet and we could easily have a nice conversation during our meal without being disrupted. This is an unforgettable dining experience.

Weird Place.... We were told what a great restaurant this was, actually that it was the best restaurant in Playa. It's in a cave which was really cool..but.... the service was poor, the food sucked and I couldn't wait to get out of there!!

Must visit on the other side of Route 307. This is an extremely unusual and rewarding restaurant experience in an unexpected locastion. We found an ad for it in 2014 in a touristic/shopping part of Playa del Carmen, which tends to be located in a close proximity to the beach. Conversely, Alux is on the other side of Carretera 307 and anyone who traveled this road knows that resorts are located on one side of it and cenotes plus caves and underground river parks - on the other. Alux is exactly this - a restaurant within a significant cenote/cave structure and is therefore just great place to be in and to walk around. However, there is no way I would be writing this review had the food also not been absolutely excellent (and inventive). There are many things to try (we had a party of six the first time and a party of eight, when we returned there in 2015 and everyone was quite satisfied with his/her meal). Cocktails are priced very reasonably (especially compared to Playa's 5th Avenue) and Mayan Coffee is a must. This is a very short ride from downtown hotels and Playacar resorts.

Unique atmosphere . We were a small group of 5, 3 adults a teen and a child-we loved our Christmas dinner! This is an experience like no other! We made a reservation online and arrived a bit early. We found parking in front of the restaurant. We made our way down to the restaurant and we were pleasantly amazed at what we saw. Our waitress was pleasant and great at explaining our meals, she guided us around our plates by flash light with careful details about all the items on our plates. The food was delicious. He staff was wonderful. We all enjoyed our time at this restaurant.

An experience not to be missed!. We had Christmas dinner at this very unique restaurant, on our final night in the Riviera Maya. On a scale of 1-10, I would rate it 15! Excellent service and food, with exquisite ambience. Good for families, but equally good for a romantic dinner for two.

Beautiful ambiance - very unique restaurant. The restaurant is inside a cenote, each table nestled in a small area of the cave. It's well-lit and a beautiful ambiance. The service could have been a little bit friendlier but the food was quite good. A great restaurant for a romantic or family dinner, and they also have larger tables for bigger groups.

Not quite a pilgrim Thanksgiving, but great fun!. Alux Caverna is a place of wonder and amazing ambience. To get out of the cab onto this nondescript street and through the gate,,,to where the adventure begins. You walk down, down, down into the earth and find yourself at a hostess station from where you are led through room after room to a table under a crystal chandelier. The food was good, but it really could have been bad and you would still have had a great experience. We had our Thanksgiving meal here, hoping to forget we were doing without the stuffing this year, and couldn't have been happier with the choice. The lighting was subtle colors that pulled you into anti-rooms that were wine cellars, lounge areas and many other dining rooms. Then, just after dinner, the live music started which, with a Drambuie and coffee, was the perfect nightcap. Although a bit pricey, but nothing like the prices at the Caves in Jamaica. And, the staff was super. They accommodated two youngsters who were kind of over trying new foods and wanted just some pasta. Highly recommend to anyone looking for an unusual experience.

A unique experience! . My husband and I went here as we wanted to do something special for our anniversary. We were surprised to pull up front of it on a busy street but as soon as we walked in we were impressed. It wasn't a super busy night and we were able to pick a spot right by the water (and right by a fan to keep us cool) love that you can walk into the wine cave to pick your wine! We both had steak dinners and they were both very good. Service is great and we loved being able to walk around the whole restaurant checking out all the different areas. I can imagine it getting very hoy in there with a lot more people! I'm glad we pretty much had it to ourselves outside the dining area. Definitely recommend it!

Amazing Experience!. We went here during our honeymoon for dinner and the atmosphere was 'WOW' !! It was cool sitting in a cave to eat and it was cool that you were able to go to the wine cellar to pick out your wine. The food was incredible with a lot of flavor and presented well. It was well worth the price and we would go back! Best meal in Mexico by far!

Amazing dining experience!. Alux was one of the most unique dining experiences I've ever had......it is unbelievably beautiful and the food was amazing. We started with a couple cocktails and had a nice bottle of red wine with dinner. We tried 2 appetizers, Portobello Alux and stalagmite peppers which were both delicious. All of our main courses were excellent, Beef Medallions, Fresh Catch of the Day, surf & turf and Chile Lindo.We took a tour of the restaurant after dinner, the whole place was incredible!Hopefully they will resolve the issues of the standing water in front of the bar (there are planks set up so you're feet don't get wet) and the warmth and stuffiness of the cave. You would think a cave would be nice and cool, definitely not the case, prepare to be warm. Even with all the fans running, it was quite stuffy. Regardless, I would definitely go back.
Amazing Restaurant!. Underground cavern restaurant with great food and service. Price was very reasonable! DO NOT miss this place. You will not be disappointed!

Eat in a real cave. This is a truly unique experience. If you have ever wondered what it would be like to eat a fancy dinner in a cave, by all means, Alux is the place for you. Overall, the greeting was somewhat confusing, then there was some sort of run-off causing either a mini-river or spill through the main hallway forcing all guests to either pre-plan to wear their galoshes or constantly be 'walking the plank', literally if they needed to use the washroom. But, you are eating in a freaking cave! And that in itself is very cool. They have the whole thing lit up with various colours and the cave is actually a bunch of separate adjoining cave sections. We had our own private dining area and they had strewn rose petals all about for the celebration of my wife's birthday. We shared the Surf & Turf, which had an odd mix of flavours. The tenderloin was great, where the flank steak left a lot to be desired. All of the seafood left something to be designed because it was all overcooked. The shrimp was at least seasoned, where the lobster tails, while generously portioned lacked flavour.The 'tower of roasted vegetables' from the menu consisted from one slice of plantain and one slice of zucchini.I was surprised how incredibly hot and moist it was in Alux. Had I been warned, I would have dressed down significantly rather than trying to 'dress to impress' as I had.Without the dedicated fan on us, it would have been unbearable.Service was snappy and friendly and the pictures came out great. I would recommend Alux for the experience. Also, I believe that the table we were at had been used to film an episode of The Bachelor so, for fans of the show like my wife, it's a must stop if you're in the neighnorhood.
Incredible Atmosphere!. Great place for a romantic dinner or for a group dining experience. Alex is a restaurant in a cavern.

Sad.... I am very sorry to hear that this restaurant is now closed. This was the most unique dining experience, and I loved their food. We were planning on visiting again, when we came back to Mexico next month. How disappointing. It was a little pricey, but you were paying for the entire experience. ❤️

One of the most interesting meals of our families lives!. We ate here the second to last night before it closed and it was wonderful! Nothing like eating in a cavern. It was a bit far into town on a fun taxi ride...but a trip and meal we will never forget! Thank you!

Location, location, location. They have done a nice job transforming the cave into a restaurant. However, if you're claustrophobic, this is not the right place for yo to dine.You definitely pay for the location since food and drink are both overpriced. The hostess was accommodating, and the service was average. We ordered the two salads on the men, which were small. Followed by the lobster with a butter sauce and a hint of garlic and lime, we finished off with a fat bill with already added tip for a mediocre taste and quality. I recommend a walk through the cave and just a drink if they allow it.

Delicious food in an amazing place. We really enjoyed our dinner in the cenote. The food was gourmet, the waitstaff was incredibly nice and you couldn't beat the surroundings. The cave is really beautiful, and they encourage you to go and explore. One word of caution; I figured that it would be cold in the restaurant since it was in a cave. It was actually very warm. So dress appropriately (they like you to dress up here - no shorts and flip flops.)

Great food, Great athmosphere.. We ate a 3 course meal and the food held very high standard. Waiters were professional and plesant. Only minus i could find was that it is very humid.. But ask for a fan and problem is solved.Dont forget to explore the cave :)

A must see with excellent food and service. This was an unforgettable experience eating in a natural cavern. We were seated right in front of the underground waterfall. Ask the staff and they will let you tour around the private dining areas and the incredible bar. The steak we had (T-bone) was the best we have had in Mexico. Our server Emmanuel was incredible. The main hostess and Emmanuel made sure fans were placed and even brought out a special dessert once they heard it was our luna de miel (Honeymoon). Even when he was seated with a huge group near us Emmanuel made sure everything was perfect and checked in at just the right frequency . Wonderful job and you must try it. It is not the cheapest place in Playa del Carmen for sure - but for us with drinks and dinner it was $102 U.S. which is very reasonable for a memorable experience. It is humid - so light clothes are best and the staff can redirect a fan if needed.

Cool Experience. We had a wonderful experience visiting Alux last week. The cave is beautiful and it was really neat to be able to explore it as an after dinner activity. We weren't expecting much for the food because the reviews seemed mediocre but we were pleasantly surprised. The huitlacoche and poblano soup was probably the best soup we've ever had and the seafood stuffed poblano pepper in a phyllo puff pastry crust was so good. I just wish I could have finished it all. Wine selection was limited but the cocktails were great. We also didn't find it too warm at all. They have air conditioning and many fans set up as well so we were quite comfortable. All in all, the experience exceeded our expectations.

Awesome Ambience. Although the food is very good, even if it was only good, you've got to eat at this restaurant in Playa Del Carmen. The restaurant is located in a underground cenote cavern. The ambience will blow you away!!! You won't be disappointed.
Good food, nice ambiance. Went there for a nice dinner with my partner. Romantic ambiance and food was delicious. Make sure explore the large cavern afterwards!

Anniversary Dinner . Booked a private area with flowers (passion), great ambiance, friendly helpful staff and good food. Maybe a touch more expensive than one would expect in Playa and certainly sticky in June..... but.... we still loved it and I'd recommend it for a special occasion :)

Where else can you eat in a cave? Amazing!. This was seriously the coolest dining experience ever and I couldn't stop raving about it with my husband for hours and days afterwards. It was so beautiful in the cavern! Cocktails were good, the food was good, but the location was amazing and I think you're paying for the experience of it all. Yes, it was hot and humid...but you're in a cavern! We were allowed to walk around in the cave afterwards, which I highly recommend- it was breathtaking. If you're looking for something unique while in Playa, try Alux!

Stopped for a few beers. Had the chance to walk over Friday night and check out the bar area. A little dark inside, but it is a cavern. Beer was 40 pesos, a good price for area restaurants. I thought it would have been cooler than it was, but better than the outside 86.

One word: UNBELIEVABLE!. Wow. Just wow. You walk into an entrance like any other street but then immediately descend several stairs and you are completely inside a cavern that is beautifully lit (dimly) with natural springs and a complete fine dining experience unlike anything I ever imagined! They could definitely have a wider variety of food options but I highly doubt anyone goes there for any other reason than the ambiance and beauty. Because it's natural, there are several nooks and tables are set up based on the type of nook available. A private table for 2 or a lounge fit for 10 people.

Great Anniversary Dinner. My husband and I had the pleasure of dining at the Alux restaurant for our 45th Anniversary. What a GREAT experience. The cavern is amazing and the food is first class. Very efficient staff with attention to detail. They surprised us with a dessert and champagne ! Wonderful experience!

Unique and Romantic dining experience. This was probably the most unique dining experience we have ever had. A must see if you are in Playa del Carmen. Dining in a cave with waterfalls, cenotes, stalactites and chandeliers. Great menu, good food and nice affordable price. Take time to wonder through the cave while they are preparing your food. Would be an amazing place for a rehearsal dinner before a destination wedding!

Nothing great in our opinion. To each their own. I suppose you must go try it yourself.For us, we visited for a BPM venue.It just didn't do it for us. It was boring. We left within an hour.It's a cool place to check out but don't expect to stay long. We can't tell you how the food was because we didn't try it.Those are our 2 cents!

Amazing. My boyfriend took me here for my birthday. It was so magical and beautiful. The food was delicious and the service was great. They let us tour the place after dinner and take pictures. It was one of the coolest things we got to see in Playa. I would definitely go back!

Great time. Went to Alux on my b-day, didn't make a reservation, but still got a nice table. Dinner was great, best rib-eye I have in my life, service just excellent! Stuff go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your visit. Thank you Alux to make my 26 bday special!

Good Experience. We were a group of 10 people and all of us absolutely loved the venue, it is just gorgeous. The service was good as well but the food not so much. They were out of lobster when we arrived and since so many of their dishes have lobster, it limited our choices. They had 2 choices of white wine by the glass, I ordered the sauvignon blanc and it was horrible. As an appetizer my husband and I shared the seafood trio which was ok. Since we couldn't get the seafood platters my husband got the duck which was fantastic and I ordered the Mayab Medalion but it was really just steak, didn't have the bacon it described on the menu so either our server gave me the wrong dish or they were out of bacon. Either way, it was ok. For some reason our server didn't think to ask us if we wanted separate bills and gave us one big bill. He apologized and manually calculated what each of us had so we could pay accordingly. From what we saw only tax was added to the bill, not the tip. While our server sorted out the bill we took a walk around the cave and it is simply spectacular.Would we go back? probably not, but we were all glad to have had the experience of eating in a cave :)
What an experience. A must see when in Playa del Carmen. Great atmosphere and great food. Gets very humid so dress accordingly. Nice change from the typical 5th ave.

Unique. If you are claustrophobic this may not be for you. It is also a cave so you can expect that it may be humid. I didn't find it difficult ... they had lots of fans circulating the air but don't go expecting it to be like a perfectly air conditioned building. It's a cave. My husband and I went in the last few days with a group of 6 couples. We were looking forward to dining there after a recommendation from someone in our group who had been there before. The setting is not to be missed - the restaurant is laid out around a cave with larger areas for the main dining and bar areas and smaller coves for more intimate dining. I found the atmosphere to be lovely.When you have such a draw (a restaurant it an cave!) they could be lazy with the food and service and still draw people in. This was not the case. The food was decent and the service excellent and the cost was about 1/2 what we would pay in Canada for a similar dinner. My only disappointment was that we were charged for water even though we all had full dinner with drinks. I have read reviews by people who have complained about the gratuity being included but that's pretty normal for Canada, especially when you go with a large group and all have separate bill.s

Interesting atmosphere; average food. Cave location is very neat and well done. Very humid though! Menu is very limited if you don't like seafood. We took our picky teenagers and the only thing that interested them was the ravioli - which wasn't available that night. Restaurant made chicken fingers for them. Overall, it was high priced for average food. But, a nice change from resort food!

Average - if you take away the cave....  We have very mixed feelings about Alux. No effort was made to acknowledge the birthday we were celebrating (except a quick 'Happy Birthday' from the hostess). The wine and cocktails are priced very high. The seafood trio was expensive and bland with a very small portion. The pasta for our lobster ravioli was rubbery, and the cheese sauce was pasty. The bread in the basket was underbaked. The server added his own tip to the bill, more than what is customary for Mexico, and more than what we would have given him...But what are you going to say when he's already added it?Other than the fact that we were eating in a cave - which is amazing - it was a lack lustre experience for a special night out. We don't splurge often, and this experience was disappointing. If you don't factor in the aspect of the cave, I'd give it a 6/10. Go for an expensive cocktail...Have dinner elsewhere.

Special Place for special event or romantic dinner~!. This restaurant is not always easy to find but well worth the visit. If you have anyone who is a geologist, rock hound, or loves diving in the Cenotes....this place is gonna leave a lasting impression. Not only is the atmosphere very unique and unusual the food is over the top great~! The service is good, and there are some very unusual dishes there that are not on your ordinary menu. Anniversary, Retirement Party...or for just FUN....give this place a try. I know this is going to be on your list to strongly recommend to other friends and family who might be visiting this area.

Great spot. The food is great, the environment is incredible. You can walk trough the whole place and it's huge, it has even a separate place for weddings. You should make a reservation before going, just to make sure.

So unusual!. We were looking for somewhere different to go for my birthday and our holiday rep mentioned this restaurant. We looked it up on the internet, liked what we saw and she booked it for us for the Saturday night.It was the most unusual restaurant we have ever been to and so romantic. You are given a torch to read the menu by as the candles were not bright enough. I had a salad to start which was nice and refreshing followed by beef medallions. The beef was so tender and my husband thought his T-bone was the best he had ever had.They brought out a special dessert as it was my birthday but fortunately didn't make a big song and dance about it.There was a band playing while we had the meal which was also a nice touch.Afterwards we walked all around the caves and then sat in the bar area for another drink.The whole experience made my birthday very special.
Dine in a Cenote!. Amazing and magical location with very good food. Try the seafood plate for two. Delicious. Unique must see dining experience,
AMAZING!!. We ate here whilst on our honeymoon... This caverna is an extremely romantic place to eat. The food was extremely nice too. top quality in my eyes...

A must see. This place was really cool - well worth a visit. We only came for a drink (no reservations for a drink required). The atmosphere was really awesome and the staff encouraged you to walk around and explore. They seated us in a private area off to the side, very nice. The drinks were great and worth the money!It's hot in there, so dress accordingly. I read some reviews that it had a bit of an odor, I didn't really smell it and next time we will try the place out for dinner!

Wonderful Dinner. Eight of us ate dinner at Alux on a Thursday. The food and service are first class. The prices reasonable. We had no delays and were not rushed. Our server carefully explained the contents of each dish and took us on a tour of the cave after dinner.

Very, very cool. This place had such an amazing atmosphere and the food was great, although they could serve Cheerios and I'd be back. Although it's very much an underground (literally) gem, where we anticipated snobby service, the people here were out of their way nice. Definitely a must if you're in the area!

Try it. First I am going to say, we went even though we had reservations on going.Thought it was going to be very expensive, and there was a complaint on the quality.I am glad we went.. For our meal we had an appetizer, and a glass of wine each.We both had steak for our main entree, which I found to be very tender.The potatoes were garlic infused which I really did enjoy, even though they were green in color, my wife's were colored purple. For desert I had american coffee with bailies.... Bill came to 97 bucks with a 12 percent tip included in the bill. I left him another ten because it was worth every penny

One of the best experiences in Playa. I almost never write reviews...but this time I cannot help it.I must admit we entered Alux by chance, without knowing or reading anything about the place. it was my girlfriend`s birthday and I was really hoping for something different...We just noticed an intimate little garden, but had no idea about what was going on underground. Well, with every step we took onwards, our pleasant surprise only kept on growing. Exquisite service, great people, fabulous gourmet food, totally decent prices and, above all, unique atmosphere. The cave, the perfectly assorted mystical ambiental music, the sound of the waterfall, the lights, everything is perfectly balanced.I am so happy we stick around Playa one more week, for I must come back and try some other things from that menu.Thank you for a perfect evening!

Incredibly unique experience, food was so-so. Looking back I'd say that this was one of the most memorable dining experiences of my life!The pros:1. It's both romantic, and extremely cool. Perfect spot for an anniversary, or to entertain clients if your clients are in Mexico...2. What seems like a small cave entrance turns out to be a massive recessed cave that you can walk all through, hear the water dripping, even sit very far in where it's muggy and, well, cave-like. 3. The servers are very friendly. 4. There's a translation section on the menu. 5. They take Visa / MC. 6. The food is upscale compared to other local restaurants. Now, the cons:1. The food, though up-scale for Playa, I'd rate 6/10 max. 2. The bathroom was disgusting. 3. The dinnerware and table settings felt old, and a little cheap. 4. The cocktails were crazy expensive, more than a Canadian/US restaurant. All in all, very unique, very romantic, very worth going to!

An awesome experience with a one of a kind setting. During our vacation we left our all inclusive resort to get the flavor of the town, Alux came recomended by several locals. It was a great dining experience. Obviously the setting is very unique and beautiful. The live jazz was perfect and the food was very good. Gustavo waited on us and provided a great experience. Also picking our own wine in the seperate wine cavern was great. Overall it was a great choice and I would reccomend to all. We went on a Saturday night with 24 hour notice and had no problem getting a great table.The one small issue was we ordered a seafood platter for two (Lobster tails, squid, Sea Bass etc...) Our server reccomended a certain oyster dish as an appetizer which we got. It was just ok. Well the seafood dish we ordered (most expensive selection on menu) also had the same portion of the reccomended appetizer. Obviously we would not have ordered the same thing twice. Gustavo was very attentative but i feel this should have been pointed out

High class service, good food in unexpected location. The restaurant is right on Juarez - with local shops and apartment buildings. You would never guess what is hiding behind the gate of Alux restaurant. It's jungle and a cenote. It's beautiful, romantic, clean and original. The service was great. The waiter was there just when we needed him, didn't bug us every 5 minutes, food was served hot and fast enough, the drinks were amazing. Would highly recommend for romantic dinners or quiet celebrations!

Very unique restaurant - Excellent food. Set in a cave, Alux mainly uses natural lighting (candles) and is quite large and spreadout. The food was excellent with great service. Very glad we experienced this place!

Amazing!. Every aspect of our dinner was beyond wonderful. The food was delicious. The drink choices were awesome and the entire experience in a low-lit cave with a live jazz band playing was surreal and amazing. Do not miss this opportunity when visiting the area.

Like nothing else you've ever seen!. While on vacation in Playa del Carmen my friend who lives there suggested that we go for dinner. We had spent the day in Tulum exploring the Cenotes and this was the perfect finish to the day. Having dinner in a beautiful cave? No way! Yes way!! Right from the entrance you are transported to another world. I have been in many caves but never one like this! Beautifully decorated, with various spots for private dinners, parties etc....We chose the Surf and Turf and it was delectable! Tender, mouth watering and the sauce was to die for! Drinks were lovely and our waitress was always checking that everything was as we wanted. I seriously can not find anything to complain about! Service - amazing. Food - amazing. Atmosphere - BEYOND AMAZING! After dinner we walked all around to see all the areas....it was late, almost closing so we stopped at one of the bars to have another drink and then toured around a little longer. I was sad to leave this place! One of the highlights of my trip I must say!!

A great discovery in Playa Del Carmen. Finally, on our fourth trip to Playa, we got smart and started asking the taxi drivers for their recommendations on the best places to dine in Playa and found this unique restaurant that is a welcome break from the new mall development underway on 5th Avenue. The ambiance at Alux is warm and inviting, despite the fact you're in an underground world. Our waiter, Lalo, was extremely attentive and did an exellent job of explaining the specials. Surf and Turf was done to perfection. Pork medallions were tender and delicious. Presentation was classy and priced right. We recommend topping off your meal wth Cafe Maya...it's always fun to see someone play with fire, and the result is a delicious after-dinner drink that packs a great punch! Don't forget to explore the caves...very fun. Oh, did I menttion the margaritas are the best we've experienced so far in Playa del Carmen?

Amazing Spot!!. We were suggested to go to "the cave restaurant" and after doing some research we were excited. The atmosphere was amazing and service was great. We were delighted to be invited into the wine cellar to pick our wine. It was very warm, as suggested by previous reviewers. We were glad to be prepared for it. My only complaint is that the food was not very warm. We understand the food comes from above ground but this is something they should work on. Had the food been hot this meal would have been as amazing as the rest of the experience!

Great surprise in Playa del Carmen!. We happened across this spot in Playa del Carmen, and what a find! After spending the days driving around to cenotes we could have just come here. Amazing underground bar/restaurant located inside of a cenote cave! We just had cocktails, so I cannot comment on the food, but it is worth a trip here just to see the caves, they go on forever! Super cool find!

Amazing. Can't believe that I haven't seen any advertise about this place anywhere.. Just founded on Google!! It is a must go while in Playa del Carmen.. The food is superb.. The waiters very friendly and the place.. You have to see it to believe it!! Amazing!!

birthday dinner. Food was delicious and quite an adventure. Good place for very unusual photos at Playa del Carmen. It is a bit hot so dress accordingly especially if you go in the summer. Can be a bit pricey, but well worth the visit. Spent my birthday with my daughter and sisters there.

Not for dinner. After someone told us about the "cave restaurant" we decided to check it out even after reading all bad reviews about the food.They emailed us the confirmation with the reservation for dinner and a free drink which was again mentioned at the table by the manager but was never brought to us.Also they mentioned in the email a "dress code"...what a joke!! People were wearing t-shirt, shorts and flip flops....I was insulted. We dressed up properly for the occasion.The server was very nice and the atmosphere very cool....The food was cold. They brought some bread with no spread or oilnof any kind and the bread itself had a funny taste, like old.The appetizer was cold and poorly made.The main course portion was so small that we left the restaurant hungry.Just to wrap it up, is worth going in for a drink, take some pictures and eat somewhere eles. You will have a better meal eating tacos at Don Sirloin.
Interesting place for a drink. Being a cave, it has a smell and a warmth that is not appetizing. I would not be able to eat here. But if you are in the area, it's worth stopping in for a drink.

The most special and unique place in Playa!. I visited Alux last night for a drink in the bar. It was the most amazing place! The setting is beautiful deep in the cave surrounded by stalagmites and stalagtites! There's a large cocktail menu (they're around $100 MXN) and the bar was surprisingly empty at 8pm. The restaurant was busy but after reading some disappointing reviews about the food, we decided to just visit the bar. After, we took a wander through the underground cave system and saw the Cenote and waterfall. It's by far the most beautiful place I've ever been for drinks.

Fantastic. Excellent restaurant, food and superb service, Lalo invite you to give us a tour of the caverns and has been one of the best experenias, Thanks Alux. The best restaurant in Playa del Carmen and Mexico

amazing place, but hot and food to posh!!. as above really!! we visited on sep 28 during our holiday!! yes the place is beautiful and worth going just to say we have been. only grumble was it was too hot and the menu was full of posh crap like oysters and seaweed so we didn't eat there , but drinks were lovely . my advice is go for a drink only and marvel in the beauty!!

A must-go place- unlike anything you've seen..... First off, we did not eat here. This is a restaurant but also a bar/club. You can just go for drinks, and I have done that on several occasions.They have a very interesting drink menu and several bars to visit within the underground network of caves. You enter through the front door from the sidewalk and immediately descend a wide,stone staircase into the caverns below street level. There is a small river running through the dining room area, and there are a series of caverns and caves spreading underground, connected by winding stone,corridors. Everything is electrically lit, the ceilings are high- it is not at all claustrophobic or uncomfortable.There are several different bars, there is even a dance floor with a big,stone stage- never heard live music there, but they have it. As you wander through the various caves, you will find little private seating nooks set up with couches and chairs and tables with candles. This place is just so COOL! I have never seen anything like it. ( note: one reviewer mentioned a tour of the cenotes....there are no cenotes down there!). I tell all my friends about Alux- you really should check this place out!

What to impress your loved one? Go to Alux. Talk about a venue - how about a restaurant in a cavern (actually an old cenote or sinkhole)? Food - the chef uses local produce and cooks everything to perfection. The ambience is amazing. There are a lot of restaurants in Playa del Carmen and even if you are staying at an "all inclusive" I recommend you take your loved one to Alux - you'll gain a lot of points!

Fascinating Cavern Bar. This was our second visit to the Alux (pronounced Aloosh if you need to tell a cab driver). We enjoyed cocktails around a small table in the bar area and strolled the cavern walk. Next time we would enjoy trying dinner in one of the private cavern rooms where servers appear from nowhere it seems with drinks and trays of food. It can be a little stuffy but fans are used to circulate the air.

10 Million year old Bar.. Wow what a fascinating bar. This cave is said to have been here for over 10 million years. So amazing. Besides the natural habitat the bar was very nice. We had a drink with the Head Bartender Oliver. Very nice guy. He explained the cave to us and had great drinks. You have to visit this place if your in Playa Del Carmen.

Incredible!!!. Thank you, Marcy! Chef Miguel and manager, Aliana!This was our first time here, our friend's second visit - the night before was their first!The oyster appetizer - amazing, entree was the medallions for me- pork and beef - perfectly cooked and so tender. Excellent service and Marcy was the best!

Most Romantic Place Ever. This restaurant is a must see. It is in an underground cenote which Playa Del Carmen is so well known for. There are tables hidden between the caverns. Beautiful lights fill the room against the rocks and candles alight the darkness. A group of 5 of us sat in the lounge. White leather couches around a small table with a natural spring waterfall behind us illuminated by blue and red lights. Just had beer. Did not look at the dinner menu but the drink list was extensive. Nice music. Very humid. Amazing how they placed chandeliers and candles in the cave. 150 pesos in a cab from downtown Playa on 5th St.

Truly amazing. Been here tonight as a group of 4 and the experience was amazing, never rushed to finish and the food was fantastic. The service was perfect as was the setting, altogether a perfect evening.

Breathe taking . My husband and I spent night before our wedding here. We wanted something special for a meal just the 2 of us before our wedding. Meal was amazing 5 * and just what we wanted. The restaurant was told in advance this was our night before wedding and we were escorted to private area covered in rose petals. Very romantic and special. Cave is very hot but we were provided with a fan which helped a lot. We were invited for tour and was amazed how big and breathe taking the place is. Food is bit more expensive than norm but well worth the extra for special occasion and experience. Definitely be going again.

Amazing. If in Playa Del Carmen you do not wanna miss this one.... off the beaten track a bit but just a 5 min ride from 5th av and well worth the experience of walking around in a Sonata with such history. The food was just a 3 star but the service was great and the atmosphere was...... well... one of a kind.

Visited 8/23/14. Great experience at this bar. We didn't eat, rather just had a few drinks, but the atmosphere is amazing and the staff were exceptionally professional. It's about 3 miles from our hotel, Royal Haciendas, and isn't that hard to find (on the west side of the highway, about 4 blocks on the left hand side of the street (I don't remember the street name though). There's really no designated parking, but we found a spot about a block down on some side street.

Unique Dining Experience. Went with a friend, a few years ago and had a totally unique experience. Probably a once in a lifetime chance. The food was delicious, as were the cocktails. The decorating and lighting created the perfect ambience. The cave was very hot, but isn't everywhere in Mexico?

Once in a lifetime experience!. Went to Alux with my family for dinner in July and expected to eat in a cave but what we got was much more. This was a once in a lifetime experience. The cave is beautifully decorated and laid out. Yes, it was hot, but well worth it and if you ask, the waiter/waitress will bring a big fan right over to the table. Our waitress gave us fabulous tips on where to go in the area and what to see, she even wrote down a handful of her favorite places with directions for us! Every mean on our table was exquisite, four star dining for sure! After our meal, our waitress offered to take us on a tour of he cave. She told us the history and the Mayan beliefs for each room of the cave. The restaurant is a bit out of tourist central which was a wonderful change. Make reservations and sit near the cenote or book a private room of the cave for a family event. Can't say enough of how much we enjoyed this restaurant! I think we spent upwards of 3 hours there! Considering the location, the quality of food and the atmosphere, the prices were very reasonable! For the only cave restaurant left in the world, Alux is a must see!!

A must see!. This bar/restaurant is very interesting. It is a short $9 cab ride from Playacar Palace. I'm looking forward to going back when I have time for dinner instead of just a drink. The tour of the cave was very informative. The drinks were tasty and the service was great. The end of July is probably not the best time to go as it was humid but still a must see, no matter what the weather is. There are some very romantic tables inside. It would be great for a couples dinner. Anyone planning on popping the question, this might just be the place to do it. Different than the typical proposal on the beach.

Totally Unique Experience. A four star dining experience in a unique and romantic cave environment. Every item we ordered was delicious, especially the lobster, encrusted quail, and yucatan lime soup. Slightly expensive but well worth it. Server was very professional. Take a moment to explore the passages of the cave before or after dinner. A short ~$10 cab ride or long walk from the pier at playa.
Coolest place to eat!!!!. A definite must!!! We heard about it in a shuttle from airport to resort and it was everything the lady said it would be!!!!

Great Attraction - Average Restaurant. The atmosphere of this restaurant is a must - great idea to build it in the caves. The food was average, and it was very hot down in the caves in June. There were several fans plugged up in the restaurant, but they were promised to other tables. The staff was great. The caves alone is worth a visit. The fact you can have a drink and some food while you do it should not be missed, even if it is a little hot.

Hot and smelly. Wouldn't recommend it if you're looking for a great atmosphere to eat. It is pricy for those on a budget. There are plenty of other great places in the area to eat. The food is not worth the price. Stay away from the ravioli with salmon. It's located outside the beach area, so you'll need a taxi on the way there if your resort is on the beach. This placed seemed very romantic, but was not what we expected.

Even if you just have appetizer or desert, you must see.... Food is a bit expensive but anywhere else in the area, they would charge you just to come in and see such a cool cave system. We had citrus shrimp which was good but not outstanding. Someone said the seafood platter was awesome. As long as you go in and order something, you can tour the whole cave as long as there are no private parties. I recommend calling ahead for reservation. It is so very unique that I consider it a must see for Playa del Carmen area. You cannot see this anywhere else. I'm sure this would be a great place for a special occasion but vacation was all the special occasion we needed. There is no handicapped access.

A Dinner Excursion in a Cenote!. An amazing cave restaurant. The cave/ cenote itself was only discovered about 22 years ago within Playa del Carmen. There were several rooms within the cave system including one that had been turned into a bar and stage. The atmosphere was unbelievable. It was very romantic with artful lighting. This enhanced the dramatic nature of the cave. It was almost museum quality in ambience. The temperature was a little warm but the fans that were situated around the restaurant were very helpful. We were a group of fifteen but the restaurant easily accommodated us. The server was happy to provide us with individual bills which made the billing situation much easier.
