The food was very good - international in flavour - the seafood of the day was mahi mahi which was very tasty - others in our group enjoyed the quail. The costs of the main entrees ranged from $25-40 US. Wine was available by the glass and bottle. If you're interested in dinner in a unique and interesting location - this is the place! If you want to spark endless conversation - take a geologist with you!

Unique Dinning experiance. I will have to say I have never had dinner in a cenote. This place was recommended by some other travelers we met at the Moon Palace Resort in Cancun. So when we transferred to the PlayaCar Palace, we decided to give it a try and I am glad we did. This was a truly unique dinning experience. They even had live music in the cave. The atmosphere was great, the wine was great and the food was delicious.Our waiter did a really good job. Told us all about the cenote and the history of the restaurant. Answered all the questions we had about the menu and different dishes. I had no idea what to order, so I asked our waiter what he would recommend. The dinner he suggested was fantastic. The presentation was beautiful. It was definitely five star. The chicken was a little dry but the taste was delicious. The combination of the chicken with the sauce that was provided, made it one of best meals I have had in a long time. A really great and unique taste.It was a wonderful evening with my wife and our friends. Relaxing, unique, fun, good music and a great dinner. We will go back again without a doubt. I would recommend taking a walk through cenote and looking around.

Caves. Most exciting restaurant I have ever visited. Restaurant, bar and lounges located in multi-room under ground caves with beautiful natural stalagmites and stalagtites. Our table was along an underground river. After dinner, we explored the many carved by nature rooms and passages. And, the food was superb!. Well worth the short taxi ride from the beach area.
MUST SEE!. Hands down, my favorite place in Playa! Great food and an atmosphere like you wouldn't believe! I had the surf and turf, which was a filet and shrimp, it was amazing!

Don't make a special request. This restaurant I'd quite unique, so we elected to dine there on a special night - our 25th anniversary. When we made the reservation through Open Table, we noted our anniversary and requested a table by the cenote. When we arrived, we were greeted with a "happy anniversary", but were escorted to a table near the bar. Upon leaving we inquired about our request. The hostess replied that our request had not been noted on her listing. So much for special requests on special occasions such as 25th anniversaries.

Very unique. Went here for dinner our last night in playa, very exotic and interesting environment to have a dinner. Most of the meals are seafood but done up very fancy they have a lounge inside also and you can go for a tour inside the cave. I really enjoyed it the only thing I didn't like was the smell but it's a cave it's been there since the ice age. They did burn incense to mask the odor we were just there right when they opened for the night.

Extraordinary Place please go and please tell your friends !!. Excelent please go!!Its a very pleasant experence I will go again and again because I love It.We d like this place to be your favorite .I love everything there

Unique experience!. We were told about this place by some fellow travelers, so made a last minute reservation. The building IS unique and worth a visit, but wish we had only gone for drinks. The food wasn't spectacular as we had been told.I would recommend and I would return, but keep in mind that it is quite expensive. Go for the experience!! Great date night :)

Excellent cuisine and superb service. We visited this restaurant last week and were very pleased. Leaving aside the intriguing setting which has already been commented on by other reviewers, we found that the service by our waiter. Unfortunately we cannot remember his name. He was definitely one of the best servers we have ever experienced. If we can remember his name, I will update this report.Both the presentation and the food itself were excellent. Congratulations to Alux for running a classy establishment.

A must-see for Playa Del Carmen!. Excellent food with "Mayan Themes". The setting itself can hardly be described, but I was start with INCREDIBLE! To sit and dine in an actual cenote is an amazing experience. After the meal we walked around to see the extent of this bar/restaurant and was surprised to see how many winding tunnels there were with even more private tables and beautiful lighting and designs. It is so extensive it actually took us a good 15 min to view the whole place, almost feeling like we should pay an admission price for just the view!Our only issue was that when we arrived there was no hostess or anyone to acknowledge our arrival for almost 6-8 minutes, somewhat appalling for this level of finer dining. However after that the service was great. If you are in the area, you MUST check this unique place out.

Amazing restaurant. We went here for partners birthday, we we're recommended this restaurant by the first choice rep at the bahia principe akumal, the atmosphere was fantastic, the food was amazing, live music, very romantic. Will would recommend the lobster ravioli it's lovely.

A very nice surprise.. As with another reviewer, I too dined here on my birthday. I love caves and I love to eat so this was a joy to find under Playa del Carmen. We arrived half an hour before our reservation and were seated as soon as we walked in. My wife and I both commented on the rather fast service and good food. She had a rib-eye steak ( too big to finish) and I had Alux Surprise (catch of the day). Quite possibly the best tasting fish I have ever had.I could not pronounce the kind of fish so can not remember now. One thing... bring a flashlight to read the menu.

Unique restaurant, slow service. Food was quite good (nothing brilliant, but nice) and the ambiance was AMAZING. There are seemingly endless numbers of underground corridors to check out in the cavern, all romantically lit up with candles or dimmed lights.
So cool!. We loved the originality of the restaurant. It was intimate and cozy. Food was absolutely delicious.

Excellent Birthday Dinner. I went to Alux Restaurant for my birthday dinner. We arrived thinking that the butler where we were staying had made reservations for us like I had asked, but we had none when we arrived. After about a 20 minute wait, the hostess was able to make a table for my party of three and seat us. This was extremely nice of her because we were told that Sundays were reservation only nights. The food that everyone had was really good, our waiter was very attentive and he did a little show for me with heat and liquor. It was very cool, got some great pictures! The dessert he gave me was pretty good too. This is a very nice restuarant, a great concept, and very enjoyable. An excellent spot to visit while in Playa.

Extremely nice interior but food can get better. This is a must see restaurant. The interior is simply fantastic - great experience! It is in a cave and furnished with taste. The waiters are very friendly.However, the food (main dish priced from 200 to 350 pesos) does not live up to the standards for such a price range. My fish was fried and late at night I had stomach ache. It was also not very tasty. It is also one of the few restaurants where you get the bill with 15% mark-up for the tip. I always thought that it is on me to determine how much to leave for tip depending on how happy I am with the service. Interesting, but not the only restaurant in Mexico where this happened to me.Overall, you have to see this place but be careful with the orders.

Cavern dining. What a gem! This unique restaurant was recommended by an employee at our resort. Food, service and prices were all fantastic! We would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to experience something a little different!

Really Special Restaurant. A taxi driver made a recommendation for this restaurant and what a great choice. Food is very good, a little limited with choice but very good. The service was good but could have been better. The setting in the cenote is fantastic, a very unique place. One to tick off the to do list. Cost was reasonable for 4 persons - 3 courses and soft drinks came to $220 us dollars. Great place. :-)

Great food set in nature - a true gem!. We booked reservations based on family recommendations and were not disappointed! The facility itself is set within a cenote which is breathtaking. As other reviewers have said, It is a little humid inside but when we said something our server immediately brought a fan close to our table and problem solved!! We ordered the oyster app, 4 drinks, rib eye, and surf and turf.. With tip that came to $118 which I think is very reasonable. The oysters were my favorite part and the steaks were cooked to perfection! Our waiter took us on a tour of the cave and was very knowledgable about the preservation of this natural beauty, he offered to take many pictures for us. I would recommend this place to anyone! Totally worth it
beautiful restaurant in a cenote. Loved the atmosphere so much, wonderful layout in the natural cenote with private dinning available and great prices too!

What an amazing restaurant!. Went to take something off our bucket list. That was Alux. What a location for for a restaurant. In a cave. The ambiance was fabulous. The cave is dark, so a recommendation for the management would be to have small flashlights on the tables. The food was good, but not that good for the price! The experience was wonderful! A restaurant to go to so you can say "been there"! But overall very interesting!!

Great setting, good food service mixed.. We ate here last week. The setting is really spectacular - the restaurant is set in an old Cenote. The service was mixed. We asked for a private room but didn't get one, they were mostly empty. The restaurant manager was not particularly warm or friendly, quite cold and horrible in fact but the wait staff were very accommodating and even took us on a short tour of the Cenote after dinner. It is very hot and muggy inside with lots of mossies. The food was good, we ordered a surf and turf platter with lobster for about $100 US.

An unforgettable dining experience!. Nothing like anything experienced before!Once you've settled into your comfortable seating after taking in the overall naturalbeauty of this treasure,you will be pleasantly pleased to find out that the gastronomical cuisine is also quite good,and the staffs knowledge bountiful,bringing the overall value of this experience to new heights!

Drinks Only. I guess when reading Trip Advisor reviews on restaurants I guess I need to consider that people have different tastes. We went to El Alux last week off the suggestion of our resort bartender and reviews of TA, and I'll say that the cave is absolutely stunning. The food on the other hand was completely subpar as was the wine list. We were sorely disappointed which is too bad because this place has so much potential. We split the surf and turf...my god it was like cutting through a piece of leather. Our service wasn't the best either but I think that was more of an issue with our sweet little waitress who could barely spoke a word of english. Little tips about the place: dress in cool attire because it's warm in the cave. Ladies should not wear heels or at least be prepared to take them off for your descent into the cave. Would I go back? Only if someone in my group wanted to see it. I'm in kind of the mind set been there done that. That being said I would totally recommend going for a drink. The cave is that amazing. Cheers

beautiful.. the cave here is amazing just peaceful cuts you off from the outside world. You will have a minimum spend when you walk in but that only works out to the price of one drink then you would be free to walk around and have a look you will not be dissappointed.

Awesome dining experience. My family and I went there for my daughter's 40th birthday dinner. The place was awesome. What an experience to eat underground in an actual cave with cenotes, tunnels, and stalgmites. I had prime rib, absolutely delishous. My daughter had roast duck which she enjoyed immensely. My grandson and aunt had chicken dishes. Everything was cooked just right. We order two bottles of wine. The total came to about $280 including tip. Not bad at all!!! Service was good. There is no air conditioning there and was a bit stuffy. We mentioned it to the waiter, who brought one of the big fans closer to us, which helped some. We took a tour of the cave/restaurant and discovered that one of the wait staff had previously lived in South Philadelphia and had attended the same high school that I had. What a small world. They called the taxi driver for us when we were done.

Simply amazing. This is literally a restaurant in a cenote in the middle of Playa del Carmen. Very romantic and breathtaking. There was live music that fit the atmosphere. We had steak and lobster with an appetizer, drinks and dessert and paid $200 for two (includes mandatory gratuity, which we found pretty standard in Mexico). The food was very good and was plentiful. We couldn't even finish the whole main course (but found room for cheesecake...) The only complaint is that it can be a bit humid, but it is what it is. I strongly recommend this place and would return.

Unlike any other bar you've been to. Totally recommend a visit to El Alux - it's unlike any other place in playa del carmen & elsewhere. Found out about it in the Lonely Planet guide book as otherwise would never have come across it... It's quite a way up Avenida Juarez on the left hand side - just about walkable from the resort but recommend taking a short taxi ride for only about 40 - 50 pesos from Quinta Avenida. We had a couple of drinks there on a Thursday night. You also have the option to eat in the bar f you don't want to sit down in the restaurant area for a meal. I have to say nothing stood out for us on the menu but we were free to explore the caves and walkways by ourselves. It's a little surreal but beautiful and very atmospheric! Reminded me of the scene in Phantom of the opera where the phantom hides out underground in his lair!Staff were friendly and good music playing. The bar was almost empty when we went which was surprising as I'd read lots of reviews and thought it would be packed. A bit of a shame as lacked a bit of buzz / atmosphere but then again it was quite surreal having it all to ourselves!

An unusual and magical experience. I had heard about Alux and missed going there the first time I was in Playa del Carmen. So this trip I had it on my "Must Do" list! There are not many places that can give you the experience of having dinner or drinks in a cave. From the first flight of stairs you descend you can tell you are in a very special place. The lighting is romantic (lots and lots of rod iron candelabras and chandelliers) and the mood is classy. No hip-hop or blaring music here, the mood music was more Tony Bennet and Michael Buble which was welcoming and relaxing. The hostess asked if we had a reservation (we did not). I guess the encourage one for dinner but we were only interested in drinks which she said was fine as long as we ordered $100 Mexican Peso minimum which is really only about 8 US dollars.She led us to a bar area which was strategically underlit in blue lights and had comfortable tables, chairs and couches scattered around. The only "off" thing in the room was a Red Bull neon light. Whoever hung that should note it was out of character with the rest of the cave, but maybe they thought it was appropriate for the bar area. Our waiter not only came to take our drink orders but offered us a tour of the cave. Parts of the cave were surprising hot and sticky with large fans circulating the air. There were lots of little nooks set up with intimate dining seating - chandelliers, white table cloths, beautiful seating. Upon leaving we were assisted with catching a cab back to Playa's Fifth Avenue. It is only a $5 USD cab ride away - I'd encourage other tourists to check this place out!

Magical caves. We just went to this place to have a look round and get a drink rather than eat. I understand it is owned by the government and therefore has some sort of protection from over development. It is an amazing, large system of caves with stalectites and mites, beautifully lit with very special and different types of seating areas. It looks like there is a dance - music area and a restaurant. It is incredibly beautiful.We went around 6pm and it was empty. There was a minimum charge of around £5 each person, which is expensive for Mexico. We had cocktails which were nice but ther service was not good. Having said that, it is such a large place that it would be difficult to keep an eye on customers but there were few attendants and they seemed elusive.In all it is worth a visit.

Unbelievable Restaurant - and very romantic, too. My husband and I spent Christmas Eve 2011 at this restaurant. The setting is unbelievable. Walk down the stairs at the entrance to a huge cenote. Each little nook and cranny is a different little dining area. Furniture is eclectic but tasteful with a modern twist. The restaurant is very popular so reservations are required. Even so,... they lost our reservation! Tsk. With just a little drama from us and two other couples in the same predicament, we were all escorted to tables and my husband and I soon forgot about the trouble. The food was fabulous. Drinks were great (and not watered down). And, the Mayan dancers that came in around 9 pm put on a wonderful show. Their very ancient dance told a story ... one that I hadn't seen danced by others like this. That was refreshing. There was quite a bit of suggesting from our waiter that we not only leave a tip on the bill but that we might perhaps slip him a tip personally that he would not have to split with the rest of the staff. I didn't really like this idea in the beginning but I looked around and saw this going on subtly by other guests and waiters/waitresses. And, in the end, I think our waiter did a great job and was very helpful and attentive. So, we slipped him a little more cash! :) El Alux is not near the beach nor near the trendy 5th Avenue strip in Playa Del Carmen. You'll likely need a taxi. And when you leave, there are usually taxis nearby (if not at the door.)A wonderful place to go ... a MUST SEE in Playa del Carmen. MUST SEE!

Great Location only Good Food. Great location, and nice that our waiter gave us our tour. Atmosphere might be a little better than the food which is only slightly above average, but nice to get away from chain restaurants on 5th in Playa del Carmen.

Romantic, Soothing, Relaxing. After 6 days in Playa, sun and fun and mostly making our own meals, we decided to go out for a relaxing meal. We certainly found the right spot. Starting with the beautiful latina lady who greeted us graciously. The gentleman waiter who was always on the spot and very classy. Our appetizer of portabella mushroom was served as a beautifully dressed plate including a wonderful salad with a viniagrette of apple flavor. Simply devine and practically a meal in itself. All 3 of us ordered the Ribeye Sandye, we were very pleased. It was juicy, near melt in your mouth delicious with a bit of grill flavor. I was quite pleased. It was cooked med-rare just as I like it even though, typically for Mexico, only about 3/8" thick, no problem. It was more than enough food. The ambiance was great, maybe a little dark, they do have penlights, if you need. The music was perfect. A soothing rendition of Pink Floyd sank by a sweet, soft female artist recording by a band named 'Buddha Bar' (?).We really enjoyed this most relaxing break.Tomorrow is off to sea turles in Akumal Beach.I do recommend at least once. Put it on your bucket list. You may never get a chance for a unique dining experiece such as this. Go!

Great experience.. Service not great.. We went here for our 30th wedding anniversary on the recommendation of a local couple. What a beautiful and unique experience. We had never been in a restaurant like this before.. very cool!!! The food wasn't bad.. our waiter was horrible. They also add in the tip on the bill.. 15 percent.. and he was NOT worth it. Didn't work for his tip for sure. If you get a fellow from South Africa.. ask for someone else. Half the time we couldn't find him.. and there were only three tables in the place. He did however give us a free dessert since it was our anniversary. Despite his service, I would go again just for the surroundings. Bring a camera since you can walk around the cave and take pictures. Again, it was a highlight to our trip and would go again!

Alux - so much promise, so disappointing. We went to Alux with a group of 11 when staying in Akumal for a week (August 4 - 11, 2012). The setting is not to be missed. Definitely unique and worth a visit. if only the food and service were even average, it would have been a great evening out.Unfortunately, the food was overpriced, not very good and the service was very slow. We arrive early, about 6 pm and there were only about 4 other tables occupied when we arrived. The wait staff was pleasant, just not very efficient. Many of the entrees sounded exciting but the actual food disappointed almost everyone at the table.Also, be aware that, at least in August, it is warm and humid in the restaurant. They use fans to help with that but they aren't sufficient to make the temperature and humidity enjoyable. The management did accommodate a request for another fan but the fan they brought was a very large and very noisy which made it difficult to carry on a conversation with the people seated right next to you.If Alux can upgrade their food to average or better and improve the responsiveness of their service, they will have an amazing dining experience that you won't find many other places.

Just Ok.. My husband and I went there for dinner, the prices were ok, the food was slightly above average, drinks ok. The atmosphere was the saving grace - I definitely would have given it a 3 star rating if it were an average restaurant. The greatest thing about Alux is most definitely the ambiance and atmosphere. Wouldn't go back...once you've seen it that's all you really need :)

Bring your camera. My wife and I went for a drink and appetizer and I have to say, the place is amazing. A server took a few minutes and walked us through the place and it's pretty cool to look at. You definitely want to get a few pictures of this place.The service was excellent when we went, and the appetizers were good, too. Booze isn't cheap there, but I've seen worse. I gave this a 4 because of the good service we had and the incredible look of the place. It's very musty smelling and get's quite hot and humid, but that's to be expected from a cenote, in summertime, in Mexico. I think that's normal.It's worth going just to see the place.

Appaulint service and no apology!. We heard about this place on line and booked via email 3 weeks in advance. We phoned a few days betore to confirm our booking also. After a mad rush from the airport due to delayed flights we made it to alux on time for our booking and were so excited. There was a queue outside and we were greeted by a staff memeber who told us they had a wedding party booked in and dismissed us, no remorse, no advice on where to eat, no option to accomodate and not even volunteering to pay our wasted taxi. We headed back to 5th ave and ate at la casa de ague instead....Muya rico! And very hospitable!
the best. My boyfriend at the time took me here to propose. We found out about this place from some locals and it was the best dinner ever!!! I could not of asked for a better night, food and wine!!

Great Dining Experience!. My husband and I visited the Riviera Maya last year to celebrate that we had made it to our 3rd year of marriage. Since we were not staying at a resort for the first couple of days we decided we would try the local foods and any interesting place that trip advisor or my frommers and eyewitness travel books recommended. I cam across “El Alux” restaurant throught the frommers books and tripadvisor. We decided to gof or dinner and take some pictures as well. Its not every day that one gets to dine in a cave. Someone from our hotel had recommended “not to go” to El Alux. According to our friend the restaurant was humid and had a foul smell since it was a cave. He also added that some tourists had complained the food was bad. We still wanted to try it anyway! When we got their I was blown away by the décor of the place. Posh, modern, cozy and very intimate. I thought it was very romantic. It was a little humid, but of coarse you’re in a cave what do you expect? The restaurant did have some big fans to ventilate the place. I was actually very pleased with the food. I remember having I think chicken cordon bleu and its probably my favorite food of the whole trip. The presentation of the dish was also pretty neat. Service was good our waiter was good. After we dined we took advantage of the place being almost empty and went for pictures. I thought it was a great experience overall. We would definitely return if we go back to Mexico.

primitive standards in a cave. We booked this abysmal restaurant for a party of twelve, on the basis of numerous on line reviews. We should have been suspicious that it was more than half empty on the 26th December! First impressions were excellent. The restaurant is in a large and well fitted out natural cave, and we were welcomed and shown to our table adjacent to an underground stream. From then on things went from good to awful in a verical line. Service was unacceptably slow. The food was very slow in coming and when it did it all the vegetables were cold. Several starters were not finished, and two main courses were sent back as being inedible. We asked to see the manager who was 'not available'. We cut the evening short, removed the most unacceptable items from the bill, left no tip and departed angry and disappointed. To add insult to injury, the prices are twice what you would expect to pay elsewhere. Not a problem if the food and service are as good as the venue, but this was not the case. To describe this restaurant in one word it would disgraceful.

AMAZING, SPECTACULAR AND WOW. My husband and I are experienced travellers and heard about this CAVE restaurant. So we looked it up on the internet and were impressed. It was a special occasion so we dressed a liitle nicer and the cabbie took us directly to the location.We walked down the steps into a cave lit by luminaria-candles in white paper bags. The host showed us around a little and we chose the table we wanted to sit at. This was on Sunday August 15th at 7.00 pm and it was not crowded-yet.We only ordered beer as this keeps the price down and you have control over what you are drinking. We looked over the menu and many things looked very good and this never happens but we ordered the same thing. We usually try to have variety in our meal.My husband ordered the deep fried camembert cheese for an appetizer which was to die for. It was very good. I ordered the cenote salad which was fresh greens, oil and vinagrette salad with pecans and pine nuts-awesome and refreshing. For our main we both ordered medium rare filet mignon. It was at least 12 oz if not 14. We are from cattle country and have enjoyed many great steaks-so we thought in our time. This is by far the best steaks that we have ever had in our lives-bar none. It was perfectly cooked and seasoned and I am drooling now thinking about it.My husband wanted to order a 3rd steak, but I was too full. Why ruin a good thing.We even had printed the coupon off the internet and they took 10% off. We thought the beer was priced okay for a restaurant, $40.00 pesos each so $3-3.5 each depending on exchange. The appetiziers were 90 and 70 pesos each which is about $7 and $5.5 each. The awesome steaks were 275.00 pesos which is $22.00 each. At home they would have been minimum $40.00 each. With tip we paid $86.00. Amazing. At home we could easily have seen $135.00 or more plus tip.We then toured the amazing beautifully lit caves and decided next time we would at least sit in the bar and have a drink there first and then sit at our table near the waterfall Our waiter Antonio was very good and attentive and we will be going back as soon as we can. We paid in cash, we checked our bill our food was excellent and the ambience was out of this world. Disney paid a lot of money to build a cave like this in the States.WE WILL BE BACK

Interesting experience, review your check carefully. We went to this place based on a recommendation from the Riu Palace front desk. They called in the reservation for us while we were standing there and gave us a card for 4 free drinks (1 each). Upon arrival they did not have our reservation but seated us quickly as their were seats available. We ordered our drinks and presented the card. Both couples shared an entree (Ribeye steak, stuffed Chicken) and a salad. We ordered 4 additional pepsi drinks. The total bill came to $120 USD which we paid without reviewing the bill. However the bill should not have been more than $80 USD when we re-totaled later. Having said that... the food was pretty good and we got to take a lot of pictures of a very unique place.

Interesting Restaurant..Not so Interesting Food. Had the occasion to dine in the restaurant with my husband and sister. We heard about the place on the shuttle from our hotel to downtown Playa Carmen. Atmosphere was awesome though the place was a little "air starved". Food was just okay and somewhat pricey compared to other nice restaurants in the area. Will return..but only for cocktails.

BEWARE of using your credit card !!. My husband, myself and another couple we were travelling with ate at this restaurant in March of 2010....my Mastercard bill came yesterday and I have been charged 2X with the amounts differing by about a $1.50. So I called our friends and believe it or not his Visa had also been charged 2X with the amounts differing by only pennies. I could understand if one of us had been charged twice and the other not at all but 2 different charge cards and both charged twice -- I think they were trying to rip us off.I have had to open a dispute claim with MC while Visa immediatley refunded our friends.While the cave was interesting the food was not the best and therefore overpriced - now with this happening I wish we had bothered to go.

Awesome setting...Awful food.. Exactly as the title says. The cave was incredible. Every color of light imaginable..never seen anything like it. Worth going and taking lots of pictures...the cave restaraunt is insanely huge and beautiful, and I was told they were expanding it even more, and that's why there were places we couldn't go that were blocked off.The food, on the other hand, was absolutely horrific. I wanted to barf after trying my "lobster bisque." No pieces of lobster, and a raunchy fishy taste that is probably still lingering in my mouth 8 months later now. Our appetizers were so bad that we just ordered salads because we wanted to spend as little money as possible without being rude to our waiter and the staff. We got out of there for like $70 after tip and tax, and that's having one drink each. Seriously, stay away if you are just going for the food.If you want a cool experience, I'd suggest going once, but just getting drinks at the bar so you can see the cave. The drinks were good, and the place itself is spectacular, just don't eat anything there or you will absolutely regret it.

Okay, if you go at the right time. We went in March and showed up a bit late on a Sunday evening. By this time, all the shows were done, and the staff was a bit annoyed with a group of 8 coming an hour before closing time. (I get it.)Because nothing was really going on and it was so close to closing time - we felt a bit rushed. We ordered, drank and paid for our over-priced drinks and left.The caves are really cool how they are sub-divided. My experience was better at the cave in Veradero though. I think if we'd shown up earlier and caught one of the snake-dancers/fire-eaters' show, my review would be a lot better.

Unique setting makes El Alux a must-visit in PDC. El Alux is one of the most interesting and unique settings in which I've ever had a meal, and I've traveled extensively. Behind an unassuming door on Avenida Juarez, you'll be greeted with flowing water and a stairway lit with luminaries (candles in paper bags), leading the way down under street level. Upon entering the cavern, stalactites, stalagmites, and underground streams - all lit in colorful lights- greet you, along with tall candelabra, flames flickering in a gentle breeze. From an ambiance perspective, El Alux is romantic, fascinating, and beautiful - tinkling chandeliers and running/dripping water add to the mood. During dinner, a guitarist performed Mexican and other Latin love songs. Because of the limestone walls, sound does travel, and it's not a quiet space. A winding set of 'paths' bring you to the lounge area, found deeper in the cavern, which is prime location for night life. Lots of little tables tucked into corners, and large lounging beds too, as well as a stage and dance floor complete with laser disco ball. We wished we could drop the kids with a sitter and come back later. Friends who had dined here recommended El Alux as a must-see, but suggested we go for cocktails rather than dinner, as their impression was that the menu was pricy and the offerings average. We tried at lunchtime, but they were closed, so we went back another evening. We had a very enjoyable meal at El Alux, and recommend it as a unique stop during a trip to PDC. My husband and I and our sons (age 5&6, who are adventurous eaters and accustomed to dining in 'tablecloth' establishments) had an early dinner, around 6:30 pm. While the food was not 5-star, it was one of the better meals we had in PDC, and the service was polished and attentive. They have a pretty good wine list (remember, you're in Mexico, not France), and we ordered an Orvieto for about $40 US. If you ask for water, you'll get a bottle of Fiji (50 pesos, which is what the cab ride over cost!). We all ordered pasta dishes, which were served with 6-8 large shrimp (U15s), and real, imported Parmigiano Reggiano cheese. The bill came to about $150US, which included the bottle of wine, 2 bottles of Fiji water, four entrees, and an appetiser soup (which we suggest you avoid - the bisque had few chunks of shellfish and no cream, --the salads looked much more appetizing). We didn't feel that was overtly expensive, and we were surprised by the quality, creativity, and presentation of the food -- much better than we had expected, and we enjoyed the meal very much. We enjoyed the evening, and the boys are still talking about it, which tells me that they did too.

Really Cool Experience. My boyfriend & I decided to have cocktails here 8/20/2009 and thoroughly enjoyed it! This place is so unique-a cave with stalactites and stalagmites everywhere, natural streams-absolutely AMAZING! Our cocktails weren't very strong, but still tasty he ordered an appetizer that wasn’t very appetizing, however we’d already heard that it wasn’t the place to go for dinner so we weren’t disappointed. We took it upon ourselves to walk around and take photos, other reviews mentioned a tour guide but no one ever approached us for a tour or stopped us from exploring on our own. I would recommend everyone to check this out; it's such an amazing piece of history and a really cool place to hang out!

Unique and worth a visit. We had dinner on Tues. Aug.4 at at El Alux after seeing the pictures on Trip Advisor. I emailed a couple of days early to get a reservation and got an interesting response. "Your bed will be ready for your arrival at 8 p.m." I wasn't sure what I had reserved, but we went anyway. We were told we could look around after dinner and were seated at a table near a bar . We opted to drink cervesa rather than cocktails. I ordered the French onion soup- not too good...crouton and cheese were lacking, broth was thick and a bit salty. Hubby had a salad which he enjoyed- a mixture of fruits and veggies. He chose the stuffed grouper as his entree which he liked. I ordered the arracherria steak (specialty) and it was okay. A bit overdone and had some gristle and fat. Not bad, but not the best I've had for the price. We were served bread that had been heated in a microvawe for too long and had become chewy hard and inedible (unles you softened it in soup). We order Mayan coffee for dessert which was expertly prepared at tableside, but was a bit too sweet when presented. Our bill came to 92 USD before tip- not a great value for the meal itself. Before we began our tour, the guide explained that he worked for tips only (so be prepared). He seemed hurried, but did answer specific questions. The place is phenomenal in terms of design and furnishing/lighting. They do flood during a hurricane though. There was a guitarist that played American folk covers mainly; he was very good and entertaining during dinner. Remember to tip him as well. Overall the experience cost us about 150 including all tips. We are glad we went, but now that we have seen it, we would choose a different place for our next visit.

Just Ok...better with a group of people. My husband and I visited El Alux one night in June 2009. It is a really cool atmosphere, being a lounge in a cave / cenote. They have a good drink list (lots of variety), although it was a bit expensive. We also ate dessert there, chocolate cake. I thought that the cake tasted horrible (and I love sweets). It would be a fun place to hang out if it were really busy and maybe with a group of friends or a tour, but when we went there we were the only people in there...so it was a bit weird. The other thing is that it is off of the main strip, so we had to take a cab there and then take another cab to go to town. I'm glad we saw it, but I would not go back again.

interesting!. Now, isn't that cool -- a restaurant in a cave. We discovered this restaurant by reading about it on trip advisor,and we were very impressed. The drinks are expensive -- we ordered 4 Mojitos which cost 690 pesos (ugh) and then you add a tip on top of that. I had a peek at the dinner menu, and I found it typically priced for a fine-dining restaurant. It's warm in the restaurant and lounge areas, and they have huge fans helping to cool things off. The tour takes about 10 minutes of your time, and the tour guide works solely on tips. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. Make El Alux a must-see on your next trip!

must see in Playa del Carmen. This place was incredible, a bar and restaurant inside a cenote (underground cave). We only had drinks because I saw other reviews about the food not being great. The margaritas were sweet but good--drinks are definitely expensive but worth it for the atmosphere. There is a tour guide who will show you around and works only on tips. I would definitely recommend his tour, you can go places you cannot go without him and see more of the caves, he is also very informative about the geography. Also, my camera died while we were there, he took pics of us and emailed them to me along with other pics he had of the restaurant. It is only a 5 minute cab ride from downtown Playa, a must see!

WOW! What a cool place!. I’m really surprised this place wasn’t packed. Perhaps the expensive drinks keep people away. But honestly, it is worth the trip and the drink prices to at least hang out at the bar and take a tour of the caves with a tour guide.

Very Unique Dining Experience. My mother and I had dinner and drinks at El Alux, I couldn't miss it after seeing the photos on TripAdvisor. The second we got to the entrance I knew this would be like nothing I had ever experienced before. I felt like I was descending into another world...I loved every second I was there. I couldn't help but look around the entire time we were eating and then after we wandered through the different bar areas like we were Indiana Jones' sidekicks. I love this restaurant and all the people we met while dining. We don't speak Spanish and our server didn't speak much English but we got through dinner with no problem. A smile and open mind really goes a long way, keep that in mind when you travel and things will always go smoothly.

Most Beautiful Cave - SO UNIQUE!!. This was the coolest place we went while in Playa. It was so beautiful, such a strange, unique experience to have cocktails in a cave.In the US, we are not allowed to touch anything in caves, as they are protected by the government, and there, they walk you around, encourage you to touch things, gave us a private tour and the best service! Beautiful!

Definitely a Must See. I did not eat any food at this restaurant, but had heard about it while doing research for our trip. I had to ask a local to get directions because the Los Aluxes on 5th is not the same. The local asked how I had heard about this place. I told him the internet. He was surprised because he said it was a place that the locals hang out at. We were wearing casual beach wear. I asked the local if we were dressed okay and he said yes, so we went as is. Needless to say, we felt a little out of place. There was a sign on the door that said Dinner was "elegant wear" the bar is casual (no kids are allowed in bar--FYI) . I was worried we would not have time to come back it was 7:00pm so we went in anyway. The hostess asked us if we had reservations for dinner. We said no, but asked if we could go to the bar for a drink, she said of coarse. There was very few people there for dinner and two other parties in the bar area where we were sat. We ordered a drink and asked our waitress if she would take a picture, which she did. She then told us we were welcome to look around. So we did. The place is like no other I have ever seen. I don't think they would allow a place like this in the U.S. It was really awe inspiring. I think it would be more of a national park area. My husband was even surprised and agreed it is a "must see."

El Alux - Breathtaking. After reading the recommendations on tripadvisor we decided to have a meal here. We visited on a Sunday evening and the photographs we have taken do not do justice to the cave. It was breathtakingly beautiful. Our waiter showed us to a table which was actually part of the cave covered in a table cloth - we ordered a bottle of champagne (Moet & Chandon $120) which by uk prices was expensive but what the heck we are on holiday. The waiter then took us on a tour of the cave which included the vip areas and a new part of the cave which he told us had only been discovered approximately 4 weeks ago. It was astounding, we have never seen such beauty in all our travels and even worth visiting if just for a drink. We then ordered steak and this was mouthwatering (my husband works in the meat industry and is quite choosey about his steak). The waiter told us that the mango flamed in brandy was included with the meal and we had the choice of staying at our table or moving to one of the VIP tables - we decided as we were settled and the entertainment was relaxing to stay were we where. I then had a liquor coffee. Our waiter was extremely attentive and nothing was too much trouble. He prepared the dessert at our table and also my coffee. The whole bill came to $180 and that included service charge. Due to the excellent of the service we did leave a little extra. By UK standards the champagne was expensive but for the quality of the food the same in England would of cost at least double. We would definately recommend this restaurant and we are so glad we took the time to visit as it was one of the highlights of our holiday.

WOW WHAT A NEAT PLACE. I found out about this place while doing research right here on TA and WOW WHAT A NEAT PLACE!!!! My husband and I hopped in a cab and arrived at Alux on a Sunday evening right as they were opening for a quick drink. While my hubbie talked to Tony the bartender ( a great guy) about different kinds of Tequila, I mosied around the cave and checked out the beautiful scenery. Even the bathrooms are amazing. Since it was early and Tony was not busy he took us on a tour and told us the history of the restaurant and the cave. Very impressive. Having been in caves in the midwest I was surprised that this one was not at all cold. Tony explained that was because this cave is so near the surface of the land it retains heat. I hadn't thought of that?Great place and you should make the time and the effort to check this place out it is AWESOME.

What a restaurant!. We were told about Alux and decided, what the heck, let's check it out. I am so glad we did. I can't believe we could have been in the area and missed this amazing place. You are literally eating in a cave, surrounded by stalagtites and stalagmites all backlit in different colors. It blows your mind. This would be a Natl Park or something in the US....it was unforgettable. We arrived just as they were opening (6pm) so they weren't really busy. They took us on a tour of the grottos and passages. It was even more spectacular than what we had already seen. The pictures don't do it justice but maybe you can get the idea.The food is not cheap ($16 for pasta, $25 for steak) and is relatively good (the meat in Mexico is a little different) but the ambiance is phenomenal! Definately, do not miss!

Most Amazing Bar Ever?. My partner and I first heard about El Alux in our Lonely Planet (LP) Guide. The few sentences that LP had provided made the bar/restaurant sound interesting enough to warrant a visit while we were in Playa Del Carmen.At around 5pm we jumped in a taxi with the plan of hitting the bar for a quick drink before heading out to dinner - six hours later we made it out to dinner!El Alux is most definitely stupefying - it's a real, alive cave that has been turned into an amazing bar, restaurant and series of winding passageways that lead to various VIP bars and hang-outs complete with growing stalagmites and stalactites and the coolest of uber-cool decor. Think 007. Walking down into the cave you're first greeted by hosts at the entrance and shown into either the bar or restaurant. I can't speak for the food but the cocktails were amazing. Costing around $7 US, each of the cocktails were stamped with the bars signature take on the drink, many even created purely by the bar itself and utilizing traditional Mexican ingredients. My partner and i managed to work our way through almost the entire cocktail menu with the help and recommendation of one very attentive waiter (the service here is top notch). Before leaving we tipped our waiter a tidy sum and were treated to a personal tour of the cave and all it's nooks and crannies. If you ask nicely the bar staff should be happy for you to take a wander through the VIP passageway which links the separate restaurant and bar. It's an absolutely breath-taking little walk so don't leave the bar before asking if you can make the trip.El Alux is up-market and certainly pricey in comparison to most other options available in Mexico but it's still dirt cheap considering the prices at home. If you're really pinching your pennies but enjoy a good drink and an exciting experience, splash out just this once - it will certainly be worth experiencing the location and the taste of El Alux's personalized cocktails.

Best place ever!. Definitely best place in town with the best music!
Ask for Jared, and he will to serve like you deserve

Great night life but be careful. I went to this bar December 2015 and to say the least I was upset that myself my girlfriend and two friends payed 60 dollars each for all you can drink the promoter outside tried to rip us off for 200 Pessos by assuming I don't know mental math.. anyways after proving my calculation was correct soon going to this all you can drink area I asked for a double with little chase the guy pointed at the tip jar and I thought this was rude so I gave him a questioned look so he told us that our drinks all night were gonna be 1 shot (of cheap alch night I add) and 1 litre of chase all night if we didn't tip him. Very very shady business on that bartenders behalf. The night club had great music and lights and confetti cannons I would of given this bar 1 star for this jerk but it was a lot of fun and we managed to get our money's worth when he would abandon his station for up to 10 minutes at a one meanwhile the whole second floor was on this VIP promotion but to say the least if the manager is reading this you should be around more and make your self known to guests so they can have fun without being hustled by your bartenders.

Hen party. Busy and expensive. Drinks are weak if alcoholic at all. We were lured in with the promise of a special deal and X amount of bottles between the group of 11 if we took a table which turned out to be rubbish. The table service itself was appalling with drinks forgotten and service ridiculously slow yet 10% was not only expected but basically demanded. The music and atmosphere was as expected and I'm sure many people had an incredible night. If you want to pay over the odds to drink rubbish drinks whilst partying the night away with half of Playa del Carmen then please visit!

Great Nightclub!. The only bad thing about Mandala was the quality of the drinks. Sad! The rest of the club is 5 star for the service, environment, décor, lighting and staff. Two nights we were taken to the VIP section on the rooftop with free drinks and free VIP. Nice touch! The music was on point with the most popular songs from all over the world. Highly recommend Mandala!

Great music! Really good service!. I was with a bar hopper service and we hit here. Rockstartcrawl, Can't say enough about the service bar had and the music set they played. Loved it the staff here is top notch!
Very cool!. Visited here as part of a bar crawl, very cool and trendy. The decor is ultra modern yet relaxing and the music was decent too. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming too

Last night festivities . We partied till 5 am on out last night in town and shut the place down. It begins to get good around 1130 pm on a Monday like when we were there. Be leery of the last girls hanging out in the place they are women of the night. The service was very good and the staff is attentive. The place is loud and hopping so go enjoy yourself

Awesome club!. The decor and customer service is awesome! The prices are good and the service is awesome! I love this place and i think it was my favorite club in Playa. They play random music not just one style so they dont give to you the chance to be bored. Is the PLACE in Playa!! Take a few shots and dance!!

Premier nightlife!. Mandala is a great nightclub running perpendicular to la 5a avenida. The sound system is amazing, and the dance floor is well enough sized to have a great time. Ceiling is full of lights so you will sweat! It's a must visit when you're on the strip, bottle service or not.
Great nightlife. What a night. The drinks a flowing and the music is pounding. Really busy on a Saturday night. Way to busy for me but everybody in there was having a great time.

¡Expensive, but worth it!. Mandala is the best nightclub in Playa del Carmen. It has the best music and great bottle service. It does get pretty crowded and the party starts around 1AM and lasts around 5AM but you need to be in the club by 11:30PM especially if you want a table. I would recommend that you go midweek because on the weekend the minimum spend gets pretty steep. If you just want to go dance, get in early and you might go in without spending the cover charge. I would definitely recommend it as the one nightclub you should not miss in Playa del Carmen.

Best club on the strip. After two other bars on the strip, we entered Mandala and stayed there. We had a party of 5, including three parents and three girls 18-21. It had the best crowd and atmosphere of any bar in the area. We got in without a cover. Drinks are pricey, but considering we did not get hooked into some street deal to pay a large fee and get "free" watered down drinks, it was fine. Our girls had a great time as the dance floor was packed the whole night and the party was crazy. The shot lady came around and was a fun touch for all of us. As a business person, I was amazed at the size and efficiency of the staff. Our waiter was constantly keeping us serviced and at one time someone in our party dropped a bottle and it broke. Before we could even react, three staff members were on top of it and cleaned it up. Never once did I feel unsafe. I was a little annoyed that some guy hung out by the bathroom and kept offering to sell me drugs. I just had to keep telling him no each time. It seems to be a common thing in the bar district as this happened at the other places too.I would recommend this bar to anyone looking for an exciting dance club experience in Playa.

Awesome disco, 100% fun!. If you are in front of Mandala from 10 to 12, you might be invited to get in for free. They don´t offer free drinks, but is the best spot in Playa! Good drinks, very good music, and excellent vibe. It lasts untill 5 - 6 in the morning.
Birthday Celebration. this was a great place to hang out after dinner for drinks and dancing the service was awesome they people really took care of us.

Such a Fantastic Time!. Mandala is a fabulous club! We went with 2 other couples, ordered bottle service, and we were given a table near the front window. Clubs typically aren't my thing, but this place was so much fun! The music is a spectacular mix of current US and Latin American pop. I highly recommend going here at least 1 night while in Playa.

Expensive. There was a line at the entrance and for some reason the hostess just walked up to us getting out the cab and walked us in and took us upstairs offered us VIP I was'nt even sure if i wanted to stay, needless to say I didn't I was not feeling the atmosphere, the music was not appealing I usually can jig to anything but for some reason it did'nt work for me.

Best host in Playa de Carmen!. Visited Mandala for a drink with my sister and friend...we were escorted to the roof, provided with complimentary drinks and hosted by Jared Quirarte who was awesome. Very friendly, efficient and takes a fabulous photo! Highly recommend Mandala for a night out when in Playa and Jared as your host.

Busy, Expensive, Well Run Club. We got in without waiting in line paying 100 pesos each. Drinks were quite pricy, so stick to beer if you are concerned about that. The staff were really great, I don't think I have ever been served so quickly at such a busy place. The music was standard but up to date. Definitely one of the more luxurious places in Playa del Carmen.

Best place to go out in Playa!. Even after six trips in Playa, the Mandala stays the best place ever to party!The atmosphere, the music, the people, all is amazing...The welcome especially by Rogelio is warm and awesome: don't hesitate to contact him if you need something!The place to recommend!Sandrine & Julie

Great times in VIP. This club has been rocking every night we walked by. We decided to go out. The music was great. So many people having a great time. If you like night life and fun, stop back and shake your bootie!

Dirty thirty done right!. Thank you very much for your excellent service!! This place was all five of ours favorite out of all 10 we went to!! In fact it was so much fun we went two nights in a row! be prepared to pay for bottle service, but it's so worth it compared to buying single drinks, and you will get a very attractive/attentive server The music, attention of the servers, the drinks, the atmosphere, the crowd....perfect place to celebrate a dirty 30!! She loved it! We will be back for my 30th!

Best club in Playa Del Carmen. Music is great, people are awesome. You will never forget that night. The have a rooftop with different music from the dance floor. You will find people around the world that are ready to party.
Excelent place. Its the place MUST in town with the best music.Reservation, tickets, service? Ask for Roger... The best captain!!!!

So much fun!. When I am vacationing in Playa Del Carmen I always do a night of bar hopping and dancing, Mandala is the first nightclub I go to. They play excellent music and service is great. The music is pumping, everyone is dancing and having a great time. This is a hot party spot you don't want to miss. Get there early as the line-ups are pretty long.

Expensive and over rated . Went here with a friend the club is amazing as in architecture the staff smother and hound you to buy drinks and the drinks a way way OVERPRICED AND WATERED DOWN a beer was 7.50 i live in chicago we font even pay that there and the worst part is they steer at you and when your last sip is done there on you before you can get it down and there like a million servers all rushing to get you a drink to get the tip i seen the manager pointing out patrons without a drink to the servers and they rush to hound you for a drink

Stopped by while in Playa. We stopped by this night club while in Playa Del Carmen. It seems to be a true night club in the area, where things don't get hopping until after midnight. More of a stuffy high end crowd in this place. Drinks are very expensive.

Not my fave. This place plays lots of heart pounding club tunes. My biggest complaint was the high pressure bar tenders. I can see where it was good if you liked the music and overpriced short pour cocktails.

Nice club . Maybe the best during the week . I've been few times here with my friends (5 people total).The club it's small but it's nice with a decent dance floor, and many areas for tables. It's also cool you can see how is it on the street and decide to get inside or not.Sometimes was for free, sometimes 100 pesos, 1 time we got a table. We had fun and during the week where club are not very full, in this one you have fun until 5 am.Lot of girls also, many Latinas, not Many Americans. Music a mix of disco commercial, r&b, reggaeton.Nice we had fun and met many girls.

Great night out at Mandala. Over the years, we found that Mandala is the coolest place to dance in Playa. It is crowded and to sit down you need a pricey bottle service, but it is worth it. Music is excellent, crowd is trendy, service is superb. Love this place.

Great place but service may be slow. This is a great place to party but service may be a little bit difficult when it gets too crowded. Nevertheless we had a wonderfull time, the music and the people are the best!

Bad service . This place made me feel like i was worth nothing! If you don't look like a model you are not worth their time! Was happy to pay good money, but they were to busy helping only ppl they thought were fit enough for them! When I did finally get help, they got my order wrong and when trying to explain that they heard wrong they put the blame on me! They took I our table away and gave it to some else even though we had drinks in our hands and we're ready to order more! Really disappointed as we had heard such good things about them!
great spot to party!. had a great time here! 4 of us were seated in the vip area even though we didn't have bottle service. staff were awesome, the music was great and we had a good night!

Great night out. Had a brilliant night out, great atmosphere and variety of music- danced the night away! Paid a bit extra for open bar but it was worth it as drinks were bought to us which was great service definitely worth a visit

Fantastic!!. If you want a taste of Playa's best nightlife, you must make a stop at Mandala. Great music, beautiful open atmosphere (and rooftop!), fun & classy crowd (with wide age range) and last but not least, extremely professional & friendly waitstaff. My friends and I had a wonderful time at Mandala will definitely revisit on our next trip to Playa!

Great Club and Great Service!. Mandala is the best club in Playa Del Carmen. The atmosphere is amazing and its always packed and playing new music. Our waiter Mauri was great, he provided excellent service and made sure everyone had a fun night. I would highly recommend visiting Mandala in Playa Del Carmen.

Great Until It's Not!. This really is a gorgeous bar with great dance music. Having been here several times during previous stays to Playa del Carmen, I decided to bring a large group back with me during this visit. My husband and I decided to purchase the "all you can drink" special and we were having a great time until about an hour into the night, one of my friends took a drink from my beer while her husband was buying her drink from the bar. OUT OF NOWHERE, bouncers snatched the drink out of my hand and dragged me by the arm to the front of the bar where they cut off my wristband and told me to leave. Really...? Because my friend had a SIP of my drink? It was all a little too dramatic. So before entering, just know that the drinks included in the "all you can drink" special are keg beer, bad tequila, and weak vodka drinks, and YOU CANNOT LET SOMEONE HAVE A SIP or you will be treated extremely poorly. Although we have had a lot of fun in the past, we will not be returning.
So Fun. Good vibes, excellent sound system. Beautiful venue, located in the clubs area. Drinks are Ok and the music is awesome.

FUN FUN FUN. Great music, beautiful people, and in the center of everything in Playa del Carmen. You can't miss with this cool-hip place. Buy a bottle and get a table for the best view and service. Love it and go every time I am in PDC.

Playacrawl with Ivan . We recently went on the playacrawl with Ivan and it was hands down the most night life fun we had there. He was highly energetic and made sure we had everything we needed. At one point I asked Ivan about how late the hookah bar was open and he responded by bringing a hookah to the club we were at. It was a great time and I highly recommend Ivan if anyone gets the option to pick their guide.

Playacrawl as solo tourist - (Megan M). I did this tour on my very first night in Playa and it was a blast. I knew it would be a great way to have a good time especially since I was on vacation alone. I had a good group of people and the tour guide, Ivan made sure we were having a good time. Would definitely do it again.

A wild night out in Playa Del Carmen!. Booked Playacrawl and did it the night of Saturday, October 1st 2016. Ivan was our host and boy did he deliver!! There was 8 people in our group. Very small and intimate. Much different compared to the club crawls I've done in Las Vegas. There were people from all over the world (Bahamas, Iceland, Germany, Scotland and us from Canada) in our group. Very cool to meet and party with people from all walks of life. The first club was 'Abolengo' around 10:30pm. Ivan made sure everyone had drinks in hand while we were there and he had the shots coming one after another. We were celebrating my partners birthday and Ivan happily acknowledged it. He even had the club put 'HAPPY B-DAY JORDEN' on the club tv screens. So cool!! We stayed there for 90 minutes while everyone got their buzz on and were getting to know each other. Around 12am midnight we walked across the street to 'Mandala'. At 'Mandala', Ivan ordered a bottle of vodka (domestic) for the table and ordered other drinks for those who did not want vodka. While this club was fun, the one thing most of the group and I did not like was having a table that was on the outside of the club practically on the street. After a polishing off a second bottle of vodka, we headed to the 'Blue Parrot' around 1:30am. At the 'Blue Parrot', Ivan ordered a large bottle of Smirnoff Vodka for the table which was a nice surprise and pleasant change from the domestic alcohol we were drinking. The 3rd and final club (Blue Parrot) was my favourite because people were more comfortable with each other and were able to let loose more. The music walking in wasn't my thing (rap) but there was a tiny club within the club that played techno so we stayed there until the main club switched to top 40! Ivan stayed with us the whole night and made sure we had everything and anything we wanted. It was awesome. He's knows what he's doing, knows all of the people at the clubs and knows how to keep the party going. If you want to party in Playa Del Carmen and get a feel for the clubs, do this club crawl! You will get your money's worth and definitely feel it the next day. Happy to say I can cross partying in Mexico until 5am off the bucket list. Thanks Ivan!

Ryan & justine 24/9/16. Great service from the start, Ivan was a great party host made me and my partner feel welcome in the group, the service at each Bar was great and we'd highly recommend it, thank you Ivan for the great first experience of playa del Carmen nightlife!

The host is what's making this a great night!. Ivan did a fantastic job! 3 bars we hit played great mixes and they treated everyone like stars!Only 1 downside. Taxi to and from Sunset Princess is 220-240 pesos. Something Ivan's team should look at is a extra package to pay for this in advance. Almost didn't have small bills for the fair. That's not Rockstar, that was me.

Great time with Ivan!. Me and my wife had a great time partying with Ivan on our honeymoon. It was just the three of us, but he's very personable, and does a great job getting everyone to have fun. Definitely would recommend!

Best night out in Playa del Carmen. When you are new to a place, it's a cool idea to do an organised pub/club crawl, and Playacrawl did not disappoint. Ivan was the MAN and made sure we were all having an awesome time. The drinks were flowing and music was cranking, was a crazy fun night. I'd recommend anyone to get amongst a Playacrawl!

Great night!. I had no issues finding and meeting with Beto, our host for the evening, at the designated meeting point. We had to wait a while for the other guests to arrive which was a little awkward. Once they arrived we went to the clubs, and though I'm not much of a club person I had a great time. There was a small hiccup at one of the clubs which Beto was quick to take care of. I would definitely recommend this to other visitors to Playa.

Great night in Playa. My wife and I just spent our honeymoon in Playa del Carmen and figured a pub crawl was a good way to get a lay of the land and have some fun, and Playacrawl was definitely the way to go! Ivan was an amazing host all night and made sure everyone in the group had a great time with plenty of crazy drinks along the way... we definitely recommend!

Great Bachelorette Idea. This was an enjoyable experience. Went in with no idea what we were in for, to my surprise it was really fun and safe. Beto and crew was very attentive. He never left us alone and made sure we were safe. We never left his site except to go to the restroom of which he knew that we were in there. I say it is worth doing with a large group of friends.

Very fun! . Great pub crawl!! Definitely get your money's worth! Unlimited drinks of anything vip at each club. You go to three awaome places not coco bongo! But Ivan was great and fun!! Don't find many guides like him!! He is out to make sure everyone is having a good time :) went with my partner we had a ball.

The Absolute Best Party Host Around!!. During our 6 night stay in Playa, we used the playacrawl twice. We had a different party mood each night, and Ivan was Great at picking up on it and delivering both nights. Ivan was an outstanding host and we received VIP treatment at Playas top nightclubs.
Thanks again Ivan, for two incredible nights out!! 😀
Tracy & Amanda

Mexico clubbing VIP style. If you want to experience the nightlife playa style then u must do. It's safe, the host and the bars are very attentive and the group dynamic is something u can't get going out alone. Playacrawl is a must do for anyone wanting to experience the night life. In fact every time I bring a new friend to Playa do a Playacrawl. I love it, they love it, it's no hassle and a ton of fun.My host was Ivan and he is soo fun, really does an awesome job to make you feel like you are partying it up with friends. Takes fotos, dances. It's a great time

Best club experience August 20, 2016. Where do I begin! Ivan is the best club guide. No lines, vip entry, vip seating, bottles on the tables, shots keep coming. Everyone knows Ivan which makes it that much better. Only the best tops clubs with fire shows and dancing. I only gave 5 stars cause that's the limit! And for the price, you can't beat it. You get well over your money's worth!! I'll be booking a trip with Ivan anytime we plan to come back here. Thanks again Ivan!!

Birthday Bash Fun. We had planned on getting right off the plane and to our condo then finally to meet up with Ivan for a reservation for Sat night. Unfortunately the weather did not permit. We were delayed 2 1/2 hours and by the time we arrived to the condo it was already 11:30 pm. Past the 10:30 PM meet up time. I found a phone number on my confirmation email and exchanged texts with Sina. She was so helpful and offered to reschedule at no charge for Sunday night instead. We met up with Ivan on Sunday night and had a really great time. He was fun and attentive all night. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to have a really fun night out with a notable (totally worth it) hangover the next day.

21st birthday party blast . Safe,fun, and such a great time from the moment we got picked up from the resort till they brought us back. Our guide never left our side, never left us without a drink in our hand and danced our booties off.. Great for any kind of celebration ..Rock star crawls from now on anywhere we travel too
LAST NIGHT WAS AMAZING!!. Great time, Ivan made sure we had a good time and the service was awesome. I'll definately recomend this tour and will be doing it again next year.
Excellent. We had a great time! Excellent eperience! Our guide made sure we were taken care of and made sure our night was a night to remember!

Lame. We had an okay time. Before the party started we were told we had to tip last minute. Our guide collected money from us - luckily we had remembered to bring cash.The first club was dead. It was almost empty. We made it fun by adding more alcohol to the "shots" and probably livened it up for the establishment. The second club was a foam party, blue parrot - which was fun except we had to leaving soaking wet which did not make for a fun experience for the third place. Our guide kept on telling us the third club was better - except when we got there it was super lame, there was nobody in the club and nobody wanted to stay because we were so uncomfortable. All the clubs are close together and within walking distance.

Great Time. Great host; made a couple new friends and had a fantastic time - It was worth it. Was in Playa (solo) for one night before heading down south and decided to do the crawl for some fun. Best decision I ever made - met some great people, drinks were flowing and the atmosphere was fantastic.

Worth the Money. Seriously, Playacrawl is well worth it, and our guide Ivan was amazing! He made sure that me and my girls had a blast! There were 8 of us, and he catered to us all. The clubs were great and Ivan made sure that we were safe and having a good time. If you are in Playa, do the crawl, and make sure you ask for IVAN!! Think about it... VIP and Bottle service at three clubs is better than standing around and paying regular price.

Thank you Ivan. We went to Mexico to celebrate my friends's bachelorrete party and our party guide was Ivan. He is one fun person to have as a guide. He was so energetic and so sweet. He made sure our drinks service was up to the mark. Also because we were all girls, he was very protective and made sure of our safety too.It was a great experience partying in Mexico due to him. Thanks !

Perfect Playa del Carmen night out!!!. I was here for Bachelor party with a small group, and Ivan was our personal tour guide. Ivan was basically the king of the city who knew everyone and got us the best seatings at all clubs with unlimited Tequila all night so you know how that ended. Anything we needed Ivan was there to help us whether it was a group of girls or Congratulation banners on the TV Screens he came through. So for anyone not familiar with the party scene i would totally recommend it, cant beat the price, the service and experience.

IVAN WAS GREAT!!!. Ivan was a great party guided he made sure we were all safe and had an amazing time. He kept the drinks coming and made sure we were super tired from dancing all night. We felt comfortable like we were back at home in the states. We felt like celebrities and the club choices were definitely on point!! We will be using him again..

Playa Crawl 07/16/16. If you love to drink, party, and dance, this is for you! Our Playa Crawl guide was Ivan. He was very fun, energetic and outgoing! Ivan made sure my birthday in Mexico was one to remember... Well, partially remember lol! Ivan kept the drinks and fun coming throughout the night! My friends and I really enjoyed ourselves! If you choose to do the Playa Crawl pick Ivan, you'll be glad that you did!

Highlight or Our Trip!. Ivan is the MAN!! Amazing service, energy, and fun! This was recommended through another couple and we could not have been more pleased. Ivan worked incredibly hard to make sure we all had drinks all night, were comfortable, and were having a blast. Every club was wall to wall packed, and he made sure we all had tables and great service. PS: the clubs are very much that - clubs. If you want to sit at a bar, go to your hotel lobby. If you want to dance and party - this is the activity!!!

Poor value, disappointed. Group of 8 girls for bachelorette. Did a boys/girl thing as we had a big group and decided that we didn't want to see the other group.Sina was with the boys, Ivan with the girls. Ivan was great - Sina was terrible which I assume is the boss. We had been told there was a foam party, and with girls, we requested to end up there last- it makes sense for girls to end up at the foam party (since our guys didn't really care when they were going to the foam party). Sina did not allow this.They forced the girls to go to the foam party second, and after we were all dripping and wet, wanted us to go to the last bar which was pretty lame - no dance floor, just couches and no bottles. They even left the foam party without 2 girls - and the 2 other girls had to run out because they saw their party leaving. Not safe.Ivan tried to get us back into the foam party since the bride was upset, and even threatened to not get married but Sina would not allow us to do it and wanted to charge us more.Sina also did not tell us about the mandatory tips for each waiter to either the bachelors or bachelorettes. (Bachelors had to tip $75 USD, and bachelorettes had to tip minimum $40).At $80-85/person, not worth the hype for 2 bars that weren't that great, and all the drama causd by Sina. The foam party was fun though! :)

A fun night out. Ivan is a great guide. The places we went to were cool and its an open bar. There is a reserved table at each place which helps. Ivan stayed well beyond what he promised for since the night went on till much later...A little pricier than other pub crawls I have been to, but it was great fun and I don't regret the price I paid.

PlayaCrawl for Bachelorette. We were a group of 7 girls going to Mexico for my bachelorette. Booked the playa crawl after reading lots of great reviews. We were NOT disappointed. Ivan was our guide. He was full of energy and helped make my bachelorette in Playa an awesome time. We had tables/booths at every bar and bottle service as promised. Would recommend this night out to anyone looking to have a good time.

Great value!. Have done both the cuncrawl and playacrawl, can say that ivan on the playacrawl was by far the best guide we had. Kept the drinks flowing and ensured everyone had the best possible night.

PLAYACRAWL!!!. The Playacrawl was AWESOME! If you are willing to get out and experience the nightlife this is a good choice. Our party guide was Ivan and he was more than willing to satisfy our party experiences. Just remember this is not only experiencing nightlife but taking the drinks along with it. Ivan was not only a guide but also a guy who partied in our group. He was very educational in all the surrounding and very attentive to our needs. From the beginning we felt like we knew Ivan. He even makes sure you get a ride home at the end of the night... because after this Playacrawl, you will need it.

Round 2!. This was our second time booking with Playacrawl and it was a great time. Ivan kept the party going and the drinks flowing! We did the crawl on a Sunday and the atmosphere was Turnt Up! Foam party at the Blueparrot was a very unique experience and we enjoyed the fun (you will be soaked and buried in foam). Big thanks to Ivan the party ninja for being a great party host, we will definitely be back.

Best way to start out the vacation !. Coming from Vegas my husband and I had high expectations of the night life. We thought we'd be with a bigger group, but due to the circumstances of the night it was just us two and Ivan. Ivan is awesome. It literally felt like we were hanging out with one of our best friends. He made us feel comfortable and made sure we always had a drink....and a shot in our hands. I always felt safe. All three places we went to we skipped lines and were walked to a table. By far one of the best memories we made. Thank you Ivan! It wouldn't have been possible without you! Come to Vegas so we can return the favor! If your contemplating this trip...just do it. I promise you won't regret it!

Fun activity. This was my second time doing this activity and it was fun. Ivan was the host again and he remembered me and we caught up. It was a Sunday and not high season so we got to spend a lot more time talking and it was like catching up with an old friend. The biggest benefit for me is that you get to go in free and have a place to sit, you feel like a VIP. And people who did the group in the previous few days sometimes come and say hello also and rave about how much fun they had. All in all a good time even when you're tired and it's hot outside, you simply forget about this and enjoy.
dirty 30 Playacrawl. Partying with Ivan. No lines, VIP tables, open bar lots of drinking and dancing. we cerebrated my daughter dirty 30 birthday.

Overall a great night! . Great night out. Ivan was our host for the evening and really the service was really good! Although our group wasn't huge we still had a ball. Highly recommended for one of your first nights in Playa to get to know the bars. Thanks Ivan!!!

IVAN IS THE MAN!!!!!. Out of our wedding party we had 10 friends for the playacrawl! ! It was absolutely amazing! Ivan is the man!! No lines, vip tables,open bar, and drinking dancing drinking dancing! !!! Worth every penny! Hope to see you again Ivan!
