After staying there for the day they are losing a fortune since nobody checks to see if you purchased a wrist band or not. The people next to me were there all day for free. The old system was better. The fact that in Mexico people can sit directly in front of you on the beach makes this beach club a place I can do without. Next to Mamita is the public beach. Once again it seems to me they are doing so much business they do not care about the quality of the food or keeping the beach clean. Playa is loaded with tourists so Mamita could care less if you like it or not. Waiters are OK but I suggest you go up to Quinta Avenida and have a great lunch.

Fantastic Day . We've spent one day at Mamitas during our trip and plan to go back again before we leave. We rented a king cabana for the day and the service was great. The music does get a little loud so don't go if your looking for a serene and tranquil beach experience. If you enjoy spending time in the water, good food and drink, and people watching this place is for you.

A chill day at the beach. We had read mixed reviews of the this beach club but after scouting out the other beach clubs just like everyone says this is the nicer beach. After previous day wasted to the rain we were ready for some fun in the sun. We did pay 100 pesos each for two chairs and umbrella. We brought our own towels so that was one expense that we didn’t have to worry about. We drank the day away and only ordered a basket of fries. The drinks were pricey. We closed our tab after three rounds of drinks and did find and automatic 15% tip added. We had a few more rounds and closed again only for the waiter to tell us that our card was declined. We knew that was inaccurate considering we had a prepaid Travelex card and knew exactly how much we had on it. We finally settled the bill in cash. And used our Tavelex card for dinner at another restaurant. Just be sure to keep your eye on your tab. I wouldn’t say the service was great but even after tipping our waiter serval times he didn’t seem to check on us anymore than he had before. Overall I would say it was a solid B experience.

Busy beach, excellent facilities & great location. We visited Mamitas Beach club twice during our stay in Playa del Carmen in June 2016. We bought wristbands from an outdoor booth by the carpark, $300 pesos($100 refundable deposit) for 2 lounge chairs & umbrella, that included F & B service and bathroom facilities. We thought this was good value for such a beautiful beach, safe environment to leave our kindle/phone/other gear under umbrella, clean toilets, friendly wait staff and in general away from the peak time chaos of the public beach area. The food was average but the drinks were cold. We spent around $1100 pesos on F & B each visit. Ask to see the bill before paying as they may have already added a 15% tip.

Chilled. Great music . It's pretty hot at this time of year. We took the chairs front row. 200 pesos. Very happy with the service and great music. The benefit of this place over KOOL beach club is you don't have music reverberating from the other clubs. Service great. And on our day this part of the beach was cleaner and nicer to swim in
Great service on the beach!. Reasonable rate for umbrella and chairs for the day. Servers are very attentive but leave you alone. Reasonably priced food and drinks! Best way to do the beach!

Other beach clubs do it better. Great location, lots of space, but somehow we were not blown away. Food just OK, nothing wrong with it, but to be honest just a bit bland - what you might get at a Florida beach club. Not cheap either, when you factor in the cost of the sun loungers. The waiting staff seemed most animated when making sure we left them a suitable tip. Other beach clubs do it better.
Very nice beach club. Fantastic beach club and friendly waiters the only bad thing is the captain jimmy and the way he treat the people, not a good person for that job

Friendly stuff, convenient with young children. Me and my wife came to Mamitas with our 3 years old daughter. First we wanted to rent a place at the beach, but then we saw the pool and of course our daughter insisted to go there instead of the sea. So we rented a chair at the little pool ( which is really only for young kids) but me and my wife could relax while our daughter was having great fun with all the other kids in the pool. The staff was very friendly and we enjoyed the background disco house music while relaxing on the sun chairs. My wife ordered a ceviche which was very fresh and delicious. i could easily take a swim in the sea and also enjoy the beautiful playa.so alltogether a very pleasant stay.
Great place to spend a day in Playa. If you want to spend a day at the beach in Playa you should go to Mamitas Beach Club. You can enjoy sun, eat, and drink for a great price and good service.
Great. Mamita's beach club, helped our visit to Playa del Carmem to be fantastic. Great atmosphere, perfect for a relax day by the beach.

favorite place in Playa del Carmen. Seriously one of my favorite places for being at water's edge. this club offers chairs and the amount you pay counts as a credit toward food and drink. towels are checked out for a150P deposit but returned at end of day.

Great Beach Club at Playa. spent day at Mamitas Beach Club- umbrella (necessary with heat)& 2 lounges @200 pesos/day + food ordered & served at beach.Had amazing fish tacos & fish skewers. Great servers! Beautiful beachfront

A great relaxing atmosphere.. It cost 100 Pesos for the umbrella to rent, but you must bring ticket from the hotel for beach chair, otherwise it will cost another 100 Pesos. They have servers assigned to all the beach chairs, So service is very good. The food prices are very reasonable, but drinks are over priced. I would carry my own water. The club sandwich is very good.

Fun for young & old. We actually went to go to another beach club nearby but had my two young children with us and they had a no kids policy - so went to Mamitas instead & so glad we did!We were ushered straight into a fabulous lounge area on the deck where we ate, drank, dance & swam the afternoon away. We were 9 people in total ranging in ages from 19 months to 69 years and everyone had a ball. My parents had lovely ocean swims, my kids enjoyed the pool, my brother loved the tunes, my sister & her boyfriend enjoyed the drinks, and my hubby and I loved the food! The wait staff were super attentive and we were never without drinks for long. Great spot to lose a day or two if you're in Playa - definitely worth a visit. Wish there was a place like this in Sydney!!!!

Excellent!. Mamita's Beach Club is definitely the best place on the beach to go when visiting Playa del Carmen! The atmosphere is great - fun with good music - the food and drinks are very good, and the service is great! The staff is very hepful and friendly, and the beach is beautiful! Erik was the staff member that took care of us for the week, and he was simply the BEST, making the experience even better!! If you go to Playa del Carmen, don't miss Mamita's!

Great view and music. Super chill but keep an eye on your tab.. I would have to say that I was not impressed by their alcohol prices. The view is amazing and it makes up for the over priced beer. The waiters are very nice, but make sure you are keeping tabs on what you consume. Also,check their website for the pricing on the rentals of the umbrellas, beach chairs, and beds. Make sure they are charging you according to what they advertise. They have been known to over charge people, so just keep and eye out. The DJ was spinning awesome chill music and it's conducive to the environment. The only negative thing is the beach beds are not in the best of shape. The sun has beaten them up and they look a little dirty. I recommend the umbrella and beach chairs. They are cheaper and provide more shade than the beds.

Great Experience at Mamita's Beach Club!. My friends and I had an amazing time at Mamita's Beach Club over Memorial Day Weekend! It is a little pricey but the music was on point, the beach was excellent, the drinks were great, and the staff was friendly. Definitely recommend it for people looking for a fun beach afternoon in Playa del Carmen.

Bad client service!. I went to Mamita´s in June 2016, after some friends had recommended it to me, but only to find out that it is not as great as everyone talks about. The "club" is a day beach club right by the beach. Looks really nice but unfortunately the service is extremely bad. We arrived and wanted to sit on their beach with drinks so asked to buy cocktails to go. Asked 2 different waiters if this was possible and yes it was. However, ordering could not be done by those two waiters, we had to go to the bar. So we did. And yes again were told we can order cocktails to go. After we spend 5 minutes deciding which ones we want (we were 5 people) the bartender tells us that oh we can only buy it if we also buy a main dish!! Not something anyone thought of telling us, or him for that matter earlier. After some deliberation, and since we were already there, we finally decided to buy a main dish and take it to go. We then asked if we could sit on their beds since we bought the food and the cocktails (this was by the end of the day around 5 and they close at 6). Of course this was absolutely not possible as we would have to rent the beds (in other places beds simply require a minimum purchase of 200 pesos). Obviously here we would have to buy everything and only 1 hour left before closing. At the same time my friend wanted to go to the bathroom and was rejected at the door because we hadn t bought anything yet. We were so appalled that we left. Zero customer service.

Be aware. We went here because we got discount vouchers from the hotel we are staying at. The sunbeds and the beach is good but we did not have a good experience at lunch! First we had to ask to get both the menus to our table and later to order. But the worst thing was when we asked for the bill. First we waited for 5-10 minutes for the waiter to come to our table only to Tell us how much we had to pay. When we asked for a receipt we had to wait another 5 minutes. On the receipt the amount was 505 pesos but the waiter earlier told us 580 pesos, so he added the tips himself. We paid the amount on the receipt and gave him around 40 pesos as a tip. He then told us we had to pay another 40 pesos as a tip and that 15 % of the bill is the minimum tip you can give in Mexico. We've now been in Mexico for 2 weeks and have never heard anything like that from any other restaurant. There was no service charge on the bill and it did not say anything else either about tip. We told the waiter this and he said it says in the menu that tip is not included (but it does not say that you are obligated to pay any or how much!). For us tips is not something you can demand, it depends on the service you give. Tomorrow we will choose another beach club..

Heard good things...but.... Went to Mamita's Beach Club on a Sunday afternoon on Memorial Day weekend after reading good reviews. Greeted at the door by a hostess who told us "VIP" beds (and we specifically heard the word "bed") would be 200 pesos, plus a minimum spend of 1000 pesos, in line with what we'd read in previous reviews. We said, great, we'll take that.Once inside, things went south fast. We were moved over to beach umbrella and chairs, which did indeed cost 200 pesos, but were not the VIP beds or the pool. We inquired and found out the VIP on the beach is 2000 pesos, and the VIP for the pool is 1800 pesos, and you are not allowed to go between the two areas even if you buy VIP. Quite the bait and switch. Tunes were pretty good, nothing you wouldn't get at any other beach club. Beach is nice, but absolutely covered in seaweed. Had two drinks and left. It's an okay place, but don't expect what you read in the positive reviews and don't expect prompt or responsive service. You'd be better served bringing your own beer to the adjacent public beach and throwing down a towel there, IMO.

Pricey but amazing beach. We spent the day at Mamitas which is easily one of the priciest of the beach clubs in Playa del Carmen. The price is 100 pesos per chair and an umbrella, with that you get free access to showers and bathroom.The beach is amazing, however the service is not. I have seen the waiters trying to scam some people by charging 200 for one chair.I have also requested a wifi access and the waiter told me that it was 100 pesos, i was not interested, yet i asked another waiter who gave me the code for free....The best way to enjoy this beach is to come with your stuffs and sit close to the club, a lot of people were doing that, enjoying a free amazing beach, without being scammed.

Not a bad place. Kind of Pricey. Gorgeous beach.. We spent the day at Mamitas which is easily one of the priciest of the beach clubs in Playa del Carmen. Along with it's neighbor, Kool, it forgets that it is in Mexico, not South Beach, It is at a prime location in what is the most gorgeous stretch of beach available within easy walking distance to the center of Playa. When we arrived the waiter directed us to some chairs and told us that someone will be around to collect the rental for the beach chairs. When the fee is paid, you get an armband. This is independent of any food and drinks that may be ordered. The price is 200 pesos for two chairs and an umbrella, which is clearly stated on the menu, although I did over hear them trying to charge some Gringos more.The food and drinks were fine, but on the expensive side. If you rented beach chairs, you can use the bathrooms and showers for free. Otherwise, there is a charge. The bill came and it was exactly as expected, with no attempted add ons of anything like a tip (which they are not supposed to add to the bill anyway.)As long as you realize this place is expensive for Playa, I would recommend it without hesitation.
Perfect beach at great price. This place has an amazing beach and the chairs are very reasonable. Daniel is the man and took great care of us. You will not be disappointed.

BIll in restaurant had already added tip. THe service on the beach is great. WE just walked up to the outdoor restaurant to eat where it is cooler. ORdered two drinks and onion rings. Asked for la Cuenta. He (Luis) verbally said 350. I had already added it up and should have been 305. WE asked to see the bill - it was not put in money container. HE brought it, saying the tip is on there. WE then removed the tip we had enclosed - which was more than he had added.

trendy and sofisticated. this club is higly well located. Mamitas beach is the most popular for locals and tourists. They don't offer you the great service we had at the Kool Beach Club (next to it) but they got us with music . Affordable while in a group but a bit high rated for going alone. This is also the gay area if you want to sociaalize with some locals too.

Avoid this place!. What started off as a fun day turned terrible! We were a group of women looking for a fun pool club day to celebrate. We were definitely prepared to spend...and we did, and got nickel and dimed for EVERYTHING, including "renting" towels from what turned out to be a third party vendor. When it eventually down poured after we dropped a few hundred USD, the towels were taken away from us and we were no given dry ones. All of us left soaking wet and not even the manager would help. At first they told us they did not have a credit card machine and were cash only. This is obviously a lie. After we settled our tab a server chased after the guest of honor accusing the group of shorting the bill and forcing her to pay additional money. I need to note we were the ONLY people in the whole club...all day...this should have been a red flag. Do not waste your time or money here.

Busy, but modern. One of the nicest beach clubs among the neighboring coast line. We were usually the last ones to take the remaining sun beds, only the double ones remained. Somewhere around 3pm the DJ started, but it wasn't too disturbing, so we just continued with our reading. there was a big choice of drinks and food and the quality was very good.

Not impressed anymore... their expansion has gone to their heads!. This used to be a very clean and well managed beach club. For the last two years they have expanded forward reducing the beach front for locals as well as increasing their shoreline foot print. The service the last two times has been terrible. This is another establishment that has ruined this lovely beach setting.

Great beach day! . We enjoyed our day at Mamita- swimming and drinking cocktails. We hired chairs and an umbrella and the staff were helpful and friendly. We were in Mexico just after the spring break rush so the beach had a good vibe without being crazy. The quality of the food in the restaurant was great too.

crazy but fun. During my recent stay in Playa del Carmen, my fiancé and I enjoyed the entertainment and beach side service at Mamitas. It was quite the experience, with the beach party starting early in the afternoon, but we had a great time lounging by the beach, sipping on cocktails and eating a delicious lunch. It was certainly a great spot and the beach scene was fun and energetic, however, be prepared for the throngs of partying "spring breakers" later on in the day. While we did not stay for the evening festivities, we are sure it was pretty crazy. If that is your style, then Mamitas is the place to be. Overall, great place to hang out and get the beach vibe on, just be prepared for the party scene. The service was superb and food was great. We'd certainly return.

Mamita's beach club . Amazing place to chill and have amazing experiences. DJ concerts are the best there! The atmosphere is amazing! Great service too! I recommend this place if you want to chill with your friends.
Honeymooning. Place was great. Bit pricey for day beds. You had to spend s certain ammt on food and alcohol to rent them. Ended up just getting beach chairs and umbrella. All in all a fun day though!

Nice place to get caught in a rain storm. My dad and I stopped in here and it immediately started raining and did not stop for at least 1.5 hours. We grabbed a table with a view of the water and had some drinks until it cleared up. It was beautiful down there and not as loud and pushy as the bars away from the beach. Good place if you want to have a few drinks and relax.

Best beach experience. Just spent 3 fantastic days at Mamitas! Great mix of chill and party vibe at the beach! Amazing house dj's, delicious food and drinks. Ask for Russell, he took such good care of us and we will definitely come back next time we're in Playa.

Really beautiful place but pricey. Great place with all white sun beds and a live DJ playing music. Kinda like a club bar on the beach with a Miami feel $$$$. Really beautiful beach with long stretch of white sand and beautiful clean and clear water. It pretty pricey but the beautiful beach makes it worth it.

The coolness factor. Spent my first day in Playa Del Carmen at this beach club. We got a couple of beach chairs for 200 pesos. It was little further from the Dj but still had a cool vibe to it. The waiter was a little slow on drink service but nothing too bad. (Side note: If you forget your towel no problem. They loan them to you for a small fee)On my fourth day in Playa (my birthday) we opted for a cabana (large bed) which was still 200 pesos only this time with a spending limit of 2000 pesos. We got a bottle of tequila and some food for the three of us which worked perfectly. This time our cabana was right in line with the DJ and we had an awesome time! The waiter was more attentive this time. He refilled our ice bucket and even made our drinks for us on occasion.I have to note that its probably better to split a bottle because the drinks here are pricier than other bars or beach areas. There are signs all over the beach saying you cant bring outside alcoholic beverages but literally feet away from us there were a lot of people drinking store bought stuff. So you can probably get the same vibe if you're on a budget. Just stay off the beds. We saw quite a few people trying to sneak their way onto them. They never lasted very long. I would definitely recommend this place if you love a cool, loungy vibe.

Nice spot on a good stretch of beach. We used Mamita's 4 or 5 times during a 3 week stay in Feb. The price is definitely 200 pesos for 2 loungers and an umbrella (they give you a wristband), with no minimum consumption, in fact the waiters won't even bother you unless you call them over. These lounger prices are printed right on their menu. Wifi is OK, but free only for an hour, but you can try to ask for another code after that. However, there are several big signs that say you cannot bring any of your own food or drinks, and I'm sure they will enforce this. Food prices are a bit on the high side, but not terribly so. We just ate lunch up the street (Calle 28/29) or went back to our condo for a bite. They play loud mood electro-pop or "trance" music which did fit the scene well. That recent reviewer who claimed they charged ridiculous prices must've been confused by a VIP section, or was being conned? (The Grand Hyatt next door wanted 1000 pesos each for chairs for non-guests!!!) The beach between about Calle 10 and Constituyentes is pretty much unusable, very narrow with large sand bags (to prevent erosion), fishing boats, lots of weed, and smelly, although there are a few beach bars there. From the main pier (Juarez) to Calle 10 the beach is also good, and again several less classy beach bars. Most seem to charge about 100-150 pesos/chair, but some seem to imply the chairs were free if you ate or drank something - it was hard getting a straight answer out of the waiters. Wah-Wah's near the pier, however don't charge for chairs at all, and you could probably get by with only a small drink purchase. The beach running north from Mamita's is great running all the way around the point to El Marlyn Azul (about 4-5 km), but the beach services get progressively less until there are almost no people on it. The only way to use the beach south of Juarez/Pier is through Sr. Frog's (make like you're going to the bar, but then just slip down to the beach), or walk way around into Playacar past their security gate, like you're staying there. The beach there is excellent with very few people, but no services at all. There are no public restrooms anywhere on the beach, but of course most or all of the beach bars have them. Mamita's is very clean, and the best one was in the Grand Hyatt behind their pool, which you can walk into by making like you stay there. Funny thing, no one seems to use them hardly at all. Hmmm, I wonder where they have a pee while spending the whole day at the beach???

Clean, and classy. Beach club that has it all---food , surf, sand , and even a pool. Great place to spend the day with good service and amenities that rival resorts. If you are in Playa without beach-front access, this is a great way to get it. Breakfast may be the best meal. Waiters sometimes friendly, then sometimes snippy.

Ridiculous prices. We went there today and had read different positive reviews with fairly new ones which included prices ranging from $100 pesos to $350 pesos including an umbrella and a lounge chair. The $350 pesos price included drinks or a food credit for $350 pesos. When we got there we were told for two people for only 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella it would cost us $1,500 pesos ($90.00 usd) and it didn't include any drink or food credit. There's not a beach anywhere that I know of that would charge anywhere near those prices. You can buy an umbrella and chairs at Walmart for far less, use it for your vacation and throw it out ( or give it to someone) for far less than what you would pay for one day to the thieves at the beach. Or if you'd like have lunch at Senor Frogs and get a few drinks and swim at their private beach for free.

Daytime Beach Party. The atmosphere was amazing! Everyone was having a great time. Live DJ, and an amazing view! There's a walk up bar, servers, or you can BYOB. Bring your beach towel or you can get lounge chairs if they're still available. It was pretty packed when we went in August.

Detox City. We went there 3 out of 4 days! Super clean for the amenities and priced very well!2 chairs and a umbrella! We ordered breakfast/lunch, bottled water, their mixed fruit water (YUM - must try). Also, make sure you try the ceviche! Crowed was mixed in age - couples, friend, families, individuals. Music system from pool area floated to the beach and made it even more relaxing. Think lounge music, some old school r&b, Sade. Total chill vibes. Umbrellas were a safe haven for when the sun was really strong. After talking to other and walking up and down the beach, this was the most relaxed sophisticated choice. Will definitely visit again when I go back.

One of the peak experiences of my life. This beach club is GORGEOUS. We went for the All Day I Dream party there during BPM 2016 and the music was absolutely killer. Nice enough service.However they did oversell the Solomun event, couldnt really find a spot to dance without getting elbowed, go to the lesser known events.

Loved it!!!!!!!!. Me, my husband and young son visited here 3 years ago and loved it. The music at that time was amazing (ambient/house) hopefully it hasn't changed since then. The drinks were very good and reasonably priced. Food was decent. Service very quick and attentive. Beach was a bit crowded but what do you expect on spring break? Bathrooms were clean. We are going back in a few weeks and would love to know where we can park and also current rental rates. Thanks!

Annoying techno music. If you like overpriced drinks and very loud techno music this is the place for you. And be early because by 11 am there are no more umbrellas left. Take a cooler and a chair and give this beach club a pass.

A regular beach. The experience here was fine. It wasn't Nikki beach or like any Davy if trendy beach clubs. I rented a chair for 100 pesos and ordered a mojito from a waiter who delivered it to my chair. The drink was okay. It came in a plastic cup which made it feel like a regular beach day. My server, Gerard,was attentive. However, he didn't give me a bracelet which created go fusion when I went to use the bathroom. I got a bracelet after. I guess i had high expectations based on the reviews. I go to beach all the time in Brooklyn and was hoping for a fancy experience since I never get that at home. This was nice but nothing to rave about. There is techno music that plays but no one seemed to take an interest in it. Just another beach day really. I should add that it was a Monday and the weather went from sunny to windy to cloudy to rainy all day. I think this affected my experience also. I remember when I arrived in PDC in Saturday seeing lots of people here. I think I would have had fun under different conditions.  Also, as I was leaving, I realized didn't even need the chair since many people were laying right on the sand. Again, a regular beach here. It's also a short distance between the sand and water, creating the appearance of crowds, but it's just a small area. On another note, on my last day I made my way to the other side if PDC where the ferry from Cozumel comes in. Senor Frogs has a beach club there and there were some other cool beach front tiki type bars. The beaches themselves were spacious with chairs all over for patrons. The street over here reminded my of California. I. wish I had gotten a chance to enjoy this area sooner. Try to check it out.

great for lounging on the beach. get there early and get a good spot along the beach with an umbrella. lay down relax and order a drink if you want. it is nice to have a place to be and use their facilities. you can order drinks and food there as well. it does get crowded but it was a good area of the beach to be at if you didn't book a hotel with a private beach area.

Not worth it. We stopped here expecting a fun experience. Maybe some music, dancing, etc. What we got were some overpriced beach chairs, slow service with warm, overpriced drinks. The place was completely shut down and dark by sundown on a Friday night. Boring and expensive. You can sit anywhere on the beach in Playa.

100% would not recommend. We came here and received 1/2 price off chairs and umbrellas from our hotel making it 100 pesos to sit for two people. That was the only cheap thing. Cocktail was 120 pesos, absolutely rip off for playa. Staff stand around in groups of 5 chatting and not bothering to come around. Every time you wanted to order something had to wave around and call them over.Service was absolutely shocking asked for the bill three times so finally had to go up to the bar and pay it. Apparently we didn't give them a satisfactory tip for their terrible service (they're lucky we gave one at all) and quoted "you're from Australia you have lots of money." 2 of the men proceeded to stand around me and tell me that I did not give them 15% which is compulsory. Would never go back! Better off sitting on the beach in front of them and pay nothing.
Be aware!!!. The beach is horribly crowded! I mean people literally almost packed on top of each other! Absolutely miserable!! No room to spread out at all!

I love mamita's beach but... I think mamita's beach is one of the best beach in playa. They have a dj with amazing and super relaxing music, the restaurant is amazing and the waiter are always available.The only thing i didn t like is that when you finish to eat the waiter brings you 2 bill: one without tip and one with the tip decided by them but honestly it s too high. Last week they added 400 pesos just for the tip and the service was normal. No way.
Fun place. Fun place to enjoy the beach. Good drinks, good food, service was remarkable, facility clean, bathrooms very clean. Will definitely return on our next trip.

disappointing unfortunately. The place itself is very nice. But the organisers were terrible! We went there for New Years Eve. The day before New Years Eve we bought tickets from the organisers in front of the beach club. They were very friendly and happy to give us the tickets and take our money. we asked for the VIP tickets on the rooftop and paid extra for that, which At that time was no problem. Before handing over the money to them, we asked about 10 times, is this the VIP area on the rooftop and they all reassured us that it was. They told us that we were getting the rooftop area which had our own seating area for the two of us. On the night when we arrived, we had to wait about 10 minutes to be escorted inside. Once they processed our tickets, they said to us your are downstair. After explaining to the girl and guy that we purchased the tickets from that it was you that told us that we were getting VIP on the rooftop. Even with all that being on paper, that was not enough evidence. After again trying to speak to someone else, we stood in the middle of the foyer area like idiots, while they chatted away in Spanish right in front of us. After what looked like a debate between each other, we were escorted upstairs, only again to be told by another person that we are downstairs. We were escorted back to the organisers, again they discussed things, and the same lady that booked the tickets for us, said no you are downstairs and thats what I told you in the beginning. By now, this had been going on for at leased 20-30 mins and their frustration was starting to show in their attitudes.We refused to let them ruin our NYE, we enjoyed our night which was complimented by one of the kindest and nicest waiters we have come across on our travels to Mexico.
the best form Play del Carmen. The best beach club from Play del Carmen. Good service and the nicest beach from Playa. The cost was 90 pesos for 2 sunbeds and 1 umbrella.

bad service and expensive. I went with my family to eat at the restaurant of this beach club and we were surprised by the really small sizes of their dishes, based on the prices they had; we thought it was normal anyway since it's one of the main beaches, however the bad service just ruined it all, it took ages for any waiter to assist us, and even to ask for the bill. It's best to eat at any of the small or big restaurants in the fifth avenue.

Ruined my vacation. Music, dancing, and having a great time are all things I am a fan of. I can tolerate, even appreciate, the sounds of a festive bar at night, even while trying to sleep. However, I am staying down the beach from Mamita's, and sleeping simply isn't an option because of the unbelievable volume. Even with earplugs in, it sounds like we are in the club, instead of down the beach in a palapa. At 2 am, the bass was still pumping. It astounds me how disrespectful this club is to their neighbors. Half of our hotel was in the lobby complaining. The police were called. The manager said it he couldn't go into the office of the hotel because the music is deafening. The quaint, lovely resort is otherwise heavenly, but ruined by one crappy business, which I'd somewhat expect in Cancun, but not in Playa del Carmen. Oh, and an extra thank you for waking us at 8 the next morning, testing your sound system.

Beach is getting smaller and smaller. Vendor like this beach club are eating more and more of public beaches every year. Whole block was added on top of beach in PDC compared to how it was 5 years ago. It is too commercialized now. We were forced to drive out of town to a beach.

Great time on the beach!. We had a great time! Customer service was excellent! Execellent! And the prices were not bad. Our server Juan Perez was fast, very attentive,friendly and gave us great tips about the area. I recomment this place to anyone visiting Playa. Juan you were the best!!

Amazing day at the beach!!!. This is one of the best beaches in PDC! It is fancy place where you can enjoy the sea and the beach but at the same time have fun! For something like 1200 pesos my bf and I good VIP beach bed with consumption of 1000 pesos, se the bed itself was like 200 pesos, which is cheap if you take into consideration that for that money I had 3 cocktails, he had 4 beers and we ate fish for lunch (with some side dishes and guacamole) and we had a lot of water and pineapple. For someone living in Europe, I found it bargain because for 50e I can go for dinner (average) and here you can eat and drink whatever you like whole day! Just pay attention to final bill, because waiter is calculating himself tip (independently) from the bill and he asks you to pay the amount on his calculator, without mentioning that it includes tip
Nice Beach Club - too loud based music. Good location & service but music a bit too loud with booming base. Food and drinks so-so.Service was good.Beach nice.

Great club!!. This is a great place to settle at the beach, with friends, family or couples. You can eat, drink, and lay in the sun or in the shadow. The beach is beautiful and the customer care provided here makes it better!! Totally would repeat!

Excellent place to hang at the beach . Great beach club (restaurant/beach service/great beach for floating/swimming/relaxing) the facilities are ultra modern, tasty menu and bartenders, awesome restrooms amenities, with a great mix of all nationalities having a blast. I spent many days there, had a blast! Great place to meet people! Highly recommend! Our server Sergio was awesome, knowledgeable and on top off it, providing 1st class service. Ask for Sergio as your server to Mamitas for a great vibe

Nice place. Beach is generally lousy in playa but at Mamitas has a larger and a bit cleaner beach. Nice modern facilities. Good drink menu decent food menu. Its a little pricey but why not? Service was good. Waiters helpful and attentive. Didn't rent any beach chairs but saw the price list and it wasn't expensive.
Good food good service. We stumbled upon this while walking decided to stop and eat. Good views. Good food not superb but nothing to complain about. Servers were friendly also.

Good beach, horrible club. Beautiful beach and facilities, and fairly cheap to rent chairs but that's it. Service sucks and it's so hard to get anything. They were out of umbrellas. I asked 4 times for a towel, 3 times for wifi password, while the waiters stood around and talked to each other. And guy who gave me change for the chair ripped me off and charged me almost double. 60 pesos for the use of the towel and they wanted a 200peso deposit. As if I'd want their used towels! Food was mediocre at best. The bills comes as soon as you ask for it, and they're quick to remind you to tip. I'd look elsewhere. I'm going back to Indigo tomorrow. Now much of a view but the service more than makes up for it! And hey, they don't charge for chairs and towels and umbrellas!

Relaxed beach club with great service. More or less by coincidence we kind of landed at Mamita's Beach club the second day in Playa del Carmen. We payed for two sunbeads and realised with that, we had great service all day. The waiters looked after us all day long, serving us water, bear of what ever we wanted. When hungry, we visited the restaurant which had a really good selection of lunch dishes (as well as breakfast and food for the entire day, depending on what your day looks like). So we did actually repeat this success every time we decided to have a day at the beach, when we were in Playa del carmen. When it was not too windy, we had the umbrella too. The ocean outside Mamitas is great for swimming, and when you get up, you can use the showers to get the salty water off, which feels quite nice.

Better beaches in Playa del carmen. Went during 11/26--11/29. There was a Jazz fesitval on the beach during that time. Practicing in the day time and performances in the evening. Made it enjoyable to be on the beach for a solid 8 hours. Can go solo or bring the whole family. Not as much seaweed as other beaches in the area. See everything from large groups of friends, to solo travelers.

This is the best stretch of beach around. However the prices are becoming ridiculous. Everything has gone up since we were last here. We paid 470 pesos for two sandwiches and two beer. I don't pay that much at home and the food is a lot better at home. The waiters are pushy about their expectations of what percentage tip they want. We will walk off the beach from now on to eat.

Expensive for Playa!. We walked around on the beach for a while, and we picked Mamita's Beach...it looked like a nice setup on the beach.I must say that the place is clean and the service was decent! We drank 2 club sodas, and 4 patron margaritas. We were charged almost $1000.00 pesos (about $64.00 dollars)In the US that will be acceptable...even cheap, but in Playa with that kind of moneyyou can do a lot more...like add a full meal to it!

Great Beach Club to unwind at in Playa del Carmen. We thoroughly enjoyed the relaxing atmosphere and great service at Mamitas over the weekend. Hopefully will return, weather permitting, before returning to London on Sunday. Recommended although the beaches in PdC are a little spoilt.

Love Mamitas. We have been visiting Mamitas for the last seven years and we just love the place. We were just there in August and again in October 2015. Coincidentally, both times we were attended by Angel a waiter that exceeded our expectations. Angel was very professional and didn't miss a beat whenever I placed my order since I am allergic to onions.

Fun, pretty people and comfy with our baby. We liked hanging out in the shade, meet interesting people and be served by kind staff. Our baby was happy with shade and access to the showerPricey yet worth it

amazing beach. Service on the beach is amazing, if you rent chairs. It depends how long you plan on spending there but normally when I go it is for a full day so I like the luxury of renting chairs, parasol and table in order to be comfy. The food is also really good. Great time to be had but gets a little costly but worth it

Wonderful Place to Relax. Mamita's has excellent food and wonderful service too. There had been a sargassum problem over the summer but, it appears to be gone and the waters are clear again. I love this place!

great beach club. Went there on a few afternoons, I always had ots of fun. Knd of expensive if you consume at the club, but the food is good the music too. Nice people, nice beach, a great place to have fun on a sunny afternoon.
No seaweed, swim and have fun.. Cool, friendly quick service, reasonable prices. Beach clean, seaweed removed. Good drink selections. Eat in lounge or on beach.
Perfect beach Club. Mamita's Beach Club is only open is morning to 6pm.So good to hung out daytime place!Dj is plyaing he chill music.Beatiful beach .Easy to go from 5th ave.

Good place. Recommended . We got a coupon of discount from our hotel, anyway there are good prices, and the beach is beatiful an calm, perfect for relaxing. Just after 1 pm they start to play kind of loud music. So I recommend the place before 1 pm.

Great spot to relax in Playa Del Carmen. Spent an entire day here relaxing with beach chairs, umbrella, beach access, small pool and excellent food and drinks! Also, parking included and the service was good.
Nice beach club, very loud. Good enough - cheap chairs and umbrella, decently priced food, beverages were fine. Be prepared for loud, thumping bass all day long, which can be fun for a while.
great beach and more women. Getting ready for the Independence day party, it will be a sight to see , get down here now, to catch the fun,

Review. Loved it here- attentive servers, beautiful location, comfortable chairs, affordable prices and a great view. The drink menu was extensive and the food we got was very good as well. The bathrooms were very clean which was a nice bonus.

Very good piace to stay. We went in Playa for a vacation with friends. If you are searching for a good and cool place to enjoy the food and the beach this is the place for you. For only 90 pesos (around 5€) you can take 1 big umbrella and 2 chairs, with 200 pesos you can eat very good seafood dish! A special thank to Sergio that helped us during our stay in Playa with precious information and advise us on what to eat!

Best beach in playa. Overall great food music and atmosphere. Also ask to be served by a waiter named Derek, chill guy who's going to take very good care of you. If you're looking for a beach in playa this is it.

Very nice. We just spent a very nice day at Mamitas. The place was immaculate, the staff very friendly and responsive, the water was great. A very little seaweed but it made the beach seem natural.A club sandwich, salad, 2 sangrias, some iced teas, 2 lounges, 700 pesos, seems like a fair price.In particular The captain Myrea Seguro was very patient and helpful when an ATM broke down owing me 100usd. She spent a lot of time getting my money from the company. A very competent, sweet lady.

A good clean beach spot. For $3.50 US per person, you can rent comfortable beach chairs with an umbrella and small table for drinks, as well as access to clean bathrooms and a shower to rinse off the sea water. Servers are very attentive and in plentiful supply, always ready to bring you a cerveza or other drink. Security guards walk the area as well, so if you leave belongings while in the water, it's not as risky as in some other places. The water is beautiful and warm!

A Must Visit!. Mamitas Beach Club is one of the best and most popular beach clubs in Playa. The drinks were awesome and the food was great. Raul was a great waiter and was very attentive, but I have to give a special thanks to Derrick. Derrick made sure my girlfriend and I had everything we needed from food to drinks, and he even went out his way to get some pricing for different activities we were interested in. Derrick made our visit very pleasant and we will be visiting Mamitas Beach again.

PLAYA DEL CARMEN BEACHES HORRIBLE. beaches are full of rotting seaweed, the employees bury the seaweed under the sand on shore, seaweed starts rotting and they just leave it there. they should remove seaweed by raking it and putting it in a pick up truck and driving it away. maybe burn it when its dry?? if the government in q. roo doesnt due anything about it, no one will return.

Worth it if you can get a spot on the beach. Our first day we lucked out and scored 2 beach chairs and an umbrella. It cost 90 pesos to rent them for the day (around $6)- you also can't bring outside food/beverages, so you will be ordering drinks and food throughout the day - which can be a bit pricey, but not terrible. Our second day we weren't able to find chairs & an umbrella. We saw on the menu that you could rent a covered beach bed for 200 pesos, so we sat down on one. Then a waiter approached us and told us that in addition to the 200 pesos to rent the bed, you also had to meet a minimum consumption of around 1,000 pesos (of food and alcohol). We decided that we didn't want to have to pay that much, so we went over to the beach club next door. On our third beach day, Mamita's was packed again, so we went over to the neighboring beach club. On our 4th beach day, we are not going to even bother to stop at Mamita's and look for spots - too much effort & the odds of finding a spot aren't in our favor. Also, if you want to do things on the cheap, there is an area of public beach in front of the beach clubs & hotels. If you bring an umbrella or your own chairs, or towels, you can sit in the public section for free. We saw lots of people doing that and bringing coolers of their own filled with beverages & food. If we had brought our kids with us, we probably would have brought an umbrella and chairs in our suitcase to save on the beach club prices (or we would have just done an all-inclusive).

Bad service, smells like drainage. Tooooo expensive. Simply, don't come here guys. This is not the typically Mexican service. Waiters are only servicing teens that do not demand good service but alcohol. My teen agers did not felt comfortable as they are family oriented. Many better other beaches are next to Playa del Carmen

Good deal to relax on the beach. We walked quite a long distance on the beach to find this place as it was recommended by staff at the resort we were staying at. This part of the beach had little to now washed up seaweed ,whereas other parts of the beach we passed had mounds of it. We purchased 5 chairs and an umbrella for a reasonable amount to use for the next two hours at which time the club would be closing. One of the beach clubs or hotels we passed were renting their chairs for $100 USD a piece! The waitstaff was quick to take our drink orders when we arrived. There are private bathrooms and an indoor bar area as well. No complaints.
worth the few dollars for the chair rentals. It was just a few dollars to rent the chair/umbrella for the day. just having the shower to rinse the sand off makes it worth it. Nice, unobtrusive staff.

Amazing. This is a great Beach Club. The venue is large with a proper restaurant, proper service, private bathrooms, great music, excellent DJs and exquisite food. This is a must go when on vacation in Playa Del Carmen.
Meh. Have been here a few times. Bad service, they don't speak any English. Nice music. But I'll never come back again.
Chilling on beach. What a beautiful way to spend a day in paradise. Check it out. Have many drinks. Enjoys some tequila and margs. Make time to visit when in playa Del carmen
Great place to visit,. Beach was good, I enjoy walking, and the views, i really feel relax at the time of my trip that i was looking for.

Best of the Beach clubs in Playa de Carmen. Walk on over to the north side of 5th ave and reserve a chair and umbrella. The service is so friendly and the Music and quality of the atmosphere is best the playa. If you are not at an all inclusive resort than this is the way to enjoy a day at the beach. It is pricey but go spoil yourself for a day.

Completely disappointed. We wanted to try something new on our trip so we decided to try out a beach club. Mamita's seemed to have good reviews so we headed on over. The club was extremely crowded but there were some spots available. They told us to just go and find two chairs and then a beach boy would come and take the money for the day charge. When he came over he was extremely unpleasant. When we gave him money we asked for change (because we only had bigger bills) and he said he would come back to give it to us (he definitely had enough change because we saw it pouring out of his pockets). We never saw any money after that. We saw him 3-4 times and he would try to completely avoid us, but no money. He gave himself a $20 tip for doing nothing. We were pretty bummed after that so we just left.

$100 pesos. Great price for two chairs and umbrella on the cleanest beach we could find in PDC.Servers were very attentive, great drinks and lunch...the club sandwich was yummy and all the prices were very affordable.

Spent most of the week here. After trying out Cannibal and Kool we rushed back to Mamitas and spent all of our beach days at Mamitas. Cannibal had a ton of seaweed and was empty; Kool was expensive and crappy service. Mamitas has good food and a ton of people. The tab adds up a little for a full day but the wait staff is fairly attentive and the people watching is great.

Sad about the changes. We went to Mamitas in April and had a wonderful time. There were 5 of us (two couples and my 5 year old daughter) We had a great day. We rented 4 loungers and 2 umbrellas ($180 pesos no minimum consumption). We swam in the ocean and then my daughter wanted to swim in the pool. No problem. We ate, drank and were merry- spent a lot of money and tipped well- it is vacation right? We returned last week with my parents and were excited about repeating our great day with them. We rented the same chairs ($180 pesos now a minimum of $150 peso each consumption- no problem) and my mom took my daughter over to the pool. We were told it was separate now and would be an additional charge of 30 pesos each and another $150 peso minimum to swim in the pool. We skipped it and swam at the beach.Two days later we came back ready to eat lunch and spend a day by the pool. We asked if we ate in the restaurant if that would qualify as our minimum for the loungers- NO. Ok so we moved to the pool. Tons of empty loungers and a 4 top table- perfect, we will eat at the table because it is kind of tricky to eat a nice big lunch on a lounger. We were told if we wanted to eat at the table it would be 200 pesos 150 minimum per person and then if we moved to the loungers it would be 30 pesos per person and another 150 peso minimum. Seriously? We left. I understand trying to make money off of tourists- but this is ridiculous! We went next door to Kool. Sorry Mamitas- you lost loyal fans with the nickel and dime tactics. I own a condo and will advise my guests to go somewhere else. Such a shame because we loved it just 6 weeks ago.

Great beach with nice amenities. Nice place if you are looking for a beach with amenities at a low cost for 10 $ you can get 2 chairs with an umbrella and use all the amenities which are very nice. Then you just pay as you go for any food and beverage

Great day at the beach!. We were there since early morning the beach was gorgeous and calm the waiter at the beach was very nice and helpful specially with all the stuff we had for our 7 month baby. The place has one of the best beaches in Playa deal Carmen. Then we went up for some food at the restaurant and again the food and service were great! They charge per bed and umbrella but like 30 pesos ea for all day and they do not ask for any minimum consumption. But the prices were fair in both food and drinks. We spend all day there and the food and service was outstanding. Will be going back soon.
Great Beach. Great Beach, expensive and not high quality food...not very good attitude from personnel...but is a "must" of Playa

A great day at the beach. The experience was nice. Mamita's delivers what it offers, so I may refer to it as a good experience. Good music, a nice pool and great sea side facilities, with just a minor downside: only Corona beer, regular and light, with no options --not even Cervecería Modelo's brands.

Disappointed with Mamitas. You know it's a great spot, with nice drinks and good snacks and we've enjoyed it for the last five years whilst walking and swimming on the beach.However, for the first time we felt most unwelcome by one rude member of staff. Here is the issue; the previous day a Mexican couple sat on one of the lounge chair areas overlooking the beach with seemingly no issues, they were served etc. and were taking up the whole section, we were sitting behind in a smaller section.The next day we wanted to sit there to enjoy the view (we are English) and were immediately told to move as that section was only for large parties of 10, he tried to put us on bar stools but we sat a little further back in the previous section (where our previous day's waiter was friendly and welcoming).Within 5 minutes of moving THREE Mexican men sat in the exact spot we had been moved from and were served with no issue. Interestingly enough another 7 people did not join them!We left and to be honest we will find another beach club to spend our money in if this is the way Mamitas treats foreign guests....disappointing indeed!

Great food, and well mixed Drinks. My wife and I visited this past week for the first time. The shrimp Ceviche as great, and came in 3 different sizes. We each tried a salad as well, and could barely put a dent in our mixed grill fajitas. The 4 drinks we had and 4 plates of food was around $100 USD with tip. We found the service to be really good, and the wifi was free by the hour, but they did continue to ask us if we needed another code for free wi-fi. We will be back.

Felt like an inconvenience. It was our first beach day when we arrived. We had never done anything other than all-inclusive so it was a very new experience for us.We arrived and had lunch/breakfast. The staff was helpful in the restaurant and we had a beautiful view of the beach front. The food was very delicious!The "Terrible" review comes from us renting chairs. No one would give us a chair and no one would serve us on the beach. When we asked for something it felt like an annoyance to the wait staff. We were in a particular section but the waiter never came to us. We felt very unwelcome. It was not a fun atmosphere. The chairs were very uncomfortable.This experience with Mamita's was very disappointing since it had such great reviews online. Because it was our first day in Mexico it started a very negative feeling. Don't bother going here unless you like being ignored and treated like an inconvenience.

Nothing else. If you are in a hotel at the Fifth Avenue and want to go to the beach you propably will have to pay to stay in best part of the beach. There two options, the Mamita's and its neighbor club. The beach is nice but nothing else. To seat there you will have to pay and you can't bring your food and drinks, you have to buy from them. If you can go to other beaches, like Akumal or even Cozumel I recomend instead of being there.

Pretentious and dare I say RACIST.... I am here on vacation in Playa with my Mom and everyone of my facebook friends told me to 'Go to Mamitas!'. I took their advice and we showed up there on a sunday afternoon. The beach was crowded and I approached what looked like a person that could seat us. I let him know that we needed a beach umbrella for 2 people and he looked at me in a somewhat dismissive way and said they were full. I had to work to keep my cool... After some back and forth, a woman came over that worked there. I cannot remember her name, but she had 'Captain' on her tag. She was very nice and worked to get my Mom and I a beach umbrella and chairs. About 20 minutes later, one opened up and she showed us to our spot. I was beginning to feel better about this place until 10 minutes later when we had not been approached by a waiter for drinks or anything. I literally had to get up out of my seat and approach someone that looked like a waiter to ask for service. He gave me a crappy look and said he would get someone and walked away. I was fuming as I saw all of the other customers getting service. 5 minutes later, we were approached by a waiter that had no menus or anything. He asked us if we wanted anything. I asked him for a menu and he looked at me and then went to the girls that were sitting next to us and grabbed their menu and handed it to me. As if it was an imposition!!! I ordered us food and drinks.The drinks were fine but when our food came out, there were no napkins or silverware. I had to ask for them!@! Who brings food out to a beach chair and does not bring these things. Especially after we paid 90 pesos for the privelege of sitting in their chairs!?! He looked at me with an attitude and then brought them out.I won't go on, but you get the gist... If you like pretention and horrible service and being treated like it is a privilege to be at their establishment. Otherwise, avoid Mamita's at all costs and find a beach club in Playa that will treat you with kindness and respect!
Awesome Beach. Great experience! Derek, my waiter, was fantastic! I thought the beach was the best in Playa. Prices are fair considering this is the place to be. I will return.

Not what it used to be. Seems like tourist in mamitas are walking money, good service is slim and almost non existent. The beach club is over priced and some if not most waiters are rude, like I said, they are there for money and not to offer good service. Great beach and great ocean, nothing else.

Beautiful Space and Great Service. Just stopped for drinks, but beverages were delicious and service was awesome. The decor was modern and view was gorgeous. Bathrooms were air conditioned and very nice.
Just to expensive. I mean I understand that you can charge more with this amazing club. But if I pay that much I want good service and good food. For me is it a bit of a tourist trap

Very Enjoyable Day at the Beach Club. This is the 3rd yr that my daughter and I have stayed in playa and each time we have spent 2 days at Mamita's. We have always really enjoyed our days here. We do arrive around 9:30am to make sure we get 2 lounge chairs with an umbrella (so many people arrive after 12:00 noon and are surprised that there are no umbrellas - really it's a busy place so you should plan better). We have never had the negative experiences that others have described. It's the same price each time, 90 pesos for 2 lounge chairs and an umbrella for the entire day. That's very in expensive. We order a few drinks throughout the day and pay the bill just before we leave without any problems. We also eat at the restaurant and leave our stuff at the chairs and everything is there when we go back. We will continue to go here during our visits to playa.

Sucks - Definately Time to Switch Beaches. We have been going to Playa for more than 15 years. Each year this beach club gets worse - in every way. The weekend prices to rent beds requires bottle service -- two bottle minimum which does not include wine. The bottle prices are outrageous and it promotes people getting just hammered at the beach club - always a pretty sight. I enjoyed the music but the service is extremely slow. Such a shame this beach club went to hell. It has become yesterday's news on the cool factor.

Good enough but you deserve more. Nice place in Playa de Carmen and actually pretty much enjoyable, if you have time you can find for sure so much better place without speding a peny. Playa del Carmen in my opinion it is overrated, specially this places like Mamitas, seriously costumes deserve so much for this prices.

Great beach, but club has wrong strategy to attrack loyal clients. We liked the beach. It was somewhat clean for the amount of traffic. A younger crowd with pumping music, which contrary to some of the other Trip Advisor reviewers, we actually love since we've been to Ibiza. To us, the music should actually be louder with the same amount of bass, since all we hear is bass and not the rest of the music. The staff is rude and will approach with different prices from day to day??.... Service is poor. We haven't tried it, but apparently, the Wifi cost money contrary to most of the businesses in Playa. If I were them, I would advertise an honest price for the chairs and stick to the price, provide good drink service, and provide free Wifi. They would likely get a good client base and better reviews.

VERY BAD SERVICE AND DRINKS. The beach area is nice however the service provided at this place is very bad. Lack of service, and as soon as they bring your bill they want you to leave and not to use any more the chairs and umbrella which of course is paid the minute you sit down. The drinks are terrible, they taste like water. Definitely not a nice place to stay and spend the day.

Only real game in town. With the worst drinks. Definitely order beer only. Everything else is watered down with minimal alcohol. Ceviche was great and very large. Service good. The guys are as nice as you are to them. Imagine working in the hot sand all day dealing with jerks.

Awesome Beautiful Perfect Day. So we live in Canada and have been travelling for the past couple of weeks. Our time in Playa has been amazing and as this was my last day I wanted to go out in style. Two of us spent the day at Mamita's and had the great fortune of being served by a great server named Derek (if you have the chance sit in his section on the beach). He was everything you could ask for in a server: attentive, charming, smart, funny...the kind of guy who anticipates your needs and let's you enjoy your day. You know....just as you're thinking of it, he's already thought of it. I recommend this place if you wanna luxuriate, swim, tan, eat, have a drink and feel like a rock star. Best end of vacation ever. Love.

Bad service. Service is slow, wifi isnt free and takes forever to receive access to since you need to ask a personal code from the waiters. If your looking for beach, bed and some wifi better go to the beachrestaurants
The best beach club. During our trip in playa this been our favourite beach club. Amazing view to the caribbean sea, fine music and an incredible atmosphere!

Something what plays on NIKI BEACH but never be. It is place located not far from 5th Avenida. They have divided their beach into two parts. One part is with common sun beds and umbrellas and the other looks like beds with room (you may see something similar on Niki Beach but nothing so cheap looking). When you choose option No. 1 you have to be there until 09:30 A.M. because you will not find any umbrella after that time. Option No. 2 costs 200 pesos and you have to buy at least two bottles of alcohol which "good" politics on sun. The staff is other story. They are incompetent and you may see them everywhere but if you want something they still say that somebody else will come later. You cannot drink and eat there anything except the meals and drinks bought there. Other story is music. I like electronic music but Dj there is probably the worst Dj I ever heard and not only in Mexico where is electronic music very frequent. Even when they play music it is the worst music I ever heard not only in Mexico. Yes, for people who do not like electronic music, I do not recommend this place because you will not hear anything else. In the afternoon you may also see and hear very loud crowd of drunk teenagers. Other thing you may hear during the day is construction of buildings in area of Mamita Beach Club. Maybe because of that they play terrible music to cover all the noise from the drills and other construction equipment.

Rudest neighbors. I'm staying nearby at a small resort which was rated (and is) "quiet," but I am forced to listen to Mamitas' thumping bass from 1 pm to 1 am. There's no way to escape it. Even if I close my windows with my a.c. on - which I don't want to do because I like to hear the ocean, I can feel it thump in my bed. They don't own the beach, for Gods sake! Shut it down!

Decent. If you want access to the beach while staying off the beach, a comfortable chair, perhaps an umbrella if you get there early, this is a great spot.Not a stunning beach, but for playa del Carmen, its just like any beach around downtown.Staff seems to make up their own rules, but most of the staff was great and so nice. Great drinks and food. Beach had seaweed, which is rare, but does occur every so often. Nothing they could do about this, its all over Playa right now.

It´s ok. As a beach club it´s ok, cheap chairs and umbrellas... around 90 mxn for the whole day, with access to showers and bathrooms. My hotel gave me a 50% rent discount, so was even cheaper.The beach is not the best of Playa del Carmen, is a downtown beach, it´s good for when you don´t wanna travel to Xcacel, Tulum or Akumal. They keep it quite clean and you have a restaurant service, on the beach under your umbrella or in a proper table in their restaurant. It´s great food but a little bit expensive.. but you have a view.There´re a lot of staff, I´ve had different experiences with them, some were very nice and kind and some of them looked like they really don´t wanna be working there, like they hate the sand and the ocean... so I guess is a lottery how they treat you.

Greedy rude staff!. As each year passes the facilities improve but the greedy staff just seem to get worse! We usually drop about $100-150 when we go for the day and all you get is attitude from the staff. We wanted to go eat in the restaurant but our beach waiter wanted our food bill put on his tab with us. This caused an issue with the restaurant staff and we felt like we got caught in the middle. It was very awkward. The food was great. It just all seems very predatory. As mentioned LOOK AT YOUR BILL CLOSELY AS THEY WILL INCLUDE THE TIP AND NOT TELL YOU!!!! This compounded our disgust as we are good tippers and spend more than most and yet you still get the shaft!! They just don't care, and act completely stupefied when you point it out. It was very disheartening. You are better off taking the ADO and going to Tulum for the day. Beautiful empty beaches, crystal clear water and no beach clubs!

Prisoner at mamita's. My wife and I hired chairs and ombrella against payment. At 12:30 we left the chairs to go to lunch at mamita's own restaurant where we regularly pay the bill. 45 min later we back to our place and, surprise surprise, our chairs were occupied by someone else and our stuff GONE ! Where ? Why ? A person at a neighburing umbrella told us that a member of the mamita's staff went through our bag and then took it away !!!! The mamita's crew "captain" justified that if we abandon our chairs longer than 15 min they have the right to do so. Are we prisoners of our chairs ? We cannot go for a walk ? Unbelievebly we simply went to their restaurant. Moreover we collected our stuff which was left on a dirty concrete wall at the parking. After demonstrating we were at the restaurant by showing the docket nobody even bother to excuse themselves for their misbehaviour. It was still our fault that we left our chairs without saying where we where going (to whom ?) they have been treating us (the paying guest) arrogantly aggressively unpolitely uncivilizedly ! If you go mamita's be prepared to be treated like a naughty school child. Remember: you are a mamita' gang prisoner !

Music and beach. Nice beach if you want to hang with the young crowd, you can hear the electronic music pumping in the background a bit too crowded for my taste and to many drunk people on high season. If you are visiting during low season you will get to enjoy it more.

Disgusting. We walked at the edge of this disgusting throng of binge drinking sunburnt litterers. Never again. But 100 yards away in front of an interesting wall of graffiti, there were just a few fellow beachers. Water was calmish with hardly any weeds in the a.m., came back late afternoon and the surf was coming in hard and bringing the Sargasso along. Skip Mamitas and swim in the morning before peak sun and park it on your towel infront of the new construction with the graffiti wall. Mellow waves, fewer weeds.

They've turned one of the nicest places on earth to crap.. We've been going to Mamita's since it first opened. It was small and rustic and lots of young adults played on the white sand and in the clear water. The wait staff was attentive and the food and drinks were reasonably priced.I don't know what's going on with the water and it's certainly no fault of the owners at Mamita's, but copious amounts of seaweed wash on shore and clumps of it float in the water, along with a lot of other garbage. They don't bother to clean the beach often, occasionally bringing in a crew of workers with pitchforks, rakes and shovels to dig trenches and bury the smelly vegetation. Of course they do that during the busiest part of the day, rather than taking a tractor down the beach at night and hauling the stuff away.In spite of declining beauty of the beach, Mamita's continues to increase its prices. They can do so because the place is no longer hip. The crowd is older, balder, fatter and wealthier. They're also pretentious and snobbish. Beds and lounges that used to rent for $10 or $20 now go for $60 on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. In an gauche display of faux sophistication, Mamita's now has bottle service and it has a two bottle minimum to rent a bed and umbrella on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. Needless to say, we went next door to Kool beach club. It had fewer pretentious jerks who like to show off how much money they can throw away.

All things were GREAT!. We had a grand time at this spot on the beach. Mamita's is a block from a condo we got on Air BnB......x0x0x0x One straight couple, a 7 year old boy and a hot 40 year old gay lawyer from the west coast-we all had a ton of fun each of the 3 days we spent on the beach. Lounges, umbrellas, & Cold beers and nachos on the beach - use of the pool once the little one had enough salt in his eyes.

Beautiful beach; badly run beach club. We have been going to Mamita's for 13 years (hotel provides a discount coupon). It gets worse every year. The beach is lovely. However, we feel that the Club is only interested in making $... no interest in providing people w/ a good experience. Read all the other reviews. They are 100% accurate. Buyer Beware!

Blah - Your staff sucks. This place has a lot wrong with it..the only good was that the ocean and crazy people watching. The staff is so incredibly rude it is almost baffling. They are attentive while trying to collect money on rentals and then you have to work hard to flag them down when trying to place an order. Warning is wish i knew before going here: You have to get there early to get an unbrella (we were there at 10am and all were taken). Do not order food if you do not have an umbrella. The birds are soooo aggressive and swooped down less than a foot away from me to pull the basket of food into the sand before we could even eat it. Fellow beach goers helped us with wave the birds away, while the staff stood idyll by. A swarm follows the waiter with food. If you are going to eat food go to the covered restaurant. Our waiter was so rude when we were closing out I honestly was baffled by it.

Rude service, crowded beach and overwhelming music. We have been traveling to Playa del Carmen for many years...and our routine has always been to spend the day at Mamitas, rent their beach chairs, umbrellas and have lunch and drinks. However, as the year's have passed, the music has gotten worse, the bass louder and the service (what service...they basically ignore you!) We ended up bringing our own chairs and using the beach a little further north in front of Las Palapas.

FOOD POISINING. We stopped in at Mamita's on our last day in Mexico. This turned out to be a terrible mistake. Fortunately, we did not experience the chair rental ripoff outlined below, as we just wanted a quick afternoon drink and snack in the bar area to tide us over until dinner. The service was apathetic at best, and it took forever to deliver our drinks and guacamole. Under normal circumstances we would have left, but were in a good mood after a wonderful vacation. The drinks were fine--it's hard to mess up on beer--but the guacamole was very bland. So we ate less than half, paid the ridiculously-high tab, and returned to our hotel. Within about an hour, we were violently ill, and were very lucky to be able to board our flight home the next day. I felt nauseous for another three days, and barely ate. Mamita's is aimed at the tourist crowd, and charges accordingly. There is absolutely no excuse for serving contaminated food. DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE. Like us, you may live to regret it.

trashy and terrible rip-off faux-party joint. Awful place although it has potential. Way too loud music (but nobody's dancing) makes the place already unpleasant while waitstaff constantly bait and switching tourists and pushing tips and more tips (check to see if it's not added before they give you the bill or risk double tipping). Expensive prices on just about everything - you can probably buy your own crappy plastic beach chairs at Walmart for the same price they charge you to rent them for the day.

Too much is too much!. If your going to mamamita's Beach, to relax, read or have a little nap,, Forget it! The music is so loud !!!!!!!!!! WOW If only it was good music! No, it's outdated disco music on a cheap sound system, all you hear is boum boum boum. I like dico music but not on a Beach. Also, don' t be suprised If One day it cost 60 pesos for 2 chairs and an umbrella And the other day 90 pesos. Check your Bills, not all the waiters are honest.! Also, make sûre you asked for little ice In your drinks If you Know what I mean ;) Very bad expérience for us today !

Not worth it. I went to this place on Sunday as I heard a lot about it. I initially wanted a day bed but was told we had to spend $2000 pesos (for only 2 people) in order to get one. Then I asked about the chairs and was told that they would be $90 and would not be applied to any food or beverage consumption. The place was really quiet so I asked if they would have a DJ that day or play music. The guy said no DJ but they would pay music around 2pm. It was 10am! Also no WIFI! Ridiculous. We left and headed to Zenzi where they had a wonderful BBQ going on, loungers were free, great service, music but a live band, wifi and in my opinion a better ambiance.Maybe I went on the wrong day but you can definitely find better than Mamitas!

Rip-off. Today they were charging 100 pesos per chair, not bad, BUT had to guarantee $120.US in food/drink for 3 chairs!!!New trend from previous years and they are not alone.Last visit to this beach as there are 100 others.

Awesome beach with style.. This was my second visit in 7 years. Amazing beach, great music, food and he service was good as last time. Great food and the party feeling is great. Get your self a day bed with a good waiter in front of the beach and you will feel like a Rock Star!

Great day club. If you want to go to the beach in Playa del Carmen, this is the place to go. Very cool beach club, great food menu and drinks. There is loud music all day so if you were planning on a quiet day at the beach this is not the place to go. This is more like a night club at the beach. The have everything you need, no need to take your towel they will rent you one.

Best area of beach. For 90 Pesos a day you get two lounge chair and an umberalla - well worth it. This area of beach is the best in Playa del Carmen. To the South the beach got narrow and lots of sea weed that smelled. Beer prices typical for Playa - high but what can you do. Food was good.

If you are looking for a drunken bachelorette scene - which you may be. I came here on a Friday with 5 girlfriends with the sole intention of having a good time, and we did! It is a complete South Beach/Spring Break scene with scantily clad men and women all drunk and getting wild. It is probably slightly more reined in that Girls Gone Wild but it certainly isn't family friendly. Mamitas is on a beautiful beach in Central PlayaCar and has big beds and chairs for rent for a small amount plus a minimum purchase requirement. Most people get bottle service and everyone on the beach was pretty drunk by about noon. As a mother, I was really glad that I did not have my young daughter with me as this was definitely not "family friendly fun." That said, it is definitely pricey but it's a good time and might be just what you are looking for if you want some unwholesome fun. I would recommend going early to get a good bed rental spot and staying all day as you have to spend a pretty good amount of money there to get the chair rental.

Overpriced gong show. If you like loud music, crowded beach, and overpriced beach chairs/food/drink, this place IS for you.. they rest of you need to head south and check out the "better" part of the Playa and the beach clubs the give you a much better value, the same chairs, and better beach. $2,000.00 pesos for a beach chair AND a food/drink minimum of 500 pesos is a JOKE and catering to the tourists who don't know better. Know better by reading this review and head down the back for 50 peso chairs and the same beer for 90% less.

Beautiful beach club . We went to mamitas to see Carl Cox as part of BPM festival and what a gorgeous place to have it! The pool area is lovely and looks beautiful lit up after dark. The toilets are very clean and staff pleasant. The beach was nicer than the one at my hotel! They also sell Fiji water which is my favourite!We only wish we could have visited when the festival wasn't on so we could appreciate a quiet sunset drink in such a pretty setting.
Amazing renovation. Great location, amazing system, good priced drinks and amazing vibe. Can't wait to go again! I love the bars and the stage
nice but too `south beach`style for playa. poor service & has a feeling of a `tacky cruising bar`..really not the same as it was in the early 2000... :-(

Looks good but expensive. Nice place to lay at the beach. Beds are 200 pesos / pp and you have to drink/eat for minimum 1000 pesos. Service is not top. Have to wait a longtime until they serve your drinks. Nice place to go to the beach but ... not the best beachbar I visited. In general: would not recommand the place.

Waiters rip you off :(. Mamitas Beach is a must in Playa del Carmen, no doubt about that, HOWEVER, the club service sucks, the waiters rise the prices as they see fit and when you ask for the tab you realize the whole scam and the food is not even good, is quite poor actually, so are the drinks, I have got SEVERAL TIMES being served warm beer, warm sodas, dirty ice cubes. So, it is what it is, awful. Great for a demographic under 20, who are willing to put up with bathrooms that could be a challenge for the World Health Organization. Also, waiters DEMAND a tip they haven't even earned and if they don't get it, they will steal somehow.

Nice place but poor atmosphere/set up. This place is way too south beach for Playa in my opinion. The set up of the place is horrible and certain bars only have beer while others only have tequila.
