I thought this was the worst place to party for the daytime. Also as others have stated this is one of the most expensive places in Playa hands down.

Stay Away From This Circus. Mamitas is the worst place you could possibly want to be unless you are under 22 years of age.By noon the place is like Disney. The music that is blasted by a DJ caters to all the free people under 22 who sit in front on the free beach half stoned.The place has no class. The food on a scale of ten is a 4. It really makes no difference this review since they will still do a great business since tourists think everything is great. Even ice cold french fries and a club sandwich for $15.00. If it was good but its terrible.If you pay for chairs and an umbrella beware that someone who comes late will put there chair in your shade. I see that 20% of the people that come later in the day dont pay since the guys they have collecting the fee dont even care. The bathroom they check your wristband.The showers are used by all the people who dont pay a penny. There is no control.LOW CLASS LOW CLASS for people who have no class. Everyone is drunk so they really could care less. Enjoy Mamitas...if you enjoy the Disney of Playa

Beware of the 25% tip waiters are trying to get!. We got chairs and palapas (30 pesos each/day) for 3 days. We arrived early (before 8am and 10am on a cloudy day) and it packed up well at around noon. The music starts at around 1PM and can be really loud. People also put their towels right in front of you on the beach so if you want a quiet and remote place, Mamita's isn't for you! The bracelet they give you when you pay for the chair gives you access to the washrooms, which are very clean (20 pesos each time if you don't have your bracelet).The food was surprisingly good (we had fish ceviche, breakfast, nachos and a very tasty watermelon (sandia) juice). The only thing is that when the waiter brought la cuenta upon our departure, he showed the suggested total including tip (which is usually done in restaurants in Mexico, 10% for ok service and 15% for excellent service). Good thing my mom looked it up because the waiter charged a 25% tip!!! We lowered the tip and the waiter looked a bit shy. By the time we were paying, another customer came to the manager of the restaurant and asked her why his waiter asked for a 30% tip! I understand we are on the beach and there are multiple services, but I believe a customer should be choosing how much he gives, and certainly not be imposed with a 25% rate tip!But overall, Mamita's was well located for us and the waiters were (despite the tip) very nice. I wish my hotel (Riviera Maya Caribe hotel) had told me they had vouchers for a discount at Mamita's beach club!

New Years in Mamitas BIG Disappointment.. I had high expectations of celebrating New Years in Mamitas, the cost of the event and bottles were really high, so I expected that we would get our money´s worth. Big disappointment, highly overrated, to expensive and nothing really fun about the party. The service was ok, but for what the flyer of the party said and expectation created.. had nothing to do with the real thing. Really boring party, bad music, they hardly did nothing special to receive the New Year at 12 pm and way to expensive. Do not recommend going there for a New Years party, there are way more options at better prices. Big Disappointment.

Stay away!!!!. Definitely one of the most pretentious and overrated places I have ever visited, promoters outside the club were very nice while trying to get us in, once in there beach was crowded , When I asked one of the guys who worked there for Some towels and beach chairs, he looked ad me, laughed at my face and said, "there's nothing available, you have to wait" he was so rude, he didn't even stopped walking while he was talking to me, I just felt like walking away, however We decided to stay, big mistake! service in the bar was awful, very rude crowd, And the beach wasn't even clean, there was seaweed all over. This is a place I will not recommend at all.

Ruining Playa-one night at a time. The house music and DJs playing crap music and swearing with the F-word are heard for at least 2 KMs, thus ruining the experiences for those at surround EXPENSIVE all-inclusive hotels. No vacation should include so much LOUD music. no wonder kids are obsessed with zombies, they are not even dancing to this crap. Mamita's will single-handedly drive out repeat business from the resorts.
Packed/crowded and not friendly. Marmitas was so crowded we couldn't get chairs together. It is loud, crowded and the staff was not friendly or helpful.

Surprised of the quality of the food. The restaurant of the beach club is very good. Even if it was packed the food came quickly and the quality was very good. I was really surprised with the pulpo a la plancha and the ceviche. Even the coffee was excellent

We had a lot of fun again. The place is a great spot with a very clean beach. The food and drinks were very good but the beach loungers were not as comfortable as most places.The music was blasting and was the hard thump thump type of music. It was just too loud for our liking.The way they set things up is that you get a bracelet and the beach chairs and you have to spend X number of dollars to stay there. it's not a bad deal but we found another place we liked even more that was much less expensive. That place was called Wha Wha's Beach Bar and it is located at the end of Calle 2 Norte one block from 5th Avenda.

Not worth it. The service had gone from great back in 2005 to mediocre now.. Waiters are more concerned with their tips than people. Mamitas has lost it's old charm when it used to be surrounded with palapa rooftops: it was way more authentic back then. What a shame..

great place!. We needed to get away from our all inclusive and we had heard about this place. We walked a lot cause we werent sure of the location but we finally made it and it truly was an oasis on the beach for us. We only had lunch there but we loved it great place maybe next time we'll stay in town and enjoy the full Mamita's experience, the only thing is a bit pricey so be prepared is like being in the states and paying for the view at a beach bar in Atlantic City if you've ever been you'll know what I mean.

great location nice amenities. Awesome spot, nice options. House music keeps place moving. Move down towards north end do not as loud and can still hear waves crash. Definitely the spot to take in all that comes to Playa

Better than expected! . After reading the reviews wasn't expecting too much but went along as we got vouchers from our hotel. Had no problem with the service, yes the drinks are a little expensive but totally expected for the location on the beach! By European standards good service and good enough food - would visit again.

Awesome place, must vist!. This place is bautiful! It is very easy to find. In the unlikely event that you get lost, just ask a local, everyone knows Mamitas!Barring one very rude member of staff who tried to give away the seats we had paid for and snapped 'what do you want' when we were trying to order the rest of the staff were very well mannered and polite. Considering they walk in the sun for hours on end they are very upbeat. It is a well kept establishment. Although you must arrive earlier ( between 8.30-9.30) if you want to reserve a sun lounger and Umbrella as it gets packed very quickly ( people are really eager to top up their tans! lol) The prices are fair considering the quality of the Bar.

Complete rip off and very rude. We have travelled the world 3 times over and visited some of the best beach clubs ever. Mamita is pure rude!The waiters hover over you like vultures for expensive drinks and garbage good. No way these guys deserve one star of excellence. We are convinced they write their excellent reviews about themselves. Our condo rental gave us passes and we were treated with such rudeness as all the waiters wanted us to spend all day so they could get tips. Imagine we depend $38USA on drinks and food and the guy who was rude to us all day wanted a tip to boot! We complained to the manager about the nasty rudeness and she apologized on their behalf. Today we went back with our coupons and the waiters didn't even want to seat us. Me being 6'3" just took the four chairs and handed them out coupons and basically told him to take a hike. He called the manager over and when she saw me she told the waiter to back off. Think he did? No!The place is a complete rip off and way over priced. If you go there you are fools so don't complain. Tip: beaches are public so set up your towels and cooler on the beach away from the chairs and just walk over to your towel for water etc because Mamitas has a policy of you Not bringing food or drink to the beach but they can't stop you if you set up a separate towel on the beach. Oh they'll still hassle you even though you either paid or got free tickets from your condo rental.

Horrendous service and terrible attitude. We received coupons for chairs and umbrellas through our condo rental. When we went to the beach on the first day of our stay, from the moment we arrived we were pestered to purchase drinks or food. We took out a drink to give to my kids and this is when things went from bad to worse. Numerous waiters and security came over to tell us no food or drinks (really..was this necessary!? The one waiter could have told us, we were treated like criminals). They preceded to watch us like hawks all day. We ordered a ceviche (180 pesos), a beer and a mojito (95 pesos) and received attitude all day for not ordering more. This alone made us not want to give them a penny more of our money. When we asked for the bill the waiter added on a 5$ tip. Umm..firstly how presumptuous and secondly after giving us attitude and treating us terribly all day I don't think so! We gave him 2$ and he told us to please not come again. Imagine! This is how you treat people!? Am I wrong to assume a tip is given for good service. No where is there a minimum spend posted. Mamitas was being paid by our hotel for the use of the chairs and we spent 30$ usd there. I guess you are only valued if you buy bottles of grey goose. Never again.

Rip Off - Avoid. Mamitas is located at one of the nicest parts of the beach in Playa Del Carmen, white sand, beautiful clear sea. We already knew that even if you pay for a lounger you have to buy a drink too. Loungers were 45 pesos each which was fairly reasonable which we paid when we arrived. The guy who served us looked like we had disturbed his day! First of all one of the loungers the guy gave us was broken and after paying for them watched us run around to find one that actually worked. We ordered two cocktails at 95 pesos each (which is around ,£4.50 -£5 which isfairly pricey for Playa Del Carmen,). Total rip off. After a long wait the server brought them and put them behind us without saying anything. Noticed them a couple of minutes later. No wonder, they were very small with little or no alcohol, just mainly ice and salt (mine was a marguerita). Later tried to get the servers attention to buy water (you can't bring your own) and despite being in front of us just ignored us. When went to pay the bill ( asking different people 3 times) the waiter self tipped himself 15% which really annoyed me as the service was awful and we only bought 2 drinks and no food. We had planned to buy food but the drinks put us off!. If you don't want ripped off avoid. There are far better places in Playa Del Carmen.

Off Season comments. Just spent a week in PDC. Walked the beach from tip to toe and Mamitas was the place to be. This is a full service beach club. Plenty of Beach staff checking for food and drink orders. I marked them down a couple notches for a few reasons, 1. food and beverage prices are high. 2. Exchange rate to USD was a matter of inconvenience to Mamitas. 3. Beach service was spotty. Of the seven days we spent on the beach, the first day we were welcomed and about every 15 minutes, checked on to see if anything was needed. After the first day we had to flag someone down for any kind of service. There was plenty of staff and not busy. Just seemed that they were trying to avoid us. We ordered food and beverages almost every day and left good tips. They are adding on to this Club and is only getting bigger. Good luck.

A cool vibe to beat the heat. During my three month stay in the Riviera Maya, I spent most of my days off from work lounging at Mamitas Beach Club. I chose this beach club for its covenient location close to the northern part of 5th avenue and its chill music that set a relaxing tone for the day. Seeing as it is a club, to access one of the many beach chairs, umbrellas, and beach beds you had to pay a fee but the prices were reasonable and the chairs were comfy.I really enjoyed the great service our waiters provided, they ensured ours drinks and food were delivered right to our spot so that we never lifted a finger. Although, the food is over priced.The washrooms and bar area were modern and well maintained. They also had a pool lounging area which offered a great alternative to the ocean.Overall it is a great place to kick back and relax for those who did not book an all-inclusive resort.

Great bech club!. I didn't even feel the need to try another beach club. Mamitas has good chairs and umbrellas, bathroom is clean and the beach is amazing! Make sure to order ice with your drinks, everything gets warm really fast...

Mamitas Beach. My wife and me spent a week in Playa Del Carmen renting a condo close to Mamitas beach. It was not the first our visit there, but this time it was something new. Like we always do, we paid for umbrella and two beach beds. As other people mentioned here, food and drinks on the beach are quite expensive. So we decided to go home for lunch and return back in an hour or so. Once staff on the beach noticed we are living they immediately advise us that if we did not return in a half of hour they will throw our belongis and sell place to other tourists. On the other hand, it is OK to sit in the water for two and more hours not laying on your beach bed. No body will tell you anything. They trying to keep you on the leash. Nothing like that happened before.

Good value for travelers. The reviews were a bit confusing and conflicting. My husband and I were staying at a resort in Playa Riviera (which has a rocky, green beach). We wanted to spend time at Playa del Carmen and needed a beach club. Mamitas is right on the beach, and the beach is beautiful (clear water, soft sand). Loads of locals frequent the beach, so it is very busy. As others have said, the service does kinda suck. I don't think they are in it for repeat business. But for two beach lounges/chairs and an umbrella, the cost was only $9. Super cheap, particularly as the website states the price is MUCH higher. If there's a next time, we might try the Kool beach Club right next door on the beach. They seemed to have better equipment/furniture.Note: To the right of Mamitas Beach Club - just past the Kool Beach Club is a jetskiing and massage stand. The owner, Miguel, is great and so are the prices. My husband and I had a fantastic couples massage right on the beach and negotiated a good price. It was literally less than one-third what was being charged at our resort, yet the massage therapist clearly took pride in their work. That was a nice surprise.

Overpriced, slow service, and a sea loaded with lice!. Mamitas used to be a fun beach club with decent food and drink. Now, it is super expensive, slow to no service and my son was covered in jellyfish stings! It also happened to my husband and I years ago, and we have been on several other beaches in Playa and Tulum with no issues. We have only had trouble at Mamitas Beach Club and have learned our lesson. We will never go back.

beautiful and safe but expensive. Very expensive ,better off another club.They should copy Mr Zancho at Cozumel.Didn't like the price of beers,food everything very very expensive not for families with kids.

...For the love of House, love of beats...love of MAMITAS. I got good time.....good music, nice people, nice beachI recommend to order direct and sit at restaurant for food. At jul - aug and january expect lot of people and service can be slow. 100 sunbeds. In other seassons service is faster. I recommend go and pay and order at bar direct.Great Festivals are here. Jazz, electronic, futbol, etc Top Djs you can see here.New Mamitas beach with swimmingpool coming... bigger place...

Decent time but I don't like the scams. Mamitas is in the best part of the beach at Playa del Carmen and it's great for people watching. You pay for the lounge chairs and table and, right after we paid and received two bracelets, we were told that our kids (who didn't have bracelets) would have to pay to use the restroom. We were also told that the minimum order for a bucket of beers is 12 beers - for two adults, this is a bit excessive.Honestly, I had a better time at Blue, the beach club right next door.

THE beach club. Not only it has an amazing beach and ocean view, it is full of beautiful people. It offers a wide variety of food and drinks at a reasonable price. If you are visiting with a big party, you should consider one of their famous beach beds, super cool!

Lunch and football watching. We were there for a lunch,ordered nachos with beans and cheese and fettuccine aglio olio and orange juice,it was ok rather good,service normal nothing special,beds and umbrella for 100pesos together,own food or drinks are forbidden

Servers went above and beyond!. We spent one day at Mamita's beach club and had a great time! Our server was Adrian and he was amazing! The beach was packed and he was able to finds us chairs, and then an umbrella. The drinks kept coming and the nachos were tasty. Bathrooms are also very clean.

A Relaxing Afternoon. We have been repeat visitors to Mamitas Beach Club over the past several years. We consistently enjoy the atmosphere and beautiful view of the Caribbean. The food is good and the waitstaff hustle. This is our favorite beach club in Playa del Carmen.

Great Place. A nice beach club with great atmosphere, the beach is really clean and awesome, it is a bit expensive compared to other places around but it is worth it, sometimes it gets really crowded and there is a lack of attention for the clients, I wouldn't recommend it for kids though.

Great day at the beach . We had a discount from our condo and decided to try mamitas. It was crowded, but we were led to a seat fairly quickly. Our waiter came to get orders within five minutes of sitting down and remained at our beckoning call the entire day. The beach is gorgeous... The sand and water are the best in town. As the afternoon got later, we did see some drunk patrons but the staff seemed to keep things in control quite well. This beach club is for family, young adults and older people. The variety of nationalities and ages provided a great experience. The drinks are steep, but no worse than the rest of fifth ave and what do you expect, you're right on the beach. The food was decent, again with a price tag though. Overall we had a great day, the view is amazing and the staff was great. Enjoy.

Bad service, attitude and expensive . A wise piece of advice, stay away avoid stress and save money. Mamitas playa the best beach in Playa period. Mamitas beach club is a restaurant that provides beds and umbrellas on the beach. They have a mafia where they don't let you put your own towel or bring drinks or food. As they make you buy in from them. Since its inception huge traffic area they get the people anyway so they are taking advantage big time. With beds ranging from 200 pesos to 200 pesos plus 2000 pesos minimum consumption. Not enough umbrellas. Waiters and staff including the manager not friendly and with an attitude. You are better off walking a bit along the beach and choosing a different place or bring your own towel and portable chair. Oxxo is around the corner you can get drinks any food for a fraction of the price. There is also some restaurant bars along 28th just beforehand you get to the beach very affordable and great service.

Beautiful, clean beach with good service. Mamitas was the beach club of choice for our hotel and we received "tickets" to have two beach chairs with a large umbrella for $5 US. We arrived every morning of our trip by 10am and were able to get front row ocean facing beach chairs. Getting there early also gives you the advantage of hand picking the newer lounge chairs. Some of the chairs could use replacing and were sagging with little or no support...but hey you are at one of the most beautiful beaches in the world! There is a small pool and outdoor showers tucked back on the side of the restaurant. Pool costs extra $$ to sit there and you need to purchase at least $30 in food/drink to use it. While we were there there was major construction taking place so if you don't mind constant jack hammering...go for it. Honestly, the beach is way better! The construction noise was not heard at the beach...just the beautiful sound of waves. We ate lunch twice at this club. I do not recommend the burgers! The taste was bad as was the quality of the meat. Don't go for the food,,,, go for the beach and all it has to offer! No seaweed, no rocks...just beautiful white sand and blue warm water!

Poor service, club kids. I spent one of my only days off at this disappointing beach club. The service here is poor, you are treated as if they never will see you again and I guess that's true. 45 mins to get a bottle of water. I would have ordered lunch but never saw the server again. There were many young, hungover types that thought they were in the cool place to be and accepted the service there. Also in front of the beach club on the small patch of beach the club kids who don't want to pay for a chair set up shop leaving about an inch of space between you. I'm young at heart, been there done that bought the tshirt. Nowadays I choose to spend my money where I will be tripped over with excellent service.

Years ago this was my favorite place in Playa. I haven't been for years, but Mamita's Beach used to be one of my favorite vacation spots.The white flowing curtains, light house music, swing beds, beds on the sand for laying out...It was a little piece of heaven. I can't say anything about the service or prices, because I never spent money here...But the environment used to be very relaxing and loungy.

Wanna feel like you're in prison? Come to Mamita's!. Worst beach club I have EVER been to. Me and my girlfriend read amazing reviews about this place, went there to spend the day and felt like we were in prison. Over-priced, Over-hyped, Over-populated beach. They expect you to keep buying drinks/food and are forbidden to bring in your own munchies or drinks (or you get kicked out). It's a PUBLIC BEACH, how is this terrible business allowed to post these signs? The waiters/security on the beach hover around you, eye-baling your every move. We were so looking forward to this "amazing" beach club, but we left after 30 minutes of being pestered and badgered for drinks. Do yourself a favor and go down the street to the open beach, save yourself the money and peace and quiet. For shame Mamita's.

Beautiful beach day. Mamitas is very "south beach" like so we enjoyed it alot... we got VIP beds with bottle service and had an awesome day. The food was good and there was lots of security (its a public beach) so we felt safe and didn't feel like our stuff would get stolen

Totally Disappointing. I travel to Playa every year and have for several years. I am not sure what has preempted the changes at this beach club in allowing you to use their umbrellas, but after paying to use one, they wouldn't allow us to, stating the winds were too strong. The adjacent beach club was using umbrellas so we moved over to that beach club. I will never go to this beach club again. To make matters worse, after charging me for beach equipment that they wouldn't allow me to use, they charged us $28 for the two drinks we ordered before we left. Horrible service. Horrible value.
Great people watching. Hip and happening, the beach club is the place to be. Gave it a good review because this place is a hot spot. Don't go for the food or cocktails, you will be disappointed.

What a view!!. Good food, drinks, and view!! The prices were not to much and you cold see all the way to Cozumel!! A little bit of heaven.... Go for the food, a drink, or the views. No way you will be disappointed!!

Beautiful beach, outrageous prices. Mamitas is popular due to its long standing reputation for being on a gorgeous stretch of beach and having decent food and drink. Service is generally good, sometimes slow, but never frustratingly slow. The house music can be loud if your chairs are located in the back row but in order to get front row seating you'll need to arrive when they open at 8am. Mixed drinks (kind of weak) are $95 (pesos) and beer was $40-50 (pesos) I believe. Two chairs and an umbrella was $70 (pesos). I probably wouldn't have chosen to spend the day here but it was so close to my condo and I was so very lazy that one day. We had a good time nonetheless and if another lazy day struck, I'd probably bite the bullet and pay the prices.

A perfect Saturday & Sunday entertainment. Great beach to spend the day on while enjoying a chill out music. The beach side is clean and huge sun beds are available to rent if you are a group of few people. Definitely and experience to try.

Nice beach, poor service.. the beach is really nice, the food and drinks served are good. the only problem could be the service, the people are nice but slow and a bit too insistent on the tips. When you are there for relaxing is really unpleasant to being constantly asked about higher and higher tips,which in my opinion they really don't deserve. Beside this, I found it the nicest beach club in playa.

Better than Zenzi beach club but that's not saying much. Loud, crowded and bad food. Also the waiters are miserable and seem to hate their jobs. They will beg for tips even before they find out if you are going to give them one or not which we always do. It seems that everyone travelling in mexico is a smoker. I've never been at a beach where I choked because of all the cigarette smoke. The beach is clean and the water is beautiful if you can find a spot to yourself for a few moments. It is better than Zenzi beach club which was full of trash and seaweed. Do yourself a favor and walk south past Senior Frogs to find a piece of serenity and a beah to yourself (almost).

Consistantly Great Service and Food at a Nice Beach Club. This is my 2nd trip to Playa and both times my daughter and I spent 2 days at this beach club. You must get here before 10 am if you want to rent an umbrella with your lounge chairs which together only cost 90 pesos which is very inexpensive since you can use them the whole day. Both times we ate breakfast in their restaurant which was delicious and cost around 330 pesos for 2 full breakfasts with coffee, juice and tip. While on the beach we had great and very friendly service from our waiters Edwin and Niccolas, whom were very easy to get their attention and service. Both times they let me run a tab which was convenient. And their bathroom is very clean. I don't understand the negative reviews because each time I have come to this beach club both my 13 year old daughter and I have had a great time for not that much money. Yes the beach is crowded but so are most of the beaches and the music volume did not bother us at all. We will definitely come here again on our next trip to Playa.

Over rated. It looked nothing like the pictures on their website. We paid for the loungers but then had to wait for another 45 mins until a waiter came to take our orders. We stayed for about 4 hours after that and no one ever asked us if we needed more drinks. The service was overall very poor. Only good thing was the rental of the loungers as it was quite cheap.

too crowded and too expensive. Mamitas beach club was a cute little club when it started out. Away from the town itself, quiet and very inexpensive. Plus they had a lot more beach and it was so nice to go and so relaxing.Now it is filled with young people and very loud and EXPENSIVE!!! They have music blasting very loudly the whole day. Its super expensive a simple cocktail drink was 80 pesos which is expensive for Mexican standards. Honestly I would avoid this place. I went with my small son who is a year and a half, we felt like it was too crowded too expensive and really no place for him to play. Unless you are a hipster or a young adult and you like listening to loud dance trance music I would recommend this place. But if not there's no way I would recommend it.

Too crowded for no good reason. We had tickets for free chairs but they didn't have any with shade so rather than offering one of the many beds they had available they decided they didn't want our business. Very poor business practice.

Great place, but get there early. Get there early if you want to rent chairs and umbrellas, it can get crowded. We got there around 11 and all chairs were gone. We ended up renting a bed and umbrella for $200 pesos and had to spend a minimum of $500, which was fine with us since we were spending all day there. The fresa colada and ceviche are amazing!!

Great beach club on lively beach.. As an older Canadian not into the Beach Club Scene this was an interesting visit. The beach is great, and as others have said up to comparison with those in Europe. We were staying in a smaller down town hotel (Illusions) which has an arrangement with this place. Our cost for two chairs and an umbrella for the day was 8 US dollars and unlike other beach clubs there was no minimum food or drink cost. The beach is fairly crowded and the crowd in young or at any rate younger than I am! The restaurant and bar provided good service. Alight lunch for two with two soft drinks was around 30dollars with cheerful service. Showers are available and the washrooms are clean .

Nice beach, amazing place. Playa del Carmen is very, very nice. In my opinion, very close to the Greece , France and Spain beaches. So, to turn it closer, a beautiful beach club, with best margerita in Mexico, good food and service. Definitely I recommend it for stay the whole day!

Excellent Beach, Too Crowded. Pros:Gorgeous BeachGreat ceviche at restaurantGood service at restaurantCons:The beach is beautiful, so this place is very popular and gets very crowdedWe had to spend a minimum of $120 to reserve 2 beach chairs

Nice Bar Just off of Fifth Ave ~Playa Del Carmen. This is one of our regular pit stops when we go to Playa Del Carmen..WE were here in 2011. It's right off fifth avenue. Close to the pier so you can see the ships rolling in and out of port., The beach is nice but very crowded. The food is ok. The staff however really remember the regulars and are genuinely courteous. You can rent a chair for the day if you want to catch some rays. If you want to spend the day there you have everything you need right there. Showers~food~sun~beach~shopping..Enjoy!!

No Mamitas 4 Me. Too expensive for Mexico and the world. No AMEX accepted. Beach view is ok. Partially obstructed by beach umbrellas. We ordered the shrimp ceviche and it was't real ceviche. Just a lot of onions and tomatoes chopped with some shrimp. (not the classic ceviche) The fried calamari was aweful. O-rings only and chewy. The portions are small and overpriced. If you want to be on the beach and eat, for the same money I suggest Fusion a few blocks away. No Mamita's for me.

Nice beach, service, and scene. My wife and i were pleasantly surprised by Mamita's after all the negative reviews. We were suggested to go to another club by our hipster hotel, but the beach area there wasn't open until later and the actual coast was not nice. Disappointed, we walked down the beach until we came upon Mamita's instead. Two chairs and an umbrella was 90 pesos. A deal compared to the 30-50 USD we have paid in South Florida or Europe for other "city" beach clubs. Great people watching of beautiful and scantily clad. We had good service over two full days.
Beach Blues. Too expensive to sit at a beach and eat there. Grab a couple of towels, sit on the sand next to the big shots and then go to La Terraya to eat and drink and save $25.00.

Very Disappointed in their attitude. "So you are aware".We rented two chairs and a umbrella for the day at around 9:30. About noon we wanted to go for a walk, at that point we were approached by one of the waiters and TOLD if we were not back in 30 mins we would lose our place! I questioned this politely. I asked if we get our money back as we rented for the day! They changed the tune somewhat, saying they would move us to the back."It's the rules" they said ...there are no rules any where to be found, I did ask.It was obvious to us that we were not buying any of their drinks and food.It's all about the money. As far as they are concerned, you are there for a week and gone.Mick and Sue Canada

Bad fee years ago, worst today.. This place is nice , no doubt. The problem is the horrible service attitude from staff.members. I could sit and describe what happened to me give years ago and today. It's not even worth my detailed review. If you want to see nice people and don't mind spending big money and have servers with 'i don't care

Fab beach and service but BEWARE the jetskis. Mamitas beach club offers a relaxing environment with great service and great ambience and chill music. Fabulous way to spend your time as the water here is clear and they keep the beaches very clean. A relatively new phenomena at Mamitas beach is that the jetskis going back and forth along the beach drive VERY close to the shore. So if you want to go in the water more than about 5-10 meters (that is up to your waist) be very, very careful because the jetski drivers dont care who they might run over. This is a disaster waiting to happen. I was at mamitas today and the jetski driver was screaming at all the swimmers to get out of the water. THese drivers used to go out far enough so that you could have a relaxing swim and even snorkel (beautiful fish in these waters). NO MORE! Too bad the beach club cant make these jetski operators go a bit farther out so that everyone can enjoy their time at mamitas-sun bathers, swimmers, and jetski fans.

Paradise. We spent two days lounging here and we really enjoyed everything about it. We had Niccolas as our beach waiter and he was extremely attentive. We also ate lunch there one day... had the bean and cheese nachos...YUM! The drinks are on the expensive side, but the views and service are amazing!

a nice place to relax, although expensive.. We spent one afternoon at Mamitas Beach. Our waiter was so kind and friendly, which is hard to find in Playa del Carmen as most of the people are rude and you can tell they are only after your money. Either way... if you go to Mamitas ask for Jorge Aguirre "chente" and he will get you a great service and good time.Do keep in mind that if you are not staying at a hotel that has an agreement with Mamitas beach Club, you will have to pay around 10usd to rent beach chairs, if you want a bed is more expensive.Also, at high season it's very crowded, so I would avoid visiting at that time...Food and drinks are expensive so, keep that in mind too. Altough the ceviche was delicious.Other than that, this is one nice place to spend time at the beach in Playa del Carmen.

Crooks!!!!!!. First off, you have to be at mamita's quite early to get a spot, first couple of times we tried, they were out of umbrellas, the condo we are renting gives us 50% off coupon for lounge chairs and umbrellas, so we went to kool instead and paid full price, they let us take off and come back anytime we want, we would be gone for couple of hours and grab lunch elsewhere, third attempt with mamitas, we made sure that we reserve lounge chairs and umbrellas before noon to get a decent spot, when we tried to leave for lunch (after we paid for our chairs and umbrella) the waiter chased us to tell us that we can't be gone for more than 30 minutes or they will give our spot to someone else and that's their rules, i spoke with the manager and told him that they should have informed us before we paid for the chairs, because i would rather pay full price at kool, than saving 50 pesos but feel like we are being held hostage. Stay away from this greedy monsters and give your business to someone else! We have been coming to playa quite frequently this past couple of years mainly because we love the mexican's warm hospitality, but my experience with mamitas on our last day left a bitter taste on my mouth, they are a shame to the tourism industry.
Cool beach. Its quite pricey though you really enjoy the view. Great place to make new friends all over the world and have a blast !!

Mamitas not the king anymore. Just got off the beach and honestly mamitas is not what it used to be. It's still good but why bother with mamitas when you have kool next door at the same price with a pool and a dj who actually knows how to mix.

Fun Place to People Watch. Great beach to people watch, have some drinks and relax. Went there twice on our week trip and both times was worth it. 90 pesos or 9 USD for chairs and umbrella is fine with me. Make sure you bring towels. They have them to rent, but the deposit is pricey (500 pesos).

paradise. The beach is gorgeous. The staff is great. The food and drinks are delicious. The atmosphere can't be better. The DJ provides good and relaxing music during the day and a little more action by afternoon. What more do you expect from a Caribbean beach scene?!
just chilling. great place on the beach is you're tired of the beach on your resort . free brach but you have to pay for a chair but you can get your own alcool if you want

Don't bother. If you're looking to do some people watching and have a beer under your umbrella and chair with techno music, go for it. Whatever you do, eat someplace else before or after. 10 years ago Mamitas was once a great palapa restaurant on a beach with little else on it that had great Mexican beach food and a gorgeous pristine beach out front. I cannot express to you how AWFUL the food and prices are here now. Its really quite shameful the place they've gone to all in the name of money and tourism. The service sucks, the food sucks, and the prices are horrific for McDonalds style Mexican. It makes me sad. I once loved this place. It's a place to be seen. For a drink. That's it .

Bad service. The beach is outstanding, but me and my boyfriend had a bad experience, we had 25% off coupons from the hotel we were staying, we spend the morning in the beach when the server told us that they were switching shifts, we said it was ok, we spent the rest of the day in there and when we paid the check there was 2, one for the first waiter with the 25% discount applied and the other one without it, when we talked to them, they were very rude, did not gave us the discount even though the waiter never told us and did not even apologise and honestly we are not going back. The food was too expensive and usually mexican servers are very nice, but in this time they were not.

Great beach thats all.. Great place to chill at the beach but really expensive could have got better prices and specials they charge prices like you are in a top place in miami no a good place if you have a budget the best is the service the worst is the prices like pay for a beach bed and you spend $150 on a tab come on man.

Great Place to Spend the Day..... Great place to relax the day away. We had free passes from the hotel we stayed at. It gave us lounge chairs and a umbrella. The sand is a beautiful white, the water crystal clear and the scenery is off the charts.... Very helpful staff and good cold drinks served right on the beach. Had very clean bathrooms and showers to rinse off the sand and salt water.... It was only a short walk from our hotel....

Good Service, Solid Food Offering, Great View. My husband and I ate at Mamitas Beach (Restaurant) club on the first day of our arrival, as it was recommended to us by our hotel near by. The Restaurant itself offers a modern and relaxed dining experience, with good food selection, prompt service and a fantastic view overlooking the beach and beautiful water. No complaints and would defiantly recommend for casual dining experience.

Image over quality. I have found the Mexican people to be polite, honest and hard working and deserving of tips more often than not. Mamitas challenged my way of thinking. The bar looks contempory and everything you would wish for but the drinks and staff fall way short. My wife and I started with a piña colada each, big glass, no trimmings.......and no alcohol! It was little more than a coconut milk shake, if there was alcohol we couldn't detect any. Undeterred my wife tried a different cocktail, I switched to beer. The beer arrived in a bottle, no lime or offer of a glass. My wife experienced a fruit juice masquerading as a cocktail. I left the amount due without the optional service charge as it was not deserved.. I was chased at the exit by the server demanding a service charge, I left him a bundle of change from my pocket, probably about 200 pesos mainly because I was stunned and amazed by his brashness. We left to what sounded like a traditional Mexican verbal insult. Beware Mamitas some people Speak Spanish to a degree. Great setting, good looking image, poor drinks, average to poor service and awfull protocol. By the way, I have tipped over 6000 pesos over 2 weeks and have thoroughly enjoyed Mexico. Avoid this place, there are better more traditional places with smiling helpfull staff.

Great place to relax & enjoy. This is an excellent beach club to relax & enjoy the turquoise Riviera's ocean. The prices for the chairs and umbrellas are extremely cheap. The only "negative" is the service; not bad but average.

Go to See and be Seen. This is for the glamorous set. I had fun watching everyone on the beach but it is definitely touristy. It wasn't my thing but I can see that for many this would be the place to be. There are loads of beach chairs and a pool and parking and drinks. If you spent money for food or drinks or a chair there was no charge to park.

Crap. Your money and they are way to dumb to know it. Day one go have a ok time for 100 us no big deal expect to pay. Day two sit at beach chair no one comes for over an hour to get a drink or collect for chair. Have to go use the bathroom and gonna get charged 20 pesos. What a joke thanks you just lost 100 bucks a day for next 10 days. Found service rude and slow more worried about a tip than if your enjoying yourself.

Playa Mamitas!. Playa Mamitas is a Hotel, Restaurant, Bar and everything else you would want from a Beach club. You can't miss this place on the beach, It has all white umbrellas, beds, and there will probably be A LOT of people hanging out having a good time. I have only been here during spring break so I can't speak for year round but March-April is CRAZY. Be sure you get there early in the morning if you want an umbrella and some chairs. Sometimes they require minimum consumption when it is super crazy or when they have special guest dj's.Be sure to bring your flip flops, cash, and a smile because you will surely have a good time at playa mamitas. The drinks and food weren't overly priced for being such a nice place and on the beach. I think beers were like 3 bucks.. compared to a dollar on 5ta.

Nice place to find chairs/umbrellas/service on the beach. I'm used to $20 USD chairs in Miami, so when Mamita's asks for 30 pesos per chair and per umbrella - it's a bargain! (we have been going on the weekdays so far... the weekend was just a zoo)Yes, maybe the chairs are a bit older, but you're bringing your own towel anyway to lie on! The man who collects the fee for the chair and umbrella is a no-nonsense sort of guy, part of the job I guess. He needs to crack down on the freeloaders and whiners and collect the fees. This part of the beach around 28 ave is really nice, and the surf is very even, not a choppy break so swimming is easy. We tried a bit further up the beach, but some of the private beaches and hotels won't let you rent chairs/umbrellas from them. The music at Mamitas is good, and the buildings are new, and washrooms are very clean. There is parking for your car, small pool for kids, and an outside shower too. We thought the service was good, but I guess that depends on your server and the crowds too. Beer is 44 pesos I believe, but if you're dying for a cheaper drink you can walk up 28th to a taco stand for beer there - 25 pesos. The fajitas are good, not plentiful, but it's a convenient snack for 120 pesos.Remember, you're at a beachclub to enjoy your time at the beach! I wouldn't fuss over slow service or paying a bit more because, well, life could be worse!
3 days on the beach. We visited Mamita's Beach Club for three days. The service levels were very good. The food is excellent and the drinks were very good.

Perfect day(if you're looking for the beach club experience). We came here at 12 pm, and had the chance to choice where we want to be/sit. We were 6 girls,so we rented a bed. It was overpriced, but included two bottles of your choice, and unlimited mixers(sodas, mineral water or juices). The service was average. We had a perfect view, in front of the sea.We ordered some food, and I had the scallop ceviche and was DELICIOUS! All the instalations are very clean and nice(bathrooms, massage spa). If you can, bring your own towel, because here it costs 60 pesos, plus a 250 deposit.Around 4 pm, the beach was kind of crowded, but with our bed, didn't feel so. But then, the staff put sunbeds for more people next to our bed. That was weird because we had 2 persons staring at us,almost sharing the bed or the mini roof.I saw a lot of people getting by the beach with their own towels and coolers, and sitting in front of Mamitas, without having to rent a sunbed or consume anything. So maybe if you dont want to spend a lot of money, this is other option.If you are looking for a bar scene-vegas beach club style, with dj's, and people watching and drinking alcohol, this its the place in Playa.

Very Good Beach Club. My daughter and I went here twice during our visit and we really enjoyed it. You have to come early to get a good spot. Some reviewers were complaining about the quality of the chairs but we did not encounter this, both visits we had good comfortable chairs. It did cost 90 pesos ($8 US Dollars) for 2 chairs and an umbrella but you get to use them all day. You can have the food on the beach or go into the restaurant (we chose the restaurant). I had the fajitas, mixed shrimp and steak, and it was delicious. It also came with black beans and guacamole. I enjoyed it so much I had it again 2 days later. My daughter had the bagel with chicken breast and it was also good. I had a margarita and it was weak but tasted good. The bathroom facilities are very clean and you can use either the one by the pool or the one in the restaurant. We will definitely come here again on our next trip.

Best Beach Club. We visited Mamitas based on a friend's recommendation and enjoyed it so much we never went anywhere else. The chairs/umbrellas are a bit cheaper than Kool next door. The food is decent, but I would stick to beer since the drinks are weak. The service was great. The facilities were nice (bathroom, shower). And by far, this stretch of the beach is the best. We walked the beach south to the farthest ferry pier and determined that Mamitas wins the beach club competition hands down.

Meal only -- mixed. We didn't rent chairs here or use it as a club, just a restaurant. We walked five miles (truly!) down the beach, in an ultra-long walk from our hotel that ended at Playa del Carmen. The walk was a great experience, taking us past every type of beach sight -- giant hotels with wall-to-wall loungers, vendors of every sort, empty stretches, a deserted area that looked like a bit of a hook-up area, even a park with many local families swimming and picnicking. But it was hot, and we were tired and needed sustenance at the end. Mamita's seemed like a nice spot right on the beach, so we went in for lunch. The guacamole was delicious and extremely fresh, and my garden salad with tuna (a modification, which they were kind to do) was great, but my husband's chicken sandwich was pretty pedestrian. They were nice about giving us the log in so we could use the Internet on our phones, and the service was friendly and thorough, if more than a little slow. I will say the guy made a point not only of pointing out that the tip wasn't included but suggesting specifically what it should be, but I didn't really fault him -- it was a hustle with a smile, at least.

Good place to catch the rays!. We really enjoyed our visits to Mamitas. Most of the staff are very good and provide a very good beach service so you don't have to it interrupt your sun bathing! If you want a break from the sun and heat, the bar/restaurant served good food and drinks. The staff did a good job of keeping the place clean not so easy with all the sand around. The one thing that needs attention are some of the beach chairs and parasols could do with renewing as they are not in a very good state of repair.

Mamitas!. Nice beach club. If you want to get a nice place in front of the beach arrive early. Food and drinks are really good,nice party music. The service was nice and fast. 45 PESOS LA CERVEZA. Small swimming pool and shower . Nice place to have fun with your friends.

Keep walking down the beach. We sat at Mamitas one day for about 4 hours because it was very close to where we were staying. You have to pay $3 US for each chair plus $3 for an umbrella just to sit in the chairs. That doesn't include drinks or pool access. Basically just the chair/umbrella and access to the bathroom. The chairs were really in bad shape and in desperate need of replacement. We did eat here in the afternoon, had a club sandwich which was about $12-$13, sandwich was fine, nothing special. It was hard to get a waiters attention. I would definitely skip this place and walk further down the beach to Wicky's or Wah Wah instead.

Strange place, in fact even bizarre, terrible inconsistency!. We have been in Playa for over two months, usually set up just north of the Mamitas boundary. We have rented loungers and umbrellas, bought food and drink. Generally ok. However today it was quite different. I used the men's washroom mid morning, no problem, left a tip in the tip jar as I usually do. Often when using the washroom the cleaning ladies come in and out, pass by the men using the urinals, sweeping or cleaning! Not used to that, however, it is not a practice one expects! Today as I was leaving there was a lady guarding the men's washroom door. Not the ladies, ladies went in in front of me without interference, however, I was stopped and told 20 pesos! Not a large amount but the fellow behind me said, what 20 pesos to use the bathroom, answer was yes, 20 pesos! I had left a tip earlier and only take small change unless I plan to eat and drink there, so I had only small change. Offered it to her, she said, no, 20 pesos! So I said adios! I know it costs to operate the washroom, however, 20 pesos seems like a lot for one use. Not sure what I will do next time? The inconsistency bothers me as does the practice of having the cleaning ladies walking by and treating lady guests differently than the men.

Overated and not worth the nickle and diming.... Food is average at best, they make you pay for everything incl. the umbrellas... Not exactly in excellent shape either... If you get served by Fernando Lopez, make sure you ask for a receipt cuz he makes up prices and includes his own tip. Next time im bringing my own goodies... Greedy place and service is slow, slow slow. Dont waste your money here, much better places that deserve your money...

It's supposed to be a beach not a night club!. There is no doubt about it Mamitas Beach Club (and next door Kool) are situated on one of the best stretches of beach in Playa del Carmen. But what is it with these beach places that they think people want to hear loud ‘music’ all day?! Calling it music maybe too much of a compliment - I’m no expert but I think it is more like the incessant thud-thud of tuneless, formless ‘dance’ stuff you would find in a night club. Perhaps the very young enjoy it, but from what I could see, the age range of people hoping to enjoy some beach lounger time ranged from zero to their 60’s or even 70’s. If you want to spend time on a beach without the noise, you have to go to either the Playacar end of Playa or head past Mamitas on the northern end until there is a stretch of beach with no sun loungers, no drinks service but just the sound of the sea and the odd seagull….bliss!

Quite decent. Was expecting a tourist trap with so-so food and overpriced drinks and average service.Pleasantly surprised that this was (for the most part) not the case.Service: Be prepared to wait a bit longer between getting menus, ordering etc. - this is Central America and time has a different "flow" here. So if you're from the US, don't complain about the service, it is not SLOW, it is simply delivered at a "leisurely" pace.On to the food: Shared a lunch with a friend of mine, who is a chef, so we were a bit pickier than most guests I guess.We were there during lunch, the restaurant was mostly empty, however we did get a nice table next to the beach which provides a very nice "view", depending on your preference for males or females.We shared a fish ceviche, guacamole and grilled octopus with onions and the habanero(can't remember the name of the sauce) on the side, Both of us weren't terribly hungry so those 3 things were more than enough.Guacamole: Overall, pretty decent, but it lacked a bit more lime which we were luckily provided with our ceviche and octopus. + They have homemade chips and not the store bought ones.- They were a little soggy, due to the humidity of Playa, but overall, it did not detract from the taste too much.Octopus: Very decent, although the veggies were kinda mweh so I didn't care for them too much.Fish ceviche: The fish was frozen, but other than that, it was pretty decent, we made our own mixture on the spot: Valentina(a slightly spicy sauce), one packet of Heinz ketchup and about 1/3 of mayo, add lime according to preference.On top of that, we had 3 bears and a Havana Club 7(the real stuff, not the one Bacardi makes for the US market) which was served in a regular glass and not a rocks/old fashioned glass.Which is my slight peevee as I am in the business and feel that a nice bar and a nice restaurant overall, should serve nice rums in a rocks glass.Overall, the experience was good-to-very good.Total bill = 600ish pesos(around 50$)+tip, for a total of 700 pesos(about 60ish dollars).Definitely worth it, but nothing over the top.

It was ok.. Nice beach club. If you want to get nice places in front of the beach arrive early. Food and drinks are good, bathrooms are cleaned and service was average (in the beginning was slow, but once the beach got crowded they got up to speed). Lounge area is nice but music was kinda loud, maybe to please those that were far. Also, I would change the massage place, the lounge is just next to it and as I said music is too loud.

OOOOOOOOOhhh-VERATED!!!. Poor service. They charge for every little thing(towels, umbrella) which were in terrible condition on top of it all. I was in Puerta Vallarta(chairs and towels comes included in PV) in January and the better beach clubs don't nickel n dime customers.When I asked for a chair at Mamitas, they said find it yourself. In PV they FIND you a table, and bring you a towel!!VERY Watered down drinks at Mamitas.Food was ok.Waiters ASK for a tip!!! Unbelievable. Bold and obnoxious.Music was the best point(very groovy less vocal tracks so its possible to read to a good beat), but the next day, I simply sat near the club and enjoyed the tunes.I find Playa Del Carmen simply 'drinking it's only watered down kool-aid' and they think they can get away with poor service cause the beach and water is so cute.
party time. if you are looking for a fun time with friends, this place is the best,, party music , sand, ocean, drinks ! all together and really cheap too.!

One awesome looking beach bar. Was there for new years eve party with David Guetta. May I say the party was great as was the location. The day before hand I saw the bar looks great and gathers a crowd. I guess this one of the places to be at. Deck chairs have to be paid for, the beach had many people free loading with the entertainment by hanging on the outskirt with a box of drinks

Great Beach Club, awesome beach. Visited with a friend who lives at the Bahia Príncipe Golf residences. Beautiful beach, very high end beach club like the ones in Ibiza (where i have been several times) y nice foodI highly recommend it

Beautiful beach.... but crowded. I have been to Playa del Carmen many times (including Playacar) and have to admit that this is probably the best part of the beach in the area. On the other hand, it comes at a cost, the chairs are really crowded and you therefore need to show up early should you want to be next to the beach. The 'sun beds" are amazing but are 200 pesos to rent (about $20) and then they ask you to spend an additional 1,000 pesos (about $100) in food and drinks. We were able to get it at only the rent fee one day and at 500 pesos another one.... But that was impossible to do on the weekends.

Overpriced, dirty.. This place is overpriced, because they tend to give away free passes to different resorts. The chairs need to be changed, as they are torn a dirty.I would recommend to look for another beach club.

1hour and 45 minute wait for VIP tickets. paid $2100 for 7 VIP tickets to their new years eve party..had to stand in line 105 minutes to pick up the tickets...got in 15 minutes before midnight..they said table service was available but there were no tables left and waiters were hard to find..left after 20 minutes..next time i will spend the 2100 on booze and listen to their music for free on the beach!

David Guetta concert. Great party place right on the beach with breeze so no sweat at all. Security guards for the Guetta concert were bad and had double standards, allowing people with SLR cams while stopping others.

Was Once Our Favorite PDC Beach. I've visited Playa 5 times in the past three years, and each time I stayed, I would spend time on the beach at Mamitas.This last visit will be my last. It seems to have gone downhill ever since their renovation from palapa roof and wood floors to all granite. The top notch service has suffered. On my last visit, the service was slow, orders were incorrect, and at the end of it all, we were told that couldn't remove the items we never ordered fro the bill..."just go ahead and take it out of the tip" we were told. I understand that places have bad days, but this was common on not only this trip there, but the last 2 as well. I'm sorry Mamitas, I have given you 3 more second chances, I must bid you farewell. There are too many much better options in Playa that deserve my business.

ok. Almost four stars but couldn't quite go there. Pretty big beach with one half consisting of lounge chairs and umbrellas and the other half of beds you can rent. We sat on two loungers with umbrella. The beach is packed, but we were still able to get a spot around noon. The service was nice and fast. Our server was attentive. Prices aren't anything great-- your typical 10-12 for a drink and 3-5 for a beer. Food was just ok, ordered the chicken quesadillas. The beach is really crowded. Don't expect to go for a swim without others at arms length. The beach didn't smell which was nice. The loungers were old and kind of worn out. Nice place to chill for a day though.

Love the beach!. This was our second trip to Playa, La Tortuga and Mamita's. We love it! We heard that some people were complaining about the service but we've had nothing but good service, great shrimp stuffed avocados and cold beer. Perhaps it's the attitude of others. We always try to improve our Spanish and call our waiter by name. Miguel and Rodimiero were friendly and very helpful. Thanks for another great time at the beach!
Luxury and style. Excellent beach club , food and drink reasonably priced, very good facilities . Waiter service to your sun lounger . Small swimming pool and shower .

Beautiful beach, great drinks and amazing service. I got to Mamitas late (noon) and got a chair and umbrella (free with hotel vouchers) at the back of the beach, near the restaurant. Not much of a view, but comfy spot nonetheless. I ordered a margarita on the rocks from a really nice server, it was really really good, not made with cheap tequila.After I got back from my swim, I could not find my bag and my towels. The server saw me starting to panic and came running: a chair had been vacated right in front of the water and he had moved my stuff to the better spot for me. HOW NICE!!! :D He continued to check on me regularly, I had more margaritas and a hotdog with fries (good fast food, generous amounts of ketchup/mustard/mayo packets). He also gave me tons of info about the Jazz Festival (which was held right next to Mamitas).What a great afternoon! Don't miss out on this fabulous Club!

Trendy and über cool for Mexico!. We used the beach club everyday and our hotel gave us vouchers for the sun beds. Service was polite and efficient. Food was tasty. You pay to sit with trendy people, the gays and surgically enhanced of Mexico. Be seen is the moto and is great for people watching! Best beach club and music is very lounge. Don't waste your time sitting anywhere else!

Best beach in Playa. After spending our first two days in Playa at two other beach clubs, we decided to try Mamitas. Well, all I can say is that we were very sorry that we did not choose this spot from the beginning! It's reasonably priced, or at least comparable to the other clubs, great service without being hounded, and has the prettiest stretch of beach. Will definitely go back!
Amazing views. Need I say more? The food is okay, the drinks are over priced and the chairs are better at Kool. BUT, the views on this beach are truly something to see!

Review of Mamitas Beach Club. Beach is clean and water is clear. Music is good. Service is slow and sun beds are hard to find. Food is excellent but drinks are expensive. When the beach is busy and full the servers will be rude and not help you find a sun bed. They will take very long to get your orders and ignore you when you call them.

Better than Miami. The scene is exquisite- friendly people, beds with streamers to hang out on, DJ playing European house music aloud makes for a great ambiance(loud enough to hear/move to, but not too loud to be a nuissance). It is much more beautiful than South beach and half the price for everything(Compared to Miami). it is not cheap, but not expensive, great mix of Europeans, Mexicans, Americans just having fun. Walk down the beach with a beer in your hand, bring your own beer, or be waited on by the staff. White sand is super fine. Overall, I have been to LA, Miami, Malibu, VA beach, Nags Head, Palm Beach, Hilton Head, JAx, and nothing compares in overall beauty, fun, free spirit. Place is ridiculously gorgeous; It has a great sense of refinery without rules enforced, has a wonderful sense of do whatever you want-but without the trash, music plays freely without complaints or people trying to give requests or the DJ talking on the mic. the DJ never talks, just plays music to set the tone for a trip to paradise... sand is fine and white, streamers blow in the wind, music pumps and drinks are served and people are friendly and know how to act.

Great beachfront in Playa del Carmen. We actually stayed north of PLaya in the Riviera Maya, but came down here to experience a better section of the beach for a day. our concierge recommended Mamitas, and it was a godo choice. Turquoise water, nice sand, plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas. At $9 per person (if you're not staying the hotel there), it was a good deal. The beach bar was great with sports on the TVs an plenty of servers. Bathrooms were very nice and clean. Highly recommend for a day at Playa del Carmen.

Beautiful beach. We came to this beach thinking it was a free public beach, I guess some areas are, like by the beach. You have to pay for lounge chairs, not only 1 lounge chair, but you have to rent 2. They wanted to charge us $16 for two. But we decided not too. Oh and you can't have your own food or drinks if you decide to sit on their lounge chairs. Well no big deal, just a bit deceiving. So, we decided to sit real close to the beach like where the waves hit the sand. But we had a wonderful time there. **BEWARE** on topless women. Sounds funny huh? But while we were there enjoying our family beach time, out of nowhere this topless lady came out of the beach, like as if she was not topless, but of course she got lots of stares and a few giggles here and there, because it is a public beach, I was very shocked to see that, thank goodness my 8yr. old daughter did not see her.

Great beach club. Having been impressed with Wicky's yesterday we decided to try Mamitas to compare. The sea and beach is certainly better by far at Mamitas. The soft drinks were half the price of Wicky's but the food was no where near as good although similarly priced. We loved it here and plan to go back soon, however will probably eat before we get there.

Boy, is this place overrated!!!. Yes, it's on a beautiful stretch of beach. And Mamita's should thank the Almighty He isn't making any more beach, because location is the only thing this overrated, self-impressed "club" has going for it.The lounge chairs ($3 or more each depending on how much the guy thinks he can get by you) are threadbare and in dire need of replacement. Make sure yours works before paying since many of the reclining positions are cracked. Another $3 or more for an umbrella. And the little drink tables (if you can get one) are also cracked and falling apart. I found it hilarious that the guy who came by to charge us for our chairs and umbrellas wanted a tip!!Drinks are as pricey as any you will find in PDC. $4 and up for a bottle of beer or bottled water; $7 and up for a cocktail. And waiters who are not the slightest bit shy about telling you how much they expect in a tip whether their service is fantastic or dismal.We got there about 10:30 and were at least impressed with the space provided between chairs and rows. Until about 11:30, that is, when the place filled up and the waiters began filling in every available spot of sand with additional chairs.Do yourself a favor. Skip Mamita's and head south down the beach toward the ferry terminal. There you will find many beach clubs with better service and better prices.
Awesome. Good music, decent service, incredible beach and lots of events if you like jazz or house music!

I take it back I was wrong! AWESOME place. When I went in 2010 I was disappointed because I had NO CLUE about some of their amenities or maybe these are new. I went to Kool beach club and their menu was slim to none and their drink menu was subpar. So I snuck over to mamitas where they had a full AWESOME menu amazing bathrooms and cheaper prices. The servers are more friendly too! The managers also come out when you pay to ensure that you are the valid owner of your card. I REALLY appreciated that. The only thing I would like is to have music playing while I'm there.

Just avoid this place. I had a very bad experience at the restaurant. I ordered a club sandwich with fries which were just awful, cold and tasteless. The waiter was rude, especially when he pointed out how much he was expecting for tip. Worst meal I ever had in Playa.
It´s ok. I don;t know why this place is so famous. To me it´s very normal.
beach club. Had a nice time here. the food was good and the ocean is beautiful. Only complaint they wanted an additional fee to use the pool.

Awful service. I went there with my girlfriend to spend a relaxing day at the beach. I admit the price for the beach umbrella and chairs was good (90 pesos for 2 chairs and the umbrella). But apart from that I was really disappointed. The staff was extremely rude and unwilling to help the customers. I had to ask 3 times and wait more than an hour to get a beer.I lived and worked in the mexican tourism business for 3 months and that was really the worst experience ever.
Beautiful Water and Beach. Fun Beach with people, music and drinks. We loved the water color and we had so much fun that we can't wait to go back.

Nice beach club. Great beach club with nice sandy beach, a little bit pricy, decent food, good music and people from everywhere (europeans, americans, mexicans, southamericans). if you have never been in a beach club maybe you may think is to crowded and hate the music. the music is mostly chill out, tecno, lounge and electronic, so don't go expecting something different because you will be very disappointed.Overall, mamitas is a great place to spend your days at the beach listening to good music, having great cocktails, and watching people.

not so good. This was my first time at a beach club in Playa del Carmen and I was disappointed. It was very crowded and the chairs were close together. The non-stop techno music detracted from the soothing natural sound of the waves.We ordered food and it also was disappointing, overpriced for what it actually was.Although I was a paying customer- my hotel had provided passes, and we did order food- we were denied use of the restrooms.I visited 3 other beach clubs- this one failed in comparison.

If you visit Playa del Carmen Mexico this is a must have..... If you are planning to visit Playa del Carmen at Mexico or you are in Playa you must need to visit Mamitas. Mamitas is a great beach club that offer you different kinds of place to take a great rest looking and enjoying the caribean sea.You can rest in a great Kamastro and need to pay only 3 dlls or you can rest in a bed for the little price of 100 dlls.So in Mamitas you can have a great rest for just 3 or 100 dlls it depends what you need and wantHope enjoy my review and have fun in your trip.

Nice beach but service is not great whenever crowded. The beach is great. We ordered food from the bar and it was reasonably priced, good quality, and delicious. The service is good only if the beach is not crowded. Whenever the beach gets crowded, the servers don't seem to care as much.

Loved it!!. Great beach club with really reasonable prices. My daughter and I spent an afternoon there. Nice sandy beach (unlike our resort), ok menu, full service bar, good music. Also, there is a photographer there who is EXCELLENT. We had pictures taken there as well as at our resort. His were half the price and twice as good.

TACKY. This place it´s absolutely tacky, the beds are dirty! Loud music, terrible service, crowded, lots of drunk kids, trashy girls. It´s not a place for families, couples, or somebody that is looking to rest and enjoy the caribbean view. It´s more like the sort of place to get wasted and miss behave. The food is pricy and they over charge you for everything: chairs, umbrellas, etc,etc. There are other beach clubs where you can really relax without all this crazyness!

Yuck!. Loud music, terrible service, crowded, lots of Speedo donning Euro trash, obnoxious photographer who kept trying to sell us "sexy" pictures of us, drink overcharges... this sums up Mamitas. We went here for an afternoon in the sun and lasted about an hour. Our waiter was rude and negligent, and he overcharged us for our drinks and then acted upset when we left no tip. It was filled with Euro trash men who wear Speedos and really shouldn't or Euro trash women who go topless and really shouldn't. There are better beach clubs, like Las Palapas, which is not nearly as obnoxious and s right next door. Our admission was free through our hotel, but I wouldn't go back again even if it's free admission. Manitas is yucky.

My 50th birthday trip. My husband and I and 18 of our friends traveled to Playa del Carmen in September 2016 to celebrate my 50th birthday. The people who work for this company starting with the owner, Miguel, go above and beyond to make your parties and excursions top notch. There was never a thing we needed or wanted that wasn't thought of by this company. They truly made my birthday party one of the best nights of my life. My guests couldn't stop complimenting the party location, Blue Parrot or the service we received from Miguel (client attention/ reservations), Daniel (WhatsApp attention/backend opperations), Abraham (logistic/operation coordinator), Daniel (support/ guide), Ysolina (photographer guide), and Julio (guide). Just reading this list, you can tell that they are attentive and organized. I mean, who is lucky enough that they get all these people making their events run smoothly. Just a few points: they took us to each event in nice, CLEAN vans, had drinks in van, helped everyone everywhere they went and photographed it all. I can't say enough! We did two events with them and sooooo glad we did. We all especially miss Julio dancing with us and making sure our night went smoothly. Book this company. You will not be disappointed!

Ladies Night Out. I booked a ladies night out on the fly (last minute). The staff was amazing, they communicated with me every step of the way. They arrived at me resort on time with surprise gifts. We visited Blue Parrot night club which was so much fun. One of the most important moments during my outing was the staff. They made sure we were safe the entire night. I felt like Beyoncé with this staff. They accommodate our every wish but our safety was their main focus. I can't wait to book with them again on our next trip. Ladies if you have concerns about going out in Mexico alone. Book with this company and you will have the best and safe time of your life.

Bachelor Party. I found this company online and saw they had great reviews so I decided to give them a try. We were only in Playa for the weekend so we wanted to make the most of it. The first night we went to 3 or 4 clubs/bars and the second night we went to 1 club. We never waited in line to get into any of the places and we had a VIP table at each place. We had 3 people from the company with us at all times making sure we were being taken care of, having fun, and that we always had drinks at our table. They definitely did a great job and I would highly recommend them to anyone traveling to Playa.

Bachelor Party. We planned this trip with Miguel after reading all of these reviews, and he did not disappoint. He hooked us up with a beautiful villa for all 10 of us, and got us VIP service at every club/lounge. We also booked a catamaran trip with him, which was nice. He was very accommodating, and gave us everything we needed, including recommendations for great restaurants. His associate Abraham was always available to get us around and provide recommendations. I would highly recommend using Miguel's service if you're planning a trip here.

Well Organized. I organized a low key bachelorette party for my gf. We did a tango lesson and dinner in a restaurant that was closed for the day. We had the entire place to ourselves. It was easy to organize over whatsapp as I'm in Canada. I would use them again for any special outing. They even surprised the bride with a mariachi band!!

Great Bachelor Party! Very well Organized and Great People!. We hired Miguel and his team for organize a Bachelor Party trip for 16 guys in May. Not only did they do an amazing job but they were all great people. They set us up with a really nice villa in Playa and help us plan a lot of fun activities as well as nightly parties. The whole group was very happy with their services and we were very impressed with how they operated their business. Definitely a A+++++!

Bachelorette Trip. I found this company on line while in the process of planning my friend's bachelorette trip. They are great to work with and very accommodating!!! The Catamaran Trip we booked with them was so much fun!!! I would definitely recommend this company and would definitely use them again in the future!

Best Day = BOAT DAY!. I traveled with a group of 14 to Playa Del Carmen for my bachelorette party and on our last day there, we reserved a private yacht via Caribbean Dream Yachts. It was the BEST DAY of our trip and we couldn't have asked for a better time. The staff was so friendly and accommodating, the yacht was luxurious, service of food and beverage was spectacular and our interaction with the management team in planning this excursion was seamless. The on-site team took tons of photos of our day which was great while all of us were in the water and unable to capture the moments and they did it for us! Very professional group of planners - would highly recommend booking any experience with them while on vacation! Miguel was A+ to work with! We had the best time ever!!!

It was great!. I found these guys on trip advisor with great reviews on bachelor and bachelorette parties and they really lived up to the expectations. Miguel found us a great villa right on the beach which was awesome to be able to walk out of our back door straight to the beach. They also took us to different clubs with vip services, and our tour guide always made sure we were getting served and were having a great time. You guys definitely made a highlight in our trip to Playa del Carmen

It was just.. one of those amazing nights!. I was searching for someone to help out with my cousins bachelorette party in the beautiful and sunny Playa del Carmen. I met the right guys for the job - they promised me the best, and yes, they delivered! They were so helpful, organized and made every moment of my cousins night worth paying for! They were professional with a great sense of humor and importantly they made us feel 100% secure. When I come back for my own bachelorette party, I know where to go, and I know I'll have a party of my life. Thank you all!

Amazing bachelor party . This was definitely a bachelor party to remember. I was in contact with Miguel for months prior to the event and he really listened and organized this trip to our liking. He sent Abraham to take us around who was very entertaining and helpful. They catered to our requests and we couldn't have asked for more. They set us up in a beautiful villa. The yacht trip was amazing. And the places they took us to party were all fun, especially because we had VIP service (no lines, table service, no hassle). If you're planning to party in playa del carmen, you must contact these guys if you really want to make the most out of your trip.

Fantastic Bachelorette!. For my best friends bachelorette party we choose Playa del Carmen and I would highly recommend booking through Miguel, what we got was fantastic! He showed us around town and brought us to the hottest clubs and bars at night, we girls had a blast! Everything was in walking distance and went as planned. Thank you Miguel for this great time and best bachelorette party we could imagine!

Recommended.
