Came down to the riviera maya with my girlfriends celebrating a bachelorette party and found this services online, making easy to organize our activities and showing us around town with our own personal guide who took care of every detail. Abraham was great and charming and made us feel at ease to enjoy our different activities we organize with them. Our highlight was our salsa lessons with latin dinner and a mariachi they surprise us with. We really recommend them if you are having a party in the riviera maya

If only it was my bachelorette.... Even though my group did not go with Miguel and his crew, he was absolutely wonderful in providing multiple packages to cater our wants and needs. He was quick to reply and easy to communicate with.

The ultimate Mexico experience you've always dreamed of!!. IF YOU WANT TO EXPERIENCE THE ULTIMATE MEXICO HOLIDAY YOU'VE ALWAYS DREAMED OF THAN YOU HAVE FOUND IT!! I can not recommend Miguel and Playa del Carmen Bachelorette highly enough!! Weather it's for a bachelorette party or just a group of friends who want the ultimate holiday partying experience!! I can honestly say that it was one of the best weeks of my life and wouldn't have been the same without meeting Miguel and his team.

The life of our bachelorette party!. Miguel is the best partner in crime to have by your side in Playa. The organization and communication beforehand was seamless and he even helped us book a really nice dinner before our big night out for no extra charge. And once we were out, there were no lines, no waits, and no empty glasses. Miguel kept the party going and livened up everybody in our group. His staff also made sure there were surprises for the bride to be throughout the night. Super fun and goofy, awesome dancing partners and also extremely reliable. They're the best at what they do! I would definitely recommend them for future parties, especially for a group of girls. You'll be in good hands!

AMAZING Bachelorette!. Organizing a bachelorette from Canada proved to be incredibly challenging. I was so happy to have stumbled upon Miguel and the "last fling before the ring" website. I read his awesome reviews on tripadvisor and decided to inquire with him. He was super helpful via email. To be honest I was a bit skeptical of this actually working out, but Miguel was there on time, with the van at our hotel, we made it to the port and got on the catamaran and had an amazing time. There were other people on the boat (we didn't choose the private yacht option) but it didn't matter at all, we had fun! The music was amazing, the water was insanely beautiful. We went snorkeling, parasailing and visited isla mujeres. To be honest the island wasn't that exciting, but we were having too much fun / drinking to even notice. The food we ate at isla mujeres was good, nothing too exciting though. Miguel was one of the best parts of the trip. He likes to joke with the girls and bother the bride (in a friendly way). He got us all wet even though we were still in our sun dresses which ended up being super fun and our dresses dried in about 2 minutes because it was so hot (and we left our dresses in the sun). Miguel reads people very well and can gauge who he can push/bother (in a friendly way) and who he can't. He totally got our jokes too. He was raised in the US most of his life, so we found it incredibly easy to relate to him. Definitely would recommend him for future parties. I wish we had been able to coordinate more activities with him during our short stay in playa del carmen!

The Bright Spot To Our Rainy Vacation. We planned my friend's bachelorette party in February when it was winter in Minnesota because we REALLY wanted a beach vacation, but we couldn't get all 7 of us together until June. Unfortunately, the weather forecast called for rain the entire weekend we were there. Thankfully Miguel and Anny showed up as the bright spots on our vacation. They were extremely flexible when we asked to push the meeting time back an hour so we could finish getting ready. When they arrived at our hotel, they were friendly and welcoming and just what we needed after the rain. After taking our photos in the hotel lobby, they had champagne waiting for us in the van. We chatted and laughed the entire drive. The first place of the night was an open air bar where they made sure to broadcast that it was my friend's bachelorette party across the TV screens, had bottle service and a table available for us, and even did some crazy fire show with cinnamon. They blended in with our group really well. At the second place we got a table on a rooftop, which would have been perfect, but it was wet so we decided to try the third stop where we stayed the rest of the night. There were a bunch of other bachelor and bachelorette parties the same night.They knew all the good spots for a Saturday and made sure to cater the evening to our group. We never had to wait in line or worry about money. It was like the clouds had parted. The best part of it all. Our hotel had terrible food so they took us out for authentic tacos. I don't think we got back to our hotel until after 5AM. They were both very personable and I had so much fun dancing with them. I now consider them friends and would highly recommend them as tour guides. They are the best in the business!!

FUNNEST BACHELORETTE PARTY. Miguel along with his Staff-Amie did an amazing job planning my Bachlorette, we had an exceptional day of shopping finished off with a Beautiful Sunset Cruise, swimming, ceviche, tequila and wayyyy tooo much Fun! I required gluten free options and they took care of every detail. I highly recommend them if you are planning a Bachlorette Party in the Area, we stayed in the Mayan Riviera and they arranged everything.

First bachelor Party. Since my friend decided to really make planning my first bachelor party super difficult by having it another country, I totally appreciate the help and service I received from Miguel and his crew. I can't say anything bad about this experience, from start to finish it was an amazing time. Totally recommend using them for bachelor/bachelorette needs.

fun place to vist for a day. Go downtown to the bus terminal for $10 u get round trip every half hour. Walk up and down the main street stop for a beer at any of the little bars and watch the people. Go out on the beach and have a great measage for 25 bucks for 90min. then head back to your hotel.

Book with Miguel and you won’t regret it!. Miguel is the King of Playa! Him and his team take care of everything and make sure that every night in Playa is one to remember. We were there for a bachelor party and he made sure we were treated like VIP every night.
Miguel we will definitely be back for round #2.
HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

The best party organizer guy in Playa!!!. Miguel was a great resource in the bachelor party trip in Playa 2 weeks ago!!! he organized everything for us every night!!, no problems, no surprises, no extra charges, just party all night long!! His team and himself are taking care all the time of the group and making sure everything is perfect for the groom and his friends!!! Thanks Miguel for a great trip!! we will look for you next time we go!!! Cheers!!

Bachelorette Party. Night out . Best bar in Playa, and great service...Salvador knows how to take care of the customers and the atmosphere is amazing.

Loved this place . This club/bar was the best one we visit during our stay in playa deal Carmen. We went there for my birthday. The thing we liked the most was the service, our server Salvador was amazing. I am from Venezuela and my wife is from US and she loves dancing, we had good variety of music to dance and Salvador even taught us some steps. The drinks were coming out quickly and it was a great atmosphere. I highly recommend this place. I have told all my friends visiting this area to go o this bar.

We had so much fun that we came back 3 times!. We visited Playa del Carmen for our honeymoon. There are lots more bars there than here in Kansas City. We visited quite a few, but Abolengo was our favorite by far! Salvador showed us such a good time. He was funny and attentive. We had such a good time that we came back and asked for him.

Fun place. This is a great place to enjoy amazing drinks in an outdoor and air-flowing setting. The music was contemporary and fun. Also, it is fun that it is in the centre of the party area in Playa del Carmen so a ton of people are around
Chilled music lounge. Great chilled music, huge signature cocktails and full selection of drinks.Really good vibe with outstanding service. One of the better clubs in this section.

Well...but . The problem is for Tukan (hotel) guests, since no waiters that serve you, you must go to the bar every time you want a drink, sometimes the bartender makes tours recliners to attend personally, but it is not very often .

Very good beach club. Spent the whole day at Kool beach club and like it a lot. The chairs and sun beds are very good. Service and food is excellent. We didn't use the pool so I can't say anything about that. You pay an entrance fee but can consume towards that in the bar/restaurant.

Great location. Drinks are good & the staff is very helpful and considerate.
Very nice beach and and there is WiFi everywhere. I can highly recommend this place.
I'm not sure why anyone would want to go to the pool though, when there is an ocean right next to it. :)
The toilets are very clean too.

Great day at the beach. Great place to spend the day and have fun at Playa Del Carmen.They have lots of option, from normal chair to beds, pool, bar, very good restaurant. We had the Ceviche mixto and it was enough for two persons and it tasted REALLY good.They charge you an entrance fee but you get it back as a "running bill" for food and drinks all day so basically, its free to get in.Service was great, Gustavo was always there and asking if everything was ok, service was fast.My wife had a 1 hour massage for 25$ and she said it was great.IT ended up costing us 30$ per persons for the chair, 4 cervezas, 1 margarita and the ceviche meal...I would definitely go back!
Love this place. Me and my boyfriend were in the beach, good vibe ,great service - Alejandrina and her team were wonderful. Highly recommended (-:

Kool ambience. The palapas and rigged sails that cover the dining area contributed to the upscale tone of this beach club. Convenience and cleanliness are the keys, and the prices reflect those values. We tried the pescado and camaron taco plates - tasty. Its a short stroll to the salty Caribbean, and you can purchase a beach pass for $250 pesos/p/p. Nice club, but we prefer the less civilized areas. Great for first-timers and refined vacationers.

Great place to spend the day. I was at kool beach at 8 oct 2016, was awesome!we payed 475 pesos each, and we sit at the 2nd row.food was very tasty, drinks were awesome and refreshing.A bit expensive attraction, but was worth every peso.One more word about the crew.They were fantastic, they are always around if you want something so we didnt have to wait a second to order, always smiling and willing to help, just a great crew!Anton,Otniel,Alex and another one i forgot his name. (forgive me if I write it wrong).Thanks and I hope that I will be back again.

BLAH!!!. Not sure what to make of this place. The location is great, the concept makes sense, the service is pretty good. But whoever is in charge of the music has got to go, jeez!! One would think a "beach club" was a club on the beach. Kool wound up being schizophrenic...yikes. Our first visit the atmosphere was charged, the music was lively and the people were moving and laughing and buying drinks and food, just as it should be. On our second visit, expecting more of the same, we get something akin to 3 hours of Celine Dion, Oh My God!! The crowd was smaller and we, all, were having trouble staying awake. Even the wait staff was lethargic. It was pitiful. Kool Beach Club is hit or miss.

Yes, Yes, Yes!. We have been coming here for years. LOVE the service, nachos, drinks, and shrimp ceviche!! Fairly cheap to get a chair in the back by the pool (about $15 USD per person) which includes drink and food credits. If you want to sit in the front yes it's more money, that's obvious. We will definitely be back as we have been coming here for years. Guadalupe, Fernando, and many others were our servers whom in which were fantastic. Sometimes the Kool pool gets hazy.. And has a lot of kids inside the pool.. So I love being a few steps from the ocean to escape that (hey kids wanna have fun too, just don't pee in the pool!). DJ always plays great party music. Thanks for the great time for 8 days!

Massage . Had the most wonderful massage from Vicky. Please ask for her when getting a massage at the Kool beach club. So loving and she exactly felt how to make it a very relaxing, curing massage. This is a gift, for sure!

KOOL Beach is one of the better beach clubs in Playa Del Carmen. Awesome place for couples, groups of friends looking to recover from the night before, and families looking to enjoy a day at the beach.Get there early or around 2 to get the best spots, closer to the beach. They have a minimum spend for different types of chairs and rows that you sit in, and it is basically just a consumption guarantee meaning you agree to eat and drink atleast that amount . My wife and I generally choose the 450 peso per chair section and easily get to the 900 pesos with food, drinks and dessert if little too much. If you aren't a big drinker, you will still enjoy the food including the fresh ceviche and seafood and regular Playa staples. There are tons of servers so the service is pretty consistent but sometimes when it is busy, your food can sit for a while, dont be afraid to speak up if something isn't right, they are happy to fix it. The sun creeps up on you so make sure to wear sunscreen and use those umbrellas. There are also some cool activities on the beach near KOOL like jet ski rentals, para sailing, snorkel tours and the obvious ocean swimming and the water is always pretty perfect! Highly recommend checking this place out for a relaxing day by the beach in downtown Playa Del Carmen

Great!. There are a ton of beach clubs along the beaches of playa, and I believe Kool is easily the best. It is the most expensive to get a bed, but service was great, beach was clean, music was great and the patrons were the best looking. My family of 4 spent $40 to get 3 beach chairs for the day. The prices go up if you want to be close to the water or get a Bali bed. The great thing is the money you pay is credited toward food and drink, so it actually is a really good deal after a few beers and lunch. We will be back!

Good and Bad. - Service: Hit and miss. One day, set in row 5 at a corner. Difficult to get service on a busy Sunday. Another day, set in 2nd row on a weekday. Great and attentive service. - The cushions all have mold spots. So it could be a health hazard. - Tried mango margaritas twice. Both weak. - No breeze if you are sitting in the back rows. Thus the front rows are more $. - Food is decent.

SIMPLY THE BEST TIME EVER,. We chose a small boutique hotel in Playa which had lovely pools but was not on the beach. After checking trip advisor (as we do...) we went to Kool Beach. Great choice, the place is fabulous. The way it works is quite fair, you choose your loungers, they are priced according to location and then the amount you pay is given to you as a credit for you to spend during the day on cocktails,food etc. Pool is very clean and the staff are excellent. Nice menu , great fresh fruit smoothies. The beach in front of this beach club is good. We did take a walk to The Blue Parrot Beach Club which is further down the same beach and found the beach there very inferior. Today was our last day at this beach club as we are off to beautiful Tulum tomorrow. We will miss it. Thanks to all at Kool Beach Club for making us feel very welcome everyday. Especially Allan who welcomed us and ensured we were always happy

Good spot for the day. Kool Beach Club was recommended to my husband and me by a few people, so we chose this location over the other beach clubs in Playa. It's definitely elegant, and the service is great. Plus, the money you pay for the beach chairs is actually an automatic food/drink credit. The lounge chairs are comfy, and there are umbrellas- which cover the whole chair except the feet, so if you want full sun, you'll have to lay your towel down somewhere. There's a pool, too, which we didn't use but which looked nice. There are two things to bear in mind: 1. If you spring for the waterfront chairs, please know they are NOT water's edge. They are the last row before the public beach--which extends from the last row of Kool's loungers to the water. So we paid for waterfront chairs but a few feet in front of us was a huge rowdy group of guys in the public area drinking, acting crazy and throwing beer cans around, so it wasn't the relaxing experience we'd hoped for. For that, the price we paid was not worth it. 2. The chair side service is great, but we didn't want to eat our lunch on the chairs, so when we went up to what we thought was the restaurant area, we discovered once we were heading toward a table that we'd crashed a private event. The restaurant area is actually upstairs in an enclosed room, and it's one sort of awkward family-style table where you can sit and order your lunch. I also feel like our waiter was a little annoyed that we went upstairs to eat. However, I must recommend my favorite aspect of the beach club: DO NOT miss the spa! At first, when the massage therapists walk around with info, you may think oh no, I just want to lounge here. But Vicki was so nice and the prices were great ($50 for an hour massage-- and you pay at the spa, not the front desk of the beach club) my husband and I decided to give the spa a try. Vicki had talked with me about an aromatherapy massage, and I'm so glad I chose it! She was wonderful- the oils were fragrant and relaxing. I can't recommend her enough. The massage is done on a table right at the beach, in the open, which was really nice. She was very professional and careful to protect my modesty, so if you're worried about feeling all exposed on the beach, don't worry. You are in your bathing suit, but she makes sure you are covered with towels, etc. also, she used soft mitts to brush away the sand from my skin, so don't let a little sand deter you. I loved that she placed warm towels while massaging, and when the face area of the table became uncomfortable, Vicki placed an extra towel around my head to make sure I was relaxed.

It was good. We went here two different days on our trip. The first day was great. We got a great waiter! Very attentive, got everything we needed. It was raining on and off that day and they even helped us move our stuff inside just in time before we would have gotten soaked. Then after it was done moved us back outside. That happened twice! They were great. The next day we went.. Not so great. Our waiter was TERRIBLE. The way this place works is you pay for your seats and that gives you credits for food and drink there. It's pretty good deal of you have a good waiter. He was so terrible we had to flag someone else down to take our order and they helped us and told him. You would think this would mean he would pay more attention, actually he paid less attention. If we were able to find someone else to help us, we could get some service, otherwise we would just go the bar our selves. It got so bad we left with credit still on our account, and it was only 2. So this place is a bit of a hit or miss depending on who you get. Drinks are decent, but very small. Food is decent as well. Not bad, not great. Great beach though! And comfortable chairs

Very good service . For 250 pesos, you get a covered lounge chair on the beach for the day. More expensive options are available for premium seating, but regardless of the cost, the price is credit for food & drink, which is better than decent, but a little on the expensive side, mind you. Still a much better value and less pretentious than it's neighbor, Mamita's.

Great way to enjoy Playa!. Extremely attentive wait staff and great food! Jael and Juni and Gustavo were all incredibly attentive and sweet and remembered our Sri is and preferences from one day to the next. We couldn't be happier! They charge about $25 for two beach beds but the money covers like two glasses of wine and two appetizers! Well spent money.I will definitely recommend this ASAP!
Fun beach club! . Seems expensive, but the money for the sun lounges goes towards food and drinks! Good wifi, towels and pool. And very nicely made palomas :)

Outdoor massage. I didn't think Playa could be any better but I was wrong. I just finished the most amazing massage with Vicki at club Kool. Very reasonable price for one hour in heaven. Tropical breezes, ocean waves, awesome massage. What are you waiting for? Go and go now!

Loved it! . The beach was absolutely gorgeous when I went; no seaweed, perfect temperature, no waves , not too crowded which added to my overall enjoyment for sure. As for the beach club , clean and comfy beach chairs ( I was first row) paid about $40.00/ $675.00 pesos which I got back in lots of drinks and yummy fish tacos. Service was swift but not intrusive and I liked that tipping was at the end when you get your bill and at your discretion based on service .

A day on the beach. . The setup of his beach club is as follows;You register at a kiosk to pick a deck chair located on the beach. You pay your fee (depending on how close you are to the water determines the amount you pay.)Prices start from about USD $40.00.You sit at the beach on your deck chair all day eating and drinking. The amount you pay at registration comes off the food and drink bill. Food and drink prices are very good. The staff most of the time are very efficient and on the ball.

An enjoyable day. My hotel had an arrangement with Kool Beach Club so I used a free Saturday to sit on the beach here. Based on other reviews, I expected to be sandwiched in here, but that was not really the case. I never felt crowded, noone bothered me, the waiters were nice. I will confess though that my cocktails were watered down and I would probably stick to soda or water or beer next time. Not the best cocktails, guys. But overall, a pleasant day on the beach in Playa del Carmen.

Nice beach club. This beach club, next to the Grand Hyatt, offers a nice clean beach and chairs with umbrellas, a pool, good food and drinks and reasonable prices. You pay an entry fee of $500 pesos per person (some hotels like ours had discounts so it was just $250 pesos) and less for kids or under 5 free. The cost of the entry counts against food and drinks so if you have breakfast or lunch then use of the club is practically free. Lots of water activities around- jet skis, banana boats, parasailing. Good service although the runners work hard and are sometimes hard to catch but all friendly and want to make you happy. Had a good massage there too and well priced. Only cons would be that the cushions on the chairs could be better- kind of get dirty and moldy in heat and sun. Also bathrooms could be better.

Nice beach to hang out. Needed a nice beach as we weren't staying at an all inclusive, but instead in downtown playa. This beach had a nice location., good music as well as good food. You paid according to how close you wanted to be to the beach. The cover charge totally went toward food and drinks. Their nachos were killer. We had a nice time here. It's wasn't as crazy as other parts up and down the beach.

Good private beach. The beach was so so, as most of the beach on playa deal Carmen but at least the kool beach club is welcoming.They have a good system of assigned chair with a credit to use based on where you seat.The service is good, chair are confortable.It is great if you want having drinks for a day long.About food it is another story... Not good at all, not cooked and bad ingredient. So remember, go there for seats and drinks and enjoy the beach (and maybe the little pool full of kids).

Beach fun. We had a beautiful trip there , highly recommended good food clean swimming pools nice restaurant. Family oriented, the money you spend to get in the facility they use it toward your food or drinks.

Second time and happy/ la palapa de masaje. If you want a really good massage ask for Clara - she is amazing. I had 7 sessions of Kool massage with reflexology, deep tissue, sport etc. Really love it. Thank you very much! Hope to repeat next year!

Beach Massage . My sister and I had beach massages. Lili was amazing with her deep tissue massage. She literally got all of the knots out of my back in 30 minutes. I was so amazed. My sister's masseuse was Ana and she really liked her massage as well. Professional staff, very courteous, and great ambiance. Would def come back!
Beach massage. Ana and Vicky at Kool beach club were the best masseuses! Really lovely and professional. Would definitely go back next time we're in Playa.

Worth the money. My husband and I stayed in Playa for 7 days. While there we visited Kool Beach Club. For one price we rented our beach chair, towel and umbrella. I think it was roughly $60 a day but that amount was also put towards food and beverage. It's a really good deal and we were right in front of the water. Waiters come around very often to take drink and food orders. Very friendly and will definitely go back to Kool !

Awesome!. This beach club is very nice, some people say it's overpriced... but come on, it's Playa, tell me one thing that it's not overpriced, we liked this one better than mamitas club, paid 600 pesos for a family (2 adults + up to 4 children) and got a bed nearly on the front row, service is great, food is ok, beach is nice, 600 pesos is 4 beers and nachos and wings, not bad. Definitely coming back!

FABULOUS!!. We spent 1 day of our 7 day vacation at the beach in front of the Kool Beach Club. Beautiful beach, fine sand, warm water and sun. We paid $28 US dollars for our chaise lounge and umbrella. But all the fund were credited to our food and beverages. Our waiter, Israel (from our hometown of Chicago) took marvelous care of us. Water, drinks and good food were taken care of in fine fashion by Israel. Watching the water sports from this area was great. We could see across the water to Cozumel. We had a wonderful, glorious day on the beach in Playa Del Carmen. Tip: the chicken Alfredo and nachos with chicken was fabulous. We highly recommend this spot!!!

Eating pays for your loungers!. We arrived to Mamitas Beach and were immediately starving. We decided to eat at the closest place and Kool Beach Club was just that. We each paid 250 pesos for club access, which seems steep at first, but when you consider what this gets you it soon became more than worth it. The 250 pesos is basically a tab that you have to spend at the club, on anything you want. We ate lunch here, rented 4 loungers and had drinks throughout the day. We had access to their bathrooms, showers and changing rooms, as well as free wifi all day. By the end of the day when it came to settling what we owed above the 1000 pesos we paid between us, it was barely anything! It was almost like buying lunch, then getting free loungers, wifi and changing room access for the rest of the day. Perfect! The beach itself was really nice, but suuuuuuper busy. Easily the busiest beach of any we went to and I was happy we weren't staying in such a busy area when we went to Mayan Riviera. Nothing particularly outstanding about the beach, it's more of a party vibe if that is your thing, but for us not so much.

A memorable day. Had a very pleasant day at Kool Club on Playa del Carmen beach. Pay for your beach chair and umbrella and use the payment against food and drink. A win win for the individual and club. Service very efficient. Food not too bad. You have use of pool, showers and restrooms. We had a great day.

Juan Ortega . Very nice club we will be back soon. The massages we had were outstanding by Vicky and Clara they both were very friendly and helpful. The service was great at the bar with Erick being an outstanding bartender

Good service, excellent staff. Waiters, guards and hosts are efficient, kind and very accommodating.Food is good and well presented.Flavored mojitos -maracuya especially- are a must.But contamination is a big issue in beaches so you've got to consider using washable plastic cups instead of disposable ones; and also consider not using straws unless customer specifically asks for them... you could advertise yourselves as an ecological conscious club.

sr. I am very satisfied with my kool experiemcia at the club. a good experience ... emphasize the great attention, palapa where do the massage was the best !!!! high quality service , very profecional and pleasant, in a quiet and relaxing atmosphere , I had the opportunity to be cared for by Mary Tere , who kindly gave me the service as his companions were busy! I am so grateful and pleased we highly recommend this service! I am very happy with the results , I did not expect to experience ! Mary Tere thanks for this great experience. thanks Kool for your awesome team!

okay. it was fun for the day but we were there for two weeks. 500 pesos for two beach chairs, an umbrella and that in credit to order food or drink. perfect! my boyfriend doesn't drink and the selection of non-alcoholic beverages is pretty boring so he brought in his non-alcoholic beer. they told us it was fine. yet every day it was a huge issue. we had to fight over and over and over and have the conversation with numerous people on a daily basis about it. why do they care? they don't serve it and we were still consuming 500+ - they didn't respect that he doesn't drink and they even suggested he did at one point. We didn't go back after day 4 of this. we went to mamitas instead. they were respectful and didn't bother us.

Nice and Great Beach! . Ok so if you're with people willing to pay $50 each in alcohol and drinks, you can get the VIP chairs. The funny thing is the chairs go empty all day because nodody does, and they still place people behind empty chairs. That's some Mexican craziness. Some people paying $20-$30 per chair are places way in back away from the beach?  My husband and I went VIP to be right in front of the beach. If Mamitas (which I like better) is full, you can pony up and come here to get some expensive front row beach loungers. The Loungers are very comfortable.  The service was pretty good. They do not have any hot sauce though. I asked for some and they kept telling me that have it, and just not bringing it and brushing me off. The food here is good!!  If you're looking for a more empty place all to yourself, for the most part, this is it. Prices are so high with food and drink minimums that you can really hear the crickets chirping in the background.  Not sure what warrants the price, considering the restrooms are yucky, especially compared to the simply immaculate ones next door at Mamitas. Simple math, they need to lower their costs by at least $10 per chair to bring in more business. Prices are anything but KOOL.  We had a lovely day here. I would go back again. They just do need to change some minor things and, for god sakes Update the scary bathrooms. I had to pee in the ocean because I wouldn't step foot in there!

Kool Beach Lunch. Grilled fish tacos and the fajitas were very good. The coconut and strawberry margaritas were very good and the maracuya (passion fruit) mojito was very good. We did not enjoy the fried fish tacos or the fired shrimp tacos as it was mostly fried dough and small amount of fish/shrimp. Guacamole was excellent. Our waiter, Israel was excellent, fun and accommodating. It was a great lunch place on the beach.

Good service and drinks!. Came for a beach day and paid about $600 pesos - credited toward food/beverage purchase - for lounge chairs and umbrella by the pool. The music was so loud there (the pool deck is where the music emanates from) that we relocated to an area nearer the restaurant. Be prepared to pay a deposit of $300 pesos for two large beach towels. The good: the lunch service was efficient and good. Excellent chips served immediately and they made a tasty if smallish margarita on the rocks. The ceviche seemed a little on the tough side but the fish tacos were really delicious. Drink service on the lounges was also very quick and responsive. The not so good: the beach is beautiful but as you enter the water the bottom was so uneven we exited and went further down the beach in front of Mamitas and entered the water there where it seemed a tad more stable under foot. The truly ugly: blasting techno-music all afternoon!! Really awful techno club crap! Ok, so I'm not a fan of that genre but it was almost intolerable. The $600 pesos - about $29 US - was credited towards our food and drinks and they have a nice set up there but the music just didn't cut it for us.

Great Customer Service. The food and drinks were awesome! Really enjoyed lounging here during the day. We enjoyed the chicken wings, nachos, and shrimp. Cocktails were good but we added a little more of our own alcohol to them!

Great ambience, awesome drinks and amazing shrimp tacos. Very fun place with comfortable sunbeds at the beach and a dj at the pool area. Recommend the maracuya mojito and the shrimp tacos. Service is good and the place is lots of fun! The beach is nice and clean too. Very trendy. Must visit!
Great Beach, great staff. This place is exactly what you picture when you think of Playa. The beach is amazing and the staff is helpful and attentive.

Fantastic beach club!. We visited here and received the best service of all of our holiday...The beach and sea is beautiful and the atmosphere is a great balance of relaxation and activities. We would highly recommend!!!

Sun, Service, Sexy, Savory and Kool!!. Kool Beach Club has it all, a great beach, wonderful service, tasty food and comfy beach chairs. The cost varies depending on how close your chair is to the ocean. I usually opt for row 2 or 3, which costs 475 pesos each or 950 in total. The cost is used as a credit against the food and drinks you order. At the end of the day, if you order moderately, it's usually a wash, that is you just about break even. The food is delicious and the drinks cold. I especially enjoy the mango margaritas....very yummy! The service is phenomenal, a special shoutout to Ricardo Alvarez, who always had a smile, and took great care of us. Great people watching too!! Massages and a pool are also available. Kool Beach Club is our favorite place on Mamitas Beach.

Massage on the beach. I had the most incredible massage at Kool Beach club this past week. Vicky, the masseuse, was incredibly professional and gave me two wonderful massages during my stay. She is very talented, knowledgeable and kind. I highly recommend her. If you are in Playa go to Kool Beach Club and get a massage from Vicky by the beach. She is fantastic!!!

Great Beach Club!. We were here in a Tuesday so the beach was not packed. Staff was on point, food and beer were good and served fast. My boyfriend and I had massages in the outdoor spa area and they were very nice! Felt save and secure as the security was always keeping an eye out. Beach was blue and pretty and the sandy beach was all we wanted to see in Mexico so we were pleased and will go back again next time we are in Playa.

Great place and very Kool. This side of the beach, the Playa Mamita area, is very popular and on weekends it's very crowdy. So, if you wanna enjoy the beach, meet people and still keep your belonging on a safe place, Kool Beach Club is a gret place to go. They offer you a range of services based on the price you decide to pay (from $100mxn to $500mxn per person) but what is the best of the site is their professional and warm service. Food is great too.

Great days at the Beach with excellent service!. We visited KOOL Beach Club on our recent stay in Playa del Carmen on several different days. We enjoyed both a bed for our family of five, as well as the lounge chairs. We had cold drinks, fresh ice, and all the food that we wanted all while enjoying the beautiful view, clean beach, warm, but not hot sand. Our server on all but one day, was Michael. The one day that we sat in a different section we were much less happy with the service. The staff was friendly, the bathrooms clean, and very accessible from the beach. The best part was that all of our fees for the use of the chairs, umbrellas, and facilities went towards a credit for our food and beverage. There was essentially no charge for the chairs, etc. as you used it for food etc. We were not able to use all the credit at the club, so we were able to use it towards our dinner at one of their five restaurants on 5th Avenue. What a great value!! We can't wait to come back again, and see our favorite waiter, Michael!

They used to be Kool... but they lost all of it!. This beach club, like the rest nearby, have all expanded their footprints on the beach taking away from what the locals own and adding to the destruction of the beach. It used to be a very nice place to stop for a drink overlooking the water or spending the day on the beach. Packed in like sardines and not very relaxing anymore.

Excellent service. Nice facilities . Good place to spend the day if you don't have access to a beach club through your hotel. Very nice sun beds, pool and restaurant. Very courteous and helpful staff. My only issue :,they automatically added a 15% tip (which I would have given anyway)

Amazing - Again!. We married here last June. Upon our return trip to MX last week, we decided to stay in Cozumel. But the highlight of our trip was the day we returned to visit Kool Beach Club. The management and staff took SUCH great care of us. Our servers Jesus and Blanca with the assistance of Angel were nothing short of INCREDIBLE! Not pushy, but right there should be need anything!Jesus was so appreciative of us when we left. The manager went above and beyond to accommodate us, just like the staff did when we married. The chef is amazing and again, delivered an incredible meal. The drinks came quick and you actually got a nice buzz, unlike some other places. The DJ is always spinning music at the right noise level. The massage I received was the best massage I have had in a very long time! I will update the review once I find out her name! Wow! And what a bargain price. I could never get a massage like that in the USA for 50-55 dollars! I would have gotten more, but family was waiting on me !They are trained massage therapists and the quality was top notch! I just can't say enough!If you are in Playa and want to get away from the hustle and bustle come here! The beach is amazing and you will be pampered!

Great Beach Club. Spent a day at this Beach Club in Playa del Carmen. Pay for a beach chair - price dependent on where you want to be. Full use of facilities on premise for the day - pool - bar - food. The price you pay is then deducted from food / drink you order - ie: we paid $25.00 per chair and all the food and drinks we had are deducted until you reach $0.00 overage pay at end of day. Overall we were very happy with our choice. VERY attentive wait staff - good food and drinks - no pressure but they were always there to help and get you anything you wanted

Relaxing! . We visited this beach club on a few days. What we enjoyed was the service and atmosphere. At first it may sound expensive however, when you take into account that your drinks and food come off of your chair rental, it's actually a reasonable day at a serviced beach. I think it's important to mention that you need to go to the reception to book your chairs as you may find that the spots you think are open are already booked by someone else. Also you can only use the facilities if you have an arm band as proof of payment.

Worth the money. My wife and I were staying at an apartment in Playa, so we didn't have access to the acres of reclining chairs at the resorts. Even though 550 pesos/per person seemed a bit steep, when we learned that money could be "earned back" through drink orders and (good quality) food, it turned out to be a good deal. The day we were there, it was too windy to put up the umbrellas (and the blowing sand had us wondering if we'd made the right choice) but by afternoon, the winds dropped a bit and our server set up our umbrella, a good thing because the clouds disappeared and we would have fried in the sun. We were in the second row and it was great for people-watching too.

Awesome Beach Club - the place to go in Playa. Kool Beach Club was absolutely one of the highlights of our time in Playa; we spent 4 days there in one week. It's convenient, fun, very reasonably-priced, and the staff is fantastic. From the time we arrived, everyone made us so welcome, and they helped us with everything we needed. It is literally almost impossible to even try to put up your own beach umbrella without one of them trying to help you. There are several other options on the beach, but Kool has the best location, music, most comfortable chairs, and the food is awesome. A few *pro tips:-when you arrive, ask to be in Blanca's section (one of the servers). She is unbelievably awesome - so nice and accommodating, we literally hugged her goodbye when we departed on our last day. Ricardo (another server) is also super nice and attentive -try to arrive early if possible (before 10:30am), but this isn't totally necessary. However, getting there early will allow you to get the best chairs on the beach (we were in town during Semana Santa, so the whole town was especially crowded)-food and drink minimum - when you arrive at the club, you pay an amount that goes fully toward your food and drink minimum - so if you're going to eat/drink the amount that you prepay for, you essentially get the chairs for free - it's an awesome deal-food - order a shrimp and steak quesadilla (not on the menu), get a side of guacamole, pico de gallo, french fries, and habandero (olive oil with roasted habenero peppers). Put all of this together in the quesadilla, and enjoy one of the best bites of food in toda la planeta-drinks - the strawberry minto mojito was one of our favorites

Great place. Alejandrina was excellent, service was great! All staff were pleasant and friendly. Food great, drinks were cold. Speedy service, clean washroom facilities with access to pool and showers.

Great beach. The concept of this beach club is great you purchase a chair at the desk which is very well ran you then get what you spend on the chairs towards a drink/food purchase. You only settle your bill when leavingThe staff are amazingly attentive they go out of your way to help with anything they canThey have an awesom lunch menu they serve breakfast but we did not try itThey have a great drink menu with bottle service also There is a pool if you do not like the ocean

Way better than the Blue Parrot. My husband and I were at The Blue Parrot for 2 days in a row. We were not impressed so we decided to give Kool a try. Mind you both beach clubs are a bit expensive, but Kool has a lot more to offer for the price. The drinks are bigger and stronger, the food is better, the pool is bigger and much cleaner, and the whole place has a really fun atmosphere.

Loved it, but expensive. At our hotel you could not play in the sand. We were with 2 11 year olds who wanted that so we tried several beach clubs around Playa. The kids could play in the sand or swim in the pool at Kool. The service was excellent! You did have to pay for your chair so the closer you were to the beach the more expensive it was. We had 2 kids with us so we were on the first row. The money we used to reserve our chairs was used towards food and drinks! They also had a dj which was fun!

Fine I guess . This place is fine for what it is. It's nice to have a chair and service at the beach of course, with access to a small pool (4 feet deep, maybe 8 feet wide and 16 feetLong). However we couldn't use umbrellas because of the wind, yet we could see the resort next to us using winds. There Was no wind and people kept complaining to the staff. Staff said the umbrellas did not have adequate anchors so whatever. Food is just okay as are the drinks. Obviously a tourist trap so will be paying more for food and drinks Than you would at other nearby local restaurants. Did not like being hassled for a 15% tip. Either add the tip automatically or let people tip as they pleased. I also only tipped on the amount above the chair fee (accidental) and he changed my tip to cover the total without explaining it and with already sliding my card.

This place is fantastic!!! . I HIGHLY recommend this spot for a perfectly relaxing day at the beach. I took a chance and booked a hotel off the beaten path, so we needed a spot to come each day. The service by Wendy, Mijangos was absolutely spectacular and a special shout out to Victor for being the kindest, most hard working soul on the beach. The drinks were strong and cold, food superb and the view and beach are second to none. I will be back here every time I come to Playa Del Carmen. Thank you for having us!!!

Totally Pampered at Kool Beach Club. We had access to the Kool Beach Club as part of our vacation package . We have never been so spoiled! Its in a beautiful location and the service was excellent (thanks to Victor and others)

Excellent time at Kool Beach Club. I have to say that myself and my Two travelling partners, can only give the Kool Beach Club, an excellent review....we were Premium All-Inclusive members staying at the El Tukan, and Kool Beach Club is part of the All-Inclusive.(Alcoholic and Non-Alcoholic Beverages ONLY) If you wish to eat then you must pay for this, but that really wasn't a major concern for us. Quick note, the only Beer that we were allowed was, Corona Light. Again if you want any other beer you must pay for it. The seating for us because its part of the hotel are situated in the last 3 to 4 rows. All have umbrellas, and the lounge chairs are what you would find at any other resort....if you want to sit on the cushioned chairs, or Beds, you do need to pay extra. You will receive an assigned seat...no need to run and find a chair early in the morning... Service......there are 2 people there that we were very happy with....A great big thanks goes out too, Victor, and Blanca. they made our stay at the Kool Beach Club very memorable. I say this you treat them right, $$, you get the service, and the smile.To the Kool Beach Management, Victor had told me he had only started a fews before, do not loose him, him like Bianca, are servers, that deserve to be you #1 go to people......Thank you for a wonderful time, and WE WILL see you again......

Very enjoyable!!. Traveled with three children ranging from 11-17. We all enjoyed our time at Kool. The beach was gorgeous, the pool wasn't crowded, the food and drinks were tasty and the bathrooms were clean (big plus). Our runner on the first day, Israel, was excellent! He checked on us often and was very quick to bring whatever we needed and took a little time to get to know us making a friendly connection. We went a second time and choose the same seating area. Israel recognised us and greeted us but was working a different section so brought us over to introduce us to our new runner. He was just okay, communication was a little more difficult and he wasn't as attentive. Still a good experiences overall. Will def spend beach time at Kool on our next visit to Playa del Carmen

Best of both worlds. We didn't want to stay at an all-inclusive so stayed at a nice hotel in town. Not on the beach but modern and reasonable. Of course you go to Playa for the beach and sun so Kool Beach Club to the rescue. You prepay a certain amount, guaranteeing them business, and they give you a nice spot on the beach with chairs and umbrella and great service. Clean bathrooms too. There's also a pool. Wait staff very friendly and helpful. Honest too. I left my snorkeling gear at my chair and didn't realize until the next day. Went back and they had it put aside for me. Very impressed.

Kool Beach Club with Family. Fun and worth the cost. We went with our family mainly so we could have bathrooms to use. The charge you for the bed but you get that in food and beverage credit...so really it's free. Spent the day there and had a blast.

Inexpensive pampering for the whole family!. If you're not at a resort and are looking for a beautiful, clean, inexpensive place to spend the day, this is it! Pay to rent chairs and that money becomes your credit for food and drink for the day. You get a beautiful beach, pool, chairs, umbrella, clean bathrooms and a server dedicated to you all day. We ate and drank as much as we wanted and, at the end of the day, the bill worked out to approximately $100US. For a family of 4, that was only $25 a person for a whole day of pampering and entertainment. We kept going back for more! The staff were super friendly and we highly recommend it!!
Ripp Off. 5 of us went for the day service slow ,food expensive and not very good, lots of staff but clueless and the beach there not real good complete waste of money!!!!

Our favorite beach in Playa!. If your idea of a great day is laying on comfortable lounge chairs while people bring you drinks and food, this is the place for you. At first the cost of the chairs may seem expensive, but the it is a credit toward food and drink. We were able to drink all day and have snacks and lunch for the cost of front row chairs. Ricardo took such great care of us that we made sure we were in his section each day.

Terrible service and a rip off. We went to kool beach club today and paid 500 pesos for two chairs (the cheapest chairs on the beach) you are able to use this money as a credit which certainly does not get you far as the menu is so overpriced. Chairs are so close together you can't even walk between them! The chairs also are unable to lay flat and they are constantly clicking out throughout the day making your back fall down.Had to call someone over EVERY single time you wanted to look at a menu, let alone order a drink or food. And then they tell you that the bill doesn't include a tip and expect you to give 15%, after standing in groups chatting all day.100% would not recommend. Would rather put a towel on the sand and lay down further without the noise and cheaper food and drinks.

excellent getaway. excellent getaway and beach club. Service is top notch, and the system of seating and beach beds is truly innovative. it is not cheap but worth every dime. Music plays all day long and facilities are clean. Food better than most beach clubs.
Kool Beach should called take your money beach. overcharged for food,drink, and beach chair. do not be sucked in like I was. 115 pesos for a small bottle of water...please.

More laid back than Mamitas next door. Price varies by where you sit. The more expensive chairs are much more comfortable than the cheaper plastic ones. We went twice, service was good first time, slower on the second visit. The music was Ok for us - we are in our 60's and don't like the thumping music like they have at Mamitas.

Great Beach and Food. The price was great and you pre-paid for your food and drink for a beach lounger. The staff was very attentive. The food and drinks were very good. The food and drinks were reasonably priced and you received quite a bit for your money. I recommend tipping at the end of the day. We tipped through out the day to the servers and at the end of the day when we received the bill the server wanted a tip and wouldn't leave until we gave him one even though we tipped through out the day. Then he complained that the tip we gave him was too small. This kind put a bad impression of the place after a really wonderful day.
Beach bumming. Got a beach bed for the afternoon and the money we used to rent the bed is used as credit towards food and drink. was nice to split with friends and hang out

Great beach spot. We have visited Playa several times and we enjoy hitting the beach at Kools. They have varied accommodation for chilling on the beach. (Rates change depending on what's going on, but are reasonable) when you pay for your lounge chair, large beach bed or cabana you have a credit to purchase food and drinks (so you are really creating a "credit" to ensure you order food from them.) The food is good and at a reasonable tourists rate. They have upbeat music playing via DJ and a pool if you'd rather not play in the ocean. Ulin Mescro, Blanca and Erik were my favors servers! They were kind, attentive and helped me with my Spanish! You can also make reservations the average cost for a chair was about $15 US, not bad for a day at the beach with maybe 1 drink and lunch!

Spent two weeks at Kool . We loved our time in Playa mainly because of our days at Kool!! The beach club was fantastic....every staff member had a smile, the food was consistently great and we couldn't have asked for a better time. Music was good too...never blasting loud so you can relax. Special thanks to Miguel, Norma, Rosa and Marvin who took care of us....we can't wait to get back and see them all next time we return. Really great club...best we've been to in Playa....worth every peso.

Too crowded and expensive. We have visited the beach club for a day and felt very disappointed. The Playa del Carmen beach was overcrowded, dirty and smelly, renting the sun beds was min.$300 to 600, and they were stacked so close to each other that you nearly shared it with your neighbour. Unfortunately, it's not worth the money.

AWESOME. During our month stay from Dec 10, 2015-Jan 12, 2016 at the Aldea Thai we went to Kool Beach Club many times together with out two children, we had the same server every time we went, Ricardo was awesome and the beach club was a great place, food and drinks and service was all wonderful. WE would go back on our next trip!!!

It's not cool, at all. We were "lucky" to find a table, found it ourselves, at the entrance there was nobody to help us out, the beach was packed, it was like the Mexico City subway at 8 AM in a monday morning. We called at least three waiters for service, no one payed attention. We had to go to the bar ourselves to ask for our drinks, after begging for attention, we finally got our drinks, very expensive by the way. A pretentious, overrated place. Definitely, NOT recommended.

Very nice club to enjoy the beach while downtown. Beaches downtown Playa are not that nice, but we stayed twice at this full service club and it was a great way to spend the day relaxing. I like the concept (what you pay for the chair is a credit for food and drinks). The service was slow though, especially on Xmas day when it was crowded, and sometimes the large team of waiters seems completely disorganized. But, hey, it's ok if you are there to spend the day. Food was good enough.
Great way to spend the afternoon . A busy, yet relaxing beach club in PDC. Wait staff was on top of it...although actual food and drink delivery was a little slow. Delicious fajitas and pina coladas!

Hit and Miss. We stayed in the VIP area in the first row of chaise lounges near the middle. Paid around 650 pesos for each reserved chair for the day. All food and beverages were additional cost. Once you pay, they are your seats for the day.Pluses: Very popular area with a nice stretch of sandy beach, not rocky or covered in seaweed.If you love to people watch, the front rows are the place to be. The pool area near the rear appears to be for more of the party crowd and is somewhat louder.Security does a good job of making sure that the public does not bother anyone in the marked off area.Lounges are comfortable and towels were provided. This place is very popular with people from Latin America, and other areas of Mexico. Being from the US, we really enjoy being in the minority and immersed in the local culture. It definitely helps to know how to speak some Spanish here.Minuses:Service can be excruciatingly slow. Waited for over an hour and a half from ordering lunch till the food was delivered. Although, it was very busy at the time. Each individual staff member seemed to have too big an area to cover. Sometimes they would ask if you needed anything a few times in a half hour, then wouldn't ask for an hour or more. They were all very friendly. It would be more efficient if they had some kind of table flag to let them know that you needed something or had a tablet to order food and beverages with.The food was ok. Nothing of the quality that the numerous restaurants in Playa serve. It appeared that several of our meals had sat under heat lamps for quite awhile.Some things are good, others are poor. Would try again just to see if the service would improve over our first visit.

Excellent full service beach club. I highly recommend this beach club. We spent there beautiful days here. Main waiter was Ricardo. He's worth asking for. He is friendly and very attentive. For those not familiar with the concept, read on. You pre-pay the entire day based on level of beach chairs. We chose mid level which was three paced lounge chairs with umbrellas. Came to just under hundred dollars US. OK to use credit card. The rest of the morning and afternoon you work against the credit you have. So for 2-3 drinks per person plus a fresh lunch of seafood you basically break even. Pay a tip and walk away. Comes to $30-40 US per person. Beach is clean and safe. Crowd of trendy middle to upper class Mexicans. Some Americans, Canadians and Europeans. Great concept and atmosphere. Last day my wife added an hour massage for about $30 US. Say hi to Ricardo from us.

Beach Visit . VIP Beach Club has comfy beach chairs with cushions and pillows, umbrella, towels, waiters, food and beverages. The cost of VIP area is $550 pesos per person and that money is put towards food and drinks. Once you exceed that $550 you start a tab.

The best services I ever had.. The place is very nice and confortable. Ricardo, Alejandro and Alejandra gave us a really good services. We visited the club two times and both times had an excellent time.
very nice place. staff is very friendly and attentive, food is good, infrastructure is good... don't think to far but go and check it out!

The best most comfortable beach club in playa del carmen. Love it. Padded beach chairs, big umbrella, good price, great beach location, lots of fun in the sun...We had Ricardo as our server both times we visited and he was excellent and very attentive and respectable. Hope we get him again next year. Breakfast and lunch were amazing. Recommend the Cheeseburger and fries for lunch and the spinach omlette for breakfast. Got a package for 550 pesos from our hotel and we used every bit of it. Got there around 0900 and stayed till 1700..Great price, Great food, Great fun

disappointed. I usually don't rate anything as "disappointing" but ... Let me say first: the pool is nice, the music is nice (even if this is not the place for people looking for a calm afternoon, music gets loud ...), food was nice too and the prices are good! unfortunately I had a really rude waiter, I changed sunbed and a colleague told me it was ok, but then they got confused what certainly was not my fault and tried to make me change back to my first sunbed. I didn't want to - and after that the waiter started to ignore me. When I wanted to order I had to tell someone else and, that was the worst thing: I asked for the final bill, gave him the money and he was telling me angrily: I want my tip. Is that possible?! I was so shocked that I gave him my coins, he took them without looking at me and went straight away without saying thanks or goodbye. it was my layt day in playa and I am kind of sad I spent it in this place :(

nice place. they charge you to use the structure, wifi, beach chairs ,towel (you have to leave a deposite to get one, and they give it back when you return), the money you pay will be for you to consume drinks, and food. Nice place to go

Great and friendly service. I was here today (November 18/15) and had a great time and found the service and food to be really really good. I never had been to a beach club before so didn't know what to expect. I got a great chair on the beach. They do not rip you off and the cost is totally worth it. I was sitting with some people that have tried several beach clubs and they said this was the best one. They served us very well without even knowing how we would tip. We tipped well because the staff deserved it and all in all the price before the tip was very reasonable. I'm definitely not bothering with the other beach clubs.

Beautiful beach club with great service!. The beach was beautiful! Service was great, I did not have to wait very long for my food or drinks. The prices were pretty decent, there's great variety if you're looking for an inexpensive chair or a cushy bed. I did not feel pressured to tip a certain amount. The food was pretty tasty, their mixed drinks were pretty good too (I especially enjoyed the kiwi mojitos!). All around a great experience.

It's ok... If you have no agreement with a hotel you need to pay. The more close to the sea, the more bucks you will need to expend to get a spot so that's a big dissapointment. However the service of Michael, Ana, Marvin and the F&Beverage manager Sergi makes the difference they make their best for you to enjoy the beach, they also have security to take care of you and no one without a bracelet can come intonthe area, that keeps disturbing vendors to come and bother you to sell you something.You can also enjoy the pool and restaurant.It's facilities are always clean and the quality of food and beverage it's OK.

Perfect first day in Playa. After walking the length and breadth of the coastal line of Playa I decided on Kool club. There are a few different tiers of seating/bedding, I went for the middle which was 350pesos and equidistant from the pool and the beach.My Spanish not being the greatest I thought it was all you could eat and drink (haha) but it's only up to the amount of tier you are in. So within my 350 pesos I got a couple of frozen margaritas and a really amazing salmon and chips lunch. I did end up paying for a few extra drinks but I didn't mind because it was in an amazing location, the sea was clearer than anywhere else, it had a cold pool which was IDEAL after trapsing about getting hot and sweaty! I had a fab day!

Beautiful place but server demand tips 15/20 %. I really loved this place the beach was beautiful clear and clean water and Kool beach bar was equally well done. Beautiful setting comfy chairs but super expensive at $72usd for two chairs and an umbrella. The place is beautiful and very clean. With the price of the chairs $72usd they give you a food and drink credit. We had chicken fraijas and Nachos and cocktails with the credit from the chairs. The food was really Good better than inside our Resort (occidental Grand) The servers seemed nice but at the time of leaving we left a generous tip when we were told it wasn't enough and she wanted more and we had to give her the recommend tip which she had written and stamped on the Bill. Needless to say I didn't like that part at all but we gave in and paid her anyway the extra money.The next day we returned and got a Guy server he was kinda rude never came around to offer us food or drinks until the end of the day when he was looking for his TIP..I LOVE THIS PLACE and I would return the service could be better but I would recommend highly just watch the bill its very expensive and the server's demand big tips..

Kool beach club. This my second time here, and it's a very affordable beach club. We bought the 350 pesos beach chairs, which gave us the same amount to consume from their menu! Delicious fajitas for sure. Service is slow that did not change, but beside that I love to come here.

Good Beach Club. Kool beach club has good drinks, good food, nice facilities-- pool, bathrooms, bar-- and good service. The beach chair rental can be expensive for the prime chairs, but you can usually negotiate bar/food credit to offset that.

Scamming staff. Nice beach but that's about it. The staff added a "tax" to the end of our bill. This is on top of the tip they requested. The menu clearly states all prices are inclusive of tax and the ugly old woman at the bar added a hand written tax. We only realised after we left. So dodgy. Bad service. Go elsewhere

Nice Beach Club although expensive. This beach club is at the north end of the beach and is very large. Nice loungers, facilities and also had a pool. It's a large beach club, energetic music and three levels of lounger pricing. We chose to be by the pool for which was in my opinion the nicer area for 150 pesos per lounger. Sitting at sand level, the second level was I believe 450 peso section was so far back that in some cases you don't even see the water while on the lounger. The VIP section which is at the front is yes, close to the water, but it's also just behind the public beach and on a busy day, this area is crowded with people who have brought their own chairs and umbrellas. The food and drinks were okay. My daughters loved the pool and people watching. Our service was very good. We did agree that it was the most expensive compared to the other beach clubs we tried during our trip and for the extra money wasn't worth it. The bill was much higher because they added 16% tax and then we were told tip was not yet included. Interesting, no other bill we saw during our trip added tax on top. Still glad we came to try this beach club

Couple. Me and my partner enjoyed our stay whilst at the Kool beach club. We were warmly welcomed by the bartender Eduardo/Eddy; who explained to us how the process worked etc. To which we took a liking to how Eduardo was fluent in his ability to speak in English so fluently. We returned and used the beach club the following day.Where we were served excellently by Carlos, Jesus and Micheal on the following days that we returned! The place was always nice and clean and people seemed to be working really hard. We enjoyed having lunch on the balcony which gave us a break from lying down. Whilst on the beach we carried out various activities i.e jet skiing, banana boating and all sorts to which we enjoyed.The DJ also played some really relaxing and up beat music to which helped the vibe of the whole place. I must also add that the workers did such a good job with tackling the sea weed problem, as this could've been a huge put off. We also really appreciated how friendly Ubaldo despite not ever being our server; he asked how we were to which we appreciated. You can tell the Kool Beach Club us trying to maintain an exclusive service to which I'm sure customers like myself appreciate. N.B: The staff work very hard and I'd like to think managers reinforce this and make staff feel valued.

Great beachside bar. I wandered in after walking the beach for awhile. Enjoyed some beer while catching the scenery (with both the beach and the people - there's plenty to look at). Rosa Linda was very friendly and I enjoyed the bartenders Eduardo (who speaks excellent english) and Johnny. David was nice too (David and Rosa Linda both worked the beach chair areas but still were nice enough to stop and talk to me at the bar). Great atmosphere for just hanging out and enjoying an afternoon beer (I believe they close after the sun goes down). They have beach lounge chairs for rent... so you can stay all day if you want.

What a week!!!. My Wife and I spent 8 days in Playa Del Carmen. 6 of those days were spent on the beach at Kool Beach Club. From day one the crews at the beach were amazing. Wilber and his team made us feel welcome and we could not have been treated better. We enjoy our Cerveza's on the beach and Wilber did everything he could to keep them on ice nonstop. Lunch was great every day from just the fruit to the quesadilla's. For 6 days on the beach we did not want for anything. Through that whole time Wilber and the team made sure we were happy and had everything we needed. We took a catamaran ride and Joshua the Captain was friendly, funny and knowledgeable. It was a great hour spent. Needless to say we will be back next year in April and Kool Beach will be our spot.

WILBER IS LIFE. My girlfriend and I stumbled on this place by accident. We were staying off the main strip and obviously took advantage of Kools great prices while we were at the beach. This place makes you feel like a rock star. The service is amazing- I give them so much credit for walking around when the UV index is 10. They are super quick and love just hanging out with you. The DJ is awesome- makes you feel like you are in miami. I had a ton of mimosas, my girlfriend had the hurricane and said it was good. I ate the fish tacos they were pretty good, maybe a little too fried. My only complaint is that I couldn't take our server Wilber back to the states with me. He was so much fun!!!! And also I think their guacamole is packaged, which is a little annoying.

Lovely feel good vibe beach club . Day rent of sun beds are only 150 pesos a day which is cheap compared to some other places, beach is lush, nice sand clear water(when there isn't seaweed due to a storm) staff are not hovering over you all the time, they are attentive and very nice.

My WEDDING. Big Big Thank you to everyone at Kool esp Yuritza and Jesus the chef! You guys made Sarah Johnson and I wedding day very very special. Thank you guys for all your hard work and diligence and for just being there to make our day incredible! Thank you both so much. Jesus I can eat your cooking any day!! Wanted to eat more but had some much to do Thank you. Cannot wait to go back!!

Ok- nice facilities but pricey.... Overall a nice day, I wouldn't go back as it's quite expensive for what it is, but worth a visit if in PDC and your hotel doesn't have a beach....Positive points- really nice facilities- Cool, chilled out atmosphere- Clean beach- less seaweed than the rest of PDC- good beds- like!Negative points- Service took a long time- we just ordered beers, but it took a while - Waiter asking rather bluntly for a tip after less than average service!- food quality was much lower than other places in PDC for the price we were a little surprised how poor it was

get a spot, ask for Daniel. Here's the deal, people - when you travel to PDC (or any other country) expect things to be, you know, unlike they are where you come from. In the summer, PDC has some seaweed visitors from South America. Kool Beach Club does better than most about getting rid of it and making sure you're enjoying your stay (think I'm kidding, go on down the road and compare, you'll come right back). Great service from Daniel, who was very attentive and the prices are good. Great people watching and the real estate, you gotta pay for that so maybe it's a little higher than others - but you're on vacation. So if you're looking for probably the best beach club in PDC, go to Kool and ask for Daniel. Great pool, showers, lockers.

Horrible but nice location. Horrible service, and people want to scam the tourists you pay 100 dollars for a bed and they tell you that you hace that in credit for food and drinks and they don't pay attention to your order they take like 3 hours to bring your food, plus the waiters and waitresses don't have their work stuff as lighters or pens or their tablets... The dj is super lazy and maybe my spotify playlist was better than that, if you make me choice between kool and mamitas, absolutely mamitas.

Great beach club if you don't mind waiting...worth a visit!. Gorgeous beach club but staff are totally overworked running around in the sun, but all trying hard! It took us an hour to get food and 30 mins to get a beer. One member of staff, Carlos (in the red sunglasses) was exceptional, worked hard to check on us all day even though we had a different waiter (who we never saw), spoke perfect English and even refused a tip! If this guy is not a manager yet, he should be! Great customer service - this guy is 5 star hotel level.

Poor service. This Beach Club is located right on the beach in Playa del carmen. It has a nice layout but during the BPM festival the don't have much business. I went to meet some friends there but couldn't locate them. I asked the bartender to get the wifi code after ordering a drink and he gave me the code but it didn't work. Then another bartender said we can't give you the wifi code unless you buy a beach chair. Once I found my friends we ate lunch which was overpriced and not particularly good. I went to use their bathroom and a security gaurd wouldn't let me in until I went back to my waiter and had him escort me to proved I was a paying customer.
Beach party. Just a great place to spend a day. Jet ski snorkel swim in the pool and the ocean. Eat drink get a massage and enjoy the day. Music all day with dj

Nice but can be even better. Koolbeach is not the first place like a beach club for us so we have something to compare it to. And here are major + and - we have noted:+Good facilities, nice lounge chairs and umbrellas (it can be an issues if they of a poor quality, which was not the case here), quite tasteful dishes and good menu- Wifi. Alright, not all the beaches can boast that they have free wifi connection, but if you offer it, it MUST work. There's nothing worse than unfulfilled expectations. Sea itself. Don't know whether it is due to season, or water currents or whatever other reasons, but the sea was full of seaweeds. We had to overcome initial "ick" factor. And even after that was hard to swim.

The Ultimate VIP Beach Club Experience!. So I wanted to set the record straight on the beach clubs in Playa. Yes, they can be pricey, yes you're expected to tip afterwards, and YES it is worth every penny! From the moment we walked up and took a look around, we were greeted by Esther and Arturo who answered all our questions and gave us suggestions. We figured to only get a couple of days of good sun (it's the rainy season) so we went for the VIP experience. Yep, we bought a day bed right in front, on the beach, with pillows and towels all for around $120 for the ENTIRE day! We ate fresh ceviche, drank Bellinis, did shots, and partied like you should when you're in the Caribbean. It was fun, the service was SECOND TO NONE, and cannot say enough about Esther and Arturo taking care of us all day. I would go back in a heartbeat! You should too!

Decent but Expensive. We spent the morning at Kool Beach Club. The facilities were nice (showers, pool, restrooms, etc.) and the staff was attentive but overall I felt it was expensive vs. other facilities in the area. For the new to beach clubs, essentially you pay a price for a few lounge chairs and an umbrella and the price is returned to you as a credit for food / drinks. Makes sense depending on how much you will be spending.For our visit we opted for 2 lounge chairs on the second row so we could watch the kids play in the sand - 'deposit' was 900 pesos or $60. Throughout the AM we grabbed 2 sodas and 2 waters, then had lunch. Biggest problem I had with lunch was the food was mediocre at best. We had a caesar salad, Chef's sushi platter (terrible), chips and guac, and quesadillas. I had kept rough tabs on what we ordered and it was just shy of 900 pesos. When it was time to pay our waiter brought the bill and it was 1200 pesos and he not so politely reminded me that it didn't include tip. We ended up leaving with a final cost of ~1400 pesos or $90 USD.As a point of reference, the day before we hit a different beach club about 8 blocks south (don't know the name) and the same basic experience was about $30. Only difference was the facilities at kool were nicer but the beach at the other club was nicer, food was better and service was more down to earth. Depending on what you're looking for you may be better walking further down the beach.

Exactly what we were looking for!. The staff was fun and helpful. When they found out our Spanish was obviously terrible, they found us a waiter that could communicate with us. Aresteo was awesome. We made sure that he was going to be there for the duration of our trip. We were so happy with his help and friendliness that we made sure we were in his section. The wooden chairs are well worth the upgrade in price. Especially since you will probably drink/eat the amount required to sit in that particular section. They are comfortable with a nice padded chair and pillow. If we went to the beach... this was simply the best for us and our needs.We did not eat at Kool but did have plenty of cocktails. The cocktails were delicious and not watered down. We really enjoyed ourselves at Kool Beach Club!

Far Far better than mamitas. Really nice beach club at the Best beach in playa Del Cármen. You have a míninum consumption fee that you easily reach by having breakfast or lunch together with drinks at the beach service. Good food, best service in playa and you have great massages available. Look for Jesus Sanchez, awesome service! Thank you Jesus.
A perfect day!. It is not the company, but the staff that creates the feeling of quality...... Thank you Wilber and Ivan....Fenna & Pierre (The Netherlands)

Stay away!!!. This place is a rip off, I would expect this kind of place in Cancun but not in Playa. Service sucks and prices way to high, the beach isn't even that pretty. Paamul beach about 15 min south of Playa is much better. Here you can snorkel over reefs and have a reasonably priced beer.

Nothing cool about Kool. Visited twice in a row and what a disappointment. Both times we got VIP section and it's a disaster. The management and the staff made us feel like they are doing a favor to us- bad service, slow service or waiters nowhere to be found. They asked the deposit for towels. OMG!!! It's so low end... It's so not cool. It makes you feel like you are at a low end place... We asked for an umbrella, and waited for 2 hours. No umbrella in the blasting heat!!! And in VIP section!!! What's VIP without the service?!?! And at the end the waiter demanded 15% tip!!!! Who asks for tip?!?! And if I want I'm not tipping at all if I don't get any service! We had to chase our servers to get drinks, food, anything. We live in NY and we are very good tippers, but this place crossed the line! However, the managers are no better. They are arrogant and no helpful at all. Who calls the place Kool and doesn't give any cool vibes and just give you stress... Bad bad management!!!! That's all.
Great beat club!. I had a great time at kool, good vibes, nice crowd, great beach. The service was awesome. The swimming pool is super fresh!

Must go here!!. Visited week of April 1st. I read every review for this beach club and "the other" next door. I decided on this one. We rented chairs in the front row. Yes it was not cheap $40 per chair, but you get it back in food credits. Everything on the menu was excellent. Music not too loud and great place to people watch.There is also a pool there if you want to take a dip, and you can sit at tables and chairs in the shade if you don't want to eat at your beach chair.You pay a deposit for the beach towels, but you get it back when you turn them in. They smelled SOO GOOD!SERVICE: Shout out to Irwin. He was awsome! Can't beat the service.
