I gave the server a $20 when the day started and I told him I would take care of him at the end of the day if we were happy. We were VERY happy.We went there for the two days we were in Playa. I would go back. And I'm so glad I didn't go next door. Looked seedy and not my speed; music was way too loud.

Overpriced, slow service. Overpriced beach club. The waiter kept asking for more tip even though we already gave him a big tip and the service was not good at all. I found the bill higher than I expected and when I asked for a receipt to check the bill, he said he couldn't give it to me because there was some problem with the computer. The beach chairs are also way to close to each other and it takes ages before you finally can order something.

KOOL NOT SO COOL. Playa is now all about ripping off the tourists. As you can see from other Posts KOOL BEACH CLUB is a rip off. The chairs you sit on are priced according to the location to the beach. Like Broadway show tickets the closer to the beach the more expensive. The people in front of you on the beach sitting on towels or chairs they took from home don't pay a penny. Since the beaches in Mexico are not private. So you sit in VIP at KOOL and have the beach in front of you loaded with people drinking beer, tequila and eating food...HA HA its true..they are the smart ones.The 500 peso you pay you get a credit toward food or drink but this allows them to force you to eat and drink at that club. The tip is not included and the waiters try to rip you off on the tip. Better you go to Mamitas next door at least its not a RIP OFF.Years ago KOOL was great...it was owned an operated by nice sweet people.Now KOOL and Playa have become a rude grab the Gringo money and run type of tourist destination. Its a shame that this small fishing village slowly being destroyed.Its called Chinga los Gringos. Which means we love Americans.

Disappointing end to the day. Went to Kool Beach Club today as Mamitas Beach Club was closed for a festival. Arrived at about 1pm and was told to rent a chair for tanning is $450 pesos however we get $450 pesos of 'credit' to use at the bar/food throughout the day. We paid the money and ordered lunch and several bottles of water through out the day. Everything is overpriced however we didn't mind too much as its a great location. When it came time to leave we had about 150 pesos of credit left so the waiter bought us over a few bottles of water. He then proceeded to tell us that we needed to pay a tip $1800 pesos!!!!!!! When we have already spent $1800 pesos between 4 of us? I have never been somewhere and asked for a 100% tip. We ended up giving him 200 pesos and leaving. Disappointed as we felt it was so rude and really left us with a bad view of the place.My recommendation would be go to Mamitas as they charge $30 pesos for a chair for a day!

Relax at the beach rave.. This spot isn't bad. It was included in our hotel stay, so we imbibed for one afternoon. However, we hoped to relax at the beach and instead were treated to boom chi boom chi all afternoon. I asked the server if they might be able to turn it down, as no one seemed to be garnering much enjoyment out of. He said yes, but there was no discernible effect. I think it kept the pool fairly cleared out--I know I wasn't getting any closer to the speakers than necessary. Anyhow, if you want the annoying sound of the surf and birds drowned out by disco tech, this would be a wonderful beach to hang out.

Best Beach Club. Gotta find Wilbur n Michael and sit in their section. They are super fast with their service and are a lot of fun. Our group of 8 went to this club each day as the beach is well taken care of and having access to a pool is a great extra when the ocean is rough. Also, the beach offers great people watching which everyone truly loves to do on vacation. Ask for Wilbur!!!!

Nice beach and very good service. The beach is awesome and the overall ambience is really "kool" and relaxed. The music can be at times a little louder than necessary but you won't regret going there for a relaxed day on the beach. Ricardo has gone the extra mile to provide us a very good and flawless service.

If I was 20 years younger and on spring break .... I had requested a recommendation for a beach club appropriate for my family of four (two kids 9 and 7) and was sent here. Yes, they had a pool and yes, there were plenty of chairs and very friendly and attentive staff but the fact that they parked us far away from the beach so I couldn't see the kids from my chair and the super loud music cranked by the pool (and I am a fan of a good night at a club so I'm not complaining about the quality; only the unnecessary volume inappropriate for the kids), this wasn't really a kid friendly place. And don't get me started on the seaweed...

Best beach. We spent a few days here. You can choose to pay $70mex per bed cheapest or from $350mex per bed which you can use as credit on food and drink throughout the day. You don't have credit on the cheap beds. They seem a bit unforthcoming about explaining this to you. The waiters are good. The music gets very annoying after a while. Very loud and limited loop which means you hear the same stuff over again. The toilets are clean. The most beneficial thing is they clear the seaweed so you can swim in nice water. We tried other beaches where they didn't and it makes a real difference.

Great Service - Family Friendly - Loud Music. My husband and I ended up here when the service at the Mimatias beach club across the street was horrible. The service was awesome - we rented a bed poolside for 1960pesos but that went to food and beverage. You can rent smaller chairs as well if you do not want to spend as much money. The location was great, they were constantly cleaning up the pool deck.The menu was decent - lacked items for vegetarians/vegans but we were able to modify the sushi accordingly no problem. The service I cannot say enough how great it was.My only complaint - as a younger married couple with no kids - this place was very family friendly. But for families this placed rocked.Free wifi! You can rent towels with a deposit - which they will return to you for 20$ each. Or just bring your own.Bathroom are clean.Massage is available. You also have the choice of pool side or beach with is nice.If you wish to just have breakfast or lunch here - you can attend as well and not rent a chair or bed.

Great place to spend the day. I visited Playa del Carmen with my 15yr old daughter and her best friend. We came here every day of our vacation. The pool and beach together was perfect for relaxing and they loved eating on the beach. Wilbur was our server each time and he was the best, always making sure we had what we needed and making the girls happy. I also was able to sneak away and get a massage also right outside on the beach and that was great too.

Very nice clean beach club. Even though we had discount tickets for Mamitas next door we chose cool due to the more relaxed music selection and more relaxed vibe. Glad we did. visited 3 times during our 7 day stay in Playa.Staff here were fantastic, particularly Wences and the food and drink, although unsurprisingly a bit expensive, were top notch. From a people watching perspective Kool had it all. As well the swimming pool was and surrounds gave respite from the sand and endless Caribbiean seaweed. Toilets were spotless

Kool is right!!!!. We trudged there on a very busy day and found a "bed" for up to 5 people to drop our things and install ourselves. They told us they would have to remove everything at 3pm as they had an event on that part of the beach (OK by us), charged us 600 pesos (150 for each of the four of us) which was deductible from any food or drink we ordered. I was thankful for the shade, as I burn badly. I have never seen waiters RUNNING along the beach with orders. The place was completely full, so there WAS a bit of a wait for orders, but the fruit juices were fantastic, the beers were cold, the Kool salad was very good, the burger one of the better we've had. Delightful and enjoyable, with great service.

Good beach and great service.. This is right on the beach. You rent beach chairs and umbrellas, however they credit the price back to based on consumption of food and drinks. Thus, at the end of the day, your seat and umbrella ends up being free. You also get to use the pool, restrooms, showers, and there's a dj with great music. We liked it very much.

Visit Kool- seek out Wilber Diaz, Luis and Manuel! for great service!. We have been visiting Playa del Carmen for 9 years and spend our week at Kool Beach Club every year. It is under new management and they are working through some changes which I hope will improve. We had some hiccups this year but the service from the waiters and staff is great, they just need better management support. Wilber Diaz, Luis and Manuel are exceptional servers! You want to relax and enjoy a great day at the beach, seek out these guys.

No nightlife, overpriced. Thus place closes after 7 PM so after that you will not find any nightlife actions, only during the BPM you will find action here. So if you rethinking to go this to party at night stop. This is a beach club all of the action is during the day and the action is really on the beach, they over price and charge for the beds and put minimum amounts of consumptions on clients if not you are not able to stay on their beach.
Excellent service!. Manuel and Micheal were excellent servers. Always helpful and smiling!I will recommend this place for lunch, drinks and chair rentals.

Be careful of the SCAMS!!!. Just warning you; be ready to be scammed. We stopped by Kool's on Sunday, March 22 and inquired about renting two chairs. Ricardo (very nice) had a hard time with our English and went and got one of the other waiters. Ishmal told us it was 350 pesos each and I said how much in US and he said $30 near the beach and $20 further back. We selected two chairs further back and I gave him a $100 bill. Ishmal came back with a 500 peso note. I told him it wasn't enough and he said it was, so I pulled the calculator up on my phone and did the simple math, 100 - 40 = 60 times 14 (a bad exchange rate, but fair) which is 840 and I said, you still owe me 340 pesos. Ishmal said, no it's 25 dollars for the chairs, so I said, well then you still owe me 200 pesos. He said he had to talk to his manager. About 5 minutes later he came back with 200 more pesos.We had a nice afternoon in the sun and enjoyed some chips and guacamole along with a couple of beers. When we decided to leave, I called Ricardo over, (who had waited on us and did a very nice job) and I asked for our check. He said we still had a .50 cent credit on our tab. I laughed and asked him to bring us two more beers and he said, "You'll have to pay cash for them." and I said it wasn't a problem. He brought us our beers and when we were half way through, Ishmal came back and asked if we were ready to pay, I said, "Sure, what do I owe you?" and Ishmal said, $200 pesos, to cover the tax and tip. Gee, what a coincidence! Now, I had already been tipping Ricardo for the attentive service he gave to my wife and me. I have learned over the years, that nice tips, make for nice service. What I don't like, is to be ripped off or taken advantage of. If you go, just be aware, they will scam you. Best of luck.

Great place to spend the day!. Don't bother with buying online or trying to use an online coupon, they won't honor it. You have to ask for the wifi password and you have to pay a $20 deposit to get a towel. The waitstaff is VERY slow and hard to find and you MUST tip them, even if you are using up your free credits, they are sort of rude about that and insisted on a tip AND then insisted on MORE. I like to tip for good service and the service was poor. But the place itself is great - on the ocean, with a shower and a bathroom, and a pool, loads of comfy chairs, umbrellas, nice music that wasn't too loud and was easy to find. We had a lovely day!

Amazing food and beach club in Playa Del Carmen!. This was an incredible beach club we went to for my sisters birthday/bachelorette weekend. I couldn't get over how great the food was (the quesadillas, ceviche and guacomole are a must order!) and how excellent the staff was. Carlos the manager is so helpful and made our experience 5 star. Thanks!

Best Service Ever!. Beautiful! Stunning set-up for a large event. Estrella was an awesome server - he was quick to please and had a great sense of humor. March trip so the weather was oh so perfect! I want to go back just so I can visit Kool Beach Club again! Thanks for a wonderful evening!

VIP, Baby!. Hotel Aventura Mexicana offers its guests free or discounted day passes at three beach clubs near the hotel; Zenzi, Coco la Maya and Kool. Our first evening in PDC we happened upon Zenzi during a stroll down Avenida Quinta and I was not impressed; it was a very small crowded beach and there were boats docked at the beachfront. When we actually set out the following day for our first beach adventure, I asked the hotel guest services rep which he recommended explaining that I had already seen Zenzi. He said since the most important part of going to the beach was the view, so he emphatically recommended Kool. I was not averse to spending a few extra pesos since this was my birthday trip. When we arrived at Kool we were greeted by a very nice employee who showed us where to check in. The individual in charge is named Carlos and he proceeded to show me where the designated chairs were for guests of AM Hotel. Understandably, they were near the back of the beach about 10 rows from the beach front and the 'nicer chairs and beach views'. I explained to Carlos that this was my birthday, I wanted to go first class and that, in this case, money was not an object. He offered me two front row chairs with umbrella in the VIP section for $1100 pesos and explained we would receive that money back in food and beverage credit. BEST. DEAL. EVER! The front row chairs were awesome and very comfortable and the views and immediate ocean access were well worth the investment. Service was very good until they got until the thick of the lunch service and it was understandably a little slow. They take your food and drink orders on a tablet and then inform you if you have gone over your original credit. This was such a phenomenal experience that we went back two days later for the same experience. Treat yourself and go first class!

Kool is the coolest! Es lo mejor!. I go to Playa del Carmen twice a year and always go to Kool Beach Club because: it is the cleanest, the safest, has the most wonderful food and drinks, and the servers are really the most caring and helpful. Kool Beach Club started a plan system that most folks may not like, but if you think about how much food and drink you can have in one day, it's worth it. The second and third row seats are just as comfortable as the front row seats and cost 100 pesos less. Keep in mind that the servers DO NOT get to keep any of the money left over if you don't spend your total food and drink allowance, it goes back to the "house". Please tip them because they work very hard to take wonderful care of you. There's Alfonso, Manuel, Wences, Edwin, Ismael, Elias, Wilbur, and Estrella who make Kool Beach Club the wonderful place that it is. I'm heading back in two weeks and can't wait.

Bizarre and overpriced. We walked away. They wanted 500 pesos each for a bed right next to a buffet serving area that obscured the sea view. We went next door to Mamitas and got beds for 60 pesos each, then just paid for what we wanted as we went along.

Great location, food and service!. I've been to Kool Beach Club several times and am never disappointed! The location is great (Mamitas is the best beach in Playa del Carmen), and the food is delicious (order the shrimp cocktail, you won't regret it!). Service is excellent...we were waited on by Alfonso Rueda who was kind, honest (he cleared up a mistake I made leaving him a tip the size of the total bill...any other person would've kept the tip like that!), and funny while taking care of us and every other person he was tending to! I recommend the place highly!!

Watch out for the scams by bartenders at the beach. I was at Kool beach club a couple of times this past week. The beach is great and the water is amazing. If you choice to go here be very careful of the scams the bartenders play. Of course there's the usual ones like changing the exchange rate and adding more to your tab than you ordered but they have a few new ones like paying up to 550 pesos per person for a chair on the beach. They tell you that it's a credit but you'll have a hard time using it up they tell you there are no refunds. I guess after almost 50 USD in drinks they plan on you not remembering what you paid. Use caution.

Glad we found Kool. We had an excellent beach day here. After a bad experience at Zenzi (getting turned away despite having a reservation) we figured we'd try Kool since we knew it was very big and likely had lounge chairs available. So we hoped.Once we got there it was no problemo. There were choices in three categories and sure, it does cost some pesos (350 when we were there minimum) but you can then use that deposit towards your food and drink. And, the good news is the drinks are cold and the food quite tasty. It's perfect casual lunch dining of all the usual favorites. Our deposit more than covered plenty of food and drink for us and we were happy to pay it for the nice relaxing day.The facilities are great, everything is clean and we had an excellent waiter who appeared often enough and at the end made sure we got our full money's worth with our final order to cover our deposit nearly down to the peso.The wifi is free - just ask for a code. Sure, it's not fast but just fine for emails and looking something up quickly.This is a good stretch of beach to walk on as well since it's not narrow like a lot of Playa beaches. Next door is Mamitas but that wasn't our scene - it seems to be more of a mess and maybe we're just too old for that scene. Next time I'd probably pay a little extra and upgrade to the wooden chairs. They seem to have nice cushions and are more comfortable so I figure I'd pay a bit more but just have another drink or two and cover the difference plus be more comfortable.You can also go here without towels - they will "rent" you clean towels for a deposit that you get back at the end. Seems fair enough to me. Next Playa trip in a couple months this will be our beach destination once again.

4 stars due to location and good food. This is our 3rd beach club and by far, the best location. Not a boom boom club music scene which I liked. Good location. Sandy beach, minimal rocks and no boats. Ocean to swim. Food pretty decent. Service pretty average. 3 different tiers to pay for entrance fees which act as credit towards food/ drinks. 550$, $450 and 150 ( not sure if this was negotiated rate with our hotel since she called ahead)-- all based on how close you were to the water. We paid the cheapest rate and were about 4 rows from the front. Not s problem at all but we had plastic lounge chairs versus the pretty wood ones. All in all, would return

Extra TLC at Restaurant. We arrived at 11:45 a.m. requesting breakfast. When we showed disappointment when we found out that we had missed the 11:00 cut-off, Sergio May took the time to check with the chef to see if he could extend breakfast hours for us. The answer was "yes" and we had a lovely meal and great service. Thank you!

Great Place! . I like this beach club very much! Awesome service, clean beach, pleasant music, fast internet and delicious food. Especially, thanks to Abraham Estrella (waitress) who always make great service! )

Great beach with amazing food and service !. We just came back from our vacation in Playa and have some great experiences to share about this beautiful place. We stayed at A-nah suits which is about 10 min walk to Kool Beach , we enjoyed every day walking along fifit avenue to get there . Once there upon arrival they charge you 350 pesos per person with includes your meals and drinks if you go little over they will charge you extra.Service on the beach was amazing our waiters : Luis , Lopez , Edwin and Ismael really took care of us and made sure we get the best food and drinks . Food and drinks are really good on the beach and we really liked selection they had . All atmospher on the beach was really good and friendly , we really enjoyed the music played by Daniel beach dj. Also we really liked the crowd there , there is mix of everybody ; families ,couples , single people so the overall experience kept us there every day of our vacation and we never even considered changing the beach.
Great beach !!1. Great service at the club and especially our man Wilbur Diaz.....always polite and quick to help. Thanks makes us feel special.

They'll only get you once. Our first day we went to Kool Beach club. They charged us like $65 US to sit in their chairs, this also included drinks until the $65 was spent. We didn't spend all the money - watch out no refund. We told the waiter to put it towards his tip and handed $5 more. He told us he does not get that money and then told us that $5 wasn't enough for a tip. He served us twice (beers). I felt like I was in New York. Needless to say we did not return.

Lazy days at Kool. Spent 14 days going to Kool Beach Club every day, lounging on comfortable sun beds and being served decent food and drinks by a mostly very friendly staff og waiters. The prices are high, beds costing Mx$350 for the worst plastic beds to Mx$450 and Mx$550 for the better and more comfy wooden sun beds in the first three rows facing the beach. Price for bed is a credit for food and drinks and you can spend the whole amount during the day. Access to pool and a decent DJ playing tunes on-site while you relax, make the day very enjoyable.The cheapest beds buy you maybe one cocktail, a couple of sodas/waters and a decent lunch, while for the Mx$550 credit you can drink two to three cocktails more. All in all very expensive compared to prices in town, and ludicrous compared to general prices for the locals/non-tourist areas.We considered lying on the sandy beach some days, but always ended up at Kool for the convenience of not having to go get lunch somewhere else, and for the sense of security of having someone watching out stuff whenever we went swimming in the sea.If you go, make sure to get Edwin, Elias, Ismael or Estrella as your waiter. Pick the chairs they attend to, as all of the above make the experience that much friendlier than some of the other waiters.

Could be great but poor service & Crazy prices for a lounger!. I have been trying different beach clubs all week in PDC. Mamita's is too loud and juvenile for me so I thought I would try Kool. It's down tempo electronic music was perfect (good DJ). The design and layout is very nice. The food is even good especially the tuna tartare salad. The waiters were slow and rude. The craziest thing was the chair/lounger prices. $7 for a broken lounger at the back, then $13.50 for a few rows forward, $35 for the next grouping and $45 for the nice flat comfortable loungers at the front by the beach. The beds are $165 per day! Sorry, I'd rather lay in the sand.

disappointed. We spent almost everyday at this beach club last year while in Playa and loved it. This year we went our first day. We had lunch prior to getting a chair. We were told the last two rows farthest from the beach were 70 pesos a person. These were sold out. The next few rows were 350 pesos per person. About 10 percent of these were full. We were not willing to spend 350 pesos per person for a chair so we left never to go back to Kool.

Comfortable Chairs; Good Beach Area!. We walked all up and down and were glad to go here because several places the beds were too tightly crammed together and in bad shape. These were comfy with plenty of shade and a great stretch of beach. Awesome people watching too!

Incredible New Years Eve Party. We spent new years eve 12/31/2014 at this beach club. Had a great time.The attention to detail was incredible. It was a premium open bar with surf and turf for dinner with a soup, salad and dessert. We spent 1995.00 pesos per person. The food was great. They offered grapes, champagne, and party favors. with the open bar they served anything you wanted. Danijel the MC from Croatia kept us entertained was very nice and went out of his way to make sure we had a good time.The promotion manager Carlos did a great job!! talking to us about the event and kept an eye out the whole evening on us since I am allergic to lobster he wanted to make sure I did not get sick. Overall an excellent time.

Best Deal in Playa del Carmen. Every year I spend Christmas and New Years in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. This year was no different, except this year I changed my beach venue to Kool Beach Club. They have a GREAT deal. $625 Pesos or about $42USD you get a chaise, towel, umbrella and a $42 credit for alcohol and food!! Best money spent. It's a GREAT scene and the WAIT STAFF WAS INCREDIBLE. They made me feel like a celebrity. THANK YOU Fernando, Rolando and especially Paul! You guys ROCK! See you next year....or maybe even at the Arena Festival!!

Great choice to spent your day. I'm a regular customer at Kool ... Visit every day off... Either if you are a visitor of the turquoise beach of Playa del Carmen or you live here ... Is your perfect getaway ... Makes you feel on holiday all the time great and friendly staff specially LUIS the "playordomo" who always remembers you as regular customer ... Love Kool being here since my first visit on 2009 ... Accessible prices specially cause the rent of the sunbeds you can spend it on food and drinks ... Totally Recomended to friends and family :)

Great service, good prices and the best beach in Playa del Carmen. We went to Kool Beach Club twice during our stay in Playa del Carmen. We rented sunchairs the first time and a sunbed the second time - I prefer the sunbed. When you rent a sunbed/sunchair you can eat or drink for an amount corresponding to the price of the sunbed/sunchair without extra cost at Kool beach club. If you exceed the price you'll have to pay the difference - I think that's a good arrangement. The staff is very hard working, polite and giving a great service.Kool beach club is located on Mamita beach which I consider much better than the beach stretching from "the ferry to Cozumel" in the south to Mamita beach.

Arguably the best stretch of beach in Playa. Get there early for front row as it fills up fast (if you're willing to guarantee at least 1250 pesos in consumption which is nothing if you're there eating and drinking for several hours). Service was not as attentive as at Fusion or Zendi (much smaller places south of the pier)

Excellent experience!. My wife and I have been to PDC a number of times over the last decade or so. We used to go to Mamita's but for all the reasons documented here, no longer do so, and now go to Kool's pretty much every day we are in town.Go to Kool's for a good experience. Make sure that Alfonso is your Playadomo for a GREAT experience. The service that he and his team of waitstaff and runners provide ensure that your beach day will be top notch. Like others who have posted here, I can't say enough about his attitude, work effort, and the joy that he brings to the time that you spend with him and his crew.The business model here is that you pay upfront for the beach chair and umbrella, but all of that goes toward food and beverage credit. We prefer the second row of lounge chairs for about $1050 MX, which right now is about $80 U.S. This pays for us to have breakfast there, lunch there, and a few drinks, although we aren't giant booze hounds. The food is excellent - shockingly so, actually. The beach scene is wonderful, and the location can't be beat - our doing this gives us a great vacation.We've been at beaches around the world, and the Alfonso experience is special.

AMAZING!. We were four people and we rented a bed for 1500 pesos, which is about 120 USD, so we end up paying 30USD each, and they gave us that money as a credit for drinks (including alcohol) and food... The best deal ever! At this time of year the beach was crowded but if you have your bed, you don't even notice. This beach club is right next to Mamitas, another really popular beach club and really close to 5th avenue which is the Main Street. The food is amazing, fresh, clean and the service is the best. Clean bathrooms and beach towels rental as well as access to the pool. The best place if you want to just chill, eat, drink and sleep.
Expensive, crowded. Kool is really expensive with pricing depending where you sit. It is packed crowded and not friendly. Try elsewhere.

A bit pricey with slow service. Wanted to go to the beach while visiting Playa Del Carmen so we this place online. It was New Years Day so the beach was packed. There were 2 beach clubs with service and chairs to rent. Kool's and Mamitas. We went to Kool beach Club as it had nicer looking chairs and more umbrellas. We had to purchase a package to sit in the chairs. It came to about $40 pp and you had to pay upfront. It wasn't really that bad a price because you get the $40 pp back in drinks and food. The food was really good. My husband had the grilled shrimp with garlic and olive oil with a little spice. It was served with rice and some rolls. I had the shrimp tacos with French fries. We would recommend this place except it took us about 1 1/2 hrs to finally eat. Just trying to get someone to wait on you was a chore. When we finally ordered it took forever to get. The same went for the drinks. We were there for over 4 hrs and only had 2 drinks each. The problem is we were talking to the couple next to us who said they were at the place next door (Mamitas), last year and the service was sooo slow they decided to go to Kool's this time. Maybe it was the holiday. I will try it again during the week and see if it's any better.

Kept us going back!. We spent our days lounging in the sun at Kool Beach Club. We made sure to be in the section of Sergio, Abraham and Gerardo as they took such great care of us each day. They were personable, prompt and friendly. Not only did Sergio and his co-workers keep us going back, but the food was also delicious! Included in the upfront cost is use of the bathroom (spacious and always being tended too), pool, free wifi, beach loungers, umbrella, table and towels. You also receive a credit towards food and drink (the amount varies depending on the section you're in). You will be set for the day with Sergio, Abraham and Gerardo serving you. Enjoy!
Fun for party people. Its not a cheap place but if you love electronic music and to "be seen" then this is your place. Dont miss BPM festival in January

Fun in the Sun- Sergio is #1!. Sergio and team helped to make our week long stay in Playa relaxing and enjoyable. Sergio, Abraham, Pat, May, and Gerado are super friendly, paid attention to every detail, and made sure all of our needs were met. The food at Kool Beach Club is very fresh and offers generous portions. A relaxing massage by Jesus was a great way to end the day.

Good Value Great Service. We Stumbled upon Kool Beach Club as we were taking a walk late in the day upon our arrival in Playa. We decided to give it a try the following day as we, my wife, my infant son and I, didn't want to schlep towels, beach chairs, umbrella, etc. to the beach in Playacar. We paid 1,250 pesos for two chairs in the front row. The cost of the chairs included, towels, umbrella, and and a credit toward food and drinks. Our waiters Alfonso and Manuel were awesome. We highly recommend these guys but you will need to ask for their section. We have now gone back to Kool three times and each time we sat in Alfonso's and Manuel's section. Overall a great relaxing experience. highly recommend it.

GREAT day at the beach!. OK, so we weren't sure at first, when the server said $500 pesos per person for the front row of loungers (4 adults). Sounded too expensive, but then he explained that this was simply a "credit" towards food & drinks and that the chairs/umbrellas/towels (yes, we got towels) were actually "complimentary" from the club. Never experienced anything like that, but what the heck, we planned a whole day at the beach and the front row seemed like a nice way to spend it. We had SUCH a GREAT time! Our server was super attentive, new buckets of beer arrived like magic! And the food! Wow - really surprised to find it was the best meal we had the entire trip. It was THAT good! And also loved the music...perfect way to spend the day! Highly recommend it.

A good day on the beach. We valued the service of Sergio and Abraham today at Kool Club along with the fine food and generous portions. We found all the servers to be prompt and friendly in their attention and service. A great massage by Rosy was a great way to end the day.
Overrated . Not as authentic as it used to be: the waiters are more concerned with getting fat tips from larger groups than servicing customers
Bad service. Worst service experience ever. Had to wait forever for drinks and food and really hard getting the waiters attention. Food was good. Music got better during the end of the day.

Love this place! Alphonso is the man.. Took my mom here for the day so we could enjoy the beach without any worries. Our waiter was great- Alphonso. Friendly, personable, polite and not obtrusive. He let us nap for hours without bugging us, but as soon as we needed something he was there in moments. His partner Alejandro was nice too. Excellent Mexican breakfast, beautiful ceviche, nice tart daiquiri, and friendly staff. We hope to make it back a few more times during our trip. Thanks to the whole staff for allowing us to have a relaxing day and for teaching us a little Spanish.

Overall was very good. We went to the Kool Beach club today in Playa. We purchased the two chairs and umbrella package $600 pesos, the price of the equipment was granted to as credit on the bar/restaurant, so basically we spent $600 pesos on food and drinks and got the chairs free, however you want to look at it. Of course the prices are inflated. But you dont cook as well as they do and you get a nice view of the best stretch of beach in town and music. The Kool Beach club is definitely cool. The grounds were well maintained for a tourist destination in full swing. The prices were very reasonable. We have been staying in playa now for several months and have been to most of the resorts and beach clubs up and down the main beach IN playa. This is in the "young/hip/vibey" part of playas beach area. Mamitas is located next door. The sound systems compete for your ear, that can get annoying. The sevice was generally good. As stated, it was in full tourist swing so naturally they were busy and those poor guys were sweating thier butts off toda running around getting drinks and food for everyone. We ordered two different fish plates. A salad and grilled fish. Damn... it was good. Everything felt very fresh. It was really good. Of course we got some drinks and a couple snacks and our $600 credit was finished. So you figure for $45 USD we got lunch complete with drinks, which is pretty close to normal in a tourist area AND we got beach chairs, showers and a bathroom. Which if you stay all day on the Sea, then its essential. The music was run of the mill top 40 until like 4PM and they turned on some light house music. Very relaxed place, pretty standard service, amazing food and drinks. I would recommend Kool Beach club if you 40 and under. Have some money to spend. Want a restaurant quality meal,. Like lots of other people around and you want to relax on a beach chair with some music, complete with bathroom and shower services. If you don't want to spend the cash or its not your type of place but the location is, go to the OXXO store within 30 meters of Kool and purchase your snacks and beer there and spend about 30% of what you would at Kool, bring your own cooler or get one and ice at OXXO. Get your towels and umbrella and park right in front of Kool for free and you can hear the tunes. But you get no service, no shower, no bano. Either way, bring your towel. At Kool Beach, they dont give out towels. Thumbs up for this place.

Getting ahead of themselves.... The service was bad. I do not exaggerate or complain often, As I am a server myself. However after over twenty minutes without a drink, I went back and asked again, brought it back myself. The prices are also over the top. Many equally nice beach clubs in Playa with great service and far better prices. The waiter writing his own top on the bill was too much. I understand this is common, but I tip on my own accord (and very well), so do not provide bad service and then throw yourself a few hundred pesos.

Gorgeous beach, warm Mexican hospitality and delicious food. We spent an incredible afternoon here while visiting Playa del Carmen. As we were staying at a hotel south in Tulum, we wanted to check out Playa del Carmen's turquoise blue waters-- so a beach club sounded like the perfect solution. We couldn't believe how clear and blue the water was here-- and those powdery white sands! See my photos to get an idea of what it looks like. We also had a truly decadent lunch here-- which was a nice change from the taco stands we had been hitting in Tulum every day (which we did love, but it was great to sample some fine dining too). Our favorite was the seafood salad-- we could not stop eating it and ordered more. I loved the pina coladas too-- frosty and refreshing but not overly sweet. But the best part was the staff-- really warm and welcoming.

Nice view, great service. My friends and I rented chairs in the first row and we had a wonderful day. We received excellent service from Wilbert and Wences. We ate breakfast and lunch here and the food was good. Two of us had ceviche and two had burgers. The drinks menu is extensive and they serve quality liquor. The only drawback is the number of people asking if you want a massage.

Worth it.. Although you do have to pay for their services, its a great service. Buy the top of the line for one day, better chairs, better location, better sun but the service is great no matter what! We did the most expensive and least expensive and there was no difference in service .... just quality of chairs and location. The food was fair, not the best, not the worst. Of course the drinks were pretty good and the pool is a great way to cool off. It gets hot under that sun! If it rains and it did, there is covered space to hide until it goes away. So all will not be lost.

Just Perfect. This beach club at Playa Mamitas is fantastic. We rented an umbrella and two chairs right by the beach, the price is a little high but the whole amount that you pay is actually a credit towards food and drinks. The food was perfect and the service was phenomenal. We went with our 8-month old son and asked if they could place an extra umbrella to have more shade to protect him and they did it at no extra cost... The guys who are there renting paddle boards and other equipment even let me borrow their hose with fresh water so I could fill up an inflatable pool for my son. The beach is stunning, you won't regret going there.

Not just for the young party type.. We decided to venture off our hotel beach becuase we heard this beach was better, cleaner and nicer. The rumors were true! How it works: There are many lounge chairs in many rows progressing from most expensive being first row getting less expensive as you get back expect for the large beds. IMPORTANT: When I say expensive its deceiving and we almost did not stay here as they tell you its $550 pesos per lounger front row. BUT what it really means is that you have a credit of $550.00 pesos once you pay against food, water or adult beverages. If you are staying a full day that is very easy to spend. If myself and my 72 year old dad can do it most people no problem. But if it is too much or your on a budget simply go back some rows to meet your needs.The chairs are soft and comfortable. The facility gives you accesss to a bathroom, showers to rinse, a pool, towel, music and good food. However the best part is the service.ALFONSO AND ABRAHAM: Caps to signify they are the reason I will be back in February. I am very particular and demanding about service. In fact, if you read most of my reviews I am tough to please in this area. These two managed to exceed my expectations. Any request we had was delivered with a smile. They ran to get stuff, they watched from a distance so not to bother us but then knew when to come engage and chat with us. We really liked how they treated us. I hope the mangers or owner realize how these two becuase as a business owner I can tell you employees like this are hard to find. Never once did we lack for a beer, a towel, they even moved the umbrella as the sun moved becuase my dad wanted shade. They learned our names as evidenced the next day when we returned and they ran to greet us and shake our hands. Cons: Minor but the massage people drove us nuts asking for massages. I finally asked our servers to tell them to stop. I know they must make a living but if I am relaxing I do not want repetative questions. They need to come up with a way to let guests opt out. Suggestion: Teach the staff to word the sytem better. We would have left if ALFONSO and ABRAHAN had not elaborated versus the person we originally talked to. I would say - "The chairs are FREE. What you give me is a credit agreeing to spend money upfront on food, water, adult beverages throughout the day in return I will service you like royalty." If they hesitate I would say "how many drinks do you think you will consume today, and will you be eating lunch" then show them the total and get them in the right seat. Its a no brainer to stay here versus the chairs next door that charge you without a credit for food or beverage.Owner/Manager I would be happy to talk to you about this or even meet and show you what I suggest and in return all I ask for iss the same great service I received when I return in February. Ill be back and made a deal with ALFONSO and ABRAHAN. If you remember my name and provide the same service I will double my tip :) I hope they win.

Great club on a nice section of beach. We visited here twice over a 4 day period while we were in Playa Del Carmen. The biggest thing this club has over many others in PDC is that the section of beach in front of it is impeccable. There's no seaweed, boats or anything. Just lots of room to swim and the water is outstanding. As for the club itself, we had to spend around $100 US each time we went, but this got us two of the nicest chairs on the front row of the beach. The $100 was not a charge for the chairs though, and we got to use the money towards food/drinks throughout the day. Both times we went we spent the whole $100, but that went towards several drinks each as well as two meals. The first time we visited was on a Thursday, and while the crowds were less our service was a little lacking. It took some time to get our drinks and food but we never complained. I'm not in a rush while relaxing on the beach. Ironically, the next time we went to Kool was on a Saturday and the place was PACKED but we got much better service. We never had to wait more than a few minutes to get anything ordered and our waiter was VERY friendly. Overall I really liked Kool. It was a great place to sit and relax, while also going out to the ocean to swim from time to time. Oh and they actually had a wifi signal all the way out of the front row, so if you need to check emails and such you can do that too. Good times!

Best beach club in Playa!. We had an amazing day on the beach with the comfortable beds and tasty food and drinks. We sat on the beds by the pool and got a package for 300 each (we were 2 couples on 2 double beds)- it includes credit for food in that value, and you get a towel for a 200 peso deposit. Service and atmosphere are amazing and music just makes you feel HAPPY :)

Nice beach club. We went here today and found it to be very nice and friendly. The cost was cheap if you bring your own towels, which we did as the hotel provided them. It was 60 pesos per person for the whole day from 9 am to 6 pm. This included a beach lounger with umbrella, use of the pool and the changing room. Can't beat that for a club right on a beautiful beach. Highly recommended.

Nice Beach, good service. This is a really nice spot to go and hangout at the beach with some music. Wilbert and Luis took really good care of me and my wife. They were really on top of things and were really friendly. So if you are looking for a place to chill have some drinks, this is it.

Great best place to hang out at the beach. We are here now!! Our beach attendants, Alfonso and Abraham have attended to all of our needs. In fact they have been extremely accommodating. We live in Las Vegas and work in the hospitality industry, so for us getting the same type of service that we give is expected and when we don't get that type of service we know it.We highly recommend if you go to the beach here, ask for Alfonso and Abraham, you will not be dissatisfied.
Wow!!!. The Best Beach club at Playa del Carmen!!! Good food, fantastic place and great workshop! Thanks for all!

Kool, is Cool !!. Stopped at Kool for a few hours of beaching it up and partying. Went mid week, got there around 1:45pm...paid approx (going off memory) 600 pesos for 2 beach chairs/umbrella/table and got that amount of $ in credit towards food/drink. We had steak nachos, order of fries, 5 Dos XX for the 600 pesos. Our server, although I forget his name, was great...quick and friendly. We rented beach towels, which upon return, got our money back..used the pool for a little bit, got a free round of shots and tipped 20%. Left around 4:45, only due to rain. The beach is one of the best, water was clear blue, calm, and warm. Beach wasn't overly crowded. We had a great time and would visit again. Thought we got a good value for what we paid. Don't think we were overcharged, coming from Chicago, and wasn't pressured to buy/spend more than we should...and wasn't told what to tip either (like some reviews mention). Would party here again!! Music, if you like EDM, was great too!!

Awesome place, Music much better. I translate all the reviews (all languages), i must say they are complete wrong. the staff is great, work hard in the sun, smile all the time and on rush, Bersanid and Jesus. my respect!!!food is incredible "DELICIOUS".I am big traveller, and i knew the Kool Beach Club from before - and i must say: finally the accept kids in the pool with the family, the new great D.J. Danjel put finally different music - NO MORE DANCE/ELECTRO PLEASE!!!You are in the carribbean and you should feel the Latin music, Electro and house music you can enjoy in the night clubs.Thank you Kool, see you soon

Great experience!. Just visited Playa del Carmen for the fourth time.. Was able to check out Kool beach for the first time and I have to say Kool Beach is a place go!! I wish I knew about this place sooner the food is great and the atmosphere is perfect. The staff is so sweet and made sure our every need was met. Roberto was especially helpful great service overall! coming back again!

Nice beach club with an awesome view. We wanted to spend the day at the beach and decided to give this place a try, they have loungers and charge depending on how close to the beach they are. We paid $50 per person to be in the first row and got to use that credit for food and drinks (so basically, they have a minimum consumption fee depending on where you seat). We think it's worth it, well located and good food/drinks. The only downside is that service is very slow (even for a single beer) plus there is a massage service nearby and their workers passed by every hour asking if we wanted a massage, at least 8 people asked us if we wanted a massage! Besides that, it's a great place to spend the day, they have showers, bathrooms and lend you towels.

Great Day Trip. Our family made a day trip to Kool Beach Club from the Grand Luxxe Resort Residence Club to enjoy a different beach setting. The staff was very attentive and not too intrusive. Always available when we needed a drink or food. Had just what we needed for the day and the kids enjoyed the water sports. DJ Danijel Brandich (P.R.) was great too! He was very friendly and hospitable. Know his part of the world very well too (Croatia) so next time we can enjoy a few shots of Slivo! We also share the same barber and was glad to share my Bald Guyz sunscreen with him too. Danijel found my son a very nice Kool Beach t-shirt that he loves because of the World Cup logo. Also enjoyed watching the World Cup on the many televisions throughout the bar area. Think any visitor to Playa would enjoy Kool Beach Club too!Vlad K.

awesome beach place. My family and I went to Kool beach club and we got a very good attention and service from all the staff specially the D.J. Danijel Brandich y think he is from Croatia but he spoke very good english and spanish he gave us a very good time there very talented guy.In general I recommend Kooll beach to all the people great place great food and great staff.

Wedding at Kool Beach Club May 2014. My husband and I held our wedding reception in May at Kool for close to 80 guests. I worked with Adriana Paz throughout the whole process, including choosing the meal plan and the set up for the event. We were so blown away by Adriana's professionalism, punctuality in response to my emails and requests, and overall work in making our wedding such a huge success. In addition, the food and service staff at Kool were top rate. We did not get a chance to taste the food before the wedding (we had travel restrictions unfortunately)- however I was totally blown away by the quality. It was outstanding- similar to what I would expect at a 1 star Michelin restaurant in London. We also chose the open bar option for our guests which was great. The bar staff were very accomodating and the entire evening went by very smoothly and was very organized. I would absolutely recommend Kool to anyone looking for a wedding venue but not wanting to be tied down to all of the costs and restrictions of an all inclusive resort. Our guests flew from Europe, the Middle East, the US, Canada and Mexico to be a part of our event. We decided against having our wedding at an all inclusive due to this (because we knew our guests wanted flexibility and some would not stay in the resort, having to pay a day pass fee just to attend our wedding.) All of our guests loved the atmosphere and set-up at Kool, and Adriana and the Kool staff were open to my suggestions for additional add-ons as part of my event. Absolutely outstanding experience with Kool - I cannot recommend them enough!

Choose someone else. We had a discount through our hotel to rent sunbeds at this beach club. We've been here three times.Some of the beds are really uncomfortable. It's like the fabric is too tight, so you always have to sit up straight.When we came back the third time all of a sudden we couldn't rent the beds we normally did. They used to cost 60 pesos each, but now the price was 300 pesos included drinks and food.I asked if they had changed the prices, but the waiter denied that. Later we found out that there's high season for the tourists, so everything is even more expensive.It's just not worth paying that much. There are other beach clubs near by who's cheaper, better and have great food. I'd rather recommend Mamitas Beach Club. 90 pesos for two sunbeds and an umbrella. Nice staff, great beach and tasteful and cheap food.

great staff, great food, great music. this was an awesome cub which i can tell. the staff make your stay important and feeling well. Special hello to Danijel (P.R.) which gave us 100% attencion all the time. I will come back on september with couple of my friends.

Great time at Kool Beach Club. We recently went to Mamita's Beach and rented beach chairs from the Kool Beach Club. We paid approximately $24.50 per person. Rental fee went toward food and drink at Kool Beach Club. Food was delicious!Fernando and Russell went above and beyond. They both provided excellent service!!We are really glad we made the decision to stay there. The beach is clean and beautiful! This was probably one of the best days we spent on our vacation!

Do not recommend. My friend and I have just returned from a day at the Kool Beach Club! From the moment we arrived we were presented with attitude from the staff member who greeted us. Anything we asked of him there was an issue! The club had around 90% spare lounges and when we asked if could we lie on one that had more direct sun he said no and asked us to move back to our original lounge despite there being no one there. He wouldn't take our $20 note bc it had a tiny tear in it and when we asked for a fresh towel after being there for over 4 hours we were denied, despite spending the 950 paso plus. If the club were busy and many people were occupying the lounges I'd understand the no changes of lounges or the changing of the towels, but it wasn't. The food was average and the pool was too warm! We won't be back.
Price was great!. Spent a full day here and probably had the beach/cleanest beach area. Staff were great and found was awesome. Highly recommend it.

Great Spot to enjoy Playa Beach. Kool is the perfect place to relax and enjoy the experience of Playa Del Carmen! The prices are very reasonable and the service excellent and attentive! Great music.. Nice dipping pool when it gets hot and the ocean and beach! Not sure why any bad reviews? This place was great!

Destination wedding at Kool. We just returned from our week long wedding celebration with just under 60 family and friends who joined us in celebrating our weeding at Kool Beach Club.We did not stay at Kool we only had our ceremony and reception there. First let me say Adrianna ( wedding coordinator) did an amazing job. We met with her the day before the wedding and she certainly put my nerves to rest. We reviewed everything and did the walk thru.The day of the wedding I felt very comfortable lettng Adrianna and her team do what they do best.After the ceremony was the champagne cocktail hour while my husband and I took a few photos on the beach.Adrianna had a timeline for everything and I feel she did very well in keeping it in order.I really need to mention her serving team. Our particular server was Diego. He was amazing in his service. Most of our guest also commented that thier servers were amazing. They never allowed us to have an empty glass and were very cose if we did need anything.Dinner - We choose the #2 Dinner. I have to applaude the chef and his team. The dinner was delicious even my kids enjoyed every course.From the Palm heart salad to the cream of brocolli soup and even more for the stuffed chicken.Location - To the locals its called Playa Mamitas. It's literally right on the beach.The Ceremony was a beach ceremony. I was a little dissapointed that the general public didn't move away from behind the palapa were we were married, but I didn't notice them until I looked at my pictures.Reception - I had 6 tables that were placed along the pool and my table was at the head of the pool. It was a perfect setting with plams trees and lighting and the much needed ocean breeze that came by.

Russell is awesome . We are on Honeymoon Day 2 and spent it at Kool. Russell took care of us and was very polite and helpful. We got second row chairs, towels, 5 beers, 3 cocktails, a bottle of water and a quesadilla for $66 USD. It was a bit confusing when we first arrived about what was included and what was extra but it had all worked out pretty good for us in the end. We will be back

Chill time at Kools. After a few rainy days we had the opportunity for a beach day in Playa. We headed for the beach and decided to rent a plastic beach lounger and umbrella at the Kool Beach Club. We had read a bunch of reviews, positive and negative about a few of the available beach clubs and decided we really needed to just go and make up our own minds. Kool turned out to be a good choice. Cost 60 pesos each for the rental. The music was pretty varied and the staff were attentive without being TOO attentive. We also opted for a snack of nachos and they were actually better than we had hoped for and a good deal for getting beach front service. We will be back!

Noisy, overpriced, overcrowded. Bassdrum, bassdrum, bassdrum.Drinks not at all at mexican price level. Price for hamacas totally overpriced! Noisy, busy, nothing to do with carribean coolness. This is a money making machine and you are shown this every moment you are there. Better choose a hotel with its on beach!

Best beach club in Playa!. We have been to Playa many times and have been to many of the other beach clubs. Mamitas is right next door and a good option as well, but we prefer Kool. The service and beach chairs are excellent and reasonably priced. The music is great if you like EDM...it's at a nice volume during the day and cranks up in the late afternoon and evening. The food is great...fresh sea food and good Mexican dishes. The washrooms are clean and the pool...small but nice. Overall a great experience and we will be back soon!

Luis is the Man. Luis took great care of us. The music was our type, while maybe if you were older you may not enjoy it so much. Drinks could use more alcohol but don't they all. Beach chairs reasonably priced and access to plenty of sand before the ocean.

Fantastic Time. Good value, excellent service. This is the place to spend the day at the beach in Playa. You won't be disappointed. $50 for the day for two people - Good food and drinks, excellent service, padded lounger and beach umbrellas. We each had a wonderful massage and that was excellent also.

Not suitable for families. We visited as a family, but we're not impressed. Their prices are ridiculous, the service is very slow / inattentive, and worst of all the music was offensive. We are fairly liberal with our media choices, but we couldn't keep our kids there to hear the constant barrage of obscenity blaring from the speakers. Expect to pay 60 pesos for a basic lounge chair, up to 345 pesos for a mattress. We ordered two basic drinks for a cost of 180 pesos. There are many better options in PDC.

Loved it!. I will start off by saying that my mother and I (56&28) went to Kool as part of a Playa del Carmen excursion offered by our cruise line company, so I'm not sure about the prices, etc but we loved it! Had a massage on the beach, and enjoyed some drinks in the sun. Staff were wonderful. My best memory of Kool is by far the staff. I hadn't realized I had forgotten my wallet - which had my money, credit cards and only way to get back on the cruise - on my beach chair while we waited elsewhere for our transportation back to the pier. Luckily, a very honest staff member turned it into the bar before it was too late. I would definitely recommend an afternoon at Kool, especially after a long morning of shopping on 5th Ave.

Way too pricey. Just a few minutes ago I went to the desk of this very crowded beach club and asked to rent one of the wooden chairs for the price of 90 pesos. All they wanted to talk about was selling me some "all inclusive" package for 495 pesos. (I'm sure this is without their tip) When I said that was too expensive the younger lady started giggling so I told them never mind and I put my towel down in the sand a few feet from the beach club's chairs for free.

Great for a relaxing afternoon sunbathing!. We were 3 girls and took a big bed, it was $30 but then they asked $18 for the towels and $16 for the security deposit.We were next to the pool so by 2pm we could perfectly enjoy the deep house music from the DJ, we like all the songs, it was very relaxing.The sea is clear and a few steps away The food was very good and fresh, I had the shrimp tacos and a guacamole, my friends had the fish and the chicken.We all enjoyed our lunch!When the sun started to go down, we asked to be moved to other long chairs and the friendly staff helped us without asking for more money.Just make sure to look closely at the bill, the service charge/sales tax is not very coherent..We will go back for sure!

Better than Mamita's Beach Club. We preferred Kools beach club after trying both Mamita's and Kools. Better service, You do need to arrive early if you want a front row beach chair though. Great service and it wasn't too expensive. We paid 180 pesos for 2 front cushioned chairs with umbrella. However, they are very strict about you bringing any of your own beverages. You cant. You'll have to purchase all drinks from them... even water!

They get greedier every day. We had a nasty surprise today when we went to the beach. Today we chose not to go for the buffet breakfast as we were going to be eating lunch at Kool Beach. We usually do one or the other and occasionally have the buffet breakfast and lunch. Today when we got down to the beach at 9:25 the waiter approached before my husband had even had sat down on the chairs. He said we had to purchase the package if we wanted to sit in the front row. I had gone straight to the towel/ticket kiosk to get the wrist bands and my husband had gone straight to the chairs. My husband was very surprised and came to tell me and I was already being told the same at the kiosk. I was talking to the manager already and was explaining that we were regular customers, had been coming for five years and staying for six weeks at a time and spent most of that time at Kool. I explained that we usually had either the breakfast buffet each morning or lunch if we missed the buffet. It made no difference to them how regular a customer we were. It made no difference to them that we didn't drink alcohol and could never eat that much food in one day. They demanded $495.00 pesos each for the chairs. We feel that if we get there early enough in the morning to get a front row chair then we should be able to. It should not be who can pay the most. The chairs in the front row are the same as the second and third rows therefore why should they be a different price? If the chairs in the front row are taken when we get there we have sat in the second and third rows and that is not the issue. The issue is charging a high price for the front row which has the same chairs as the second and third row. We had found the first change this year was that they were not giving out bottles of water and we thought "oh well". Then a couple of weeks ago they said they were starting "packages" and we could get a package for food and drinks and chair all included. We specifically asked if we had to take the package and were told no you can still get just the chairs and umbrella for the same price. Today we were told that we HAD to pay $495.00 pesos per person to have a chair in the front row. As my husband and myself do not drink alcohol it would be virtually impossible for us to spend that much in one day on food. We have generally spent most days at Kool Beach because it is only one block from the condo, they were reasonably priced and we generally have liked the staff and service we get there. Last year I had an injured back and was unable to walk any further than Kool. We feel the way customers are being treated this year is unreasonable. Loyal customers who come almost every day should not be subjected to treatment like this. We saw several couples approaching to sit in the chairs and walking on when told about the prices. The rates changing without notice and from waiter to waiter (we actually heard one waiter telling a couple that the rate was $525.00 pesos each) is not a good way to do business. I can guarantee that we will never pay $495.00 pesos each for a chair in the front row!!!I realize that many people will not agree with what I have written and that is fine. I just wanted to let people know what was happening at Kool.

Not impressed. 8 of us decided to watch the Seahawks stomp the Broncos at Kools. We ordered a fair amount of food and drinks during the game and then paid the bill without looking at the items that we were billed for. Later after splitting up the bill between us we realized that we had been charged for items we never ordered. The next day we went down and let them know what had happened knowing that we would not be reimbursed but just to let them know that they need to pay more attention what each table actually orders. They were somewhat rude even knowing that we were not expecting any reimbursement.

Padded bill. Went there, had a good time, in the evening, thought our bill was a bit excessive, paid it and left. It was our own fault for not looking harder at the charges, but two of our group had already wandered off. Later we noticed we were charge for 3 Tangeray shots on top of the one Gin & Tonic we did order for an additional $30 US plus a $10 shot of tequila, which none of us had. The menu at that time of day was only appetizers and those were good, but costly. Went back and brought the overcharge for drinks to the managers attention, not to try to get any reimbursement but to let him know. Will not go back, too many nicer places to go to. If you go, make sure to check your bill.

2 days in the sun/shade. We spent 2 days of our vacation at this beach bar, a little expensive, but well worth it when you need to hide from the sun awhile using their umbrella's. The music wasn't too loud until late in the afternoon, earlier in the day it was nice music playing low.

much comfier than mamitas. me and my husband have been going to mamitas for years which is the beach club next door to kool but we decided to give kool a try. the lounge chairs are 90 peso vs 30 but you get an umbrella and they are extremely comfortable! its a whole other experience there and you can go in the pool which is really cute. the food is also awesome there. that is my new spot.
Don't expect any attention. For hotel guests, the attention isn't there at all, but at least you can bring your own beverages. The reserved area is small and can get crowded early.
Great beach. Soft sand...clear water...good music..reasonable prices...fun people watching. We are in our 40s and loved spending the day there.

Good food, good beach chairs . Even during BPM when Mamitas wanted a whopping 8 bottles to sit down, Kool was 60 pesos for a beach chairs and umbrellas all day! We ate fresh Shrimp and fish cerviches. Both tasted right off the boat (PDC is a fishing town, better be fresh!) Excellent margaritas and Mojitos all day in the sun. Will continue to enjoy this place when staying in PDC

Awesome Beach!. I recently visited Playa Del Carmen again and decided to hang out by Kool Beach Club. It was quite a delightful experience. The staff was very attentive and the people there were friendly. Although I thought the drinks were on the expensive side it was worth it just for the people watching. As I sat enjoying a drink some young women asked me to take a photo of them with the "Beach Guy." I said sure and next thing I know they were all clinging to this guy that was walking on the beach. As I found out later, he is a beach legend in Playa. I wish I would have asked them to return the favor!

great food for breakfast. This is the place to eat breakfast. Inexpensive and lots to chose from. Omelets were cooked to perfection. Fruit and Salad were good. Orange juice is fresh squeezed and delicious. Coffee kinda strong but that was ok cause needed to wake up. Nice view of the ocean.

Nice change from Mamita's. I have used Mamita's for the past three years because the condo I rent was associated with Mamita's and frankly the chairs and umbrellas were free because of the association. The association no longer exists. Since I had to pay for a chair and umbrella this year, I thought I'd try "Kool" for a change.For $6 USD (at today's exchange rate), I got a lounger with a cushion and an umbrella for an entire day. I tipped the person arranging the umbrella for me another $1.50. (This totals 100 Pesos - 80 for the lounger/umbrella and 20 for the tip.) Not a bad deal.Unlike Mamita's, there was no pressure from the wait staff to purchase drinks or food. The staff stopped occasionally to see if I needed anything. Bottled water and standard drinks, i.e. margaritas and mojitos, were fairly priced. I normally do not eat at the beach, but I did try an order of regular nachos. It was about $6 USD. I have a healthy appetite and it was enough to feed 2 and came with extra hot peppers, etc.At the end of each day I paid my tab. A big difference between Kool and Mamita's...the staff brought me the check, went over ever item on it to ensure that it was correct. I paid in Pesos and my change was brought to me promptly each time, including enough change to leave a reasonable tip (I did 15-20%). Mamita's - more often than not, the check was not available or there was a problem with change, etc.The loungers with cushions were in relatively good shape. The beach at Kool is wide. And the water gradually gets deeper - no steep drop off point. The lavatories were also clean.

The place to go and enjoy the beach at PDC. Love the place! I go here almost every day off that the rain allows me to and I am always greeted by the staff with a genuine smile! Gotta choose one of the beds by the pool area so you can enjoy the live Dj sessions! I recommed this place way better than Mamitas cause the staff is way more friendly and has a pool too :) Do not hesitate to visit this Kool beach club :)

We Love This Place!. Once again (for the third year in a row), we have plunked ourselves down every day, for seven days soaking up the sun and friendly service here at Kool Beach Club. It's not as fancy as Mamitas, but way more relaxed. Do yourself a favor, pay for the padded/wooden chaise lounge chairs up front (about US$8 for the day) sit back enjoy the sights, beverage and food service with super friendly staff. Also included are bathroom facilities and a pool. The DJ starts about 12pm and plays not too loud or offensive pool beats. We usually arrive about 8:30am for a decent and cheap ocean view buffet breakfast (about US$10). Then make our way to our chaise lounges. Be friendly, tip well and these guys will really look after you! We've made great friends with the staff and mutually look forward to seeing one another every year.

Kool is cool!. Beautiful beach club. We were on a Carnival excursion and this beach is so close to the port. It was not at all crowded when we arrived and we stayed by the pool on the beds and the shade was wonderful. The pool was nice, the music was great, and the service was good. Not too pricey food menu and the food was good. The beach was crowded but the poolside was right on the beach and had a great view of the ocean. The bathrooms were adequate and close by. Overall a very relaxing beach day.
Much better than mamitas. This club is adjacent to Mamitas and they provide the same atmosphere with better customer service. I recommend this beach club.

Bad Attitude and Poor Service vs. Great Location and Music. Maybe you will have a better experience, but I have been to Kool many times over the years that I have visited Playa del Carmen, and I frequently have problems there. Up until now I have tolerated it because I like their location and the music. However, I have spent quite a lot of money at this place over the years too, and I'm tired of their BS. I figured its only fair that I write this review. I think it's also important that I mention that I speak some Spanish: enough to politely greet my server, and competently order from a menu. I'm in another country, where English is not the native language. I'm not one of those travelers that thinks if I just talk louder and slower that I will somehow be understood. Furthermore, I'm used to being treated well by those in the hospitality industry, and I return the favor with my gratuity. Kool just doesn't seem understand that concept very well at all.   Bad Attitudes:  •They have a policy that you cannot bring food or drinks into the club. This is understandable. They are in the business of selling food and drinks. However, I will sometimes have a single bottle of water with me, which I finish, or simply leave in my bag, and then order from their menu. I will usually stay all day, so my bill is usually a quite a lot of money by most people's standards. Consider that water is about $2 US, most alcoholic beverages are $5-$10, and the average food item is about $15-$20. It adds up quickly.  When I entered the club I had a half-finished bottle of water. There was approximately 8 ounces left. On this particular day I suppose they choose to make an example of me. When I went to the desk to rent my beach chairs for the day, the woman working there refused to rent me the chairs until I walked back to where I left my bag, returned to her with the water, and put it in the trash. This is pretty ironic, and hypocritical since they have signs all over the property saying something like this "Water is a precious resource, please conserve it." I guess that only applies to their water. She had a very smug look about her too, like she had just solved some major crime by spotting my smuggled water and disposing of it. In that respect I must say she did an excellent job! Poor Service:•My chair was in the sun, so I asked the servers to adjust the umbrella so the chair was in the shade. I was with someone who spoke Spanish, so there was no definitely miscommunication here. For whatever reason this request was simply too much for them handle. After a great deal of discussion between 2 of the servers. We were asked us to move to another spot if we wanted shade. This spot was further back on the beach, rather than the front row near the water. I have been to Kool, and other PDC beach clubs countless times. This is not an uncommon or difficult request at these clubs. They move or adjust the umbrella, and then I tip them, simple. I have never had them refuse such a request before. The 2 servers just couldn't be bothered, or were just completely incompetent at their job.  •My server wasn't extremely bad, but he definitely wasn't good either. He just seemed indifferent towards us, almost as though he didn't want to be there. He was terribly slow. Again I found all this ironic, since it is my understanding that many servers in Mexico aren't paid a wage, but work for gratuity only. Understanding that, you would think that even if you are having a bad day, you be a good actor, pretend that it is the best day of your life, and the people you are serving are your new best friends: not at Kool. Location: •Excellent in my opinion. The beach is big , the water clear, and the ocean floor isn't too rough on your feet. Many other parts of the beach are not as clean, and are very rough and rocky. Music: •If you like electronic music you will love this place. They play it all day and it's a good mellow selection of tracks.  Atmosphere:  •The club itself is well maintained, and comfortable, with generally clean bathrooms. Food: •Mostly good to average. Sushi quality in particular is very inconsistent, ranging from average to poor, so I just avoid it.  I hope this review helps you.

Kool Club is wonderful but BEWARE the jetskis.. I love the kool club at Mamitas beach in Playa del Carmen. The ambience is relaxing and all the services you need (beach beds, umbrellas, food, bathrooms, etc) are here for a small fee. The waters off the beach are very clean and the beaches themselves are constantly being cared for. A relatively new phenomena at Mamitas beach is that the jetskis going back and forth along the beach drive VERY close to the shore. So if you want to go in the water more than about 5-10 meters (that is up to your waist) be very, very careful because the jetski drivers dont seem to care who they might run over. This is a disaster waiting to happen. I was at mamitas today and the jetski driver was screaming at all the swimmers to get out of the water. THese drivers used to go out far enough so that you could have a relaxing swim and even snorkel (beautiful fish in these waters). NO MORE! Too bad the beach club cant make these jetski operators go a bit farther out so that everyone can enjoy their time at mamitas-sun bathers, swimmers, and jetski fans.

Fun!. Visited here in July 2013 with my 2 kids. The food is great, the beach was wonderful, and everyone was very nice. I loved being able to travel with my kids and visit someplace neat like that, and if I was able to, would go back! We didnt get in the pool, since it was for 18yrs old and up only, but we didnt need it after we spent the day in water and sand anyway :)

Excellent place to spend a day. This place has all the amenities a person could want. It has umbrellas and chair. Its has beds to sleep in. The club house is open with food and drinks priced reasonably. The beach is great and the security is also viable. It seem all the employees want you to have a good time.

Expensive but nice. If you are staying in Playa del carmen, ask your hotel for coupons to different beach clubs.Our hotel had coupons for Kool Beach club and off we went.The club in itself is very nice, you have a pool, great music, showers, and beach service.Prices are a little bit on the expensive side, but nothing crazy or prohibitive.Quality of the dishes is good, but drinks where very weak. But still, to be able to lay on that wonderful beach, walk for miles on that wonderful ocean is fantastic.Great for relaxation since the music is not blasting its just at the perfect volume

Kool and Great. Kool beach club is an entertaining place to be. The water is crystal clear and sandy (versus rocky) and you won't smell seaweed or boat gas. I was turned off because you have to pay 80 pesos for a lounge chair with padding or 50 pesos for a regular lounge chair. On top of that a bucket of 4 beer is 160 pesos where other clubs offer 6 beer for 150 pesos. The massage people attached to Kool will come around and keep asking if you want a massage, which I found annoying. But you can't put a price on the experience. The wait staff are very attentive and funny. The food is excellent and the music is not blaring. All the locals plunk down in the sand in front of you, bringing their coolers full of food and beer. Everyone is partying and having a great time. You get caught up in it and at the end of the day you say that was fun. Have been there several times and Kool is not disappointing. It just might be my most favourite beach club.

Great place to be!. My husband and I stayed in a condo half a block from Mamitas and Kool Beach Clubs. When it came time to choose a place to enjoy the beach, we choose Kool Beach Club each time. The prices are similar between the two, but Kool has a food menu that's just a bit more upscale. Kool also has wooden loungers on the first two rows (the main reason we went with them) and these are much more comfortable. In my opinion, the beach in front of Mamitas and Kool is the best stretch in Playa hands down, but the downside to this is that it can be a bit more crowded in the afternoons. Overall, we enjoyed our time here.
