Wow. My favorite beach club ! Bottle service is great and cheap, the beds are comfortable and the food is great. Dj starts at 1:30 and put some really good house music.

AWESOME!. This place is great. The service is great and view is amazing. You pay about the same everywhere for chairs and towels, but this place has great music and is right by the jet ski rental. A great spot.

AWESOME. I love this spot. It's very clean and their ceviche is awesome! The wait staff was fantastic. The guys waited on me hand and foot. Icing my bucket of beer and water down throughout the day. Anyone that says they didn't receive good service here is probably a cheap tipper! I loved the DJ that spun really chilled out music all day, you could hear it in the back ground, but it was not loud or intrusive. I send all my friends that visit playa there. :D

Well worth the $$. We didn't stay here but we did fork over around $15 for a beach chair and towels to use the club are as a 'day pass' and it was the best day we had on vacation! the staff was super friendly and attentive constantly asking if we wanted more drinks or food and the water was gorgeous. Well worth the money!

Best beach in mexico. From tulum to playa are my favorite beaches in the carribean. Kool beach just happens to be right downtown in the heart of it all. The beach club itself is good, food is above average and service is okay.

Not great service - massage staff annoying.. If the wait staff had paid me 10% of the attention that the massage staff did, it would have been a good experience. I was there for 4 hours or so and was NEVER waited on but I was asked if I wanted a massage no less than 10 times. I did however get great service from Javier at the bar and the food was actually really good. The prices were reasonable. The wait staff needs to pay more attention to the guests - aren't the there to make money? The establishment should also tell the massage staff to cool it - it was super annoying - several of the staff asked me multiple times. I will not go back - will try another beach club next time.

Nice Beach, good service. The beach is beautiful with ample seating. The lounge chairs are nicely cushioned and the waiters were abundant. The pool was small, but nice. A DJ was constantly spinning trance/techno riffs all day. The beds by the pool were very relaxing. There was a nice restaurant, but I did not try the food. Everything could be brought to you on the beach in your chair which was nice. The crowd was mixed.

Great Beach Club. We were a group of 7 people. We went on August 27. I had already read about Kool beach club through tripadvisor and wanted to go. We got lucky and it happened to be that, there was an CORONA Light Event going on. It was $7USD to get in and you would get 2 Corona Light's free. They had a huge stage on the beach with various djs playing house music. Great vibe. There were beach beds and lounge chairs. Small modern pool surrounded by beach beds as well. im not sure what this place is like when nothing is going on but, with an event going on there was soooo many people socializing, drinking, partying. Just having a good time. People were from all over the world, American, Europeans, South american, you name it. it is a place you definitely want to go if you are looking to listen to some music and have drinks with friends!!!* Not sure if there is a fee on a daily basis due to the event.

Great Beach Club. Great service and fun day at Kool Beach Club. Good food and drinks all-day. Great people watching and all beach activities (jet ski, parasail, massages) are just a few steps away and kids can hang out at the kid's club while mom and dad relax with a massage.

Made our holiday fantastic !. We stayed in an all inclusive in Riveria Mayo last year and visited playa del Carmen three times. We went back this year in jan for a sneaky little week and spent every day at Kool beach club. Heaven on earth! Couldnt have asked for more! Beautiful beach, food, service, weather - it has the lot! We'd go back to playa del Carmen 3 times a year if we could afford it and it was a shorter flight. Enjoy!!

First impression: good. On second thoughts, go nextdoor!. The first time we got at Kool, our impression was good. Nice staff, good atmosphere. During our next visits, this impression was pretty much destroyed by our next experiences: most of the time we were more and more ignored by the staff, so ordering food or drinks could take up to half an hour to get only two beers. During our last day in PDC, we decided to give Kool an other chance. We'd better not have done that. we were not only ignored by the staff, we waived at crew members to order something, they glanced at us and walked on. It took 45 minutes to only get a menu. besides that, there were a couple of Mexicans with their own (irritating) music. When we kindly asked a staff member to ask those boys to put down their volume, his reaction was 'Mexicans are like this, i cannot do much about it'. That was the straw that hit the camel's back, and we immediately took off, and did not pay the tip they already put on the slip. After reading the other reviews here on TripAdvisor we learned that everyone who stayed at the Hotel Aventura Mexicana had the same experience. THis hotel provides tickets for free beds at Kool. At Kool, you get a light blue wrist band, and you pick a (plastic) bed of your choice. But it seems that this blue wrist band is also a sort of sign for the staff to reduce service to an absolute minimum. I really wonder why.... after all, this offering make people come several times to Kool (we often saw our fellow hotel guests at Kool), so this offering should be a great opportunity for Kool to make good money...but they don't seem to understand this. The first day we were at Kool and spend 700 pesos only in the afternoon. We tipped the staff more than the usual 10%...but no reason to 'cherish' us as customers. Shame.So, if you stay in PDC, don't let the first impression of Kool fool you. There are many beach clubs in PDC, so plenty of choice!And for those who stay in Hotel Aventura Mexicana, don't let the tickets for free beds temp you to go to Kool. Oh, last but not least, their prizes are high, in comparison to other beach clubs, and the food is not that impressive. We had much better meals at the beach, for much less money.

time filler while wife and son went diving.. For those who are young and seeking "social" action - might be good.l DIdn't work for my younger son and I. Loud music - not the best food - esp, given prices - and the sacrilege beer that was not super cold. Though not their fault - not the ideal beach to go to either though the pool was good for a quick dip to cool off and the showers and bathroom the redeeming feature. The massage at the next door location was excellent.

Well staffed, clean and nice. Nice stretch of the beach with good menu for food and drinks. Not amazingly good value but very clean and comfortable. Pool is pretty sub standard but it's a good choice if you're interested in the beach. Massage is very good

Love it - best beach club by miles. This place is fab! Love the Moët cushions and big beds. It's 300 pesos for a big dbl bed for the day, 70 pesos for a woodern loungers and 40 pesos for a normal bed. Food great - we have visited a few times and the nachos are good - fish tacos fab and the burgers great. A defo must in playa. Only thing I would say is rather than charge for lounges introduce a minimum spend.
sweet!!!1. best beach in mexico best sand, beers, tequila, best time when in mexico!

Average service, dirty bathrooms. I went to Kool beach one day and Mamita's the next. Mamita's beats Kool hands down. Kool and Mamita's share the beach next to each other. Kool has good food with large portions but it is more expensive. Service was better at Mamita's and the bathrooms much much cleaner.

Excellent Beach Club. We had free access through our hotel to this beach club. The service was very good; they want to take care of you! The bummer was that the "good" chairs were more expensive, and it's on the edge of town. Otherwise, this place comes HIGHLY recommended.

Best beach club in Playa!. This is the best beach club in playa by far!! It was my first time in this beach club since I usually go to the next door one Mamitas but this time I found Kool to be much better! better music much better service, food and drinks more confortable sun beds and chairs nocer pool etc! We were two young couples and we all agreed this was much much better beach club location is the best and you have an awesome view specially from the sunbeds around he pool it also has great massage placa and clean bathroom facilities! Excellent dont miss it!!!

Wonderful Time on 5th Avenue, Playa del Carmen. 5th Avenue on Playa del Carmen is a great place to go no matter your age. It has alot of good restaurants/bars. Nice chic hotels, awesome stores and shopping! And I has entertainment for all ages and nationalities. I recommend this place to anyone who wants to relax or have a good time. I would go back very soon. This was my 2nd trip there.

Great for mommies who want to have some down time. The best thing for me was the koolkids space. I left my todler there for a couple of hours while i sun tanned, swam, etc. When i went to pick him up to go swim at the sea, he didn't want to leave!!

topnotch operation. I’m completely amazed with the consistent level of service they’ve always provided. I spend most of my days here for sun and relaxation. The wait staff is amazing, dependable and remembered my previous visits as if I never left. They’ve always taken good care of me and I appreciate all the things they do to keep me coming back. You guys are the best in my book! Thanks!

Always busy!. Kool is a nice beach club to hang out at. They over full size beds and louge chairs. I really Iike the infinity pool too. The ocean in this area is usually very calm and there are no boats to interfer with swimming. I like the food here too. They have good ceviche. They even have sushi, but certainly not the best in town....but they have sushi! The service is usually very attentive. Always a good time.

Amazing Place! Party ALL DAY!. This place is AMAZING... i love to go the when im in Playa del Carmen! I visit this palce almost 2 or 3 times a year and they always have a great DJ's and great Parties.... the food is good and the service is excellent... I always recommend this beach club instead of Mamitas because they have a great pool to party with friends or girlfriend! the restrooms are always clean and the security is very tide!

Beware they allow topless sunbathing. We went to Kool Beach Club on a busy Saturday afternoon and had to wait a while to get a chair (our mistake for going on a weekend). After we were finally seated (3 of us to 1 chair) I had to track down the waiter at least two different times to get service. But had I known they allowed topless sunbathing we would have sought a different beach club (traveling with 2 young teenagers). Also, the swimming pool & swimming pool lounge area doesn't allow children.

Mostly good....with an exception (bill scam). We stayed at Aventura Mexicana April 5-13 which included free use of the KOOL beach club's 40 peso loungers. As this was just a lazy vacation (and a very hot and humid week) my husband and I spent about 4 hours every day at KOOL. We have used this beach club before (in December) so I was familiar with it. We had wonderful servers every day. We tipped very generously (usually 50%) because first of all, our loungers were free and that is an 80 peso value for the two of us right there and the service is spread out over a number of hours and I just don't think the 20-30% works in that situation. Anyway....day one was just beverages, bill was 140 pesos and we tipped 80 pesos. Day two we had lunch and when the bill came there was a 10% charge on it. I asked if this was tip included and the server said "no, that is for the bartenders and the kitchen, my service is not included." I told him that had never happened before and he said they just never told me. Well, I knew that wasn't right, but didn't make a scene and still tipped him 150 pesos on top of that because he really had been a very good server and of course they are standing over you watching as you are figuring your tip. Days three, four, five and six we also had lunch and no service charges were added to any of those bills (again, really wonderful servers). Day seven we get the server from Day two, who had cheated us. First thing he asked was how many days we had spent at KOOL. We told him we'd been there every day and he knew right away that we remembered him and what he'd done. Well by then I was really stewing over this and how to handle it. During the course of the day he pretty much stayed away from us, just stopping occasionally to see if we needed anything. When we were ready to leave and he brought the bill I asked him how he was able to add that charge onto our bill on Day two. For awhile he played innocent and said that was procedure. I told him NO-ONE else had done that and maybe we should talk to a supervisor to see what the true procedure was. Then he said "Oh, you want to get me in trouble". And I said I really kind of would, because we had gotten such great service at KOOL but his little scam left a bad taste over everything. Eventually he was apologetic, but the bad thing is I don't think it will change anything. I think some servers there may very well do this randomly. I'm not sure what made him think we looked like suckers. This was our 15th trip to Playa, so I'm kind of offended that we did look like suckers. But I also think it's pretty dumb to risk that scam with people who have free lounge chairs from hotels and therefore will more than likely be down there more than once that week. I'd go to KOOL again because really most of the servers were really great, but if I was ever presented with a bill with any surcharge on it I would have them remove the charge and then I would not tip the server. Maybe over time it would hit them in the pocketbook enough to teach them a lesson.

OK Experience until waiter spilled my drink.. Nice beach club. We arrived at about 9:30am which is the best time. Not to many people around the beach. By the time we left at 3pm it was packed. The bathroom was also in poor condition around this time. It hadn't been cleaned in a while, one stall was a complete mess and many stalls were missing toilet paper at this point. We ordered several drinks and food which was ok. The mixed drinks barely had any liquor if any at all in them. The strawberry margarita seemed to be crushed ice with Flavored syrup and water. When removing the food from our table our waiter dropped my pina colada which was half full. When I asked for a comped drink since he dropped it he said he would have to ask his manager. When the manager came he said that the waiter told him there was only a small amount left in the cup. This was totally untrue and I no longer ordered any food or drinks.I remained for a few more hours because the chairs and umbrella were complimentary as a part of our hotel. I went to another beach club the next day which was more secluded.

koolio!. I started off on a beach lounger (75 pesos) which quickly got crowded so i moved up to the pool area to find solitude. I requested a lounge chair be brought down from the platform to an open space located on the bar level to get more sun rays and the staff willing accommodated. The music was very soothing (slow to mid tempo) playing remakes of classic songs from unknown artists which was very relaxing. to my surprise, around noon they start playing techno music and it got louder. thankfully i had my own tunes to jam with to block it out. The entire facility is modern and hip with the exception of the bathrooms, which were dark and slightly creepy. David and René were my servers the first day, then Ernesto, Asterio and Wences the days following. All very attentive and even rotated my chair and umbrella to follow the sun without hesitation. I got a massage on the beach and it was fantastic. Didn’t catch his name but he was a younger male, perhaps in his twenties. I never go by the recommended tip on the bill and always tip above and beyond if the service is impeccable, and it was!! Also, never haggled by security and would have given an excellent rating, but I loathe techno.

Watch the waiters for getting extra tips when paying the bill. The place was great a little noisy at times but fun to watch. When you get your bill at the end of the day the tip is automatically added to the bill as recommended tip. When you pay this without adding an extra tip for your waiter he will chase you down and ask for the tip.When you point out that you paid the recommended tip he will complain that it is shared with the cooks and others and he should get extra, if you don't give him more he will get pissy and give you nasty looks when you go back. Food was very good.

Excellent service! Great beach club!. I visited while on a cruise docked in Calica, wanted to get a cab and go to a beach club in Playa. I had planned to go to Mamacitas but I took a look at Kool next door and went there. Was glad I did! First of all, Kool had lounge chairs that had huge padding on them and huge umbrellas. (You could also get a day bed with canopy or just plain chairs - not sure of cost) $14 for 2 padded chairs and umbrella for the day. When we got there it was pretty empty - great for us! Chose my chair and parked...the waiter came over and introduced himself and said he would take care of us for the day. He was awesome -Excellent, excellent service! The funny thing is - they have a nice bathroom and a guard who guards it like Ft. Knox. If you don't have a wrist band - you don't get in..I loved it! I was there in November and they were resurfacing the pool but who cares - the beach is it!! Nice, wide, white sandy beach. We had some great guacamole and chips and some drinks for $21. On the internet when I looked at this place I was worried it would be a loud party place but it was so quiet and relaxing..We had it pretty much to ourselves most of the day. Was with my mother who doesn't like crowds or loud music and it was perfect. A large group came after lunch but didn't stay long. (Looked like they were from an excursion that got some beach time) Tons of shopping a block away. For you cruisers, walk down the beach to right past 'The Royal' and walk up the street about a block and catch a cab back to the ship. Also, none of the pushy beach vendors there - the beach police don't allow it..Very safe - easy great day! I will be back! BTW...about a 20 min. ride each way. Cab was $15 each way but if you know what time you want to go back you can book a round trip for less.

Bribed and intimidated by Kool's security officers. In a recent trip to Playa del Carmen, my boyfriend and I used the Kool club’s beach facilities several times. On our last night in town, the police saw us on the beach outside of your club. They told us that the beach was closed (which it was not) and that we would be arrested unless we withdrew $200 USD out of the ATM outside of the Kool bar, and paid them. After we discovered that the ATM was not working, the police drove away, leaving us with two security guards who were stationed at Kool, who had seen and heard the entire exchange. The Kool security guards told us that we could not leave until we paid them the $200 USD, even though the ATM wasn’t working. They refused to speak to us in English, and refused to respond to anything I said in my limited Spanish vocabulary, unless I said something about paying them. I was terrified, and asked if they could accompany me to another ATM (toward 5th Avenue) so that I could give them the money. They refused, and told us to follow them toward the bar, which was closed and dark, out of the lighted area where the ATM is located. I begged them to please let me bring them the money en la mañana. Finally, they agreed and let us go. I did not bring them money the next morning, since our flight left from Cancun early, but I think that it is a horrible, shameful thing to intimidate and take advantage of two young tourists. I hope that my sharing this experience might prevent this from happening to someone else. I enjoyed my time in Playa del Carmen immensely, until this incident. I hope that this can and will be the last time young travelers are put through this by the Kool staff.

KOOL = LOUD?. Just a short review of what should be a great place to hang out at the beach. The positives first:1) Fantastic Beach2) The Colours of the Caribbean3) Great waiters and the Chair Guy.4) Cold Beer5) Good Food6) Use of Pool & Showers7) OK Price (40-70 pesos depending on type)Now the negatives (there is only one really):The music is too loud, too annoying, too bad! BOOM BOOM BOOM all day stops any kind of relaxing lay in the sun.If it's peace and quiet you want or at least some quiet backround music this is not the place for you. Music better suited to night club on 5th avenue at midnight.

Great Time at Kool!. We went to Kool most days during our short stay in Playa and loved it! The beach speaks for itself -- beautiful, white sand, amazing turquoise water -- what could be better? The beaches are free in Playa so there really is no need to go to a beach club unless you want to pay for a chair and have an umbrella for shade. As both were important to me, pay we did and it was cheap! Our hotel gave us 10 peso discounts for the 40 peso regular chairs that were perfectly comfy. Why pay 70 pesos for a "bed"? The wait staff was pleasant, helpful and courteous. We ate at the restaurant itself and also on the beach. Most days the music was pleasant and soothing. We tried Mamitas one day, but couldn't find a free chair and didn't feel overly welcome there. We liked Kool much better.

Not soo KOOL!. Kool beachclub is far from the cool place it could have been. Most of the servants and barmen are nice and decent people but the "managers" that bored hang around the reception and slowly inspect the area trying to look important, are rude and snobby. I see no reason whatsoever for these 4-6 "managers" to infect the KOOL beachclub with their unpleasant appearance.There are lots of opportunities for this place to improve and "cheer up"!

Great Show, crowded but a must go!. I went with my couple but purchased the late ticket, it's almost half price , but you still get to see the show. The show is awesome!!. The dancers and the performance is great!!. Though it was really really crowded, I recommend to visit this atracttion. If you like to dance a drink , you should purchase the complete ticket. I loved it. There are also tours that pick you up from you hotel, but I recommend to go by yourself, you can stay more time. they also have a souvenier store with cool things.

Amazing Experience. We bought our tickets to Coco Bongo through our resort and had seen some videos before and were dying to go! The show was amazing and if you like to dance and be in the middle of the entire thing I would recommend staying on the bottom level. There are 3 levels and the ones higher up are actual tables and seats to watch. It is super busy and squishy in the club so we had to move around a bit to find some room. I would go again and again! Only thing to remember is to bring your ID! Our travel agent from the hotel forgot to mention that we needed them and we were rushing back to our rooms last minute and back to get the bus to take us.

Coco Bongo - a must when in Playa del Carmen. We did the Coco Bongo Tour, this includes:- pick-up at hotel by bus- Senor Frogs (approx 1 hour)- Salsanera (approx 1 hour)- Coco Bongo (the remainder of the night till 3)- return by bus to the hotelAt all 3 places:* open bar (beer, local spirits (tequila), all cocktails made with local drinks & sodas),* tables & * waitress Total USD 90 per person and we find it was well worth it!!At Coco Bongo you get a great show, which you can see from your own Bongo Tours "wing", this way you look down towards the podium and really get a good look at the whole show big PLUS you're not in the crowd getting squashed :)!Did I mention the open bars, you pay up front for the ticket and no additional costs at night (tips and taxi if needed excluded of course)

So much fun!! Worth the money! . I must admit I was cynical with the price and reading reviews about how to go gold. We went normal and had a fab night, it was a Thursday, was busy but not stifling. Was in November however so that would make a difference. Loads of fun, loved it, veryhungover the next day!

Nice Variety Of Music & Entertainment. This show was amazing. There was a mixture of music from rock and r 'n' b to reggae. In between the DJ music there were amazing shows to watch. The VIP service is worth paying for. You get elevated sitting, which means great views and you can sit or stand when it suits. In addition there is a bottle service in VIP section. Downstairs is jam packed and you have to stand all night - this show is about 4-5 hours long. But worth it.

Great show . UPGRADE TO VIP. You get bottle service, but also can sit and enjoy the show. The floor is packed and I don't think it would be enjoyable if you had to stand the whole time packed like a sardine. The show was AMAZING. We loved it.

An excellent night out.. There was a group of 6 of us ranging from 18 to 62 years old. We booked the gold VIP tickets so we could have a table and chairs and a good view of the show. Our waiter was brilliant and kept our drinks flowing and wouldn't let us lift a finger. It was packed to the brim so paying extra was well worth it.

GREAT. A must do!. This place is really hard to grade because some of it is exceptional and other is ok. So I'll put it in bullet form:Dislike:Drinks are quite bad. The alcohol is there but the cheap booze is cheaper than the supermarket somehow.Not a separate man/woman toilet so you have to stand in line... They close early.Like:Exceptional show!Super service.Thought it was expensive paying 60$ but for what I got I thought it was really cheap.Read a few reviews an since I was here mid season/low season it's hard to know if they are right. But When I was there start of November you could definitely manage with standing. In high season I think booking table is a good idea (a bit more than twice compared to standing.)This is a must do for everybody over 18+ though.

The best!!!. What a night we had. Got three gold VIP and it was everything and more than we thought it would be. Friendly staff brought me drinks whenever mine was empty and the show...I have seen a lot of shows as I am from NYC but this topped them all. A must do!!!!!

Good night, however VIP not really VIP!! . Visited Coco Bongo on a Saturday evening, show starts around 10.30am - 11am. We paid for a VIP ticket which was double the cost of the regular ticket, we did still have to wait in line, however did avoid the MASSIVE regular entry queue. Once in the club you had to manoeuvre through narrow corridors filled with bodies trying to push through to the actual show, shots and drinks were handed out during the shove - fortunately! We finally got to the main show and the room was much smaller than expected. There is seating all around the room at an elevated level for VIP and this was jam packed!!! It certainly did not make you feel like a VIP and we actually seen several people complaining and leaving the club, due to this issue. The venue allow for far too many people than can actually fit!Within the VIP section we were sat very close to the bar and there is a waiter service, we tipped our waiter as soon as arriving and he kept drinks on our table all evening!The show was good and we did enjoy the night, everyone has so much fun.During intervals - which they have regularly, they do ask girls to get up and dance and video them on the big screen - which I did and it was a laugh! I was glad we experienced this night, however did feel it was overpriced (although I am glad we done VIP just for the fact you have a seat and waiter service, as the whole venue is packed out!), although doubtful we would return.
Anne mac. This place is amazing.payed for vip which was really good.own table own waiter and all the drink you could ask for
Coco Bonkas. An amazing night out wish we had one in England - we went last year and couldn't wait to go back again this year

Brilliant show. The show and performance from all those involved was amazing. Tickets into coco bongos and transport was included would definitely pay for gold band even tho it was cramped it was better than not being able to move on the floor was so much people. It was a bit to cold inside the club. Was sold this night out in bahia coba by Alex he was so nice he also took his time to say hello everyday and even after we had been to the show came and asked us the next morning how everything went he went the extra mile thanks for such good service Alex :)
It's a must!. Vegas show/ rave party/ cirque de solidly. It's a must...splurge on the VIP it's worth it! Michal Jackson, Madonna and other impersonations are great!
Great night out. Get goldmember ticket so you have a great view and are not squashed in crowd. Waiter service too is great. No standing at bar

Fantastic atmosphere. We booked this with thomsons the very next morning after we arrived at our hotel as it sells out so quickly. We didnt get booked in until 11 days into our 2 week holiday, it is just so popular. We did the gold V.I.P. package which was travel and unlimited drinks all night and supposedly good seats with views, I was unlucky and had to stand all night as my seat was behind a tree but it didn't stop me enjoying it. The atmosphere is so good it just entices you to get involved, balloons and glitter raining down everywhere. The acts are really good and worth the wait in between.Be careful not to buy the shots off the girls who come round $ 5 a time U.S. dollars. Luckily I already knew this by reading trip advisor before I went but one unlucky man in front of me was being pestered after he took one and already spent his money.They will take photos of you and charge $20, but I got a t-shirt as a souvenir for roughly £15 from the shop.We got back to our hotel safely at about 4.30am

Phenomenal cabaret show/ club!. It's easy to see why this is such a popular and must-see event, with over 20 mini cabaret style performances showcasing aerial acrobatics and musical shows executed in a very vibrant and energetic way. My only criticism would be the long queues and the overcrowdedness, the venue was practically bursting at the seams with people, it's very difficult to move around let alone dance and trying to get the unlimited drinks at the bar proved to be a nightmare. We ended up tipping a waiter to keep getting our drinks for us all night and Javier just kept them coming and was very attentive, thank you :) We went during the weekend of the day of the dead festivities (Halloween) and the atmosphere was brilliant!!!!!
Part of a pub crawl . Booked this as part of our pub crawl. 2 hours in coco bongo! Great place, great entertainment! Very busy! But well worth it for a night out! Wish we'd had longer than 2 hours!

night out from the hotel. We fancied a night out to get away from the entertainment from our hotel and this was the perfect solution. We paid for a vip ticket which included a visit to two other bars. It is pricey but well worth it for a good night out. We were in a roped off area which was high up, but gave excellent viewsYou get a waiter for your own section and he is great at bringing regular drinks , plus refreshing ones that get a little warm. Make sure you tip him at end of night ! You will get pestered to have your photo done, but they are a nice keepsake. The show is excellent. Really good fun and the atmosphere inside is great

Great Night Out ...... It really is a brilliant night out , you will not be disappointed , we had the gold tickets so we had seating and drinks included all night. I would say it was worth the extra few dollars ($30). We went during the week and it was fully booked & a great atmosphere.Enjoy your night !

A MUST GO . Better than a night club this place gets super packed so go at least 40 minutes before 10pm to get in , the music is great and the show is awesome you can see the singers live imitating the video that is on the back screen they are really acting the part with the same outfits and everything , worth every penny
Really fun! For all ages!. Great shows and good music and drinks. The tickets are not expensive for what you get. It is an unforgettable experience. Really fun. You gotta go!

Great night. We went her after a pub crawl. A buzzing atmosphere very full. We were on a balcony our only issue 1 mens and 1 female toilet very tight and uncomfortable...............obv when drinking a decent toilet is advisable. Balloons given out full screen to see everything and also a personal waiter to our balcony of about 100 people no drink issues
Night Out. Went to Coco Bongo again which still has an amazing show however you need to keep hold of your drinks as my daughter had hers spiked
Xoxo this!. Well it was a great place to spend a few hours - lots of peopleWatching and drinking and dancing! Loved it!

Wow. Just wow.. We went on a weekend to see the show. Vip/gold is definitely the way to go. Drink service, eagle eye view of the show not seen from the floor. Comfortable seats. Regular access gets you standing room only. The show is phenomenal. Definitely worth a look.

You can't miss this . This was recommended to us by another family member and it is a must see. The best comparison is Broadway meets Cirque de Soleil. The entertainment is everywhere. Yes it is crowded but that should be expected. The energy and entertainment there is incredible. We will glad go back and see another show.

OMG!!! MUST DO IN MEXICO!!!. For 18+ - this is truly an amazing and incredible experience. Pay for the VIP package in order to obtain the best experience in Mexico....I've never seen anything like it! It's absolutely brilliant!!!!

Mental fun.. WOW. Get the gold member wrist band and prepare to dance and party for a few hours. Great drinks all night excellent waiting staff and a show like nothing else. I've not danced so much in years. I had heard that oxygen is regularly pumped into the air and I can believe it. Every now and then I'd flag and sit down, then suddenly I was up and jumping again. Good job my missus was ere to escort me back to the car to get home at around 4am. Again, UAU!
Pleasantly surprised. The show was good and made the visit worth it. Don't opt for VIP or all u can drink. But the show was entertaining and made it worth it!

Overrated. Beware!!! This place is highly overrated. Unless you pay for VIP to get a table and a bottle service, you will hardly enjoy this place. I can't believe that CNN rated this a top travel place to visit!?1. This place is super crowded!!! To the point that people are pushing and barely have any place to walk. It's like sardines fest. It's called a nightclub with no place to dance at all!!! IT's too bad because they do play some good music. There are three levels to watch the show, the ground floor, with bottle service area where people are seated, the second floor with more tables for bottle service and the third floor for standing.2. I do not think this is worth $75 even for all inclusive. We paid that much to watch the show at the standing area on the ground floor. We got there pretty early so we were happy that we were able to get a spot by the elevated bottle service area, but as the crown came, it has gotten really congested and overly packed. We can barely move. We barely got drinks as it was so hard to order anything from the server due to the noise and the pushing crowd. So overall we were only able to get 2 drinks each for $75!!! Not worth it.3. The performers were amazing! The entire show was fun but was really hard to enjoy. In addition, the amount of confetti they use is highly excessive and dangerous. the mix of alcohol and paper confetti in a super crowded room just screams red flag to me. The worst part of this place is that there is only one exit with a non-visible exit sign! It's crazy dangerous!!! It was pretty upsetting to me, I feel like I got ripped off because we stood for 5 hours fighting the crowd for the spot we are standing on while trying to enjoy the show. We can't even get drinks! I don't think the whole experience is worth $75, but if you really want to experience this place, I suggest you pay for a bottle service. But again, I don't think that this is worth $100+ for an average show. I might as well spend my $100+ to Cirque du Soleil which will give me comfortable seats and enjoy high-end acrobatic show. I was glad I was able to experience Coco Bongo but I don't think that I will come here again.
Playa visit. Great fun, songs get you dancing, crazy crowded but lots of fun. Late night, but time flies by. Stand all night wear comfortable shoes.

Enjoyable but over hyped. We went last night as a gold member, not really knowing what to expect I read the review on here. We got there for 9.45 having getting a taxi there as the coach would be leaving later than we though.Once in, a drink was given although I still no idea what it was? You were shown through to the club area and I was surprised how small it was. We were shown to the second level and I thought we had paid for a table! Nope we ended up on a stool with a ledge, not happy, I asked to be moved but we were told tables were for groups of four.My husband must have had the worse seat in the place, all the greeted him was wooden posts!! For a £130 I felt we had been ripped off. Your much better if you can afford to go VIP but again that doesn't compensate for the size of the club.We then waited 1 and 1/2 hours before anything happened. Once it did it started to buzz. The highlight of the night was the dwarf in the entertainers group, had me inhisterics abousoulty brilliant. Never laughed so much the entertainment was good but I'm not sure about the boast of being better than Las Vegas??? Shows in London take some beating too. But we enjoyed it all the same. Then there were the bits in between the entertainment that, well if your an exhibitionist, you would be in your element and believe me people certainly played up to the camera's, boobs and all, again that was funny at times as some of the punters thought they were the entertainment. Drinks were nothing special, in fact only had 6 weak vodkas, service was iffy at that.1 toilet for ladies and 1 for gents, for a club that busy, not good. It was something we had to do while hear but I wouldn't go again.Jim Carrey, it needs more material in it for the show element. ,

Fantastic but very small wear dark clothes. We went on a 3 bar pub crawl first with thompson rep Then at 11 onto coco bongo we has reserved area at the very top of club. One ladies toilet really small. Drinks are thrown around due to people dancing.the act was fantastic although we has limited viability. They try and give you free alcoholic drinks however ask for what you want you will get it. My daughter thought it would all be youngsters in the but she was wrong their were oldies enjoying g themselves. I wod recommended however go without reps as they were very self indulgent enjoying g themselves and getting smashed. Book direct.

The best show ive seen in years. This was the most unique show ive every seen. The intertainment never stopped. Having waiters fight the crowd for you was a plus because it can be crowded. I would go again when we visit Playa Del Carmen again.

You Must Not Miss Going Here it's Fantastic. we were picked up from our hotel at around 21.40 and taken straight to the venue and returned to our around 04.00. the coco bongo rep took us straight in as we had gold membership so we bypassed the large queue outside and directed us to our table right next to the bar,where we had our own waiter all night.The shows were brilliant and well performed especially the trapeze artists who flew very close to where you were sitting.on gold membership you get premium spirts and beers,you only get local ones if you do not have gold membership and have to queue outside for a long time,so i recommend paying the extra for gold as it is well worth it.this is a place you do not want to miss going to visit,and is owned by the actor jim carrey

Night out. Absolutely bloody loved our night out it's a must if going to Mexico VIP is definitely best, it is by far the best show /disco and the staff at not do enough for you as soon as your drink is empty you have another. Also they get the public involved in the show we was buzzing the next day it was that good X

The "ULTIMATE" Club Experience . Well what can I say...Everyone back in the UK that had been had said that we must go here, and we did!! This place is unbelievable and I must say that this was the Best Club Entertainment Experience Ever! We went with a party of around 10 that was booked via our Hotel. We didn't go VIP and we weren't disappointed. We paid $70 US each and still had a fantastic time! We went on a Monday night so it wasn't at Capacity!! I've been told they hold 1200 but can hold 1500 on Wknds. We were at stage level and had table service which was unlimited drinks! It started at approx 11.30 and we left at approx 3.30am. A great show for all ages, take some ID just in case you look under 18. Full Bag check done on entrance! Dress casually, it's really cool in there as they have A/C on. A fantastic night and one I'll always remember!!

Wicked night. This was our second visit to CoCo Bongo with the first being in 2012 and it didn't disappoint. As with the first we did the VIP package and would recommend it as the view we had was really good opposite the stage and all you can drink with waiter service is a must. The show throughout was outstanding with many friends that come with us saying it was the best night they have ever had.

bonkers and brilliant. The entertainment at Coco Bongo is fantastic, particularly the regular acts. There's a great atmosphere and at several points the servers, shot girls, and staff do group routines which is funI've seen half the show once and saw it all the second time, I certainly enjoyed seeing the same thing more than once, but it's up to you if you enjoy a multiple visitI went on the special Thomson/Tui "Silver Ticket". It's $25 cheaper than Gold and you get ALL the same perks as Gold, except you stand on a terrace and not sit at a table. You'll need energy to stick out the night, but your drinks are all free and if your server is as good as ours was (Juan) they'll just keep replacing them for you. The only issue is that the Silver ticket was only for a Tuesday, so it wasn't at it's busiest. Our terrace was quiet and quite cold with the air con, so I'd imagine busier would be better

Great Show. This is my second time at a Coco Bongo show but my first in Mexico. The show was amazing and as good as I remember from my first experience. We got the VIP package and it was worth it. We didn't have to wait in line to get in, which they are long. Our own personal waiter and table was a plus. I would recommend anyone looking for a great time to go see the show.
Nice over loaded. The place was packed We couldn't move and we where very disappointed ,we stayed for one or two show and we left ,if you want to enjoy the place take the v.i.p section

sardines in a tin springs to mind. booked this on recommendations from friends plus my wife really wanted to see this Las Vegas style show.We got the gold membership passes and we're expecting a table for the two of us plus free drink service and quick entry into the venue. well we got pretty much a quick entry met with a shot of tequila and escorted through this rat run to our seating area and at this point is IMO is where I wanted to leave within 5 minutes of entry.The place was really dark and packet already with punters ,we along with all other gold members were lead through this place by a guy with a little torch up to the 2nd level where our seats were.The 2nd floor is as best described as a very tight balcony where you were sat on a small square stool which were rammed together , no room to swing a cat .your table was but a bit ledge in front of you and when everyone was in and sat down you were practically sitting on the next persons lap.absolutely disgusting that we paid good money to be rammed in like sardines In a tin .it was that tight .you were constantly being nudged and knocked by people walking behind you as there was absolutely no room to move considering the amount of people rammed into that place .god knows where the fire exits were in event of an emergency. so your expected to sit here for 5 hours like this!drinks were average ,only served sol beer the wife only had vodka and coke the show when it started was OK tbh I did enjoy that but because of the conditions we were put in I really hated being there but the wife was enjoying it ..just.as the night wore on the amount of people leaving was staggering and must of felt the same as we did .on the plus side tho it did free up a bit room for us .Would I go again or recomend it .....NO .......wouldn't go near that place if I was given free tickets

If you've gone once, don't go again.. I went once in 2011 and returned again this year, I was annoyed to find that the majority of the show was the exact same as 5 years ago. Save your money and time.

Fun to go to ONCE. We went as a large group of 60+ seasoned adults & had a blast. I personally don't drink much, but I think most who go there love the unending stream of booze, loud music, big screen showing famous acts, lights & dancing. I'm usually in bed by 9ish, but stayed there til 3:00 am because of the oxygen they kept pumping into the crowd to keep us alert. It was quite a spectacle I don't need to see again, but I do admit it was fun.

Great fun. Booked through the hotel with pick up and drop off included had a great night altogether.More than accommodating for my sister who attended with crutches. They made sure she was seated and not queueing for a long time.

A must go !!. My husband and I just got back from Mexico for our honeymoon and Coco Bongos was somewhere that I really wanted to go and I'm so glad that we did!Brilliant night. We paid $130 each for the gold package where you skip the cues in and get a table with a waiter and all inclusive drinks all night. We had great seats where we could see all the acts but to be honest most of the time we were on our feet dancing. Drinks were flowing, we had heard horror stories from people in our hotel about things they do to the ice so just to be careful my husband stuck to bottled beer and I made sure I asked for no ice in my drinks. All the acts were great, from Freddie Mercury, The Mask, SpiderMan, MJ, to musicals like Chicago. I was worried it was going to be a really long night as it doesn't stop till 3.30am but the first time I looked at the time was when the last act was over and this was about 2.45am. The night flew by. We decided to get a cab back to our hotel at 3am rather than waiting for the coach to come at 3.40am and then go round the other hotels. There are lots of cabs outside and it only cost us $25. This was a great night and I recommend people to go!!
Amzing. Crazy, insane and somewhat bewildering. A night we will never forget and would do again without hesitation!

Gold Package - Amazing experience!! . Me and my boyfriend LOVED CoCo Bongos! We had such an incredible time.We booked the gold member package which gave us VIP seats and unlimited drinks and waiter service. Definitely worth the money. The show was unbelievable, and great for ALL ages, we had older couples of 60+ on our coach and they loved it as much as we did.I even got asked to dance on stage at the end of the show, which I obliged after coaxing other ladies from my group to go up too.10pm pick up from our hotel Grand Sirenis, takes approximately 25 mins to get there, and they return you back about 4:30 am. The time will fly by and you will not want to leave. Go and have a great night, you won't be disappointed!

Fantastic night!. Coco bongo plays out parts of musicals and has full stage shows and costumes to make you feel involved. It is a great night and there is always some entertainment going on. There is lots of aerial stunts which are very impressive. There are many tiers that you can pay for to get the best out of the night but being on the ground floor was good fun a you are in on all the action and among the crowds. We had to go back for a second time as we enjoyed it that much the first time!

Amazing night out! . I must admit I thought this would be pretty naff but as our second time to Mexico, we wanted to go and experience it and the hype. We booked a VIP Goldmember ticket with Thomas Cook as part of their TC project bar crawl - 2 bars, then ending up at Coco Bongo for the rest of the night. What a great show/experience. The VIP access is definitely worth it. We had a private balcony with great views of the stage, private bar with branded drinks and personal waiter who was excellent and kept the drinks flowing. The show was great fun and I enjoyed every minute. It is totally cheesy but well worth the trip. The show is mimed, but is pretty well choreographed and there is a great party atmosphere. The only negative as they currently advertise Rolling Stones as part of the show, but there was no Rolling Stones tribute at all during our night which was a shame.

If you like to party this is the place. Coco Bongo is a place to party when you're in Mexico. The music is loud the show is fantastic and the drinks flow freely. Once you go you will know how a sardine feels. It's a wild place Full of fun and good times. everyone should experience Coco Bongo at least once in their lifetime. Go and have a great time you will not regret it
Very nice!.. My husband and I we spent an amazing experience in one of the most beautiful attractions of the city. Here the fun is the top with your friends during all the night long!

Fun Entertainment. My husband & I and the other couple we were with decided to go to Coco Bongo Saturday night of our trip (we are all in our mid-40's). We bought a table with bottle service (Gray Goose), it was an expensive night but very well worth the money to have a table, if you don't pay for a table you have to stand for 5-6 hrs & wait in line forever. With bottle/table service there's no line. Amazing shows & night club, we had a great time. It's been along time since we got home at 4:15 a.m.
Katie. Such an amazing time here with my friend. So much variety with the music and shows it didn't get boring at all! I'd love to go again, you could never get bored of this!

WICKED!!!. What a party!! EXCELLENT SHOW!! Except it is over capacity and extremely packed! We bought the gold package, because it was sold to us with the assumption we would have a table with people serving our " table ". We were sat at a ledge, with no room to move. I ended upStanding for the night so the guests we were with would have more room. One of our "stools" had a view blocked by a huge pole! When I first got there, i was extremely disappointed with our seats and how over packed it was. My first thought was, the danger everyone would be in if there were ever a fire or emergency that broke out there. I am giving it 5 stars for the show! The serving staff were also great! But the over capacity is a real concern.

Great Night Out. You must book GOLD/VIP....All drinks are included so give your waiter a good tip at the start of the night and he will look after you and may even get you involved in the show! Get drunk, enjoy yourself, enjoy the show and have a laugh. It is not cirque or the west end but it is a nightclub with a difference! Definitely recommended to groups, young people who want to enjoy themselves and those who have not experienced Coco Bong before!

Amazing...You have to go!! Whatever your age!!!. Even by my slightly eccentric mind, Coco Bongo I'd absolutely mental!! From Micheal Jackson to Madonna with a bit of Bruno Mars, Spider-Man flying around and a live version of Tron..... Absolutely bonkers! It's a late night but worth it.

All your $ worth and more. Be smart buy no line included. Every time you walk by this place there's a line. Luckily we didn't have to wait. Friendly all around the show could easily be in vegas. Obviously packed so might want to get a table if that's not your thing.

Wow . Wow what a place probably the most amazing show I have ever seen funny and exciting all sorts of aerial fun and singing and dancing we went vip so it was unlimited drinks and seats which is the best way to go Not for anyone who doesn't like late nights at the show doesn't start till about 23:30 and finished around 02:30

I'm way to old for this! . Loud music, bad drinks and way to many people. Couldn't hear myself think. Drinks where not good and your stuffed in like sardines. I would say best for your 18-20 who like that sort of thing.

Best night ever. My advice book ahead it was sold out the night we went the only reason we got in was pure luck .and the help of the most awesome guy working in our hotel .we went vip 400 for the both of us and worth every penny .the vibe and entertainment was amazing .any chance we have to go again would be top on our list .

Crazy night!. What an amazing night. We got the gold member tickets so we had our own seated area, table service and included drinks. Our waiter was on the ball and after ordering our first drinks we never had to ask, he just kept bringing them. The club is packed out and so the atmosphere was amazing. There are short performances throughout the evening with music in between. Some of the performances were impersonators and some were dance performers. They were all really professional. I really got into the party spirit and even ended up having a dance on the stage at the end.Transport to and from the club was included in the price of the ticket. The only downside was the terrible hangover I had the next day!!If you like to party, Coco Bongo is a must!!

Top top night. Coco Bongos is amazing just one thing wrong the time goes so quick.top service by Christopher at the bar can't fault him anyone visiting the riviera maya take a trip here you won't be disappointed thanks for the memory Coco Bongos wahoooo
Amazing show. Paid 65 USD per person with a reserved table and a bottle of Belvedere vodka.3 and a half hours show/party.Had lots of fun.Very recommended

The BEST club ever!!!!. We booked the Gold members entry fee for $130 per person... That included a round trip transfer from our hotel to Coco Bongo, express entry, a table with seats and table service. My only issue is that there was only one ladies toilet on each floor for such a large venue. Show and service was brilliant!!!

Amazing Night of Entertainment. What can i say it lives up to all expectations. The staff were friendly, the waiters hard working and the entertainment absolutely out of this world. If you can afford it get a VIP pass and you will be over the moon as you see straight on to the stage and the entertainers tend to hang around that area. I would certainly go again if i return to Mexico.

Coco bongo. Great night but felt a bit hemmed in as everyone packed in like sardines! They were very accommodating for me as a wheelchair user who a ramp into the club and ensured I had a space with a view but without being in people's way. Great night

Best night of my life. If you go here you have to get the VIP package. Guaranteed seating and a waiter who'll never let your glass get empty. The show itself is amazing, the skill from the performers will leave you speechless as they fly above your heads in synchronised skill. We partied till 4am, atmosphere was 2nd to none and we didn't want it to finish. Don't think about it if you're in Playa, just go....trust me you won't regret it.

Super fun! But Don't pay extra for the VIP. I went to coco Bongo with a large group. We were at a convention in Playa del Carmen so there were people from 22 to 55 in our group. We payed extra for a VIP section because they told us we would get a special place with 6 tables. But the VIP is just some stairs were you stand and have no space for dancing and the tables are really tiny. A lot of the eldest just stayed for 20 minutes and they left. The show is great and we had a lot of fun but I really don't recommend paying the VIP ticket.

A lot of fun:). I really enjoyed the show. A lot of songs, which everybody knows. Lots of laughs and fun:)
You wont get borred in there. Usually I dont like these kind of shows but this one was a great experience.

Disappointing. Having allready been to coco bongos in cancun found this event disappointing. It's only a quarter of the side of the one in cancun and the entertainment not so good. If you haven't been before you'll probably enjoy. Very crowded though and clostraphobic.

Excellent Fun. A great show for adults. It is a really good fun packed night. Normally a really long Queue to get in even with pre bought tickets. Once you are in if you have an area to yourself for your group that is great but generally you are squashed in like sardines. The drinks are brought to you but they are very bland or not the right taste that you would be used to. It is still a really enjoyable night. A night not to be missed during your time in Playa Del Carmen.
Worth the wait.. Prepare for long lines to get in. There's plenty to see outside while yiu wait in line. Time will go by quickly. The drinks are good and the atmosphere is excellent. You will enjoy.
Coco Bongo property. This club was so much fun! Reminds me of the clubs in Vegas. There was never a dull moment here. Definitely one of the biggest clubs in Playa del Carmen.

Promised Great Seats but - NOT!. Okay, we went to this place for a stagette party and the tour guide that booked it said we would have a balcony all to ourselves - BUT we DIDN'T. We were ground floor and the stage in this place is quite high above the crowd so, trying to look up all night made the neck a little sore. We were promised (for the amount we paid) to be on one of the 3 or 4 levels of balconies, this was very disappointing. I do have to give Kudos to the staff in this facility as they made sure our drinks were never empty, they paid very close attention to this. For the show (from what I saw) looked to be amazing, lots of hard work on their part. I would love to actually see the whole show from a better view. When you go, make sure to get seating in one of the balconies.

Mad! Amazing, but mad!. I'm not one for late nights out really, so when I was told this party started at 11pm I was unsure!But from 11 until 2:30 they had my attention almost constantly!We paid extra for gold member, which meant seating and drinks all night, but well worth it!It seems pricey up front, but personally I think it's worth every penny! You'll not see anything like this show anywhere!

Crazy party and show, but not cheap. Coco Bongo is a special experience indeed. Not just a night club but also a never ending show with dancers and acrobats who pay tributes of movies and artists of all times and genres (I remember seeing cabaret, guns and Roses, Elvis, Micheal Jackson, Pirates of the Caribbean, Spiderman). The downside is that it's really crowded, and pretty expensive even for the cheapest tickets for about 70$ (yeah there's a show, but it's still playback and lip sync). Drinks are supposed to be included, but it's very hard to actually get service, so unless you're in the VIP section, don't count on it too much.
Packed in like sardines!!!. Coco bongos is soooooo much fun and the show is great. The drinks are not great and you are just squashed in still enjoyed it though.

Crazy night out. We had to book online once in resort as Thomson excursion was fully booked. We discovered we actually got the VIP package for $10 dollars less at $145 each. (Not a cheap night but all drinks included). We were still booked on the excursion mini bus from the hotel at no extra charge...After further hotel pick ups We were dropped off 2 blocks away, walked up to club and it was quite scary how busy it was. If you book on line make sure you take copy of all your passports and credit card that it was paid on. Once in there it's so packed in, even in VIP you are squeezed up on the balconies, absolutely not suitable for anyone disabled. I was a little scared by it all but you could see security was well on top of everything. Do not even take a paracetamol with you, it will be confiscated along with selfie sticks.The show itself was amazing, a must see, the waiter brings your drinks to the table and as long as you don't have annoying people standing in your view it should be a great night. There is only one toilet on the balcony area but this is kept immaculate by Saidy, well done.

Mixed reviews . So I went to coco bongo as a solo traveller on a Friday night and had mixed feelings about my experience. I thought the show itself was amazing and therefore for that reason I say it's a must see!! HOWEVER, I was surrounded by sleezy men (mainly those on vacation too may I add), it was too overcrowded (I ended up finding a nice spot literally outside the door) and the quality of the alcohol was very poor. I also found the staff team very hasty and it was very annoying to have assistants constantly sweeping the floor during the show. Bar staff were very quick though I give them that. My advice would be to buy your own drinks/bottles when you get in there, or have a few nicer drinks before going in otherwise you may find the whole experience overwhelming!!

Excellent night out. We went on a Monday night with gold tickets, the show was absolutely amazing, nothing I've ever seen before. In the gold section we had brilliant views of the stage and were constantly brought premium drinks from our waiter who we tipped at the start of the evening. Show started at around 11.30 and didn't finish until 3ish. All ages were there as there was someone there for everyone to enjoy
Micasa Holiday 2016. Great party atmosphere! I will definitely come back and enjoy the music and convience near my hotel.

EXCELLENT!! MUST GO IF IN MEXICO!!!. We booked this through our tour operator Thomson so price included transfers to and from hotel as well as entry. This has got to be one of the best nights out I have ever had and I am quite a party animal. Granted it is busy but that just adds to the fun. The live acts are 2nd to none with streamers and balloons etc coming from the ceiling into the crowd. Waiters and waitresses are constantly on hand to take drink orders. Be prepared to not get back to your hotel until the next day as you will be enjoying yourself too much. Miss it-Miss out!!!

Great night out!. I'd recommend first and foremost to get the gold member tickets to get to the vip area. Not only do you get the best view but it totally improves your experience compared to just getting regular tickets. They change the theme each evening so you never know what live show you will get to watch. Highly recommended
Party. If you want a big, great and crazy party you need go to coco bongo, the show is amazing!! Its a little expensive but is it worth it
EXCELLENT. we had the pleasure of seeing this show if u in playa del carmen THIS SHOW A MUST SEE NOT TO BE MISSED

Show is great. BUYER BEWARE!! VIP IS NOT WHAT THEY SAY ITS VERY CROWDED AND TIGHT WITH SPACE.. Our waiter Williams was amazing and trying to help us with the people next to us who were very drunk and acting like jerks all night. The private bathroom is also not so private anyone on that level was using it but it was kept VERY clean.

Fantastic night out!. Absolutely amazing show, would recommend going for the gold VIP package if available! It is a Vegas style show with tribute acts, dancers, acrobats - amazing! This can be booked a s apart of a bar crawl package via your rep which is also well worth the money as these excursions are all inclusive of alcohol too!!!

going loco in coco bongo. being disabled was a serious problem at coco bongo. squashed on a little table. unable to move. promised an excellent night. turned into a night in hell.golden ticket holders were not specially looked after although some appeared to be. great night for young fully mobile people. we were wrongly advised. it would have been great if i were 30 years younger. sorry coco bongo. not for me.

Great night out!. We bought tickets direct from Coco Bongos (there is a stall open there during the day), as it is located not far from where we were staying and 5th Ave.Having had a look on their website, gold/VIP tickets had sold out for the night we wanted to go - however, at 150 US Dollars, we wouldn't have gone for them even if they were available. We bought standard tickets at 1,250 mexican pesos (half the price of Gold), roughly £50, and were not dissapointed.We got there early, around 10pm, and were one of the first in, so got drinks and found a place to perch near the back (also managed to sit down here for a bit so was worth going early to get this spot). We had waiter service all night long and he remembered what we were drinking so kept us topped up frequently. A lot of other reviewers seem to think you have to have Gold tickets to get waiter service - not true. However, the quality of the vodka wasn't great - if I went again I'd probably stick to beer. Included in the price though so can't complain too much anyway.The show itself was fantastic - amazing costumes, dancing, singing etc - never seen anything quite like it!Overall I would definitely recommend going, but having read other reviews don't bother buying Gold tickets and get there early.

got to go. this place is amazing worth every penny if your a little older like me i would say go vip ro get a golden ticket as you get a seat, we didn't get the best seats in the house but what a brilliant night.

What an experience! . Wow! A must see and a fantastic experience! People of all ages were there - we purchased tickets with coco bongo reps that came to our hotel for cheaper than the Thomas cook rep, a better package and better availability also. We had VIP where you received a bottle of vodka or whisky and free drinks all night - a table, best view and que jump. Worth paying the extra money for it! The show was just a bit of everything - I don't think you could be disappointed. The show started at 11:30pm and finished at 3am. A late night but so entertaining with a massive variety of entertainment.

Glynn rowett . Best night out (ever) must see been here three times now and gets better every time. Starts late about 12 of clock and ends around four. You should pay a little more to be upstairs on balcony as it's pretty crowded down at the bottom. Plus you get waiter service and free drinks. It's a nightclub with a difference dance acts and trapeze shows all into one fantastic

3rd Coco Bongo trip!. This was our 3rd time to CoCo Bongo's whilst on holiday and it didn't let us down!We took my parents so we upgraded to the VIP package and it was well worth it for the extra few dollars!The waiters were great - tip them and your drinks will a flow!They even got me up on the main stage to dance with the professionals which was amazing to see from behind the scenes.From where we were stood we watched the whole production and coordination of dancers etc and this place is amazing - which i am sure no one really notices as they are too busy drinking and dancing but seriously credit where credits due guys !

Best club ever!. We visited coco bongo while on our honeymoon in Mexico! I wish so much that the uk had a club like this, hands down the best club I've ever been to. The shows were great, always something catching your attention in between shows whether it's dancing on the bar, balloon cannons or beetlejuices/the mask walking around. I would definitely recommend the gold VIP ticket also, saved us from going to the bar as it was all inclusive waiter service and much better seats, it's not much extra but definitely worth it!

Not the best... drink before hand so your in the mood for dancing!. After being recommended to go Coco Bongo me and my husband were fairly disappointed. The build up is great with good music etc. We have the Silver pass, as there were no Gold ones available, when booking through Tomson (TUI). These are standing tickets. Which I would recommend standing on the front row of you can as we were not as lucky and we could not see that well. Plus the air con was so low and we were freezing!!! Our waiter was great however. We were expecting a really good show, and to be honest we just thought it was really cheesy and not very well choreographed. Recommendations before going:Get drunk, and go for seated tickets for the best views I reckon.

Coco Bongo - Playa De Carmen, Mexico. Wow, you want to go out of your resort and go clubbing/dancing and socialize and drinks. this is definitely the place to go. We brought our kids so we tagged along but decided to go in. This was an experience on it's on. It was a bit pricey but what isn't. Definitely worth going. You will have an amazing time.
Coco bongos. Great place can't believe it till you see it!very different to anything else I've ever been too but been twice now and would go again brilliant

Amazing . wow what a place from the minute you walk in you get a buzz from the atmosphere everyone dancing lights flares etc the music is brilliant with everyone singing the show is brilliant so realistic. I was apprehensive as to last till 3am but before you know it, it's closing time best evening ever but book gold member with seating and "bus boy" to get your drinks delivered. Not too be missed good for all ages x

Craziness in playa. . Went here for my wife's birthday and had a great time, got there around 10:30pm the shows start around that time, we got a little table but it was good people next to us where having a great time and the vibe was like that all over the place, what time did we get back to the hotel...who knows we had a blast.

Not impressed. Firstly I must say the show was fantastic from what I could see ....we came a long way from the uk Aswell as travelled an hour from our hotel, when we got there we wasn't told we had to pay more for the gold membership and I understand that our rep should've told us that but it was lucky we had a credit card with us, we paid a lot of money and we was not happy to be sat right near the stage where we couldn't see anything, right under the air conditioning so I was shivering all night, and kept getting hit by staff going on and off the stage. When a staff member ( the mask ) came over to me he felt I was cold but I was never offered to be moved even though we was one of the first people in and there was plenty of spaces but never got offered. We paid the gold membership so we could get our own seated area with our own waiter and we only saw the waiter like 3 times the whole night and got a stool on a bannister. Suggestion you shouldn't sit people right near the stage past the stairs it should have been for staff. Or if you going to, at least sit people that are first in more central first then fan them out.

Fantastically fun and zany!. This was a fantastic night out away from our quiet resort. It was good value for money and we met some incredible people both tourists and locals.I have to say however, the ladies in the toilets were a bit rude! I didn't have change on me and decided to wipe my own hands so they started shouting and laughing at me which I found a little unnerving but I'd had one drink too many and found it funny in the end.I recommend by the more expensive tickets with seats and waiter service. That way if you want to get in amongst the crowds on the floor you can or if you want to sit back and take a break with a strong drink, a giggle and a little dance, you can! You'll come out of Coco Bongos wanting to buy another ticket!

Crazy night!. Had a great night at Coco Bongo but it was scarily busy! Really enjoyed the trapeze artists, amazing. If you get the chance, go, but make sure you go VIP and request good table in advance.

Great Experience. We went to Coco Bongos as part of our honeymoon and what an experience! This was by far my partner's favourite trip the entire fortnight. We booked the Gold Member package and we're pleased we did. They really pack people into the place but we had good seats and a good view of the whole performance.Well worth a visit if you want to see something completely different!
Very good party and show. I recommed it for everyone, it was a very good party and nice show. Taxi from Grand Palladium to Coco Bongo costs max 20 USD

Dance your butt off.. We were packed in like sardines. Spend the extra to get a table or else you are on the floor with no seat and no designated table. If you want to dance and meet people then the floor is perfect. Dance, dance, dance. The show was very cool and had funny parts too.

An Absolute Must. CoCo Bongo opens at 10:30 pm and ends at 4:00 am. The time will fly by and before you realize it's 4 am. We had a VIP table which includes a table and chairs with bottle service / set up and a very attentive waiter. I initially thought this was a show then thought maybe a dance club well, it's BOTH. the show starts and you watch and if you feel like standing up to dance, you do. There are no rules at CoCo Bongo. The girls like to stand on the bar and dance while the show is on but beware of the blast of air that blows up your dresses for all to see!!The cost for us was about $150 for VIP which was well worth the price. I've been to CCB 3 times and each time it's a little different and still a blast. You MUST go!

Great show. Really poor service. I had been to the Cancun Coco bongo 2 times. Both times I had a blast! So I figured this connected to the Cancun location, show should be good and same for the service. Well, It's been a long time that I've been treated like cattle and paid for it. As I had bought thru Rockstarcrawl and not the hotel, I wasn't allowed to goto the 2nd level with the people from the hotel I was from. I was on the main floor in a area everyone comes in. 2 hours there being bounced around like a pinball. All you can drink? 2 hours I was able to get 5 drinks, 2 got knocked out of my hand. After the 2nd time I left. If a fire marshal would seen the amount people in there, he'd say they are over the limit by 250-300. I've bounced in my younger years and I've never seen staff treat customers like this. Shows great, but if your treated like a second class person, that isn't fun.

Don't trust any of the coco bongo reps that come round the hotel pools..!. We booked a night out to coco bongos in playa del Carmel with a coco bongo rep called NELSON *BEWARE*There's a few of them that come round to your pool to sell trips and the guy we booked with was called nelson.We were told prices start from $140 for standing tickets with open bar,Or you can pay $160 for a table or $180 for a table with a bottle of grey goose.We was unsure what package we wanted but nelson said its ok we could decide on the night.So the night came and we were picked up on time from the moon palace hotel, Nelson was there to meet us and asked what we wanted to do and how we wanted to pay. We went for the $160 option which was for 2 of us with a table and a free bar all night.We paid Nelson $160 and went inside coco bongos and had a great night..!The problems only started when we came to check out of the moon palace at the end of our holiday, moon palace said we had to pay an extra $140 ??? We tried to explain what the situation was but they were not able to see our point of view and we had to pay $140, so one night at coco bongos cost us $300 for two people.. We have been ripped off so I'm just wanting to let people know not to trust the coco bongo reps that come round your hotel pool...! Especially not NELSON..!!!!

Worth a visit. Love this place it's fun and wacky. However, this was my 2nd time there and it wasn't as good as the 1st time. They could do with changing the show more often as it was exactly the same show as 2 years ago. Still a good night and worth paying the extra to go with Thomas Cook.

Not to be missed, crazy night like you've never experienced. This place makes you see and watch things you've never imaged in a night club environment, dancing, table service, shows, dancers, trapeze dancers everything you can think of is in this show, such an amazing night and doing the gold package was absolutely worth the money, I can't say the seats were great as for me to sit down I had to sit between my boyfriends legs!!! But you can get up with plenty of room to dance around and you can even go onto the main dance floor if you wanted or up on stage to dance in front of the whole of coco bongos! Once in a lifetime crazy experience that you just have todo when visiting Mexico, it will not be like anything you have ever experienced before I think there's something for all ages your not to young or to old to go there there's something for everyone. Do not miss it, and always ask the coco bongo reps rather than booking through Thomson!

Interesting!. Worth a visit if you're in the area, quite a wacky show - never know where it's going next!We had seats in the top tier so it wasn't too crowded, the ground floor however is rammed. We had drinks included and they flowed freely in exchange for the odd tip to the waiter who was covering our area. Watch out for the usual tricks with people asking if you want photos, playing drinking games - there's always a charge at the end!

Gold Member Through Thomson. We visited Coco Bongo on 15/09, a Friday night. I booked the trip through Thomson and opted for the Gold Member ticket. Worth every penny I paid! Coco Bongo sent a bus to our hotel to collect us and we were taken straight passed the long queue then taken to our 'seats'. My son has just turned 18 and was asked for ID as we entered, which was okay as we had it with us. I visited with my husband, daughter (25) and afore mentioned son (18). At first impression of entering the club it appeared a little grubby and we were worried. Our 'seats' were actually a kind of stepped bench where the man sits on the top 'shelf' and the woman sits in between his legs, as you can imagine this did not impress my son and daughter who did not sit like this my son stood on the back bench. However once the show started and the free drinks started flowing we didn't care! It was an amazing night! Dress in anything, there is no dress code. Prepare to be drunk but be aware that the shots handed out by the girls are not free. However the drinks from your waiter as a gold member are unless your drinking champagne or cognac. We left Coco Bongo at 03:30hrs and got the complimentary bus back to our hotel. The only disappointing part for us was that it was over so quickly!!

#1 thing to do in Playa del Carmen. What a wonderful time we had here, we bought the all you can drink package and got absolutely hammered which was fun. The performers are really amazing they swing from the ceiling and fly around the room while playing out scenes from popular action movies. The place does get pretty busy and going to the bathroom can get annoying. It was probably the most enjoyable night out we had in Playa del Carmen.

Surreal Night!!!!.
