I was told I had to go so I did.When we got there we had to queue up to get in and I was a bit edgy as it looked a bit seedy and uninviting (wasn't really sure what to expect).As we walked into the main area we were confronted with a load of girls dancing on a stage in the middle of the room (these were club goers). We plotted up close to the bar so as to get a drink easier (not necessary as drinks flow freely all night).Then the entertainment began, wow is all I can say.Going here should be on everybody's bucket list!!!!!Would not have missed this evening for the world.

Fun experience! Lots of people.... Nice spot, full of people. We paid $75 on the resort which included roundtrip transportation, club entry and unlimited drinks. You can also pay an extra $10 at the door for the express line. Be prepared to stand the entire night and not being able to move, because it's so many people in this place. Please go if you are interested in dancing and drinking all night. We had a good time here.

Great night . Went here VIP with my partner had a great night! Tip the waiter and you will be fed drinks all night long!! What a show the only downfall was VIP was incredibly crowded/overbooked otherwise it would have been a 5! Still..... Would defiantly visit again!

Amazing Night!. I was apprehensive before going (I'd seen some of the negative reviews on here and I'm usually asleep by the time the bus even comes to get you! ha) but I'm so pleased we went. The bus collected us at 10:00pm from our hotel, it was actually late so we got there a little later than the other buses as it was already packed when we arrived. There was no queue at all and we got straight in. We were shown to our seats really quickly - we had booked the Gold VIP Package which was well worth paying for as you get an allocated seat and all drinks included. We got a great seat directly opposite the stage but there was a row of people in front of us so we couldn't always see what was happening on the stage on the ground but we could easily move to a better vantage point. Yes, it was heaving and I definitely wouldn't have wanted to be down on the dance floor. It looked great fun but too busy for me! there were people of all ages around us all having a good time and dancing. The quality of the performers was great, the atmosphere was buzzing and our waiter was really attentive. We never had to try to get his attention. We had an absolutely brilliant night.

Absolute insanity and it was brilliant!. Genuine madness and insanity but was one of the best nights I've ever had! We visited Coco Bongo's via our Thomas Cook rep who took us on a little bar crawl first as the venue itself didn't open until after 11 pm. Our ticket took us to the third floor which was actually the perfect eye level for the stage.The performers were stunning, the pyrotechnics and lighting was amazing. Our package gave us free drinks all night and we were served by a waiter who did take a while at times but the place was rammed so it's understandable.The show offers something for everyone and after reading some reviews, I can't believe some of the rubbish people have said- everyone deserves an opinion but honestly don't miss out this show its absolutely outstanding!

Fab night out!. We bought our Goldmember tickets from a vendor in Playa del Carmen. We were a little dubious at first but the guy only took a deposit from us for reassurance. We were collected by coach from our hotel and taken to CocoBongos. I was surprised at how small the place was, not what I expected and would hate to see it on a busy weekend! We went on a Thursday (Wednesday is Ladies night and apparently gets really busy). There were lots of security checks (a good thing in my eyes) before being taken to our seated area. We were up on the centre level so had a perfect view of the stage. We had our own bar waiter and we never once had to ask for a top up! The drinks were premium and all inclusive. I would recommend paying the extra for the Goldmember tickets as I've read some bad reviews regarding the bars and not being able to get served. The show itself was amazing!! It's more cabaret/show than nightclub and definitely worth a night out here!

Awesome night out. Awesome night out! Buzzing party atmosphere, very friendly vibe. You don't have to be a youngster to go here, you don't feel out of place if you are a bit older than most club goers. Spectacular, entertaining and professional show.

Don't waste your money. Recommended by a work colleague, free drinks fabulous show. In reality dire show, warm beer and poor cocktails.This building must be the biggest fire hazard in Central America.

Great night out. I looked at some reviews just before heading out to this and wasn't sure what to expect but loved it!One previous review said it was just girls wearing very little prancing about - think we were at a different show! Yes there were girls in small costumes but the acrobatics and show was amazing. It was a number of different clips of different things from phantom of the opera to guns n roses! We had gold member tickets which I think are definitely worth the extra - we had brilliant seats which offered great views and were away from the crowds of people - although we went on a Monday so it wasn't too busy. Also skipped the queues outside!Another review mentioned the toilets - yes there is only one set of toilets but they were immaculate! There were two staff in there who would check the individual stalls before you went in.Waiters ensured the drinks were flowing and never made to wait for them.They take pictures inside with some of the characters which you can buy for $20. We bought the first one but wished we'd waited as a later one was much better Be warned its a long night - it doesn't finish till 4! So don't plan it before a busy day. Brilliant show!!

Brilliant. This is a must - absolutely brilliant, we were gold members, drinks included, also straight in, no waiting.Picked up from hotel at 9.30pm and return bus at 3.40am - the show and music was that good the time flew by,,,Highly recommend visiting here!

Excellent night. Purchased Gold tickets direct from their website after reps said Gold tickets all sold out.Walked straight in and had great seats on the first floor balcony.The waiter was great, kept the bottles of beer and shorts coming fast, never had an empty glass or bottle. Build up was great and the show was excellent too. Yes it is expensive but the experience and atmosphere was amazing and worth the money.The venue was cool, I really feel the heat but did not suffer in there. The air con was just right.

Definitely worth a visit . For years we have been coming to Mexico and finally we tried out coco bongos and we were not disappointed. We did a trip with Thomson and drinks were included. The performances and atmosphere was electric Balloons, streamers etc makes it a good laughOne word of warning is to the girls that go round giving shots - be warned they are not free- yes it is a bit of fun but very expensive Other than that it's a great night out
Great night. You just have to go & experience it. Go VIP great service. We booked direct with Coco Bongo reps on beach very helpful.

Great. We are a couple in our late forties and we enjoyed this place so much the show was amazing a bit to long maybe but still so much fun i recommend you go VIP as it's so much easier to get into the place

What a night . What a place, never seen anything like this before! You will be entertained that's for sure and no matter where you are in the club you can see what's going on as stage is high up . If you go to player del Carmel GO

Trap - over priced. Tourist trap. Instead skip the crazy lines, over priced ticket, over priced drinks and head to the local bar spots and dance to the local upbeat music rather than the American club music. Do yourself a favor and convince your overly dramatic friend who NEEDS to visit coco bongo and go for an actual fun experience in the beautiful downtown area of playa.

Best Club Ever!!!!!. Had a fab time in this club, what an awesome experience!! Paid for gold member and my glass was never empty, had great seats! Would advise you to get to the club to start queuing at 10pm to get good seats, the place fills up fast and coaches of people start getting dropped off to queue so I recommend you get there first! I really really want them to bring this club to England.......pretty pretty please?!

Very disappointing!!. Went to Coco Bongo last September and absolutely loved it. Went again, last week on the 16th September and was so disappointed - was no where near as good as the show was last year. Paid £117 each which included entrance, free bar and waiter service. The waiter was excellent but there's where it ended. The staff that were dancing on the bar were so disinterested it was shocking - last year they were very professional and just put on a real excellent performance. The show - well what show!! We just seemed to pay a hell of a lot of money to watch members of the audience dance on the bar or podium!!! I believe they are living off their previous years success.

What a let down and a health hazard! . We booked through our hotel rep as we were told that buying from coco bingo reps that go round hotels we wouldn't be guaranteed table seats! When we eventually arrived we had to wait about 20 minutes to get in. Then there was no seats. We eventually got seated at the side of the stage. My hubby sitting on normal seat stuck in corner and me on a bar stool squashed in! Couldn't see anything! It was crap! Bar staff rude! So disappointed! Poor miming! Poor show! Over packed! A real health and safety issue especially if there had been a fire!!! There is 3 balconies which were overcrowded and they were bouncing! It was pretty scary really! Waste of money! Would not recommend at all! It was nothing like we were told to expect!

Go, you will love it. What an amazing exciting place. A great show and lots of fun. We did VIP tickets at $150. Well worth it if not a teenager. You get quick access, rather than standing in line, a table, a waiter, all your drinks. Well worth it we thought. A must in Playa for grown ups. Treat yourself. Be prepared to dance.

Always, always fun .... Its very hard to please different crowds but somehow this place does it and does it well. You can see here from 20 something bachelorettes to senior couples and everything in between all having a blast. It is a show / dance club mix kind of place. Theres like 15 minutes of show and 10 minutes of varied dance music (the music energy increases trough the night). The show is very very good quality, costumes are great and in between sketches are fun. The show changes a little bit every 6 to 12 months so they include the latest pitbull song or blockbuster movie so its ok to return every once in a while (but maybe not in the same trip). Waiters and personnel is nice and attentive. Regular drinks / alcohol are included and premium drinks are on the cheap side. I really recommend this place as is very unique kind of experience, not snobby at all as dance clubs in Miami, Vegas or Ibiza. Go with an open mind and a nice attitude and allow yourself to be surprised.
Lots of fun!! . Great performances, awesome location, lotta girls, unlimited drinks , what else can you ask for! I will be back!

Must do tick of bucket list . Must see I can't begin to say how fab this show is its a must do in Mexico. For all ages above 18 never get board of this place drinks never stop flowing only down side need more toilets but if that's the only down side then it's nowt really !!its a fun packed night with laughs from the start to the finish fab entertanment except night I would always say pay a little more for the seating areas !!!! Coco bong is a must do a tick of the bucket list !!!!!

Absolute fail! . Coco bongos coach never arrived to pick us up from our holiday which had been organised by our Thomas Cook rep! Waited at our pick up point for 2h and kept being told it would be there until they realised that the coach had forgotten us! Unfortunately we never made it to coco bongo! Having received a refund we were offered free tickets to go.. but we herd from other people that in the area we were offered it is sweating hot, no air con and watered down drinks, we decided to give it a miss! Not impressed coco bongo!
Holiday. Fabulous place, such a great experience, a must do when in Mexico. Fantastic acts, all inclusive drinks. Would recommend gold membership

Amazing Night. we went on a TC package which began with drinks in two clubs first then off to Coco Bongo. We only brought the standard package, we was lead through a very packed club to the third floor. I began to think it was a big mistake as we would be standing and being on the more mature side thought we would struggle. How wrong could we be the shows were amazing and got drinks brought to us all night long by the waiter ( god knows how he remembered where we were standing) loved all the dancing and the sing alongs would definitely recommended the club but make sure you go through a rep.

coco bonkers. it was my first time, my husband and I loved it as we had a good view from balcony, near stage.however a lot of people paid same and had issues such as people standing in front of them, no room to move, had to share table even though had paid for vip, its loud crazy and fun but if you get rubbish table its not so much fun.

Crazy, Packed Party. Went on a Thursday and it was super packed! If you have never had this experience it is something to see. Prices differ based on the day that you choose to go. If you don't have VIP pay the extra $10 to skip the line!! Reps roam the local resorts and sell you tickets and transportation to and from the venue. Prices differ based on the experience. The least expensive ticket is around $60 if you want the GOLD or VIP experience then pricing starts at around $150. People pay top dollar once inside the club to try to secure a table (better known as a super small space that may or may not have seating so get there early and negotiate for your space) Drinks are included but you quickly realize that they are included b/c it's so difficult to get to the bar. With a table you get service for your drinks but of course you must tip your waiter/waitress. Overall I'm glad I went just to say I had the experience. I'm early 30s so I'm not a big fan of being shoulder to shoulder in the club and getting drinks spilled all over my clothing, so i'll pass on going again but I do not regret the experience.

Another great night at this place . My second visit to coco bongos at playa del Carmel .went with an organised trip with TUI. Bit of a pub crawl before hand and then on to bongos .....this is a cracking night out even if your not a big drinker ( I'm a light weight) ..if you get the chance ...it's a must do .......
superb. If thinking about it dont think about it DO IT !!Great show Elvis,Queen, Madonna, Michael Jackson to name but a few it never stopped

Great show, great atmosphere, great fun, but still room for improvement.. I'd been dying to come here ever since we booked our holiday to mexico.We booked through thomson so got our transport included.Gold member is definitely worth the extra.Pick up from our hotel was about 9.45pm and we had a lovely coco bongos rep member on our coach with us who sold beer and margarita's on the way for $2 to get you in the mood! great touch. He explained thoroughly the pick up time and place and what to do when entering the club. Gold member means theres no real queue to get in. You receive a welcome drink of vodka and cranberry juice, and then offered a shot of tequila, i wish i'd given this a miss. We were then shown upstairs to our seat & table. I was expecting a table with two chairs either side, however unless you get there very very early you won't receive this. Instead we were sat on a row on a bench squeezed in with many other couples and my boyfriend had to sit on the back of the bench, with me on the lower part in between his legs, and we were sharing a table with someone else! Not ideal when you want to talk to each other, take photos and dance, but i would just get there early next time. You do get waiter service with gold member. However although our waiter was great and remembering our order as well as many other people's, and was very attentive, keep an eye on this because you cannot be sure what is in your drink. I'm not accusing or assuming anything but just be cautious because i only had two gin and tonic's from the bar (which isn't unusual for me) and i am a dancer so as you can imagine was having a great time with the music and the show. The waiter was asking me if i wanted to go onto the podium to dance (they do this with girls in the interval and continually shoot the camera at their assets) however i said no. I was violently ill the next morning, i felt as though i had 20 drinks so you have no idea how strong they are or what's in them! However i would still do gold member as i went to the toilet and saw the queue for the normal bar and i am SO glad i didn't have to deal with that!All moaning aside, this was a wonderful night. The dancers are amazing and the aerial performers too, meaning you can see something wherever you are in the room. The different themes and tribute acts are great, the show really is perfected down to a T and i cannot fault it. The special effects, balloons, smoke and music are top class, like a club in Vegas. There is a smoking area on the 2nd floor. When the show finishes about 3am the whole atmosphere kind of slowly dies as everyone leaves rather quickly to get their coach. My advice would be to book yourself a taxi back however, as we were stuck next to a young lad throwing up the whole way home and the poor coach driver spoke 0 english, so maybe reps on the way home too would be a good idea. All in all a wonderful night, you will never experience anything else like it, i would definitely go again. Thank you!

Night out. Went out on a Thurs night, the place was packed. The show was entertaining, and has good music to dance to. The party went till 3:30 am, the club was so full ppl were standing right next to eachother. By 1:30 am there was more space as the drunk ppl were crazy kicked out, or ppl just tired and leaving. So was better with less ppl in the place. Over all great night out. Wear comfy shoes is a must!

Great show!. Coco Bongo is a bar like no other! This was my second time there and both times the show was great! The performances in the air and on stage were completely entertaining. And for how many people were there, the waiter brought us drinks all evening. The only con was that a representative from CB brought us to the club around 930pm and then stand in line outside until 1045pm. Needless to say, it's a little warm in Mexico to stand in line for over an hour. Once inside, the show and music made you forget all that! Thanks to all the performers and wait staff!

Crazy, amazing outstanding Night Club. Make sure you visit Coco Bongo if you going to Cancun. Also if you plan to go early coz there is always long line ahead waiting for you. Fully crowded club with theme dancers and amazing music.

Brilliant !!!. Not quite as good as Coco Bongo Cancun but nether the less still better than anything the UK or any other country can offer for that matterEvery moment in there is a good laugh or a show !I could have stayed in there all night!DO NOT do this as part of the Thomson bar crawl - the bar crawl section is rubbish and then you only get 1hr 30 in coco bongos !!!!

Honeymoon . Went to the Coco Bongo show whilst on honeymoon, absolutely amazing with brilliant acts, I'm not a big drinker but just the show and the atmosphere are worth the money. My only advice would be is be prepared for pushing and being crowded as we went on a Monday when it's meant to be quiet and it was heaving.

Amazing!. We went on our honeymoon and had an amazing time! Definitely worth paying for a gold member ticket and getting there early as we had great seats. The show was amazing and we danced all night, definitely one not to miss!

Amazing night.. We visited Coco Bongo as Gold Members.Cabaret was amazing! We were getting our drinks from our waiter so often I ended up with three at once! Brilliant service!The shot girls are a tad pushy, shoving a shot glass in my chest and insisting my partner had one... it got quite awkward after it had been there for 30 seconds. Later on in went to the toilet and she approached my partner who refused (he says... it was 3am and 12 vodkas later) however ended up having one as she was pestering him and then asked for 90 pesos, when we were under the impression they were included in the all inclusive drinks, so be warned (not that 90 pesos is a lot but they don't advise you that you have to pay until you've taken the shot!) However this was the only downside of the night so all in all it was amazing!!
Social. What a show !!! 10/10 With a show like that I'd like to see that in the uk !! Brilliant performance!!!

Don't go there!. We were so exiting about this Coco Bongo night club trip. Sounded safe and well organised. Paid quite a lot for the trip and as they said the bus will pick us up from the hotel and will take us back in the morning. When we arrived it was a massive row of people which they said a 45 minutes wait. But if you want to go in quicker you can pay an extra 10 dollar which we did. Then you end up is a building which have 3 levels. We went to the bar and asked for a drink then wanted to head upstairs to take a seat. Then they said we are not allowed to go upstairs only if we buy VIP tickets which will cost us an extra 100 dollar. There were 4 standing tables where we put our drinks down and we have been told not to use them either as we are not VIP. We ended up downstairs like herrings, very hot and crowded. So we headed outside but they didn't want to let us out first, they said they will give us a seat...but we were 5 of us. I'm not too sure what they were expect from us...seating on each other? ...Well we ended up taking a taxi back to the hotel. So being in Coco Bongo for max half an hour cost us almost 200 dollar. Think about it before you go!!!!!

Fantastic Show But....... The show is amazing BUT the place is a dive!! They need a bigger venue, it is wall to wall people, with the VIP section stuck up on ledges to the point of being dangerous. The walkways are about 2' wide so trying to get to the dance floor is a challenge.The waiters do a great job bringing the drinks as fast as you want them and the show!!! Cross between Cirque/Legends/Nightclub, it really is worth seeing. High energy club filled with people having fun, fun, fun....but be careful moving around.Another drawback was 1 tiny washroom for an entire floor. Having a larger place would make the experience even better.

Brilliant night. We had an amazing time. The shows were spectacular from acrobatic displays to Freddie Mercury and Elvis. We didn't think we'd make it to 3.30 am finish but the time flew in. Would definately say you can't visit Mexico without visiting Coco Bongos
Clubbing in Mexico . What a great night at this club the best clubs in Mexico good show in a disco get a vip ticket much better not so mad long night fax dazzle

Great shows.well performed.. We went there as part of a thomson bar crawl.......Coco bongo was the highlight! !!!!I wont ruin it for you by giving you a minute by minute , but I'll say this it was fantastic !!!The thomson pub crawl wasnt , but this was a means to an end....Take youre camera..Guys you'll be searched as will handbags ect on entry.......I cant coment on how expensive drinks are as we were on a free drink package but we didn't drink the watered down tequila you're given on entry so we just drank bottled water....The show goes on for hours be warned...And we stood in the upper terrace. If youre not great on youre feet then stay down stairs....Other than that its an experience you must have...I would recommend this everyone .......

Great show but poor service . A fantastic show would recommendTo anyone but be warned it's like a shoe box in there and will get put anywhere even if you can't see the show then be charged for an upgrade even after having a gold member ticket. Pushy and no customer service but the show was great after paying £140 on top of our tickets to be moved once in so we could see the show.

Great place. This place is crazy. We loved every second. The Congo Bongos rep that visited our hotel (Secrets Maroma Beach) was fabulous and she escorted us into the club. We went for the Gold package and I would definitely recommend to pay the extra. You have a better view of the stage and performers and you have waiter service with unlimited bar. There is more space to dance and move around without being squashed on the dance floor. By paying for gold you have access to the dance floor at the bottom if you wish.

Night Out In Playa. After seeing the show in Cancun, it was a must to take my husband and our friend's there for the first time in Playa. The show did not disappoint. We wish the resort staff would have told us about the different options (open bar, bottle service, gold member etc.) so that we wouldn't have been standing on the floor. Best advice is to get the bottle service so that you have your own spot and can see the show without being pushed around. Also, take some cash with you so you can take a cab back to the resort if you don't want to stay till almost 4am for a pick up. Can't wait to go and see it again.

Brilliant night out.. Myself and my partner bought the goldmember passes from our tour operator in the hotel after being advised it can be busy and book up quick. This seemed pricey to me at the time but I was sure it would be worth it, and it was. Waiter service to your seats so you have no need to move apart from toilet breaks, and around 10-15 short shows from michael Jackson, to Spider-Man and tron, all with acrobatics and interaction with the crowd.Stunning night out, expect to be out from 10pm-3am at least.
Really Good Show. On my visit to Mexico, I went few times because I really Love the differents show they present. Me and my friends really enjoy it.

Not what we expected! Waste of money!. Me and my mum went here last night after hearing all the good reviews saying what a great "show" it is. We booked tickets for goldmember, the seating was okay, however where was the show?? It seemed to just be a nightclub which we had paid £70 each to get into to watch young girls prance around on a stage all night or get there pants exposed to the audience! We couldve paid £5 to get into a club back home! I think that the advertising for this place is way too misleading as it shows an actual show! I wouldnt recommend this to anyone unless they like clubbing and willing to pay this price!
Nice place. Very nice place but way to packed! Went on a Wednesday and the club was packed shoulder to shoulder, other then that it was a nice club. The show they do is amazing!

Coco Bongo. This club is promoted everywhere you go whether at your hotel or out on the town. The club has an amazing show but is so crowded and packed with people that you cannot move. Be very careful ladies, men think they can grab whatever they want due to the crowded atmosphere and endless amounts of alcohol the waiters and waitresses push on you. Shot girls are not free, they charge a lot for the shots they push on the customers so beware.

Great show but BEWARE!!!. To ensure we got VIP tickets for a particular night we bought them via Internet 3 months in advance of our trip. As instructed my husband took photo ID and the credit card that he paid with to ticket collection point. Whilst queueing some young ladies were having trouble with collection being told having proof of purchas, e-mails etc on phone not good enough. Eventually they were allowed in after using Coco Bongo reps phone as the girls did not have internet signal. We thought this odd but were under the impression all would be OK for us. Unfortunately we were wrong. After showing his driving licence and credit card the rep then proceeded to copy them on a laptop scanner. When asked why we were told it was company policy in case of non payment. We argued that they had been paid 3months earlier and that they should not be copying ID. We were then told no admission if this was not done. As we were looking forward to the show we went in and cancelled the credit card the next morning. This caused a lot of inconvenience and great annoyance as we were worried about fraud or the card cloned. Once inside we had our handbags searched. I do not object to this as it is an essential safety precaution. But why on earth were my clear plastic rain macs confiscated? My friend also had her selfie stick put aside "as it could be used as a weapon". If true, then why were we served beer in glass bottles? Then we were shown to seating with limited view and told that we would have to pay more if we wanted to move. Our waiter was very attentive and regularly replenished our drinks. Unfortunately I had shards of broken glass in my drink and was told by another woman that she had had two drinks with glass in them. A glass had got broken and they hadn't cleared up properly. Extremely Dangerous. Now for the good things about Coco Bongo. The show was fantastic and very professional. Young ladies were invited to dance on a podium in break between each performance and were treated to having their skirts blown up exposing their underwear. Despite this there was a queue of willing volunteers. Would we go back? Maybe. But ALWAYS buy you ticket from holidayrep at yourt hotel or Coco Bongo rep who visit beach and hotels or the box office in Playa de Carmen. Tickets cost the same but you get free transport.

Omg spectacular! . Too much fun!! It's like cirque except better if one could say that. For $70 we were transported to & from our hotel, then received bands to get in ( we waited about 20 mins in line), once inside we received a shot of tequila & a vodka cran while waiting to go completely in. After inside all drinks are included! So drink up!! This place is beyond crowded but so worth it! The show was impeccable & visually stunning!! This is a must go!! Watch videos before going you won't be disappointed. Plus all of this for only $70??!! Seriously best deal in Mexico go!!!!

A MAZE IN !!!!!. Crazy Place - Brilliant - Stuff happening all the time - shows, massive party poppers, smoke jets, dancing on the bar, proffesional dancers (male & female) all around the club, the shows are fantastic and the music was brilliant. Just look on youtube. I would pay the £100 each again it was that good. Bit silly how they price it though, you have to buy a bottle of spirit, which then determines the table you get, go for the best bottle and get a private table with a sectioned off area for your own private access & dancing, private waiter, bouncer and unhindered views to the whole club. We also upgraded to an all inclusive bar and took our good bottle of vodka home!

Great show . Initially I thought this would have been a club but in fact it's just a show. Wonderful to watch but no room to actually dance. It's interesting the performance they out on specially the acrobats etc. It's such an iconic place that you'd be silly not to go. Just don't expect to have much room to move.

Really?? Whats the fuss about?. I don't understand what all the rave reviews are about although it's probably my age. The bus dropped us off 10 minutes away and we got soaked to the skin walking to the club. On entering we were kind of segregated from the locals but i suppose that was a positive note as on the bus there was a promotional video showing the club and it said not to take guns in with you! Also, what is it with these holiday destinations and taking your photo all the time then crazy prices for them.....we did buy a pic, well the girlfriend did and then they still carried on taking the same photo....On a plus note, the performers were amazing but have seen it all before just not as loud! Only so many times you can watch someone dangle on a wire before it got *yawn*......Now that place is a Health and Safety dream come true, far too many people in there and if there was a fire etc....well that would be the end of everyone. Was so expensive for what it was but again, the performers were excellent. Would i recommend it to anyone? No, save your money and go on a decent trip.

Brilliant night!!!. Fantastic!! It's a must the show is one of the best I've seen both hubby and myself loved it the staff looked after us as soon as our glass was empty there was a full one right there non stop entertainment x

Amazing night out!. This place is nuts! Such an amazing night out and definitely worth checking out for yourself! We paid extra for the gold tickets and it was worth every penny! We were sat on the balcony by the stage and had our own personal waiter that never let your drinks run out and the drinks were all covered with the cost of the ticket! Only gripe we had was the attitude of the rep that picked us up on the bus because we ordered our tickets online before we went rather than through the hotel rep. Doing it this was saves you money to and it's easy to sort your tickets when you get there!

One of the best nights ever!!! . We had heard so many good things about coco bongos from friends and family and we knew it was a must when we came to Mexico! We were not disappointed! We payed a bit extra for the gold member tickets and these are totally worth it! We were on the 2nd floor, was right next to the stage so we could see everything so clearly and the waiters were always coming round and asking us if we wanted more drinks! This is a definite must!!!
The best party . The best club i have ever been to. So amazing and so safe for you to go. For sure i will visit it again!
great time!. It was a great show and I'm glad we spent the extra money to go VIP! it was better to see the show and the waiters were great at constantly making sure out drinks were filled!
Funny night. Great place not as big as the cancun one and deals not as good. £85 each person and there was 11 of us and that got us 2 bottles of vodka and 2 jugs of cranberry juice.

Best time ever! . We had such a great time here! Such a fun show with talented performers. Lots of aerial performance and dancing! The only complaint is that we paid for bottle service with a table. They originally tried to put us on the 3rd level at a counter with ppl blocking our view. I told them that this was not what I paid for and asked to be moved and we got a great seat. They also don't allow selfie sticks. I forgot to pick mine up after the show but when I came the next day they were doing some maintainencephalitis and couldn't give it to me.Bottom line: Go! Have fun! And get a table to avoid being knocked around missing the show and sugary drinks.

Honeymoon!. Coco Bonga Gold Member - 8th August 2016 - I am lost for words for this place! It's Is a crazy night out and not by means of getting drunk!!!! It is a great string of shows incorporating a mixture of music and films, with short breaks inbetween of latest music hits. This is a must do whilst in the area.

Absolutely amazing!. Myself and my partner booked the CoCo Bongos VIP Gold package with our Thomas Cook rep for around £135 per person. This sounds pretty expensive but the night is 100% worth it, and a definite must for anyone visiting Playa Del Carmen in Mexico. We were given brilliant seats above the partying crowd and unlimited drinks all night (including frozen strawberry daiquiris, Sol beer, rum, vodka, and sambuca shots). We were picked up from our hotel in a small minibus at 10pm and returned at 3.30am. The show was absolutely incredible and time flew by. It really was a fantastic night and the best nightclub I have ever been to!

Expensive, Fun, Loud. Booked gold member ticket $130 US dollars each through our hotel Thomson rep. The gold ticket means you join a shorter queue to enter on arrival and are shown upstairs to a seating area. Don't expect comfort , you will get somewhere to sit and somewhere to put your drink but thats about it. Our waiter was excellent and continued to bring all inclusive drinks all night. Our seats were side on near the stage so we lost some of the shows impact but had a bit of a backstage view. The show is mainly high level acrobats, and lookalikely performers with a dance troupe. Lots of themes - Superman, The Mask, Tron etc. It's good fun, lots of balloons and ticker tape and dry ice but don't expect Cirque du Soleil quality. It's very very loud. Show finishes about 2.30am Club closes around 3.30am.

AWESOME - WHERE DID THE TIME GO?. We were a bit dubious booking this excursion and nearly didn't go when we found out the place didn't open till 11pm.We did the customary pick everyone up thing and then our guide took us to a bar, with free drinks at 8pm. It was boring and coach loads of people turned up doing the same thing. Then we were herded just like cattle - I checked to see if I had a bell round my neck - to a second bar for an hour and more free drinks. We were starting to think is this all worth it? We were sitting next to folk we weren't really interested in, some of whom were already on the booze wagon.Finally we were shepherded to Coco bongo. If I had known we could have booked this independently and turned up at 11pm we would have.What was it like? It's really hard to explain. Think nightclub, that every 10 minutes puts on a show - and what a show. The owner is Jim Carrey and that might give you some idea of the madness and mayhem that ensues. People come on stage, its three floors up - and either perform identical routines from films or musicals, others are look-a-likes who do tributes acts from Michael Jackson to Guns and roses. There's a touch of Cirque du Soleil at certain points too. Prepare to be amazed and wonder where 3 hours went.Tips - Only book the top VIP floor. you get to sit down, drinks are free and the toilets nearby. Down-side if you're disabled you won't be able to manage the stairs. They're steep and crowded all the time.

Incredible!!!. Visited this place 8.9.2016 and I Highley recommended it. It was a fantastic night loved every second of it. We had gold passes which aloud us to have our own little seating area and a waiter that brings your drinks which were all inclusive with the gold passes definitely recommend getting the gold passes you'll definitely have your money's worth. And as for the show it was incredible I couldn't take my eyes of the dancers/singers/gymnasts. It is a must do whilst in Mexico.
Brilliant. A bit smaller and abridged version of Cancun. Too much audience participation at the expense of the length of the slots. VIP still good value.

Beware. Right were do I start. Positives. Was a entertaining night with great acts. Negatives. You seated in gold like cattle wife had to sit between my legs whilst I sat on a ledge. Also the Wifes drink not once not twice but 3 times had BROKEN GLASS in it she complained every time but on the 3rd time and the lady next to us having the same in her glass we decided to leave. I emailed them 3 times and I've had nothing back from them do please beware when you go there.

Brilliant night out. Me and my husband went in june the show in this club is brilliant we paid gold membership as get better seats and waiter service with your drinks so would recommend paying extra unless u are young and wants to be down on dancefloor all night..

50th Birthday Celebration. This place is a complete scam! Beware of the hired staff that circulates thru the resorts making promises they never intend to keep. We were promised many things that were never delivered. To further complicate the situation, entry was a nightmare as we stood in the street sweating for over an hour. Once we entered we were herded like cattle into a very dangerous situation that would have been impossible to escape from in the event of an emergency. As soon as the "show" was over, we struggled, but FINALLY managed to leave the property. I advised our resort to refuse entry of anyone representing this highly fraudulent establishment.I could say far more to describe the unsafe conditions... but hope the above is enough to help people decide to stay away!
MAD MAD MAD. I love this place coco bongos is a must place to visit if your in Mexico !!!! :-)you will have a night out that will never be forgotten. The acts are amazing the place is amazing.
Party Night. Perfect night for party time with friends, we were 13 girl friends in a bacherlotte party and all was just great and fun,

Overall service is very bad. At our Resort !We were offered a CoCoBongo tour. Consisted of visiting 3 Nigth Clubs (Senor Frog/Salsa/CoCoBongo) this included transportation to Start we were not picked up. We contacted coco bongo was told to take taxi to senior frog to meet Omar. He would refund the cost. We had to wait x him 35 minutes. He said money would be refunded upon arriving in coco bongo. The second place is across the street from coco bongo. We were there only 30 minutes. We all were told at 3:00AM we were leaving meet again at entrance. (Oscar) he also collected tips x bartenders he was serving the drinks although he was nice he did not waited upon leaving. So no transportacion To return. The Coco Bongo show was not as in past years as others mention mostly videos. Not enough lived performers and very very short. As always very very crowded Tried 4 times in the past this was my last. Very Dissapointed. Do not Recomed it

AWFUL EXPERIENCE!! Wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy. Paid for a table with bottle service for 8 people and paid $800 for the group. Once inside we asked to go to our table and were told to wait "one minute", after waiting 10 minutes we asked again to go to our table because the show was about to start and we were barely even in the doorway. We again were told "one minute" and waited another 10 minutes and so on and so forth for the next half hour. After nearly an hour and missing almost the entirety of the show we walked back to the front to ask for a refund. We tried to explain that we paid for a table with bottle service and there was no table available as they just kept telling us to keep waiting with no end in sight. Since we weren't given any drinks or bottle or table or anything we were promised, we figured they would oblige to our refund request. Well we thought wrong as we tried to talk to employee after employee and manager after manager that all refused to give us a refund stating that our table was available even though none of them were actually inside to see that there were no tables available. Once the arguing escalated we were surrounded by multitudes of security guards trying to push us farther away from the door so nobody else would see what was going on. After over an hour of trying to argue with no offer of a refund we were forced to leave empty handed having lost $800 and given nothing in return. This place is down right criminal and will take advantage of you no questions asked!! I will never return and I suggest anyone thinking about going here to think twice before being taken advantage of by this very unproffesional business!!

Amazing night out! . If your looking for a crazy night out this is the place to go! It's amazing! If defo recommend buying the gold band tickets, if you book with thomsons the this is what you get on the trip anyway. You get to sit on a upper level with a seat and a bar/table. You also have a waiter than just supply's you with drinks all night and everything is included in the price! It's fab. Lots to see! One minute it's dancing the next Spider-Man's in front of you! Amazing!!

Amazing experience! A must go!. Didn't know what to expect but heard great things about this place. It's a club come cirque de soleil type evening. I would suggest upgrading to Vip gold member as the whole night lasts approx 5 hours and you don't want to be standing. Gold member gets you a seated table with untapped premium alcohol with a dedicated server and also some pretty awesome views! I had an awesome time, drank lots and danced lots. Well worth the $99.

Crazy Amazing. We went to Coco Bongos for my cousins 18th on our recent holiday in Mexico. The night was totally crazy, the entertainment was none stop with people being asked to dance on podiums and the stage in between acts. We sat in the Gold lounge and the service was great, our drinks were filled up as soon as they got low and the waiters were really friendly and accommodating. If you visit make sure you take some money for tips as they really do go the extra mile! Some of the acts we saw were Elvis, Michael Jackson, Madonna, Spider Man and of course the mask. Once the acts had finished they introduced the DJ and the place turned into a nightclub! When it had finished we went to the coco bongo shop where the prices were surprisingly cheap for good quality items, then some of our group went across the road for a kebab taco (apparently it was really nice). Altogether we had an amazing night that ended our holiday on a massive high!

Glorified Strip Joint. This is a glorified strip joint, not by the locals but by the tourists who attend. We wanted to take our 22 year old daughter and her friend to a dance club. We expected to watch some good shows, listen to good music and have fun dancing. NO. The talent in the shows was good. Only certain guests were asked to dance by management, mainly young women including our daughter and her friend. They declined because lewd dancing was encouraged. The more disgusting, the more the camera spotlighted the girl. We even paid $150. for a bottle of vodka to sit in the upper level but after our $ was taken, they said the tables were unavailable. We were packed in the bottom level like sardines. Sham and tourist trap.

Great night out!. An absolutely crazy place unlike any other, but great for all ages young and old! We did it as part of the Thomson bar crawl and got 2 hours access to Coco Bongo which was not enough time as we could have stayed for longer (we were lead out by a bouncer eventually when we tried to hide and stay in!) We were on the balcony and hadn't paid for a table (where I think you get table service?) but we tipped the waiter 20 pesos (80p) each time he served us; after an hour she was bringing drinks back before we had even asked for them!
Best disco ever. Wanna have fun and have enough energy to last for six hours on a dance floor? Do it! Consider vip if you like to watch but not participate
Worth it! . OMG! Had the best night ever at Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen. Worth the price. Shows are amazing and some are breathtaking. Unique experience.

Good Night Out. A great night out, make sure you get a golden ticket as this get you great seats and misses the long Que's. Drinks are include in this package, they come fast from the very good waiters. The show is non stop from start to finish, with great costumes, dancers and music. You will get you Picture taken with The Mask, Beatlejuice and Spiderman. Girls are aloud on stage to dance at various times and also all women can get up at the end.

AWESOME. Went to see the show 2 nights in a row!! Blown away by the place. Eduardo and Ernesto our servers we so good at looking after us that we didn't want to leave them! We got our tickets from Alexis in Ocean Maya. He was an excellent ambassador for the club and got us great seats. On our 2nd night it was my wife's birthday and the whole club sang happy birthday to her!! (Thanks to Alexis and Ernesto for that one)Don't miss an opportunity to see the best show I've witnessed. I've seen shows in the west end that this blows away. Yes it's expensive but believe me it's worth every penny.

Awful. Just a horrible night. Paid for bottle service. Waiter let 2 girls sit in the spare table next to us at 12am... clearly they hadn't paid. The girls then tried to start a fight with my friend and the waiter told us to move. A random girl started drinking our vodka. Waiters dragged us up on stage. I asked twice if I could get down. They said no, so I just got down and got told off. Biggest waste of money ever.

what a fun night!!!!. what an awesome place the moment you walk in you are bombarded with tequila shots its such a fun atmosphere lots of great talent specially the Freddie Murcury impersonator gave me goosebumps its fun for all ages its not only just a club its more of a show. i highly recommend.

fantastic night out. this is a must. The acts are amazing its like being at a vagas show.Drinks flow all night thanks to our personal bar man. I've never seen anything like it. What a night... a definate must no matter what your age

DO NOT DRINK THE ALCOHOL HERE!. We went to Coco Bongo due to rave reviews of the place. It was $85AU to get in which included unlimited free drinks. Even though it seemed expensive & we weren't big drinkers, we decided to go along anyway.Our tour guide advised us to line up 1.5hrs before it opened to get a good viewing spot near the stage. They gave us balloons in line which was fun but it still took an hour to get in. They packed people in like sardines. We could barely move. There was only 1 bar open even though it was a Saturday night. The bar was so far away & so hard to get to we only ended up having 5 drinks over several hours. The drinks tasted like methylated spirits & we're sure it was some kind of home brew. The show itself was ok. I've seen better elsewhere. What really concerned us was that 2 of us suddenly collapsed & blacked out 3/4 of the way through the show. Considering none of us drink much at all (my last drink was over 1 year ago) & we are very careful to monitor our drinks, there was no way we had simply lost track of our drinks. We went from being a little tipsy to blacked out. Luckily our third friend was able to get help from some nice American boys to get us back to our hotel because we couldn't even walk! We vomited all night & I ended up with a black eye from falling. We have never been in such a state our whole lives from alcohol (we're in our mid thirties) & we were extremely sick the entire next day. We had been warned about the drinks there which was another reason we were being careful but we certainly didn't expect this to happen! Save your money & don't go here. I wouldn't recommend this experience to my worst enemy. The horrible pain in my stomach I can't even describe. I would've went to hospital if I was back home. I couldn't eat, drink or even stand up for 36hrs afterwards. It's not worth it.
A must see!! . Amazing show/club. Gold member tickets are worth it. Amazing seats and a constant flow of drinks brought to the table. Suitable for all ages.

Terrible experience. We saw a lot of good reviews and we were excited to go to coco bongos. We were a group of four in our mid 20s, so we like to party. Upon arriving it seem like a good time and an employee named Edith approached us to sell us the tickets. The only info she gave us was that the were only $70.00 USD tickets available. She asked for IDs and when we couldn't provide them. She still proceeded to sell us the tickets. Upon entry for the first 20 minutes of the show it seemed like it was going to be a good time until they kept packing people in. We couldn't move and the staff was rude and pushing us. So we decided to leave after 40 minutes of being there because we couldn't dance or keep having a good time. As we were exiting the building, there was a long line of people still being shoved in and we couldn't believe they were trying to fit more people. when we got outside an employee named Paula approach us to see why we were leaving and we told her because it was to crowed. She started talking to us about what she could do for us and her only option was to come back the next day on a Saturday (which it will probably still be packed) but we were also leaving and when we told her this she gave us no other option replying that the only reason she stopped us was to tell us not to write a bad review and they could not give refund only admissions for a different day. Different employees approach us giving us different excuses and telling us they had general admission $20.00 tickets available that we should had purchased those. we started getting frustrated with the change of people and stories, so we asked Paula for her to be the only one to talk to us as she was the original person that approached us. Before we asked for her, another group of people were complaining for the same reason and they purchased 8 tickets for $1000.00. and were unable to get the money back because they signed a waiver stating no refunds. We realize that we did not sign anything and approach Paula with this info. She asked employee sold us the tickets and employee was Edith whom approached us at that point and yelling that she told us that it will get packed and that they don't do refunds. at that point she offer to give us tickets for us to sell to other people, but we couldn't do that as we were leaving and no one will buy from someone on the street (I wouldn't ) she kept shaking her head saying that she understands but was not helpful at all. After 2 hours, we finally were able to get our money back, except for our lost time in our trip. The show seemed worth watching, but the staff, the overcrowded place gave it a bad experience to be in. The just want to sell as many tickets as they can to make the max amount of money.
Irresistible. If you go to Playa del Carmen then you HAVE to go to see the uniquely burlesque, impressive show. It's a full on assault on all your senses, and a lot of fun.

A must see show! . Buy the Gold member/VIP tickets! You get straight into Coco Bongos without having to stand in the horrendously long queue which looks like it's a 1 hour wait! You also get your own private table and a private waiter, who, if you tip at the beginning, brings you drinks over all the time without even having to ask! The show was spectacular, there was something for everyone! From Guns n Roses, to phantom of the opera, Beyoncé to Beetlejuice! It is a must see and quite overwhelming! Yes it is cramped but come on, it's a nightclub, the biggest in the city, so it's going to be a bit busy! The bus picks you up from the hotel and also takes you back. Only a 5 minute walk from the bus station! If returning I would 100% return and would recommend anyone else to go as well!!
Great entertainment . A great theatrical display and interaction with the audience, a must see if in Playa Del Carmen or Cancun.The gold member seats are worth paying the extra money.
Amazing entertainers and a lot of fun . A must see at least once in your life! Wicked fun. Amazing quality entertainment. I was extremely impressed. Very recommended.

The club is awesome.. Although I was put off by the price, we decided to go as heard good things off friends and seen reviews on trip advisor. We booked Gold member which I advise as a must, no time trying to get to the bar drinks are brought to you by a waiter, the waiter even took my g/f to the toilet area, waited, then brought her back as it was in the main area which was rammed. We got seats and could see the show all the way through. The main area was very very busy and a not a lot of room to move. We had plenty of room to dance in our area and was pleasant. Also as a gold member we must have skipped at least an hour worth of queuing both in and outside the club.

Sincerely think twice before getting the ticket. This place is not worth 75$ for a ticket. The show was ok and the aerial show was nice and that where the good ends. The place is extremely crowded ... People pushed us around and even the security guard were rude and pushed us. I had drinks spilled on me several times. Place is extremely unorganized I left and complained to the front desk that this is terrible and they said they will find a nice spot for us. They took us to a small corner all the way third floor. Not worth the money, not worth your time.

Think twice before paying for a ticket. Admittedly as a 51 year old man I am probably not this venue's target audience, but I do have lots of experience of both working on and seeing theatrical shows and have also been to quite a few clubs over the years. I decided to buy a gold member pass having read pretty amazing reviews about this venue on trip advisor. Unfortunately I can only describe it as a rather soulless money making enterprise. The alcohol (included in the price) keeps coming but so do the girls trying to persuade/hassle you into buying drinks that aren't included... And will suggest you are boring if you don't decide to partake. The VIP seating area is basically high stools on the narrow platform you see the show from. To start there is an hour of short clips from music videos interspersed with live camera shots of the crowd. I personally didn't think a lot of the women appreciated having the cameras constantly zoom in on their breasts but maybe I'm wrong. The aerial work in the show is great and hats off to the performers working in such a small space and busy atmosphere. However the bulk of the show consists of dancers miming to extracts from films and music videos. Strangely, the actual films are projected behind the dancers - making me want to see the real performers sing, not someone impersonate them (with varying degrees of success). I was really hoping to have a good dance once the show was over, but each track is played for such a short time (usually less than a minute) there seemed to be no attempt to build an atmosphere or to allow people to get into and enjoy the music. I doubt my review will put many people off going to this well oiled money making machine, but there are definitely better ways of spending your money in Playa. Or save it and see a good show on Broadway or the West End. My two stars are for the aerial work (which, I repeat, was good) but honestly, think twice about going.

Fantastic Show!!!!!. Fantastic show!!! It is worth the upgrade to gold member status. Great seats and able to see the show without any difficulty. A very nice transportation van picks you up from your hotel property and provides transportation back.
Awesome. Best club that I have ever been to. Service was awesome, entertainment was awesome. We had an amazing time! Recommend it for sure!

Group Trip!. Coco bongo was Coco bananas!!!! We had an awesome experience. Everyone was telling us we had to go and they were right. You cannot go to Mexico and not go to Coco Bongo!!! Jonathan was put PR rep who reserved my space for my group of 14. We had the best space in the house. We loved every minute of it. This place is a must!!!!

Got to go!! . Don't miss out on this awesome nightlife experience. We purchased tickets from the Coco Bongo rep on the beach outside of our hotel. It was one of the most fun nights I've ever had!! I recommend going early and getting a seat. Dance floor gets crowded. We really enjoyed having a seat(does get tight). The music and performers are awesome!! Can't wait to go back! Get ready to dance the night away!!! Well worth the money! Dress comfortably!

Alot to Take In!!!. A group of friends and I did the Coco Bongo tour and it was an experience. The Coco Bongo club has a Las Vegas show vibe and it is LIVE!!!!!! I would recommend option for the VIP only because it comes with seating!!! If you do the VIP Tour , you will be there until 3 am and your feet will HURT!!

Great night out. we went to coco bongos with our friends who were staying in another hotel both of us on our honeymoon. the night was amazing defiantly worth having the gold member so you get a table and all your drinks are included with waiter service, the shows were amazing and my wife and her friend even managed to dance on stage with one of the acts. If you want a good night out with a relaxed carnival atmosphere then I would recommend going here

Party Party Party. Not a place for the faint hearted,, this place is amazing,,, buzzing from 10pm until 4am,, no let up what so ever,, if your going to do this trip,, make sure you do the Gold package,, VIP,, free drinks all night (definitely no shortage),, great views of the stage,,, good place to dance - tip,, sit on the back settees - as if you sit on the front rows chairs,, you'll find it hard to move all night,, it sounds expensive 130$ but with the VIP access and few drinks,, then it's well worth it,,

Blows your mind! . Booked through TUi and heard loads of great reviews about coco bongos therefore had to go and we are so glad we did! There is nothing like this anywhere else!! It is an unforgettable experience and one I would definitely repeat. Suitable for anyone aged 18-100 it was out of this world! I'm not saying anymore as you have to experience this place for yourself! A must whilst here in Mexico.

Gold Member is worth it!. Came here with my family for a night out and paid for the Gold Member upgrade. we were given seats and a table with a perfect view of the stage, free drinks all night was a bonus and we definitely got our moneys worth! The show was brilliant and lasted all night (till 3), which i didn't expect. It is definitely one of a kind experience and I would recommend anyone to give it a go
New Years Eve everynight. Highly recommend to go - no matter what age you are - fabulous show and music - drinks all night - you have to experience this

Amazing night out. This is a must to visit the night is so packed full of shows and music to let you dance the night away.. if you are in the area you must visit. We booked with bernado who was based at our hotel the grand sunset princess suites by the main pool..
Girls trip. If you go to Playa Del Carmen do not leave without going to Coco Bongo. There is nothing else like it. You will not regret it. It is definitely crowded but it's worth the experience.

One of the best nights out I've ever had!. My partner and I - with friends we'd met on our resort in Playacar - booked up for this with some trepidation. After much haggling with the sales reps (at our resort) we negotiated a hugely discounted price for 7 of us for table service in a dedicated area. Our ticket price included a bottle of spirits (either tequila, white rum, vodka or similar) between 2/3 of us with all mixers/ice. We bought bottled beer as needed (very cheap) but otherwise were very happy on our private (albeit tiny) balcony with our very own waiter (we sent him away pretty sharpish with a big tip and most of the balcony furniture). As we ploughed through our tequila and vodka (two bottles - followed by a very costly third) and ton of mixers we enjoyed a fantastic stage show and even better music. We were ferried to and from the venue from our hotel which made the experience extremely painless (handy since we were definitely feeling the pain on the way out). The table package is worth the extra for a prime spot for the entertainment (and even the main stage for drunk mum dancing later in the night) and to avoid the jostle at the bars. Top tip, make sure to take your passports or other ID with you to avoid hassle getting in - it will ensure you get fastracked right through to the action. Others we spoke to suggested it is even cheaper to go if you book online before you leave for vacation but can't vouch for that. As it is, we paid c. $75 a head for an all inclusive experience (reduced from an alleged $150/head rate).I can't recommend it highly enough for a wildly entertaining night out. Seriously one of the best evenings we've had in a long while.

Wild party!. This place was insane! The show lasts like 4 hours and it's just action packed with dancers and covers of Micheal Jackson, Freddie Mercury, Madonna, etc and then there's midgets and Spider-Man and a lot of other weird random acts! But the confetti guns are the best!!!! I'd say that it literally explodes 20 tons of confetti from the sky every three minutes or so! The light show, the music, the crowd...it's a big party! I was not sure I wanted to tag along with the group of friends that were going but I'm glad I did. It's not my thing, but it was definitely pretty cool to have done it! Tip: don't drink the alcohol there--it's plentiful (they start pouring shots down your throat at the entrance!) and it's super cheap quality--2 people in our group got throw-up sick from drinking.

Ten of us got ripped off.... NEVER GO HERE.. Visited the Mayan Riviera with the family and some friends. We had been to Coco Bongo in Punta Cana and had a great time there, so we thought let's do it again.Saw Oscar and Pedro (Coco Bongo reps) at the Grand Palladium and inquired about the various packages offered in Playa del Carmen. We opted for the private table with a bottle. This was supposed to give us, no waiting on line, met by a host, and as per their website, "Feel the energy of the party with a privileged view of the show, just two steps from the crowd, enjoying the advantages that this unique location has reservation for you" We were met by Pedro at our lobby 15 minutes late, the bus then picked up several others in different hotels and we were dropped off 3 blocks away from Coco Bongo.Also told we would have to walk back at the end of the night to same location.Pedro the coco bongo rep took us to the bar and those who had purchased floor tickets were told where to line up. The ten of us who had purchased a private table with a bottle were taken in by Pedro and he turned us over to some guy who then told one of his servers to take us to our tables.So far... we were OK with the walking even though our dates were all wearing high hills and were all dressed up. We were also Ok with the bus been late 15 minutes, we were also Ok with the fact the bus did not have any music. However, things got complicated. We were escorted to the third floor which is the highest you can go. There we were told that we would have privacy as there will be no one else and we could lean on the hand rail and see the show on the ground floor and directly across from us. After we were promised by the Coco Bongo rep that we were going to be alone we decided not to pursue this any further.We arrived at the bar and on the screen the time said; 47 minutes left before the show would start, and there 3 empty VIP tables on the left side, and 3 empty tables on the right side. Once the show began, we all stood up and leaned against the hand rail where we could see the entire show. The only draw back was we were not part of the high energy crowd below us. Twenty minutes later, 30-35 younger kids were brought up to our section. The Coco Bongo waiters told us very abruptly we had to go back to our designated seating area. We all told them we could not see any thing from there as we were right against the wall and now all these people which were part of the 3 bar excursion were right in front of us blocking our view. One of them said it wasn't his problem.Our waiter, came late and brought us the five bottles we had purchased, One per couple, and placed them in the corner along with the mix. We waited another 20 minutes before he even brought us the glasses and ice. After our waiter served our first drink, he was too busy with the group in front of us and never again did we see him until the very end when it was time to collect his tip. This brings another complaint we have. When we purchased exactly the same package in Punta Cana, they did not added any other money to the bill. However, in Playa del Carmen, we were charged an additional 15% of the cost of the bottle which was $125US dollars for gratuity. No wonder why the service was so terrible.... the waiters already know they have their tip secured so why work.We were not having a good time, so we asked a Coco Bongo waiter if this was a private table zone. He said, no the private tables were below, and also told us that this area was more for the tours or if they had more than the capacity they opened the third floor. I asked several Coco Bongo servers if they could have a supervisor or any one in charge come up and see us.We then noticed an older man in the same uniform standing near us, and never approached us. We then called him over.... by now the show has just passed the hour. He introduced him self as Adrian Moreno. We asked him what was his job and he said he was in charge of the area where we were, that he was basically responsible to see everyone having fun as he was the captain of the area.We told Adrian that we (5 couples) had purchased packages for private tables and we were extremely upset how we had been treated and where we had been sat. Adrian was not help, he came up with every excuse on the book. First he said that when we arrived there were no tables. WRONG... there were 6 tables available with then sign that said RESERVED. Adrian then said this was the best place in the whole bar... WRONG this section is only opened when the main floor is over sold and/or for bar tours. Adrian then told us that Pedro or Oscar (Coco Bongo reps at the Palladium) had requested we were taken to this location. WRONG... I was beside Pedro at all times and he never said such thing, and we asked him the following day which he also denied of saying or requesting such. In fact, Pedro was not happy how we had been treated the night before.Adrian said that he could not do any thing....so I told him that it was OK, we would all write a review on TripAdvisor, and tweeter.Adrian left us and returned 30 minutes later. He told me he had a table for 4 of us, and showed me where it was. The table would have been directly under the stage where the show takes place. I said no we would be under the stage and every one else would be left behind. I asked him if there was a Manager as it was obvious he was not going to be able to take care of us, and he never answered it. The show had been running now for over 2 hours and a man came up to us and introduced himself as Manuel Hernandez and said he was the assistant manager. He said he knew what had taken place as Adrian Moreno had briefed him. Manuel apologized several times and said he was going to take care of us immediately. Half an hour later Manuel said he was preparing two VIP tables for us. We asked him and where are you putting the people that are seating in those tables?.... also 10 of us would not be able to fit in such confined space, and there was only half an hour left of the show left.We told Manuel that Coco Bongo had failed to provide the service, and comply with a contract with ten of us. He insisted that we could see the show from where we were... when asked if he had to pay what we were paying for a private table and suddenly the only thing you were able to see were the back of the heads of all the people placed in front of us... would you be OK with that?... Manuel said No, and apologized but, no solutions.I have to say that he offered me a t-shirt from Coco Bongo. I was more insulted by that rather than making me feel any better. I denied his bribe. We would all have left a lot sooner, but unfortunately we had to wait for the bus to pick us up. Probably the worse time we have ever had on a night out after we paid a good amount of money for a service that was not delivered, and management refused to fix the problem from the start.I have another review of Coco Bongo in Punta Cana and I highly recommend it. But I would strongly advise you that if you care how you are treated while on vacation, and want a good service, Playa del Carmen Coco Bongo is not for you.I also have to bring this to your attention, this location is smaller, and the show is exactly the same as any other Coco Bongo. It is certainly not worth going twice, the show is boring and the sound system here inferior.We also informed the concierge at Palladium of our experience at Coco Bongo. They should not allow their reps to be at 5 star resort if Coco Bongo is not going to treat their guests well.

Fantastic experience! . A great night out with a fantastic show, the show lasts around 3hrs and we were transfixed from start to finish. I would recommend to reserve a table as it gets very busy & crowded. Lots of fun & highly recommend.
A must see! . Amazing night! Never had any trouble getting a drink and never once felt hassled for tips. I'd recommend a table and the gold member ticket as there was virtually no waiting to get in!

Not as corny as it seems. If you are from NYC you are going to see all the performance and shows from around the city in five minute increments but somehow it was still fun and worked. Tickets for admission range from 55-85 depending on open bar and weekend versus weekday. Be warned not all hotels are included in Roundtrip pick up and drop off. If you live in hotel zone you are find but otherwise no. Security is good, we saw people being throw. Out for trying to photograph under people's skirts.

Coco Bongo Gold Member. We went to Coco Bongos on our recent trip to playa del carmen, what a great night. Would definitely recommend the gold member ticket. With this you are separate from the main area, you are eye level with the stage, you have a seat, a waiter rather than queuing at the bar, all inclusive drinks and a separate toilet to the main area, where the toilet attendant wipes the seat down for you! The show was fantastic. We got a taxi from playacar (120pesos) and then you queue outside for a little before given a balloon and a shot of tequila. We were there for just after 10pm, the show doesn't start till 11.30pm but there is music and dancers beforehand. We left after around 3am the show finished before this time and again there was a DJ on after this. Great night!
No sitting down . It was hard to stand in one place for three hours! Not able to move around freely! Took a while to get in the place. Still a good thing to see

Loud noisy crowded mess. I'm sure it has appeal to many, especially younger clubbers and ravers. But don't go expecting a Vegas style show - it is a loud, noisy, crowded mess. Some of the acts are entertaining enough, but not enough to justify the outrageous price and overcrowded seating.

What a show!!. Like 3 acts into the show I felt like crying it was so good brilliant atmosphere great buzz in the place. Never a dull moment! Wouldn't bother with vip because you won't wanna sit down. One of the highlights of our trip to Cancun!

Excellent night and brilliant staff. Always been told that Congo Bongo is a must when in Mexico. This was our first time. We bought the gold member VIP tickets that were 130 USD each. Worth it as VIP's get straight to the front of the queue and in a separate VIP area right next to a private bar. We got plenty of drinks regularly and had our own waiter! Enjoyed the acts and music that was played. My daughter and I were asked to dance on the main stage which was a good experience! All staff were very friendly and I got talking to Saidy who provides the toilet service there. This was where I put my Spanish skills to use! She was lovely. Make sure you tip the toilet staff and waiters who work really hard to make sure you have a good night! There was one negative though. The tables were too close together so you were touching the people next to you on other tables. A great night, but would have been even better if there was more room inbetween the VIP tables.

Brilliant. As many others have said we thought the gold package would not be worth it but how wrong we were. We always had a drink in front of us all night and had fantastic seats. The show was amazing, it was a mix of everything it was just great. You really, REALLY have to go here it's such a good experience.British young people - we very nearly didn't get in as the bouncer asked for any ID. we managed to convince him after a little discussion that we were indeed 23 and weren't lying. Take some form of ID just in case.Partttttttyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy

Amazing Experience. We visited Coco Bongo last night and had an incredible time. The best way to describe it is a HUGE party. The show takes you through a number of well know movies, with performers throughout the club dancing.Bring your sense of humour, at times there's a bit of a dated feel with things like 'Booty Cam' - the camera zooms into the bottoms of women dancing and broadcasts it on the big screen.We booked GoldMember tickets through our TUI Rep and although at $130 per person they weren't cheap, it's the only way to experience Coco Bongo. Taken straight to the front of the line, escorted to our own tables on a balcony over looking the stage. We had our own waiter with unlimited drinks all night. Give the waiter a couple of small tips early on in the night and you won't ever have an empty glass. You do have to be prepared for a very very busy club though, I would not have wanted to be on the main floor of the club which looked incredibly packed. That being said there's loads of staff throughout the club and it feels very well organised and safe. All in all, if your visiting Mexico this is not to be missed!

Excellent Night Club. Great entertainment. Its epic. so hard to describe the fabulous show thats put on my the team. Waiting staff continually fill up your drink. Beware of the shot girls they have a little party trick which is worth buying the shot. Play along for the fun of itEnjoyable night all round
Total extravaganza. Went VIP for a night here. Thoroughly enjoyed the evening of music, song and dance and loads of drink!!! Don;t think you are too old for this: I am 65 and had a great night

This is difficult for me...... This was my second visit to Coco Bongo, previously I would have given it an easy 5/5, this time I reluctantly had to go for 4/5. It's difficult for me, because for 4 years I have raved to everyone how magical this show is, sadly this time I feel a little different.Don't get me wrong, this is still the most incredible show in the World in my opinion, but there were just a few things that I felt let it down a bit.Back in 2012, I was simply blown away but the incredible fast action, unbelievable stunts and the atmosphere of the club. A place like no other, an experience like never before. Perhaps this is why I feel a bit let down.To me the show didn't flow as I felt it should. It wasn't as quick paced, there were gaps and much of the stuff was totally identical to the last time. I know they have routines for the night, but it was Tron, Spiderman and the Passion of Christ as the main shows as it was in 2012. I had hoped to see the Matrix, Batman v Bane, Captain America or some new shows. The new show was Star Wars and for me it went on a bit too long.The show started at 11.30 instead of 11.00 and finished at 3.00 with a DJ set by the resident DJ. I'm pretty sure the show used to be 4 hours long and in all honesty it felt a bit like it was being rushed through.The atmosphere just wasn't quite the same. I don't know if this was down to the inclusion of so many tables, or the "Juan hell of a night" crowd who only get to see the first two hours of the show and then ushered back out again.It's very crowded on the balconies and was quite a relief when the two beside me decided to go as it gave me decent room.For all these gripes, there is absolutely no doubt that there is no place on earth like the Coco Bongo and you will not see a better show anywhere. I just feel they have reached a stage where they know they have made it and feel as though they don't need to keep pushing and they can relax a bit.
