Brilliant!!. What a great night out!! So much going on! One of the best nights out my partner and I have had in ages. Fully recommend!

Fun night. Fun night, great show, although people say its better than Vegas shows, we saw a show in Vegas 8 days before we went here and in all honesty it isn't (but i guess it depends what show you have seen in Vegas). We went VIP, this is a must as it looked chaotic downstairs. Drinks were continuously brought to our table which was great so we could concentrate on the show and have fun. There is a VIP toilet so don't worry, and wear whatever you want, there is no dress code. Definitely worth a visit as is nothing like you would have seen before.
Mad. We went to this night club on friday , booked through travel rep , bit expensive but got seats upstairs and great view, bit of a crazy night but a good laugh and a great show

WOW!!. Literally AMAZING!!! We didn't really know what to expect of this nightclub and wondered whether it was worth the money but we were certainly not disappointed! Paid for a VIP gold member ticket, glad we did as we were on the balcony with a great view and never an empty glass! The show was incredible, such a great atmosphere, didn't want it to end even at half 3 in the morning!! Highly recommended!!

Wonderful night out. Brilliant show is wonderful been seen show twice  Two different holiday one hubby & Me first time Mexcio & second time with Sister & her Husband both fabulous show recommend it Go ! :-))))

Didn't even make it to the club. Shocker. Coach arrived to collect us, our names weren't on the list because of a mistake with the booking, the guy who was due to "look after" us said he'd "do us a favour" by "letting" us on the coach didn't look happy when I kicked off about his attitude. Said we weren't going anywhere with someone who spoke to is the way he did. He wasn't bothered. Got a full refund but this guy worked for Coco Bongos according to his t shirt and gave an horrendous impression.

Our night out. Amazing u have to do this!!! We bought a via ticket well worth it didn't have to queue and drinks included with waiter service and seating area really enjoyed it a fantastic night. Would definitely recommend.

AVOID.... TERRIBLE COMPANY . I didn't even make it to coco bongo! I had paid $250 to go here for my birthday with my husband while on holiday from the UK. I didn't have the credit card used to make the booking as the account is closed but had all the confirmation of purchase etc... they wouldn't let me collect the tickets nor refund this amount so I'm out of pocket and didn't even get to go. AVOID AVOID AVOID

Alexis, Ema , Elizabeth, kika, . They were all very entertaining to our girls, they were all very kind to all of us! They all came to us to talk to us and offer to play games with the girls and my girls really like all them very much and so do us!

VIP is a joke. OK the show and the atmosphere are amazing. Can't fault that at all. Never seen or experienced anything like it. If you want to go to dance and be a part of it all don't bother with the whole "gold VIP" bit. Right the Gold VIP thing:Pros- our waiter was great. Really attentive and didn't leave us without a drink all night. His name was Dave I forget his surname. He was great. Pros- branded drinks, although the cynic in me makes me wonder. Cons- according to the website the VIP area is restricted to 120 people. No chance. They had us rammed in like cattle. So much so that a wall length bench seat with tiny dots of round tables in front they wanted 4 to a table. To achieve this we were instructed that the men should sit on the back of the bench whilst your partner sits on the seat of the bench between your legs. Resulting in two people taking up one space. Also from this view yes you can see the stage but a lot of the action happens on the dance floor on the ground floor. You cannot see this at all, for one because you are sat right up against the wall and secondly because you then have another row of people on stools sat in front of you.There are a few tables next to the balcony which would offer a good view but unless you happen to be the first half dozen in you stand no chance. We decided very early on we would not stay where we had been put and spotting some empty stools on the third landing went and nabbed them. Ok. Now we had a better but not great view and the stools were so tightly squeezed into an area I physically couldn't sit facing forward as there was no room for my legs. H&S obviously isn't a big thing here. All in all what could and should have been an amazing night was ruined by the so called VIP bit. Seems to me like it's just a con to make more money. Unfortunately I fell for it.

Coco Bongo. We travel as a group and book a VIP excursion to the Coco Bongo. We avoided the long lines and drinks were free. the show was out of this world. We are all in our late 50's and 60's, and were worried about the late night shows, nevertheless we did not want to leave at 3:30 a.m. to catch the shuttle back to the resort.

What a night!!. What an amazing night! the show is incredible and all the staff go to extra efforts to make sure that you have a great night. I would so recommend going goldmember as I think it was sooo worth the money! we were never left without a drink thanks to the fabulous waiter Francisco! I loved that between the show there were music intervals where everyone just went crazy!! the music is great in here. I thought to begin with that it was going to be a very long night, but to be honest I wish It would have lasted longer!! would recommend a visit to coco bongos to anyone! couples or singles of any age! will definitely visit again if I ever travel back to Mexico!! best night of the whole trip!!

Crazy time . Went last night and it was amazing!!! We got regular tickets at $62.00 per person and I am glad I didn't get VIP as our spot was fine. Shout out to Freddy our server he was amazing!!! This was a crazy party with alcohol everywhere. The shows were very well done and the energy was great. Awesome experience to try even just one. Get vip if you have mobility issues.
Oh ya. I got pulled onto the bar 5x to dance! The shows were really good to watch. Major long waits to get in unless you want to pay more. Our large group had a blast.
A must go. Only one word to describe the entertainment Spectacular, not even Vegas could offer better shows Entertainment at its best

Night Life. Booked the funtastic night out from our resort, really easy and not with our travel agent as well. Our Air transat rep was upset that we didn't book with her, there were reps for coco bongo walking the resort selling tickets for the event which we believe to be much cheaper than the travel agent

Great fun . Good fun, we had VIP tickets, no crowd. Drinks served one after another, included. the only thing is that you need to show to the staff passport and bank card which is bit odd. Basically you don't take your docs for whole night party. Worth money.

Very disappointed . We booked CoCo Bongo for a great fun lively night out but it was much to our disappointment!!! We booked with Thomson the Gold VIP tickets and paid £97.00 for each ticket to be guaranteed seating, but this was not the case. I would like to make you aware that NO point you are guaranteed seating and the Thomson reps lied to us! We were very disappointed with the show for the amount of money paid, there are only one toilet on each floor so there is no point drinking as you spend most of your time queuing. I wouldn't recommend wainscoting your money!

VIP disappointment coco bongo. heard all the good reviews about coco bongo we payed for the VIP tickets nearly £200 for two tickets from the Thomson rep to say we were a bit disappointed is a under statement firstly one ladies toilet on the VIP level and two urinals for the mens. not all drinks are free you also have girls walking shaking a shots bottle at you costing $5 dollars a shot and to say it puts Vegas to shame is sadly wrong been to Vegas is far better. the dancers were good the miming a bit out sync.

Has to be experienced . We went to Coco Bongo very late around 1am, paid for the VIP package which was about 70 dollars with drinks included. Don't expect a nightclub it's a proper show, every 5 minutes the stage has different acts. Mostly impressionists and characters from movies like Mask and Spider Man. Overall fun!

Wow! . Believe the hype!!
We went as gold members and had the best seats in the house! Drinks flowed and the many shows made the evening go very quickly! Go!!

Great night out. Booked the VIP Gold Member through Thomas Cook, opting for the seated area, definitely worth doing as this includes all of your drinks & the waiters are great at coming round & keeping you topped up - regardless of tips. The show is incredible & the atmosphere of the club is fantastic. I found the breaks in the show a bit irritating (largely as I am not a 'dance' music fan) & think the evening would have had more impact if there had been fewer breaks. Would definitely recommend this for a fun night out, have a siesta first, the show doesn't start until 11, we left at 3 am & it was still going strong!

Good night out but dont go for VIP. As you may have read in all other reviews, this is no ordinary night club in more ways than one, but not all of the for good reasons...let me explain:A fair assumption to going to a 'night club' in a spanish speaking country, even in a touristic city like cancun, is that one will get to hear some music, possibly latin, and have a chance to dance. This assumption may be slightly optimistic mostly because the club is packed - and i dont mean a little, i mean that you will genuinely have 50cm by 50cm to bust your best moves...trying to go beyond that will certainly lead to stepping on someones shoes.The music is trendy, feels like they do have a lot of love for Pitbull and Black eyed peas because by the end of the night, it felt like we had gone through all of their hits... So if thats your sort of music, you will enjoy it a little more. This is not to say that there wasn't other genres, but it wasn't a significant amount. So this may sound a little off putting, but i truly would say that the when your amongst other people, you simply get into the environment and its definitely a good night out.The shows are creative, although once you see one the rest are basically the same but differently choreographed, nevertheless they are still impressive. The skits they do in between to get people interacting are also fun and a good laugh (granted that if you get picked for any you don't take yourself too serious). If you are a lady, i would also suggest that you wear pants or think twice before agreeing to dance at the top...wont give anything away but you been warned. :-)All entries include drinks but don't forget tipping money, and if you do need to leave early or didn't get a ticket with transport, you are looking to pay between $12-$15 to get back to most hotels. The last tip i would give to have a good night is don't bother with VIP, its essentially the same experience with the exception of getting in about 20mins earlier at around 10:40 (although show doesn't start until 11sh), position yourself near a table if possible and you will basically have the same night as the VIP guests. Definitely a must if you haven't been before, but not as much fun the second time as its the same show...music and shows. If you been once, you're better of going to other clubs to mix it up.
FAB!!. It's a late one, but do it, it's well worth it!! You will have a great night and it's not just for the young ones!

Amazing experience. We booked this directly with the travel rep to ensure we knew exactly what we were paying for and it did not disappoint! The drinks were constantly flowing and the performances were amazing. I would definitely recommend going and if I am ever in the area again I will definitely return.

Amazing . We had heard lots and been told to go so we thought lets go VIP.We were put on the side of the stage and as much as the view was very limited we enjoyed it.The show lasts for quite a long time and goes through the music eras where the team of entertainers dress up as Queen, Madonna, Beyoncé, Elvis as well as Spider-Man and other entertainment.I would recommend going if your ever in the area. Also VIP is very good for a few more Pesos and you get a waiter to bring you unlimited drinks.When you arrive you get tequila shots and a cocktail to enjoy.

Words cannot describe!!. We went on a Friday evening in April, booked through Lomas on the GoldMember package and were picked up from El Dorado Royale at 9:15pm. We went to a few other hotels to attempt to collect more guests and then finally arrived at CocoBongo.Queue jumped as expected, shot of tequila on arrival, quickly shown to our seats (first floor sitting directly opposite the stage) and immediately introduced to our waiter for the evening.The show starts at 11:30pm but it doesn't feel like a wait at all. There was a single toilet upstairs which very rarely did you queue for, and the toilet attendant was brilliant.There wasn't any pressure to keep drinking, the waiter just was on point to fill up or change drinks as we needed/ wanted. Very attentive, fun and helpful.The show, wow - just wow. It's pretty much non stop from 11:30pm to about 3am. Without ruining too much of the surprise there is a massive mix of everything from Michael Jackson to Chicago and a respectful tribute to Prince. A mix of tributes, west end, circus craziness! Highly recommended!!! TIP: get the GoldMember package - it's 100% worth it. Normal ticket holders means you queue, your looking up to the first floor for the show and your crammed in like sardines. Although you get covered with confetti ...

The best party EVER!. We have been to Coco Bongos twice now! The show is also new and wow what a show! It's Mardi Gras, 4th of July and New Years Eve all rolled into one! The drinks are great, music amazing!! You can have your picture taken with the Mask and Spiderman! I highly recommend going as a VIP. You have tables and seats then, much more comfortable. The main floor is packed in so it gets very hot and crowded but the VIP area is wonderful!!!
Amazing!! . The performance is amazing!! I want to go back!!! I was in the vip zone really close to the stage, I enjoyed every minute in coco bongo!!! I love it!!

Was good when entertainment was on. Women should go dressed in a hijab if the camera guys are about.. The performers i cant fault. Fantastic to watch and you can tell alot of effort went into their performances. What taints this slightly is the women going around asking if you want shots then charging when youve paid for all drinks. Also the guys on the camera need to stop making it the perv show. Loads of girls they zoomed in on (in intimate areas) were horrified and tried to cover up when they saw themselves on the big screen. Did the camera men stop? NOPE. This just leaves customers feeling uncomfortable. Entertainment deserves 5*

Fun. Great place to go the show is fabulous and worth every penny one minute you're dancing then some part of the show starts it is very loud and the beat of the music pulses through your body but worth it
Outstanding!!. One of the best shows to see, had a fabulous time.great music ? Excitement, balloons come out of nowhere , great impersonations .

Fantastic evening! . The Mrs & I had a great night at coco bongo! The show is brilliant with some superb live acts such as Spider-Man & pirates of Caribbean! MJ was my personal fav at the end! We went for the VIP which I'm glad we did simply so we wasn't as crowded. Well, I say VIP it was more a very small table with a stool lol. The area is very busy but not as bad as main stage. Going to the toilet is beyond a joke. Definitely need to do something about that. But all in all, fantastic evenings entertainment!

Gold member is worth the money!. We went to Coco Bongos in September 2015 and had a fantastic night out! We booked the Gold Member ticket through Thomson which I thought was well worth the money. You are guaranteed a seat and get a waiter service all night. You also skip all of the queues, when we got there we were given a wristband and taken straight to our seat, the queues were massive so it was well worth it. The show itself was fab, you didn't know what would happen next, one minute spiderman was flying across the club, the next Madonna was on stage. Incredible. We were there for 5 hours but it flew by, it was really good fun for all ages.

Awesome club. We had awesome experience in Coco Bongo. Initially, I thought paying 60USD for a club may not be worth it and it may be too much commercial. The entrance ticket is all inclusive of drinks. However, the experience turned out to be much better. They run multiple shows and I have to say they looked very natural and professional. The service was great, I never had to queue up for a drink. I would highly recommend to party in Coco Bongo if you are around the area. They are redefining the experience of clubbing.

You need to go at least once!. Very cool experience. The acts were well done and music played in between for dancing. The place does get pretty full. But it's not too hot as bursts of cold air and confetti come out for almost every show. It's kinda like a Disney ride to get in where your in a line up and go down a long hallway. They give u a drink upon entrance check your bag/purse then around the corner they hand you a shot of tequilla. Had so much fun.

An absolute must!. Where do I start? Wow! What an incredible night, the entertainment was amazing and they love to get you involved which adds to the experience.We opted for the regular open bar over vip and are really glad we did, that extra cash did not seem worth it and we were not short on drinks! To each their own but if you want to be up amongst it and get the chance to get up there and dance on stage regular is the way to go.

Happy Birthday buddy!!. We went to Coco Bongo on April 22nd to celebrate a buddy's birthday and all we can say is WOW!!! What a freakin' good time. Bumpin' and grindin' on the floor until 4am. Met a whole bunch of fun people from all over the world! Word to the wise...when you are told not to do certain things then don't! One guy got booted within minutes of being there for lighting up a joint in the bathroom...freakin' moron! You should have smoked before you went in buddy, it's all the booze you can drink anyways! The show itself was absolutely amazing and would go back again for sure! It's a long night but totally worth the exhaustion the next day LOL. Party hard my friends :-)

A MIND BLOWING EXPERIENCE !! MUST SEE. If you do anything while in Mexico you must visit this Nightclub/Show!! been all over the world throughout Europe and nothing compares to this!! Vegas could be worse lol The blow oxygen , confetti, baloons etc, there is a dance cam and the show and performers were amazing!! OPEN BAR if you book with your hotel...don't buy the VIP, its better in the crowd if you like to party...find and green shirt guy out side when u get there he will bring you to a black shirt guy (you'll know who they are, clearly marked with logos) and they will charge you 10 usd to skip a line which i waited in for 2 hours! lol still well worth the wait....dont take a wallet...there are pick pockets inside!!

Disappointed after so much hype. We spent the night at Coco Bongo, after seeing the reviews on here and a few people saying it's a must-see. We went with the gold package: upstairs seating/'free' drinks. What they don't tell you is that the seats are crammed in pretty tightly and if you're at the back (there were two rows where we were sat), your view is somewhat restricted, though you can still see the majority of what's going on on the top stage, just not when things happen on the bottom one. Also, not all drinks are free: vodka and coke, yes but a jagerbomb no: that has to be bought with a coco bongo cup which is 18 US dollars. There is also only one single toilet for all the people sat in that section so if you need to go: don't wait until the last minute as there was a constant queue.On arrival it was very busy: very much a club atmosphere. As gold guests, we got to skip the queues and were seated in the upstairs area near the bar. The show starts with lots of scantily clad women in studded bras gyrating provocatively around to music. It was very much a strip show, without the stripping! The main show takes you through various acts, basically tribute acts with people dressed up as the famous people, (badly) miming their songs. There was a good selection though: off the top of my head there was Beyonce, Madonna, Michael Jackson, the Moulin Rouge, Queen, LMFAO, as well as a Batman and Spiderman sketch. The acts last around 5 minutes each and in between each one there is around 10 minutes of music playing, with the video playing on two large screens either side of the stage. Meanwhile, two women from the audience wriggling around, doing their best 'sexy' dancing while the next act prepares to come on. If they're wearing a skirt or dress, a wind machine blows a huge gust of air upwards at a random moment, sending their skirt flying upwards to reveal.... Well, we saw a few bottoms and front bottoms last night! The audience thought it was hilarious but the girls were mortified at having their bits and bobs flashed to a couple of thousand people. We got pretty drunk and danced and sang: the selection of music is good and there was constantly music on, though we expected to see a more polished show. We didn't expect that for well over half the time that we would just be watching music videos: we have MTV for that! We were also surprised at how sexualised it was. At several points, a dwarf dressed in various costumes proceeds to simulate having sex with various people.... Very strange and quite unnecessary. The camera was panning around to women, zooming in on their chests and bums: really not quite sure what that all added to what everyone said was going to be a great quality show. I'd read that it rivalled las vegas. I've never been to Vegas but have watched shows in London that are more polished and much better quality. I really didn't want to write a bad review after all the good ones. What I will say is that with all the drinks flowing: it's more likely that people are going to have a better time! But if alcohol is needed to make something better: it probably wasn't great in the first place. It receives a lot of hype but in my opinion, doesn't really live up to expectations. It may be seen as one of the best places in Playa del carmen but then, there is nothing to compete with because there is nothing else like it to compare to.

Exciting evening. I am a non drinker and hate crowds so I thought this would not be the place for me boy was I wrong. The show is something spectacular to see. I recommend anyone looking for a fun night out in Playa del Carmen to check this place out

Not to be missed. Incredible entertainment once it got going and the waiters did an excellent job in keeping the drinks coming. We were on the balcony and in my opinion it was better for us ( 2 couples on the wrong side of 60! ) Music, dancing, mime, acrobats and lots more. Believe me this show keeps the senses reeling!However I must agree that the toilets are inadequate. Only one at a time in the upstairs male and when you washed your hands a guy outside handed in a paper towel. What? I also agree with other reviews concerning the fire hazard. This place is going to have a very bad happening if it is not acted upon. In Britain it would risk being closed down
I night to not forget. Amazing place, fun all night whit super show. People are nice and funny and make sure your drink is always full. The show are music start whit Beatles untill Super Heroes.

So much fun! . Had a fantastic night here, had a waiter topping up our drinks all evening. Amazing atmosphere and the show was spectacular. My only criticism is a long wait for the toilet, there is not enough toilets.

Fun but a HUGE fire safety issue. We had a lot of fun here. The lower level was definitely for the younger crowd. If you're 30 or older, it's probably best to pay for the VIP service. My one big complaint is that this place is a death trap waiting to happen. There were no clearly listed fire escapes and no sprinkler systems. I swear it's a White Snake concert fatality, waiting to happen all over again. If you're going to go, I just suggest you have an exit plan and stay near the exits. It was a fun night.

Amazing show. We went with the VIP deal through our hotel which was definitely worth it as we got to skip all the lines and got reserved seating right next to the stage for the show. Table service is absolutely amazing we were never without a drink thanks to our server, and the show itself is like broadway and cirque de soleil in one!
Gkfjones. Amazing night out can't wait to return fantastic value for money everyone travelling to Mexico should make this part of their Agenda

Overpriced VIP. Go for the bear pit at half the price. If you paythe basic price and stay in the main stand the view is good, atmosphere too and you get those the whole show. If you go for VIP option you may get in quicker, but you still wait for the show to start, get a few more drink but not £150 worth and only see half the show and atmosphere flat as you are staining to see what goes on. We complained butt were toLd we we the only ones..we weren't.We must be spoilt in our hotel as the dancers and acrobats were better and singers were live and no lipsync. This is supposed to be Jim Carreys place but I bet he doesn't go there himself. Only one set of toilets in basement and really needs whole update. No VFM here for £250. Go to London and seas how and diner.

Coco bongo!!. Was very hesitant to go bc we could drink and have fun at resort. SO SO glad we went it was a blast and we couldn't have been happier with the experience from the waiter and drinks to the entertainment and music !!!! Definitely worth every penny!!!!!

Amazing night. What an experience,fantastic night.The show is amazing and the atmosphere has to be seen to be believed.The staff are terrific, we brought our tickets via our travel company and upgraded to the VIP part of the club which was brilliant,we were never without a drink.Although the club was packed it was well monitered by the staff and we would definatly go back.The acts ,dancers and music are great,we are still talking about it know to friends and family cannot wait to go back.

Nightclub experience . This was a unique night club experience with a great vibe and excellent entertainment. If you don't get VIP tickets and it's later in the week, expect a lineup to get in. We waited 45 minutes to get in the door.

Amazing. I have been here twice and will be back again. Imagine watching a cirque show in a bar with musical impersonators that will make you believe they are the real thing. Both times we got table service in the 100 level. Well worth the price. We danced and partied for hours. Don't take any recording devices they will search you and take them but you will get them back after. Don't miss it.

Amazing. We did the VIP deal and whilst it was expensive it was amazing. The show was fantastic. The attention from our barman who served drinks and the coach service to and from the hotel. Really enjoyed it and would highly recommend it

DO NOT GO HERE!!!. Actually I can not tell a Lie. On the Outside it is beautiful, you can see they are big and have a terrace for smokers but, the staff is unfriendly, to hasty and pushy, and they did not adequately accommodate me for my voucher to their establishment either. Another excursion sells you tickets to there place for you to have WATERED Down drinks, poor music selection, Crude staff and no fun. You're probably better off just walking up to the place to see if you can get it free because even at a discount for $35 USD it still WAS NOT WORTH IT. Try Palazzo or the Blue Parrot instead ( Blue parrot actually had free entry and body paint party) you tell me which deal was better. Sorry to say my experience wasn't as good as I expected it to be.

You'll never experience anything like COCO BONGO!. This club in humungous and I loved it because it drew many different types of people from all over Cancun brought together from all over the world under one roof. This place is not just a nightclub it has live shows which are fun and entertaining to watch. It gets pretty packed so if possible get a table higher up so you can get better views (which you obviously have to pay for). They pull people out of the crowd to dance so prepare to have your best dance moves ready for the spotlight!

Lost goods. Went to coco bongos the 2nd night we were in Mexico with over 20 of family and friends and the show was amazing! But staff were always shaking their tip boxes and not wanting to serve you if you didn't give them a tip also we booked through a man in our hotel who was a rep for coco bongos and we booked as gold members for our own space together which was fab but a lot of money! The man we were paying couldn't stay away from us and promised us free T-shirts when we pay, soon as we paid all our money and after he dropped us off at coco bongos in a big bus we never seen him again and never got our free T-shirts he promised! my mum was also spiked throughout the show and her bag, shoes, phone and a photo with the 'mask' was left as we had to rush her out! staff were useless so we spoke to a different coco bongos rep at our hotel as the first one wasn't in sight and he said we need to write a letter of what happened and what was in her bag and other goods she had left so we did and handed it in the next day to our rep we waited about 4 days and didn't hear anything so we went up and asked him and he said if there was anything left coco bongos would phone him so there was no point in handing in the letter!!!

Gold member price, bronze member experience. We booked the gold member tickets for US $130 thinking it would enhance our experience.The queue jump is a lie. You join a separate queue and then the two queues merge onto one after passing the ticket office. We waited in line for around half an hour. Once inside we were seated on a table up high at head height. We needed to unseat the people next to us and climb up on their chairs to get to this table. The chairs were on an uneven surface meaning I toppled off it, this is before any alcohol! They then put 2 people on stools in front of us meaning we then had to unseat 4 people to get out. At this point we asked to be moved. Our second table was behind another meaning we had a very restricted view so we couldn't enjoy the show (see picture). After 40mins of frustration we then moved to the floor area which charges US $65. We much preferred this view and being amongst the party. The Coco Bongo website states that only 120 people are in the gold member area. This is a lie, there were easily double that amount of people. We got the impression that they weren't bothered about the experience people received as long as they got your money. We really had to push them to move us and they didn't want to give us a refund. We've reported this to our TUI rep, we don't normally complain but it really was a poor experience. If you want to go don't bother with the top priced tickets, it's a con and lie. You can reserve a table on the floor level with bottle service for half the price and you can watch all of the show with a better view.

Not for the claustrophobic but it's a blast!!!!!!!. I went to Coco Bongo with my mom and sister for my 30th birthday and man was this place awesome. I've never been the club type and the evening started off rough trying to get packed in, but it was worth it. The performances and music were awesome, there's special effects, good drinks, great crowd. I have to say that this was the best night of my trip, and by all accounts the best night we've ever had!!! Highly recommend it

Fun Fun Fun. What an amazing incredible not stop musical extravaganza. Party until you can't no more.This multi story entertainment emporium is a fun night out for a small group or large party of friends.The ever changing acts are really great and it is unbelievable how many songs they can choreograph in 5 mins. You will never be bored.

Amazing Night. We visited In April 2016 as a young couple whilst on holiday in Riviera Maya. We booked our tickets through a rep at the hotel and chose the Gold Member VIP package which came to $260 for both of us. It was hassle free and included transportation from our hotel, although we chose to take taxis as we wanted to go to some bars before rather than just straight to the show and didn't want to be tied down to a pick up time at the end!We were slightly apprehensive as neither of us wanted a crazy 'spring break' night out...but we had nothing to worry about! It was a fantastic night and the show was amazing, with all kinds of performances mixed with music, confetti and balloons! The audience was really varied and there was something for everyone. We had such a great time laughing, dancing and singing.We had our own table and chairs on the first floor overlooking the stage as part of our package, as well as our own waiter...meaning our glasses were never empty. After giving our initial drink order, we never had to ask for more as he was always there with a new drink...very good service. There were loads of shot girls but we avoided and these cost extra.I really would recommend this to anybody...the show itself is so impressive and there is no pressure to get involved with anything you don't want to! On the other hand...if you want to dance on the bar and podiums...they welcome it! It really was one of the best trips of our holiday.
Once in a lifetime. After doing some research, we booked Coco Bongo. Our excursion included V.I.P. seating and unlimited drinks for five hours of awesome party and Vegas quality non-stop show.

Very packed. We went on a bar crawl first with thomsons/first choice which was so much fun we then finished in co co bongos, we were glad it was the last part of the trip, for us it was way too packed you could not really see much even tho we stood on the chairs what we did see was good but there should of never been so many on each level over looking the main stage but worth a look to end the night don't go all night .

Pay the extra $$!!!. We went with a group of 15. We paid the $75 and most of us regretted it. We should have paid the extra money. It was so crammed in there! They will put people anywhere they can fit them! We were placed in a corner on the 3rd level and had no view of the show. Some of us ended up leaving(me) and the rest found a spot on the floor, probably the best place if you don't have a table. Unlimited drinks are included in the price so drink up! We all ordered 2 drinks at a time, you might consider the same. Get in line early and plan to be packed into this place. The ones that stayed did say the show was amazing.

Do Not Miss It !. We bought tickets to go to the club through the official representative of the club Giovanni at H10 Ocean Coral. We weren't sure if this event would be safe to attend since it was all night event. Giovanni explained what we could expect during the show & gave us some safety tips. He also brought us there earlier so we could enjoy the street party performed by staff members which right away put us in the great mood.This show is for everybody. No age limits. We didn't pay for bottle service but we had our table and waiter which was taking care of us within minutes.Giovanni and Oscar from the hotel entertainment team took fantastic care of us. We felt safe we and our transportation was on time.Thank you Giovanni and OscarAnna 5404
Worth a visit. Went as couple on honeymoon, great night out! The show is fantastic and tunes are great! Would recommend

Best night of my life. Came to Coco's with a group of 20 of us after much debate throughout the week. So incredibly happy we did! We had ViP with open bar, attentive waiters, and energetic amazing show with tons of crowd participation! From the first confetti blast I knew I had found heaven. Don't debate it, pay the money and go, you won't regret it!

One of the best nights ever!. Me and my boyfriend booked VIP. Was so worth the extra dollars.. We got a table, our own waiter and we got a great view of the show! Such a crazy night and we absolutely loved it! If you go to Mexico you NEED to do Coco Bongo! You will have a ball!!

Make Sure You Do it!!. You have to go and experience this it's like Cirque Show in Vegas with all of the Elements of the Best nightclub you've ever been to. Plus it's Open Bar. I'd recommend that you buy a bottle so that you can get a booth to be able to sit and enjoy the show and sights
Fun fun fun!!!. This is my 4th time here and it was just as fun as always! The music plays all night and our waiter was very attentive and fun!

Was a blast!! . Enjoyed an evening here. Amazing show and really fun atmosphere. We had VIP package so it was nice to have seats to sit in, it also included an open bar with server serving us. Would definitely go back.

Amazing experience!. Shows and night club dancing. Amazing experience and must seen place.
Negotiate in your hotel and you will get it cheap. Get a table if you can, will be around 3h show.
The bad points are: it's too crowded and too small place. Impossible to enjoy your Open Bar if you are at the dance floor.

Stag/stagette. We went with a large group of 20 people so we got a vip section. We were getting married 2 days later and wanted a night out with friends. I wasn't to excited to go because I wasn't feeling like going out. It's a late night but it was one of the best nights of my life! They put on an amazing show and it's good for all ages! Def a must do in Mexico.

Fun and Entertaining Show. After being harassed endlessly by all of the salesman that line the streets and beaches in Play Del Carmen and Cancun, we decided to purchase tickets for a Monday night show. We didn't expect much, as we were not too impressed with the bar scene there. We were actually pleasantly surprised by the content of the show and the caliber of the performers. You are lead into the arena and assigned a spot to stand if you are doing open bar. From there, you have a waiter/waitress who will literally hand you a refreshed drink every 5-10 minutes on the dot. We couldn't even finish our drinks fast enough. After 4 nights of sweet, sugary mexico drinks we had our fill for sure, but appreciated the attentive nature of the workers. Show was fun, interesting, eclectic and unique. We wouldn't necessarily go again, but we had a great time.
Just WOW !!!!!. COCO BONGO is night club meets concert meets circus meets Red bull. It was 4 hours of pure Energy, great music, great dancing, great drinks and awesome acts. DO THE VIP ITS WORTH IT

Great night out. Great night out full of energy! Didn't think I would last the night but it was so energetic I couldn't leave! :-) we paid for the gold member experience and glad I did, we didn't need to go to the bar once and had drinks whenever we asked for them!

Well worth a visit! . Great show, will keep you entertained for the night! If your a woman and you like to flash your body parts this place will be more then happy to accommodate you for the evening! You'll know what I mean when you go! Prob wouldn't go again, but glad I went.Also, I lost my phone the night I was there. Was told by the reps and hotel staff not to bother going down to check lost property. I couldn't get through to my phone provider to cancel the phone, so went down there on the off chance and they had found my phone and gave it back to me! Was well chuffed!

Great Night. Visited Coco Bongo with 5 friends and had an absolutely great time. The atmosphere inside was electric and the drinks flowed all night. The shows throughout the night keep everyone entertained and lively. The only hint is if you have a prepaid drink service is to watch out for the shot girls. Those shots are not included in your prepaid drinks and they will try and get you to do a shot and then ask for money. Thankfully we knew this before, but we witnessed a ton of people forking out money after the fact and had no idea. Overall, I would recommend this experience to anyone visiting Playa Del Carmen.
Amazing. Had an amazing time with friends and family at Coco Bongo! Show was great, service was great, transportation was great! Highly recommend!

Fab night out. We went here in March and had a fab night out. Its a lot of fun and even though my partner is not a night club lover, he really enjoyed it. Would recommend. The only downsides were that we paid for the gold tickets and when I went the toilet there was only one toilet! which meant there was always a queue and it wasn't very organised either. We were led to believe our seats would be reserved and if you wanted to go down and dance you could come back and you would still have your seats. When we were taken to the area there were no tables left and then about ten minutes later we were taken to the other side of the club and they sat us down..i didn't feel I could leave and come back to the same seats as it was so busy, I doubt the seats would be there when we came back. Other than that it was a fab night out with trapeze artists, and shows on most of the night.

Wow!. Me and my partner did a pub crawl which ended in the coco bongo! It's safe to say it was a booze fuelled night I felt it the next day. Getting drinks in the coco bingo is hard work, you're best to tip and you will have at least half a chance of getting a drink! The other places we visited were brilliant, with waiter service and good quality drinks, I'm sure we were given trebles haha if you're a couple I really think you should try this. We met a few couples on it who we still speak to now

this is the 3 time I go....... 3 days ago i went. I had fun, this is the 3 time I go and you still enjoy it. The only thing I can advice you is a lot better to get the regular cover. Also from Tuesday till Thursday ($75 usd) is a different price than weekend. ($85 to $ 90usd) Is 10 to 15 usd different. The VIP service is not need it plus the space you get is small and you always stand up, you don't sit cause the sits are not to comfortable. The price for VIP $ 130 till 170 usd. Dependent where you buy it. The people in the 5ave always race up the fee. If you worry about the view, don't worry cause the place is small and you can see very well. To have more fun try to be in the middle by the bar. You don't to wait for a drink and all the show is in the middle. Don't forger to hold your personal bag (ladies) and your wallet (gentleman). If you don't want to have a hart time with you stuff don't leave it in the table or bar. Always hold on it. Other than this go and enjoy it. If you don't have some one to go just call me. I live in playa. Have fun!!!!

Amazing Experiance!. My girlfriend and I had an amazing Coco Bongo experience from beginning to end, Our Coco Bongo Representative Hector Martinez from the Catalonia Playa Maroma really gave us a perfect experience. He picked us up right on time and stayed with us the entire time on line and even making sure we got a good spot to enjoy the show, he didn't leave until he introduced us to our waiter for the night and even gave us free coco bongo souvenirs for our travels, He made the experience worth while and I highly recommend him. Hectors booth is located pool side at the Catalonia Playa Maroma Resort in Playa Del Carmen.

Fantastic both times. I have gone to this bar twice (once in my thirties and once in my forties) and both times were just as much fun as the other! If you like a “party” atmosphere this is a must. The shows are excellent – loud music – a little cirque de soleil – very vibrant and energetic. Both trips we organized through the hotel with VIP service – VIP service is the way to go – no line ups and your guide also is your waiter all night staying with you the whole time. Both times we stood in “the pit” which our groups really loved due to the liveliness of our location. We could see the shows very well– sometimes the performers were literally over our heads! Highly recommend – because the show ends at 3:00 am I would recommend having a pre-arranged tour (it is reassuring coming out of the bar and having your transfer waiting right there – especially if you have had a few drinks) – however taxis are usually outside for hire as well. There is no smoking inside however access is available to go outside if you must.If in the area you must go at least once!
SO MUCH FUN!!. Went with a few work colleagues and it was a BLAST!! Felt very safe the entire time and it was very lively! The hours passed so quickly!!

Wooowwww. We paid for gold and it was well worth it £160 for both of us includes return travel minibus to ourselves driver waited for us inside we had fantastic seats in the vip area you have a waiter who has another drink for you before you have even finished acts were brilliant this is a must see if you visit mexico and if you don't want to be standing and squashed all night pay extra for vip

Worth Going VIP . A very entertaining night- we did this as part of a Thomson bar crawl style tour which included drinks and advanced entry with a balcony giving a great view of the show. I'm not normally one for 'night clubs' but this had something for everyone.

Travel Agent Review....Going Down Hill...Skip it!. I have been to Coco Bongo's ten times! Seven in Cancun, twice in Playa del Carmen and once in Punta Cana. We were there Wednesday April 6th (Gold VIP) and it was the worst I have ever seen it. They have scaled back the shows for more DJ/bar star dancing from the trashy audience girls & eliminated a lot of shows completely. They did manage to add a StarWars sequence (two actually) that were great. There was no real finale and about 2:45 am or so, they just brought a DJ on stage with girls from the audience shakin there booty. The show used to be non-stop action, but now, its more like a regular club with a few shows mixed in.They opened the Punta Cana location last year, which was amazing. I wonder if they stole the talent from Playa Del Carmen.Either way, I won't be back to the Playa Del Carmen location. I was disappointed!

Beyond our expectations. my husband and I booked this with my daughter and boyfriend (late 20's so we're not so young!) at our Thomson welcome meeting. On the reps advice we got VIP tickets meaning good seats and free drinks.i must admit when we got in the cab at 9.45 I did wonder if we'd made a mistake, it doesn't start till 11 pm and I'm not use to such late nights! On arrival at coco bongo we were in a short VIP queue and soon entered the venue where we given a cocktail and a shot. Everything was meticulously organized with checks at every corner. We had great seats overlooking the stage and dance floor . We had our own waiter who we tipped $5 on arrival and kept our glasses filled all evening. There was a screen with a countdown to showtime, and videos with great music of every era , with dancers on the dance floor, all very entertaining and the time passed really quickly . The actual show is several different acts dressed as the artist and miming, Madonna , Elvis, Michael Jackson and many others with a bit of cirque de soleil , all kinds of music and dancing not to mention the midget who was behaving inappropriately at every turn . The music is really loud( Paracetomol before you go not a bad idea) but makes the atmosphere electric especially when all the streamers and balloons come down. Not easy to put into words all that happens but the whole night is amazing and unlike anything you will have seen before. We left when the show finished and disco started(about 3am) Just go and see for yourself

What a night. review is a little blurry as i was a little (a lot) drunk, we went in a group of 4 and paid for the vip package, was well worth the money and sat on the balcony over looking the entire show, the shows and entertainment staff were amazing and the staff keep bringing you drinks... cant remember how many in the end, Going back again very soon and cant wait ,

Nada del otro mundo (Not a great deal) . Es un bar con una tematica muy norteamericana. Los shows son buenos pero no tienen nada típico del país y aunque los bailarines son excelentes me parece que hacen falta cosas mas latinas. La música es regular. Al open bar le falta organización, no te dan una carta y los meseros esperan que sepas que pedir sin darte opciones, adicional los mezcladores son terribles. Es bueno comprar la boleta por internet por que ingresas sin hacer fila. El lugar tiene una buena energía sin embargo esperaba mucho mas por su fama. It is a bar with very American themes. The shows are good but they have nothing typical of the country. Exellent dancers but I think it needs more Latin shows and ambientation. The music is regular. The open bar lacks organization, they do not give you a menu and waiters expect you to know what you want without giving options, additional mixers are terrible. It is good to buy the ticket online so you can jump the whole line (It was long!). The place has a good energy but I expected much more from the famous Coco Bongo.

Great moment . What a great time we hadI was worried because I was tired and wasn't that days I would like be out in Clube for hours But at the moment I step in I enjoyed to much We payed VIP and worth because we stay in great place and we could see well the show and have fun Recommended If you go to Mexico make sure you book day out and spent on coco Bongo

British Honeymooner Review. We visited on St Patrick's day which was also the last day of spring break. Booked tickets for the VIP area (Note $20 USD extra for Fri and Sat) and it is worth the extra money. You get good seats and table waiter service all night. Only drink they charge you for is Red Bull.So you know the show starts at 11pm and finishes at 3am. VIP have to be in by 10pm so it is a long night but it really is amazing atmosphere and well worth a visit.Final thing if you give the waiter a decent tip at the start of the night he/she will go that extra mile for you all night.
dont waste your money. wow , if your into crowds , drunk people in a dirty place this is it .. weak drinks to boot.show was ok but not for the money

What a Blast! Highly recommend this!. Highly recommend going to Coco Bongo! What an amazing show and a fun time! We went VIP and I am glad we did so that we had the option to sit in our seats when we needed to. Very crowded on the floor, but very fun for dancing! The actors, dancers and staff really put a lot of effort into the event and it really shows! Loved it!

Gold member service very disappointing. We turned up on 31st March with our pre booked printed eticket and the original card that was used to book as per the information requested on the ticket. We were turned away because we didn't have id(the ticket just said to bring the cc not id)and had paid $40usd round trip taxi fares for nothing. We re booked for the following night, only to find the next day that there was a free transfer from our hotel if we booked the tickets from the coco bongo rep at the hotel. In spite of having to pay twice for the taxi, we were told we didn't qualify for free transfers! When we arrived the next night we were taken to a table upstairs that was squashed in a back corner with tables in front of us. The people on the front tables were standing up so we couldn't see a thing. For 145usd per person I would expect a better view. The show was ok but it doesn't even come close to competing with the likes of cirque du soleil and is pretty much a club with some ok entertainment.

Great night, definitely a must do. Coco Bongo has such a great atmosphere & was such a creative show. We went with VIP which was great, all you can drink, great view & quick access to very clean toilets but the general entry seemed fine to me.

Disabled Access. Went last night with Mrs who is wheelchair bound.I have to say we have never been treated so well as the staff at this club looked after us.We first got fast tracked into club and my wife was lifted onto a viewing platform still in chair.Our party of 4 wanted for nothing and Victor our bar waiter was top notch.They have a disabled toilet and when she needed it, she was lifted down and security parted the crowds there and back.BLOODY AMAZING Cannot recommend enough

Amazing!. Simply put, if you go to this area of Mexico, you absolutely must go to Coco Bongos!I'm not one for nightclub l'd anymore, being 41 and having been there and done all that, but this place was mind blowing and like nothing I've ever seen.Buy a silver or gold member package so you get a good view of the show and enjoy!
Great night . Really enjoyed this night out , is a bit expensive but great fun and you get looked after all night , definitely recommend

This is a must. I've never seen a show like it . From Spiderman vs the green goblin to Michael Jackson. Hi vis hi wire and highly dangerous amazing show with booze on service A good tip is to get the VIP tickets for the best service and unrivaled view of the stage. Thumbs up for this 18+ show

Great entertainment. My husband and I took our Grandaughter and 2 of her friends,all 20 years old to Coco Bongos in Playa Del Carmen..We arrived at 11pm and was escorted in by Antonnio.Not sure his position there,but he treated us like royalty.Walked us in,walked us through security and took us to our table.Our grandaughter and he friends danced up a storm all night and even got invited to dance up in the spotlight for 15 minutes.They just loved it.As fir the entertainment,well,it was none stop,till 3am.Fabulous,fabulous.I couldn't even begin to discribe it..Amazing and fantastic doesn't even begin to discribe it..Everyone should experience it.We went with the young people to "look out for them ",but truly no need..Everyone on staff treated us with the utmost respect ..Walking home at 4 am probably was my only concern for the young people,but taxis are always handy..

Fantastic night. We were a mixed group us in our 50's and our son and daughter in law int heir 30's can honestly say the best night ever my old man managed to steal the show nearly with his dancing absolutely loved it the acrobatics were wonderful and we danced nearly all night.

The best !. We're walking around the streets of Playa after a long day of sun & margaritas, you can't miss CoCo Bongo!Bought the premium package to go straight in.... Probably the best party I've ever been in ... 100 times better than anything in Vegas, what an experience !

Coco Bongo was bonkers! So much fun!. Simply put, this show is an absolute spectacle. After a long day of boozing, and sunshine by the pool, we were worried about not having enough gas in the tank to last all night. But soon after arriving, the atmosphere was enough for us to gain out second wind. What a show! What a party!We opted for the bottle service and we're happy with our choice. $100 American each got us our own table (which we thought was key) in a semi private area, a bottle of Jack, which was enough for us since we were drinking all day already, and what we considered the best seat in the house for the show. The seating area was great because we could be sitting and still have a great view, or could stand and mingle with others as we pleased. Coco Bongo was probably the highlight of our trip and I'm super glad we chose to do it. I'd recommend it to anyone who is in the area, definitely something everyone should do at least once in their life!

Wow!!!!. Did the VIP and booked at our hotel with Coco Bongo directly, which is the key! Took my 2 18 year old daughters and it was awsome! Professional, fun, worth the money and felt safe, and well looked after the whole time! Transport was very nice as well which helped me at 3am .... I highly recommend this tour to anyone who is looking to have a truly awesome club experience in Playa, just make sure you book with them directly!
Turbosid69. Very poor seating very slow service for the money you pay don't bother you will find a lot better in other parts of the world DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY !!!!!!!!!!!!!
3rd time just as fun!. 3rd time, loved the show, did VIP this time because one of our party had mobility issues, didn't think it was worth the extra $, I enjoy the floor more.

Wonderful night out. Living in Playa del Carmen always here from my friends who also live here that it is a terrible place, only for tourists and there is nothing to do there. Don't listen to anyone! Just go and have your opinion. It is a great place for night out. With the regular ticket wouldn't be so fun though. We got the VIP pass, so we didn't have to wait at the entrance and had a great table and a place to dance.Music is great, atmosphere is amazing. The time really flies there. We didn't leave until the end of the show. The show, costumes, speacial effects everything is very professional and good. I like that the place is rather small, so you can see the performance very good and it gives the actors possibility of interaction with public.

This is a wild and fun club.. We went one evening around 10:00 pm. It's one of those places you must go ! Very wild shows , loud music and lots to see. Do the VIP package no waiting in line and you get a table whit a nice view. Please check it out when in Palya.

Fabulous night out, would go every night of the week!!. We were staying in the platinum yucatan princess and booked our trip through Bernado who works our resort. We went for the gold package and Bernardo assured us that we would have the best of experiences. From picking us up to taking us into the club via the line jump he was brilliant. He got us great seats overlooking the show on the balcony and wouldn't leave until he knew we were satisfied! Our waiter Juan Carlos looked after us from there in and he too was attentive and kept the drinks flowing. The show itself was phenomenal with loads of interaction between the performers and the guests. Limitless amounts of ticker tape throughout the night poured from the ceilings and the balloons were a real laugh too. Well done to all the staff and performers at coco bongo, we can't wait until we come back to go again. Special thanks to Bernardo for making our night extra special! The Tiptops from Wales UK

Not to be missed. I must be honest, I think I may be a little too old to fully enjoy this venue, The thumping base notes gave me a headache within minutes of arriving and the drinks were pretty dire, and as they were included in the price, we got a gold member ticket, I felt a little cheated.Having said that the shows were brilliant and my niece, had a wonderful time.I think it is worth the visit for the shows alone and if you can stand the noice you will have a brilliant time

Should have been better!. I was really looking forward to taking my 18 year old daughter and her friends to this show. I had been 6 years ago and had a great time. The night we went was extremely crowded and as the night went on more and more people were let in. At one point someone was vomiting over the rails and we decided enough was enough. The quality of the shows was not as good as I remembered and the time between the shows seemed to take a longer than I remembered. This is an expensive/late night. Be rested and be ready for the crowds.

Party like Vegas in Mexico. Like their slogan states " Its New Years Eve, St Patrick's Day and Vegas all in one place". If you go, spend a little more and go VIP. You have a shorter line to get in, a private table with waiter service, and close to restrooms. But the view and show is awesome from anywhere. The show starts around 11 and goes to around 2 AM. Multiple rock groups like KISS and Queen to soloists like Michael Jackson and Madonna to fun times like Beetlejuice and going to Rio. Dance songs and party atmosphere, just a fun time.

What an amazing night!!! . We came to Mexico as a large group of couples, some with children. So we decided to go to coco bongos as separate male/female groups. We paid extra for bottles of spirits and a table- which was definitely worth it!! The table was in an amazing spot and we had an amazing time! Staff brought over a drink for the bride who was with us and the whole audience sang to her. The show itself was way better than I expected! I thought it would be a bit cheap and tacky- but it was amazing! I was wowed from beginning to end! I thought I would leave early but was shocked when it was eventually time to leave!The only rubbish thing about the night was the music they played after the show finished at 3am- but we were leaving shortly after so it didn't matter to us!
Unreal night !. Unlike anything you could ever imagine , cheeky staff and unreal show ! Loved the atmosphere . Would definitely recipient this place
Night out . Really not to be missed. Friends tried to describe the place but you really have to experience it yourself. It's full on 100% of the time she not for the faint hearted
cool show. very cool show only complaint is the line is soooo long book thru your hotel. i would say a must see for anyone going to playa del caremn.

Awesome shows!!!. We were there with a girlfriend and got invited in free of charge, they will pull the single ladys up on a platform in the middle of the place to dance between shows. Shows are amazing!!! We saw Tron, MJ, the mask with his mini me (giving away tequila shots), Beyonce... It was soooooo much fun would definetly go back. They give you your drinks in a collectable cup (I lost mine :() so worth it

Great entertainment for all ages. Went on a Monday night, not jammed packed but full enough. VIP is the way to go, it's on the second floor which gives you a great view of the floor and stage. The interaction between the crowd and the show is what makes it so much fun. Will definitely go again.

What a night!. Wowwwww!!!!! Amazing shows and great music! What more can you ask for! Go with comfy shoes because you'll be standing all night and dancing, and the place is just extremely crowded. If you can, pay for a table, we did this once we were inside and it was way much better! You must go to Coco Bongo!!!!!

Fabulous evening.. What a great night of entertainment from start to finish.Arrived back at hotel at 4am.We purchased the gold ticket and had a great seat upstairs.Waiter made sure we didn't run out of drinks.Great party night.

Amazing club & service/spectacular show!. I've been to the other coco bongo at Cancun, which has similar shows and is a little bigger than this one. But what it lacks in size it makes up for in service. Our waiter Alejandro introduced himself when we came in and was very friendly and gave us amazing service all night. Every time our drinks were nearly empty he would magically appear and put a new drink in our hands. Amazing service and show. I would highly recommend!

An experience!. Booked the "VIP" trip with TUI. Told we would skip the line, taken to VIP seating and have waiter serving free drinks all night. WRONG! After a coach transfer to Playa Del Carmen we were escorted up back streets to the club. Hundreds of people milling around outside trying to get in. Access is down a load of dark steps through a maze of corridors with people pushing and shoving. Eventually emerged into the club. Its far too small for the amount of people it lets in. Found our VIP area which was on the third level sitting on a high hard bench. Didnt get a drink for a whole hour. Ignored in favour of groups of young girls until David came over and looked after us. The show itself is wacky wild and disjointed.. aerial trapeze and silk artists ( brilliant).. tributes to Elvis, Madonna, Britney, Michael Jackson etc ( just dancers miming to original tracks) mixed up with Tron type animations, Beetlejuice, then back to the usual club anthems. It was an experience indeed but dont go looking for glamour or an upmarket venue. We were probably way too old for this really and the youngsters looked like they were loving it to be fair.. but it was a bit seedy ( big screen camera shots zooming in on girls guests thighs and crotches) and a bloke dressed as the Mask pouring shots freeflow down peoples throats. Overall it wasnt much different from a downmarket British club on Saturday night, minus the health and safety. Certainly not worth the £120 we paid. Only giving it a 3 for the skill of the aerial artists and our waiter David. Wouldnt recommend for over 30s.

Buyer Beware. The vibe itself was electrifying for us, because we've not seen something like this before. We purchased our tickets at 125 USA Gold Member from our hotel Coco Bongo rep. He said this included 6 hours, (was 6 hrs round trip, not all-inclusive for 6 hrs), Bottle Service (bottle brought to your table and server makes your drink at the table then takes bottle away, and had to keep chasing waiter to get drinks), separate seats from the standing crowd which was appealing because I couldn't stand for 4 hours (crammed in a tiny seating area with a cocktail table like sardines for 3 of us) we asked to move to where there was more room, but they said no). They just didn't care. They had our money. Transportation was included which was safe and on time. We were told we had our own private bathroom if we booked VIP instead of the $65.00 (which ended up being one toilet for a hundred females, and a bathroom attendant cleaning the seat every time the toilet was used, and slowing things down immensely, then expecting a tip each time.It was our friends birthday. We were told everyone would sing happy birthday to her, and she would be on the main screen. (Happy birthday was sang, and they brought her a shooter). Then expected another tip. Our server was tipped well, but it never seemed to be enough, and he disappeared half way through the night. Brutal. We were told all premium alcohol was included. Then in the bus we found out champagne, jäger, and red bull were not included. Then when we got there we were told only sambuca and tequila were included. The list was getting shorter. Again mislead. This could be so much more. They don't treat their guests well, and cram people in like nuts. It's very misleading, and I asked as many questions as possible before. Our bus was on time on the way back, but a girl fell down the stairs hard on the way out and the bus driver just shut the doors and drove away. Beware.

Amazing!!. Absolutely amazing place, it's like a theatre but extra fun with partying in between!! It suits all ages and the older group sat next to us thoroughly enjoyed it! I think if you go to Mexico then you need to visit this place otherwise you will regret it!

Don't bother with the "Coco Bongo Experience ". I have a mixed review, we did the experience thing where we went to two different places than to coco bongo. Senior frogs was super fun, the second club would have been good if we could have gotten our drinks anywhere in the bar but the staff seemed confused and the only place to get served the drinks we paid for was the patio area which there was no room to stand or sit. My biggest complaint is that we paid for the VIP bottle service at Coco Bongo on the 3rd floor with the rest of the group. We received the bottle service but we were separated from the group and placed on the dance floor. It was AWFUL!!!!! In fact the guides that were with us and responsible for us thought we left!When we complained at the resort we were profusely apologized to and given some nice swag. But had I known that would happen I wouldn't have gone, it was like being in a mosh pit. Our server Edgar was amazing and did everything he could including leading us by the hand to the restroom, smoking balcony and the exit. If you choose to go on the experience do not wear heals!!! You have to walk quite a ways from where the busses drop you of to Senor Frogs on cobblestone, then you have to walk 4 blocks to the Salsa club.

Amazing buzz but some issues. You have to been drunk before you go to this place if not you will probably be overwhelmed by the atmosphere and staging. This place is mayhem but has an amazing buzz about the place and think if it wasn't full it wouldn't have the same affect. However, I was told to move 3 times in space of 30 minutes because supposedly we were standing in the worn place which was very unsettling so my partner and I decided to complain which they were very concerned about so we were placed into the VIP area which I was very pleased about and enhanced the experience. You need to go here as it is an experience and there is no other club like it. Enjoyed it but I wouldn't go back as it would ruin the experience

Never too old. We booked an evening to Playa Del Carmen Coco Bongo through our Hotel resort. We went of a Sat evening and paid for the VIP package . We are a couple in our early 50's and I was skeptical that it would be a little crazy being up till 4 am. Well it was crazy however we had the best time . The VIP services was exceptional and we felt that the staff were courteous and polite. We had arrived just a few minutes prior to 1100 pm and the show started. We were back to our resort close to 5 am . The show was very loud ( which is OK because that's the setting). The crowds on the bottom levels are packed so if you don't like crowds and want to go ...do the VIP. Overall classy show ..lots of excitement and great service

Hell is jealous!!!. I don`t party as much as I would like to, but every single time I`ve been asked to go to CocoBongo my answer is "Damn yeah". The Service is good, but the show is totally amazing, the show starts at 11:30 p.m. sharp and that`s when the fun starts. You will see performances from the Moulin Rouge up to Michael Jackson, you will dance, sing, laugh and the best of all calm your thirst with as much alcohol as you want to. By far the best nights of my Life!!!!

Horrible experience.. We visited Coco Bongo with two other couples coordinated by the Hotel The Reef entertainment group. It was a disaster!!!. We got asked a deposit just for sign in, the table and open bar was included. When we arrived we when thru the door ahead of the line straight to pay for the tickets once paid the hotel coordinator and a Club employee took us outside again to the end of the line!!!. No reserved table to get a table we have to buy a bottle which I didn't bother to ask, the place was overcrowded, the hotel dude MIA, we had to leave the place and return in a taxi to the hotel. DO NOT BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU HEARD from the hotels and definitely DON'T PAY IF YOU ARE NOT NEXT TO ENTER THE CLUB.
My favorite . Best place ever!!! Amazing service. Carlos was the best waiter, definitely worth the money for the bottle service! You won't regret going to this place. The show was awesome.
AMAZING time!!!. If you go to Mexico you have to go to the Coco Bongo it's so fun you must love music, dancing and drinking! I suggest you to pay the price for the VIP it is Worth it!!

Good Times, Bernardo was excellent. Went on Feb 27, 2016. Booked through Bernardo at our resort. Everything was excellent. Paid for bottle service which meant no lines. Bernardo delivered. Show was excellent and the next day Bernardo found us on the beach and asked how we enjoyed it. Recommend going.

Best Night Ever!!!. We went to Coco Bongo on the eve of Valentines Day and it was hands down the most insane party atmosphere I could ever imagine. A MUST do for anyone looking for a great party and an entertaining show!

Waste of time. They say better than Vegas show, I'm thinking they have never been there. Way over priced, they pack people in like sardines, you better use restroom before you go. Would not recommend.

What a waste. This place was horrible. We bought through our rep at Riu Palace Mexico (Pedro). We were told we would have two tables next to each other for four of us. Bought a bottle of vodka per table and cost roughly $450 for everything. 4 tickets and two bottles of vodka. What a scam. Transportation provided was late, got to the venue late. We were put in a horrible spot were we couldn't see the stage. We were seated across the dance floor from the other coupe we were with. We had to pull teeth to share a single little table for the four of us. Coco bongo is said to be a "show" and bar however the show was terrible. Nothing exciting just a bunch of dancing skits which were garbage. This place of more for a younger crowed to get drunk and dance in place since they pack you in like sardines. Approx 1000 people were there the night we were (3/18/16) My wife and I are only 27/26 and this place sucked. Between acts they love bringing young girls up on the main stage to Dry hump each other. They compare it to shows in Las Vegas which does not even come close. Please take this review for what it is. If your looking for a place to get drunk and not be able to move, this is a place for you. The one positive thing is the music they play was good however it is an Over priced over hyped place.

horrible experience. Worst experience I've ever had in Mexico. From management on down to the ticket collectors all they're interested in is money. Not comfort and certainly not safety! They pack you in like sardines and don't care about how many people get stepped on or drinks spilled on them ect. I would never go again and will continue to tell others to not go. Complete waste of money and time!!

You must go, fantastic night out. We booked this through out Thomson rep while staying at Riveria maya. We opted for VIP and we glad that we did as we had excellent seats and a great view of everything that went on. The show is a concoction of music, comedy, dance, acrobatics and audience participation! Tributes to Madonna, Michael Jackson and Queen to name a few. The dances are fantastic although I am not entirely sure they are all actually women however stunning none the less and very attractive, men in particular will ove it. We went as part of a party of 4, with 2 friends who opted for the 'cheap seats' and they still had a fantastic time. All drinks are included and with the VIP you get additional top shelf brands, we did not expect to make the 3.30 am end being a bit older 44 - 52 however we still danced on the stage and threw some shapes with the best of them. All in all a fantastic night and we would highly recommend, cost around £110 per person but well worth it with out transfers included !!
Not for claustrophobic! . The shows were amazing. Service great.. but too small of a venue for the people they pack in like cattle. Something I will only do once.

Fabulous night! Something you'd never do at home..... We've gone three times now to this Coco Bongo. It is very safe with excellent security. By the package at your resort that includes travel from your resort - there and back. It's a long night - they pick you up at 10ish and bring back at 4ish BUT you don't feel tired when you're there! It's too good. Great music, dancers, acrobats, actors, waiters. Make sure you don't get a ticket on the floor unless your under 25 and over 6 feet tall! Pay the extra for a spot up higher....so fun....awesome people watching. We're in our late 40's and love it.

Great show. but be aware!. We booked the show with Julio at Grand Princess Sunset. The show was $65 per person. Julio stated he is the best rep in the city and promised best experience. Our pick up was on time. At the club, we were asked to pay to skip the line OR buy bottle service for $160, and it will include express entrance, bottle service and a table/seating area. We agreed. Big mistake. We got a table on the "dance floor" with no seating, big traffic waking by and knocking our table and a server who wouldn't help us UNLESS we tipped him every time. I would not pay for the bottle service, or wait in lines for drinks. Just enjoy the show as it really is amazing!
Over rated, over hyped. Expensive tourist trap with a medicore show. I would never recommend that anyone pay the crazy prices they charge for the premium seating. Too crowded and awful service.

Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen. Fun party atmosphere with an amazing variety of entertainment! There's action on the stage, the bar that becomes a second stage and in the space in front of you with aerial acrobats...very talented people and must be seen. Make sure you reserve seats if you you and your friends need to sit. Most available space is for standing only.
very expensive. paid 1200 dollars for 10 of us feel like I have been ripped off now after reading some of the reviews and how much they paid
Good Times. This place offers a variety of shows, drinks are included in price. We had a great time! Awesome for groups, great music and atmosphere :-)

Coco Bongo!. Awesome! Do not miss a night at Coco Bongo if you are in Mexico! We picked up tickets (about $60 each) that included a bus ride there, a wrist band that included all-you-can-drink-all-night and a bus ride back home. Best night club in the world for sure!

I never imagined that such a large company as the Coco Bongo could be so disrespectful to their customers. Yesterday I was at the nightclub Coco Bongo in Cancun with my boyfriend (actually only at the entry). The situation is that we bought the tickets through the Internet on the official club website, we paid the most expensive package, We paid with the credit card of my mother because we had no card for international purchase , at the entrance present the PROOF OF PAYMENT and a copy of the card and your documents. But even so they did not let us go claiming to be her card she has to be together !! Not to mention that we were super badly treated by the attendants who disrespected.We pay dearly for something we can not use , I never imagined that such a large company as the Coco Bongo could be so disrespectful to their customers and not even returned us money .We spent a year working to pay for the trip and our dream was to go in this club . The Coco Bongo and his team spoiled , I felt robbed and disrespected. My tip is do not go to this place of people go to this place of arrogant people and if you never buy over the Internet
Great show but expensive . Great show and worth going out with your partner. The show is entertaining and of good quality. A bit expensive and should not charge for skipping the queue

Love the show, but worst Coco Bongo experience ever. We purchased tickets through the rep for Coco Bongo at our hotel, and I throughly recommend the Goldmember seats for a good view and unlimited drinks.I have visited Coco Bongo twice before; first time in Cancun and second in Punta Cana.Myself and 5 others purchased Goldmember tickets. The transport to and from our hotel was perfectly fine. Upon arrival to Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen, it definitely looks smaller and a lot more dated in comparison. Putting this thought to one side and remembering the unforgettable experiences from previous visits, we went inside. It was quick through the club and got straight in. We went up the stairs to the VIP section of Goldmember and we were put right in the corner right next to the stage all 6 of us, with two tables. Not even 4 of us could sit on the side. The place seemed full and it was evident we definitely were one of the last to arrive. We should of arrived at least 30 minutes before we did as this seemed the only option to sit.
