It was a great crowd but if you don't like to be where it's crowed this isn't the place for you. The shows were great! WE wont say to much and let you experience that for yourselves...but trust us the mix of alcohol...music...shows and a crowd of happy partiers made for a GREAT NIGHT!

Coco bongos totally bonkers! !. We booked a night in Coco bongos through our Coco bongo rep at our hotel, if I remember correctly it was about £85 each but that entitled us to jump the que,free bar for the night with a waiter allocated to us and of course transport there and back at silly o clock in the morning. To be honest I was not that bothered with going but I was really glad we did.The club is spread over three floors with a huge centre stage area around a massive dance floor. The music was bouncing from start to finish. I knew I was in for a long night the second we arrived.I'd describe it as a super club and the show was spectacular. It really was a great night I don't want to spoil it for anyone but I can't emphasise how impressed I was with the show it literally had everything from Beyonce to bettlejuice, dancers flying around the ceiling it was really really impressive and so well done. The music was great easy to dance to and be warned girls you will be pulled up to dance on the stages but don't be shy go for it. By the end of the night we were knee deep in streamers and balloons it's like new years eve and mardi gras every single night. I would no correction will definitely go again just be aware that buying tickets from a rep who doesn't work for the club will get you in but you will not have a table or a waiter and will have to que if your not willing to pay the extra to jump the que. This could catch u out as the other reps don't actually tell you you will have to que or be left outside so be aware, if your going get them I suggest throwing caution to the wind and going as a gold VIP it's roughly 120 dollars (about £85)but u are treated like royalty and although it may seem expensive if you have been to other super clubs then actually it's not that much plus you have added bonus of your own waiter and are escorted straight into the club and if you are anything like me on a big night out with your free bar of top shelf drinks u can easily get your money's worth,to be frank I'd pay this amount for the show alone,it really is fun.A wild, brilliant night can't wait to go again x

Are you ready to party (and be entertained) until the wee hours of the morning?. This club is better than alot of Vegas parties we have been at. We were there at 10:15pm, a little early, show started at 11:30pm. None the less the staff kept us entertained and were very attentive to our bottle service. There 3 price categories, VIP, Bottle Service and Floor. The floor group was very young and stood the whole time ($60 US). The bottle service included 1 big bottle of Grey Goose and 2 types of fruit juice to mix $85 US but room to sit. VIP was $150 US. This show included a tribute to NY show Chicago with pro dancers, tribute to Elvis, tribute to MJ, and featured all the music from 60's to current. If you have a favorite song, they will play it and dance to it and put up the Music Video on huge screens. The audience will participate on the elevated dance floor. There were lots of repeat customers, everyone seem to know what was coming, but me. I am older and stayed until 2am, they were still going, but we had plans the next day ....

Overpriced and disappointing. After our 3rd trip to Playa del Carmen we finally succumbed to going to Coco Bongo, we had been told so much about it that we decided to treat ourselves to the VIP Experience, £80+ each, which was supposed to guarantee good seats to watch the show. We arrived about 10 pm, yes we got in faster than the ordinary queue, after the usual inspections we were led to our seats. By the time we got to our section of the club, all the front seats had been taken, bar 1, and I was asked to sit on the seat about 3-4 feet away from the front, with my wife straddled between my legs at a lower seat, both seats unable to see the mosh pit were all the dancing was happening. The show finally started and for the next 4 hours we were entertained to very loud bass music, dancing, in my opinion some of it pretty average, miming to original acts, and some acrobats in the mosh pit area, which I couldn't see due to the seating arrangements. Only one thing left for me to do was hit the bottle, which I managed to do successfully. Again I felt in the hotel I stayed at they did similar things but not to the same standard as Coco Bongo, but in the UK i have seen tribute bands perform live music close to the original sound, so did I feel it was value for money?, no, did I enjoy it?, some of it, would I recommend it, not at it's current price, however it is full most nights so maybe I'm getting old.
Fabulous. Fantastic, a must do when in Mexico, fantastic brilliant would go again. VIP a must if you want to see everything.

Mad night out!!. Coco Bongo did not disappoint!!
It was a mad evening and we went for the all inclusive option via our rep so we had constant drinks flowing which made the experience even more enjoyable. Planning a trip to Punta Cana next month and will definitely check out the one there.
Fun as Always. This is a must for all ages. Dynamic and entertaining show. Keeps you going all night! The service is great! Recommend either VIP or bottle service as they treat you right!

Mind blowing. This venue is INCREDIBLE. Pay for the VIP/Gold Member for sure!
It is loud, raucous and wildly entertaining. Worth every single penny spent on this VIP night out.
If you are not a fan of FUN, this is NOT the place for you.
Fantastic Night Out. A fabulous show/nightclub - a night not to be missed, with unlimited alcohol included. The best night out we had

Fun and very entertaining. Coco bongo Saturday night show is spectacular. If you can't have fun there- you just can't have fun at all. The music is different from a regular club in the USA, but it's a part of the experience. All staff is friendly and polite. The show are really fun!I suggest getting bottle service instead of a vip ticket since it guarantees a table. You pay about $82 per ticket for bottle service- and get a second row table. Totally worth it.

A disco with a video screen. I have seen reviews mention Broadway Vegas and westend REALLY .Its basically an over crowded disco with a big video screen if you want to dance you will have to do it on the spot and if your in VIP seats it will have to be a bum shuffle. Oh by VIP I mean a bar stool. Leads you to believe it has tribute bands ,nope not a single singer or instrument played. Same people dancing about to various artists on big screen behind them. And canned cheering ever time they finish. The canons shooting confetti and balloons about are very affective and add to the atmosphere .THe acrobat show is very basic and seen far better in Spanish holiday resorts . can't believe some of the reviews it so over hyped as for 130 dollars for VIP try halving at and its still dear for what you get. Got there at 10 left at 3 service was good but walked out as sober as I came in. Seen quite a few leave early so guess not only one who thought it was rubbish. So if your going to go just do the basic price then you haven't wasted too much money on an over hyped disco show

a night to remember!!!. we booked a gold pas with our virgin rep, we were taken straight pass the ques, given a front row seat and as advised we tipped the waiter and the drinks were brought before you finshed the last one, the music was fantastic the show was amazing, it started at 11.00pm I think the time just flew by we were collected on the coach at 3.30am. words can not describe the experience. everyone should go!!!!!!!!
excellent show. Encourage everyone ( except kids ) to take this opportunity and see a show prepared. Exciting time. Suggest to do a booking before otherwise You are going to stay in a long queue.
Loud and crowded!. Younger crowd for sure. Dont wear anything you dont want covered in other people drinks. On the good side the shows are pretty cool. Worth seeing once.

Girls night out. We arrived around nine thirty to huge line that moved quickly. I went without doing any prior research so had NO EXPECTATIONS. I am a musician and very picky on entertainment. I was blown away by the talent and energy. I highly suggest it to anyone even if not typically a club person. I will also say it gets more intense as might moves on. I love how it included everything from phantom of the opera to Michael Jackson to more recent music and movies!

The best elements of Pop Culture in one building.... When in Riviera Maya, in my case at the Grand Riviera Princess Hotels, there is one place that you and your friends have to absolutely go to, CocoBongo in Downtown Playa Del Carmen. If you want to ensure that you get the best deal, once you settle-in to your room, scope out the CocoBongo representative at your resort, they usually wear the bright yellow shirts with the CocoBongo logo on it. They are usually in a booth near the main pool of your resort, next to a lifesize statue of Spiderman holding a sign saying: "Better than Las Vegas Nightlife - CNN". They are usually in the mail pool area of your resort between 11am to 1pm and 3pm to 5pm. The more people you are, the higher the possibility of getting VIP treatment with bottle service, also Open Bar. The prices are better at the resort with the onsite CocoBongo rep. If you participate in your resort's main pool activities and contest, the greater chances are to win a free ticket. When you purchase your ticket, follow the advice of the representative as to shuttle service to and from CocoBongo and which lineup to get in when you get there. Above all, when you get inside, it will be crowded, so for you ladies with stiletto heels, wear a nice sexy flat shoe. Because it is open bar, you will be greeted by a waiter who will be catering to you by bringing you drinks 2 by 2. Tip generously as you feel. Normally 200 mx pesos is good. Don't bring too many valuables with you, and leave the bling back in your hotel safe. Don't flash your wad of cash, because every place has their regular up-to-no-good pickpocket who is looking to withdraw it from you. If you're a selfie junkie, please be act responsibly and be respectful of the interactive performers as they are there for everyone's entertainment. Place closes down at 3am, so be mindful of the shuttle returning you to your hotel. If you intend on partying a bit too much, don't misbehave in or outside the club. Although tourism is welcome, please note that Police is there for everyone's safety.One thing's for sure you will have a great time.

Dont miss out on Coco Bongo. So im not into night clubs and all night drinking is not my thing. We went last Wednesday as a holiday group (Mixed gender aged between 25 and 60) and this is probably one of the best nights out ive had in a long time, the atmosphere was great. everyone was there for the show and the performers didn't let us down.its like no other show ive seen. there is something for everyone there.even if you think this is not for you, go and don't miss out on the experience
Lot's of fun, definitely have to see at least once in a lifetime.. The shows were great and the energy inside was amazing! Definitely crowded but it added to the experience. Free alcohol included.
A fun night. Not what i expected. A super fun night with some awesome entertainment! It was very busy for a Tuesday night. Be sure to get there around 9:30...the line up is huge.

Great Night Out - A different experience. This was my first time to this club (I believe they have a few of these now in the Caribbean). It was a great experience and completely unexpected. We had been expecting a regular lounge/nightclub, so were totally unprepared for the blended shows and music.I would highly recommend this experience to everyone.

Be sure to get a "bottle" table. Many thanks to previous reviewers who suggested getting a Bottle vs VIP table. If you pre-purchase a bottle, you get a table on the main level. It's less expensive than a VIP seat (around $100 a person vs $155, depending on the bottle you purchase) and, because it's on the main floor, it's easier to join the dancing. This option is not on the website -- ask the Coco Bongo guys at your resort. Make sure you get a table on the 2nd or 3rd tier (3rd is preferred). If you get one on the bottom level there will be General Admission people standing right in front of you all night. If you buy your tickets when you get to your resort, it will include transportation. Web purchases don't seem to. I personally would not have enjoyed general admission. The floor was so packed it was hard to squeeze through when I had to go to restroom. If you are claustrophobic, this would not be the place for you. It was a fun night! However, we were under the impression there would be more acts. It's more of a dance club. About 2/3 of the time the entertainment was watching various girls from the audience dancing on the stage. Our waiter was fantastic! Was constantly getting us fresh ice and keeping our drinks filled. He watched our table for us when we went to the bathroom / got up to dance.

Disapointing Club, Great Performers. OK first things first...the show was fabulous! the performers worked hard and were amazing dancers/acrobats. well done! Even the service in CoCo Bongos was very good everyone was friendly and drinks came quickly.HOWEVER:we were expecting a party atmosphere we had pre drinks before hand and then got on to the shuttle bus that was going to take us to the club (booked with Traffic Tours) while we expected music to be on and drinks to still be able to be purchased on the bus we found instead it was silent and the lights were turned off for a long sobering hour long ride to CoCo Bongos.Our group spoke little to no English or French, they found a passenger to translate in French and we were left pretty much guessing in English. knowing nothing more then our bus number and what were we're getting picked up at 3:40am. we just kinda followed the crowed through a sketchy area until we reached the main strip which was well lit and full of people.The wait to get into CoCo bongos was 40mins but you did get handed a drink and a shot as soon as you got in the doors so we could start drinking again.I would recommend doing the VIP table because standing from 11-3:30am was brutal my feet in flats filled (say no to heels) Coco Bongos is MUCH smaller than I though it would be with it rising 3 floors but being very very tight. VIP tables are the 2 floors and everyone else is packed in the main floor space left to bump into too many tables set out.Atmosphere was weird despite their best effort to make it a party hot spot with old club bangers, smoke, confetti and balloons falling from the ceiling it's a mixed crowed. I came to dance and no one around me was dancing other then the girls who had been pulled up on the stage in the middle of the main floor. When the dancing did finally pick up closer to the end of the night (thank you drinks) there was little to no room to move around table and people.AND the part I hated most was the exploitation of the girls in the club. I'm all for you wana get wasted and take your top off you go for it you're on vacation! but inviting the girls up to dance in front of the club or on stage with a group and unknowingly blowing their skirts up without their consent...and I swear I'm not this crazy person I even though it was funny the first 1 or 2 times but it began to become old and was just a pervy way to pack the club using the girls. Also the Booty cam all fun and games the first couple times and then got creepy again and unnecessary. Crazy party acts happen on their own just add tequila you don't need to use these girls to fill your club.

Very entertaining. Coco bongo is not like a normal night club, it is more like a show. With recreations of music videos and lots of acrobatics. The dancers there were amazing, very good atmosphere. We had gold member tickets which ment you had all inclusive drinks while there which were brought to you by a waiter, you also got to enter the club first and had a table and chairs. The tables were situated quite close together which ment you had to be carful when dancing as there wasn't much room. Inbetween the acts they got girls up on the bar and on the stage to dance which was hilarious to see there shock when they sent a shot of air up their dress or skirt. Overall a very good night out!
fantastic night out. I visited thus amazing club a week ago ! It was amazing club a. Try and pay extra to get balcony seats . The bar men look after you all night and have great sense of humour

Great Night. I've done both Coco Bongo's - 1 in Cancun and 1 in Playa Car. Near enough the same acts but still a great night. If you want to have your own space do VIP great view and all drinks brought to your table.
For the young. A real nice dance club and it gets really packed. Opens later and goes into the early hours. For the younger crowd, but was a treat to go to.
crazy fun!. a random, fun filled, drunken experience i loved! the time flew by i would would recommend! we did the VIP package which meant we were on the balcony which was better than standing.

Great show...ok table. A must see once! . Myself and partner visited a d upgraded to gold package but we arrived only 29mins before show and didn't get the best table. We were in corner so had to get up to see some of the shenanigans going on the floor stage but overall seats were ok to view the stage. Bartenders literally were replacing drinks before empty so we were quite merry. There's a great vibe in this place and the djs are hilarious and keep the crowd entrained between main acts it's a must do!

Amazing night out. This place is like no other it's a mix of theatre meets disco with stunt men and women performing. If your gonna go I would suggest the vip package as you get great seats your own waiter with unlimited drinks and toilets for your balcony only if you wanna go down to dance you can!!!

FUN NIGHT AT COCO BONGO !!. ...There was a complimentary shuttle bus that took us from the resort to coco bongo which made two or three other stops before arrive to the place. I thought that was pretty cool but they only return to the resort every two hrs. Co Co Bongo was a very interesting experience which consisted of 2+ hrs of entertainment from dancing divas to a midget beetle juice...confetti was all over the place, cheap drinks were being offered by the walk around servers, everyone was as friendly as can be. It was pretty packed but we found a nice spot near a rail on the second level where we could see the entire place. I would definitely visit go again the next time I'm there.

This place is crazy!. I went with my girlfriend and another couple we met on holiday. I've never been to a place like this, it's mental but brilliant. You've got amazing acts all night and in between acts they bang the tunes out and get everyone dancing. We went gold member and the service was great, the view from our table was really gd too. I would definitely recommend this place and will be going back. 5 stars :)

Wild and Entertaining. What an amazing fun party and breathtaking show! It was a little Vegas show, mixed with aerial feats and the wildest fun party. The show lasted over 3 hours and was one of the most entertaining shows I have seen! The performances of Michael Jackson and Beyonce were spot on!

Very good show....however....... You will more than likely catch a coach to the club coco bongo unless you decide to catch a taxi. The coaches drop off at the bus station of playa del carmen and it's a short guided walk to the club. If you don't want to queue for 45mins pay to $10 USD fee to skip the queues. Trust me! Once in you are given a quick pat down by security and then given a few shots whilst you are shown in. The actual club is set on 3 floors if you really want to be in the action get the cheap seats on the ground level. Your view is a bit restricted but another tip is stand as far back from the ground floor bar as you can and you will be fine. The show itself is fantastic! Very good......well put together and elements of it had me stunned at the quality of their performances. The drinks aren't watered down and as a result we ended up very merry! Buses leave around 03:40am but local cans are ready and willing to get you home but watch they don't hike the price if they think you've had enough drink to be an easy target And don't fall for the "I don't have change" they will push their luck......The club itself is clean and I'd 100% go back. Enjoy!

just what you expect in a niteclub.. It was very loud just like a Nite club usually is. entertainment was promoted as better than Vegas But was not. It was entertaining tho. Once is all I would ever go.
Mesmerising show. Fantastic show night out, unmissable if you're in riviera maya, worth every penny, will visit again on next years holiday

What a night,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,. What a great night out, the show was fantastic , the hours fly by , a must is to get a table with drink service , one of the best night,s we have had out, the drinks are not to bad , and the cocktails are not bad to, enjoy.

Great Energy. We had a great time, there were 12 of us that went to the "VIP" section. Drinks were easy to get, music was great, show was awesome.
Downer- Standing room only pretty much, and holy fire hazard if something went wrong we would have all been in the news headlines. They need a new venue for this show!!
Super night club. Amazing show, I have never seen:) Delicious coctails. Smilling stuff. I hade the best time of my life:)

Fun night out! Jaja!. Okay, firsts things first! I'm searching for the guy who was sitting next to me on 10th of november all the way to CocoBongo and way back. Bus took our company from Bahia Principe Tulum hotel and he was already sitting there. :) Some people at that place really was getting on my nerve and I felt really sick, but it doesn't matter. That place is amazing and fun anyway. Thank you for amazing night! Hope to return someday so can I enjoy my tequila shots and dancing!

Great entertainment . We got a great deal on our tickets and was able to reserve a table with bottle service. The shows were great, full of energy. The bar itself was a bit crowded, there must not be a capacity cap for this place. This place is perfect for anyone, aside from young children for obvious reasons.

Nice show but too crowd. This place is nice and the show is really good but the place is too crowded of a fire or something happen there it could be extremely dangerous, from my opinion, I went to Coco Bongo Cancun like 4 years ago and the show in this o e in Playa del Carmen is the same, I enjoyed but only whit this little issue. Hope you enjoy your visit there

Best. Night. Ever.. We had been told that this place rocks before we went to Riviera Maya and as a result booked a night there through our Tour operator- VIP access, no queueing, waiter service and a private seating area. After that we saw a few reviews on here that weren't so complimentary - some gripes about safety, how busy it was, etc etc and we started to wonder if we had done the right thing.We needn't have worried, it was a fantastic night. On a practical level the VIP access was the way to go. There was no queue, We were escorted to our seats and were introduced to our waiter for the night. We tipped him at the start and the drinks kept coming. The ground floor level did become very busy but its not that big a place and the emergency exit was clearly illuminated and even accounting for the number of people in the club I had no concerns about egress in an emergency situation. In addition there was security looking after all levels of the club. We were well looked after drinks wise as were all the people near us and although I was merely tipsy at the end of the night my partner was certainly feeling the effect of the regular drinks service so there were no complaints in that dept. either.We both thought the show was fantastic and the atmosphere that all the staff, dancers, waiters, busboys, entertainers created kept us going through the night. The highlights for me were the Spiderman/Green Goblin set and the Michael Jackson tribute.Best tips from me are - choose a VIP package that gets you a table and drinks service, don't opt to go to Coco Bongo for just an hour - do the full night to get the full experience, and go prepared to relax and enjoy it.Only downside and this is not really a Coco Bongo issue - we booked the night via Thomson, our tour operator and travel to and from our hotel was included but on the night the coach left us without further instruction at the Bus station with the bus driver merely using a lollipop sign to indicate what time the bus would be leaving later in the night. We then had to make our own way to the club, it wasn't that far but the only reason we even knew where to go was we had been in Playa Del Carmen a few days before. This is a small issue which we overcame but some guidance from a Thomson Rep might have been nice.All in - just do it. We were skeptical and nightclubs of any kind are not normally my thing but this was just - WOW.
Honeymoon. What an amazing show!!! Loved it. They did so many different songs and movies and acted them out with incredible acrobatic skill!

Awesome night!. I was very sceptical before going but the wife really really wanted to go. I was 100% sure it was going to be one of those tourist traps. However I was surprised and it was an awesome night! We went a Wednesday and it wasn't overly packed. We got the open bar tickets. Paid $10 at the door the skip the 2.5 mile line up. Worth the $10. Than I found a bartender and he placed us by the bar where he said he was going to be all night. Which he was....gave him $20 tip after the first beer and our glasses where never empty. All the money spent was worth it and cheaper than a bar back home. Now the show....show was really good. Yes can be a bit cheesy but it was very fun. Only problem...the stage is quite high...so if you're on the floor prepare to have neck issues! lol It was a super fun night...maybe too much fun because the next day sucked! (my fault) Damn you tequila!!

Speechless… great, only in his generw. Hello, It is the first stop to do when you go to the playa carmen… is an impressive performance… is like being in a modern drama… is not a typical nightclub because for more than 3 hours do with these shows and impressive choreographies identical scenes to the best modern singers and of the past… I got the luck watch the show on Michael jackson, I made me get goose bumps… bye

Wow, brilliant.. We went to Coco Bongo, a night club 25 minutes away from our hotel, and were really impressed. There was transport to and from the club, and we were there 90 minutes before the show started, and for an hour afterwards. The show is brilliant. Lots of different acts lip-syncing and dancing to many international acts. There are also a number of other “acts” during the show including the like of Batman, Spiderman, Tron and an aerial show.The cost was approximately £90 - 100 but, was value for money. We purchased the Gold Member option with everything included, and it was the best of all options. When we got to the club we were escorted to our seats, after being given a welcome drink and a tequila chaser. There was a dedicated waiter all night, and with a few very small tips going his way, the drinks didn’t stop coming all night.
Top Notch Party. Pay a little extra and go VIP, totally worth it, unsurpassable service, better views, committed wait staff, personal and private seating area!! really cool show and amazing party!!

AMAZING experience . I have to say, what a party place to go to. If you love to party and go wild you will love this place it's very exciting. BEST NIGHT OUT. . If you don't like crowded places and loud music dnt bother coming and then giving bad reviews... it's a night club they do get busy !!!... I have read a lot of reviews saying the drinks are altered ans watered down, well I got absolutely drunk there and the waiters are great especially Jesus who kept the drinks coming left right and center and bottles of water without asking I guess he could tell I had enough of rum lol

Amazingly mental !. We went to Coco Bongos while on holiday in Mexico. First of all, if you book through your hotel or any company operating from the hotel, ask them where you will be dropped off. We were picked up 30 minutes late and dropped off at a bus depot and just left! Had no idea where to go and just followed a crown and found it, after walking through a massive pond (left by tropical rain!!). Either get a taxi or a bus service that will take you there. Getting in there as an absolute nightmare, nobody knew where to go, everyone closed in and not knowing what to do or anything. A lot of people were getting frustrated. This is case if you are VIP as well as normal tickets. We eventually got in and the fun eventually began. The drinks are readily available and just ask or tip a waiter and you are sorted for some time. The shows are fantastic and when they break which isn't for long, the music to dance to and the atmosphere is amazing. It does get crammed when not in VIP and at one point just getting pushed one way by people then another by waiters with drinks so I would definitely recommend the VIP tickets. Would definitely go back but in the VIP area.

Insane amount of fun. It has taken 4 visits to Mexico for us to eventually book this night as we didn't think we'd make it until 3.30am with the time difference. But we did it and I'm happy we did. Never experienced a show like it, utter mayhem (in a good way) from start to finish. I don't think there is an age limit to this show either. It was non stop fun and music. We had the Gold member tickets which meant we skipped the queue outside, got plied with alcohol on the way in and were given reserved seating above the crowds with a better view of the show. This was well worth the money as we had a seat and not sure my 37 year old legs could have coped with standing up all night! HahahaWe also had a never ending supply of drinks during our show, both local and premium, a few dollars tip every now and then meant that our glasses were never empty. The servers work so hard! Oh and the gold member section has their own toilets, nice and clean and I never had to queue. A lovely lady named Alicia worked in there, she was fab. Look out for her and tip her a few dollars too if you can, she does an excellent job.The time flew by and before I knew it it was 3.30am and time to go!! Truly unforgettable (as was my hangover the following day! Lol) I'm so glad we finally got to see it!

Great party. My husband and I recently visited for my 40th Birthday. We had a blast. Weather you like the club scene with dancing or just want to watch the entertainment this club provides a great time. We paid for the gold level tickets which allowed us to bypass the long line and guaranteed us a seat on stage level. When purchasing my tickets through the club online they were able to include transportation from our hotel and back after the show.

WOW!!!. Visited Coco Bongo whilst staying in Playa for my 30th birthday. I have never experienced anything quite like this, it was out of this world! My friend and I got VIP Goldmember tickets which included all premium drinks and shots plus table service all night. I was treated like an absolute queen and will definitely visit again when I return to Playa, hopefully next winter. Special thanks to Juan Carlos who was our waiter, nothing was too much trouble.
Unforgetable. We'd been told this was a good night out and they weren't wrong! Has to be on your bucket-list no matter what age you are. Will be back!
Amazing . What a night we had was fantastic !!!! Got Daniel to take us he works at grand seranis got coco bongos really made it easy toGoAnd come home well recommended

Coco Bongo Playa del Carmen. Being of the "older generation" I'm not sure I enjoyed this experience or not!Cost $150usd (£100) for VIP ticketEntry at 10.30pm with a disgusting drink! Show started at 11.30pm.Mainly circus type acts with lots of loud music and video clips.Actively encouraged to drink as much booze as possible ... can't think why!Still going at 3.30am.Promises a lot but doesn't deliver much.I'm sure you could spend your money more "wisely" elsewhere.

A must vist. I highly recommend this to anyone who is going to be in the area. The show is very well done and entertaining. The acrobatics are amazing. At first we were just paid for the regular tickets, but when we got there we asked if it was possible to upgrade to VIP section. Fortunately there were spots left and we paid the extra for that section. It was worth every penny. As soon as we got in we were seated at a table and our waiter Brandon came over and introduced himself. He was very attentive and made sure we had what we needed. I must say the staff here are very quick and efficient. After confetti was released, staff were cleaning it up right away. Staff worked hard to ensure the place was kept clean. The only downside is that some of the shooter girls can be a bit pushy. This can be annoying when you are trying to watch the show. I would definitely go back. As far as I am concerned no trip to Playa del Carmen, Cancun and now Punta Cana is complete without going to Coco Bongo. If you like to dance then the regular tickets is the best option for you. If you just want to enjoy the show go for the VIP. And if you are concerned about being out late, don't be. You will have so much fun at this show you will forget about the time.

Enjoyed it to the max!. Was there in May 2013.Long waiting queue but was worth it! Excellent show and atmosphere. As another guest here (JohnBeds) said, be careful with the drinks, same thing happened to me :)Definitely a must in Playa!

Fun night out, but be prepared for a long night!. My husband, brother, and sister-in-law went to Coco Bongo and weren't quite sure what to expect. We're not huge partiers but had heard good things about it and decided to try it out. We bought Express tickets, which allowed us to bypass the line to get in, and it was TOTALLY worth it. We got in before the crowds hit and met one of the servers, Garcia, who took fantastic care of us for the rest of the night. Even when it got extremely busy in there, Garcia kept us constantly supplied with drinks, and he even brought us over to a spot where we had a good view of the stage and show. THANK YOU Garcia for the fantastic service you provided us- you were amazing!!Just a note for newcomers; we bought our tickets through our Resort and had shuttle service included to and from our resort. Beware that we did not return to the resort until 4 AM! If you want to leave earlier than that, you have to pay for a cab. The time went by pretty fast, as the entertainment is pretty good, but you're on your feet for the whole night, so this place won't be for everyone. It also gets VERY, VERY crowded, so this is not a place for claustrophobes.Overall, we are glad we went to Coco Bongo, and we want to make sure Garcia gets rewarded for his fantastic service!

went through my resort Best Deals. definitely need to try at least once. It is not cheap but to get past all the lines we went through our resort best deals. it got us past all of the lines right in to our reserved table. it was up on the second level, and drinks were free flowing. Also, what was really good was that no one was allowed to stop at our level to block our view

A completely madness, long long loooong quue. Ok we were at hotel and there was this coco bongo kiosk and the guy selling us this package in order to go on Halloween which we thought it could be great, after all we have read about coco bongo but it was absolutely the worst decision ever, I think maybe it was because of Halloween I hope nobody has experienced what we did, it was an extremely long queue just in order to get inside and guess what!! There was absolutely no space to dance or just to walk inside, free bar? Oh yes if you hopefully find a nice barman that could bring you drinks, hopefully I found him but it was completely stupid to be there in order to be just on your foot not even dancing not even watching the show, just trying to find a place where you don't interrupt anybody else 70 dollars, absolutely not worth it for such a nightmare and not necessarily talking for costumes Hope everybody takes note of this because maybe show is good but if is some particular day like Halloween you should think it 1.000.0000 times before going

Be Careful With The Drinks. We had a fantastic night at Coco Bongo, it's a fabulous show, like nothing I've ever seen before.  Just be careful, they ply you with drinks from the moment you walk in the door and to be honest I got so drunk it kinda spoilt my evening.

Awesome fun. Always a good time at coco bongos. If you can afford it, get a table on thr main level or stage level and enjoy the show. Be cautious tho. The last time we were there my gf got to go onto the stage to dance and pretty sure she got her watch stolen off her wrist while being guided.

Don't see what the fuss is about. Honestly quite dissapointed with Coco Bongos. Don't get me wrong it was still a great experience but don't see what all the fuss and hype is about. The place is actually tiny which was quite a suprise, nothing how it appears in photos/videos so shows what a good camera angle can do. Goldmember package consisted of queue jump (still had to queue), table (bar stool at long bar overlooking dance floor sat shoulder to shoulder with other customers), free bar (poor local spirits etc but as expected with "free bar"). Dancers were good however just lip syncing/performing identical routines to films/artists shown on screen behind them in my opinion not far off the entertainment provided at our hotel every night just with better costumes & special effects. Confetti cannons, smoke, streamers and balloons were entertaining first few times but once they went off for the 5th time in about an hour couldn't really see the point. Guys that operate cameras which project images of the crowd onto the big screen focusing on the same 3 girls chests and short skirts all night. Funny the first time but bit tedious after a while. Seemed to be a lot of young American partygoers too. Nothing against them and it was great to see them having such a good time but perhaps the fact that US drinking age is 21 and over the novelty of being in a place like coco bongos and being able to drink alcohol would seem pretty exciting! This review makes me sound like an old grump that doesn't know how to have a good time! I'm really not, I just expected a little more after everything I had heard!

Best night out in Playa del Carmen!. We've always had an amazing time at Coco Bongos but this time was the best thanks to Williams our waiter. He made our night even better by taking care of me and my friends whenever we needed a drink he was there. He even escorted us safely to the bathroom because there was too many people. Thank you so much Williams for making our night!We will be back again

Alcohol, Entertainment and Balloons...... The Coco Bongo trip was a blast. The bar tenders and servers kept the drinks flowing, the entertainment was fantastic and the music was current. Had so much fun we almost missed our bus home!! Definitely recommend the experience but be prepared for a late night.

Best night of my Vacation!. It was truly one of the best clubs I have ever been to, the shows were incredible. The bartenders were awesome and dancers were unbelievable! I would definitely go back if I am in the area again! but if you are trying to go, go during the first 3 days of the week, the weekends are super packed.

best bar ever!!!. Coco bongos is mardigraw, meets Broadway, drinks are free and the places is amazing!! buckets of confetti, great music and entertainment, balloons, people dancing everywhere, and people flying from the top stage down to the main bar, crazy !!!!, would definately go again!

Crazy night!. It was quite an experience if you haven't been there before you have to go. Excellent show; however, it is so crouded that you have to dance in your own place. Very very loud, so be prepared. Perfect for a crazy night!.

Wow!!. This was the best night out ive ever had!!! I was in awe the whole way through. If i had known how good it was going to be i would have booked again for the second week of our holiday. Cant wait to come back here again!

Absolutely Amazing . You have to have the Coco Bongo experience. A trip to Mexico is not complete without it. Be prepared to be entertained the whole night. We signed up with a tour group from the hotel and our guide took the best care of us. VIP all the way. The most fun was found on the ground floor it has a great view of all the festivities! Again make sure you go.
OMG. What a brilliant night out! We came in as part of the Thomson Bar Crawl and only stayed an hour and a half but wish we could have stayed for longer! An amazing show and such a great atmosphere!

Worst experience ever. We went to Coco Bongo on Nov. 14, 2015 and paid for the "VIP" experience which included a table and bottle service. I would call this a joke but it wasn't funny at all! Yes, we got a table... a table with layers of people stacked above us so that drinks and debris could be dropped on our heads and poured down our backs all night. The place is beyond over crowded. You literally cannot move at all. You cannot get anywhere because of the volume of people packed into this small space. You can't get to the restrooms and you can't even get to the exit. They make you get there at 10pm but the "show" doesn't start until around 11:30. Then once it starts, you have about 10 minutes of show with about an hour of music in between before the next 10 minutes of show. We made it about 3 hours and we just had to get out of there. It was a nightmare trying to get out when there are so many people that are all tightly packed in but we made it. I observed several others who were panicked trying to leave also.I would strongly suggest that if you aren't 18 years old, you think you're going to see a show or you aren't looking for a rave.... Stay Away From This Place!!!!I can't believe that I paid good money to be treated like this!!

Funnest Nightclub/ Show I have ever been to!!. This place was absolutely amazing! The shows were fantastic! Hours of endless entertaining. It is a busy place, so expect to be bumping elbows with other people. We were able to book to from our resort, so we got transportation, cover fee, and unlimited drinks for $60. (There was a group of 10+ of us who booked). What a blast! Highly recommend for anyone going to Playa

Bizarre but excellent fun!. We bought Gold Member tickets for Coco Bongo so when we arrived at 22:00 we went straight in without any waiting. We went through two sets of security that checked our bags and ran metal detectors over us so we felt safe inside. We were given a large balloon and two shots of tequila whilst walking in. The show was very good with a mix of different acts from Spiderman to Michael Jackson. The drinks were unlimited with our package and all branded. We slipped the waiter $100 (about £4) at the beginning of the night and we were given a new drink before the last one was finished all night. A very wacky night but highly recommended.

Fun for all. Went on last Wednesday night and it was fun. We paid 65 usd at our hotel for our ticket and transportation. We opted for the bottle service at the door which ment we paid an additional 160 for a bottle of spiced fun and a table for 5. They escorted us to a table and brought the bottle as well as a bucket of ice, limes and Coke. 2 of us don't drink rum so they had open bar service included with the ticket. The waiters were always cleaning up and checking in to refill and bring more drinks. The show... Wow it was great. I didn't really know what to expect . We were a family of five aged from 18 to 75 and everyone enjoyed it. The music was everything from Madona to Bruno Mars, Beatle juice to tron. The night flew and before we knew it it was 3:00 am and time to catch our ride home. Would definitely go again.

Fantastic: best club ever. We went on the Monday night, got the VIP ticket no waiting straight in, what an atmosphere, the place was rocking from when we got in at 21:30 till we left at 03:30.
the bar tender made sure we always had drinks in our hands that was again all night. We booked with the Hotel no issues no problems.

Fantastic night, best night for my 21st!. So you hear alot of people talk about Coco Bongo's about how amazing it is, in all honesty .. They're not wrong! Me and my friend came here on my 21st birthday, we got the rock star package which includes a sit down area and taquila, big bottle of vodka! with all your mixers, the waiter who looked after us for the night was great, full of energy, dancing around and very efficient at his job! and towards the end of the night i noticed the staff was picking me up (i thought i was getting kicked out for being too drunk) then all of a sudden i was on the big screen with a huge happy birthday sign and my face on camera with the staff bringing over a cocktail with a huge candle! it was ace! and the atmosphere was great very busy i must sayThe show, well... it's just amazing! all dances was entertaining and very interesting as you don't know what act is on next they have a very wide selection of shows/bands etc. In between the breaks the staff always tried the best to get the people involved with dancing on the middle stage etc! Definitely recommend this place! especially if it's your birthday as they make a tad extra special for you!

A disaster waiting to happen !!!!. Read all the reviews about Coco Bongo and thought it would be worth a visit.Paid £190 for 2 Gold Member tickets and felt a bit wary as entering the venue...felt not much way of safety inside..show was not worth the money and we only got asked twice for drinks in 3 hours on a all in drinks ticket.So we decided to leave at 2am...that's where the feeling of safety and being crushed alive as we tried to leave,my girlfriend feared for her life and was starting to have a panic attack...if there is a fire or incident people will not get out alive!!!The acrobats were good and the atmosphere was good but it's too dangerous.Never have I felt so endangered of being crushed alive...I would never recommend a visit to Coco Bongo

FUN NIGHT OUT. Went here on one of our nights out in Mexico. The show was absolutely amazing. The songs were great and the dancers were amazing. The only bad thing was seating. We payed a decent amount of money to go there and get good seats and we were kind of tightly packed in a corner and 2 of us had to stand since there weren't enough seats. I'd recommend making sure you know where you are seating or what kind of seats you are paying for if you buy ahead.

Go Bongo in playa del Carmel. Had a fantastic evening , the show was great and the drink flowed with help of an amazing waiter, (tip him when you go in and your glass will never be empty)Coz, your never get to the bar and back and your miss the show !Costumes , dance routines and all round wow a real must , BUT don't get led to high up or anywhere near the back because the view becomes very difficult if your not over 6'6"!The evening , show and dancing goes on well into the early hours so make sure your ready for a truely amazing evening, and before the revamp this was the venue of the(Film, The Mask with Jim Carey) so cameras at the ready too !So very well worth it and just of 5th Ave where the party can continue after if you wishOr the taxis are waiting nearby if you just need your bed !Your have a truely amazing time , and be amazed Cheers Mark x

Best place ever. This place is absolutely mind blowing- from the moment you are ushered in to be seated (we had the rockstar package) it was literally jaw dropping. The dancers are incredible and the music is out of this world. We had waiter service and he was brilliant.If you are anywhere near this place you HAVE to go but be warned the drinks are lethal. It's a long night

Amateur hour. We booked with Thomas Cook on a VIP package in which we were promised priority entry to enable us to avoid the long queues. What they and Coco Bongos don't tell you is that there are still huge numbers of people in this queue meaning we had to wait outside in torrential rain while the queue lessened. The actual show is a complete con. For the money paid I would expect a high quality entertaining show but what you really get is 2 minutes of performance followed by approximately 15 minutes of nightclub music. The performances are outdated and poorly executed. We seen better aerial acrobatics in our hotel and even items such as Batman and Bane and Spiderman were overly drawn out and amateurish. The only positive I can say is that the barman, waiter and toilet attendant in our standing balcony area were excellent, and you do get plenty of drinks. However this did not make up for the awful show and we ended up leaving over 90 minutes before the end.

So much fun!. We had a ball at coco bongo! Though pricey, getting the "gold" VIP experience was worth the price. The shows were amazing. The alcohol left a lot to be desired. If you are looking to get a bit (or a lot) tipsy, stick to beer. Otherwise, you will be drinking watered down cocktails all night and never receive the desired effect! We loved this club! So fun!
Great show and atmosphere. I've been here several times (but would not go more than once if I payed for it). It's a great show, fun atmosphere, and definitely worth going to.

Excelent shows, poor service, disgusting alcohol. Been there many times but the last one was so bad! So many people even if it was Monday, alcohol very poor quality and if you do not tip you do not get drinks even if you paid the open bar!! I will give 3 stars and not 1 cause the shows were amazing and well performed.

Vegas doesn't have anything on Coco Bongo!. Balloons and confetti and music, oh my! This is my fourth visit to Coco Bongo in PDC....and won't be my last, as the show changes all the time. Very fun, entertaining and high energy! You have to enjoy crowds though, as it gets really crowded. Its not like just "going to a club"....this is a constantly entertaining show, with lip-synch celebrity impersonators up on an elevated stage, so it's easy to see (for short people like me). Actors on aerial fabric and zip lines come right into the crowd. Don't expect to get intoxicated on the "all you can drink" premise....the drinks are watery, off-brand and few and far between. Your waiter is not exactly attentive,( unless you pre-tip) and there is a LOT of pressure to buy "bottle service" at $200 US a pop. With bottle service comes mixers and a small table, so you have a place to put your drinks, and basically a place to stand on the stair-like viewing area. One tip--definitely pay the extra to NOT wait in the entry line, which snakes down the street for an entire block. The show goes for about 3 hours, then its house music until 4am. But hey--where else can you dance on the bar with Batman? A lot of fun, but might not be for everyone unless you are a people/party person. I, however, love the show and will be back.
AWESOME PARTY. This place ROCKS,ignore the bad reviews,go gold member section and have the time of your life. Personal waiters,seated areas varied show and an excellent atmosphere.

Amazing. Went to this place via our rep at our hotel vent streight through the line cause we had vip access lots of things going on all the time and we got back to the hotel just intime for breakfast the following morning

A must do!. I will admit wasent set on doing this but my othwr half twisted my arm... we went and booked the GOLD package (would reccomend this for view and drinks)I must say i enjoyed it alot drinks in gold area were good named drinks and coco bongos is amazing... if it was in the UK it would make a killing. A great show from entry till leaving. Fun filled with ELVIS, THE MASK, PRINCE and even BATMAN Epic loved it!

Excellent Night!. This club is very much alive, no matter the day of the week. The price is very reasonable especially for all the drinks you can get and the entertainment. Very energized throughout the night and never boring. Highly recommended if any where near by.

It's fun but look for discounts. . If you're 20 something, never been to Vegas or seen cirque de sole and your like to drink dance and get loose, this place is amazing. If you're 45+ been to Vegas or have seen cirque de sole but you like to drink dance and get loose, you will be entertained (provided you can stay up late -- cause this place doesn't open until 10:30 pm) If your 50+ but otherwise like the above, you'll enjoy it better as a VIP with a discount (there are lots of discount opportunities around ). So what is coco bongo. It's a modern day moulin rouge. Lots of choreographed shows and acrobats, lots of music and dancing on bars, horns, kiss cams, confetti, balloons, beetle juice and dwarfs. Unlimited alcohol, though security is good and the establishment will remove sloppy drunks ( there will be lots of them). It's something to do, at least once, but it is pricey.

Do not hesitate, a must do!. Awesome, awesome night! We took advise from a recent reviewer and purchased bottle service tickets on the night at the door - too easy! Loved where we sat/stood/danced, I think I would prefer where we were over anywhere else. The entire experience was amazing and soooooo much fun! Very entertaining! A must do!
A fun fun fin night out !! . Such a crazy night out with lots of singing dancing and entertainment all night long. We got the vip package for a hens night and worth it for the free drinks!

Best club & show experience ever! MUST DO IT ONCE!. What a fantastic show and night spent at Coco Bongo. We didn't do this as part of a tour, nor did we book through a hotel. I thought I'd write a review to answer all of the same questions I struggled to answer when reading through previous reviews. Note we are three 25-35 year old females, not big drinkers, and frequent visitors of other shows and Vegas. 1) Is it worth it to go on a weekday? We went on a Tuesday night and the place was full and the atmosphere was amazing. You'd never know that it wasn't a Friday or Saturday night, the crowd and staff were all there to have an amazing time. It was full but not packed. I'd be reluctant to go on the weekend given how full it was on a Tuesday (comfortably full but not sardine-full :)). Did not feel like we were missing out at all. 2) Which ticket should you buy? I was very confused reading through hundreds of reviews where some people said that the VIP area looked "boring" and "outside of the action" and everyone in VIP saying that they're glad they were on the second level away from the action. I would HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend a third option that is not available on the website. Go to the venue to buy your tickets (the staff outside are very helpful) and buy a "bottle" table instead of floor ticket or VIP ticket. These tables are in the middle between the floor (where you're forced to stand for the whole show) and the VIP (out of the action) and i think they are the best of both worlds. You get to enjoy all of the things falling from the ceiling throughout the show (incredible) but you can sit or stand in your own personal area. The staff are very careful to stop anyone with a floor ticket entering this area. We had three people and bought a bottle of Absolut Vodka. Our tickets were only $78USD and I think they were the best seats in the house. The only difference is that these tickets do not include the open bar (although when we were dancing the staff gave us many free drinks!) so this is the only thing to be wary of if you think you will get through a whole bottle of alcohol! These tickets are also fully inclusive of tips, and because you can pour your own drinks, no need to worry about fighting to get to the bar, or waiting for someone to get you a drink. 3) What to wear? This is a beach town but I was fairly surprised at how casually dressed many people were (shorts and singlets acceptable). Dress for comfort. The venue has great air conditioning.4) When to arrive? We got there at 9.45pm to buy our tickets. We were the first in line for VIP entry (note that bottle entry also gets you fast tracked). Highly recommend getting there at this time. There are three tiers of "bottle" tables in between the floor and the VIP area. Get in early and get a table on the highest level away from the floor. Perfect view of the action. Overall this was an amazing experience. It is not that the acts are more incredible than what I've seen elsewhere, nor was it that the clubbing experience alone. It was the brilliant combination of all of the elements, coupled with an outstanding team of staff who create an incredibly fun atmosphere. A huge shout out to our waiter Carlos. He was constantly topping up our ice and drinks, and looked for us when we returned from the bathroom to help us back through the crowd to our seats. Amazing.We were there from 10pm - 3.30am and as everyone has said before me, the time flies. Don't plan too much for the day after!! :)

Waited In Line For Two Hours. Waited in line for two hours on Halloween night. We we got in there was no where to move or go. They oversold the event. We couldn't enjoy the open bar we paid for. It was shoulder to shoulder people on top of each other. Maybe this is just because it was a Saturday and a holiday. We had to pay $25 to get a cab back and $140 for the excursion. We were never refunded any money after our complaints. Don't go. Their staff harass you at all the resorts in the area. It is a waste of time.

Just Go, It is amazing!. From the moment we won our free ticket at the hotel until we go back to the room (at 4.30am) it was an experience that we will never forget. We had the bottle service (at around $3000 pesos, with the free ticket) and a table included with this price. The coach picked us up at the hotel at around 9.45pm and took us to near the venue. It is about a 2 minute walk from the bus to the entrance. The only reason for this is that is pedestrianised. We were welcomed at the entrance and given wrist bands. We were shown inside by our guide and then left to the staff to do their thing! Our sever/friend Habero was absolutely outstanding. As per previous reviews our drinks were never empty and even showed us to the toilet! The show was mesmerising. People say that it is a few acts followed by lots of filler. This is partly true but I think it was a really good balance. There were loads of acts and each one was really entertaining. Not getting into detail but I really believe there is something for everyone. Would definitely recommend this place. A final thank you to Jesus at the Princess Platinum for the amazing service. If you stay here book with this guy!
fantastic Show. Really enjoyed this excursion. Make sure you upgrade to VIP if you don't like to stand for a long time. Performances were outstanding.

The VIP Experience. Saw the Friday, October 23 show and what an amazing night to remember forever! We bought our tickets in advance when we booked our vacation through Sunwing. Once we got to our hotel and found our Sunwing representative we had him contact Coco Bongo to take our reservations for the night that we wanted to go. We stayed at Akumal Bay Beach and Wellness Resort and our pick up from the hotel was at 9:30 pm. A coach bus arrived right on time Friday evening and we were the first ones on it. Then we stopped at two other hotels to pick up 6 more people. We got to Coco Bongo 45 minutes before the show officially started and they have a countdown on the big screen. Our pick up at the end of the night was at 3:20 am and the time just flew by while we were there! They drop you off and pick you up at the bus depot down the street and tell you what number to be at. Also there is free WiFi here which was amazing! Upon arrival we were given a welcome drink and a shot of tequila on our way to our seats! Definitely gets the party started. I definitely recommend opting for VIP so you have a seat, I don't know how people can stand and watch the show all night. The service was great during the show and we never had empty drinks. The bartenders were loading me up with shots every time I walked by to use the bathroom. There was only one bathroom stall for girls with a bathroom attendant who was amazing. After each use she would clean the whole stall for the next person. Smoking was very inconvenient here as it was on the opposite side of where we were seated and its up a set of stairs that leads to a balcony outside.They pull girls on stage all the time and it is the most exhilarating opportunity, so don't be shy! They loved me and my friend so we were up there at least 5 times. I'm so glad I finally got to experience Coco Bongo and I will definitely go back if the opportunity presents itself, or maybe I'll check out one of there other locations. It's an experience that is best left for your own experience, but it definitely doesn't compare to anything else you will find in North America. Go, enjoy the show and have the time of your life!
Such a fun night. Awesome club and show - the time flies and before you know it you're heading for breakfast! Dance troup quality is superb

Excellent show!. We went to coco bongo after so many people had recommended it to us as a must go ....and we wasn't disappointed! We went VIP gold member which I would recommend as drinks are all included and have the best views. It was a lot smaller than I imagined and for smokers the smoking area is not easy to get too, it also has quite steep steps in there as VIP area is up high. However was worth it, the show is amazing and time goes so quick, the Show Starts at 23:00 and finished at 3:30 and we were buzzing the whole time! Never had an empty glass, we'll worth the extra money :)

I'm in love with the Coco. So much fun! Best club we have been to (comparing Miami, Orlando, Las Vegas, Curacao, Whistler). Great energy, people. The house beats were booming, a perfect mix of Spanish and EDM hits, the shows were incredible. We did not get a table but will for sure next time. We had open bar and the waiter did not wait for us to ask for a drink, he remembered what we liked and kept them coming. Everyone was having a good time. The place was super packed with fun people and there were no problems all night--wait for coed bathrooms no more than 5 mins. This is a MUST have experience!!!

good show. The show was amazing, and the concept was great ( 30min of show and 30 min of dance). Minus: the place was to small for all the poeple in it. There too much poeple and the staff push you to change place

If you can, go!!. We booked our trip through Thomson we booked gold member with a bus which was a table and bottle service, I would definitely recommend doing this you get a table with stage view and your never without a drink! Only tip would be not to catch the bus it picked us up at 10 and it was too late I wish we went earlier! The shows are amazing you won't be bored this is not your normal standard nightclub, the drinks are good, the service is top notch our barman was lovely make sure you tip and he'll look after you well. It's a once in a lifetime chance to go see the show so make sure you do it will not disappoint! Take extra cash for tips & you can have photos taken and buy then I'm cool frames!

Experience of a lifetime. MUST GO!. Jim Carey owns these clubs. And if you know much about him and his personality, then you kind of know a bit what to expect. It was a hell of an experience. Loved it. The dances. The songs. The atmosphere. The drinks the service. All impeccable. Make sure you take a good amount of money with you though as you can buy a picture there that comes in a cool frame and also you will want to tip your waiter at the end. TIP - Book the gold or vip package from your hotel rep. You get better seating and a table which adds to the comfort and experience.TIP - Mare your own way there by taxi, don't get the bus that is sometimes provided by the hotel. Get there before everyone else and you are given the best tables with the best view.They cover dance music to Jackson to James Bond to Tom Jones. I hate old music but trust me... this was amazing. I loved every minute.
Must Go!. A must do in mexico! The Show was really amazing! The atmosphere was fantastic, I recommend getting a table with bottle service for best seats.
Party of a lifetime. We had a group of people go to this place and it was very entertaining. They have an amazing show that they do. Recommend trying this place at least once.

Very Nice night club. If you need some night club action while in Playa, and your resort doesn't offer any than CoCo Bongo is the place for you. It's a very busy night club, especially on the weekends. Drink prices are about average for a resort destination, comparable to U.S drink prices, but someone needs to pay for the band every night. But if it isn't happening for you at your resort, you won't be disappointed here. Before you start drinking and having fun, write down your resort name and address and phone number as well as your room number, just to ensure if you are unable later to remember, you have something to give the taxi driver so you make it safely back to your resort.

Incredible!! . My fiancé and I visited Coco Bongo in September, we went with the gold member VIP tickets and did not regret it. The drinks were flowing all night long and the show was incredible! We wish we could go back.

Incredible Night of Madness. Didn't know what to expect really, we went VIP which is definitely recommended! A lot smaller than expected which is even better for an interactive experience. Free alcohol all night in the VIP with drinks being bought to you constantly - lets just say my drink was never empty! The show was fantastic, we stayed until 3am - such a fantastic atmosphere!!!!!

Fantastic show, disgusting drinks!. We have been here twice now, once last year too. The show itself is fantastic, along with the music. Very talented acrobats and impressionists, the show really does WOW you. The drinks however are disgusting and we didn't drink anything whilst we were there. BEWARE: When buying your tickets make sure you dont' get ripped off. The rep in our hotel sold us a free ticket he had and pocketed the money - then made us lie saying we had paid for the ticket to get in!

Disappointed. I attended coco bongos with my partner, his brother and his partner. We had booked through our rep at the hotel and decided to go 'gold member.' The rep advised up to get a taxi (30 min journey) rather than wait for the bus. So we arrived early at about 10.15 to get good seats. At about 11pm my partner went to the toilet and never returned back. After about 20 mins of waiting I went to look for him, to be told by security he had been chucked out and wasn't allowed back in. I asked for the reason to which 3 members of security couldn't give me. So after spending $130 my partner didn't even get to see any of the show! I later spoke to him when he got back to the hotel and he said that 3 security guards had grabbed him by the wrists, asked him where he was staying then threw him out the door and wouldn't let him come back in to even find me. So just a warning to anyone going as a couple, never leave each other's side or you will be left on your own.
Great show. Amazing experience.... Graet show. I recomended GOLD TICKET all drinks inclusive. After show can stay for disco to 7:00 am

Amazing!. Loved every minute of this place!One of the Entertainment staff from our resort took us with a couple other people. Got us on the VIP list, and in quickly. The show alone was amazing and the quick drink service was insanely good in a place that was wall to wall people. Such a great time!

An absolute must!!. We didn't go to Coco Bongos the first time that we went to Mexico and regretted it! So it was a definite this time and all the recommendations from friends and acquaintances were not wrong! We experienced this as apart of a pub crawl and part show experience! I was sober and will only dance if drunk! Not on this occasion - I danced sober and had an awesome time!! I will definitely go again but next time I would do the VIP Experience & recommend that you do too!!

Everything it was hyped to be, and more!. Wow. What a show! I had very high expectations, and they were exceeded. We were fortunate enough to speak with an on-resort salesperson who took the time to explain in detail the various ticket options. AND, the Playa del Carmen location offers round-trip transportation (for us it would have been a $50USD cab ride in each direction).General admission gets you on the floor - shoulder to shoulder for hours upon hours, and long drink lines despite numerous waiters (they can barely make it through the crowd themselves).We opted for bottle-service, which is not as pricey as the gold package but provides the same benefits (including a personal table, somewhere to sit, and a bottle of brand-name alcohol). We were thoroughly satisfied with our seats...it gets busy, but we always had a great view and just enough personal space.The shows were almost on par with Cirque du Soleil - and the variety was amazing. Theme after theme, song after song, confetti cannon after balloon drop, I couldn't believe when it was finally over and I realized we had been there for five hours. It was worth every dollar.

The beach party was amazing!!. I love the beach party, it was FUN! The music, was great. We danced to Latin music, American pop music. There bubbles everywhere! Everywhere! The staff entertained us. My kids, my husband and I had the time of my life!!!

Absolutely Shocking !!!. Just back from a what was a lovely family holiday to Riviera Maya apart from the bad experience my son had when he visited Coco Bongo with his brother and their girlfriends, they bought VIP gold member tickets from our thomson rep at the beginning of our holiday but because of high demand couldn't go until nearer the end of our break,The rep advised that they get a taxi to playa del carmen instead of the using the courtesy bus as it would get them there quicker and avoid queuing, they arrived about 21.30, they were given a drink when they first went in and then given another 2 drinks at their VIP seating area, my son and his girlfriend went outside for a cigarette and when they came back in she went back upstairs and he went to the toilet, a security guy (bouncer) came up behind him grabbed his wrist, asked where he was staying said he had done something wrong and told him he was being put out, he asked what he had done but was not given an answer, when he asked again another 2 bouncers grabbed him by the wrists, ripped his VIP wrist band of and threw him out, he was never given an answer, when he didn't appear back upstairs his girlfriend went to look for him, she asked the bouncers if they'd seen her boyfriend and the said he'd been put out, they could not give her a reason for this either, he hadn't been able to contact the others on his mobile because of the signal so had to get a taxi back to our hotel on his own, I wonder after to speaking to others and hearing that this has happened to people they know if there is some kind of scam where the bouncers can sell the band on at the door for a for a nice little earner, it cost $120 for the VIP gold member and my son was lucky to be in the place for 45 mins, he was totally gutted but what can you do when your on your own with 3 burly guys round you in a foreign country, we reported the incident to our rep who said she'd look in to things for us but I'd like to add Please be aware of this if you intend to go when your on holiday and try to go around in pairs and nowhere especially the toilet on your own !!!

Well worth buying a Goldmember Ticket . A fantastic night out just off 5th Avenue. Well worth paying for the Gold Member ticket so that you don't spend a long time in the queue to get in, you have reserved seating with a great view of the show and a fab waiter who has a drink in front of you before you have finished the last one!
Best Party in Mexico!. Best Place! Must Visit!The standing places close to the VIP are valuable and worth it!! (it's not to crowded and you have the best view)

Wow. Just go, it's fabulous you will not be disappointed. We loved it paid for vip was expensive I thought but the talented show and the fantastic music not to mention all inclusive bar you soon see why . Worth every penny got in the club early around 945 show start time is 11 but the place is buzzing music is the best in playa del Carman modern and loud . Again just go ages ranged from 18 to 60 so don't be shy if you nearer the latter there is something for everyone.

Expensive, but worth it. I really enjoyed time spend ant this disco with my friends. I was there few times, every time i visit playa del carmen. Drinks are expensive, price policy is not regulated, tickets sold in many places and the price depend on you negotiation skill. Show program is wonderful.

A night out at its finest!. We purchased the seating VIP tickets for $125 US. This included a bottle of Belvedere Vodka and 5 mixers. The entertainment was spectacular as well as our very attentive waiter who poured us drinks all night. Coco bongo is a must when in Playa
Loved it!. Great night out..... atmosphere is fantastic and I can't remember leaving the place!!! Well worth getting a gold membership and enjoying everything from upstairs!

Best club ever!. The best night/show club I've ever been, indeed!The production is impeccable! You see people falling down from the ceiling, skypaper, balloons, dancers, performers every where during the entire time! And open bar!It is simply amazing! The best place to have fun that I've been so far!Congratulations!

go gold!. we got a gold pass for our night out.. this meant we were opposite the stage which was on a diffrent level, and could watch everyone else below us dancing and having a good time. you also had your own waiter who pretty much poured drink down your necks all night.. FOR FREE!! the dancers and show are amazing and had incredible areal skills. its worth the money

What a show!. Booked this trip with an independent tour operator just outside the Riu Palace Mexico, didn't go for the v.i.p treatment because you get the same service when booking the open bar, tip the service staff who look after you n the drinks flow all night, Fantastic show from start to finish, has everyone dancing and enjoying themselvesif you come to Mexico then you got to do this trip!!

Way better than expected... super fun!. I wasn't sold on going because everyone outside looked like they were on spring break, and because it was $60 to wait in line and get in. But the fun started when a) we realized you could just pay up front and jump the line and b) they served us cranberry vodkas and tequila shots just coming in the door. We had a blast!! If you want to go out for a show, drinks, and dancing, then this is definitely your spot. The show was great too, acrobatic and with great music.

good night. really good night out, but very packed in, if there was a space someone was sat in itentertainment was very good and the drinks were plentiful, glad we paid a bit more for the VIP optionit was a very late night though didnt finish until 3.30am so i would recommend you visit when youve got used to the time difference

What a fantastic night out !!!!!!!. Don't miss this night out, it's a fantastic experience. Awesome show and very entertaining staff, go for the gold member tickets well worth the extra money, free drinks brought to your table all night and you have your own space.Need to book gold member early in your holiday or before you travel.

Wild crazy fun,. I literally felt like I was a part of the show, it's an interactive experience like nothing I have ever seen before! The music was amazing, the dancers were well trained, the whole show was out of this world.However when I go back (because I definitely will!) I will get a sit down table on the first level. We were stood on ground level and it was packed out to the max, there was no room for anything and drinks took ages simply because it was a logistical nightmare in there! Also at the end of the night my neck hurt from looking up for 4hours... I just couldn't take my eyes of the show so in didn't notice until I got in the taxi back! Despite the crazy crowd we weren't sweaty due to the blasts of ice cold air regularly blown out with confetti which lit up the air... Cover your drink when that happens though! ;)

Crowded but good. The place was packed and we were like sardines but the show is amazing and really well produced.We got the open bar package but the cocktails we got had almost no alcohol in them so we stayed sober all night. Wouldn't recommend the open bar tickets.Would also recommend trying to get a table at a higher level, we were at ground level and we had so many drinks spilled on us as people went past.Show is amazing though.

A good time I don't want to have again. Despite the bad review I will admit I had fun towards the end- although that might be in part to the free alcohol they provide you. I'll start with the alcohol- it's included which sounds great but the only offer horrible well alcohol, the drinks were truly terrible and it took forever to get one. They do sell better quality alcohol and shots however in my mind I just payed for an all inclusive experience and I couldn't justify paying more. They have a designated server who will come around and take a drink order and then return with your drinks, hopefully with 30 minutes. They pack the place way past capacity, you are literally on top of on another. Definitely not a good place for someone with claustrophobia. I found myself looking for fire exits and hoping I wouldn't be trampled if I needed the use them (of note I was not able to find them). The show is sub-par. A lot of acrobatics putting on renditions of classic american TV /movie / pop acts, the acrobatics were pretty good. Towards the end of the night when everyone is boozed up things get much more wild, people clear out so your have more space and its a little more fun. It's right downtown so it's easy to get to and near shops and restaurants, they have lots of cabs in the area so transportation is easy as well. Would I do it again? No. Would I recommend it? No. However it wasn't a horrible night and I did eventually enjoy myself.

Good night, not as good as Cancun.. I've been to both Coco Bongo's and the Cancun one is bigger and better than this one.Still its a good show and an enjoyable night. Be careful who you book with though, we bought tickets through our rep which included return transfers, when we left the club however our driver didn't arrive to take us home and we ended up having to get a cab home!
Nice big club with lots of live shows and acrobatics to older songs. I like the club atmosphere but disliked how crowded it was inside and that it was often hard to get drinks

Great time... If I remember correctly..
