Did not know what to expect,had been told it was something not to miss, had to book seven days in advance to get gold tickets, bought them through thomson rep, would not do again just gave them £15 commision and only advice was dont get on the bus that picks you up get you own taxi there...Thanks, Anyway once we got there Fantastic night to be had, straight down vip side and up to our table (very small with 4 stools) but could not have picked a better seat ,straight opposite stage at eye level, drinks flowed all night ( 10.15 to 3.30am) great service and a handy toilet, Will not say anything about the show do not want to spoil it, but will say would go again if we go back FANTASTIC NIGHT!!!

Great night!. We went to Coco Bongo as part of an excursion on our honeymoon and we absolutely loved it. We can't stop saying how we wish they had this back home. A lot of people will say "Don't bother spending the extra for the vip, the main floor is not that packed" - - Granted. But the experience of being right by the stage, not too many people hovering around you, having a table and chairs to sit on and all you can drink is pretty worth it. Our server was really cool and kept bringing us these innovative drinks. Tip: him 10 and then 10 again sometime during the night and he'll make sure you're well taken care of. This is of course not mandatory but it helped. Also if you're a woman with a short skirt... Unless you want the entire place go see your panties/privates... Don't go on the stage. That jet of air will let all see your goodies :POverall, a must go for first timers at the Coco bongo!

BEST CLUB EVER!!!!. All I have to say is WOW !!!!!! this is a must go, must experience in life it was the club of all clubs the holy grail of clubs every little thing about this place was amazing from the shows to music to drinks highly highly recommend

Showtime. Great spot great entertainment 1 downside is the overcrowding .They let too many people in and it is a distinct fire hazard .In the UK or US never happen .Make sure you upgrade to gold vip or elseyou will end up almost squashed as the place is really tiny .

Had a great time!. This place is definitely worth the money. The shows are absolutely awesome and so entertaining. Very clean and I would definitely recommend getting VIP seating. Your own waiter will bring you another drinks all night. You can still go down on the bottom floor and dance if you would like. I would definitely go again!

Had to See What Everyone was Talking About. We booked this through our resort (Blue Bay Grand Esmeralda). My husband and I went with our daughter and her friend. It was fun, but I would not do it again. The show and performances were great! It started very late and went into the morning so we were just exhausted (too old for this). The place was crowded (hundreds of people) and we had to stand through the whole show and it was very difficult to see the stage! Like I said, it was an experience we had to try but would not do it again!
Got to go. Did it as part of the pub crawl and it was good but may be better to have just spent the full night there but we enjoyed the time we were there -except toilets hummmm

Best Time of My LIFE!!!. OMG, So much talent under ONE roof it's not even funny. If I wasnt married and didnt have kids, I would definately want to move to mexico and work here. I only wonder why they dont have one of these in the USA. This place is so much fun from the moment you get in line to wait, till the moment you hail your cab. And believe me you will need a cab. One price at the door and you never have to take your wallet out again. (exept of course to tip your server, even though they say, it's included, it's nice to give more) Your drink will NEVER run dry. It's like being in a huge concert center with stages all around you and a show going on in every direction. Including the ceiling. Take a musical tour down memory lane and relive it all through impersonators while sanctimoniously dancing with the folks all around you. It's like Time Square at New Years. Fabulous celebration EVERY night. I love this place. adults only, no ninos

Good but don't go with Thomas Cook. We booked to go to Coco Bongo through a Thomas Cook rep whilst on holiday in Mexico. The rep sold it to us as the Cancun destination and not Playa del Carmen, which was inaccurate and blatant mis-selling.We didn't book a table as these were sold out but we had very good views from the higher balconies of the show itself and feel that the tables weren't really worth the extra cost as we had our own separate bar area and toilets, as well as a waiter serving us the whole night anyway. The show itself is definitely spectacular in parts but there's too many spaces between points of action where you're just watching people from the crowd (normally young girls) dancing on the bar. There is a very good atmosphere though and some of the set pieces were fantastic to watch.**People thinking of booking through a Thomas Cook rep**I would sincerely advise against it. As expressed at the beginning of the review, we were initially miss sold the excursion as Cancun. We were picked up from resort at 8pm and told to be back at the bus station for no later than 3.20am or the bus driver would leave without us. In reality, the bus driver did not appear at the bus station until close to 4am and everyone was exhausted and fed up waiting for him. No explanation was given for the delay and no apology was given either.When we first arrived at the bus station in Playa del Carmen another Thomas Cook rep who came to take us to a bar before Coco Bongo didn't even tell us anything,he just marched us along to a bar at the end of the strip and gave us a wristband. The reps who were with us didn't seem at all interested in informing us of what was going to happen and they left at midnight after taking us into Coco Bongo. Their lack of communication was a bit of a dampener on the whole experience and I would really advise anyone planning on booking through your Thomas Cook reps whilst at resort to think again.The tables are only really worth the extra cash if you'd have an issue standing for 3 and a half hours, otherwise they're actually a bit of a con.

You must visit Coco Bongo!. Las Vegas shows with the best night club party you will ever go to! I suggest paying for the upgrade to VIP so you have a seat and more room to dance along with the shows! Bartenders were amazing and kept the all-included drinks full!

You have to go..... We're a couple in our 30's, who enjoy going to bars but haven't been to a nightclub in ages.We pre-booked VIP gold tickets via Thomson but on speaking to the rep at our hotel, was told not to get the coach (which we paid for with the tickets) and get a taxi instead at around 9.45pm so we'd get better seats. Due to the weather being heavy rain, we got a taxi straight to the club and got straight inside ie no queueing.We got seated upstairs on a couple of front row stools so had a great view of everywhere and Brandon the server was great, constantly topping up drinks or getting different ones when asked.The show was amazing, different bands/singers and acts and in between, the music was great which made you want to get up and dance.It started at around 11pm and finished just before 3am but it didn't drag at all and we left shortly after the show finished however could have stayed and danced etc.You definitely have to visit here if you haven't before but I would return, if I came to Mexico again or wherever else there is a coco bongos
What an Experiance. Excellent evening singing dancing and shows absolutely mind blowing party party party time we would definatley go again just for Coco Bongos

Go with a group and be sure to get VIP tickets. We went with a group a wedding planners from the US while visiting destination wedding locations in the Playa del Carmen. As a group we were able to reserve a VIP area with our own bar-waiter and bathroom. Both proved to be well worth it :).You can plan this in advance or consider working with the person at you resort if they have a Coco Bongo rep working there.They can set you up with private transportation and help make the whole experience great. They had a few bachelorette and bachelor parties going during the night and everyone was having a fun time. If you are going to Playa for a wedding, consider adding this to your activities or even having the Bachelorette & Bachelor parties at the same time. It's a blast.The show is non-stop entertainment. Charge your camera, you'll e taking lots of pictures/video. The VIP sections are worth the extra fee. Remember the drinks are included and they keep your glass full all night. The club is located in a popular tourist shopping and dining area with a strong police presence. Come before the club opens and enjoy walking around a bit.

DO NOT MISS. Me and my girlfriend went on the VIP member night with Thomson and wow what a night makes anything in the UK look rubbish! The show was amazing with all the confetti and balloons raining down every 5 mins, they covered so many genres and music types and the dancers were great. Worth getting VIP as looked a little congested downstairs, get there early and get a seat then it's service to your table all night, the minute you're close to empty a new drink is served without asking! Just tip them after the 2/3 round and they don't bother you again.

Spectacular night out... A must do!!!. Never been to a place like it, what a PARTY!!! Vip gold tickets are definitely worth the money, unlimited drinks attentively served and replenished before you have even taken your last sip! The shows are awesome and breaks in between with just DJ are wild with confetti cannons, Giants baloons EVERYWHERE! Only downside, time just flys in there!!!Great night out, thank you coco bongo!!!!

Assaulted & treated appallingly. This evening I went to Coco Bongo with my husband and another couple we befriended during our honeymoon in Mexico. I was punched in the face by a very large man. I am a 5 foot 5 woman aged 29 of small build. He was a great deal taller than me and heavy set. He assaulted me because I stepped in a space where his friend had been. My husband was in the toilet at the time and I was only with my female companion. The staff at Coco Bongo did nothing at all, despite the fact that plenty of witnesses saw the unprovoked attack. They allowed the man's group back inside the club and let them to come up to me and laugh in my face! I am disgusted by the way I have been treated. My nose is badly bruised and swollen. I was in the club for less than two hours. When I suggested they could refund my ticket or pay for my taxi home- baring in mind we paid $70 each to get in- they flat out refused. I was informed that the perpetrator would be arrested, but he was outside the building when I got outside, with a smirk on his face. To say I am disgusted with the way I was treated is an understatement. The staff acted as though I was a burden and seemed to view the assault as a trivial matter.Ladies- if you disagree with men assaulting women then please do not go here!

Amazing show. make sure you get what you paid for. We went VIP (table and unlimited drinks) however when we arrived we were left on the dance floor with no table. Eventually got what we paid for after a few harsh words. The Show AMAZING. A GREAT EXPERIENCE and a fantastic Atmosphere not to be missed. One of the best shows I've seen. They even had a workers brushing up ticker tape, that went off every 5 minutes.

Amazing. This night club is one of the most amazing experiences of my life. I can't big it up enough. The show is brilliant and so much is going on that you don't realise how long you have been in there. Totally and utterly brilliant. Vegas has nothing on this

A great laugh. Brilliant show...a bit cramped sitting down at a table but fabulous fun!Worth paying for a table and drinks included. They just keep offering more drinks... remember to tip the waiter though.
So much FUN. I really enjoyed the whole show. One thing I disliked, is paying VIP area and service and the Shooter girl came around and we had to pay for that as well. :( otherwise, so much fun!
Disco. Did not like. They jam pack people in. Standing only unless you book VIP! Cannot see the show. Definitely does not surpass Las Vegas. Would not recommend it.

Worth doing. OK OK it may be a lot of money for what it is but if your only there once it's worth it. The shows are well done an the time fly's by. It does get very busy on the floor so it you want extra room your going to have to pay for gold.

Fan bloody tactic. I was advised to try this club for a night out ,,,,I'm not really a drinker and I'm not one to stand on my seat dancing But this place is electric ...I had a few beers ( included in the price. More if you wanted) I did sing along ...I did stand on my seat and wave my arm and dance ....If you only have one night out ....it has to be this ....

Awesome bachelor party. Coco bongo is not your regular club. We celebrated our bachelor/bachelorette party. It was definitely special. Thanks to Diego who is the sales person at Sandos Caracol resort where we where staying we where able to get 13 people in short notice to the VIP in Coco bongo.

Coco bongo night club. It was good but I wouldn't go again unless I got a ticket on the door and was drunk! We went with Thomson as a gold member with advance tickets to jump the que and have our own waiter in a separate area. I felt it was a lot of money for what it was and it lacked the atmosphere as we were out the way of the action!

Disgusting!. We visited Coco Bongo in Player del Carmen last week when we visited Mexico on our honeymoon. This was the place I'd been really looking forward to, after hearing such fab things about it before. It was horrendous. My husband and I love to have fun and party, and I love shows, it sounded like great fun! We paid $128 each through Thomson for the 'Gold Package'. We arrived at 10pm as suggested by our rep to be greeted by a hectic, underage and overcrowded mess.We were herded into a small balcony and only brought drinks (which were included within package) if the waiter considered the tip (which he stood there waiting for) enough. The first drinks are made at bar and brought to you, the rest are made in front of you, which sounds acceptable but felt very suspicious. My husband noticed immediately that the drinks being poured to girls were almost neat alcohol with a token amount of mixer. As for the show... Well, the "show" actually starts at midnight, not 10pm and then it's about 2 mins of very poor performance followed by about 10 mins of filler. The "filler" being staff plying girls with booze and then getting them to dance provocatively on the bar whilst a camera captures down their tops and up their skirts and projects onto a big screen. Some of these girls could have been no older than 14 (I say this because one of the girls I saw was staying at our resort with her parents, so I got to see her the next day!!)My husband and I both felt really uncomfortable and unsafe in there, both with the surroundings and the ongoings. We stayed as long as we could, hoping it would get better, but it really didn't. I did however, leave feeling very nervous for some of the girls in there, both their safety whilst in there and getting home after. In summary, don't waste your money and time on this. Instead, take a walk down 5th avenue and enjoy some cocktails and friendly Mexican atmosphere. I would personally recommend Camillas!

Don't miss this. Loved every minute of it if you are going go vip and see if you can get the seats to the left of the stage on first floor not top floor the show is fantastic but it is the atmosphere which makes the night

Our best night in Playa!. First off- we are not extreme party people but Coco Bongo was our best night in Playa del Carmen! It's very crowded and loud- but that's what makes the atmosphere so great. Have a couple drinks and you will have fun no matter what!
a party not to be missed. - a lot of dancing and action on stage-show and performances of acrobatic acts and mimes-sell tickets outside the door
Fantastic. Absolutely loved this place. performances and unlimited drinks. very exciting and room for everyone to get involved.

Fantastic Experience!. I'm not one to frequent night clubs (I'm 52 years old) but I must say this is the best show I have ever seen! It's nonstop entertainment and dancing for 4 hours, the time flies! Be sure to get table service as it can get quite crowded on the floor, and the bathroom escort comes in handy. Would not hesitate to go again!! First rate.

Not Your Average Nightclub. I don't get out too much anymore, I'm passed that stage. However, this was a great night. It was really cool in the establishment so don't worry about being hot and sweaty all night long.The music was great, everything you could sing and dance to. The performances were awesome. Overall, definitely a place I want to be at when going out.

Out of this world just amazing . 3/6/15Me and my other have went to see this show and I would not normally watch this kind of shows but I have to say coco bongo is amazing and from start to finish I could not sit down it was just full off full and plenty to see. For the amount of people that was in there I was worried it would be a sweating but it's very well air con in there. If you plan to go I would definitely get VIP section as I am glad I had it and more room up there and also u don't need to go to the bar as the drinks just keep coming to u. Thanks again for a wonderful end to my holiday and if I come back to Mexico again I will definitely be back to coco bongo.

Best club ever!!. We was in Mexico for my wedding so had a range of ages. We convinced our parents and friends to go coco bongos (as we had been before) and against their will they all come with the intention of not enjoying it and coming home! Every one loved it!! We even had a member of our group (who's in his late 60's) get up on the stage and start stripping! It's so much more than a club, and I would advise anyone no matter how old to make a trip if possible
Excellent Entertainment. Such a great night- very crowded would recommend the VIP section but go earlish to get a good spot, some places would have restricted views. Would definitely go back.

Good Night Out, Very Crowded.... Good night out, was rather crowded but we got moved to a better table...Gold Member the best way to visit with all drinks included...Sooo much happening, expect a late night, so maybe get some sleep the day beforehand...
crazy night. Enjoyed a mad night a coco bongo great fun I would definitely go again and wave my balloon with the best of them .

A must, just brilliant. We went on a Friday at the end of May 2015 on the Gold VIP ticket. I would recommend doing it this way. We had our own small queue for VIP so it didn't take long to get in. We were places on the middle floor right next to the stage with a small bar stool and area to place our drinks. David served us and he was amazing. We ordered Vodka a coke and when I finish my drink I put it down and the empty glass was almost immediately picked up and replaced with a fresh vodka and coke. I could not fault this kinda of serves, although we did get very drunk. The venue is very crowded but we found the the VIP area was not as bad. This was mainly down to the very good security person who stopped everyone trying to get into the VIP section. The shows were just amazing and I can not put into words how good the night was. You really have to go and see for yourself
Crowded. Paid for "upgrade vip" and got a table in the upper back corner. Couldn't see anything and people were standing in front of us the whole time.

Amazing place. Wow what a totally amazing place. If you love shows, lots of singing & dancing you are going to love this place! Highly recommend going VIP as you are looked after so well, drinks continue to flow throughout the evening without you leaving your seat, even enough space to have a dance too!!

Awww what a fantastic night. Well not being one for night clubs I was a little apprehensive about going here but I had an absolute ball. It is not really a nigh club, more of a theme bar, but the acts are fantastic. If you go Gold Member you get your own private balcony and waiter service and just sit back and watch the show. You wont be standing for long though as the music is that good you just have to get up and give in to the music. The acrobats in the show were superb, one minute you could be having a beer the next the Mask is flying across the room and heading towards you. You must go and see this show, its a late night, but definitely worth it.

Great night!!. When in Mexico this is a must visit!! The fastest 5 hours of my life full of fun and entertainment , I would advise to do the VIP gold tickets you have a seat including drinks and waiter service it's not cheap about £100 each but well worth it!!

Good night out. Went on a club crawl before being taken to coco bongos with thomson. The club was already very busy when we arrived but we got passed the queues and to our spot in no time at all ( priority tickets have some privileges ).We had a standing area above stage height which had an ok view but not great. The atmosphere in the place was great. Some impression singing acts were interspersed with long spells of music videos played on a screen. Some airborne acrobatics at ceiling height appeared for a few minutes then more videos. Plenty of crowd singing with balloons and ticker tape being blasted into the club. I felt a better view might have made the visit better.

Wow, what a great place!!. I'm not totally sure how to describe Coco Bongo but it sure makes for an unforgettable experience that would be hard to rival! It's part show (or rather several mini-shows), loud music, massive energy and crown participation and general crowded mahem! Loved it!!

Wow! What a show!. I thought I may be getting a little old for shows like this, but with the right group of people, you'll have one hell of a time! Show was excellent, Las Vegas style... Club is packed on Wednesdays...(Ladie's Night). I've never seen so much confetti!Show is on elevated stage and also in the aisles and stairways! Book this early on during your stay and make sure transportation is included and open bar. Show ended at 3:30am, but I only made it till 1:30... Just awesome!!

Fantastic night . We booked our trip through Thomas Cook and payed for VIP tickets, which were worth every penny, we were collected from our hotel and walked straight in past the other people queuing, we had good seats level with the stage. We loved all off it from the show sets to the impersonators to the acrobats, the ticker tape and balloons it was fantastic. We had drinks bought to us all night and we are over 40 and it was a great part of our holiday.

Amazing show. Went to coco bongo which we booked through our Thomas Cook rep who took us to a couple of bars in plays del Carmen first. We booked the vip package which is a must otherwise I have no idea how you would ever get a drink. The show was the best thing I have ever seen- well worth the money.

Glorified nightclub. We booked the "VIP" Gold member through Thomson for the last Thursday of our holiday. We were told we'd be picked uped at our hotel but were not collected. Thomson rearranged for us to go the Friday night. You pay 130 USD to stand in 2 lines and are then taken to a seated area . they put me behind a pillar. They later came to us to give us a bag and one shirt to say sorry for not collecting us the previous night. Didn't really make up for a wasted day of our holiday. The night consists of guests dancing on stage, a couple of acrobats and impersonators. The music sounds like someone skipping through a mixed tapeI don't think it's worth the money and wasn't really what was described. I don't think this is worth the hype. But this is my opinion. Maybe we would have had a better time if it didn't cost so much and we'd had an honest description of what to expect.... And if we'd been collected on the date we booked. One good point is that the staff are excellent and worked very hard to get you drunk.

Fantastic!. A great night out such energy and entertainment in a well run club. Don't be put off by the sleazy bar dancing at the beginning of the evening.. we wondered what we had let ourselves in for! But once the show starts its simply a lot of good harmless fun. Owned by Jim Carey its exactly as entertaining as you would expect .

Amazing. We visited coco bongos recently on our 2nd trip to Mexico, we did not manage to go on our 1st trip but so glad we got there this time. Words can't really describe how great this place is, it blew us away never experienced anything like it and would love to go back again. It was so refreshing to see people of all ages, even older lady of about 70-80 having a great time. Advisable to be seated and waited on or upstairs standing but a must to see

Coco bongo craziness. OMG it's hard to find the right words to describe this place. It is a total hoot. We laughed all night. The shows are amazing, great extra effects, staff are fab. I advise the older folks that don't want to dance all night to buy VIP tickets for the upper level seated area to take in the whole experience and be waited on with a barman providing you with an endless supply of drinks.
Cocobongo Club. We loved this club - what a great show and what a great atmosphere the club had! Would recommend the VIP tickets, although they are a bit pricey!
too much fun. This is a awesome club! Super entertainment! The drinks are okay/ Would definitely go back to COCO BONGO MEXICO!

Too popular for it's own good.. I loved Coco Bongo. I've been there 4 times, and 3 of those were 3 of the best nights of my life. My most recent visit was a horrible night, and it all stems from the popularity of this attraction. We started by waiting in line for over an hour which is more time than we actually spent inside. Once inside we immediately realized it was WAY too crowded to enjoy ourselves at all. I couldn't get a drink, I couldn't dance, I couldn't move AT ALL. A few drinks spilled on me and my friends, a few elbows to the head & stomach and it was time to go. If only they would stop selling tickets at a certain point, or even open a new location, then many more people would love Coco Bongo the way I used to. I won't return to what used to be an amazing place until I hear they've taken measures to cut down on crowds. Basically it was a $65 shot of tequlia.

Best night out!. This is the second time we have been to coco bongos through Thomson and it had been amazing each time! We had a bar crawl first to a ABTA in the beach, the crazy cow bar then manadala, which was really good. Then coco bongos! One word - unreal! It's for all ages and its non stop fun! There's all types of music with tributes miming along. Acrobats and people flying through the air. Balloons, confetti, smoke! It is truly a night you won't forget!

Wow. Definitely a must do if you are staying close to playa. Paid extra for the upper level and was not disappointed with the show or the booze provided. Got back to the resort at close to 5 am and slept by the pool the next morning!! Will go again next time in playa area.

Like nothing you've ever seen before!. This place is amazing! Nelson from The Iberostar Paraiso Beach took us here! He is one of the reps for Coco Bongo! Such a nice guy! Hilarious! You get there and are in a massive line that seems like you will never get in.. the wait was only around 30 mintues or so.. and honestly its Mexico! You've predrank a little and its nice outside! The wait goes fast! Not knowing what lies ahead makes the anticipation grueling though! Once you get in you go through a small hall where you are given a vodka cranberry to pound back! Follow another 100m by a shot of tequila! Don't worry! This is normal here! We paid I believe $90/person for a bus trip to and from our resort and unlimited drinks all night! And it is a late night! I think it wraps up around 3 3:30! Needless to say we prepared and enjoyed a redbull prior to make sure we could stay up for all the excitement! When you walk into the hall/club itself it is spectacular! It's almost set up as an arena with different levels surrounding the stage in the center! The great part is you can actually be on the stage! You can literally go up in the middle and dance your heart out! It is a lot of fun! There is a lot of security at Coco Bongo and not once did we feel unsafe. It is mostly all tourists here. Maybe the odd local. You will watch a huge variety of shows throughout the evening all while standing around or dancing around... whatever you like! You will be dancing! It is so much fun! If you are likely like I was you will get to go up on the main stage at the top level and dance your heart out! Quite liberating actually haha dancing in front of 1200 plus people can be quite the energy booster! It was literally a night I will never forget for the rest of my life! Ginormous balloons flying around, streamers shooting out! Beetlejuice impersonators to Cirque de soleil type acrobats literally hanging right above your head! it is a show! The Mexicans know how to party! You feel like you are part of this unreal party that is never going to end! I would highly recommend it to anyone within the area of Playa Del Carmen! You will not be disappointed!

Amazing show. Booked our tickets with the guy from Grand Sirenis. (Freddy). Took us straight in past the queues and to a table, had a bottle ready on the table and waiter service with all drinks included. Amazing show so much happening. Not to be missed
Nightclub visit. Awesome, best night club i have ever beent to, unique. i went VIP and it was worth the extra money, no queuing, waiter was fantastic

Must Do! Must experience Coco Bongo!. We purchased a bottle of vodka, which covers your entrance fee and reserves you a table. Get there early (an hour before show starts) to get a great table with a good view! This is like cirque du soleil meets a broadway show! SO fun and entertaining! A show like this with alcohol would be double the price in the US.

Amazing but hot and cramped!!!. I paid for a "VIP" tour, but it was a small table cramped with people , the show was awesome and they did great performances!! The drinks were strong and I dont remember getting back to the resort but others helped me haha! Enjoy this trip and show it was a blast!!!
Very entertaining,. Weird and wonderful at the same time, you can tell jim Carey owns it, go VIP as you get a seat and table, drinks are all good quality brands as well

One Time Thing. It was an okay experience but it all depends on your likes. I am glad I went and saw what it was all about. I don't think I'd go again though. I'd buy tickets right from them rather than the sellers on the streets though !

overpriced but a must!!. well we are in cancum at the moment we was oohing and arring bout booking but i came on here read reviews...undecided rest of our group wanted to go. we booked thru coco reps around our pool, 140 dollar each VIP and transport. took 40 mins form mooon palace, vip let in first, the rep made sure we got to our section before leaving, we had a small bit and all cra,,ed in, we was the side to the stage, if you can imagine when you go to a west end show all the people on the floor and all vip on two levels up higher and all around the edge, we complained we was like sardines before being given the space next to us, we was quite firm we wasnt moving lol, the show didnt start till 11 and we had to endure an hour of the staff badly dancing and some of the show staff lol than the stage curtains opened and it all began..well it was very entertaining we saw a britney spears that was im sure a man! madonna looked like bet midler...Chinese elvis...the girl dancers were either men or ugly women! was no gaps..everyone was dancing, on the floor i wasnt crammed and unless you stood at back you probably couldnt see the stage!! there are tables on the floor section which prob be better than being squashed in VIP... our service lad Adrian was a top guy!! only issue i had was drinks very basic...i drink sparkling wine they had none!! its cheap enough lol was a great night we all loved it..the whole club sang happy birthday lights on me and showered me with confetti hahaaah fab!! so in my opinion, if your a big group VIP..but youngsters can do the floor!! its fun but stand at back! so a club well worth going to....even tho its overpriced!!!!

What a Night to Remember!!. Totally entertained and well looked after in the VIP Area from the moment we arrived! Entertainment fantastic, thought as " oldies" we' d feel out of place but definitely recommend, what a variety show, from musicals, tribute acts, film scenes, air acrobatics, just amazing. Well looked after by the staff, photo opportunities. All round good fun!
Great night time scene. Coco Bongo was an upbeat, entertaining night out. It was like a Broadway show meets Studio 54 - music, drinks, aerial acts and much more

Fantastic show. This is a very late night but I recommend you buy VIP tickets as you get seated upstairs where you have fantastic views of the show and the dancing and your also encouraged to dance the night away

Incredible night!. Booked these tickets via the boys at the Grand Serenis - the lovely Alfredo sorted us out.We paid the £90 ish for the VIP / Goldmember package - worth every last penny. We were seated up on high, with a fantastic view of the main stage. The show starts at about 11pm and then is literally non stop until 3am ish - literally one act or performance after the other. Streamers dropping from the ceiling, confetti, balloons - its absolutely insane and thats not even taking into account the quality of the acts which are excellent.The waiter service too is superb - literally never had to once ask for a drink past the initial order. The instant a drink was finished another one arrived. Outstanding. Thanks to Fernando for the great service.If you are in Riviera Maya or Playa Del Carmen and you only do one outing or trip it MUST be Coco Bongo!
FUN!. Very fun and show was good. Be careful of the shooter girl, booze is free so don't spend too much on her.

A MUST. You have to go. It's insane!A good show and party for everyone, cannot explain. You'll only understand how good it is if you go!The que was so long, but you can pay for quick entry for 10$ each - ITS WORTH IT. Otherwise the greatest experience, absolutely bizzare, fun and exciting!

Amazing night out. Amazing night, booked through our Thomas Cook rep, paid $130 each for VIP tickets. No queuing straight in, got a welcome drink. 2 shots on arrival then taken to our table. Our waiter Brandon was awesome, got our first drinks from the bar and then was pouring them at our table, toilets are downstairs and the stairs are quite steep, there is a smoking area outside quite small. The show is amazing a great atmosphere.
Amazing nightclub!. Best nightclub we've ever been by far! Definitely worth a visit if you are in Mexico, great shows and different to anything you would see in the UK!

Dangerously over crowded . Myself and husband both in our thirties visited as part of a thomsons bar crawl, we had standing space on the top floor balcony, once we managed to get there the view was fantastic and show very good, however the stair ways all had people stood watching the show squeezing past was dangerous. There was a toilet on the top floor but I have never seen such a small toilet, you had to manouvre behind the door to be able to close it. Your legs were tucked under the sink as it jutted out to meet the edge of the toilet. They have tried to cram far too much into a small space. As said before the show was good but would never visit again
Great night out!. Went to see Coco Bongo in Cancun and again in Playa del Carmen, enjoyed it both times! If you're looking for something to do in the evening it's definitely worth checking out!

Awesome Show!. We bought our passes for the coco bongo at our resort during one of the pool parties. Since it was only my girlfriend and I, we only bought open bar tickets. I recommend if you go the way of open bar, you pay the extra $10 at the door to get in right in & get the best spots to watch the shows. Do not worry about not being able to get a drink or waiting forever to use the restrooms. This place is very well staffed, didn't wait long for any drinks & there were restrooms without lines at the bottom. we paid $60 for each pass (open bar & ride to the club & back in an awesome bus)

No help and too crowded. We visited as it was highly reconmended to us. However i would not go back ever again.I had not been feeling well before we left for the place however when we got there i felt a bit better and was able to relax a bit more.our first problem started with coco bongo spelling my boyfriends surname wrong and so we almost did not get in! Thomson had spelt it right on our ticket so god knows how they got that wrong.seats were not very good for vip and my boyfriend ended up on a shelf behind my seat. we were introduced to a waiter who brought our first drinks over, after this he made the drinks at our table which was a bit weird. i took one sip of my drink 'tequila sunrise' and thought it best just to go slow due to earlier illnes (i had not been drinking alcohol at all that day). an hour and a half into the show i suddenly felt like i needed to be sick so grabbed my boyfriend who tried his best to find the toilets for me. however i couldnt hold and was unfortunetly sick on the floor. the staff were extremely unhelpful, even with my boyfriend screaming at them to help after him asking 3 times nicely. they just spoke into their walkie talkies and turned their backs. we eventually found the toliets and my bf was ushered out of the ladies by a mexican lady for obvious reasons however some fellow british girls looked out for me and took me back to my boyfriend. we then got ushered straight out.bear in mind we had come on a coach and now we were outside with still 4 hours to go...we ended up getting a taxi whos driver was brill as we didnt have enough money for the taxi but waited for my bf to run back to the room for money.thomson have been the only saving grace, they hounded coco bongo and when coco bongo turned round and tried to offer us a free night (on our last night) my boyfriend demanded a refund. we got this in the end only because of adam at thomson desk who we heard very loudly say 'coco bongo cannot keep doing this, happens too many times now' all in all, it seemed like it would have been a good show although they do mime, if it wasn;t for the staff and treatment there that we encountered! it was also very over crowded

amazing atmosphere . had a great time we got the best seats in the house but im scared of heights so I couldn't settle they moved us down no issues the show was amazing singing dancing acting scenes from movies a party atmospheres the only comments for me where it was a crowded area u were very close to the next person it was full the brim this included the very small smoking area but I didnt go much as didn't want to miss a thing the show kept you glued! all in all a very entertaining night we bought the tickets at the box office a few days before £75 gold vip tickets

Whoa! Brill!. Excellent show but missed first bit because we paid for gold membership and there was no where left for us to go. No seats or table or even a space to stand upstairs! If you can stand or of course dance for four and a half hours downstairs don't pay the extra and you have a fantastic view.

Wow!!!. We are in our 60's but after reading about this place decided we couldn't miss the experience! So glad we went! Booked with Mike from Riu Palace Riviera Maya. He arranged VIP tickets which included priority entry, seating and we had bottle service which in our case was a bottle of cognac between us which was our choice. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. Venue was smaller than we expected but we had great view and great space to practice our dancing skills! The show itself was spectacular. Varying from acrobatics, flying characters and too many other things to mention! Brilliant! venue was packed to capacity and getting to the loo was a bit of a trek but apart from that we loved it. Managed to stay till 3.15 am and an abundance of taxis available with a charge of around £6 to return to our hotel. Great experience which We wouldn't have missed!

Absolutely FANTASTIC!! . Just recovering from an excellent evening at Coco Bongo. Superb entertainment with an unsurpassed atmosphere that grabs even a miserable sod like me!! Extremely infectious fun night with great dancers, good bar service and lots of fun. However, I would suggest you pay the extra and go GOLDMEMBER (US$130 in the week $150 at weekends for all inclusive drinks)This allows access to the first floor where numbers are controlled. The ground floor was packed but looked like fun. I would thoroughly recommend this on anyone's to do list when in the Playa Del Carmen or Cancun region.

Not as good as the one in Cancun. Having visited both venues Playa Del Carmen does not have the wow factor like the Cancun one. It was much smaller and had less acrobatic shows. It was a glorified nightclub which spent too much time zooming in on female cleavages and projecting the image on screen. If you are visiting Coco Bongos do the Cancun one.

AMAZING. We went to coco bongo as a group of 11. I have to admit I was pretty nervous about going but now I cannot wait to go back. We purchased the VIP package. This included out travel to and from, VIP entrance, welcome cocktail, shots of tequila at the door, we were brought to our table, and had a waiter for just us for the entire night. Also, we had unlimited drinks as they were included in our package! There was a bathroom very close to us as well. We had a phenomenal view of the stage. Entertainment was amazing. There were girls going around the entire night just giving shots. These had to be purchased. But still a lot of fun. I would recommend this bar to anyone look for a goodnight and a break from the resort nightlife.
Spectacular show!. This place knows how to party! Fantastic show, amazing music and awesome atmosphere. Be prepared for a late night! Cover charge includes open bar!

Eh, still not Vegas. We went to check this place out as people kept toting it as a "can't miss". My mistake may have been booking at our resort but we were not VIP as I thought we were supposed to be. That said, if you buy regular admission beware. The drinks were horribly watered down and the margaritas were carbonated (After being fed drinks non-stop for 3 hours, I hardly felt even a buzz).The bad alcohol and horrible overcrowding aside, it was a pretty entertaining show. It's still not a Vegas show but wasn't bad. I'm glad we went once, worth checking out.

Bonkers night in Coco Bongo. If you have the stamina, do visit Coco Bongo whilst in Playacar as it will be a memaroble evening. Prices start from about £45 and you can get tickets from your hotel resort rep or from sellers in the town, or at the entrance if you get there early enough. It is a nightclub crossed with a cabaret and you never quite know what to expect, from dancing dwarves to stripping grandfathers! Mime artists perform pop hits and trapeze artists and acrobats fall from the ceiling, while dancers act out scenes from major moves like Batman and Spiderman, flying through the air from stage to stage. There are 3 tiers to the club and you can get VIP tickets with an open bar, or buy tickets only. The cheap drinks are poor and you are crammed in like sardines so you may struggle to get a drink, or see all of the show. It goes on for almost 4 hours and does get a little dull after all that time, but still worth a look. Beware prices, as people were paying as much as £90 a ticket we heard - it aint worth all that. We paid 89 us dollars with a pub crawl and drinks free all night so got our money's worth. Girls can be invited to dance on the main stage and cameras highlight you, so be prepared, especially for the hot air blasts up your skirt! Coco bonkers.

An absolute must!!. My boyfriend and I bought our tickets through our holiday rep at the hotel and were advised that tickets sell fast... This is absolutely true!We paid for VIP tickets, as we were advised that VIP meant you got your own table (What it actually meant was that we were sat upstairs, next to main stage with a group of approx 30 others and we had our own bar and waiter... Drinks all included!) Definitely worth paying extra for this as otherwise you'll find yourself standing all night, looking up at the stage.A coach came and picked us up from our hotel and also dropped us off (Included in price of ticket)The atmosphere was electric... It was buzzing as soon as we walked through the door at approx 22:00, until we left which was early hours of the next morning. You honestly won't know where to look next as there's just so much happening!There were singers, dancers, different tribute acts, loud music, gymnasts, lots of glitter and giant balloons... There was even a kiss cam which was just hilarious and all good fun!At Coco Bongo, you will find people of all ages (no children) and we were actually sat next to an elderly couple, who looked like they thoroughly enjoyed the show too.We would definitely go back if we were to go to Mexico again... We certainly weren't disappointed.An amazing night out and experience!

AMAZING!!!. The BEST club I have ever been to. Amazing show, buzzing with people and energy. I would definitely return. The only complaint was trying to get down from the VIP tables to the toilets. It was sooo busy you couldn't move past people!

Magic night. This is a must visit for all ages. We went in September for the 2nd time the first being 3 years before and if we go back to Mexico we will be back to Coco Bongos, We went on a VIP trip organized by First Choice we got collected at our hotel and taken into Playa Del Carmen this show doesn't start until 11pm and you don't get picked up again until about 3.30am, we had excellent seats at the front of the balcony and our glasses were never empty, our waiter was very attentive. The show was once again amazing. We even got caught on the "kiss cam". Highly recommend visiting this amazing nightclub.

It's worth checking out!. Where will I start? Well, a group of us (12, all couples) went there on Friday, May 15, 2015 while we were staying at a near by resort in puerto morelos. All of us bought VIP gold member tickets which were approx. $350 CAD per pair. We arrived there and after a brief delay in the VIP line up we were on our way inside. Security seemed pretty good, they patted up down and they took my Visine eye drops for whatever reason, which I was perfectly okay with. We we offered shots and once the group was all together we were escorted to our area.... this was not good! They brought us to a small area on the right side of the stage that was only big enough for 6 people to sit comfortably... it was actually ridiculous. we were all shocked and in disbelief. we asked coco bongo employees several times to move us and they didn't seem to want to help us at all. Luckily for us, one of our group members was a comedian and a really funny/lively guy, and he was on the big screen going crazy and everyone was loving it (this was about 30 mins before the show started). He managed to get another employees attention and convince him to relocate us and the employee said that because he was" the life of the party" he would see what he could do for us.... finally! they moved us over to the left side of the stage on the first level above the floor right next to the bar in the corner. We were satisfied with this new location and had no complaints after that. If we hadn't of been moved I'm certain a lot of us would've left early.Once we got there a girl came around with a whistle and some glow in the dark shots.... she didn't tell us that they were not free and some of the guys done a few, which was fine. she continued to come back throughout the night and ask us to buy more which was slightly annoying but not a big deal.Our server was really good. I gave him $20 as soon as we got there and he made sure my drinks we refilled with little to wait time. I was pleased with this service.The show itself was excellent. Very impressive and very fun. I would've liked to have seen G'N'R or Queen personally, but the acts we did see were awesome. To name a few: Tron, MJ, Elvis, Christina A., Madonna, Batman vs Bane, Spiderman, etc. We danced and enjoyed the music in between performances. It's also worth mentioning that in between performances girls would dance in the center of the stage and air would blow their skirts/dresses up... most people seemed to enjoy that! Haha! Overall it was a pretty great time but when we first arrived we weren't sure that it was going to be a good time at all and I can only imagine how bad it would've been if we had not been lucky enough to be relocated to a much better area. Luckily it was a plesant experience but I can totally understand how there are some negative reviews on here. In my opinion VIP gold member is the only way to do it as it is very crowded at this club. Security seemed to be very good and the bathrooms were very clean.If you've never been to Coco Bongo I would recommend that you check it out... great performances and fun atmosphere.

Totally worth it. Where do I start this club is the best night club I have ever been too,the place itself is great and the shows are undescribeable they were very coordinated and fun,i would recommend the vip tickets the bar man who looks after you is on the ball you finish one and there's another straight away,the acts are awesome and are right above you and the trapeze is unforgettable,do this PLEASE!!

Good but only good for one visit, other than that, waste of time.. The entertainment is really good however the cheers and celebrations are smart work of prerecorded audio which gives you the illusion everyone is having a fantastic time. The bar is very small however they do fill it out quite nicely and the crowd and music are great which will make the experience that much better, i would recommend a booth because it is not fun standing around for 4-5 hours with people constantly bumping into you. After one visit , it will not be worth the money anymore, save it for something else like a nice meal or excursion .

Vegas eat your heart out.... wow! what an amazing night. I dont want to spoil it but amazing dancers, acrobats and entertainment. Worth paying a bit more for VIP as you get great seats and waiter service to your table. the best nightclub i have ever been to!

One of Best clubs. This is a must visit place if youare visiting Mexico and love clubing. Its grande and beautiful, you'll rate them in one of the best clubs you ever went. Nearly everything available, good DJs and great music selection. Its better to ask any guide or local a low crowd time since if you go Friday or Saturday evening between 6-10 pm you'll be in the line for a hr or more. A little early is good for starting to explore the club and ambience rather than just trying to make way and waiting in que for everything.
smoking. Go to be seen amazing night, couldn't get this back in the UK everyone who goes to cancun should go to coco bongos simply brilliant place

Only good for a one visit!!!. I always wanted to see this show based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and the advertisements. The show did deliver pretty spectacular entertainment as it was promised but the sad part is how it was so overpacked with so many people that you are constantly bumping on to the crowd and it didn't really leave a space to dance. Good luck getting drinks unless you have a vip reservation, because the service is non existent. Ladies, unless you booked the vip seats DO NOT bring your fancy high heels here because you'll be on your toes for at least four hours!!! Ouch!!!

Way too crowded!! Music was good. The place was full to the rafters, to the point it was quite scary! The music and show were good but the free drinks were rubbish, we paid for express pass to then be told they dont offer that anymore so my advice would be get there early so as to get a decent spot! If your a smoker- dont bother the smoking area is a tiny spot on the top, you cant even pass each other and the railing isnt safe. Staff work very hard to keep walkways clear and very steep stairs lit up. Im glad i went but wouldnt go again

Not as good as I was expecting. Good night out.. Though the actual acrobatics etc were a let down to be honest. The majority of the show is padded out with film clips on a big screen.. With brief intersections of the proper show you pay to see. Saying that it was a good atmosphere. Worth paying for VIP just to skip the enormous q at the entrance. But if you pay VIP you are sat up away from the dancing and action which happens on the floor by the bar. They seated us right next to the screen at first but we asked to move as there was no way we could see from that angle. They moved us without problem which was good. At seat waiter service for VIPs and we tipped the waiter straight off.. He then kept drinks coming all night. If your a bird beware of getting up to dance.. This happens way too often and is used as another form of padding out a pretty light agenda.

Everyone should experience Coco Bongo. It is such an amazing experience, one that you won't regret. If you are holidaying in the area regardless of your age, do make a point of going to this incredible place. Its a carnival party atmosphere, and it will be a lasting memory

Mind blowing entertainment . We booked gold tickets through our thomson reps. Maybe more expensive but we wanted to know we was ging to get good seats. And so pleased we did as I would never be able to stand all night long. We had great seats with a table on the 1st floor balcony and had a great view of the stage .. we could see the floor stage too and of course of the artists on the trapeze from the ceiling. Drinks flowed constantly,without even asking most of the time. We tipped about £5 and the waiter was very attentive. The show was immense.. mind blowing, constant and fun. There was miming but who cares. I know I didn't pay to see Madonna or Michael Jackson. I payed to see the show. And we loved every second. The actors and artistes were very talented. There was a photographer and we bought 1 photo but we didn't felt pushed into it. We wanted it for a great souvenir. The toilet was kept very clean by the attendant. All in all we had the very best time.. was amazed we kept going till gone 3 am but the entertainment was so good we didn't have chance to feel tired. I have mobility issues and use crutches and I can't say thankyou enough to the team of staff who ensured I got in and seated safely and when leaving they cleared a path so no one got hurt and we got out easily. We signed some safety paperwork so they were aware of my needs in an emergency which makes me believe that safety was paramount to them. Yes it is crowded but so are most nightclubs. But if you dont like crowds ensure you get in a seat then you would be just fine. Loved it! loved it! loved it!. Can't wait to try out another one on our next holiday.

A Fantastic Show!. It took a while to get into but was worth the wait! The entertainment was amazing. Loved all the confetti and balloons coming down from the ceiling! The only downfall was how incredibly packed it was. I got bumped into several times and there was not much room to dance. The show was great and I would definitely recommend it if you can handle the crowd.

Incredible and expectacular experience. Hey, do you know those parties in which you are only one in the middle of hundreads of people? This place is pretty much the same. However, there are special areas where you can stay that are like stages, you can be the dancer of the party.This party is more like a event of several thematic concerts, I've seen Michael Jackson, Lady Gaga, themes based on famous people, movies, etc.The price is a bit high it was $60, but open bar, you could drink anything, from Tequilas to special drinks such as La Paloma or Sex on the beach.People there were mostly tourists but I've met some Mexicans coming from another regions in Mexico, as this is a very complex party to make, it might be a unique experience to go only once or twice, as they might have the same concerts every day. But they may change often the attractions.You can also see high skilled acrobats, I felt my self as going to a circus and a theatre not only a party made for tourists.
funky place. They shows are worth the price on its own m, but yes lots of people if you can pay the extra for the VIP

HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. My husband and I bought tickets to go here. When we entered....OMG!!!!! It was packed from level one to level three. The security has everyone to continue to the third floor when you enter. It was a night mare. It has to be a fire hazard... Never again will I ever consider visiting again.

Awesome Show! Way to crowded... Great value for only $75 including transportation both ways and free drinks all night. If I wasn't 6'4 I wouldn't have been able to see most of the show as we were crammed into the club extremely tight. But Amazing performances by all the dancers covering 20-30 live shows and movie themes.. I would high;y recommend going the VIP is definitely worth the extra money to be higher up and not crowded on the floor level.

Good night. This wasnt really what i expected from things i had heard from other people. We booked gold member tickets which gave you express entry (the normal queue was miles long which in the heat would have been horrendous!) and someone bringing you drinks all evening. All drinks and transport were included in the price of the ticket. Firstly our VIP seats were rubbish! Couldnt see a thing and wouldve been better on the floor. Our waiter was fantastic and kept the drinks flowing all night.The show itself was good however nothing in comparison to going to vegas like its marketed! It was a mix of a show and then music leaving everyone to dance which i preferred out of the two.A guy comes round dressed as the mask and we had our picture taken with him. To buy i think it was the equivalent of £15. Spiderman came round later too. Overall this is a good night out and i would recommend paying that little bit more for the gold member purely for queue jumping. We were there from 10pm - 4am and it flew in.

Fantastic night free drinks and an amazing show !!!. We booked Coco Bongo "gold member" through our Thompson rep whilst staying at the Riu Tequila hotel which included transfer from the hotel to the club and VIP seats with free drinks all night.We decided to take a taxi which cost $120 and saves picking up at all the hotels on the way and the taxi back at 3am was the same price unlike taxis in the UK.the VIP seats are in the raised balcony area which is a little out the way of the dance floor action but you get great views of the show which is going on both on the main stage and interacting with people on the the dance floor.Our table waiter was fantastic never letting our glasses empty before bringing another round of drinks he worked hard for his $500 Passos tip that's for sure The main show starts around 11pm and finishes around 2.30am with the club remaining open until 4am with something going on all the time including streamers, giant balloons, a midget beetle juice and Spider-Man flying into the crowd !!!If your in Mexico you must visit the world famous Coco Bongo it's an experience you won't forget ....

Interesting Place.... We bought our tickets to Coco Bongo through a representative at our hotel. It included transportation to and from our resort, and drinks at the club. Over all it was a very weird experience. When you walk in, everyone it trying to give you drinks and shots, and for me personally, I like to have a good time but I don't want 3 tequila shots and 2 mixed drinks the second I walk in the door. The show itself was really good, I have no complaints about that. But, in between shows, they would play a few popular songs and they had girls dance up on stage in between 2 HUGE tv screens, and on the tv screens they would project the girls that were dancing on stage. If that isn't weird enough, it's not like it was just a shot of the girls dancing on stage, the camera would scan each girl from top to bottom and zoom in on...certain areas of their bodies.... Those girls didn't seem to mind, but that was just not for me. So I mentioned all those drinks that they throw at you when you walk in? It's not a surprise that one of my friends drank too much and we had to have help from bouncers to get her out of the club since we were on the third floor. The bouncers were incredibly nice and helpful. There aren't even words to describe how helpful they were. It would have taken us an hour to get out of there if it weren't for them.

Fantastic night out in Mexico. My husband and I went to this night club and did not know what to expect. We booked the VIP seats and I am glad we did. The show was AMAZING. The drinks were flowing all night and we did not have to move from our seats. Would I go again, YES, it is worth every penny.. a fantastic night out.

Past my bed time but glad I went!!. My daughter wanted to take me to Coco Bongo but as an old guy (62) I thought I would be to tired as it didn't start until 11:30 pm but I was so wrong! Had a wonderful time at this amazing night club! We opted for the VIP seating from Best Day Vacations at our hotel at the Valentin Imperial Maya. Got picked up and driven to the night club where we had no line up and were immediately shown to our seats on the second floor. No wait for the bathroom and excellent service from out waiter who looked out for the old guy! The varied musical acts were very well done with lots of action and fantastic performances by the impersonators. Before you knew it the clock said 3:30 am and time to get our bus back to the hotel. A great time and highly recommended! Very crowded on the main floor so was glad to pay the extra for the seating on the second floor!

Do not go if you like breathing space!. I've been to Mexico several times and never managed to get to Coco Bongo. As it is rated a top attraction and the fact that we travelled with our children ages 18,22,23, we decided to go. We paid 70 US each deciding against the 140 for VIP thank goodness because it turned out to be a waste of money. We were picked up at our hotel, transfer to was fine, and we were all excited that we were finally going to go to this highly rated attraction. When we got there, we were all herded in like cattle and our party was squeezed into an area - well on the steps without any room for movement. Any time we tried to move we were told we had to go back to our spot. I lasted twenty minutes and had to leave as it was too congested. Exits were not clearly marked and I can guarantee that if there was ever a fire , there would be many casualties . Maybe because I'm from Canada where everything is risk managed to death, it made me more nervous , but coco bongo was definitely not what I expected. They describe it like a cirque de sole il, but there was no resemblance to me. It was just a huge overcrowded building. I must say when we left, the employees were very good and tried to encourage us back in by offering us a VIP spot. Well those VIP spots are no different other than they provide you with a small table. They also told us that it wasn't crowded that night- that another 400 people could fit...HA! That's a joke as it was wall to wall people. The staff gave us a couple free shirts and off we went. If we had known what it was going to be like, we would have taken our 420 US and spent the evening checking out the bars and fifth avenue strip. Some people may have fun at this attraction, but it was definitely not for us

fun night but over hyped up.... i went to Coco Bongo with a open mind as i dont usually like clubs but i enjoy caberets and shows. We got the gold member ticket which meant we had our own table and waitor. i was glad we did this as the floor area was packed! it looked like they had filled the place to the max. Our waitor was great, i can't fault him at all. The "shows" were ok, nothing that amazing. the acrobatics were the best bit! they were amazing. other then that it was just dancers mimming to music. pretty standard really. the atmosphere in the club was really good though so it was worth experiencing it. The only thing i didnt like was that i felt the place was pretty pervy. They used a spot light and spotters to find girls in short skirts who were asked to go and dance like tarts on the stage between acts...as they were dancing a gust of wind blew up their dresses, skirts and tops and revealed all to the audience below. it just felt very seedy and pervy in there. more like a gentlemens club then a club for all. i've seen it, done it..wouldn't go back in a rush. The drinks were all included in the price except for the shots that you get pestered for constantly. They dont leave you alone! they say it is better then Vegas, but i doubt it very much.

Crazy night out. We had VIPs tickets so did not have any queuing. Before we reached our seats we had been given 3 drinks, a cocktail and 2 shots! It was a night packed full of fun, entertainment and drinks as we were served all night long by our waiter. We did find tipping him half way through the evening speeded up the drinks! This is an experience you don't want to miss when in Mexico.

OUT OF THIS WORLD. This place really does put Vegas to shame, I have been to both Coco Bongos in Mexico - they are the exact same and both crazy, insane places... honestly never been to a better show/nightclub in the world. The staff work so hard the place is unreal ... simply Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Huge disappointment. Total waist of my time and money.. Every one I have spoken to about going to Mexico on our honeymoon said you must visit coco bongos, for the life of me I can't understand why. It was horrendous. We paid for gold member tickets through tomsons so cost roughly £85 each. This meant we got a seat at eye level and free drinks and waiter service. Fair enough, I am glad we done this as its the only reason we stayed as long as we did. They pack the club out to the max. People literally could barely move. It is full of 30+ something Americans acting like 16year old. You spend the whole night having willing girls (I say girls but they were actually women) go up on the podium just so they can 'accidentally' have their skirts blown up to show their thongs. As for the act, it was the biggest let down. You get 10 minutes of show followed by 20mintues of clubbing and so on. The acrobatics where the only good thing about coco bongs but you got around 10mins total of this out of the whole night. All the songs where mimed . They are comparing it to Vegas but not one song was live. Just people dancing around on the stage pretending to sing. Can quite honestly say it was a total waist time and money. I wouldn't reccomend this to anyone.

An absolute must do!. Amazing, fantastic, brilliant, superb... Just a top night out for anyone to enjoy. Great show and entertainment, intermingled with music intervals, well organised if you have gold member seated view with own waiter. Drinks all inclusive too. Great atmosphere, just a be done night out.

Best night out ever. Visiting coco bongos is a must if you are in playa del carmen, best night out ever!!! If you don't want to stand all night and que outside for an hour make sure you go VIP you will also struggle to get drinks at floor level.
great night. Great time, enjoyed the whole evening, our server, Roberto, made sure we were well looked after. Show was brilliant especially the trapeze artists. A must go see!

A Must See. I would suggest this to anyone travelling to this area. This is by far one of the best shows I have ever seen. We went with friends and my husband physical limitations therefore we purchased VIP tickets which is worth every penny. They met us near the back of the line and moved us quickly through the crowd and up to our seats. Our waiter even moved my husband to the front of the line to go to the washroom. The show is spectacular. We would return again for sure!!

Lots of fun and amazing talent!. We booked this adventure through our hotel rep - we paid an extra $10 to skip the lines and it was WELL worth the money because the line was a mile long! We went on Cinco de Mayo which is a bigger holiday for Americans than it is in Mexico. There was some confusion over our tickets at first - they wanted to charge us another $20 for VIP, but we had already paid that. I don't think we were actually VIP, we just got to skip the line. We had no idea what to expect but we were greeted with a drink when we walked in, then later a shot of tequilla. Once we got in, we had no clue where to go - we tried going up the stairs but this is where the VIP people get to go so we were told to go back down. The place is NUTS and VERY crowded. Finally a server grabbed us and brought us up to a little section where we stood on a narrow step for the rest of the night. It turned out to be a perfect spot because we were right in front of the stage and off of the floor which was even more crowded. I don't recall our server's name, but we tipped him well at first, then we only saw him a few more times throughout the night. We couldn't have gotten drunk if we wanted to - I think we had 3 or 4 drinks all night which was fine because our flight left in the morning, but may have been disappointing to someone else. The shows and talent were incredible - there is a wide variety of American and Hispanic music, all very fun to dance to! I got hauled up onto the bar to dance which was fun for a few minutes, but I had more fun dancing with my fiance - the girls on the bar are young and don't care if someone is standing there with a camera pointing up their skirts. There were people there of all ages though - one lady got up on the big stage overlooking the crowd - she was probably in her 70's and she was shaking it to "Pretty Woman." The crowd went wild - she was SO GREAT! They are always letting out streamers, confetti, balloons, etc. I do think that they pump the space with oxygen so they keep you feeling cool and awake. As crowded as it was, it was never hot in there which was nice. We left to go back to our bus around 3:15 and we were exhausted! It was a great time - not sure I'd do it again, but well worth the experience!

Fantastic. We recently visited Coco Bongos for the second time and I think it was even better than the first time. This really is a must see at least once. Worth it even if you don't drink much or at all...the atmosphere is amazing...very hard to describe. One thing to keep in mind is that this is a night club and will ask for ID for those who do not look of age. The other thing is that it IS a late night...I think we left at 3:40, back to the resort at 4:40....

Great Experience. Coco Bongo is something I would tell everyone to experience atleast once. The shows, the music, the atmosphere everything was great. They play a variety of music so its meant for everyone to enjoy. The all inclusive drinks are great too.The downsides: You must get there early. We arrived at 9:30pm and the line was more than a NY city block long. We ended up paying the $10 each to get in the club faster without waiting on that line. The worse part of the experience is when you finally enter the door. There were these people that had Gold Member wrist bands and you are stuck in a very cramped hallway with staff member pushing these people past you which causes for alot of commotion and aggravation. So our first hour in there we were pretty annoyed. And once you get inside you have to secure your waiter and promise him a nice tip or else you will have to be going to wait on the long line by the bar to get your drinks.

Worth doing for sure!. It wasn't at all what I was expecting. From 11PM - 3:30 AM you are dazzled and entertained with an amazing show of acrobatics, dancing and more! The time passed very quickly. Get the Gold Member/VIP tickets. They are worth every penny and you will be VERY glad you did.

Awesome !!. At sixty six I thought I might be a bit old for this one.Don't you believe it. It was great. It was a cross between a Disco, a floor show and a circus. With free drinks thrown in for good measure. Had a quiet day the next afternoon.

Best night out ever. My wife and I booked the Gold VIP tickets to celebrate her birthday and what a night it was. From the time we got there we were looked after and had two tequila's pushed into our hands as soon as we stepped inside the entrance. The show and the whole experience is something not to be missed. Definitely a night to remember.

What a night for our group!. We booked through our resort and got a great spot on the main floor. The bar is amazing with so many levels. You see people from all age categories having a great time! This is an experience not to be missed! we had a few people in our group that had never been and didn't know what to expect they were blown away and so glad they ventured into Playa off resort! A fun safe and exciting way to spend a night in Mexico!

Out of this world. We went to Coco Bongo with a group of 20. It was the time of my life! We were all VIP with all inclusive bracelet. The staff are all awesome. It's a none stop party from the moment the time you walk in. We are going back to the Playa Del Carmen area next year and we are already planning to return to Coco Bongo!
So much fun!. Quite possibly one of the best nights out I think I have ever had. Worth every penny, do yourself a favour and go there if you get the opportunity. You will not regret it.
Coco Bongo. Brilliant night out, the entertainment just went on and on. The drinks flowed. Don't go if you have hearing problems, it was very loud!

Claustraphobic!!!. Hated it very low ceiling and huge que on admission and then got took up to the teeniest balcony and had a panic attack as it was crammed went onto the lower floor and felt better amazing atmosphere but can not move and feel really claustrophobic but if your not then you might like it acts were ok saw Britney will I am Freddie mercury were all good but I wanted to see beyonce but because id bought my ticket as part of a bar crawl we got shipped out at a certain time and I didn't get to see her :( drinks were all inclusive but vile overall experience not amazing for me but other people in my party recommended it and it was there second time there and they loved it so depends on the individual

An experience you must try. Amazing. Beyond anything I have ever imagined a show and disco could be. We chose to upgrade to the VIP, which we liked because you were able to sit and received upgraded drinks. Worth seeing.

This will be one of the best nights of your life. This place was INCREDIBLE!!!. The show is high end Vegas quality and the performers are super talented. We had the night of our lives here. We had a private table which i highly recommend if you want to really get a good view of the show. The extra cost includes a bottle of liquor, private table (you're still going to be standing a lot) and a great wait staff. You absolutely have to make this place a priority one or two nights of your trip.

Danced til the early hours!. We visited Coco Bongo's whilst on holiday in Playa del Carmen. Tickets were $65 each for open bar and return transport from Playacar. Although queues outside club appeared never ending, they dispersed quickly into club and I would not justify $135 for fast track entry and VIP seating.The show was amazing, time flew and after dancing for hours realised it was 3am and time to head home. Fantastic experience and I would recommend to everyone, regardless of age. People there appeared 18-70 yrs old. I would definitely return on my next holiday there.

Fantastic experience. It is hard to describe but i guess "Vegas show that you feel you are in the middle of" is a pretty good summary. The only reason I didn't give it 5/5 is because its quite expensive but I'd go again and again.

AMAZING! Best. night. ever!. BEST CLUB NIGHT EVER!!!!!! We booked a tour through our Westjet guide for $65 usd each that included hotel pick up and drop off, club admission and all inclusive drinks. Totally worth it. The line up is insane outside but moves fast. We thought the night would be too long for us (9:20 pick up at hotel and 3:33am pick up at club) but we honestly could have stayed way longer! Tip a server soon as you get there and ask for a bottle service table if there's any empty and you'll have the best view in the house.
Nite out. When in mexico this is a must nite out brill ent well organised go for the VIP seats much better view we went wiv our 18 yr old we in our 50th but still had great time

Amazingly entertaining. We went vip which is a must don't bother if not as you would que forever ! As we entered we had a cocktail put in our hand and had three mor tequila shots all before we were seated we had a great seat and we gave the bartender ten dollar at the beginning and ten at the end and we never had an empty glass !! The entertainment is spectacular and so much fun it's a mixture of band covers movie scenes ticket tape cannons ,balloons ,high trapeze batman swinging in Spider-Man spinging round and of course the mask singing Cuban Pete I'm the king of the rhumba beat ! It's such a good crack !! Also they pull girls up and offer them the podium I struggled getting my missus down haha it was our favourite night of our holiday and we would love to go back again !!10/10 can't recommend enough !!!

Dissapointed. Had been told be everyone who had been to Mexico to go to Coco Bongos as it was unbelievable and a must see show. Paid for VIP Gold Tickets but had seating to the side so had to continually turn to see the show. The show itself was not what we had been told especially the singing/dancing routines. The best parts of the show were in fact the acrobats and the incredible feats they performed.Nice to say we had been but I would not waste my money and go again.

AWESOME. This is truly a must see. We went as the VIP and the extra is well worth it. The building is kept very clean and well staffed. The place is super crowded, but VIP/Gold will get you a greta spot. The air is often changed with bursts of fresh cool air, so the place never gets stuffy or smelly. The show is awesome!!! It is long, but you do not notice because there is always action and music.

outstanding show beware of staff. The Coco bongo show was amazing. We had VIP Gold membership which was supposed to give personal waiter and personal seating area. however our waiter took a bribe from someone who didn't have all that access and allowed them to sit at our table. The show however was really good, atmosphere great.

Legendary :). This place is hard to describe, it's just a bit crazy - but in a good way. We had the cheapest tickets but were very well looked after by our waiters (even without tipping), the drinks just didn't stop! All the different shows were great and in between the shows the place became a nightclub, it was probably the most fun nightclub i've ever been to :)
