Great Night Out!. The place was rocking, had a great night and would recommend. Went VIP and the drinks flowed all night. Would recommend - party from start to finish.Only annoyance, although the ticket includes your drinks - they still have girls going around trying to sell you shots @ $5.

Expensive for an evening in a nightclub. This is a nightclub essentially that puts on an average show. In between the shows, it is like any nightclub anywhere in the world. If they continue to charge theses prices they need to up their game. Wouldn't go back.
Just all out fun!. Went here for hubby's 50th and what a fabby night! Paid for VIP - well worth it - had a ball! Excellent show!

Wow! Wow! Wow!. I could not believe my eyes in this place. There are not enough words to describe the show. It was a hoot. Very popular and very crowded but a must see experience. You must go. I won't ruin the surprise with details.

Show for a lifetime!. This is the best "mix" of disco club, live-show, where the perfect imitators of Freddie Mercury, Madonna, Jack Sparrow, Spider-man, etc., etc. dance and sing on a stage. Acrobats, movie sketches, hundreds of huge balloons raining from the top, hundreds of lighting sticks, thrown for us to enjoy, to feel as we are part of the great show we witnessed. I would come back there, if I have the chance. The only "disco"-club" I will never forget ;)

Oh What a Night!. This place is off the charts all together! We had such an amazing time! I have tried to describe this place to others and the best I can do is say it is a dance club meets acrobats, meets broadway show and tribute artists/bands all mixed together to create one massive party with confetti and balloons. What. A. Time. We went with the six of us and were right away greeted by Rodrigo who offered to serve us drinks for the night. He was great, we were never without a drink. Towards the end of the night, someone dressed as "The Mask" went around getting pictures taken with groups of people. The cost of these (should you want them) was $20 USD for a framed pic and 12 to have the picture in a folder. We purchased the picture in the folder. Honestly, 12 is really reasonable considering what other areas we visited wanted you to pay for their photos. We paid 70 USD to go on a Friday night (I believe you can go for 65 Sun-Thurs from our resort?). The cost covered our bus transportation (40 minutes from our resort) and our entry fee. Considering what an amazing time Coco Bongo is, it is well worth the money to go and see it. Do not think twice. Just a heads up to all the ladies out there, air blows up from the floor and if you have a very flowy skirt and are on the bar dancing, they will try to expose you. Myself, as well as many others, got caught. So wear a tight skirt or your best undies! :)Have a blast everyone! I will definitely be going back next time!

Awesome Night!!!. A must for your trip if you love to dance and party! We took the VIP tickets and were so lucky to have the most amazing view of the main top stage, we were on the balcony directly opposite it.The shows were great, our waiter never let us go dry there were also a drink (at some points two!) in our hands, we had such a great night!

Great show but not worth the amount we paid!. £104 for a gold ticket on a wednesday with unlimited premium drinks, transport there and back and resevered seating, not bad however when we got there we didn't get our reserved seating but instead we were shoved into the corner with an awful view of the stage. We had to bribe one of the bar staff 50 pesos to move to an empty reserved table! Once we moved to our new seats we had a briliant view of the stage however that wasn't enough to redeem the whole night. The overall performances were brilliant, although we found the Michael Jackson one to be quite boring and disappointing. It was very busy and hot, would go back if I could get better seats!

Because why not a little person Beetlejuice transvestite on a trapeze?. Yeah. Bizarre and insanely fun. We wound up staying til close at 4 am. Very crowded (but it was spring break season). Not that pricey really, compared to what you get. It is some silly stuff, but the talent is insane. Real acrobats and fantastic performers. Especially if you like looking at women's rear ends and overall sensory overload. Somebody Scream!

Probably the dumbest place to go. Got tickets for a decent price (85$cnd) with the open bar, but as soon as you get in you realize all they want is even more money to get any kinda service worth sticking around for. Left after 2 hours once our server felt we wernt tipping enough. I'll stay at the resort and enjoy the awesome shows and tip them my money because they first of all deserve it and will never leave you stranded like this dump does. Like fack if I saved that 85$ for a cool hour show at the resort I would be absoutley plastered by the end and who knows where that would of taken me!
Amazing. The best club ever.I've being in Ibiza... I've being in Mallorca and still.. this is the best club ever.Orgullosamente mexicano

Sensational!. On our way from the airport to the resort we were intrigued with the large billboards advertising Coco Bongo. Travelling with our two adult children we were looking for a unique, memorable travel experience and Coco Bongo proved to be nothing short of amazing. This tour includes round trip transportation from your resort to Playa del Carmen, entrance fee and unlimited drinks. The club has a very distinct presence on the street and it is easy to become engaged in the energy while waiting for the doors to open. As you proceed inside you are soon greeted a glass of tequila which continues to flow freely all night. The show, that starts about 11 pm and ends before 3 am, is comprised of talented performers are able to entertain and amaze with scenes recreated from movies such as Chicago, Moulon Rouge, Spiderman, Batman, Tron, and Beetlejuice. Further they are able to replicate, with precision, the sounds and stage presence of a multitude musicians including Lady Gaga, Rihanna, Pitbull, Michael Jackson, Elvis, Katy Perry, Beyoncé, Usher, LMFAO and Guns and Roses to name a few. The choreography, lighting, party atmosphere, acoustics and raw talent make Coco Bongo a truly memorable experience. 2013

crowded. This bar had great entertainment, and great music for dancing. the only issue I have with this bar is there is way to many people allowed in at once and you have no room to move, sometimes you have to get out of the way for the entertainment and there is just no where to go

Amazing amazing amazing. They know how to do it right! The show is amazing, with dance parties in between to keep the crowd involved and having fun. Bursts of cool air and balloons and confetti add to the fun.Its packed (like crazy shoulder to shoulder) but its definitely part of the fun.I suggest not wearing high heels or expensive shoes as drinks did get spilled.The wait staff were insanely amazing, tip them because they deserve it. They wade through tightly packed bodies with a tray full of drinks like pros, they always find you and you always have a drink in hand.Do not miss out on this adventure, its one for the bucket list!

best show experience I've ever had. probably the best show I've ever been to in my life, starts off slow but at one point i didn't know what the heck was going on, balloons and streamers and performers coming from every where. Spider man fighting a villain, phantom of the opera, it was nuts, a definate must if you are in the area
Best Party Ever. We did the Gold member VIP pass and it was amazing, highly recommended!!! We were treated like royalty. Service was awesome.
Party nite. Fantastic show and evening. Plenty drinks and non stop entertainment. Show starts at 11 pm, go v.i.p. it's worth it just to queue jump .

ABSOLUTE RUBBISH!. Waste of money!Old fashioned!Embarassing!Not entertainment!I dont know who thinks that dressing up as an artist & miming to their songs is a "show". The dancing was not good enough to make us ignore the lousy miming.We paid to go in as VIPs ($150) and 3 out of 5 couldnt see the stage as we had been sat behind a palm tree. And 2 out of 5 couldnt see the floor work due to said palm tree.We were asked several times to squish together until we werent given enough room for all 5 to sit down.We were told that only 125 VIP tickets are sold. This is a complete lie or staff brought their friends into the area and gave them more prominent views.VIP drinks were supposed to be better than those of a standard ticket yet there were no spirits we could stomach.After every 2 or 3 songs on the stage; general nightclub music was played and local girls were encouraged to go on the podium to attempt to dance provocotively.The acrobatic work was well done but nothing compared to other holiday shows and it was so few and far between it didnt make up for the rest of it being so poor.I would not recommend any Brit going over the age of 21.It was by far the worst part of our holiday in Paradise!

You HAVE to go.... On Sunday April 5th (Easter Sunday) we went to coco Bongos. I can not tell you how much fun we had. The show was incredible, people flying in the air, dancing was fantastic. The actual acting was amazing. In between the show the music and environment was a ton of fun. The middle bar was perfect for anyone wanting to get up and dance on it, myself included. We did the gold member which gave us VIP access. To get a good seat, I suggest getting there for 10pm and then just load up on booze. The drinks are terrible for those who are picky drinkers. I tried a few drinks before I just stuck to Coors Light for the rest of the night. The tequila girls are hilarious, they will motor boat you and let you motor boat them, but lets be honest, its a tactic to get your money, I could barely taste the alcohol in the shot. I would definitely go again, i would do the gold member again as well, it gives you the chance to go into a less crowded area and then go downstairs into the crowd whenever you want too. If I go to Playa again, I will DEFINITELY do this again!

Night life quicke during a destination wedding . Went here w the only other single to escape the destination wedding mushiness. This place is super cool and not really a nightclub, more like a show and is mostly standing room only depending on what you buy. I got tix through the resort I stayed at and it was so worth it with it you can drink til your hearts content. They have you start out walking through a long corridor to get in and there are a few stops where you get some free shots of tequila to warm you up! The line is long but moves quickly because they have to get everyone out to get more patrons in before showtime. They played everything Elvis, MJ, Beyoncé, songs from movies like 300 and the Mask... All genres of music and they have dancers/aerial artists/harness performances to go with the theme of each song. In between sets they have girls get up on the center bar and dance around but be WEARY... Girls in dresses at the front of the bar (or if you are chosen to go upstairs to go on stage) there's a gust of wind they blow to get the not so flattering 'Marilyn Monroe' effect ;) so either embrace it or don't go to the front heheA great time all in all just not a nightclub for dancing more like an old school nightclub w entertainment like back in the day! Wish there were more places like this in South Florida. Have fun!!

Brilliant night! . Had the best night! Booked the vip ticket. It's like no club you will ever go in. It's like 85% show and 15% club. Once the show starts it's so much fun before you know it it's 3.30am. Never had an empty drink and the waiter was happy to help. I don't think I would book the standing ticket as there isn't really any room to dance down there and I wouldn't want to be on my feet all the time as it looked so packed. But the show was thoroughly entertaining and even if you weren't drinking you would have a brilliant time!
AMAZING. Best party I've been to ever! Show's were amazing. Non stop fun for a solid 5 hours. The time literally flew by.

Coco Bongo. We had a great time at coco bongo. It was very busy and we did VIP i would recommend VIP as we did for a terrific experience. I have been to many club and many shows and this is well worth the money

Awesome Experience!!!!. My husband and I just got back from Playa Del Carmen and one of our things on our to-do-list was to go to the Coco Bongo. We had heard good and bad things about it, but we wanted to experience it for ourselves. One night as we were walking down quinta avenida we encountered many Coco Bongo promoters, finally we went up to one and asked the price to get in. Thats when he told us that on that day (Wednesday) was ladies night so admission was a bit cheaper than other days. Ladies paid $50usd and men paid $55. Plus he gave us the Express entrance which we didn't have to wait in line, and we got a free shirt. I think general admission was $65. We didn't want to do the VIP admission because we just thought it was too much at $130+ pp. We went back to our resort got ready. We walked over to the COco Bongo and got there at about 10:20, we cut everyone in line and went right in!. walked about 15 steps and we were nicely greeted with a beaded necklace and a mini shot. We walked some more to security, they checked my bag, patted down my husband and walked a little more then another shot. By the time we had actually made it to the main area we had had a couple shots already. ONce there, there was barely anyone there, but as the night went on it got crowded and crowded. Our waiter was named Juan Carlos and he was so attentive to us. He even took us to the mid level on the stairs to get a better view of the show, since the show is up top. I probably would have been a bit more comfortable if I wasn't wearing 4" platforms standing on stairs for 6 hours. But we had a great time!! Juan Carlos kept the drinks coming all night long. My husband tipped him very well at the end of the night for taking care of us. I knocked off one star for two reasons, one because of the bathroom issue. Even though they were very clean, it was a mission to get to the bathrooms. The second reason was because it was extremely crowded, wished they had a little more control of how many people are allowed inside. The bottom level looked like packed sardines. We were on the stairs so we had a lot more room around us than the people down below. Like I mentioned before when either my husband or I had to use the bathroom we literally had to fight our way down. Overall, we had an awesome experience! I would highly recommend it to anyone that wants to go out and have a good time. Would definitely do it all over again!!

Didn't know what to expect - BLOWN AWAY!. Only downside is how crowded it is, but without the crowd the energy wouldn't be as awesome. Buy a bottle (worth it, I promise) so you have your own space, and you'll enjoy it 10x more!

Absolutely fantastic night out..... You couldnt possibly stay anywhere near here and not go one night. Absolutely fantastic show and just so much fun. Dont really want to say too much as part of the experience is you are not sure what's going to come next. It's not just a tourist place either, as the majority of the crowd on the main floor are Mexicans and there are a few sections of great Mexican music. We paid the extra for VIP and got great waiter service all night(he actually asked me not to tip him each round but wait until the end,that's how confident he was about the service.)Everyone we spoke to who went loved it, and even the staff at out hotel go there.Dont miss this.

Excellent, very entertaining. Non-stop entertainment, fantastic acts and singers/dancer. Highly recommend going. Acts were coming from all directions and kept you wondering what was coming next. We did the gold member experience where you were sat at a table and drinks brought to you before you had even finished the last one. Word of warning, they are very strong! Well worth the money.
Fun!. It was expensive but worth it! We really enjoyed our evening. The performers are pretty talented for a bar type environment. The drinks were good! We liked the music choices a lot!!!

An Experience!. Never been to anything like this before and probably won't again! Worth a trip for the experience, but it is very, very busy and squashed! Long queues to get in and they search you, then you have to fight your way through the crowd to get to the upper level. The show was fantastic on the main stage and then watching the 'clubbers' dancing on the bar and podium was a 'sight for sore eyes'. Going to the toilet was an experience, only one person at a time was allowed in and then the attendant checked the cubicle when you came out! There were always girls with bottles of drink walking round and trying to sell you shots!

Wild!. So hard to explain - except you have to experience Congo Bongo. We had a group of 17 and had arranged for transportation from the hotel. $70.00 was our all inclusive price including alcohol however we only received only 2 to 3 drinks because once the club gets full and show starts, good luck getting served. The lady with the margarita shots was around but ofcourse that was $5.00 a shot. Shows were very retro themed but really cool. Very entertaining!

BE AWARE. This is a place you should visit just once AND WITH FRIENDS, I went there twice, first time I went to Coco bongo in Cancun and it was okay (kind of expensive though), same thing in Playa del Carmen, same old show, same crowded place but smaller, and same packed as you can't walk, get drinks or even go to restroom. Staff is rude and they need a good tip to give you drinks or you will wait even more for one. BE AWARE: DON'T GO THERE BY YOURSELF, I went there by myself and got few drinks, after that I remember nothing, I woke up in the street with no belongings NOT EVEN THE BRACELET THEY GAVE ME WHEN GOT INTO THE PLACE. ..So, you can't even prove you were there last night, perfect crime!

Fun! Fun! And more Fun!!!. We decided to splurge a little and got VIP tickets. A little expensive at $150 per person but oh so well worth every penny. Great show! Dancing, drinks, service, ambiance, everything. I don't remember having this much fun in a long time. We danced almost the whole time. After 4.5 hrs which went by fast, we were finally ready to go back to our hotel and retire for the night. Definitely would recommend this to all of my friends. And it's a great show for anyone over 21, no age limit on the high side :). Saw a couple in their 60s enjoying themselves and dancing. Absolutely awesome time. Loved it and would do it again if I am back here any time in the future.

a good time. Very cool place..... tons of people, lots a watered down drinks lol, tons of entertaniment all over the place and you can dance on the bar. I mainly had a good time b/c I was with my two friends. If you are in the area I would def go at least once. I am not gonna go back b/c clubs aren't my thing but it was def a once in a lifetime experience. There were ballons and confetti falling out of the sky constantly. Girls, where a tight dress otherwise you dress will constanly be lifted up by wind especially if you are dancing on the bar. We did take photos there but I wish they gave them to you on a flash drive so I could upload to social media.

Awesome. I did not know what to expect when I booked this night out, I got the surprise of my life when I got there!!! What an experience. The entertainment is fantastic from start to finish. When you purchase your tickets you think it is expensive but when you get there and experience the evening it is worth every penny. We booked the VIP which means you get seated and have a dedicated waiter, we were never left without a drink of our choice and what choices you have - everything and anything. The show and performers are very professional and high energy. Streamers, ticker tape and balloons galore made for a very fun packed evening. The staff have everything running like clock work and look after your every need. Highly recommend this to anyone of any age.

Oldest swingers in town. Great night out, show was brilliant, company excellent, went with Thomsons to VIP area! All drinks included, however the drinks were all watered down apart from the tequila so pace yourself.

Sensory Overoad, but in a good way!. Bought the Gold Member pass which is VIP section through the Sales Rep Hector at Occidental Xcaret. $130 US a pop, which includes all your drinks and transfer to and from the club. (we were suppose to get some t-shirts & beach bags..but that never happened)It's all very fast paced, from the moment you exit your transfer to the walk down the street from the bus depot, it was herding cattle, couples and groups filing down the street to the bar. VIP's have a separate line, which avoids a wait. You are tagged and handed an overly sweet drink in a plastic glass and ushered down a chute through security. Do not bring anything sharp or food like in your purse, not even a headache pill..they will confiscate it! (i actually liked this part-one can never be too safe nowadays!) Once checked you emerge to the centre of the club, there is a central bar that has dancers on it, and the top open and closes all night, during the different routines. We had an elevated section overlooking the main stage. I tipped our server from the get go and once he got organized, the drinks were replaced, sometimes before they were empty! I stuck with straight gin and tonic (tanqueray), can't really mess that up. My partner had tequila, at first they offered him shooters of tequila, but they were not the quality he was used to so he refused them and our server notified him that he would bring premium tequila but it would take 20+ minutes to get..we waited and he kept his promise.(wish I remembered his name) Drinks flowed freely all night.The entertainment was fast paced..sometimes the performances felt like the shifted too fast, you were just feeling a song and the broke into another one, like a remix medley. I loved the balloons bursting out of the ceiling and flowing throughout the vaulted room, at times their was confetti blowing everywhere and sirens ringing to get you hyped. The security level in this place made me feel very comfortable, being in a foreign country you always hesitate to leave your resort with all the horror stories you hear & read. You can feel safe taking a break from your serene environment and shaking it up at Coco Bongo..or if your me..I kept calling it Coco Banga!! Single bathroom in VIP section monitored by a serviette person..never had trouble getting in when I needed to use it. No line ups.Have an open mind, bring some sunglasses for the sites you'd rather not see..(a.k.a the girls with granny panties from the audience dancing on spotlight, only to get a burst of air up their dress!!) Or the sweet little granny they chose to showcase. It's all in good fun.Definitely Recommend~bring another couple..it's nice to share the vibe!

The best night club in the world. I have travelled nearly 40 countries in the world and Coco Bongo is surely the best night club of all by far. Ibiza or Miami don't get even close. You don't only stay there to drink and hope that the more drunk you get the more entertained you feel. No, this club makes actually a full effort to offer a fantastic program throughout the whole night, not just drinks and music (which is also very well chosen), like most clubs do.

So much fun!. If you're looking for a fun night, good entertainment, and good service, this is the place to go! The server kept my drink full, a new one was in hand before I even finished mine. I couldn't believe she remembered what I was drinking. The show was amazing, although certainly more appropriate for younger crowds. It's very busy in there, very loud and I would hate to see an accident happen, as the crowds are just so tight. It's worth going to see at least once.

Bonkers. Mad. Crazy. Surprises round every corner.. I took a group of 30 people for a high end trip to Playa del Carmen. I am VERY happy that we went to this venue. The guests did not want to leave and will never forget this experience! My only worry (when in the venue) was fire exits and access but as the venue has been running for a long time I did not think there would be any issues. We added VIP access last minute – to be honest I would ALWAYS push VIP access for guests. The high entry fee is worth it! I honestly don’t know how they put on the whole production for that entry fee! Uber was our waiter – very attentive. The security staff were great at looking after us. I might book a flight just to come back to this crazy venue sometime...

Awesome clubbing excursion. We went with a group to this, I was learry of going but had a blast! The show was so much fun, we had a large party and had standing room only and had to standing tables. We tipped the waiter a little bit extra and were very well taken care of all night! The atmosphere was amazing, the night flew by!

Not a good show, rude representatives, accident waiting to happen. This was my second trip to Coco Bongo, and I was as disappointed as the first time. To get to Coco Bongo we had to deal with some reps in front of the club who think they are Madonna or the owners of the club, one of them kept trying aggressively to seduce one of my girl friends telling her he could get her in for free and put her on stage for the show and that he would meet her on the back of the stage. When she refused he was rude to all of us and made sure his friends at the door where too making us wait for a long time.After we got in of course the place was packed as you can't even walk, it was a pain to get even one drink if an accident where to happen there a lot of people would be injured. We finally set down in a corner to see the show that is basically dancers very badly choreographed lip singing to classic songs. I guess the recorded sheers and applauses and lots and lost of cheap alcohol make the show look better than it actually is. As I read Coco Bongo does not pay any royalties to any of the artists they mimic so basically they are running a big scam and making money out of other peoples talent, shame on you.

Best show in Playa. We went to coco bongo For my best friend birthday and it's was amazing we got the open bar bracelet and you can have all the drinks and national beer you want. The show it's great. You can get your tickets at the door or book them with the people from your hotel.

not to be missed. we booked this as a trip from a guy on the beach, Bernard, who works for them. he recommended the middle range package to us and I think its the best option.. you get a open bar drinks package with a table and seat between two of you, a bottle of spirit to start with with a choice of mixers, from then on your waiter will bring you drinks all night, as much as you want.. show starts about 10 and wow what a show. dancers, entertainment, music until 3.30am.. Bernard picks you up from hotel, escorts you to the club, takes you past the queues and to your table, introduces you to your waiter and does not leave until you tell him you are satisfied.. if you are in mexico you have to go to coco bongo.

Amazing!!!. OMG what a night!!! This by far was the best night i had in Mexico!!Its not a club, its a show that is put together fantastically with performers who are completely talented!! My jaw must of dropped about 100 times during the night, as ive never witnessed anything like what i was seeing!You had great music, amazing drinks/cocktails and a show that is incredible. I can't recommend enough - and if you going to Cancun or anywhere in Mexico make this a night out for you, you won't be disappointed!!

Not a SHOW, but a CLUB. I was celebrating my birthday and I bought the gold packaged with bottle service for my GF and I. At first we thought this was a good deal but as the night progressed we have noticed that because they have not sold the whole VIP area they were letting regulars into the VIP. for me this was a bit annoying because it quickly became very crowded. Also this was not a night that you will spend sitting and watching the show but its is more like a night club that has special shows every hour or so. The show itself was very great and the dancers were all very talented. Overall we had an amazing night but with we entered with a different perception of it all.

Best night out. Not a lot too dislike here, an amazing night out, from the minute you get in your entertained, the main show starts about 11pm and finishes about 3-30ish non stop entertainment. Best to buy the VIP tickets as your drinks are all included, as much as you can handle

While quite pricey...the sites, sounds and theatrics made this a special event.. Very crowded, and I would definitely recommend paying for the Gold Member sections so you get a seat. But it was a very unique experience with sensory overload...the fours hours went by in a flash. Remember, it's primarily a night club, so expect very loud music and non-stop activity.

Night clubbing for all ages. Had a fantastic night ages from 18 to 88 and every one having an amazing time. Get the Gold Member entry, you get better quality drinks and service and better position if you're a more mature clubbed as you get a seat & table. Get there at least an hour early to get the best positions.

Felt like cattle. We bought VIP tickets and were moved 5 times for other patrons, appeared to be bottle service customers. If we had been informed that we would be moved during the extremely crowded show, physically pushed by staff members with no place to go, we may have either purchased a bottle or passed on the show. We arrived early as instructed by the ticket sales people and we did not wait in line. I think it would be better to show up at the start of the show and have a spot to stand/dance/watch the show without having to move. Of the one hour we stayed, the show was great! Sure wish we hadn't be treated like cattle.

The BEST party of your life. When I heard about Coco Bongo, I was really hesitant. I didn't believe it could be any fun or good, but everyone insistence managed to persuade me...and I am so glad they did!Did I mention I also had the great luck to go there on Spring break? All the music was excellent, not to mention the open bar policy. Simply put, this is probably the best party of my life. It's a great mix of show with non-stop dancing, super secure and I had THE.BEST.TIME.EVER!!!!!!If you are near by, this place is a must, no matter your age. Service, party and security out of this world...everyone should take note of this place!

Crazy, fun place - out of this world. We were bused in from our resort. Didn't pay for vip, which meant you were down in the bottom. Very crowded but by far the most fun. Bar in middle turns part of show so be prepared for that. The big story for us, that in middle of the show my wife became weak from the heat, etc. We moved very quickly back towards the entrance and was stopped by security. Once I explained the situation, they went and got her water and helped her sit down. They came back and checked on us often. The manager assistant came back later and understanding we were from a resort found us a table for her to sit the rest of the night. They also brought us a 6 pack of water with ice and came by the table to ensure everything was ok.By far the best service I have ever gotten in any bar. Canada, USA, or Mexico.......

Super show, super fun and super security. we have been@ coco bongo tu accompany our teen. ALL WAS SUPER! At the end of the day we adults had a lot of fun: show is superb, even if you don't like discos it's worth to go there, music for every age, good coktails, best thing is ti take the VIP package so you can sit down and look at the show from very good position. Service is efficient, waiters smiling and dancing from time to time. We had very good piña coladas and banana mamas Security is impressive, and being with a teen you feel somehow relaxed: no pills (even aspirins) allowed inside the disco physical search at entry for males, bags search at entry for females; inside security going around massive to avoid brawls and drunk people disturbs, we felt pretty sure! Outside cops vigilating the street, where beside Coco Bongo you can find a lot of other discos.

Great Night Expensive But worth It. We recently went here for a night out following recommendation. As a couple we paid for the Gold Member Package it was expensive but worth it we had tabke service and free drinks all night straight t our table served regular and without too much trouble basically free flowing. The show itself started around 11.30pm and went on until around 2pm with mini breaks in-between the various acts. Time flew by the palce itself was jam packed so really pleased we chose to have table service nice and relaxed and at no point did we need to que for a thing. Some acts you want to last longer would be my only complaint but overall we loved it and please we went along yes expensive but worth it. would only say if going as a single ready to mingle no need do gold member but as a couple defo worth it!

COCO CRAZY!. THIS WAS OUT OF THIS WORLD MADNESS!the best night out I will probably ever have!2 things, however - the toilet situation was poor for the amount of people in this place - especially as a gold member. 1 toilet with a staff member waiting in there with you...obviously on the otherside of the toilet door...lol but still, this was frustrating. it was very cramped - stairy and thin walkways, not suitable for disabled. aside from this the shows were amazing, the atmosphere was immense, just a fantastic night out!

Out of this world!!. Absolutely amazing place!! Cannot even describe it, just amazing! Half nightclub, half show. Cant wait to return!!! Music from all eras, most acted out. Lots of balloons and confetti showers!! Couldn't stop dancing. Would recommend Gold Member tickets!!!
Don't miss to visit Coco Bongo!. Coco Bongo is one of the best amusement places in the world and anyone who visits Playa del Carmen must spend one night in this place.

Not worth it, if not going VIP. Not worth the money if not going VIP. You have no where to sit or move. They stick you next to VIP sections, where you have to stand all night. So pretty much stuck in your spot. Dance in your spot. We did move to a different spot, but still not great. They get you a drink first time around, but then good luck getting another one for the night. Only way to visit, is VIP!

Fun experience. I had a great experience at Coco Bongo! Was not sure what to expect, afterwards i was very happy i went. In the beginning it was very crowded, and there was a lot off staff, often in my way, therefore I'm not giving 5 stars. Just dive in and enjoy the experience! I love superman!
Still not in.... Been waiting for nearly 2hrs to get in. Terrible service. No coordination. Entrance too small. Not worth buying tickets before cos you still have to queue!

AWESOOOOOOME!!!!. totally loved this place. Great atmosphere, great shows and great music. The waiters bring loads of shots of tequila round all night for free. The only down side is the alcohol tastes really cheap :/ I would return definitely, as it really is a great night out

This is a one for everybody 18 - 60+. My husband and I went for a night at Coco Bongo last week and it was one of the best nights out we have had ever!!A mix of disco and live show it really was a night out for all ages. The place was packed with people some dancing on the floor, others on the bar, some sitting at tables or standing on the higher levels watching, everybody drinking.The cover charge is not cheap but there is an open bar all night, with the exception of the Tequila Shots, at $5 a go, and the drinks I felt were not watered down at all. I tipped our waiter quite well when he brought our first drinks and he kept us well supplied all night.The show itself was a mixture of tribute type performances including Queen, Michael Jackson and Madonna, to acrobatics on high wires above everyone's heads. The music ranged from Rock & Roll to more recent hits, the show finishes about 2.30am and the bar closes 3.30amThis is one I would really recommend.

A great night out. We had a night out at Coco Bongo in the VIP section. It was great! The show was really entertaining and the music good.I was glad to have a seat as the standing areas looked quite packed, but they were very organised in getting people in and out and I didn't feel unsafe at any point.The toilets were the cleanest I have ever seen in a club, very impressive considering the number of people.

3rd Time - Still a Blast!. Been twice in Cancun. This one is much smaller but the same show. We paid $65 USD through our tour group for VIP on a Monday. Great deal, no lines. Gave us a shot of tequila as we walked in the door! Show was fun as always, a lot of repeats from 5 years ago but a lot of new stuff as well. I was entertained. Great fun and experience. Service was excellent! Time flies when you're there and 3am came really quick. Everyone should try this place just once. Anyone who gives it a bad review doesn't know how to have fun or a good time. Note - we felt very safe here. Especially the ladies. Great security and very clean bathrooms. I last went to the Cancun location in 2009 and did not feel this safe and it was not this clean.

second time at coco bongo. Although the show was good we found it was not as good as the first time we went 16 months ago there were signs of drastic cost cutting ie shows seemed shorter, less large balloons and no glow bracelets and sticks.

An absolute awesome place. The dancers and the music will get you pumped all night long the drinks are strong but great the bus picked us up at paraiso beach and took us right to it we couldn't make it til 4:00 am but a taxi was 35 American back to resort in fifteen minutes
Great night out!!. Great night, we went with VIP pass that our hotel rep sell us and all was excellent, great show great party!!!

Execellent entertainment. I nice club with excellent entertainment. Minus is that I had to pay 10 dollars more in the entrance to be able to get in with my friends :( And we payed the same ticket price but purchaged on different places. My friends bought their tickets in town and I on my hotel, so dont buy tickets in your hotell.

Last to almost closing time. We booked the VIP. It was worth the extra special service.
If you are older, have a limitation that requires you to rest or sit or you don't like the stand up thang, book the VIP. Enjoy the party!

A blast every time!. It was my 3rd time in Coco Bongo and I still enjoy it every time! The best party atmosphere you can have with beautiful shows (and male dancers!!). The all inclusive club-show concept is unique and priceless!

Excellent Entertainment. Good Entertainment, great crowd but a lot of people, the place is over crowded.
Service is good...............................................

fantastic night out. i booked this before i left the uk as i wanted a vip table upstairs. im glad i did as when we got there yes you can buy cheap tickets but the vip ones had gone. we had a great view and were able to dance and if we wanted we could go and dance downstairs. it wasnt over crowded . the one thing been in the vip area was you had your own waiter who were very good as soon as you had finished your drink they saw it and fetched you another drink. not such a good thing for my son as he got very drunk and very quick haha .at the end taxis are all waiting outside

Great show. The show was amazing and very up beat. Great party atmosphere. However, our "vip" table that we booked with the coco bongo rep. at our resort, was terrible. We did not have seats, it was right at the bottom floor by the walk way. We were getting pushed around a lot, people were trying to take our table, we had many drinks spilled on us. I think this would be a great experience if you could be on the second level, out of the way of traffic.

You have to go!. My family and I went to Coco bongo and had an amazing night. At the entrance they provide us a shot of tequilla ans a sweat drink. The music and the dancer are just amazing. There was no sitting area unless you pay the VIP, but it doen't bother us cause we were dancing and signing. The staff were great, my boyfriend was sick in the bar the staff cleaned up everything and were laughting while they were cleaning up. We had a drink all the time in our hand and didn't have to wait for one. Such an amazing night. The only point if improvement would be the bus ride, there is no entertainement at all, the light were close and some music was playing, no alcohol was provided on the bus, we fell asleep....Also it's a long night my boyfriend's father was exhausted, the bus pick us up at 0930 pm and brought us back only at 5 am.

Very rude staff. I have tried to book 16 x VIP tickets for April and have not managed to do this yet. The staff on their 'chat' and booking office are extremely rude. I was asked to supply my card details over the chat and then they disappeared for 35 minutes. I left the chat because I do not like exposing my details if nobody is attending to the chat room. I then later called them and they hung up saying 'closed'. We have heard great things about the show but I wish that their staff were more helpful.
Crazy Place. What an eye opener and great night. Hector from the hotel was great and treated us great all night. A place where all you can drink for $60, bit of a certain

Fun times. Myself and 2 girlfriends went for the show last year. We bought a VIP pass from our resort entertainment team so didn't wait in the long line outside. We had a table right in front of the middle bar. No seats. Pretty much everyone in there stands. It was very very packed. The shows were fun and music great. The waiters and waitresses will come by about every 10-15 minutes or so....if you tip them well!! No tippy, no service! We were told this by our guides as well. Shooter girls will also come by with shots, although I wouldn't advise buying them not knowing how much or what kind of alcohol are in them. Just an FYI if you have a severe latex allergy...they drop hundreds of latex balloons for one of the acts. They do clean them up very quick, but they are balloons and can be deadly for a latex allergic person. We had a great time but probably would not return unless I was bringing someone who hasn't been before. Very pricey but fun.

Great Show. Went VIP well worth the money booked through coco bongo staff by pool in hotel. The music is fantastic got great seats were serve by waiters kept your glass filled at all times The dansers and trappese were fantastic they also had girls from dance floor below picked out to stand dancing under wind machine.They had cameras on audiance and would put your picture on screen.They had the mask going round for you to get your picture taken with him for sovenier in a coco bongo frame well worth the money.Also they had some one trying to balance lots of glasses while walking up the stairs would recommend would go more than once next time for all ages over 18 music for every one no age limit enjoy.
Good club for a night out. You can buy a ticket with wrist band- all inclusive! So you getting cocktails and local drinks for free. Nice show, good music, perfect place for a night out
coco bongo. very well organised felt very welcome from entering until leaving show was brilliant would advise anyone to visit

Avoid; a cheap version of Vegas; scam ridden. We bought tickets from a CoCo bongo rep and paid $300 for what we were told was 2 VIP tickets to include our drinks plus a table. We chose a premium bottle too for our table.The queues are long before the show starts so we arrived a goof half hour early. We avoided the main queue which due to the disorganisation at the door would have taken people over an hour to get in at least and joined the 'VIP queue'. It was the most painful entrance to a club ever, 3 separate queues in an underground tunnel where who pushes hardest gets to the front. If you suffered from claustrophobhia you would have had an attack, it was horrendous. 30 mins later we made it to the front and were taken to a tiny table. A group of 4 had been crammed around a table for 2 twice in our box seat. So we had 10+ people in an area that should have held circa 6.We were given our bottle after another long wait (show had well and truely started) and 5 soft drinks. When we ran out, we were advised to pay for further drinks! After paying $300 we chose not too but were obviously scammed on the VIP all in ticket as there apeared to be about 4 different levels of VIP colour banding. (the offical brouchure shows 1). The manager didnt appear but used the poor waiter to hide behind and give us some 'glass' of soda as a comp. The entertainment was good but not a patch on a vegas show and I'd urge fellow goers to be wary of this money obsessed/less is more venue that could be a health and safety mare!

Best night ever!. Myself and my boyfriend went to Coco Bongos following a recommendation from friends and I'm so pleased we did - it was the funniest and best night of our trip. The show is brilliant and chunked into just the right slots of time so you can still drink and chat. It's definitely worth paying the extra for VIP so you get a seat and your own waiter for the night - the downstairs looked like a bum fight! Also give your waiter a decent tip either at the start or the end of the night, they really look after you. Overall, one of the most memorable nights of all time!
Coco Bongo Night. We watched the show with Spiderman and the Green Goblin and danced the rest of the night away! Went out to other night clubs and had the full Playa experience.

AMAZING but don't forget your ticket. The show and service was unreal! Experience of a lifetime. Don't miss out! But don't forget your tick! We bought through the resort and it was a good price for what we got. Two of the people in the group lost or forgot their ticket. Although their names were on the printed list so they got on the bus fine but they neglected to say it would become an issue when we got to the club. They expected them to pay again even though they knew they had already paid. It took a lot of convincing to let them in but then they were expected to produce their tickets when we got back to the resort at the end of the night, or pay the fee.

2nd visit even more awesome than the 1st.. Paid for the gold experience this time with the rep in the hotel. We had the most amazing night. The show was first class, the area we were allocated was up on one of the balconies and had loads of dancing room. Our server was amazing and kept filling our drinks up. We tipped him at the start of the night following advice from other visitors and the service was first rate. We went two years ago with Thomas cook and the gold package was definitely worth the extra money.

The first thing we booked. A supper night out, Vegas hits Mexico and a party like new years eve. Book the gold seating or its a hell of a long night to stand up. the rest is then up to the bar server.

Fantastic night out. We visited Coco Bongo one evening and had a wonderful time. Lots of different tribute acts who were all excellent, our own waiter keeping is topped up, fantastic dancers and everyone enjoyed themselves. We didn't get back to our hotel til 4.30 am so missed breakfast but it was so worth it!! Highly recommend a visit.
great night out!. what a great night out this was! lots of fun with lots of tribute acts. book VIP through the Thomson rep as you have seats and drinks all night!well worth the money :)

Are you kidding me.??. Their shows are rated very good by people I know who go there. HIGH Quality Vegas type shows. The shows start at 11PM..!!!! Hello, I am in bed by then. I will just read someones reviews..!!

A lot of money for what it was. Before going I was advised to buy 'gold member' which meant you paid extra to receive unlimited drinks and a seat included in your ticket rather than standing. Which I think worked out at about £90 per person, booking with our holiday reps this was our only option anyway. It was a very late night we were picked up from hotel at 9pm, the show started at 11pm and we got back to our hotel at 4 am! The show was brilliant with lots of acrobatics, fancy cabaret and a great atmosphere, however it was PACKED!! The room was crammed full with so many people and we weren't offered many drinks for our money. It was a good show but not worth what we paid for.

NEVER Book this - Avoid at all costs!. We recently stayed at the Paradisius Playa Del Carmen, which I hasten to add was a wonderful experience and I will write a separate review of. However whilst statying there we decided (4 of our party) to book a night out at Coco Bongo show club in Playa Del Carmen, we paid £360 for 4 x VIP tickets to the club, booked direct via one of Coco Bongos reps that visited the hotel. Unfortunately the following day one of our party was taken ill and we were unable to attend the trip. We were shocked to discover that even though a doctor had visited our ill party member and provided medical certification that Coco Bongo refused to refund our money! I am utterly disgusted with the service we received, the IGNORED all emails and correspondence sent by the management at the hotel (who were attempting to get our money back on our behalf) 4 x days of waiting for a reply and STILL no response! All Coco Bongo care about is money, tread VERY carefully people. After reading some other reviews on here it's blantantly obvious that thete are other areas to be aware of too such as customer safely again greed sees to be there No1 priority!

Amazing Show - VIP Worth it - Yovani Best Server!!. My fiancé and I went to Coco Bongo this past weekend. It was both our first time seeing this show and it was an out of this world experience. Its Cirque de Solei meets Broadway meets Club. We bought the VIP service which gave us the ability to skip the regular line, table service, and our own server. Yovani, our server, was on top of his game... He poured our drinks, brought me on stage during the show and help setup a special gift to me from my fiancé, which was a wedding cake with shots on top! We danced the entire time, was in awe by the show and had amazing service... Not much more you can ask for. Ask for Yovani!!!

Fab late night out. What can I say , if you like a dance ,a drink and a show you have to go here when you visit the area. They pick you up direct from your hotel at 22.00 and bring you back at 04.30. There is something for everyone, you can pay general admission and be down on the dance floor , or as we did go for the VIP package which gave us a great seat at high level to watch the show and the waiter gets you another drink before you`ve finished the last one 1 ! Great Night , seams a little expensive when you book, but its worth it.
Amazing. Totally amazing night out!! Highly recommend paying extra to go as a goldmember!! So much entertainment and drinks included!!!

A night out to remember. What a night out. My wife and I went last year and I had promised my family I would take them this year. Opted for the VIP package at $130 each on a Monday night, we were originally sat in a very uncomfortable spot but were moved within 5 minutes. Our waiter/barman was very attentive and I personally could not have drunk much more. He kept us plied with our drinks of choice along with the occasional shot of something that I have no idea what it was but tasted good. We were on bar stools at a bench on the first floor, great view although could have been more comfortable. The other benefit of VIP is that you have a toilet within the area rather than having to get through the masses to the main toilet in the basement area. Both toilets were kept spotless with staff cleaning them all evening.The show itself is difficult to describe being a mixture of cabaret. pantomime, concert and nightclub. The lighting and effects are pretty awesome.Overall even if you do not generally do nightlife this is one night not to be missed.

Amazing show!. It is hard to describe this place, it has music and fabulous impersonators! It is a mostly younger crowd but our 40 something group had a great time. We bought our tickets through our resort, the cost was 70 US dollars person, this includes transportation to and from and drinks. Lol, it may be a good idea to take an afternoon nap as the show doesn't start until midnight and ends at about four am. I wish that I had taken some photos as The Mask was going around posing for pictures. The night we attended they had Elvis, Britney Spears, Guns n Roses impersonators and so many more including Batman fighting some henchmen. We went on a Saturday night and it was extremely crowded, I'm not sure if it would be better on a weeknight or Sunday night. I definitely recommend a visit to Coco Bongo!

Crazy fun-filled evening!. Never-ending entertainment. Excellent service. Class acts & amazing performances. Long line ups to get in make it a must to get there early. The price may seem steep but it includes all the drinks you want.

Nightmare ! Never go premium , vip - trap. Is was a nightmare ! We prepare for a special 20th aniversary night , we had also friends invited, we payd 500 us dollars for all 4 , VIP package : no line, premium drinks, second floor table with good visibility ( all this were guaranteed by DILBERT wich was them employ, he was coming in Paradissus l Perla , daily. He Said also he will come with us to give us the promised table. The truth is they does not care about Premium : he came till entrance And dissapeared , we had a 25 minutes line, no table just a balcony side in 3 rd floor with a 20 cm place for our NOT PREMIUM drinks.We were offered first floor table, no visibility, another balustrade under a stair place, no visibility ! We beg, argued for our promised places, Even saw an empty table in a good place And the reply was : it is Reserved by another clients !  Everybody from our hotel joined our position , we stayed on the balcony like in a train Window! They all left early, like our friends, unhappy ...Money throwed in the wind And hour anniversary spoiled. So people, save your money , do not go VIP is a touristic trap !!!

Great reps! Angel!. We had a group excursion to coco bongo's while in Mexico and Angel made the experience fantastic, taking care to ensure that all of our group were treated well and taken care of. All of our group were of different ages from 18-70 and explaining coco bongo's was difficult until they actually experienced it themselves and they all cannot stop talking about it.Great job Angel!
Great Show. Great show and great music, I highly recommend the VIP tickets to bypass the line and have good time
Nice show. The show was spectacular, we had seats and drinks included (VIP tickets). The standard tickets were standing downstairs and it was very crowded. So go for the VIP ones if possible.
Great show!. The space is slightly tight but the quality of the show pays for it!! Definitely a pace to visit if you want to have a slight glimpse of night life in Mexico

Amazing. This night was the highlight of my latest trip to Mexico. We got bottle service as we were able to get a table for the night and not have to stand all night and could sit when we wanted to take a break from dancing. I would highly recommend getting bottle service as you don't have to go to the bar every time you want a drink and it only cost $100 more than if we got the All Inclusive drinks. Also as we had a table we did not have to wait in line. The night consisted of dance music and shows that included tribute bands, acrobats, and lots of dancing. The show starts at 11 and goes till 3:30. Do yourself a favour and go and enjoy your night here.
Great fun!. Opted for the VIP package which comes with unlimited drinks and second floor access. Worth the extra dollars!

Lots of Energy and Entertainment. Three couples in our 50's went on a Tues. night and it was a lot of fun. It starts a little late (11:30 p.m.) for us old folks and doesn't end until 3:30 a.m. But it's loud, and a lot of fun! They had entertainers dressed like popular singers who lip sync to the songs. There is confetti flying, balloons falling and girls dancing on the bar. They do push the drinks, and are always wanting to take picture to sell to ya, but we didn't buy into all that and it was fine. All in all we had a great time and would recommend going, at least once.

Where do I start?. Didn't know what to expect but what a great place. It's non stop entertainment & you never know what's going to be happening next ~ tribute bands, on screen music videos, dancing by the bar staff, acrobats falling from the ceiling, lots of balloons & ticker tape. We had the VIP area which was sold to us as a seated area at the same level as the stage. What we got was an area like a small balcony where we would have all struggled to sit as the only seats was a padded type bench seat. Who wants to sit anyway when you can't not dance. Drink is free flowing and included in the price. I wouldn't advise you go if you freak out in confined places as it's rammed and also you need to be able bodied, the stairs to the VIP area is steep & a struggle to get up & down as there are so many people. Also there are different levels, some with quite a deep step.If you are staying in the area you can't miss it as it's a fantastic night out and not just for the youngsters.
fantastic. Booked it through tomsons had VIP access great view premium drinks the show , disco is mind blowing got to say that's the best I have been to

Originally misleading, but a great night in the end. . My group of 6 bought tickets from our Air Canada rep for $70 USD. He claimed we were getting the exact same service that the Coco Bongo reps would give us. We were told free drinks on the bus ride there and VIP service in the club. The bus driver provided corona beers...for a $3 USD fee...and did not even drop us off at the club. He took us to a bus terminal nearby and we had to walk the rest of the way and find the entrance ourselves. When we arrived, we saw 2 lines. The shorter one was for VIP line bypass...we stood in that line but were told we did not have the right ticket. We asked the Coco Bongo staff and were told that for an extra $10 USD, we could bypass the longer line. We all felt like this woman was making it seem like our entrance to the club may occur in a couple of hours, not by the 11:30 show start time that we had purchased the ticket for. We were then told of an additional $33 USD pp for a table, and she made it seem like we would not be able to see anything otherwise. We chose to wait in the longer line and we got in after about 30 minutes and saw the entire show. We also had decent seats in the end with good service. One of our group members had an issue in the restroom. Someone tried to open the door on him, and when he closed it shut, and finished, he was met by security and was accused of doing drugs inside the stall. Security patted him down, searched his person and searched the trash before they let him go. Despite these poor experiences, we all really enjoyed the show. We recommend buying the tickets directly from the Coco Bongo staff. Do not bother with your travel rep.

An experience!. Great fun, very random but worth the experience. We got a VIP ticket so we could have a seat and a waiter and a good view of the stage. It is a bit pricey to get in but I suppose all drinks are included and its worth it for the laughs.Remember waiters work for a tip!!

Great night out!!. Coco Bongo Playa del Carmen is a super fun place. You need to get the VIP gold menber tickets to actually enjoy the place, shorter line to get in, private place up in the balcony at stage level and drink waiter that made sure we never had an empty glass. You don't need to get bottle service for this.The music was amazing, the shows were nicely put, and the drinks were very good. We stayed until 3am when the show finished and had a blast.We definitely be back.

Oh what a night!. Visited with my husband. We paid the extra for the gold tickets and it was definitely worth it. If you can get up on a balcony you can get a good view and down on the bottom floor some people will be able to see the stage but not everyone. The place is packed full of people so getting to the bar could take a while if you were looking to get drunk. With the gold ticket we were escorted to a seat where we were right next to the stage where we had a perfect view and a member of staff kept going to get our drinks and ensured we never had an empty glass. We were drinking premium drinks all night long and there is no restriction on how many you can have. We weren't out to get drunk so we weren't necking our drinks but had about 15 drinks each so we definitely drank the moneys worth we paid extra for and we didn't have to get up once! The show was brilliant and so much fun. Carnage springs to mind when it is in full swing. Lots to watch and fun to sing along to. Get me back to another night out at Coco Bongo!

Coco Bongo's another must do. Go VIP worth the extra for a seat and includes free drinks which they keep you well topped up with bottles of larger which came in two's and when you were half way through your second another two appeared from our own waiter with out asking, superb service and show Well done Coco's !!!!

Deceived. We were approached at our resort by a friendly girl selling tickets to Coco Bongo.She deceived us by saying it was as good or better than Vegas shows. We were going to get VIP treatment, have our own table and open bar. I'll try to make this short. Dropped off three blocks from show on some side street at 11 pm. show starts at 11:30. Told to meet shuttle at same spot at 3:30 am. Get to show and the line is about a mile long! Get in building still in a cramped line of people and go through a tight hallway. Like being in a cave. The whole time it was wall to wall people. Serious fire hazard! Didn't get a seat or table. Show was a joke. If you are going to lip sync then know the words! Some of the acrobatics were ok. Couldn't handle the pushing and shoving until 3:30 so we left at 1. Didn't really feel safe. Maybe their other venues have better accommodations. No shuttle because we left early. Cab ride price outrageous. It was an over priced bad adventure, but we'll look back on it and have a laugh.

WOW, WOW, WOW! AMAZING!. My husband and I and our two friends went to Mexico a week ago and a friend of mine recommended going to see the live show and disco 'Coco Bongo'! And boy were we AMAZED! It's truly an unforgettable experience and everyone should experience it at least once in their lifetime! There were people of all ages there, and fun and drinks were the highlight of the party! We paid $65- USD each (booked through a rep from our resort) which included transportation to and from the bar (930pm to 350pm), unlimited drinks, the entry fee and a standing area that was all our own! We also had our own waiter who was quick and came around often for our drink orders. Thank you Coco Bongo for a truly OUTSTANDING performance and a truly AMAZING experience that we'll never forget! We LOVED every minute of it! Cheers!
Very very cool!. Nice place/environment, nice music (no eletronic music :-D ), nice girls... kind of expensive but i'll go there many more times ;)
Amazing Show. Like nothing anywhere else.. Great night out. A show like no other in the world. Now in Playa Del Carmen. Just as good as Cancun. Amazing. Don't think about it, just book it!!

awesome!!!. super entertaining (shows / music / dancing)
drinks were very very expensive.
over all, an amazing experience and well worth money.
I loved it

overpriced. The stage show was good, but we were crammed in like sardines in a can. This overcrowding was uncomfortable and although we paid VIP prices our experience was not so good. We had limited view, and not all drinks were available unless we paid extra! It was overpriced for what we got.....won't ever go again.

A must go (once is enough though). Been here with friends in December '14. We started of the night here with some drinks. It's amazing, like walking into a theatre seeing amazing shows! It's a bit crowded though, read: don't go in if your claustrophobic. The service is a bit slow, I think because it's so busy and maybe not enough staff. We thought it might be better having a table, but it's still questionable.. They need to come up with a better service. And to be honest, once you been there no need to do it for a 2nd time during your holiday - same shows.

Bongo Bongo. Definitely get the gold package. The main queue is mental. It goes around the block. The show is Vegas meets Glam Rock and a twist of Cirque de Soleil. Ignore the bad reviews on TA. There is no pleasing some people. I'm 46 and my wife is mid 30's. We had a great night. If in town - make the effort. P.

Amazing Show. Amazing place incredable show . Wow. Me and my husband loved it . Yes its true too many people but at the VIP aria up there is perfect not much people there and the show is front of you. We payed $70 pp which was a regular ticket and Francisco from Iberostar Paraiso Maya (we bought the ticket from him) sent us up to the VIP aria , otherwise VIP cost $130 pp We 've had our own waiter who always bringing the drinks for us which was all inclusive :-) we didnt even have to move anywhere . The show was super good and fun. Thanks to him we had an excelent time up there. Down there its really crauded unable to move . Dont stay there if it's possible .

Do it!. This is simply one of those things that you have to do.We went and spent the extra money for gold membership and has great seats. The show was entertaining, we danced and laughed and had a great time. The drinks were a bit watered down which was the only disappointment!Word of warning: If you dance on the centre podium be prepared for everyone to see your bottom before hey let you leave!

A Crazy Fantastic Night-Fabulous. Do not miss this venue. It is a mix between Cirque Du Soleil, Las Vegas, A West End Show and a Great Disco. Well produced show and the most amazing atmosphere you could ever experience. Show time starts at 11pm and finished at 3am. Not cheap but worth every penny. We took a VIP ticket where you get a table and seat. The alternative is to stand. 3 floors packed with revellers.The show is so varied and mixes with the disco.

Great show , too many people. Before going to the show make sure you have good life insurance. The show itself is great and is super fun, i have been before when there was less people. Now they got so money hungry they pack it to the point of you being unable to move and if you are prone to panic attacks, dont bother coming. Huge fire hazard. At some point there were so many people you couldn't even get to the bar. We stayed 30min and left as we couldn't see anything , dance or breath for that matter. Almost 100$ per ticket was wasted.
Like no other place. WOW. this place is amazing, it begins at about 11pm. But you will not want to leave until its all over ! Such a fun environment with top notch service

Love this place. Words cannot describe this place nothing like I have ever seen before defo a do if you visit Mexico even if your not a fan on late nights the energy of the whole place will keep you going

Its a must do but its very Cabaret!. Its a good night out but ours was spoiled by a very daft girl drinking far too much and being carted out by ambulance!The show is good but as with all these things it is the performers who make it, the dancing and showmanship is excellent although it is all mimed and staged.It is very much an evening of 'it is what you make of it' and we sang and danced and drank and had a great evening and if you go there with that mentality and enjoy it for what it is then you will thoroughly enjoy it.If you go thinking 'it is too crowded', I can't get a drink, I can't see anything etc etc, you will hate it. So go with the right mindset and you'll have a great time!
Incredible. It was amazing, the whole time I was mesmerized. We did VIP and it was worth every penny, the show is a must see

Awesome show/ Needs bigger venue & emergency exit plan. I totally agree with all positive comments :D.But place is too small for 3000 p+ Even though we had VIP still had to make a line inside the club, it was super crammed which made it a nightmare going to the toilet.and in an event if an emergency.... well it would be a disaster as is design like a rabbit warren.A word to the owners: your business is awesome and obviously making lots of money, now is time to invest in a bigger place and safety for your guests.Thanks for a great night!

Its ok and cool but.... First of all I have to start by saying that Alejandro who sales the tickets are one of the nicest in Playa del carmen We stayed at one of the hotels were Alejandro sold tickets on the beach. I think our biggest mistake was to go here on New years eve :(We paid 7500 Me pesos for VIP tickets for 2 people. And it was NOT worth the money. We got a small table with 2 seats were you barley could sitt (and I am not a fat person). It was so crowded and we couldn't move because people were standing so close to us so it was impossible to move or go to the bathroom. And when I pay for VIP I want VIP :( .The drinks are ok but on a place like this I want really good drinks even though the are included. And on the VIP I dont think that the girls should go around with a wisselpipe try to sell shot. Anoying The show is good , but they stop the show for playing music for 20 minutes and then the show starts again. So , if you go another day then NYE and dont pay 7500 pesos for the VIP as I did then you probably will get a nice experiense

Great show. I went to Coco Bongo on a saturday as this is the day with most guests. I enjoyed the show which was a combination of theatre/musical and pauses with party music, dancers and special effects.

fantastic night. wow we wasn't really expecting this. when we booked it we actually thought it was a day trip lol,we realised it was a night club on the actual day which slightly worried us as we are in our forties,but let me tell you don't let that put you off as what a very very entertaing night we had,from the moment we walked in it was entertainment non stop,and just wouldn't stop putting drinks in your hand,the dancers were fantastic and the show is very las vegas,we eventually managed to drag our selves out at 3am very merry and still buzzing,will definatley go again next time we go to mexico

Bongo's. Must visit, we have now been 6 times both at cancun and playa both are identical. Pay the extra and go gold. You get a seat and bottled beers. The show is non stop from the word go, time passes so fast. The place has been packed every time we have been another reason to go gold. It's a bit of a squeeze in the pit. Never heard anyone have a bad word to say. Well worth the cost

Since when was miming considered entertaining. Loads of people recommended this place to my wife and I prior to travelling wish they had not bothered as I fail to see why a load off talentless fakes miming to songs made famous by people with real talent is entertain or am I missing the point, Go there, get hammered wake up next day thinking you had great time when in reality the show is rubbish and your headache is the copious alcohol you consumed and the confetti cannon,
For X-Factor lovers. If you watch X factor or Britain's got talent then you will enjoy it. Otherwise, you'll find it tacky, cheap, loud and overpriced

Great night out!. We had heard of the one in Cancun from a Mexican friend, so we decided to try this one as it was on our doorstep. Glad we did, it was so much fun! A party atmosphere from the start. We took the AI package which gave us premium drinks and cocktails, plus our area had seating and a table, which we are so glad we went for as downstairs was packed! The show was great, very impressive. Drinks flowed, with our waiter never leaving us without one. At the end of the show the AI drinks ended however our waiter (after previously giving him a large tip!) brought us over another few rounds each before we went downstairs to dance for a couple of hours before going home. Great night out, a shame the drinks package ended so soon after the show, this was not explained to us when booking this through our hotel, but a great night out none the less.
fantastik. you can past this. one the best show i ever saw. go go go don't hesited. you have to see this .i return in any time

Absolutely loved it!. The four ladies (37-44) from our holiday group of 11 visited on the Saturday night in the middle of our holiday. We bought gold member tickets from our Thomson rep at the hotel for $145 each which included transport there and back, entrance, seats in VIP section, all drinks served with waiter service. It's pricey but by the end of the night we didn't feel short changed at all!I visited the one in a Cancun with my Husband about 6 years ago and remember having a fantastic night, despite my husband not really liking nightclubs ... he loved every minute. I couldn't remember quite how amazing it was, but this club in Playa certainly did not disappoint! I think it is smaller than the one in Cancun but the atmosphere is fantastic. From the start of the show (about 11:30) it was none stop entertainment until around 3am. We had been worried about staying up so late as we had been going to bed quite early on holiday, but we needn't have as time seemed to fly right past. We were seated on the second tier, under the stairs and just behind the camera man. At first we felt a little out of the way, but we had a great view of the show and basically had our own little dance area, right at the side of the bar and the waiter 'Williams' really looked after us and made sure we had plenty to drink. We had been warned before hand about the ladies selling tequila shots and not to take drinks from them as they try and rip you off so we just said no thanks each time they came around. We enjoyed premium brand drinks so I do feel we had value for money. As they advertise, you would pay a lot more for a show in Vegas! The toilets were quite easy to get to from where we were and rarely had to queue. The ladies working in there were really friendly and of course they are after a tip, but I have no problem in tipping good, pleasant service whatever that may be so did give a little at the end of the night.Not everyone stays right to the end so around 2:30 we were taken out from our little hideaway under the stairs and onto a side platform where other people had left and we did feel a bit more included in the party! I really can't fault this place, from the little blasts of confetti, long balloons and at one point we went and danced around the edge of the stage/bar which added to the experience. A fantastic night, one to be remembered. I would not hesitate in recommending a visit, even if clubs are not really your scene, it's like something you have never experienced before!

Absolutelute a must see for adults.. We had a Blast here. the entertainment was great. The wait staff was always there. A very late show, but worth it. If you are young, you probably will like the floor experience, but as older guests we prefer the VIP section along the side and up even with the stage. you can them look down at all the partiers dancing on the floor.

Amazing, Amazing. If you go to Playa del Carmen, you have to stop and go to Coco Bongo, even if you don't like night life, this is a must do. The show is amazing, specially Beetlejuice, the music is great. Buy the tickets to the guys outside the club, you can get great deals with them, also if you are going to buy the dancefloor ticket be aware that you won't have a preference seat, but you will have open bar, try to make friends with one of the waiters so they keep bringing you your drinks so you don't have to wait long or go to the bar.Amazing experience :D
Awesome. A show well worth going to see, the dancers never stopped.All the themes was done very well, I loved the MASK theme the best.

Loved, loved, loved it!!!. Fantastic night, absolutely loved it, didn't want it to end and would go back in a minute, best nightclub/venue I have been too (and I've been to lots). Our server was absolutely fantastic . Nothing to dislike

Crazy Night!. My Husband and i decided to give Coco bongo a try whilst on ur honeymoon! Definitely upgrade to Gold tickets that you have seats and better view of the stage. This is also a very late night we didn't get in till 4 in the morning, we had transport when we booked with Thomson. They are very clear that if you aren't there within 10 minutes of the allotted tie to leave to go back then they go without you. Which was fine for us, but if you are drunk it could be something thats a problem. Drinks flow all inclusive all night, however shot girls will come round trying to sell you tequila and its not the nice stuff and costs a couple of dollars... 40 pesos. I wouldn't bother. As they bring round nicer shots for free. Also if you are a woman, they will take you onto the stage and when you are up there they may try and make you dance on the podium at the front. Fab night though - didn't feel so hot in the morning though haha!

Crazy place, in a good way. the show is a must see, but because it's bar open, the will bring you drink at every 5 minutes. Don't bring your GoPro or a cam corder because you will have to leave them at the entrance.....you can film with your phone or camera(Kodak). wear confortable shoes !

Xmas Eve at Coco Bongo. Visited with my family of 4 and we paid for the VIP experience ($125 per person).We were upstairs sitting around a ledge on stools and were a bit disappointed we weren't given a table for that money. The show was incredible and lasted for around 4 hours so you definitely get your money's worth! It started a bit late around 11.30pm and didn't finish til 3am. Drinks are included in the VIP package but the waiter kept bringing us the same drinks instead of asking if we wanted something different.Would recommend this but now that I have been, I wouldn't pay to go again as it was quite expensive.
Nightlife Show. Show is totally different than Coco Bongo Cancun. The is not comparison with the two places Cancun Coco Bongo much much better

Group of 10. We all wanted to visit here before we left the UK for Mexico. We booked through the Coco Bongo staff who came to our hotel. He was very helpful and a great guy. We booked the reserved seats on an all inclusive ticket, which gave the 10 of us 3 bottles of spirit plus mixers etc. The bar was free up to 2am for us as well. My first impression of the club when entering was that it was small. Our area was 2 small tables with table cloths on with stepped seating behind. We all managed to get into our area. We paid $121 each for the seats and all inclusive plus our coach travel there and back.We had a great night, the place is amazing and so glad we went to experience it, some of our party ended up on stage with the acts. It is definitely worth a visit if you are staying near here. We all had a good night.
