greatest night.. best night of our holiday, in one word,, crazy !! but in a great way. get the golden ticket, that way you will get a good seat and free drinks all night, if your not happy with your seat, ask to speek to the english guy, he will move mountains to make you happy. something for everyone, and all ages.

Bonkers, barmy, MUST GO!!. This place is mad! Absolutely blew me away, has Jim Carey written all over it! Great party atmosphere, ice blasts from the ceiling, balloons, confetti, trapeze acts above your head, dancers, acts on stage, all going on at once! Loved it!

Not for us.... First of all, I will say that we're not into clubbing so it may be that we were setting ourselves up for a fail here - however, we booked tickets after 'friends' (lol) back home told us we 'must do it' and we'd love it. Sad to say, they were wrong! We honestly went determined to enjoy ourselves so it wasn't like we had a negative view from the outset. We enjoyed the first couple of acrobatic shows, but it all went downhill from there.Waiter service wasn't too bad at first, until the large group in front of us arrived and obviously gave him a huge tip. After that, we were an afterthought! Now, we don't object to tipping (and in fact we did so) but when tickets are upwards of £85 each you expect good service regardless. Didn't rate the drinks either.One toilet for all 'VIP' guests resulting in very long queues for the ladies. People constantly trying to sell you shots, photographs etc.A handful of the shows were good, particularly the acrobatic ones (4/5 in total, they only last a few minutes each) - the rest were awful! Cannot believe some people liken the quality of the acts to Las Vegas - people dressed up as Britney Spears and Freddie Mercury and miming?! Seriously lol? Over the course of the night, gaps between the shows got longer and we were forced to watch drunk people dancing around on the bar making idiots of themselves instead. Either that, or the 'roaming' camera feed on the big screen - which only seemed to roam as far as the huge bosom of an attractive woman sitting nearby. Even my husband had seen enough lol. Occasionally, the wind machine would blow somebody's skirt up on the bar and a huge cheer would ensue. Great - well worth our £175 then.I really don't want to sound like a party pooper, but we wished we'd saved our money and spent it in the local bars instead. I can only assume some people just get over excited about being let out of their all-inclusives for the night! We've had some fab nights out since we've been here (staying self-catering in a condo) and it was a huge let down in comparison.I know we're only speaking for ourselves and lots of people love it, but my advice to all would be spend the money on a night out on or around 5th Avenue instead. Some great bars with good music and atmosphere, better drinks and fresh air - some if which are on the beach! I suppose what I'm trying to get at is don't be pressured into going because other people say you'll like it. If if sounds like the kind of thing you wouldn't normally enjoy, you probably won't!
Crazy. this is one mother of a crazy night. Absolutely loved it. we paid a bit extra for the gold member tickets well worth it

Vegas worthy. My daughter saw an ad at the airport coming into Mexico and asked if we could go. I am so happy she did the night was amazing. It was entertainment from the minute I walked in til 3:30 am. We were all tired by the time our shuttle picked us up at 10:40 pm, wondering how we were going to stay awake til 4am. It was not a problem at all the place was full of energy and amazing shows one after the other. we paid $65.00 for the night and that included all our drinks. I tipped my waiter 200.00 pesos at the beginning of the night and he sure didnt. When my daughter and I were dancing on the bar, he came and found us and handed us drinks up there too. Great time, great show, great service!

Great Night out. So coco bongo is awesome - me and my boyfriend are both 24 - have the VIP with is worth it to not queue and you also get better seats to watch the shows that happen every 15 mins or so, so there is always something to be watching or doing as well as dancing around the place!!With VIP as well we had our own waiter who was amazing - dont think i ever had a an empty glass in front of me and when ever you had to go the the bathroom etc they escorted you to where you needed to beLove it here best night out in a while

Absolutley amazing!! have to go V.I.P. Me and my boyfriend bought tickets from the coco bongo rep in the hotel $125 for V.I.P and it is well worth it! with waiter service, table, seats and a smaller queue. The show itself was amazing I've never seen nothing like it! We went on a Wednesday night it was still extremely busy though! I would come back to Coco Bongos and maybe try the Cancun one!

Not the same from when I was younger. I went to coco bongo in Cancun when I was in my late teens and early 20s and I LOVED it it is a really cool idea and fun place to go. I went last trip now being in my early 30s and it was not as fun as it used to be. I felt it was just standing for hours watching videos waiting for the next act to come on. it was packed to crowded for my liking and I just felt squished in. I was on the other side of where the bathrooms are so I didn't even thnk about trying to battle my way through to lose my standing spot. I think they have a good show me personally I think I have outgrown this particular type of excursion

Best night ever.. Coco Bongo rep sold us tickets in the hotel so travelled with friends as part of a group of 15 people from the hotel. Taken by minibus for the short distance to Playa Del Carmen bus station.Arrived just after 10pm and was fairly close to the front of the queue. Doors opened at 10.30pm and we were ushered in to an area opposite a bar in the middle on a couple of steps around a table We were introduced to our server for the night who took our drinks orders although we were already given a shot of tequilla and a vodka on the way in. Coco Bongo dancers already on the bar with a count down to showtime on a screen. Show that followed was a spectacle of musical theatre, acrobatics, dancing, amazing tunes. Our server ensured that we never had an empty glass and we tipped him approximtely $15 dollars. It was busy but not rammed that you could not move. We had opted to go on a Thursday night. All in all one of the best nights out that I have ever had and great value for money thinking about the show and the drinks.

BEST PARTY NIGHTCLUB & SHOW YOU WILL GO TO IN ONE NIGHT. Words fail me with this one - Went VIP - so waited on all night and all your drinks included Music amazing - show WOW !!! Don't care if you are 18 0r 80 if you are in Mexico you have to go to Coco Bongo - been home now two weeks and still talking about it. The show includes The Mask Madonna Elvis Freddie Mercury Beetlejuice Tron Spiderman - Words cannot explain this - JUST DO IT !

So much fun we went twice. Spent a week in the Riviera Maya area and had this club recommended to us at our hotel. To describe it later in the week my best thought was it's like a Vegas show on steroids. We enjoyed it so much that we returned on Saturday night before flying out early Sunday morning. If you get a chance don't miss this attraction!!!!!
Coco Bongo!. Best club in town, night was fantastic... regular line very crowded, go for the VIP packages with the drinks included worth the extra $$$.

A must visit. As soon as you walk in you know you're in for a night to remember. It's a nightclub/show something's always going on,you could be dancing at the bar and then batman flys above you onto the stage for a fight. It's brilliant. Iv never been anywhere like this. We was lucky enough to be ask to go on stage and dance with the show girls. I was well out my comfort zone but it made my night. The best night of my holiday a must visit.

Fab night!. My boyfriend and I went to coco bongo on 16th September. We'd had to book a week in advance as apparently the week before was fully booked. Anyhoo, we booked through our hotel and paid for the VIPpackage as we'd been told by a couple of people who's been previously that if you get a standard ticket, you stand all night and can barely move as it'd be overcrowded. When booking, we were told that as soon as we arrive, we would be able to walk straight in, no queuing. Admittedly it wasn't as long as the standard ticket queue but when we arrived, we still had to queue for 20 mins with the VIP ticket holders. We were searched by security as we entered and they removed items from my handbag which I was told id need to collect when we left. We were then escorted to the top floor and were sat on stools overlooking the stage and main floor area. At this point, there was still an hour to opening at 11pm and the stools are VERY close together. Once all the VIP's were in, standard ticket holders were allowed in to stand in the main area. Looking over, it wasn't as crowded as I'd been told it would be, but it was out of season when we went so I guess this may account for that. Our waiter was very attentive. When my glass was nearly empty, I'd have another drink in front of me before I'd even asked! I'd definitely recommend tipping your waiter well... You'll get good seats and will be looked after all night! The show itsself is very good but it did feel quite spaced out whilst the dancers changed Into different outfits. In between 'acts', music is played and customers are invited to dance on the bar in the middle of the floor or on the podium. These breaks could last up to 20 minutes or more though and as we were there for the show, not a nightclub, it felt like it dragged on a little longer than it needed to at times. Overall, the whole thing was fantastic! The dancers and outfits were great, as was the atmosphere. We left at 1.30am as apposed to the finish at 3.30am as my other half wasn't feeling well and both of us were still struggling with jet lag but we've both said if we go back to Mexico, we'll be returning to Coco Bongo :)
Coco Bongo. Go for the VIP package well worth the extra money and all drinks are included the whole night and entertainment is brilliant well worth a visit

gold member booking not gold member service. the night overall was fantastic but not what we expected or were told we would have!! we booked through a rep in the hotel lobby, paid about $89 each and we were told that we would have a private booth, waiter service/bar and toilet. when we arrived we were shown to a tiny table at the right wing of the stage, tiny and cramped in, waiter looked stressed and got annoyed wth us when he took our drinks order wrong and there was one single 'private' toilet for about 200 other cramped 'gold members'.

Great night out. we went to Coco Bongos with a gold member ticket so we had a great view of the show and free drinks all night, the whole experience was awesome. the only complaint is there was only one toilet so there were quite a few queues.

Carlos cruz fue un exellente capitan!!!!!!!. Yoh eh viajdo todo el mundo y nunca tuve un mejor servicio como carlos me a dado a mi y mi familia. I had a little issue with a customer that had a little too much to drink. He work so hard to get me away from him l. I apreaciate that so much for me and my family. Thanks to him we had the time of our lives !!! Thanks carlos

Amazing night out!!!. We had previously been to coco bongo in cancun and absolutely loved it. I didnt think i was gonna enjoy the one in pdc as much coz its smaller. How wrong i was!!. We were gold vip and we had excellent seats with the stage on the left and a bar at the right. There were 11 of us, family and friends aged from 20 to 53 and we all had a brilliant night!! Trapeze acts were really professional and the acts, elvis, freddie mercury, michael jackson, lmao, bon jovi and so many others were all really good fun. Drinks were nice , you could taste the alcoholl but not so much that you couldnt enjoy them and we had a great view of everything that was going on. When the balloons are let out, the place goes mad!!. It was jampacked but that just made the whole atmosphere even better. We were next to the smoking area where you go outside on the balcony which was a good idea as the non smokers in our group didnt have to smell it lol. One tip.... They check your bag on the way in ladies and if you have liquids ie perfume, deodorant etc, they will take it from you and put it away in a locker or something, you sign for it then collect it on your way out, no problem.Men are asked to leave their guns at the door lol. Will definitely go back. Loved it :-)

Brill night out.... A must!!. While on holiday in Mexico we had the chance to go to the Coco Bongo nightclub and we were not disappointed at all. To start we purchased our tickets through our tour operator in the UK (Thomson) for a reasonable price about £70 each this was for the VIP package and got us into the club for the full night and included all our drinks. There was no transport provided for us so a taxi from our hotel cost about 90 pesos which was not much when converted. We were told that if you wanted good seats in the VIP section then you should go early which is what we did and we arrived at about 2200 hours, we were almost at the front of the queue, the doors opened about 2230 hours with the show starting about 2300 ish.Once inside the VIP customers are ushered in through your own entrance, and then shown to your seats, we were then introduced to our server who explained that he would be looking after us all night and true to his word we never went without a drink, as this was part of the all inclusive package.This club is huge and very high but also extremely deceiving as it opens up to become a lot bigger once the show starts.When the show started all I can say is WOW it was brill with a huge variety of acts and the performers all looking like the people they are portraying. For about 4 hours we had non stop entertainment.This is well worth a visit when in Playacar Mexico.I will say that at your hotels there will be the Coco Bongo reps there and there is a chance that you will be able to get the tickets cheaper through them bear that in mind before booking as they can give a few better discounts too, this was something that I did not know about when we booked this in the UK.Your server at the table who looks after you will expect a tip and this should normally be collected by them at the end of the night before you got home.Don't worry about getting a taxi back to your hotel at the end of the night there are police and official taxi marshall's outside the club who look after you just make sure you get in a registered taxi. Just remember that it will be a long night so don't expect to be back to your hotel until at least 0500 in the morning.For the guys who are reading this who are from the UK and who are traveling with Thomson they offer a Bar Crawl evening which includes Coco Bongo please bear in mind that if you do this you will not get the full experience of Coco Bongo and you will be removed from the club at 0100 when the bar crawl ends, a couple of friends did this and missed out on the best parts of the evening in the club.This is a MUST if you do anything then this should be on your list when in Mexico.

For the Kids. 40% Great Acts 60% music keeping the party going, Average age 25, Paper cannons, Balloon cannons, dry ice going off every 5 min`s and the booze well errm it`s all inclusive but only what they want to give you you ask for something different and you won`t get it unless you maybe tip them first

Good night out. This was my 2nd visit to coco bongos after previously being to the cancun one. This one was a lot smaller than the cancun one. We booked through the Coco Bongo rep at our hotel and we booked VIP as last time it was hard standing packed like sardines for 5 hrs. We had our own separate line to get in which went in quickly and were taken to our seats which were facing the main stage which was great but packed very tightly but we couldn't move the seats as they were right next to the stairs so one wee move and my husband would have been down them. My aunties view of the main bar where some of the show was, was blocked by a pillar. Our seats were right next to the toilet and the bar so not bad. The server was very quick with our drinks and put a fresh one down as soon as you were finished. The show itself was very good and very entertaining the music was brill and catered to all ages overall a very good fun night, just hard getting in at 4am and being up at 8am with a 4yr old lol.

VIP which isn't that VIP. When we arrived in the VIP section I was incredibly disappointed. There was a row of people already sat atherosclerosis of the balcony leaving us to sit at the back with a limited view . Having paid double what a normal ticket would be I was a little annoyed. As the show was about to start more people filtered in to our VIP section which left it very crowded , it ended up at the bench we was sat on, the lads had to sit up up with their legs open and the women to sit I between them. Which wasn't very comfortable at all. We went with thomsons on the Thursday night so we had transport to and from our hotel. The service from our server was great and we didn't tip him till the end of the night. I didn't give a lot but he was very grateful of it. We didn't really drink much as it was such a hike to get to the toilets and fighting through the crowds of people. The VIP section doesn't really give you much room actually gives you no room to dance whatsoever! I did enjoy the show - kind of, but I think it was just bad as we was in apparent VIP which was essentially just waiter service your paying the extra for. I've been now, but I wouldn't return.

Great night out!. This was a great fun night out for all ages above 18. Very entertaining and always putting on a show! Staff were friendly and always getting drinks for you! I would go again! Great fun!

Great Show, Poor Service.. This was a good experience. The show was excellent, I really had a good time with my wife. A good advice to take if it is your first time going to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen, it is to reserve a table on the upper levels. If you choose a travel agency to make your reservations, make sure you ask about the type of service you will be receiving such as VIP entrance so you don't stand in a very long line up to get in. A few things that we did not like are; the fact that they reduce the space you are standing and you can barely move from one side to the other let alone dancing. We had a very bad experience with one of the servers inside the Bar because he asked us to move even tighter to the other people that were staring beside us so he could accommodate three girls that were complaining most of the time because people were too close to them. They told us that the tables were for people that bought alcohol by the bottle like tequila or rum but the ladies that were moved beside us by the server were only drinking water and they got a table. We did not know when we bought the entrance tickets with BD Travel that we could reserve tables or even places on the uppers levels other wise we would have bought them in order to be comfortable in our honeymoon. The Show was excellent through out the evening, I really enjoy the one with Captain Jack Sparrow. If you go try to set your mind for a great night and go rested so you can enjoy it.

Don't know how I feel about this one?. I'm unsure on how I feel about coco bongo.. After hearing such good things we knew we wanted to see for ourselves. We went in the VIP section and it didn't feel very VIP to us. Yes you don't have people stamping all over you like you do on the floor and yes you can see the show better. But it was still cramped. The show itself was great. I like how it was done throughout the night so from 11.30 - 3.00 there was something to see and it wasn't just a nightclub, but there was hardly any room still to move and we had a bunch of girls in front of our "table" that where squealing and moving around so much I could hardly get a photo and they were more or less sat in my knee!! The waiter was excellent and so was the man who showed us to our table. All in all I think coco bongo is a good night out for the show and something you should experience at least once to say you have but I don't think I would like to go back. Even being 22 I felt like it was all abit too much and found that a lot of the time they were parading women.. Putting them on the big screen and looking down there tops or blowing there dresses up when they where on stage to see there underwear. Abit to sleazy and I feel it lets it down.

Annoying as hell staff. The good: We passed by near the place around 1:30 am, and were offere free admittion which was really nice. The show itself was pretty cool and the music was fun to dance to. However I personally would not say it's worth the insanely overpriced tickets. Maybe 20 usd max..The bad: drinks were quite expansive - 200 peso for a large glass with a little vodka some orange juice and a lot of ice.The ugly: inside the place were worker who walked around the dance floor offering shots of some alchohol for 60 peso. At first they were just a small nuisance coming every 15 minute or so and leaving after 3-5 polite no's. Some were more annoying then others and a few really did not let go. More some girls actually started touching us inappropriately hoping this would make us buy her drinks, even though we clearly said we're not interested. When the main part of the show was over and people started leaving they became so annoying! We wanted to stay and dance, but we just couldn't as these guys and girls were harrasing us every 20 seconds! In the end we were practically forced to leave because of their annoying pushineess which did not allow us to dance peacefully!That was a real shame, as we really enjoyed the music and the place itself, and that small matter really spoiled our experience ...
Incredible,something happening at all times!!!. Everything,but waiters amazing!!! Show was superb!!!The girl's who danced on the bar,and all the razzmatazz!!!

Excellent night. We went to Coco Bongo during our 1st trip to Mexico.It was an amazing night and really recommend- but please book VIP tickets. Really worth it. We danced and drank the night away and have never experienced such a good night :)

Was dissapointed. We found Coco Bongo was severely overrated. We bought the VIP seats up on the second floor terrace and were disappointed that there wasn't much room to dance up there or if you tried you would just block the stage show to the other seated people. So you just sit there and watch an over the top lipsync show. With that being said the cheaper main floor area where you could dance didn't look that appealing either because everyone was packed in like sardines. The waiter we had for our drink service was unbearably slow and we didn't get much for drinks that evening. The show itself was ok but the place hypes itself up so much ("better then any vegas show"... This is not true, lol) you may be disappointed at the end. I found this place is definitely geared toward the young bar newbies and been there done that bar-stars.If thats you then you may like it. I will give them an C for effort though. its not that its a horrible show but what you pay and what you get left a bad taste in our mouth afterwards. Overall we felt the VIP was a waste of money and the drink service was horrible.

Amazing- Go for gold member!. We booked Gold Member with Thomson which was £3000 pesos which works out roughly £140 for 2 people. We definitely recommend this when we were first seated I was extremely annoyed as I thought the main stage was the small one on the dance floor which I could not see at all as we were sat on the back benches upstairs and I was behind a big pillar. Once the show started I was much happier as the main stage was actually in line with us to the left so we had the best view by far! We had waiter service which was a bit slow until my partner tipped our waiter a load of loose change we had which probably equalled about £5 and we had drinks on the table when we were only half way through the ones we already had!The shows are amazing and exceeded our expectations. Don't book with Thomson though book with coco bongo direct and save yourself some money as Thomson only pass you onto them anyway.

Great night. Visited Coco Bongos with a basic ticket, I think we were lucky that we managed to find a spot at the top of the stairs with an extremely attentive waiter, who replenished our drinks before we'd finished the ones we were drinking and that was before we had tipped him. We really enjoyed the night, its part club, part entertainment show. Don't pay for queue jump/fast check in, its 5USD and they give you your wrist band in the queue which you still have to wait in, which saves all of a minute at the door. It had a great atmosphere, though I can understand some of the more negative reviews however didn't experience anything overly sexist myself.I'd agree that if this place were in the UK it would be shut down for health and safety as well as fire regulations. People were squeezed in and allowed to stand on the stairs to view the show, which would be a definite no no back here. I'd say well worth a visit but be prepared to squeeze in.
Let yourself go!!!. If you want a great show with good music to dance on and let yourself go...that's the place to be. whether on the vip stand or regular dance floor section, this place is on fire.

Must see!!. Coco Bongos is a must see for anyone visiting Mexico! All age ranges would love. The shows are superb!! It's difficult to describe how spectacular this place is, you just must go here! I would go every time I had a holiday in Mexico. Tip: try and get on one of the higher tiers/balconies if you don't wanna be in the midst of it all down on the main floor. Outstanding!!! :)

Amazing!!!!!!!!. We paid for the gold upgrade and it was fantastic!!!!! Our own seats and table, with waiter service providing us with our drinks from the free bar (and it was proper bottles Sol beer etc, not draught!)The show is fantastic-out of this world!!!If I ever go back to Mexico-I'll be going here again for sure!!!!

NUTS but FUN. This night club was NUTS!!! I would go back again for sure!! People of all ages were there just having a great time. It is part dancing/drinking club and part show with sexy dances and cirque du soliel type acrobats above you. My favorite thing of all was the huge cold shots of air blasting over your head. Just be warned because our tour guide did not warn us - when you arrive the line up is huge to get in, but it goes quite fast and when you first get in it is hard to get a table and drinks, but just tip your server well and he will find a space for you and keep the drinks coming all night. It is most defintely worth it to pay the $10 extra to get to the front of the line.

Crazy fun. The Coco Bongo is the absolute best night club I've ever been to. It is a mash up between a live show and a night club. It is a party you will never forget. It is really busy always so expect lots of people. Mostly tourists. We were picked up from our resort and Fredy was our guide. He was wonderful and got us a great spot. The shows are every ten to fifteen minutes with impersonators like Freddy Mercury and Beyonce. They also have live acrobatics. They play top 40 music like Pitbull and Calvin Harris. This place lives up to it's promise putting Las Vegas nightlife to shame.

GOLD VIP NOT WORTH IT!!. Me and my partner and 2 other friends went here September 4th 2014. We paid $125 each for the gold VIP section. It was not worth it, we had no room to dance and were always being moved and shoved by the waiters. The drinks are vile, cheap alcohol is used and you have to pay more for premium brands when it should be included in the price considering how much you pay! Be wary of the shot girls as they don't at first tell you that you have to pay for the shots! The shows were incredible, the atmosphere is electric and the waiters always bring your drinks over and always fill you up even when the drink you have is only half full. I would return but not to the gold VIP part! Tipping was rather annoying as well like I said considering the price you paying and then you get bugged to tip on top! Big thanks to Adir for sorting our tickets out when we were told it was sold out! He was very friendly! Overall great fun and a good night but overpriced.

Amazing party!. This is a must go if you are visiting Playa del Carmen and want to have some fun! For around $60 you will get shuttle from/to your resort, all drinks, great show and amazing music! Probably will be very crowded but that's what makes this show so awesome!TIP: Give some tip to you waiter and you will be having tequila in your table all the time ;)

Going downhill. Great show and entertainment but felt it wasn't as good as last year. Bigger gaps in the performances, also seemed like not as many as last year. They seem to be more interested in showing video down girls tops, under skirts etc. As a few other reviewers have commented quite demeaning to women. Be careful you could quite easily end up showing your underwear to everyone on the big screens, whether you wanted to or not !Another annoying new thing this year is the girls walking round trying to sell you shots, being all inclusive you can always ask your server for shots so not sure what the deal is here, but sitting in the Goldmember section trying to watch the show was constantly harassed to buy shots, I lost count of the amount of times I had to try and manoeuvre round in my chair (the chairs are so close together it is hard to move) to tell her no thank you. A few minutes later it was another one. A big irritant to say the least. If you have not been before I would still recommend it as it is a spectacle which needs to be experienced however I feel it is on the slippery slope so don't think I will go next year. Shame.

good night out. a lovely nightclub owned by Jim Carey i believe, it is very different from anything i have seen, very busy and loud, but give it a go if you like that sort of thing, there are a lot of surprises

Great night out. Had the most amazing evening at Coco Bongo's had vip access and had seat very close to stage(infact virtually under it ) but show goes all around building so you see nearly everything.
wonderful show and would recommend it to everyone
Greatest Show Ever Seen. $65 for round trip travel from hotel and back and all you can drink...definitely worth the price and awesome entertainment!!!

Waste of money. After the initial purchase of $70 per person we get there to see the longest line I have ever seen in my life. The guide tells us we can pay an extra $10 per person and get to jump the entire line plus get a private table with our own server with drink service, that DID NOT happen. We got 1 drink in the 90 minutes that we were there and we just left and went to another better bar.

Better than expected. I have to admit, I went not wanting o go After a long day of drinking and sunshine, well, it just did not sound fun. The show entertainment was way better than I could have imagined and I am glad I went. It is packed and crowed and you should go with that expectation. There is no elbow room, but find a good waiter and keep the drinks coming and you will have a great time.

Amazing Night. Went towards the end of our two week holiday and it was a great way to finish the holiday! Would recommend to anyone - all the show and acts were amazing! Great night and will definitely be back.
Extraordinary!. If you are looking to have a blast, to see awsum shows, to dance all night this is the place! Absolutely a MUST!

Awesome!!. This was such an amazing show!! We saw Beyonce, Madonna, Michael Jackson, Spider-Man, Tron and so many more acts!! Very theatrical and interactive!! We were just walking down the street and some man gave me and my other 2 friends wrist bands to get in so that was awesome (it was a little expensive otherwise, but now that we attended we see why)! I would def recommend this to others.

Incredible Party - Fun - & Show. We liked that CoCo Bongo was open bar - which at first was what offset the cost for us. However, once we got there it was very crowded and really crazy. After we were established at our balcony it was AMAZING! I would NOT buy general admission / ground level tickets. SERIOUSLY! We went down for only a quick moment and it was terrible. The show was really great and the drinks kept coming ALL NIGHT! The only downfall I would say was that we were not given adequate information on how to get back to the bus to take us back to the resort. We saw a couple of young girls that went who we had also seen at the resort - I feel like they could have been in a very bad position had we not met up. It took us awhile but we found it. Even though we were all heavily intoxicated. Also, If you are a women please keep in mind that you will be subjected to pretty demeaning behavior. If you dress scantily I suppose that's what you're after and that is what you will get. They zoom in on your 'assets' and put you on the huge screen for all to properly view your figure. It is quite inappropriate in my opinion but it didn't take away from the overall experience. After all, if you don't want that attention then do not dress like a street walker...

mexico ,carribean coast. coco bongo good night drinks included in price but a little over priced in my opinion - maybe if they'd put on some nibbles for our party good job we were all inclusive we could eat when we got back to hotel - thomson rep said food was included there was none!.

amazing night. This place is amazing the atmosphere was unreal, we went VIP which was well worth it for how long the show is on for.The service is excellent we never had a empty glass all night, the show was very good with great performers on show.If you like a good night don't leave mexico without going to coco bongos.

What a blast. Coco Bongo was a blast! We had some issues with our bottle service that our waiter did not seem to correct, but once one of our group members told him I own a bar and I want to speak to the manager he finally got the manager that corrected the issue. The show was amazing and nothing like any club here in St. Louis

Amaze-Balls!!!. So this place was absolutely amaze-balls!When we first walked in there we thought we may have gotten ourselves into something a little over our heads, but once we gave it a few minutes (to settle in), we realized that this place was going to be so much fun, and it truly was! When we arrive, it was soooo packed. But somehow, the crowd seemed to thin out a bit. We were able to dance, get as many drinks as we needed, and find the bathroom without any trouble.On our way in we spoke with other people who had VIP tickets and we were starting to get worried that we didn't have that kind of ticket. In the end, it ended up being us that had the most fun, especially since we were standing right at the bar the entire night. That meant we were getting refills on our drink super easily and quickly all night and all the acrobatic shows were happening right in front of our faces, I was asked to dance on stage, and at the end of the night I was drenched in tequila. This was easily one of the best nights we had on our entire honeymoon!The shows were absolutely unbelievable and something that we will remember for the rest of our lives. And by the way, the waiters in this establishment are nothing short of incredible. We have never seen such manoeuvring!We want to thank you so much for the experience of a LIFE TIME! We truly hope that we can come and be a part of this amazing spectacle again at least one more time in our life.Thank You!

Amazing Night!. Myself and my girlfriend both in our late 20s had an amazing time at Coco Bongos. It's like watching a Vegas show inside a nightclub where you can dance and drink. We went VIP which I'd highly recommend and I'd also recommend sitting on the stools around the edge of the 2nd floor opposite the entrance so you have the best view. Our waiter was brilliant, we never had an empty glass. The only downside is the toilets on the 2nd floor, which are pretty small so expect to que.

Cool show but too long!. Its a show! At first we thought it was show and club/dancing but no. Its just a show. Girls can dance if they want to go on the platform and everyone just watches you. The show in general was really well done but its just too long. Majority of the people are standing unless you have VIP table. You can't just sit and rest your feet for 5mins, Its either you pay to stand or sit. The show starts at 11pm (the place opens at 10pm) and we left at 3:30am because our feet were too sore.Be careful of scams of skipping the line.. Nothing is for free. There's a charge.Waiters were very good made sure you always had a drink in your hand!

Fun night. Decided to visit here as a night out during our stay in Mexico and enjoyed it. Pick up and drop off service from the hotel was good and we had a good night.We went during the week as it was a little cheaper and every night is like a Saturday night on holiday anyway! We also went VIP which was worth it, i don't think i could have managed standing up on a crowded dance floor all night. We had particularly good seats and could see everything, we were also right next to bar which meant quick service. Our drinks never ran out, our waiter was so good and had drinks lined up ready for us.It was non stop, always something going on and brilliant to watch all the acrobatics going on right in front of us. I'm a Michael Jackson fan so loved his part and my partner loves Queen so that was his favourite part. Something for everybody, I think my parents would also enjoy this as its not just a night out clubbing but its got the same sort of atmosphere.The only thing i wasn't that impressed with was the price of a photograph, i think it should be less than $25 when you have already paid $125 to get in. Other than that i had a good time and would recommend it to others.
Fun place to hang out. Everybody seemed laid back & relaxed, not too crowded or noisy.Service was very fast, waitress very cheerful and very helpful and knowledgable.

boring past 25. My wife and I were sold this place as a night club to go dancing. It's really a showplace where they have cheesy choregraphies and cut the songs whenever the professional dancers have finished theirs. We left after 30 min and they refused to reimburse us.

Absolutely amazing!!!. Went here for my 26th birthday and what a night it was! Different acts constantly on the stage and absolutely amazing!!! My sister in law advised our lovely waiter it was my birthday, next thing I knew the lights were up and everyone was singing happy birthday to me. I was also brought out a birthday cake with a shot on top!! Just amazing!!!!!

An amazing night, beyond expectations. I first went to Coco Bongo in 2010. I didn't know what to expect but it was a blast. I was tired and the shuttle from the VIM took forever. Once my girlfriend and I showed up it was a non stop party.So, the same girlfriend and I returned in August 2014 to get married at the Excellence. As a gift to our wedding guest we planned a Coco Bongo excursion. We booked about 3 months out for 18 gold VIP tickets.Booking was extremely easy. We needed transportation, so we searched the internet for a company that could get us both tickets and transportation. As it turns out if you book through Coco Bongo, transportation is included. We bought the tickets and got a confirmation number. Then we had to do a "online chat" with a representative to arrange transportation. We also put in a SPECIAL REQUEST. 4 years earlier we noticed a balcony area that would be awesome to watch the show.We asked the rep if we could get this balcony. They do not reserve areas ahead of time but would include our request in the notes.Night of the show! Only 14 of us, we had 4 cancellations. My only criticism of Coco Bongo is the transportation. The largest van the company they contract with can only fit 12 people. So, at pick up time 1 van showed up. Now our group of 14 gets split and even though I bought transportation for 18, the van that picked up the last 2 only had room for 2. So, if no one cancelled we would of had to of taken 3 vans, with all the vans having to stop at different hotels. 12 of my party arrive. I was a little worried the first time we went there was a a rep that walked us in, this time by booking online the 12 of us just stood in line. We waited maybe 2 minutes until someone asked to see our tickets. I showed them our paperwork and explained that we were still missing 2 that we're coming in a different van. At this point the representative noticed we were 4 short. With no prompting on my behave she offered to give us a credit for the missing guests. This was the first time during the night they exceeded my expectations. She also took the names of the missing 2 and said she would make sure they were escorted to us when they arrived. Walking in the place was getting packed. The VIP section looked filled up. I thought there was no way we would get the balcony we requested. I was actually expect our escort to start pointing and saying "ok 2 of you here and 4 of you over there". To my surprise he lead us straight to the balcony we requested and removed the reserved signs from 4 tables. This was the 2nd time they exceeded our expectations. It was amazing seeing the faces of our group, everyone was in awe. Our server introduces himself and the drinks started flowing. Amazing services. Amazing service. What I'm trying to say is that the service was amazing. He wouldn't accept a tip at the beginning of the night and the service was top notch all night long. The floor manager also introduced himself, this guy was very professional. He took care of any request made sure that any complaints were addressed. The service was the 3rd time they exceeded our expectations. The show was AWSOME. I had and still have trouble explaining the atmosphere. It's a club with a show and you can't help but have a good time. I had seen the show 4 years earlier. The show was similar but it definitely wasn't the same. The performers are artist, truly talented entertainers. Everybody danced, everybody were amazed and everybody had a good time. The night flew by. During the show the floor manager checked on us multiple times. The woman who had taken our tickets some how found us and gave us the coupon for the no shows. The show was the 4th time I exceeded our expectations. 3:30 , came way to fast and we had to leave because it was our van's pick up time. Here again the company they contract with for transportation let us down. The driver of the van with 12 of us said 3:30 was the pick up time. The driver of the other 2 had said 3am. No one knew we had different pick up times. And at 3:30 when all 14 of us left, 2 had already missed their van. AND the driver was saying the 2nd van was on the way, NO it wasn't on the way. It had already come and gone. Now we had to break up the group again and 4 off us took had to take a taxi. Yes, the taxi did try and rip us off. The first price was $100 to get back, we got them down to $40. No biggie for 4 of us to split. Still, I bought 18 tickets which included transportation. If I had known we wouldn't be coming or leaving together then I would of looked in to other solutions.I appreciate the customer care and professionalism of Coco Bongo. They do a great job and I can't recommend them enough.

Wow. If clubs were like this back home I'd be out almost every week. We booked gold member through thomsons and was definately worth it. We had great seats and our waiter was very attentive, our drinks were never more half empty before we had our drinks were in front of you. Premium spirits and cocktails were included too. The show was amazing I even got on stage at one. I have to say it was one of the best nights I've ever had. I would recommend to anyone I'm not the clubbing type but have to say I thoroughly enjoyed myself.
Thomson pub crawl. Ended at Coco Bongo 1,30 but could pay to stay longer, show looked impressive with drinks readily available and the place was packed and this was a Monday!

COCO RIP OFF. We were sold Gold level tickets with the promise of 2 tables. On entering the club we were left stranded by rep and given ropey tables. No one would listen to us. Show was second rate just like in-hotel entertainment. Artists mime along to songs woop woop! Music is good though but much better clubs far cheaper just around the corner. Tried to resolve issue with Coco Bongo rep in our hotel Palace Playacar but he would not meet with us and the hotel even tried on our behalf to no avail. $140 tickets and ended up with same night as those who paid on the door $70. Please be very wary of Coco Bongo reps in hotel - they are not reliable. What a rip off!

Not amazing. Not as good as we expected. Its not by any means rubbish but when all the adverts say its better than las vegas nightlife that's not accurate and made us feel it was over ratted a bit! If you can drink loads of the very strong drinks they bring you then this works out great value and I am sure for nightlife in the area its one of the best places in town. It was a lot smaller inside than we expected although it is 3 stories it's compact. The show was a mixture of cold air being blasted from the ceiling, music videos, women dancing on top of the bar, annoying female staff trying to sell you shots even though drinks are all inclusive so why would you pay extra? The show itself was ok, impersonations of the beetles, Madonna etc and some good wire work/dancers in the sky. We did not go VIP and got crammed into the lower area but on the plus side we were close to some of the acts. Good value as it included transport and all inclusive drinks

Brilliant Night! Must give it a go.. Had an amazing night watching the show, drinking all the beer we could and partying until the early hours. Watching Spiderman, batman, madonna, Queen, Elvis, Michael Jackson... the list goes on. Its a non stop, full on party from as soon as the hooter sounds and the show begins.I'd highly recommend going mid week, and VIP.Its cheaper mid week, and not quite as crazy busy. And the VIP section is higher up and gives you a much better view of the show, a table and waiter service. None VIP looks just too busy and crowded.

Lot of fun at coco bongo. first and foremost, this will be a VERY LATE night. we didn't get back to our hotel until 5am. I didn't think I would be able to stay up that late being 52 years old but I did. I paid for it the next day though, lol, but it was a lot of fun. I do recommend that you get the VIP pass which puts you upstairs so your down with the masses. Every time my drink got close to being empty someone was filling it back up. You have private bathrooms up in the VIP section. The shows are really good and a lot of fun. I do recommend Coco Bongo but it is a late night.

The best nightlife experience of the city. It's probably the most touristic and the most expensive place of the city. The "all you can drink" package will cost you around 60/70 USD and the table 300 USD. Despite these premises, the place is absolutely worth at least one visit! The show lasts 3 hours and it's extremely entertaining and involving (after the first couple of performances, people will start facing along with the dancers ), the excellent service is quick and sharp, the music offers mainly commercial hits. Overall, Coco Bongo perfectly keeps up with your expectations and even more! It's strongly recommended!!

Entertainment all the way. A nightclub with professionals from the door all the way thrue to the waiters and busboys.This was a breath of fresh air in a very hot holiday.Entertainment from first vocal!
Crazy but Great. Non stop entertainment, and drink lol, go VIP though ;-)Always something going on to look at or listen to.

Amazing. The place was great. We went on ladies night (Wednesdays) so the girls paid $50 instead of $65, and that included transportation both ways. We were greeted with a drink at the door and a shot of tequila in line. At first I was a little overwhelmed at how many people flooded into the place, but after everyone settled into their spots/tables, it was awesome. Our waiter was Miguel and he was great. He just kept bringing drinks without us asking, and I think our tips went a long way for that. It was chaos so we really appreciated not having to work our way to the bar. The performances were amazing and they kept shooting down some kind of cooled air which was a game changer. That crowd would have been miserable if we were all sweating, but no one did. This place is a must see and would have been worth double what we paid.

A hoppin club + entertainment. This beats any club in Las Vegas. You have all the music, balloons, bubbles, cannons and confetti plus the crazy entertainment. Our friends we met at the resort took us there and we had a blast. We will always remember it!

Overpriced and over rated. Far too expensive and couldn't see what the fuss was about. Some dancers come out, pretend to sing one song and then bugger off for ten minutes to get changed. Meanwhile, music videos play in the background. Plus, in order to get a seat and a waiter, you need to pay for a table. This costs $2,000 (that's pesos not dollars) which is about £100. Most over rated and over priced pile of dogdirt ever. Save your money and watch the entertainment at your hotel. It's no better, but doesn't feel like a violation.

Had an awesome time. Went on a Wednesday night and the venue was packed. Pay for the gold member, it's well worth it. The line is shorter and you get in right away. You get your unlimited drinks and a table and chair on the 2nd floor. We had a good view of the crowd and the stage. Our waiter was good and kept the beers flowing.The atmosphere was great. The shows and effects were cool. They blew confetti and balloons into the crowd a few times. At some point we decided to move our chairs away so we could dance. No way you can just sit there and do nothing. If you're in PDC and want to party for a night, this is definitely the place to go!No dress code-wear something comfortable. You can wear shorts and sandals.

Cirque du Soleil on steroids!. I was very apprehensive about going to a club that opens at midnight and closes at 3:00am. The crowd was out the door and down the block. Getting in the door and down a narrow hallway was a little unsettling, but once in, the party starts. Be sure and pay for a VIP ticket with a table and chairs. It is a long time to stand up. The show, entertainers, and music is awesome. It's mostly a 20 and 30 something crowd, but I'm a 50 something guy and had a great time!
FANTASTIC EVENT. Great staff, great music, great drinks, great acts, great atmosphere! Definitely worth the gold package on the second floor. Such a good night!

I gave in, and enjoyed it!. Never thought I would go to something like this while backpacking but i gave in after convincing from my group. The performers were amazing. We just had stand up general seating and it was great. Only suggest getting the beer because the liquor drinks were too watered down. Just enjoy the night and it definitely is a splurge but if you are looking to be entertained and a fun time out with great music, give it a shot.

You must go!. We had a brilliant night here, went on an organised trip with our Thomas Cook Rep, Luis. We went to three bars before and ended the night in coco bongo. It's definitely worth paying the extra for gold membership. We had a brilliant spot on the balcony and could see everything without being squashed. Also had our own waiter. Downstairs definitely gets overcrowded. We found the different shows entertaining and the atmosphere electric. Would definitely recommend going.

Great night out. Brilliant show and nightclub - well worth a visit. Select VIP tickets you won't be disappointed. Only downside is area round full of pickpockets and prostitutes. One of the guys in our group lost his wallet

Had my Bachelorette Party Here!. Hector Ponce from the Occidental Grand XCaret took our group of about 10 girls to Coco Bongo, at first we were a little sketched out by the place and not sure what to expect, but an hour in and we were hooked - we had an amazing time - it was such a blast! I absolutely recommend checking out Coco Bongo during your stay!! A night of insane fun!! :)

Definitely an experience. This is an experience everyone should give a try at least once. It is quite provocative and offensive to some extent to women but it is all in good fun. My suggestion is not to wear a dress ladies because you may end up showing your underwear. Also wear very comfortable shoes because unless you bought a table you'll be standing the entire show. The party aspect was very fun and the variety of music was awesome. The show itself was spectacular and made it all worth it. It gets very crowded but it's manageable.

Dodgey. The spectacle has a whole isn't too bad, could be more fun in more comfortable surroundings. Firstly the line up took for ages - to point where I was close to walking away but got moving just in time. Once inside we got herded thought a tiny tunnel and got handed some nasty shots of who knows what.It then took, what seemed to be an eternity for the show to begin, in the mean time being harassed by promotion girls trying to sell extra shots of something cheap & nasty looking, getting my attention by constantly blowing a whistle in my face as if I was blind and couldn't see them.Once the show was underway the chaos continued, this place is a disaster waiting to happen, too many people in a small place with little or not enough exits. No to mention the constant smell of farts & body odour - that really took the fizz outta our 'free' drinks.Overall we tried to make the best of it. Would we go again? Probably not, And would recommend with extreme caution - dangerous place, cheap tasteless booze & offensive to nasal cavities.

Worst place ever! Never again!!! Safety concern . I don't know how this place gets positive reviews or how we had such an opposite experience than most. This is by far the worst bar / nightlife we've ever wasted our money on. What a joke. They promote "better shows than Vegas!" Okay, maybe for the people who have never been to Vegas... This place sucks. The monster line up to get in, it's shoulder to shoulder, one rest room, can't get drinks, just a mess! It's a huge safety concern, they jam about 5x the people that should be in a room of that size. None the less, we left after 30 minutes. I will tell everyone I know to not waste their time or money.
Great night out!. This is an amazing club, with a great atmosphere and a very professional show. The drinks are good and the service is excellent considering how busy this place is!

Absolutely top drawer!. As most people are, we were strongly advised to go to Coco Bongos whilst in Playa del Carmen and we were not disappointed.As my wife will testify I often get quite tired in an evening and end up nodding off, but not here!aThe show was a-maz-ing, the dancers excellent, choreography brilliant and service top-drawer.We opted for the Gold package which cost a little extra but meaning we had a seat and an elevated view...money well spent!The waiter was ace, he never left our glasses empty all night and was very attentive.I would definitely return and recommend anybody going to Playa del Carmen to get here.
Nice. This is an awesome place in Cancun. I loved all the performances. Nice place to go out with friends or meet new people.

Brilliant!. We booked the gold package through our rep. Good table with a great view & a brilliant waiter. Our rep said to tip at the start of the night but he said wait till the end so we could judge how good he was. He was fantastic! Glasses never empty & full strength vodka :). The show was brilliant, 1st class & never a dull moment.Yes, they blow girls skirts up, yes they film cleavage. is it PC, no. Take it as it's intended & have a good night. We had been warned so my daughters declined the offer to dance on stage, others worse shorts. I didn't expect to have such a good night & I thought my days of getting in at 4am were long gone but it was such a good night.
Amazing night out. Fantastic shows. Definitely get the gold member which is $125 but includes all your drinks, preferential seats and your own waiter. Our glasses were never empty.

What a night!!!. I LOVED this place - did not know what to expect as didn't research it before I left the UK - although friends told me it was a good night out - we paid for GOLD service and wasnt disappointed it is very well organised from start to finish - the bar staff were fantastic - my glass never ran dry and the show was just ABSOLUTELY AWESOME - way beyond what ever I thought it was going to be - it gave me goosebumps and we just partied the night away - fabulous - highly recommended

NEVER GO HERE - RAPISTS. "All inclusive drinks" means you have to tip to get any drinks and even then they hardly serve too. Shots costs an extra USD$10 (which we were told were included) .. They also film up girls skirts and push them over fans to film the skirt going up for the big screen in front of 1000 people it made me sick. The security for girls on stage and put Chains behind and filmed their undies from under.Worst place ever.

A good night with a sinister side.. My experience was a positive one though I have to agree that health and safety is of great concern. Should there ever be a fire I suspect there will be many casualties and even deaths due to over crowding. It would never pass uk acceptability for health and safety.The show was very entertaining and quite funny. I take into account that there are girls who more than willingly get up dancing on the bar and the various podiums knowing full well that the big gusts of air are going to mean they will moon the crowd below. You have a choice and we are all grown ups. The dancers are beautiful and no different to vegas show girls or the Benidorm Palace,they keep their tops on too!We booked our tickets through our hotel and a very nice guy called Omar who was lovely and appeared very honest. Once in the club we didn't see him do could only assume he went home. We got what we were expecting and had a fantastic time.One thing that worries me is the allegied drugging of clients by staff, some are reported here. Had I have read the reports on trip adviser I would never ever have gone. The our cabin crew for a major uk airline confirmed that there have been many cases of men and women having their drinks spiked (date rape drug), and either being robbed or worse. In order to evade going to the police just about anyone will take a bribe or use a situation to extort money. The scarey thing is I was told this was organised by staff in the venue who pray on bunches of men, women and couples. When you buy the vip ticket you don't get to see where the drinks are made, the waiter just brings them to the table. Ours was lovely and really looked after us, he was probably the best waiter I'd had during my entire holiday.Just please be very careful, insist on beer bottles and having the bottles opened at your table. Don't get drunk and go out with a bunch of people you trust and will look out for you. It's not the UK so never let your guard down and its unlikely you will get the same support from the police or other agencies. Great show, I really enjoyed it, just be careful, don't ever go alone and be safe :-)

Fantastic night. My husband and I booked this through the rep at our hotel and we weren't disappointed. We took the VIP package where we were given a seat and a lovely waiter called Carlos who after a tip looked after us for the whole night. The show was amazing from start to finish with something for everyone to enjoy from the Ariel acrobatics to the tribute acts of Michael Jackson Beyoncé and more. They threw out balloons and light sticks to the audience at different times. The time flew in and before we knew it it was chucking out time. The show doesn't start till about 11pm and goes on till after 3.30pm, we rolled back to the hotel at 4.15am. It is well worth a visit.
Coco Bongo Night. I loved the show, the drinks, and the music. The only thing I didn't like was that we had to stand up all night.

Amazing!. I'd really recommend booking this, we went as gold members and I think it's the best way to do it. You have your own table in a section around the edge which makes it easier to see the show and you also get all of your alcohol included in the price. The way they'd structured the show was fantastic from start to finish, so much going on and the acrobatics, tribute acts and scenes from films were also brilliant. Our waiter was constantly checking on us and refilling our drinks throughout the show too.

OK. I enjoyed the show itself, the music was great and the preformers were awesome. I did not do enough research to know what I was getting myself into before leaving our hotel. We were told that it was until 3am but than told on the bus ride there we leave at 350am. When we got there we had to wait in a long line up, by the time we got in the place was packed and there was no where to go. It must be a fire hazard to have that many people jammed in there. I didnt know we could upgrade to VIP which i would recommend to anyone going to pay the extra. Half way thru the show we got a seat in the vip section i guess someone left early and I was with my mum who was sitting down so I assume they were being nice and helped us get a seat. After that I have no complaints, if you have a seat it is worth doing.You can't walk up to the bar to get drinks you have to wait to be served so imagine a jam packed place with servers walking around constantly with drinks, its hard to get served unless you are in VIP.

Coco bongo. Brilliant night out the artists are amazing and unreal what they do the acrobatics whilst doing the pirates was breath taking and it between the turns its party time can be expensive if you want the vip ticket as you do get yourown table to sit at other wise you are stood up all night. Good entertainment whatever your age would definately go again

Great Show, Amazing Night. Such a great experience going to this cabaret/club. Told by a few family members its a must visiting Cancun/Playa del Carmen. The show is fantastic and very well choreographed and planned out, getting the audience involved. GO!!!
loud and boozy. Great show with singers dancers and accrobats starts at 11 pm and goes on to 3 am...Drinks are included in the gold ticket and they are full strength!
FANTASTIC!!!!!. Best money i have ever in my life spent on a show and disco!!! would happily pay it again and again!!!!!

Drugged by the server at coco bongo, them robbed on the way out (yes, really). The show was amazing until I lost consciousness after my 3rd drink. I am a 6ft tall male and I was very sober and them suddenly completely unaware that my friend was helping me out of the club because he recognized that something was wrong. We had spent the previous night at mandala and had drank all night long so he knew something bizarre had happened to me when I couldn't stand after 3 drinks. We are responsible adults. We aren't party animals or drunkards. We are working professionals. We came to enjoy the show and have some drinks. The server said he'd send some girls over (sort of odd) after we tipped him (he refused the first tip indicating it was too small to warrant his time). When my friend carried me out we were flirted with/touched by girls (he told me, I lost about 30 mins of memory) and the girls tried to take all our possessions. They didn't get mine because I was wearing pickpocket proof pants but they stole his $500 iPhone which we attempted to track but shortly later appeared up in cancan. I emailed the club and received no response. I was told by a server at a restaurant that coco bongo has ties to organized criminal activity. If you go just enjoy the show, do not drink anything that you don't see opened or made, which is impossible as they must bring the drinks to you. I think we both made the mistake of 1) being from the US 2) using our iPhones periodically. Do not go there alone under any circumstance. On the plus side, the portion of the show that I did see was very impressive.
7th time!. brilliant yet again, sergio on the bar was brilliant! great music and performances. However, securtiy guards were a little too rough when moving guests.

Never saw anything like this. We were brought with a group from our hotel and it was a brilliant night. It is expensive and packed but worth it. Mixture of musical/ acrobatics/ dance and a nightclub in one. You're only in Mexico once!!

What a Party!!. Got a bus from our hotel and went for the VIP experience, which did not disappoint.We were sat on a high bench and were packed in - although this added to the atmosphere.We had our own bar man who delivered shots and drinks the whole night - he was lovely.The toilet assistant when in and cleaned the seat after every visitor - it was always well stocked and spotless.Which takes me onto the show - it is outstanding, the atmosphere is amazing and the staff are at the top of their game - security is present and not over bearing but you see them working all the time.Thoroughly enjoyable evening - thank you to all at Coco Bongos x

amazing night of your life!!! wow. my husband and I went to coco bongos in playa del Carmen, mexico.we paid extra for the VIP tickets, which meant you had your own seats for the whole evening.drinks were replaced without you even noticing!!the entertainment was magnificent , out of this world, never seen anything quite like it before.so glad we went, with the VIP tickets, u have a different door for entry which means no queuing up!if u get the chance to go, then GO!!our waiter was fab, didn't catch his name tho.

Amazing time. So much fun!. What a great place. Went through an excursion offered at our reort with two friends. We are 30 something. Awesome show, super friendly people. We had a great time! We didn't think we would last until 3am when the show ended but the time just flew by! Definitely recommend staying in the floor to get the full experience!

Extremely uncomfortable for girls.. This club is disgustingly sexist. Women are treated with no respect whatsoever, girls are periodically hauled up to dance on various stages around the venue by letchy bouncers, and once dancing a wind machine lifts up the girls' skirts and exposes their underwear on a big screen to the whole club. Personally I found this thoroughly degrading, and not at all funny. The shows were mediochre, most of the acts were out of time, but the entertainment was not what I had an issue with. In this day and age girls should not be objectified and treated in this way in a club, and I am appauled that more attention has not been drawn to this at Coco Bongo. If you are a man and enjoy looking up girls skirts, you will probably have a great night. As a girl, it feels like a violation.

The most offensive, misogynistic club I´ve ever been to. I went to Coco Bongo on a Saturday night with a girl friend, we were the first in the queue and still waited well over an hour to get in, being hearded like cattle through over heated corridors and being elbowed constantly by ticket sellers. When we finally got in, we already couldn´t find a space as it was over crowded inspite of us being the first in the queue. Being a woman there you feel like an object. Unsmiling staff grab you and force you to dance on the bar, inspite of me saying no 3 times they will not take no for an answer. As soon as the bit where they don´t need women on the bar comes they drag you down only to come and drag you up again 10 minutes later. They then forced me and my friend up to the podium where you are taken to wait on the balcony before the podium becomes free. I refused to go on the podium, resulting in rude sneres from the staff, my friend went on the podium where there puffed air from the floor to make her dress blow up and show her pants to the whole club. as soon as they wanted her off they dragged her páinfully by the arm and man handled her off the balcony.We then asked to see the manager (in fluent Spanish so no language barrier excuse) because we felt we were treated in a completely offensive way but were simply kicked out onto the street.On another note, it´s dangerously overcrowded, you can´t move, if you try to go to the bathroom you get groped while you try and push through people, crammed in like sardines.DO NOT GO, this club is completely offensive to women, I felt disgusting even being there.

Continues to be the best party.....ever.. Our fifth time visiting Coco Bongos and the party keeps getting better. In addition to the usual Spiderman, Mask and Michael Jackson shows that we've seen a number of times, they've added the Pitbull and Beyoncé shows which were very entertaining.This time, we elected to go down to the lower level (to avoid the expensive bottle service) since we had already paid for all-inclusive. It was packed but as entertaining as ever. If you haven't been, I can assure you that you have never (and will likely never) see anything like this. It's Mardi Gras, New Years in Times Square, and Cirque du Soleil all in one.

Amazing!. Just returned from Mexico with my boyfriend, and Coco bongo's was definitely one of the highlights! Would recommend paying that little bit extra for VIP, perfect view of the stage, drinks flowing all night and no queuing! Would 100% go back if I return to Mexico!!

excellent. Hi, ive been many times and the wow factor is their each time im coming back with my partner oct, would like to spent halloween here, he has never been so really looking forward to this, what price oct 2014 halloween should we be paying ????
Honeymoon. Fab night, well worth the money, made special by our server ernesto who kept the drink flowing, great show,fab music

great fun. It's a great night, please go with your resort they make reservations, we had bottle service, it was well worth it.. it was $149pp for reservations, table and bottle service we wanted kettle one vodka show was GREAT

EXCELENTE. We have just returned from Mexico and if you are going on holiday and are anywhere near cancun or playa del carmen then coco bongo is a must.Make sure you book this at the start of your holiday as it is very popular we went for gold member VIP which I recommend as there's no queuing to get in also you are taking straight to your VIP area which isn't over crowded and you get your own waiter who keeps supplying you drinks all night no queuing necessary. On to the shows there is something for everyone so many different artists/acrobatic shows they also get the crowd involved with balloons/glow sticks etc. it is an amazing night and experience would definitely recommend to anyone going to mexico.

Excellent night out. My husband and I went to coco bongo for the last proper night out of our holiday. We booked through our holiday rep at the hotel. We paid around £80 each for VIP golf member band. This got us transport to and from the club, entry, unlimited drinks all night and guaranteed us a seat upstairs. When we arrived we didn't have to wait in a queue. We were taken straight upstairs to a seat and we had a designated waiter who served our area. The show is fantastic, dancing and acrobatics with great music. We thoroughly enjoyed it and would recommend the VIP ticket if you don't want to have to fight your way to the bar or spend your night waiting in queues.

A show, disco, acrobatics, and so much more!. 5 stars is not enough! Not sure is 10 either!!!This has got to be the first thing you book when you arrive in Mexico, be warned if it's not booked within 24 hours you may not get the chance to see this hugely entertaining spectacle.It is unlikely to be anything you have ever seen before Think of Queen, Kiss, Chicago, Shania Twain, Beyoncé , Madonna, but to name a few then throw in acrobats, dancers, Beetlejuce, Batman, Spider-Man and Gladiator and you have some inkling of this riotous showEntertaining, mind boggling, itchy feet, bogeying, crazy, crazy night and can't wait to go again

worst experience ever.. We spent $120 to go to this. Waited in line for an hour to get in. Once we got in you can barely move. If you are 10 feet from the bar it takes you 10 minutes trying to push your way up to get a drink. Then you have to wait another ten minutes to actually get a drink. Oh and if you are no where near the bathroom dont even try to get there. If you are with anyone you will get separated. Confetti falls into your drink and you have to pick it out. The girls standing on the bar block your view of seeing any part of the show. Everyone smells and farts. Don't even go. Save your money. We left and took a taxi back after the first two drinks.

Amazing. amazing night -life experience, crowded but that's part of the fun. amazing staff in public relations. Because of AMSTAR, or APPLE VACATIONS, WE DID NOT have transportation to coco bongo, but the amazing staff there made it possible to still have a great night, with a safe ride home. Only down fall was that the confetti cleaner kept making me move out of my spot to sweep confetti every 5 minutes, it was inconvenient as i kept missing parts of the show.

Well overpriced, ideal for persons who have never been to a nightclub/show before . I had heard so much about this place that our group naturally wanted to goWe paid approx £90 each to go into the so called VIP area where we was informed that we would get a table and table service The venue- As soon as we arrived we waited approx 30 minutes in the queue to get in then led to our "table" which was around 30cm in diameter only big enough to place our three drinks on. The VIP area was so crammed in that u couldn't even stand up let alone move or dance. There was one toilet cubicle which meant that the toilet queue was constantly huge.The smoking area is on a balcony and you have to walk the whole way through the venue to a small balcony which services the whole club as the evening got busier it was far to dangerous to stand on as the railings are low and it was packed, also no fire escape.Due to recent nightclub/bar fires I was astounded at how little fire regulations were in place. Our table was at the back with a long narrow crowded walk to get to it this was the only way off the balcony.The show- the show started with the dancers on the bar. None of them danced in time and they all looked like they had better places to be. There was some good acrobatics within the show but that was it reallyThey cleverly mixed the live performance with music videos from the original songs. It's done well but I feel it was designed that way as some of the dance routines like Michael Jackson etc were probably too hard for the dancers to do so the music video distracted your attentionThe show was average, no comparison to vegas or a decent broadway musical. Overall- if we had paid £40 for the tickets I would of thought it was overpriced but at nearly £100 each I was guttedI expected it to be like a superclub where we could dance and have a laugh but we was sat from 11pm-3.30 watching semi ok dancers mime in clearly a foreign language (at 6 nights a week I would of expected the dancers to even learn the songs when miming) There was nowhere to move it was so unnecessarily crammed, waited a while for drinks even though we kept tipping, one toilet for a VIP area that size is ridiculous It's an ok show no way worth the moneyWe are all under 35, the good reviews you will have read are either from older people or 18 year old kids who have never even been to a nightclub before. This place is no better than any nightclub in any UK city and the show no better than one put on at your local theatre.Well overprice for the 5 drinks we managed to get from our "personal" waiterMy advice would be to forget it It's a Mexican hype for no reason at all The review on CNN saying it's better than vegas which is plastered around Mexico was a passing comment from a new anchor that the club has used in there mass marketing Complete waste of money!

Amazing Night. Amazing night at Coco Bongo. It was a riot of dancing, colour, drinks and music until 3 am. We bought the VIP package and we were never without drink all night. This wasn't great the next morning, on reflection, but it was amazing at the time. =P I would certainly pay to experience this again and would love to go back. It was awesome!
Electric Atmosphere. The nightclub is a brilliant night out. Waiter service, who were very quick to supply you with your drinks
this is a must see destination. other than being a little crowded you will absolutely enjoy yourself just don't travel here on the last night of your stay

What a night!. Bought the VIP gold tickets and glad we did. It looked crazy busy downstairs (a good kinda crazy though). We arrived early about 50 minutes before the show started at 11PM and were seated quickly upstairs. We tipped the waiter immediately and he kept bringing us drinks all night and we never had an empty glass!The show itself is amazing, the music, the props, the acrobats. Its really really good stuff. I would definately recommend you see it and pay for the vip tickets cos it looked quite cramped downstairs and people were having to look up towards the main stage.Enjoy!

Fabulous Night out!. Such an amazing show!We booked a package which included transport to and from the hotel, entrance fee and all drinks. This was great because we got seating at the side (which means you get a better view of the stage) and we didn't have to worry about drinks. I think this was expensive but probably worth it.We had such a good time that we didn't leave to get the coach back we stayed longer and got a taxi instead!

wow what a show. did the first choice vip ticket well worth it to get a waiter to serve you drinks all night ,show started bout 1130 pm & didnt stop til bout 3am never a dull moment and has to be experienced you,l understand when you hear jim carrey has lots to do with it

A must see in PDL. This place is utterly unique in concept and design. As a group of 6 we decided to get a table in this club and that was probably the best decision we could have made. The main area of the club gets extremely busy and crowded so if you're someone who needs your own space than that is something i would recommend. We Neverthless, that all comes secondary to the actual club/show. The music is great but the show parts of this evening really are something ive never seen before. The atmosphere here is great and its an experience you really wont forget. Anyone in the PDC area must visit this club. I would advise you to get there early however as even though we did not queue, it was huge by the time we arrived to enter.
Had fun dancing and drinking. Chill and enjoy, you are on vacation what else we can ask beautiful people good music and margaritas

Mental place!!!!. This place is absolutley mental !! You simply have to visit !! It doesnt matter how old you are , your never too old !!
