If you buy the basic ticket you may be on the ground floor which is a bit crammed in so you may not like , its worth buying the upgrade tickets for better seating & more room!!!The acts are fantastic , something for everyone !!! The bane & batman scene is fantastic as well as my personal fav the gladiator scene !! There is always something going on and you dont know where to look next !!!If your thinking of going then do not hesitate

Never too old. I was concerned that we were maybe too old for the club scene since it's been a number of years since we've gone but the show at Coco Bongos is so awesome and entertaining that no matter your age, you will have a great time.
changed my life. met new friends, drank great drinks and danced until the cows came home. love everything about it. and it will definitely be somewhere i come again

Brilliant night part of the Thomson pub crawl. We visited coco bongos as part of the Thomsons pub crawl and had a fantastic night.Tha acts we saw was fantastic we had great spot on the balcony and had our own waiter for the time we was there and he looked after us so well. My hubby tipped in 50 Mexican pesos as soon as we arrived and he never left our side we had replacement drinks before we had finished the last!!! We gave him another 50 as we left because he was fantastic!!!! It is full of atmosphere and was such a great night highly recommend!!

Please read .... I was told if I was to write a poor review I would get sued but I only think it's right to right nothing but negative feedback.Firstly José sold us a mid leading ticket ad we asked for the Cancun event due to.it being a special birthday however we found.out a few days later after paying just under 4000 pasos we was going to the one above. However a couple of night being there Jose had bumped into us when we went to playa for a night out and had dragged my friend and myself demanding we go to another bar we reported this and the treatment we got was disgusting. We asked for.a refund as we didn't feel safe going to coco bongo for them to refuse our refund. After days of fighting our corner the staff was so unhelpful, laughing in our face that I had no choice but to video the evidence as you wouldn't belive it. We ended up getting a refund the day before we was to leave bk to England. I am taking this further and warn all of you to be very careful as staff are shocking When it comes to customer service ... In the mean time I am in the process of taking this further with my lawyer

Best Party ever. This is a unique place that has to be visited when going to the Yucatan. Can't count how many times I have been there and still enjoy each time.I don't usually do reviews and have nothing bad to say about Coco Bongos however I wanted to write this review to warn people about a particular Taxi Driver that usually works outside of Coco Bongos on 10 & 12 street. I used this taxi to get back to the Hotel I was staying at and unfortunately I left my bag which contained my phone in the back of the taxi. It was a stupid thing to do but it happens. Anyway the hotel had the drivers name and number as he dropped me off in the lobby and had to provide this information to get into the resort. So the hotel contacted the Taxi syndicate for me on several occasions however this taxi driver did not want to be found and they could not get hold of him at all, how convenient! I know the bag was definitely left in the taxi as I got my money out to pay for the taxi whilst in the vehicle. The taxi number was 1373 and the name of the driver Lucio Gaspar. I couldn't get even an empty bag back, I would urge anyone to steer clear of this taxi as he is a very dishonest person.

Spectacular. Great evening, full of fun and good music. Upgrade to the Gold member area if you prefer something a little more civilised. The atmosphere is fantastic however I'm glad we weren't in the ground area as it was very up close and personal. A must if you come to this area, don't miss out it's worth every penny.

Amazing. So much fun. Best night of my life. Drinks were flowing, didn't have to go to the bar once. I always had a drink in my hand. Acts were great and lots of dancing at the end when it turned into a nightclub

Super Night. Recently visited this magic nightclub. An experience to say the least and has to be seen to be believed. The night flew by - literally! Just sorry we had to leave before the end due to our bus collecting us. Definitely a fun night out and not just for the young ones either!

Incredible. I hate clubs but this... this is something else... Get VIP Goldmember status as the queue for non-VIP is huge... HUUUUGGGEEE. and then you get in and you get seated in perfect position for the show because it is a massive spectacle (lets just say 'Flying Midgets') and you get a server who gives you free drinks all evening from 11pm till 3pm and then you are provided with transport there and back. Now the only reason why I haven't given coco-bongo 5 out of 5 is because they kept serving the guy next to me who threw up twice with some splash back on my shoe. Really they should've recognised he's had enough.

Fantastic night. Went with friends on the VIP package and this in definitely worth the money.We went on a Friday night & this is more expensive so try and go mid-week.We arrived with about 45mins to show time and joked we wouldn't make it to the end - well the time flew by. The performances were one after the other, great dancers and acrobatics.Our bar tender was brilliant, brought our drinks when we were low & remembered what we ordered.Toilets were very clean and maintained throughout the night.Brilliant time and we made it to the end if the night wondering where the time had gone - must see!

Excellent show, could be cheaper. I went to Coco Bongo with my friends, we were 6 girls and we could've gotten better price for the entrance. We felt overwealmed with the sales persons outside because they are really intense so we ended up paying full price. It's a little bit expensive but it's worth it. We didn't pay VIP or anything but since we were all girls it was easy for us to find a waiter who took us to the balcony where everything is way better, the view from the show and the room for dancing. Waiters are extremely nice but they will try to make you dance at the bar. It's fun and easier to dance but then you're part of the show. Lot's of americans dancing in the balcony and they get a vent to lift their skirts so you see their butts all night. The show is really amazing and the music is great.

coco bongo mexico. This show was as good for old age people as well as the youngsters who were on the dance floor go for gold membership and as an older person you can see all and bogey on your stool Great show and and movies to be seen on large screen drinks free VERY LIVELY go if you can.

dont bother. we booked vip which meant no view crowded half hr wait for the toilet! most of the entertainment was people from the audience trying to dance on a podeum which you can see in any regular club.our camcorder got takin of us because your not allowed to record yet everyone had there phone out recording???? its a complete waste of time and money

Hilarious night out . Me and my boyfriend went to coco bongo, booked through our hotel, which included the transfer and entrance.It's a bit of a nightmare getting in because we ended up queuing in a very narrow corridor for about half an hour but once you get in it is well worth it.We were on the bottom floor (no VIP for us) and it was a great atmosphere. We had a table and out own waiter who brought us drinks (inclusive in price) all night. The show was so funny and cheesy we had a great night. Didn't know what to expect but would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Playa Del Carmen!!
VIP is the best!. Loved everything about it. Don't want to give anything away otherwise other travellers may not enjoy the experience.

Great after party!. Coco Bongo is known to out beat Vegas shows, however it was quite a disappointment to see that majority of the scenes are reenactments from movies. Some performances were original material, but if you're a fan of watching entertainers lip sync for the most part, then Coco Bongo is it! I definitely enjoyed the after hour dancing however because the audience are truly there to have a great time! We left about 4:00 AM so expect to be there for a long time! Show starts around 11:15 PM and lasts till about 3:00 AM. Also, VIP seating is definitely worth it or else you'll be squeezed with other people like a can of anchovies on the main floor.

Lots of Fun. the girl shots cost money, but the other drinks were included and the place was a riot! I would recommend this for someone at least once for good loud music and a show. (bar type atmosphere)

great night out. Great atmosphere from going in to coming out at 3.30not bad for 63year old hey but the young ones absolutely went crazy and love every minute . paid for V.I.P ticket which is best if you dont want to be huddled upbut better down in the pit for more fun.

great night out. A great night out had by our party of 4, did not know what to expect but exceded expectations.We booked through Thomson holidays and sat in the VIP area, would not of wanted to be on the ground floor as packed.Got back to the hotel at 3.30am, which we have not done in a while, lol

Hilarious zoo with stripping dwarves and lip sync malfunctions. This place is sold as a trip at the hotel. The transfer is a joke and is a large coach with lots of stop offs and they drop off furthest away on the return journey. They say you will not queue but when you get there, a long line of teenagers. We complained and they let us avoid the queue. The inside is a black box with a central stage with lots of young girls dancing on it. I have never seen so many 'dancers' with breast implants in my life. A little bit Spring Break-ish. There is a stage show with trapeze artists, a crazy Beatles medley and a dwarf dressed up as Beetlejuice who then strips. It is hilarious. There are some strangely inappropriate Christ type figures who hang suspended on some red ropes during one routine. A bit weird. Then mixed up with people dancing on a podium. Very funny. If you fancy a laugh, go along. Show starts at about 2315.

Brilliant Night Out`. We went here as a gold member and had VIP after staying at the Grand Palladium in Riviera Maya. We were collected from our hotel at 10pm and dropped home at 5am. The show was fantastic, all drinks included and plenty of them! You cant go to Mexico without visiting it!

Different!. We were lucky to get in through the VIP entrance as there was quite a line at the regular entrance. Inside was air conditioned so that was a real plus. Good music, great performers. Was a broadway like show. The performances were based around many old popular tunes, so very nostalgic. Watching the bar-top dancers was interesting. The aerialists were the highlight. Would have been better if there was a dancefloor area just for dancers. Been there done that, was good to experience it.

Great night!. We went as a group of 8 , aged from 19 - 57 and we all had a great night. The show was amazing and the waiter kept our drinks filled all night. We bought the VIP package which included drinks, transport, a balcony table and privilege entrance, so no queuing. It was an incredible night!

Always worth a visit. This was our second visit after previously visiting in 2012. Personally i thought there was more actual dancers and acrobats back then and now they do appear to rely on video and projecting work. Notwithstanding this its still a great night out. We booked through the Thomas Cook rep and it included a bar crawl and VIP area on a balcony in Coco Bongos all for Approx 75 dollars inclusive of drinks. When in Mexico its a must whatever you age. Dont forget you can sleep on your sunbed the day.

Crazy, lively, full on experience!. Booked Coco bongo as part of my 2 week holiday to Mexico. We were staying in the Riviera Maya area so opted to go to Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen. My boyfriend and I were booked on the bar crawl option as the gold package had sold out! The bar crawl consisted of entry to 3 bars (Coco Maya, ? and Mandala) and all inclusive drinks (very watered down) before heading to coco bongo around 12pm. As we went through our tour operator Thomson we were in their balcony area above the dance floor for the remainder of the evening. The dance floor looked extremely cramped and sweaty, with not much room for manoeuvre. I was very pleased that we were situated above it all, as we had loads of room to dance and had a great view of the show.The show itself is a mad one, hence the name I guess. It's a mixture of Vegas, music videos, acrobats, tribute acts and people dressed as the mask and beetle juice, all in a club setting!I wouldn't go all the time but I'm glad I've experienced it. Not the best club/show I've been too, however I had such a good time so that must count for something!We paid £60 each for the experience and transport, not bad when comparing it to London prices but I still feel they could have dished out better alcohol!We were picked up at 7:20 and dropped back to the hotel at 2:40.Enjoy!

fabulous. Coco Bongo was a fab night out. We went as gold member which i recommend. We skipped the waiting outside and went straight in. We had our own table which was looking over the bar and dance area and was right next to the stage. We had our own waiter service who would bring us free/new drinks as soon as we had finished our last. The show was really good with fab dancing, acrobatics and great presentation. It does get crowded and is very loud but that didn't bother us as i still had space to dance and enjoyed the show. Worth a night out.

Brilliant night. One of the best nights out iv ever had!! Would recommend it to anyone! :) excellent show, quick drink service, brilliant laught aswell, dosent matter what age you are get to coco bongos!!

100% A+. The perfect nightclub. Brilliant entertainment includes the dancers on the bar, singing and dancing acts on stages and overhead. If you go as a Gold Member, you get a table looking over the bars below and close to the stage. You also get table service and every drink accept Champagne, Jagermeister and Red Bull are free. We had Alvaro as our waiter. What a PERFECT gentleman. Well presented, great interaction, efficient, great language skills - the list goes on. Another person who is an extreme asset who I would love to have as a personal friend or even family member. My love to you Al! x X x

too expensive for what you get. 6 of us paid for Vip tickets and we got a table but were jammed in with not much room. We tipped our waiter pretty good before hand but he wasn't the best. Show was good in parts but with no actual proper singing its a bit of a ripoff. Spirits aint the best quality either. Wouldn't recommend to anyone

Amazing night out! What fun!. We had an amazing night at the Coco Bongo in late June 2014! Amazing I tell you! The show is worth the cost of admission. The entertainers are superb. It is LOUD. It is CROWDED. Did I mention that it's loud and crowded? But, it was totally worth the trip. MUST DO!
Wow. A truly amazing experience. A hybrid of Cirque de Soleil, a Vegas show, a concert and a club. If you don't have a night out anywhere else - do this.

Great time and shows were very good.. Although there is no room for dancing except in "your spot" the shows are quite good and entertaining. Drinks a plenty and transportation from our resort all went well. Christian got us there via our resort and was extremely professional, fun and just awesome!

Great night. from getting on the coach the atmosphere was electric then you get to the club what ever your age you must go it is a fantastic evening go v.i.p. if you want a seat but it won't matter the night goes so fast you don't want it to end and if you are lucky enough to get Edwardo as you waiter then you are sooo lucky what a fantastic waiter he is never had a empty glass all night

So much fun!. Having gone to original Coco Bongo in 1999, we decided to give it a try as adults... How much fun! Yes, the place is incredibly packed and as in any club, you need to watch your surroundings. Music is great and the show is what makes the crazy late night so worth it! Definitely going back for more. One tip- do not wear heals!

awesome night out. amazing shows. VERY crowded. our table was in the walkway to the rest rooms.
unlimited drinks, the shows are great!

Amazing - not a night to miss. Me and my boyfriend booked the VIP package for coco bongo and weren't sure what to expect. It definitely exceeded expectations. The show was unbelievable such a wide range of acts and music and the set up of the stages and screens was amazing. All the costumes were brilliant too. We had seats on one of the balconies and waiter service for all inclusive drinks the waiter was so attentive we were never without a drink, he also brought us some shots and a bucket of bottled waters in ice in the early hours when we were getting dehydrated. It is a night not to be missed, it's hard to explain just how good it is.

Coco Loco Bongos. Everyone who goes to Mexico as to go at least once. An amazing night with non stop entertainment and a brilliant atmosphere. A bit of a struggle to get to the toilets but all good fun! I would get your tickets from the ticket office outside Cocos and ask for a table up the side of the dance floor or upstairs..gets too crowded on the dance floor. Also I would get there early.

Noisy but great night. My friend and I visited Coco Bongo while on holiday in February this year . We are both in the "older" age group and didn't know what to expect. However we were glad we went. We booked through our Thomsons rep as we were told we would be on the balcony which was correct We arrived early and whilst waiting outside the staff came and gave us our priority name bands. Following that we had to wait an hour until the doors opened at around 11pm and we were taken to our seats by the waiter who brought us our drinks all evening.At 11.30pm the fun began !.What a show !. There was so much going on ,on the ground floor, up above with the aerialists ,and on the raised stage opposite the balcony., And staff and dancers dancing on the bar below in between serving drinks.There was lots of participation by "willing" guests both young and older who were singled out by the waiters and taken up to the stage where they danced,and had blasts of air aimed at them to blow their clothes up, especially the young ladies !.The dancers on the stage gave a very professional and varied show taking music and dancing from the musicals such and Moulin Rouge and others. Also music from Queen etc.. So much variety it was unbelievable, and the drinks kept coming as much as you wanted [ which of course is included in the price of the admission..If you want a quiet night don't go - it is VERY noisy, booming in fact, so much so the place is bouncing !!..If you want a very good night , then do go it's an experience not to be missed.My friend and I lasted till 4.00 a.m [ But I think it finishes at 4.30 or around then ].As I mentioned at rhe beginning of this review, my friend and I are in the older age group but we both thoroughly enjoyed the experience and were glad that we went.

Fantastic night out. As a group of four we decided to try coco bongo Playa del Carmen. We were a bit apprehensive as we are all in our fifties but what a great night we all had. The service once inside was first class and the shows all night were amazing. We couldnt fault anything about the night at all. The four of us were very impressed from start to finish. Our personal waiter for the evening was called Jesus and couldnt do enough for us. Fantastic night and we would definately go again when we return to Mexico and overall definately worth the extra money to go in the VIP seats

Fabulous !. Visited CoCo Bongo in Playa del Carmen back in May .... have also been to the one in Cancun. I really preferred the one in Playa del Carmen, personally, as it was 'smaller' - and you didn't fell as 'crammed in'. I had had a bit of a panic attack when I went to the Cancun one - as felt too hot. This time we booked VIP seats and was well worth the extra money .. there were 6 of us and we had a brill view, close to the stage and our waiter was amazing all night ! The staff do a brilliant job to make sure everyone is happy and the entertainment is FAB ! Loved it .... can't wait to go again .....

WOW enough said. having been to vegas and most of the theatre lands, this really is as good as everyone says. We will return when we visit in October. the show differs each night so you could even visit twice and see at least half of it different.

Disappointed. Bought the ticket from our agent for this, who did not tell us to take ID for our 18 year old daughter - we almost didn't get in. Bar service was good- expect to tip your waiter. We paid for got service so got seats upstairs. We wouldn't have wanted to have bben in the crowded downstairs. Toilets facilities were not good causing queues and missing part of the show. After hearing about Coco Bongo's in Cancun we were disappointed.

A great experience. If you are going to Playa del Carmen this is must for all ages My wife along with my son and his wife went and I am 69 the show was great and the drinks are premium brands.It's worth going VIP as it saves queuing time

Coco Bongo Scam. Good show, mostly big screen video with on stage performance every 10 minutes or sooner. BUT...what a scam the agents in the hotels are selling. For just U$120 each they promise the best seats and all inclusive drinks. When you get there you are stuffed on the main floor in a crowd of hundreds. They will sell you a balcony seat for a few thousand dollars. Drinks were all inclusive, when the waiter showed up. They try hard to sell you a bottle and when you tell them the drinks were supposed to be free you will find yourself snubbed. Good show but really bad treatment and the agents are not up front about the real costs in the show.

Great show. We are in our fifty's and sixties and we loved the show, it is better then most Las Vegas shows that we have seen. We booked VIP seats as it is a long show and we did not want to stand on the floor with hundreds of teens and twenty year olds drinking like crazy. It is worth the price you have to see it at least one time.

It was great entertainment and party the whole time I was there!. Jesus from the Gran Porto Real resort took our group there. He got us up close to the action and coco bongo kept the drinks coming. The shot girls were alot of fun also. Every one should check out Coco Bongo atleast once. I know I want to go back again!
WOW - bit crowded but worth the time.. Amazing energy level here, started after my bed time and I WAS NOT ready to leave when they closed. It is very crowded but definitely a worthwhile experience.

Don't trust. Coco Bongo is probably the best show I've ever seen, but DO NOT trust that when they say your going to get VIP service, twice now I was lied to and it was very difficult to see the show and enjoy my time with my friends

Wear comfortable shoes!. Our tour bus for this attraction was over an hour late getting us there, so the table we paid to have for the GOLD package we no longer got and had to stand for the whole evening. Yes, we did have a good night, still disappointed that we were not seated at a table we had paid for. When we brought this to the tour promoters attention the next day they gave us a free t-shirt???

Unbelievable. Wow, what a night. We paid for this trip through the coco bongo rep at our hotel and it was incredible. The show is understated in my opinion and is way better than they make out. It can be described as a mime show come nightclub but it is fantastic. All genres and age groups are catered for. I can confirm this as we danced to songs from the Beatles, David Guetta, Madonna, Pitbull amongst others as well as watching performances from Spider-Man, The Mask and others. It is one crazy night and the best night out I have been on in ages. We paid for VIP package which gives you a great view and waiter services. Definitely do this!!!!

Coco Bongo general admission. Third time to Coco Bongo's and experience was as amazing as ever! Great night out for adults, good value for money as drinks all included and depending on who you book with they provide transport in the price also there and back. Waiter service all evening; best party in Mexico!! A must do if travelling to Mexico!

Wicked night out. This place is amazing if you like a mix of clubbing with shows in between, the mask, spider man, batman and baine, micheal jackson and more, the music is good and drinks are free, tip tho, try pay a bit more to sit upstairs or it gets very crowded on the ground floor!
what a blast!!. Awesome sound system, great performances, DJ kept us pumping all night! I would recommend doing the "Gold Member" upgrade as general admission is cramped with no seating.
Crazy party and amazing show. Coco Bongo is one of the most fun times I have ever had at a nightclub. Watching the party unfold from the 3rd floor balcony was epic!
fun great show. if you want to have a great show, bottle service is recommended so you can actually have a table...very crowded but lots of fun

Amazing shows!. Me and my boyfriend and another couple we met there visited here during are stay in Mexico 12-22 of June, what a place the shows are fantastic! Highly recommend going VIP though as we was standing which was lead to been bumped into drinks be spilt ect and it's rather packed out, we seen passed it and enjoyed the night ... It's a must visit place in Mexico ... I'd say anyway! :)
Coco Bongo. Very crowded but worth the price to check out the show at least once if you like that kind of club. Drinks included in admission but low end stuff even with that worth checking out.
Good for americans. this place looks like fun from the outside , and the locals make a great name for it , but in reality , not very good performances or real quality

Don't Go!!. We were told that Coco Bongo was the 'place to go' whilst holidaying in Cancun. Big mistake!! Our first impression on arrival was to turn around and leave, which did not improve once inside...the place is an accident waiting to happen as it's overcrowded and a H&S risk. If a fire broke out it would be pandemonium! We were led through a jostling crowd to one of the upper floors, which was filled to capacity on a wooden supported balcony - one false move and you would be pushed over the top and into the crowd below. We could not see the show, but did hear the music...maybe the show was good? No idea. We had one drink and decided to leave as my friends and I all feared for our lives, and one person felt claustrophobic, even though the venue is large, but it was just the amount of people crammed inside.We managed to escape through an emergency exit door, escorted by staff, then went to find the manager. We asked for a refund, but were told that this was not possible. The manager stated that it was 'ladies night' in the club, hence why it was so busy. We asked why so many people had been let in as we felt unsafe, and she said it was fine...not by British standards!! We also found out that we had been overcharged admission as we paid $65.00 at the resort we were staying in, so were advised to return there the next day to get the overcharge back. We booked through Amstar at our hotel, and the girl agreed to a refund of $15.00 immediately for the overcharge, but not for the remainder. She blamed the venue for the overcrowding, but did admit that she knew it would be bursting at the seems, due to it being ladies night. So basically we were sold a trip under false pretenses. And the 'no refund' was only pointed out to us after we complained and not when we were booking the trip.My advice to anyone thinking of going is this - if you like being a sardine in a can, waiting to be put on the BBQ, then go and have a good time, but if you value your life - STAY AWAY!!

Amazing Club... I call it a Mexican Cirque de soleil. The cost may shock some but what you get is far more amazing. We knew that there was going to be a show but not to this magnitude. Dancing on the bar, flipping in the air, show tunes even Grease.... awesome club music wall to wall people, just an amazing night (Friday). I will be back!!!!

GREAT NIGHT OUT !!!. An AMAZING night out to PARTY with your friends !!! The party starts as soon as you walk in they are giving you welcome cocktails and shots by each checkpoint. The shows are extremely breathtaking and worthwhile, it has three floors, the bartender we had was quick and with great service. It is a very packed spot but its more to watch the shows rather than dancing. The shows were crazy and the music was great. I have no complaints about the club it was perfect !!!!! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED , MUST GO
Beautiful show. We didn't know this place before we were there and was a very good surprise!! The show is beautiful!!! Place to go for a nice night!!

There are no words to describe Coco Bongo. From the second we walked in, I knew this would be a night I would never forget. I actually can't think of a suitable word to describe how crazy and awesome this place is. I wasn't quite sure what to expect as I knew it was a club mixed with shows. However the shows are only 5 mins each and just a medley of songs so doesn't get boring at all. We saw Queen, Elvis, Chicago, Moulin Rouge, Batman & Bane, Samba, Beetlejuice, Ribbon dancers (Excellent) as well as many others. I hate to think how much confetti and steamers they get through a week. There were people of all ages here and I didn't see one miserable face. All I can say is no matter who you are, what age you are - Go to Coco Bongo and I promise you won't be disappointed. I already can't wait to go back on our next visit to Mexico! Oh and we got our photo with the Mask - Totally Smoooooooking!

Great night out!. We had a great night at Congo bongo, we at first thought it was a lot of money for the gold member bands, but was worth it considering you have your own seats, little more space, and good view of the show. The show was crazy and action packed with very gifted performers, the queen tribute was extremely good, also the phantom of the opera, the mix was good with everyone having a dance between the acts. This is better then any club I've been to before, there was a great buzz and we really enjoyed it, was the best night of our holiday.

1 word, AMAZING!. I was very sceptical about coming here however the mrs wanted to come and I'm so glad we did. We went for Goldmember and it was beyond fantastic. It's hard to believe that there isn't a place like this back in the UK. Our waiter (Eduardo) kept our drinks topped up all night and only asked for a tip at the end. The shows themselves were very good and the music excellent. You will find if you are on Goldmember that people do come round offering shots at $5 which is a little pointless as the waiter service is so good that you don't need to pay for any further drinks. The only disappointing part was at the end with the guy selling photos. He was almost encouraging me to pay for a photo despite me saying I couldn't because it would mean I couldn't tip the waiter. Our coco bongo experience was arranged through Thomson and the driver was awful. He was 10 minutes late to pick us up and waited another 30 minutes before setting off, dropping us off in a bus station which felt completely away from any atmosphere surrounding the place. He also wanted us back 30 minutes before advertised. Again he was 10 minutes late and didn't set off for another 20 despite us all being back.

What a good night!. We were sceptical about going but once there we had such a good time! It's common to buy your tickets in advance which I'd recommend as the queue's are so long. Once in there it's very busy but as long as you find a nice spot to stand you're find. We didn't really know what to expect... was it a night club? a show? It's both! The shows are really good and very enjoyable to watch and it's nice you can have a dance inbetween. One note would be that tipping gets you a drink!

...when he plays the maracas they go chic chicky boom chic chicky boom. Tips:- Get there before 10pm.- Wear comfortable shoes. Be ready to be standing up and dancing all night!- Dress comfortably as well. There wasn't a dress code. We saw a wide variety of outfits from tank tops, shorts and flip flops…as well as fancy dresses. - If you are not paying for a table, try to find a spot on the first floor next to the tables. There are steps leading up to the tables and being on the 2nd step is good(higher than the crowd, but not high enough to block the view of the guys seated at the tables behind you)- Also be ready to be emerged within a biiiiiig crowd. Leave your concept of personal space at the door.Shows start at 11:30pm and go every 10-15minutes up to 3am. ***SPOILER ALERT - Skip this paragraph of you don't want spoilers***Acrobats and dancers perform short compilations of songs from well-known singers like Michael Jackson, Madonna, Elvis & Beyonce; bands like Queen & LMFAO; songs from movies like Chicago, Beetle Juice and The Mask. There are also superhero appearances and more. During the shows you see the people dancing at the stage, sometimes "flying" through the place, while videos, videos and more videos are projected on the huge screen. That really adds to the performance. I would say that my favorite performances were the ones about music videos and upbeat music that you could dance to. The ones with superheroes were involved reminded me of a cheesy birthday party performance. The more artistic ones like the Phantom of the Opera or the fabric acrobatics felt out of place as well. That is something that I expect to see at the Broadway Across America or Cirque du Soleil shows but not at a nightlife club. But overall, the shows were good and the party props were pretty cool!***They play some upbeat music in between shows to keep the audience dancing all night looooong!! If you like to dance, the night will be gone before you realize it.There are 2 big opportunities to show off your dance moves. If you want you could dance on top of the bar, sharing it with a dozen other ladies; or you (and even your plus one) could go on a little section of the stage that stays open between shows to dance for the entire audience!!!. If you decide to go for any of these, be prepared for the "Marylyn Monroe" type of air that blows form time to time.  The CocoBongo in Playa del Carmen is tiny and it gets really really crowded. No matter where you are, it feels that you are on somebody's way. We are glad that we got there around 10pm. It was the perfect time to find a good spot to enjoy the show and keep some personal space. The venue definitely falls short for the amount of people allowed into the club every night. Just go in knowing that you'll be in a crowded party.

Night To Remember. We have never experienced anything like this before. Puts British nightclubs to shame, proper experience crossed with Caberet. Highly recommended and tip your waiter well to ensure your looked after extremely well throughout the night

not great. we could hardly get in the door it was so packed. the show wasn't what we expected it to be. we thought it would be like a vegas show and were sadly disappointed when most of it was music videos with young girls dancing. was not impressed

Waiting for a dissaster. Went there because of the hihgly rated recomendations from hotel concierge... Its is way over crowded to the levels of unsafe. As soon as we entered I thought of the disco fire in Bali where all the tourists were burn down. Even though we were told and paid extra that we will have a seating, once we got there the guide said we had no seats I had to bribe him to take us front of the line so we did not wait outside line for and hour so.. The service was horrid but what else would you expect poor servers had such a limited room to manevour, everyone is on top of each other. I kept looking at the balconies waiting them to crash dowm. We thought it was too dangerous (there were other tourists with same mind set) to stay so we left. Unless you are starved and never been to a decent night club its not a place anyone should go.

Excellent show BUT TERRIBLE CROWD/VENUE. The show itself was very entertaining. Drinks kept coming and our server made sure we were taken care of at all times...HOWEVER --- the crowd itself was so RUDE and overpacked that the entire experience was ruined for us. Guests were literally on top of one another, pushing and shoving to get a better view, arguing over standing room. A group of guys thought it'd be funny to toss beer in the faces of the wonderful aerial artists. It was honestly disgusting to see a room full of "adults" behave this way.There was no difference between the VIP/general admission as there was literally no breathing room anywhere in the venue. God Forbid there was a fire, or any situation where emergency evacuation needed to take place... we would have all been goners.TIPS FOR GIRLS: spare yourself the trouble and DO NOT wear HEELS. The stairs are narrow and you will be on your feet from 10-3am.

Good show, good experience. We visited Coco Bongo in Playa in June. We got our tickets through our hotel for the floor with all drinks included. The show begins at 11:30pm and goes to 4. We left about 3am and it seemed like they had already finished the actual show and the club just stayed open later. Our hotel recommended we get in line at 10pm and we are very glad we did. We bought the standing tickets. Honestly the people at the tables didn't seem to have as much fun because they couldn't dance. I was worried about standing that long but we were dancing so it didn't bother me. Where the big, white screens are is where the show will be. They go up and down through the night. We were on the bottom floor, second step up facing the screens and it was perfect. We lucked out that they wedged a table by us so we had that to use all night. IMPORTANT: The girl at our hotel recommended we tip our waiter $10 and he would take care of us. She was not kidding. He brought us drinks 4 at a time. I'm not a fast drinker so he was way ahead of me. If my drink was 2/3 empty he would take it and replace it with a cold one. We never, ever were without a drink through the entire show. We tipped him again halfway through the night. He was really sweet. The show consists of some stage show, some ariel acrobatics, and music videos in between. It started with Phantom of the opera and Chicago. It went all the way to "Girls just wanna have fun" and all the great music that goes with that, Nirvana, Beyonce, Elvis, even a Spiderman/Green Goblin bit. If you're a girl and you like to dance on a bar then knock yourself out. Get a spot on the floor by the bar and you'll get about 15 chances to get on it and dance. They go back and forth from using the big bar in the middle for service and covering it and using it as a stage. If you go relaxed just wanting to have a good time then you will. Take a siesta before hand and you'll make it through.

Rude, overcrowded tourists trap!. I went there just recently and when we went to " pay our cover" we were told $70 for drinks all night or $30 for admissions. We just wanted to go in see a show and dance so we just paid the 30$ out front then they make you walk down the hall to give you a bracelet where they have the prices which is really $17. Rip off. They try to over charge visitors. The worst was when we finally walked I to the club it was so crowded you could not move. They over sold. It was defiently a safety hazard. There are multiple levels and when we finally found a spot to stand dance and watch the show a security guard walked over and told us there is assigned standing and we would have to take one step back that we were not VIP. He soon realize that he put us in the area of traffic and I refused to move people were squeezing through us including the staff. They give souvenir cups which I was designated driver so I for a coke in it as we were leaving. Te cups were large so it was by finished. The security sniffed my drink, stuck their figures in it and told me coke is not allowed to leave the club. After soon realizing that maybe because it's by liquor that it was done they did but it took 15 minute for them to let us leave. Recommend you don't go. There is a dive bar around the corner that plays live music with chill people who are down to earth nice and have great music. Highly recommend that instead of wasting $30.

Party. Went to coco bongo 2nd wk of holiday. We were standing 3rd floor left of stage. Right at the front. What a excellent night. It was like one big party. This was my 2nd best trip. Ziplining was the 1st. Every one go it if u have the chance. I cart stop talking about it :-)

Night to remember!. Great atmosphere and unbelievable performance from all acts.Most definitely the best club I have ever been in, and the acts are highly experienced and skilled. I believe this to be smaller than the Coco Bongos in Cancun but Playa del Carmen was closer to our hotel. So we will definitely be having a trip to Cancun next time.VIP is the place to be, and worth playing the extra, with your own personal table, area and waiter/waitress. All inclusive drinks included in ticket price but highly advise to tip your host to ensure you get the more efficient service and drinks on tap.Great night out.
Best time. Literally best time ever!! Puts Vegas nightclubs to shame!! Definitely a must do!! I want to go back!! Best part of Mexico!!

Waaaayyy to crowdy. They are letting in waaay too many people at the same time. I paid alot of money and managed to se 3min of the show. When i finally found a good place to see the show i was told to go stand by the bar. At the bar its impossible to see anything. And because the bar was so "busy" i never got the drink i ordered. I was stepped on constantly, pushed around etc. I dont know if the show was good or not. I was there for an hour or so, and didnt se anything.

Great night out. Great night out with Thomsons rep. We did the pub crawl ending at Coco Bongos. Had to leave by 1.30am but to be honest that was fine. Great Show. Strictly speaking it was a "CLUB CRAWL" not a Pub Crawl but enjoyed it nevertheless. Great to get back to the Hotel Tequila for a nightcap and snack in the Sports Bar

Meh, too crowded. We had been a few years back and there was a lot more room...they packed the place so tight this time, that even with the extra charge for the table you couldn't move. The show was ok, the music they picked to use was a bit stale but the dancers and performers were sexy and entertaining.

Enjoyed the experience...but a nightmare getting there :-(. First the problems...booked locally at our hotel on the day (Grand Bahia Principe Akumal). Waited outside the lobby at the prescribed time with another couple who'd booked through the TA. Coach arrived and the young female organiser told us we needed the next coach. After they departed, we waited, and waited and waited...eventually went to Public Relations and explained what had happened and was told there was only one coach! After many phone calls a taxi was ordered and we were told to contact a named person at the venue who would sort things out for us. Had to pay for the taxi! Found the contact person and the other couple were shown in. Offered my docket/receipt from the hotel and there ensued much discussion. Much later we were taken to the ticket desk and then a lot more discussion and waiting. After a long time, we were finally reimbursed for the taxi and given our wrist bands, then shown to a table on the lower level...I guess we were upgraded? Then the evening could begin!!!The drinks flowed, the show was quite a spectacle of big screen, acts dancing and miming to tracks and a lot of high tech acrobatics. The frequent blasts of smoke and ticker-tape from the ceiling left us with dry throats (despite all the drinks!) and almost lost voices the next day.Was it all worth it? Despite all the hassle getting there and gaining admission (for which we had pre-paid!) the night was great fun...apart from the fiasco of the coach home...but that's another story! Would we go again...probably, but only with full tickets next time!And yes, we paid for the photo with the Mask!!!

What a Party. Coco Bongo was a great night out! Pros: Show was amazing! Atmosphere was crazy! Waiters and waitresses worked very hard to get everyone served.Cons: A lot of people in a tiny place. We lucked out with a second level booth but it would have been very uncomfortable if we had stayed on the floor the whole night.Would highly recommend!

great night out and fantastic show. I was advised to go to Cocobongo by a friend and I am so glad I did because my friends and I had an amazing night. The show was so entertaining and the staff were great and remembering our orders and brining us our drinks. great music to dance to and the scene was just fantastic.

Great show, great experience!. We took a trip to Coco Bongo last week and found it to be a great experience. We had the Gold Member package which included a great view of the stage from the third tier (get there early to get a choice of seats as you will not be front row if you are late), waiter service (thanks Al! great service!) and alcohol included. The show itself was great and we really enjoyed it, well worth the money and well worth the trip even if it’s just to get a photo with The Mask!

A great finish to my birthday!. We got our tickets from Jose the Coco Bongo rep at our resort. It included transportation to and from the club and our ticket to get in. He went with us to the club and got us in we did pay the $10 to skip the line...well worth it. I did feel a little like a sardine at first, but it was one of the coolest things I have ever done. The music, performers, and party were so much fun. I danced on the bar all night.... something I would have never done at home. The best birthday ever!!!!!!!

Fun place to go to. Great fun and lots to watch all the time and great show throughout the evening. I would get there at 10ish and then watch the show which was great. Go VIP too as you wont need to leave you table we went with a group around 12 and the waiter took one order and remembered all our drinks throughout the night and it is a must see!

There are better nighclubs and shows, but perhaps not that big. We got in fairly quickly thanks to having VIP, although my visit got off to a poor start when I was forced to sign a disclaimer form on the way in - I don't mind signing the form, but it was shoved in my face, the guy wasn't especially polite and he couldn't hold his torch still for me to read it properly. I believe some discussion happened about a minor disability I have as there was some staring and chatting between two blokes, but nothing explained to me or translated.We were placed up a high spot with a good view of the stage. The show had some impressive bits and some amazing performers, but i felt it moved too fast and some of the songs were over just as you recognised what they were. It was overcrowded by the standards of a club back home and it didn't look very safe - lots of people standing on the stairs and lots of people between us and the nearest emergency exit, but we got out at the end of the night with no injuries. My conclusion is that it was an okay night. The others in the party seemed to enjoy it more than me, but I feel there are better night clubs, if you want a nightclub, and there are better shows (try Cirque du Soleil) if you want a show. I'll admit that I don't know of anywhere that combines the two on that scale though.

Mexico 2014 Fantastic. Went to Coco Bongo's after a small pub crawl with the REPs from Thomson, had a great night, fantastic view of the show, was amazing. A must do, you could go in for longer but the 2 hours we did in there was more than enough.
SUPER. That was awsome, on saturday night there's a lot of people so we were dancing on the bar and everything was ok :) we will return there for sure.

Partied the night away. We have been to Coco Bongo two times previously and have had an amazing experience each time. It is so much fun and so entertaining, you don't even realize it is 3 am and time to leave! We would like to check out the Cancun CoCo Bongo too sometime! Great night!
OH MY GOSH. Vegas style shows, flowing drinks, alot of dancing, alot of fun....This was the absolute best club that I have been to.

Didnt think you could have as much fun with your pants on !. Absolutely breathtaking show !Constant sense assault of pure fun, the best night i have ever had anywhere in the world!I smiled so much my face was hurting. Despite the late start and finish it is absolutely impossible to feel anything but a complete adrenaline rush.Would go again in a heartbeat.WHAT A NIGHT !!!!!!!!!

Unbelievable Show!. Myself and my wife went for the 1st time - and loved it. Absolutely unbelievable show from start to finish.Would highly recommend GOLD VIP when going a little pricey but worth every penny you get your own table and seats, your own waiter so you can enjoy the full show.5 stars easily.

Coco Loco!. Awesome night, went as part of the Thomson bar crawl and wish we could've stayed longer! The shows, music and dancers were great and the atmosphere was electric! Very busy though - not for those who are claustrophobic!All you can drink bar with waiter service. Great great night!
The biggest let down of the holiday. think of sardines in a tin and that is exactly what coco bongo is, music is good however playing on the name nothing overly special

Muy loco!!!. If you want to be smothered but party hard this is the place for you! It was definitely the craziest club by far I have ever been in. The shows were bizarre but the atmosphere was insane, so many people, so many drinks, just crazy! You can't even come close to describing the experience!

Felt trapped. Was a little disappointed ended up sitting in the gods had to stand on seats to see show if you have a problem with heights make sure you are down stairs quite scary at times with how many people were in there.

Best ever club in the universe. What can I say one of the best ever nights out but you must do gold member if you want to take it all in that way you can watch the packed floor while your drinks keep flowing as dwarfs swing on trapezes and elvis and Michael jackson and any one who is famous entertain you well good impressionists anyway tickertape ballon cannons everything best night out during whole stay would love to go back

Saw it, don't need to do that again. It was entertaining, with a variety of shows. It was jam packed with people, and very loud. I'm glad I went, but I won't go again. It starts around 11 pm, and ends at 4 pm.

Amazing show, but pricy and tight. This has to be one of the most interesting nightlife venues I've ever seen. It's an "all-inclusive" bar and disco, but while dancing, you watch both stage as well as aerial dance performances and skits. And by aerial, I really mean spiderman and the goblin fighting a choreographed dance fight 30 feet in the air, flying up to the mezzanine level and back to the floor bar. It is something.On the downside, there are not *nearly* enough bathrooms for the hundreds of people inside, so there is always a long line, and it is so crowded that one can feel claustrophobic, at least before having adequate drinks.
Great club with a great concept. We went in the VIP section.Great queen act.Friendly staffGreat acrobats and showsLoved the way it was different and atmosphere was amazing

Complete rip off. The shows were fun once you got hammered, but we got sold on getting in first and getting sit for $65 with all free drinks. When we go in we are told we have to stand the entire time. They actually had people telling you to stand when you sat. The shows were good, but not that good.

coco bongo may 2014. Wow what a place to go!! Mixture of ages, Terriffic show had a brilliant time. Drinks included in ticket price and people running around bringing you drinks all evening,The guy bringing us our drinks even managed to find me a stool to sit on :) The security staff there were very well organised and they were very helpful, Would definately reccomend it and would love to go back.

A good night out. This was the first time that I had left my hotel at night, and as I was travelling solo was taken by the entertainment crew to Coco Bongo. Initially I had my 'safety first' head on, and decided not to drink alcohol that night. The show was fantastic, and the atmosphere was electrifying! I did not have to worry about my safety, and have returned a few times since.

Amazing!. Absolutely out if this world! We had the VIP package which was all inclusive drinks, our own seating and our own waiter to bring our drinks. The show was awesome, enjoyed it so much! Music wax brilliant! I danced all night!

Didn't have high hopes... at first.. Best club we've been to ever, hands down. The show took us by surprise and didn't disappoint once!! Reminiscent of the rave scene at first, then I can't even tell you the experience. You NEED to see for yourself! Worth every single penny, next time we are going right away. Wear comfy shoes!!! =) The price we paid (about 65 per person) included our ride to and from the resort, the entrance fee and all of our drinks! People of all ages attended. Hottest club around!!!

Best experience ever!. Have no words, just spend some monie and go. Trust me is well worth it. I had tons of fun, did not stop laughing and jumping and singing all the songs since the moment I got there. Very good, great show, amazing dancers!

Worst experience of my life . We booked the express tickets that we were assured were not much different than the VIP package (first mistake).. Our bus was late, our host sucked, they dropped us off at a bus station and made us walk to the club in some sketchy alleyway, I we waited in line for almost two hours. Finally we got into the club only to find more line in a small short ceiling stairwell with no ventilation. There were literally hundreds of people pushing everywhere. I got pushed up against a wall my boyfriend was elbowed by a server and told to move which smushed me even more into the wall. People got aggressive trying to push past one another. We kept trying to just be patient but as soon as I saw the actual club was just as packed with people pushing everywhere, I had a huge panic attack and almost passed out. I understand this is Mexico and the laws of capacity are likely different but I freaked out when I asked the security guard where the exit was and he pointed my back in the direction we came in! Are you kidding me? So unsafe!! God forbid there was a fire there - it would be an absolute disaster. I've worked in bars and large crowds for years and never have I felt so suffocated and vulnerable in my life. I was warned it would be very crazy and busy and was totally anticipating that but there is a HUGE difference between packed/crazy/crowded and incredibly dangerous and unsafe. I don't even want to know what it would be like leaving that place after the show.. We paid $140 to be pushed around and suffocated, had to be escorted out by security because I couldn't breath.. and ended up just taking our own cab home to Tulum. Such a nightmare - never again. :(

VIP is worth the extra money!. We loved our trip to coco bongo. We had VIP gold member service so we had table service and a great view! I would recommend upgrading if you don't like being in crowds as the floor was a bit packed. The show was amazing! Great time!

WORST NIGHT OF MY LIFE!! Sexually violated my wife. As for the night we were picked up by shuttle as scheduled everything was great, My Wife got a little nervous through the areas we had to drive through. But we were assured by apple as we asked if we would be okay. We arrived to the show and waited in a very long line which surprisingly moved very fast. As we walked in we could not move, not one inch. There had to be 3,000 people in a area made for a max of 1000 (I am not sure the numbers as there was a few levels) to move a foot would take a lot of force. The wife was frustrated and was a very quiet and scared. We walked up to one of the workers and offered them $100 to get a table. They accepted and shoved a table in the middle of the floor for us so we had some breathing room ( literally we were smashed face to face until I got a small 2ft by 2ft table pulled out for us. They had brought us each a drink with the table. About half way through our first drink my wife had told me she had to go pee. Given the place we were at she had asked me to walk her to the bathroom, (I did not have to use the bathroom) I walked her down stairs to the restrooms. I told her I would wait right here for her. I walked into the men’s bathroom to wash my hands ( I didn’t even pee) when I got grabbed by the shirt and drug upstairs and out the back door by the security workers and a few guys not wearing shirts. I wish pushed up against a back wall outside and was asked if I know what this was about. (In my head I was thinking this was part of the show or they wanted to use me as part of the show, boy was I wrong) My wife must have caught a glimpse of me as she was coming out of the bathroom and seen where they took me. She ran after me and outside to see what was going on. (Keep in mind I been at this show for no longer than 10 minutes) As she got outside she started crying and getting massive anxiety and freaking out as there hundreds police were all around with ak-47s. At this time I realized this was not a joke and something is wrong. The head guy (I am assuming) asked me if I wanted to do this the hard way or the easy way. I started shaking very bad as I have no clue what is going on or if I am being detained or what? He asked me what I am doing illegal in his club? I am in awe thinking am I not wearing the correct clothes? Or what am I doing Illegal? I am taken back and shaking as I must have done something very wrong? I hear so many stories in Mexico as people are just taken away and never seen again. All I had through my head was my 3 kids and what was going to happen to my wife. I was taken away from her and she was held against a wall by 3 men. They took me away from the establishment by foot and left not knowing where I was exactly, I knew where coco bongo was from there but they then just left me. I had no idea where my wife was or what was happening. After a good 15 minutes I started freaking out( seemed like hours) as maybe she was taken away ( again the stories I hear in Mexico all that is going through my head is she got taken away. I could see all the police all over but I was very scared to go them as I have no idea what was the right thing to do or who to trust? I am lost, confused and very scared. At this time I started to try and devise a plan as I will not let my family get lost or broken up.I was sitting down a back street thinking of what I could do to save/ find her. If you knew what was going through my head at this time or what I was willing to do to find her even god would not forgive me. I was about 30 seconds of going in Rambo style to save my wife on what was supposed to be the day we were getting married down there. I was ready to die to find her and was preparing myself to do it! That’s how bad it was. Thankfully I see her running towards me. I yelled her name and she came storming to me. I asked what had happened and she was balling. She told me the idiots told her I was on camera doing illegal drugs in the club, I looked at her in awe and disbelief as to what really happened she knew something was not correct as she knows me very well. She told me she was pushed against a wall in front of entire line of people. Her dress they pulled up and searched her. They excessively dug their fingers in her private part as they were all laughing not quickly either as the fat guy who did this was laughing with his other idiots with him( only in the front not the back) . NO GLOVES and in front of a line of hundreds of people. As she is balling they are laughing. They then pushed her out the place again nowhere to go or not knowing where they took me she started running aimlessly, which is when she found me and explained to me what they did to her. Later in the cab ride they told her they thought I did cocaine, obviously I did not as I will later explain. Let me rant here for a dang second please (excuse my language btw I am shaking while I am writing this) Also please keep in mind none of this is directed towards you in anyway. First off I was High honor student. I played on all 3 levels of highschool soccer and even our state team as well. I raced professional motocross for 6 years, I have a professional career in mixed martial arts for 7 years and was a trainer there after I obtained an injury, I have job in which I make nearly double of anyone my age with perfect attendance and job record and many people to vouch. I am also a nutritionist and in the making of starting my own business on health and wellness. I attend the YMCA 6 days a week with all 3 of my kids. For more proof look up my criminal record you will see not one drug related issue as I am anti drugs and always have been and will be. This is one of the main reasons I am with her because neither of us will ever touch drugs ESPECIALLY that one!! They can look at her record too. We have each our own reasons family wise as to why we never will!!In the long run I do not need to show my credentials. They have no video of me doing no such thing as it never would ever in a million years cross my mind!! I am irate!!! They know damn well they singled me out to mess with for reasons we will never know. Maybe someone else had my description or maybe someone disliked me or maybe the little undercover Mexicans they have working there get paid to bring in people doing drugs and must not have had a good income that night so he needed to make a quick buck off others expenses? I will never know. I hope to GOD they could provide a video of whatever they say I did!! That would be one heck of a trick!!Next why would they search my wife like that? And not so much as look in my pockets as I am the one who they claim did this? Was it for fun? Did they just want to frisk my wife? I will never know. To top it off we had to run to a taxi off the beaten path. Costed me 45$ to get back, the gentlemen was so nice I told him I would tip him $20 when I got back to ocean corral. She waited down stairs with the cab driver as I ran up stairs for an extra $20. I get back and tip the man only for my wife to tell me he wouldn’t let her leave unless she show him her “ ta ta’s “ so he called them , Just great!! After what she been through now she is balling as this man is telling her to do this? She did not tell me until he left because she knew what I would have done. ( smart on her part) After all this on wed night our vacation was pretty much junk. We skipped our Friday night honeymoon dinner and basically stayed away from the rest group we were with and waited in our room. Not to mention touching my wife after another man decided to have a fun time with was not too appealing for either of us which again was not very fun for a honey moon. Now I have a good 4-5 grand stuck in a trip that someone decided to pick on us and almost lost each other so some guy could get a laugh!

GREAT FUN. Visited Coco Bongo with Thomas Cook - paid the extra money and went on the VIP package - this means that you get priority access (no queues) and a table and a waiter. Fantastic night, premium branded drinks all night (and plenty of them) great view on the middle balcony right in the middle of the stage. We are aged 49 and 54 and were not the oldest there ! (ps the bathroom facilities at Coco Bongo were some of the cleanest toilets I saw in Mexico)

Forget the hype. Forget the hype this is terrible.Your packed in like sardines and its nothing more than a Go Go barWe booked through our rep at $180 i would have had more joy with the money watching it float down river

Amazing night out !!!. It is a nightclub/show night. We purchased VIP Goldmember tickets which meant fast track entry into the club, assigned seats and waiter service all night. It was deffinately worth the extra by having assigned seats meant we were in an area that had a small number of guest all with seats so no pushing or showing and you did not have to stand up all night from 11-3.30(thats how long the show is on for), but if you wanted to dance then there was plenty of room. Waiter service was fantastic as he kept the drinks flowing all night before we even reached the bottom it was replaced or replaced even if went warm. The club was air conditioned and we were close to a toilet which only had two cubicles but was spotless as there was a cleaner inside. Having VIP seats also meant you were at the very top where you had the best view of the show which was at the top and fab view of the stage. There were different songs old and new and we loved them all and all the shows such as Michael Jackson, Madonna, Pirated of Caribbean and many others. They also got girls up onto the stage to dance and if you were wearing floaty skirts or dresses they switched on the fans to blow up ur skirt and expose your underwear on big screen to everyone. There was also a person walking around dressed as The Mask and you can have a picture with him which was $20 but we said no, so later on they came round offering it again for $12 and bringing it to you. I would not have wanted to be standing up all night at the bottom being pushed and showed and breaking my neck to see the show. Dont be a scrooge and go VIP !!!

dont do it. packed with way too many people, they should not be allowed to let that many people in! if a fire happened we would have all been dead literally. the entire night people pushed and shoved and even rubbed it was disgusting. no dance floor at all horrible night

Great Show. This was a fantastic night. Some great performances. Not a song that we didn't like.Would recommend the VIP tickets. Assigned seats with waiter service. Service was great hadn't even finished my drink before I was given another.Definitely a must do when visiting the area.

WOW. Best club night I've been to. Would definitely recommend getting the VIP tickets with table service. No idea what was in the shots but loved them and the show itself is something to be seen! Can't wait to go back in September and take my friend. Definitely worth the money!
Fantastic Night Out. Amazing show, best night out I have had in a long time!! Definately recommend goldmember tickets, great bar service and range of drinks!!

Absolutely Bonkers!!. I still don't quite understand what happened to these hours of my life - and I'm not entirely sure that was due to the free flowing drink. So incredibly surreal and completely amazing at the same time. LOVED IT!!
Must see at least once.. The club was very interesting and nothing I had ever experienced before. It was worth seeing but very crowded and loud. That said I am in my 50's.

Would DEFINITELY suggest going to Coco Bongo.. Simply amazing!I would highly recommend Coco Bongo to anyone travelling in the Playa Del Carmen.We went to Coco Bongo on a Wednesday night with a group of 10 people. We did pay a little more to have a lower level private section which was 100% worth it, we had a bartender serving us all night, I was a little worried drinks would be watered down, and we would be waiting for hours to get a drink, but not the case, great choice and drinks, and our bartender was right there to get you a refill when you ran low.The show itself was great, lots of variety to keep the crowd entertained. We got there at around 11 and the show ended at roughly 3:30Am, and to be honest the time flew by.Would DEFINITELY suggest going to Coco Bongo.

Fun night out!. Splash out on a Gold member VIP tickets. As soon as we registered, were ushered to our seats and drinks were served. You get good seats and waiter all evening (thru the night). It was so vibrant! Worth paying the extra for a good view.

Good entertainment, average service, terrible people. Went here with a girlfriend. We payed the $145 VIP tickets on a saturday, got right into the club, got seated with some pretty good seats, no complaints. We paid $10 dollars for bottle service, they brought a brand new bottle of tequila, margarita fresca for a mix, some ice, limes.. shot glasses etc, service was good. The show started and it was pretty great, good music and dancers.. Then we decided to get a different drink from our official server who would be helping us all night.. two kamikazes came to 200 pesos, yet it said it included unlimited drinks domestic and premium for the VIP so that was pretty terrible. One thing he did do was escort us to the bathroom through the vip area, and i tipped him 50 pesos for that. Now to the worst part.. A worker came and asked me if the girl i was with wanted to go on stage, she did, and a kind girl we were talking to next to us also did. When they are on stage they like to blow air beneath you especially if your wearing a skirt.. Girlfriend was wearing tight clothes but unfortunately for the lady beside us she got everything exposed.. So unless your single beware. When the song was done they did not let her leave after demanding to leave several times, and put her in a room with a chain from wall to wall saying she had to go out for the next song because she was "so sexy". After some time past, I yelled at our server to go get her and thankfully he did... If not for the 50 peso tip im not sure though. Also, we both had upset stomachs probably from the ice... Beware!

21st Birthday- I will not forget!!. This place is the most bizare and fun night out I have ever had, and it was to celebrate my 21st birthday! I went with my boyfriend and we had an amazing night, I would say couples, groups of friends/ family would love this too! I would definatly pay extra for VIP tickets as it was quite crowded down on the dance floor.. Unlimited drinks were a big plus and even got a special birthday shout out and shot as we got friendly with PR rep Omar who was also celebrating his birthday.The acts were amazing, very energetic, lively and hilarious! It is well worth a visit, and deffiantly made my holiday special and a very memorable birthday!!

Good fun night out!!. My wife and I are in our 30's, we went on a Thursday as we heard weekends get really busy! We paid $125 each for gold member passes through our Thomas Cook rep at the hotel. This gave us a table and seats, with waiter service all night. It was worth the extra money as we were very well looked after. This price included travel to and from our hotel, but we didnt get there until about 10.40, and we were the last to get seated, not that there was a queue, but they must fill the seats with the best view first, and work round to the edge. We were right at the side of the stage, and although we were close, we couldn't see the far side of the stage. It might be worth getting there earlier to sit centre stage!! That said, the show was well done, with a great atmosphere and a few surprises (beetlejuice!!) I would recommend this to anyone, although if you don't want to stand for 5 hours, a gold member pass is the way to go!!!

Go for Gold. If you don't splash out the extra cash on a Gold Members tickets then I don't believe you are in a position to complain about queuing to get in or struggling to get drinks. We did however choose to pay for the Gold Members tickets and it was worth every penny. We went straight in and was escorted to our seating with a great view. Standard tickets will get you entry onto the bottom floor which is good if you want to be right in the action and maybe dance on the bar in the centre but if you don't like crowds and standing then I suggest you pay the extra. We had great seats looking down onto the stage. We gave the waiter 20 pesos early on and we were never short of 2 drinks at any time. We have premium spirits, cocktails and beer as well as shots of Tequila. We had lots of room to move our seating aside and dance if we wanted. The show is high energy and incredible, suitable for all ages. I went with my boyfriend but it would also be great with friends/family alike. Our transfer was a little late picking us up but there was clear instructions on where they would pick us up and we got dropped back safely. We booked our tickets through Hector, a rep at our hotel.All I can say is pay the extra and you will have a brilliant night with more drink than you can finish

Great time for young or old. I'm 32 and went to Coco Bongos with a few friends and my mother. I went to the one in Cancun 10 years ago so I was hoping to give my friends the same experience I had then. We had a blast! The shows were just as good as I remember. I will admit that the space at the one in Cancun is much better(way bigger) and the prices are discouraging especially when you have like 3 different prices depending on where you sit/stand. I made sure my mom had a place to sit(which she appreciated) and we stood behind her. We were up 1 row higher than the floor, which I liked. Walking in I was a little scared because I didn't want to stand on the floor(way too crowded). If you can try to go on a week-day and pay a bit more for a seat, it's worth it. If you're under say 26 don't worry about it, pay the cheaper price,lol. if you go on a Saturday beware.....SO CROWDED. We went on a Monday.The doors don't open until 11pm so when we arrived at 10:40pm and saw the line I wanted to die. Don't worry, it moves very fast. If you get Cesar as a waiter you will be treated like royality. he is the best!!
Fab Night. Great experience the show was really good having drinks included makes it easier. well worth doing on your trip to playa del carmen!

A must visit. We booked through our Thomas cook rep paying $79 for a bar crawl and entry. It was the best money we spent. The entertainment is amazing and constant and the waiters work really hard to ensure everyone has a drink in their hands at all times!!Would recommend this to anyone!!

So much fun!. Such a good night!! Well worth the money!We booked via our Thomas Cook rep at our hotel and paid extra for Gold VIP tickets as we previously read reviews on this. It was perfect!! Gold VIP allows you to go upstairs and you get your own seat with waitor service who will bring you drink all evening with no tip until the end once you can judge the service. The view from upstairs was the best as there are a lot of acts hanging from the roof etc. Great atmosphere!! I would not have liked to have gone anything other than Gold VIP as it was very crowded downstairs and people queuing for drinks. Only downside is that it requires more toilets especially upstairs and the amount of free drink flowing! You will be missing out if you do not visit Coco Bongo.

Worth the read- was scammed $300 and arrested. My girlfriend and I decided to check out Coco Bongo. At some point one of the waiters came up to me and said straight to my face: "you girlfriend has very nice t**s." I came up to him and said he shouldnt be talking to people this way and instead of apologizing he began cursing at me. I could have punched him in the face, but instead I spilled my drink over the guy's head. Instantly I was apprehended by 3 security guys who escorted me out. Shortly, the manager shows up with a guy I've never seen saying the guy I spilled the drink on is the photographer and my drink damaged his camera; now I need to give them 300 usd right away for it or they will call the police. After 10 minutes of back and forth arguing the officers who were standing right near us the whole time decided to intervene. They heard both our sides, while the manager kept yelling something in Spanish, and only after I pointed out that the "photographer's" shirt is completely dry and how can it be I spilled a drink on him, did he finally went inside. They ended up making me go to the police station because Coco Bongo were pressing charges, to explain my side of the story. Long story short, they said in order for me to be released I need to pay 2000 pasos (160 usd).. Since I had no cash on me, they threw me in a jail cell with 30 other Mexicans while my girlfriend had to go back to the hotel, take out money, come back and pay them.. All in all, after 4 hours in jail I was out of there with 160 usd lighter all thanks to the greediness of Coco Bongo. Stay Away.

Over crowded. I was so excited to go to coco bongos I just couldn't wait. Bought my VIP ticket and I was away. The man Reuben sold then to us at the hotel and he was lovely. The coach collected us from the hotel on time, explained about getting home and how it all worked with the waiter service free drinks and what not. Didn't queue as we were VIP s went straight in security checked and tagged. Taken to our seats with an excellent view, met our waiter who got our drinks so we didn't have to move and inch. The music was great the dancers were great the place start led to fill and kept on filling till we didn't even have room to take a deep breath let alone move. This made us feel very very unsafe. We couldn't get out by ourselves as nobody could move and we asked a server to help us. This is a great place but way to overcrowded and unsafe. Not for the faint hearted or clostrophobes.

What an experience!. My friends and I were looking for somewhere to go dance on our last night of vacation. We booked through a vendor at our hotel and the price included entry,drinks, as well as being picked up and dropped off back at our hotel. We kind of knew what to expect in terms of the crowd there. It was PACKED!!Didn't really bother us. We got in and found a spot on the 2nd floor that was reserved but the security guy was kind enough to give it to us anyway. We had a guy who brought us drinks from the bar whenever we needed it. Let me tell you we never had to look for him he was on top of his game!The music was a great mix, the shows were AWESOME. We particularly loved the acrobats and the Michael Jackson show. We couldn't believe we lasted 5 hours on our feet dancing the whole time, that's how great this place is.If you're thinking about going just do it. It was really a unique experience.

Nice shows but very uncomfortable. Went to Coco Bongo last night (friday) and we had a good time. Shows are good but the place was extremely crowded....so crowded that was unsafe. Hundreds of people in a relatively small place, hot, humid, dirty and a 40 minutes line to get in. I would never visit it again. But if you are planning to visit it do not hesitate getting a table. Otherwise you wont enjoy the night unless you are drunk.

Good show . Went to Coco Bongo at Playa last night. Great show and music. But we made a huge mistake not taking VIP table. We were standing on the ground floor, a lot of people were drunk and dancing while holding their drinks in their hands. Be aware! They will pour the drinks on you especially from upper floor. It was a nightmare! We had to leave early because we didn't want to end up taking a alcohol shower.
