If you don't want to get bothered by the cleaning guy who kept sweeping the floor and drunk idiots who kept dumping the alcohol on you while they were dancing, get a VIP table on the second floor.

Good night. This was a really enjoyable evening. It was arranged through our travel reps Thomson. However the silly roes told us to dress up, you don't really need to, men smart shirts & shirt, ladies what ever is smart clothing you have! The staff there really looked after us & helped to make it & enjoyable evening.

Amazing night out!!!. We went to coco bongo on many friends recommendations and we're not disappointed!!! There are quite mixed reviews on this club but the best way to do it is to get gold tickets that sit above the crazy crowds below described in other reviews. You can go down to the crowds if you want but having the seating is by far the best way to enjoy it! The ticket price included drinks and the waiter was very attentive. We had prime seats straight infront of the main stage and I cannot stop raving about how Amazing it was! We organised our trip with Amstar based at our secrets resort and it included a free shuttle bus. There is a reason you pay more for these tickets but every dollar was worth it! Enjoy!!

love me some Coco Bongo. I have been to Coco Bongo 5 times, 2 in Cancun and 3 in Playa. I went to the original first and was excited when I realized there was one in Playa as well. The Playa Coco Bongo is smaller of course, but the atmosphere and vibe is still just as awesome. No one should leave Mexico without experiencing Coco Bongo at least once. Whether you are into clubs and loud music or not, this is definitely an experience! There are shows, concerts, dancing, lights, acrobatics, the list goes on. Although it is definitely crowded and big, the performances and shows themselves are impressive. I have brought several family and friends to Playa and have taken them all there. All of them were impressed, and they enjoy fun in different ways. I have gone there to drink and dance my butt off, and other times I have gone to simply watch and enjoy the performances. You can do either, or both. That's the beauty. Don't be put off by the cub aspect. If you do go, expect crowds and noise, but you really will enjoy the performances. This is definitely a place that shouldn't be missed!

Best club ever. I'm still raving on about Coco Bongo this was seriously the best club I've ever been too and I didn't want to go home when it finished at 4 am! Even though usually I'm ready for bed by 10!I don't want to ruin the suprise all I would say is it is a mix between a club and a show and is guaranteed to have you up on your feet dancing the night away! The only thing I would recommend is getting the vip seats as you have a great view of the stage and the waiter will top your drink up all night, we didn't have an empty glass all night!Coco Bongo... simply amazing!!

Coco Bongo is a Death Trap! Save your money!. I recently just went to the Mayan Riviera and my friends and I decided one night to book the Coco Bongo package with Sunwing. We paid $65 US for unlimited drinks and cover. As soon as we arrived they packed so many people into the place that nobody could move at all and it was so chaotic. The capacity was well over the limit that they can hold. We couldn't even get our unlimited drinks never mind use the bathroom. One of the staff members spilt a whole pitcher of sprite all over me and didn't even acknowledge what had happened. I really hope there isn't ever a fire because all of the exits were blocked by people and I have no clue how they would evacuate everyone.After all the chaos at Coco Bongo my friends and I decided to go to the Blue parrot. The Blue parrot was a lot of fun and we were actually able to get drinks and dance.Save your money and skip Coco Bongo!

Coco Bongo is a Death Trap !. Just returned from a week outside Playa Del Carmen. We visited Coco Bongo on a tour booked through our hotel Sunwing reps. The cost was $65 US for transportation and "open bar" at Coco Bongo. Coco Bongo was a complete let down. The staff tried to pack so many people into the bar you literally had someone squished up against you on all 4 sides of you. You couldn't move to get to the bathroom and forget getting to the bar for your "open bar" drink. The amount of people inside the club was completely unsafe. Good luck to the owners/management should an emergency like a fire ever erupt. Our group stayed for approximately 30 mins but after our friend had a drink dumped on her decided it was time to leave. We walked down to 5th Ave and had a great night at The Blue Parrot. Save your money and skip Coco Bongo on your next trip to Playa or Cancun. Not an enjoyable night out when you can't move and are anxious about your safety.

We love coco bongo. We loved coco bongo!!! Brilliant show and atmosphere - we went for gold member tickets so had pur own seats directly opposite the stage with fantastic views of the show. Unlimited drinks were fab and we constantly had a drink in place in front of us - just gave the waiter a tip every so often. It looked very busy below so we were grateful of the space and the seats. Defo the highlight of the holiday!!

High Energy. It’s an experience, the show performances were good and we paid $125 each on a Tuesday night, and were seated on second floor, on a stool with a rail as our table, good view other than a post I had to navigate my sight line around. Waiter was fine, we left at 2:30 am, could not find the exit on our own, but one of the employees held my hand and lead us to exit. they were all very polite, Glad we went, probably not do again just because it starts too late for our preference.

great show but not a good place to dance. This place is cool and puts on a great show but they pack you in so tight it's very hard to move around and you definitely can't dance unless you are a girl you happens to get a spot on top of the bar to dance by yourself. You pay one price that includes your drinks but it was so crowded you couldn't get through to the bars to get a drink.. You can pay extra once you get in to have like your own seating area with a table and with that you have a waiter. I guess if I knew what I was going into I would have liked it better but I wanted to go to a place to really just dance and not be bumped into a thousand times during the night.

Worst party ever... By far. Disrespectfully overcrowded. The structure forbid you to move. The service is terrible. Since we pay fixed price for open bar, the staff does not work for tips and terrible manners. The alternate music and show breaks the mood. Besides, the shows are poor covers of outdated performances.

Wild. It was a complete disaster trying to get in the door. The employees scammed $10 each out of us to "get in quicker" when actually people were streaming past us with their express pass bracelets while we stood in the tight stairwell. Booked the trip through BestDay Tours. They knowingly did not give us enough tickets, and we were supposed to get them at the door, but the lady at the counter laughed in our face. Got our money back the next morning, but it was quite frustrating initially. Once in the door, and after a few drinks to relax the intense feeling of suffocation and claustrophobia, the atmosphere was very exciting and enjoyable. Could have stayed there all night long.

Great show BUT..... beware the typical pittfalls:they fill this place way past capacity. you could not move in there! you had to stand in onespot and hope that a waiter takes pitty on you. open bar yeilded 3 beers total all night. it was that crowded. beer is not cold, that also was a big minus. the packages offered at the hotel are the best deals, but the "special area" where we where supposed to be amounted to a hallway with zero visibility of the show. all in all it is a world-class show run by very incompetent management

Amazing Experience. We'd had an exhausting time in Mexico and an hour before going to Coco Bongo were thinking what madness had made us decide to leave our hotel at 22:00 to travel to a nightclub. On arrival it was chaos, people everywhere and even a team of people making a new round-about next to the club.On entering we received a free cocktail and walked downstairs to the main dance floor; then BAM! It was madness. The whole show was uplifting, entertaining, energetic and ultimately the best club night ever.Its just too hard to explain how Spiderman, Pirates of the Caribbean and hundreds of balloons can make a great evening, but they did. I'm nearly 48 and have travelled extensively, but this was still the BEST CLUB NIGHT EVER!I can't recommend it enough.Just make sure you tip your server as you'll then have an endless supply of drinks arriving every few minutes.

Most fun we had!. All I can say is Coco Bongo is an absolute must-see, and this is coming from someone who never goes to clubs. The show far exceeded our expectations: the acrobats, the music, choreography, and the servers were dynamite. I would recommend Coco Bongo to anyone - truly dynamite!

Claustrophobic!!!. This place is a lot of fun. The entertainment is awesome. But, the whole time I was there I was reminded of the accident in Brazil almost a year ago when 200 people died at a night club. We were packed like sardines and God forbid if there had been an accident there is no way we could have got out. There is just ONE exit and the exit is not marked clearly. There is no way to get to the exit quickly. It is next to impossible to even try to get to the bathrooms when the show is going on. The servers kept asking us if we wanted anything to drink. I was afraid to drink a single drop of anything just in case I had to use the bathroom. This would never be allowed in the USA.

Everyone should go!!. We loved Coco Bongo's so much!!The best night club we have ever been to. So much going on every where!! We went twice, 1st time on a Tuesday with a standard pass and the second time on a Saturday with a Gold Member pass!! I highly recommend a Gold Member pass, you get better drinks and somewhere to sit down if you feel like it.The waiters we had both times were super friendly, and if you tip well you will be looked after. With the VIP they made sure you never had a empty glass and feed you with lots of different shots. Shows are amazing, and night club was so much fun!!

BETTER THEN NEW YEAR'S EVE IN TIMES SQUARE!!!!!!!!!. Its been a year since my Honey & I were there, and we're still talking about it!! The entertainment is great, you would think your seeing a Las Vegas Show!!!It's a young crowd fro the most part, but all were so nice, we were just part of the big Party!!!  Definitely, a fun night!!!

The CocoBongo is a must see!. I went with some of our renters and did not stop having fun until the wee hours of the morning! Between the fee (included with entrance fee) drinks the non stop Ariel show...and the great music the smile did not come off my face...oh and did I mention that when I started to feel a bit tired around 1:00 am the oxygen that they fill the room with makes you feel 20 something again...dance....dance...dance! So much fun...this should not be missed...even just for the giggles!

For young people. We felt out of place but wanted to experience it at least once in a lifetime, lol - COCO BONGO! Crazy, loud, music, show, dancers, streamers, balloons, you name it, it's there. If you're Young and are in Playa del Carmen, Coco Bongo is nice I guess.

Coco Bongo was fabulous!. Let me say that I agree with other reviewers that "if you can't have fun here, you can't have fun..period." We were happy to see upon our arrival that their were so very many age groups..from the very young party crowd in their tiny little outfits to the retirees looking for some entertainment and fun. We are in the middle...young 40 somethings on a holiday and looking for some drinking, entertainment and dancing! here we got it ALL.The wait to get in was about 20 minutes (perhaps a lil less) and once inside we were escorted to our "area". Its a SPOT (but more than enough) that is all yours...we were introduced to our server and asked if we were ready to drink and what we wanted....from that point it was "game on"The place filled up pretty quickly and the folks all around us introduced themselves and quickly started chatting it up (very friendly fun atmosphere). There were dancing girlies on the bar with their bums peeking out (FUN) and big screen tvs counting down the time till the SHOW began. In our case it showed 22 minutes till show time. The music was loud and fun and from many generations (no gaps). Hubby and I people watched for the first 15 minutes or so while we acclimatized and started to feel our dancing shoes!We NEVER waited for a drink. Not once. We NEVER waited to find a washroom or had any trouble in that area at all. I would suggest trying to travel to the washroom together (I did get groped when I went alone ..hahaha). The washrooms were clean and fresh and fully stocked. The servers were fast and fun if a little pushy at times (we did end up doing tequila shots twice because we simply couldn't get the young lady to take no for an answer..:))We even danced on the bar! Not too bad for middle agers! lmao (have to mention here that while I was asked to dance on the bar, hubby was asked to get down..boooo...they told him the bar was only for "sexy ladies". He did manage to stay dancing on the stairs for at least an hour while I boogied to his left on the bar! We had a fabulous time...my only complaint would be how ill we were the next day (totally of our own doing)! The shows were fantastic..think Circ de Solei with dancing in the seats between sets! We had a fabulous time! Would totally go again!Ps. We walked home at 4am...totally had no issues! Felt totally safe and had three cab drivers stop to ask if we needed/wanted a ride. Our advice..GOOOOOO, put on your dancing shoes! Have fun!

What a blast!!!. A taste of spring break without it being spring break. If you are looking for something to do in the wee hours of the morning this is for you. If you want to be closer to the action I recommend the bottle service. If you prefer to be away from the crowd the VIP ticket will work for you. VIP is more eye level with the acrobatics also. It just depends on what suits you.

Great show. The perfect mix between a cirque de soleil and club. Very entertaining! Recommend VIP as friends who were on the ground level had to look straight up to see the stage and couldn't see well. Would certainly go again :)

If you know how to have fun? Don't pass up Coco Bongo!. Wow! What an experience this was! Coco Bongo has something for EVERYONE! Acrobatics, impersonations,dance music from all genres, brief Broadway-type performances, open bar, and a very attentive wait staff. CB is something that you have to see to believe a literal virtual experience to the senses and a total adrenaline rush with music for young and old including: Elvis, Grease, Michael Jackson, Madonna, Chicago, Moulin Rouge, many contemporary and mexican (J Lo and Marc Antony) music as well as Circe De Solis type acrobatics. I saw people from all walks of life and they were all having a great time. There is singing, dancing, confetti, cold steam, and much, much more. The entertainment is AMAZING. Totally worth every penny and I would do it again in a heartbeat. VERY SAFE. In fact, they pat everyone down that enters and take all medications, powders, gels, and liquids for safe keeping while you are inside. Either leave them at the resort, or be prepared to "locker" them for the evening. This is for your safety (So noone can slip anything into your drink) or so there are no drugs or weapons inside the club. Every precaution is taken here so you can relax about that. :) Our waiter (I wish I could remember his name) was AWESOME and was very consistent, even shining the flashlight on you, not only to ask if you need more drink, but to make sure you are "okay" in general. Superb! Marco is the sales rep that frequented our resort Dreams Riviera and recruited us to come give Coco Bongo a try. I had the time of my life and have never experienced anything like it. TIPS:* If you book their special package for tourists that includes transportation remember that you will arrive JUST PRIOR to the show beginning and will most likely not have a table nor a seat. Standing room only on the floor at this point, so if you need to sit, or are claustrophobic, you will need to book separate transportation and get there when they open to reserve a "seat" or "table" then you could take regular transportation back. This is something we wish we had been aware of.* It is VERY crowded. Once you get used to it and the show starts, you will forget all about this if it tends to bother you, but once again, any issue can be prevented by arriving early.* ENJOY the show and enjoy every moment!Thanks Marco for convincing us that we would LOVE this experience. YOU WERE RIGHT!
wonderful. it was fantastic...treat you like royalty great time had by all....it is a late night, but you will have a blast.

Not just a nightclub. We booked this nightclub really for our daughter who was holidaying with us and when the rep told me we would be returning at about 4.30am I defiantly thought we had made a mistake as we are in our 50's. it was great it is more of a show than a nightclub and we could have styled longer

Give it a go, it wont let you down. My wife and I went on a Wednesday night which is ladies night ($15 dollars cheaper for the ladies) which we booked with a rep at our hotel we are aged 39 and 40 and the thought of a night at a night club is not something we have done for a while but this was the best day of our stay, we only bought the cheaper tickets and glad we did the V.I.P. looked a little out of the action, a server placed us at a table and after a $10 tip the drinks never stopped he would just bring us something every 20 mins we were never without a drink. The club itself was fantastic there is always something going on whether it's a tribute show, a aerial display, or just music playing on the big screens you just cant help getting caught up in the night and 3.30am soon seems to come around, if we ever went back to playa del carmen then coco bongo's will be at the top of out list of thing to do AGAIN.

Best time ever . My boyfriend I went to the CoCo bong April 4th 2014 and what a blast we had! I would totally recommend coming here! Its perfect for all ages!!! Service is amazing, before I was done with my drink the next one was ready and waiting !!! We danced the night away and had a fab time !!! Just go you will not regret it !!! One of my favorite places !!!!

COCO BONGO.....coco bonkers. Visited Coco bongo when in mexico ...riviera maya area in march 2014 and it was bonkers....owned by Jim Carey I think ...it was a great night out...if you can , go V.I.P....its slightly more expensive but well worth it ...we had guaranteed seats which was yours even if you left them for any reason.....plus all your drinks are in the price...which they were sorry of I bet...ha..late night though usually in bed by 9.....this night 5....towels straight on the loungers....ha...visually awesome show...flat in parts but thats understandable due to the intensity of the acts......they need that break in between acts.....other than that we were blown away.....awesome.....awesome....

Crazy fun!!. We went on a Saturday night and it was a blast!!!! Its hard to get a table if you just pay the normal price, But we found a great American couple and they let us party with them. The shows were so great. We danced on the bar!! Our bartender was always there when We ran out of drinks. Excellent service!!

My only advice on visiting Mexico - go to coco bongos!. If you're not planning to do any excursions during your holiday you NEED to make an exception for this place! Just the outside of the club looks amazing. Me and my friend went Goldmember in March, so had seats for the evening up the top and a waiter to bring our all inclusive drinks constantly. My last glass was never empty before the next one was put down in front of me - the waiter brought us a variety of cocktails and shots, and bottled water is available for when your head starts spinning!The show itself is amazing - the Mexicans really know how to throw a party. We spent all night singing and dancing, and got to go on stage for the 'rio carnival' section. It was literally the best, most exciting night out I've ever been on. The show included the likes of Lady Gaga, Michael Jackson, LMFAO, Chicago, Moulin Rouge, Pirates of the Caribbean, Spiderman vs the Green Goblin, Madonna, Elvis, The Beegees, Queen and Rihanna. No matter what age you are, whether you're going there to party, to drink, to dance or simply to enjoy the show. You are guarenteed to have an amazing time, it's worth every penny.

Best night out ever!. My sister and I loved our night out at the Coco Bongo! It was a super fun musical experience and definitely not an over crowded, cramped disco like you might expect in a nightclub. Instead, we had assigned tables, our own waiter and a perfect view of the incredible performers who were the best impersonators I have ever seen. A lot better than some Vegas shows even!!!

night of my life. Omg!!!! That was amazing!!!! a total blast!!! Everyone going to mexico should go there. Tha show was good and the waiters was very nice. Don't pay for the vip zone it is a very tranquil zone and yes it's nice to have a seat during the show but for dancing it's not that nice and there's not much ambiance in the vip zone

Amazing night!. Me and my boyfriend when on a Thursday night paid a little extra for a gold member wrist band. Was exciting from the second we got there. Got whisked through the crowd by a member of staff and shown to our table. Waiter service all night with premium spirits. Show was absolutely amazing. Danced all night!!
Amazing, a must go. Can't think of anything to improve the night. Didn't think I would be able to stay awake for it, but then didn't want to leave when it finished!!!! Just go, you won't regret it!

Something that fits into your vacation. I have to admit. Kids forced me into this place, I'm in the 50's and clubbing isn't my things anymore. but i've started to go back to music shows back home and loved it. this place is clean, secure and extremely well managed. I ended up looking at my watch and it was already 03h45 in the morning !!!! what a night. Ok it took me longer to get out of the bed the next morning. But it was all worthed !!! bravo to the Coco bongo crew and see you next time i'm in the area....

It's a must do .... Excellent, fun filled evening. I definitely recommend the VIP ticket - this gives you access to the balconies and your drinks are paid for, except the Tequila shots. I went with my husband and his parents (both in their early 70's). The show is fantastic and the atmosphere is electric. The dancers and acrobats are very talented. Our waiter was brilliant. Kept us topped up with drinks, including water, if that is what you want. For me this night should be on your list of "Places to visit" whilst in Playa del Carmen.

Brilliant. Yes it is expensive for a night out and yes at my age it took 2 days to recover but it was a great experience. There was something going on for the entire time.We booked through Thomson for their VIP seats and were not disappointed. You get a birds eye view and a waiter that cannot do enough for you. They do not get paid so rely on tips and boy did he earn it. I lost count how many ice cold bottles of Sol I drank, they kept appearing in front of me without me realising. Word of warning though from talking to people it would seem that the branded spirits are watered down. I only had tequila and that wasn't.

Long lines, watered down alcohol, but one hell of a party!. We made the mistake of booking a tour bus to take us to Coco Bongo's after being told that our "Express Pass" bracelet for $60 would get us in immediately with no lineups. The line was almost 2 blocks long and 8 people wide on a Thursday night! I skipped ahead and asked one of the people at the door how I could skip the line and get right in, and I was told that there was no way to do so if I had the express pass bracelet. I would have to wait in line. I hid my bracelet under my watch and asked another doorman and he told me I could get right in for $10USD each, so I texted my friends to come to the front (I was so far away they couldn't see me) and we got in right away. I was tempted to tear off the bracelet as soon as I got in the door, but they ended up scanning my bracelet after a walk down the stairs and a long corridor. The $10 was well worth it as we got a great table right away in a great location. Drinks were a bit watered down, and our waiter just kept on refilling them with the same drinks without asking. This was great for me, but my fiance and her girlfriends wanted different drinks each time and had a hard time doing so. Our waiter didn't want a tip until the end of the night, but then seemed disappointed by $20USD from the four of us. Not sure what he was expecting, but I thought it was a fine amount. I saw someone else in our area tip $100USD for his group of 7, so maybe I'm a cheap bugger. The shows were great and went on all night. It was not as much of a meat market as I expected, as I observed most groups of people sticking to themselves and not really intermingling much. I was trying to play wingman to my fiance's friends, but the constant stream of entertainment from the bar made it more difficult than expected. It was however a great time with fairly good shows right until closing time at a little before 4am. I would definitely look at other options for transportation and entrance to Coco Bongo's for next time, as the $60 Express Pass seemed worthless while the $120 VIP Pass seemed overpriced.

You won't be disappointed!!. We booked our trip to coco bongos with Marco in our resort and initially we were dubious as we didnt know what to expect and at $125 each it wasnt cheap!What can i say except DO IT!!! We had booked the vip option and this is the only way to enjoy coco bongos I think. Firstly you dont need to Q you can go straight in, you have an area reserved with free alcohol and waiter service all night ( which also includes an escort to and from the toilets for the ladies - with 1400 people in the club this is priceless in my opinion!!) we were served by the lovely Williams The show itself was fantastic and the atmosphere was electric from the moment we went inside - we didnt want the night to end!My only gripe is the girls selling the shots get very annoyong after a least 20 times of saying no thank you they still tried to sell us shots! take the hint we have free alcohol why would we pay for a shot!!!
Too Much Fun. The shows were very well done and the beautiful women dancing on the bar where very entertaining. We would go again for sure.

What an amazing show! Totally worth the $. WOW. This bar/show is like a mix of music videos, dancing, live acts from shows/singers/bands like Chicago (show), Madonna, Michael Jackson, Queen, Beyoncé, etc. and then there's these crazy Cirque du Soleil type acts where people are hanging from sheets and bouncing from bungee cords! It is truly spectacular. We paid for the VIP fee, which included bus transportation from hotel, no line-up, VIP section on the third floor, our own table, waiter, unlimited drinks all night, and there was even a guy to lead women safely to the ladies room. I would go back again for sure, it was so fun! The actors/singers did a phenomenal job and got all the famous dance moves right. The show goes from 11pm-3am, and I thought oh my god, I can barely make it to 10 these days let alone 3am!! But it was so much fun that when it was over, I was thinking what? It's already 3am? No way, I want it to keep going! It was awesome.

Great Night Out. If you can't have fun here, you probably just can't have fun. It's a club, it's a show, it's a drinkfest, it's all that and more. Crowd is about 80% under 25, but there were folks of all ages (we're late 40's), some were I'd guess in their 70's. We were warned to get ourselves up to the second or third floor where there's a little more personal space, but we got there late and ended up on the main floor and stayed there for the night. The music was loud, but did not have that annoying heavy bass "boom-boom-boom" going on which made it much easier to take. The management runs a very slick operation. Server's were on top of us with refills as soon as our glasses were empty. The performances and video were incredible. Spiderman, Queen, Madonna, LMFAO, Kiss...they were all there performing...the guy who impersonates Freddy Mercury is really good, but then they all were.Warning - if you don't like getting wet, you shouldn't go swimming...if you don't like loud music or being in a crowded environment, then you shouldn't go to a club. WARNING - if you have 18-25 year old daughters, you may want to skip this night...ignorance is bliss they say - your really don't want to see how some of these girls act in this environment.

Pushed, shoved , herded like cattle. Great marketing machine but the end product is very dissapointing. You pay about 80usd and then have to queue for over an hour outside - the line was about 500 metres . On entering you realise that you are one of over 2000 people crammed in this tiny tiny room . Then you begin to get pushed, shoved by the waiters who are trying to sit the vip guests who have apparently paid more and you are honestly treated like cattle. There's no where to move so you just get squashed . Then to ruin the night they do this tribute to Maradona so you can image being English how that went down - the majority of English people around us just left . So very disappointing waste of money and one of our nights . We were up for a great night out but the venue is far too small and oversold and the staff are rude and just walk over you as if you were not even there

Great night out.. Bought a ticket for Coco Bongo from a rep at our hotel in Riveira Maya. Wasn't sure what to expect especially when the bus came to collect us.When we got there, it was packing. Really busy, which would usually annoy me but we had our own area to stand at and our own waiter. The show was really good, quite cheesy but everyone was in a great mood and there was a really great atmosphere.Overall a great night, and I would definitely go back.

Absolutely Genius. I have been at Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen in a group of 6 March 2013. We bought our tickets at the hotel we stayed and it was a good idea bacause we were able to enter in using the VIP entrance. I was perfect because we didn't have to wait to enter.We choose to be at the main floor and not on a balcony. I suggest to anyone to do the same thing because there are more activities at the main floor and we are at the middle of the show.We never had to wait for drinks. I gave some tips (around 15$) and the waiter was all the time for me.The shows are awesome and the music in continue.Next I go to Playa del Carmen or in Cancun, I will return there for sure.

loved it. We were on our honeymoon, my partner likes the nightlife and I am not a fan so I wasn't impressed when he dragged me there. Glad he did - we both loved it.The atmosphere is crazy fun, the entertainment is fantastic. Lasted until the end and time flied. Lots of different shows, bubbles/balloons and confetti falls from the roof and drinks and dance music between shows. There was many different age groups also. Drinks - not that good! better to drink beer at least then you know there is alcohol in it. Was drinking lemonade vodka but after 4 just felt full of lemonade. Be careful of the girls walking around with shots, you think its for free then they have a small sign low down saying what the cost is (we saw a few people get screwed over).Its annoying that there is staff in the rest rooms who then want tips for their assistance, but I guess its common. I just don't need someone to open the toilet door, give me handtowel or dry my hands.We walked back to The Royal In, only took about 10 - 15 min and we felt completely safe, there was a lot of other people around, a lot of street lights and police/security around. The hotel also offers to purchase tickets with them they then essort you in a group and sort you out when you get there which is great if you feel unsafe but don't do it this way if you are in a wheelchair as you can only access the bottom floor.Wheelchair access - my husband is in a wheelchair and we couldn't believe how accessible everything was, more so than most places. We purchased our tickets the day before from coco bongos and were told "they will look after you when you get here". We decided to get there about 15 min prior opening where staff took us straight through, putting out ramps at the step at the door (which we could have easily managed but they insisted). They then had us set up on the bottom floor at a table which was great as there wasn't much seating room. The staff then helped move people on when he had to use the restroom which was a wheelchair accessible bathroom only 10 m away and when we wanted to leave.Would highly recommend to go it was a lot of fun and something completely different.

1 off the bucket list. We have been to Mexico a few times now but this was our 1st visit without the kids so we went with a group to Coco Bongos. This bar is fabulous right from the security getting in and out, the great server our group had, to the highly energenic stage show. Our group really had a great time and would recommend going to Coco Bongos if you want a good time away from the resort.

Fabulous Fun!. We visited Coco Bongo on a Monday night, we also splashed out on VIP tickets. VIP was well worth it we had our own waiter and he was super attentive. We had a great view of the show an were dancing non stop for the whole show. For the price of the VIP tickets which included drink and transport it is well worth it.
Brilliant Night Out. Just a great night with lots of dancing and loads of fun, for the older generation I would recommend taking the VIP tickets so that you have a seat with a great view.

Been here twice always a good time!!. It's an all night disco but with a twist..tributes to singers and bands.. acrobatics with awesome music..if u go via u get open bar and good seats ..servers were great was a blast!

BEST TIME I EVER HAD. Let me first start of by saying Coco Bongo is AMAZING! We did this as an excursion and I'm so glad we did! The show starts at 1030! **Try to get there earlier so you can get a seat on the higher levels** When I went it was just my boyfriend and I but we saw many older people enjoying the show as well! This place is seriously crazy! Its so fun, the shows great and the waiters are awesome!!The best way I could describe this place is a nightclub/ cirque de soliel/ show all in one! Truly you have to go here this once in your life! When you buy your ticket (75$) it includes your entry and ALL your drinks.. yes yes i did say ALL your drinks! Every single one of them!! So don't worry about bringing extra cash- just a tp for your waiter! :Our waiter was amazing, his name was Estarno.. he brought us new drinks EVERYTIME we were out & we didn't even have to ask!!! We stayed on the bottom level, mostly because we couldn't find another spot as we were late, but Im SOOO GLAD we stayed on the bottom level! You can watch the show, get drinks the quickest and dance the night away!! It was really cool they transformed the middle of the dance floor into a bar, where girls could get on it and dance as well as watch the show!IF YOU READING THIS REVIEW PLEASE GO! I am not a night person but i had no troubles staying up! The energy is amazing! Theres confetti and balloons flying everywhere, the lights everything was amazing!!!!! The show was fantastic too, it was on a screen but than the screen came to life with real people dancing and singing! They re-enacted Lady gaga, beatles, elvis etc SOO MANY celebrities! And while they are switching between acts they place top hits, great music to dance too! If i go back to playa del carmen i am definitely going again! Such a great time, GET LOOSE AND HAVE FUN EVERYONE!Part of our excursion was a drop off and a pick up so we got picked up at 3am but the party was still going on when we left!!!! SAFE TRAVELS AND BE SAFE :)If you have any questions about coco bongo, feel free to shoot me a message :)

Awsome show. Coco bongo's is an awesome show, it is many mini shows during the evening, but a late finish (0400). TOP TIP - Be the first in from your coach, so you are at the front. If you go to the back you can't see anything unless you are tall.

Exciting!. My friends and I visited Coco Bongo for my 30th birthday and couldn't have been more surprised. A couple of our friends visited this location before and wanted to take us there for a good time. My husband and I thought it was going to be a dance club with a couple acts but couldn't have been more surprised when it was act after act, and allot of dancing and drinking.If you don't enjoy standing or crowds, I would suggest getting a Goldmember rate. This got us a seat on the side balcony, with a table right next to the bartenders bar. Thank you to Jose for keeping the drinks coming and to the tequila hostesses!All the acts were fantastic and would visit the club again when we visit Playa again.

Much better than expected !. I took Coco Bongo with my tour operator and it was a great evening. I wen't there iwth a friend and I have been very impressed. We were safe, we had express pass (which is a must have), and a nice spot on the third floor. Our bartender was great and you should be ready to be really drunk. (It's still possible to have only water). As soon as we entered in the bar, we had a coktails and tequilla shots. I always had 1 or 2 coktail of my choice and they were replacing them before they were empty. The show is very impressive, music was just too great and performers were awesome. I was impressed how clean the bathrooms were. There is a person who is assigned to take care of the bathroom which makes the experience unique and very appreciated.It's not really the best place to dance but it's surely worth it. The only problem is that a shooter girl kinda forced us to drink shooters and then, she asked for money for them or the service. Actually i'm not quite sure. It wasn't quit eappreciated however... in any case, it's still a place to visit if you like clubs and big shows

Great show, little congested. I really liked the show, and would definitely consider returning, but we ended up being shuffled to between the main stage and the ground stage and were constantly being shuffled around for the acrobats. It really wasn't that big of deal I suppose as we were literally part of the show!It was really easy to get drinks, and our waiter made sure our drinks were never empty. Even though the place was packed, it was still pretty easy to move around to the washrooms and such. The second floor smoking area outside was kind of nice to escape the crowd and get some fresh air.I would probably suggest VIP if you had a smaller group, or didn't enjoy the crowd scene, but as we had a large wedding party it was pretty easy to stick together.All in all, a cool place to experience at least once.

awesome experience. one of the most amazing clubs ive ever been to,my wife and I went as part of our honeymoon with 11 of our friends and had a blast, was worried at first because the line to get in was crazy but went by pretty quick, drinks were brought to the table right away and kept coming without even having to ask,something you shoud try, I would definitely go back

Great night out!- Go VIP. We had an amazing night out at Coco Bongo, 2 couples in our late 20's. We paid the $150 each to go VIP on a Friday night and it was well worth it. Our waiter was amazing, drinks we're flowing never had to ask to be topped up..even brought us random shots with out us asking. (also bottled water too) For a place this packed the bathrooms we're really clean in VIP with someone in there cleaning after every use. Security was professional and not just goons like you see in some bars in Canada. If you don't like crowds this probably isn't the place for you, but if you want a high energy night out that you won't get at home...this is your spot!! So glad we shelled out the $ for VIP! had our own table, eye level with the stage and great vantage point for what was going on below!!Do it!!

meh (second time). Attended 2 years ago, enjoyed, had VIP seating, Coors Light available, decent seating. a good evening. Attended again this year (Feb. 2014), again VIP, different seating, all of us (x4) jammed in, constantly being jostled, no room to move, no Coors Light (as per previous visit), same show, higher price, just different intermissions, seemed lame, couldn't wait to leave. Will not return.

Fun. My partner and I went to Coco bongo last year and it was a really good night out.the show was amazing and all of the music was good.The fact that waiter kept bringing us drinks all night was really good. Word of warning...be prepared to drink a lot if you come here. All in all a great night out.

SO MUCH FUN!. WOW! This place was amazing. It was a huge, so stay close to your friends. (Also, be prepared to drink tequila. Even when I ordered rum or gin, I always got tequila. Lol)Fantastic place!

Vegas...No Way!!. My wife and I have been to PDC a few times and have been curious about what all the hype was about. We read the reviews and decided to pay extra for the VIP/Gold Member status. We didn't have to stand in the long line for the general admission and got right to our bar stools. Our waiter was pretty good getting our drinks, however about mid evening/show we went out for a smoke and when we came back to our seats...our waiter had given them to someone else and had to scamble to get us two more seats. We have been to Mexico numorous time (10 plus) and the show was like a high school production. The big screens would start a segment about an musical artist and then the preformers would be up on stage mouthing the words and didn't look happy at all. I spent more time watching the big screens than the preformers. We thought we'd be able to get up and dance....not so much unless you want to get up on a bar and swing your hips in a 2 foot square area....don't get to wild or you'll land your butt on the floor!!We can now say "Been There, Done That"...I wouldn't go back if someone else paid for my ticket. It was pretty disappointing overall.PS. When we were trying to leave our waiter started to hound me about a tip...at $125 a ticket for a 3 hour show I was done shelling out money. Beware..
Amazing Night Out. We booked the VIP Gold Package so we got the table, waiter service and All Inclusive Drinks. Am glad we did as you get a better view of the stage shows and it wasn't as crowded.

Very Good show for the Once. The show was amusing and kept everyone entertained throughout the night. I overall experience was made a whole lot better by our waiter who would keep on bringing the drinks to us to make the night even better. We had the VIP seats so paid a lot of money but was right in front of the stage and could look down at what was going on downstairs. Near the end of the show we joined everyone downstairs to have a dance and be part of the atmosphere.

brilliant . was the best value for money we found while in playa went on ladies day with two other couples ... we paud $50 each , was a little worried about how much drink we would get but shouldnt have it flowed all night , there was the mask and a little surprise, michael jackson and many others , if you have trouble standing for 4 hours pay the extra and sit on the 2nd floor ... really enjoyed ourselfs great time was had by all ....

Out of this world experience!. Been to Mexico many times but had never been to coco bongo! Such an amazing experience, one that I keep reliving! Outstanding acrobatics and choreographed routines to a wide variety of music. The hours of the night flew by because we were having so much fun! We will definitely return to Coco Bongo next time we are in Mexico.

One of a kind. Its hard to describe this experience, because I have never been any place lime it. It's like an interactive Vegas show with free booze that comes with the ticket price. The cheapest general admission tickets put in the middle of everything, it can be pretty crowded so beware if that isn't your thing. My advice would b to upgrade to a table. It is expensive as far as mexican activities go, but very reasoable if u cimp

Great Night Out!. Ive recently just come back from Mexico Riveria Maya. I stayed there for 2 weeks with my boyfriend from Monday 27th January - Monday 10th February. I have to say Coco Bongo was my favourite night of the whole holiday! It was definitely worth the money, we didn't queue to get in as we paid for VIP which was a little bit more money but defo worth having. With the VIP ticket we got our own table, we got unlimited drinks all night and travel on a coach to and from Coco Bongo. I would recommend getting VIP tickets because if you go for the cheaper ones you have to stand up all night and where you stand is underneath the stage where you can hardly see the performances and everything that is going on. That's why I think most people complain that it was terrible and not worth the money because they go for the cheaper option ticket and you don't get much for it. The performances all night were amazing, they definitely got everyone involved and made sure you had a good night. Half way through the night all these balloons and confetti came out of no way and everyone went mental. I loved all the music they played, you've got to love holiday music. Gets you right in the holiday mood! The toilets are very clean and the staff that work in the toilets are so helpful opening your door for you and when you wash your hands give you a hand towel afterwards. Little things like that does make a difference. Throughout the night I got up on stage and had a little dance with people, every time I finished my drink there was another one waiting there for me. The staff were very efficient and me and my boyfriend are so glad we booked Coco Bongo. Was definitely worth the money and if I ever return to Mexico this is one place I will be returning too!

No no bongo. This place is a total rip off !!! The actual show just more or less repeats its self with elvis Presley just miming along to backing tracks . They cram around 2000 people into a space that would be more accommodating to around 600. They try to compare this place to Las Vegas (not even close) save your money and don't waste it coming here
too crazy for older folks. great place for sin, and drinking, but really this is a place to call soddom and gomorah. but not a copy of vegas at all.

Great Night Out!. One of our favourite highlights from our holiday to Mexico! Great night out for all ages, wide range of music and the show is fantastic. We paid extra for VIP and got there a little early to guarantee a good table, if you arrive late you could end up standing. We had table service all night with premium drinks included which more than covered the cost of the ticket. You don't have to queue outside the club when you arrive either (as the standard ticket queues were massive!) Highly recommend!

Even us old people had fun!. 4 people in our late 40's decided to check out this dance club even though we are usually in bed by 11pm. grin... Travel agent on resort recommended this and he explained about regular fee and VIP fee. A good thing since the rep for Coco Bongo at resort did not. We went for VIP which gave us a seat, table, premium booze, a waiter plus a bathroom on our level. $120 US was well spent. Bus picked us up from Resort with our rep, which was 30 minutes late due to another hotel pick up being slow. Bus was air conditioned and had a bathroom on it. No one needed it but a good idea for when we returned. Buses parked 3 blocks away and rep had us follow him. There was around 200 people traveling the streets at the same time, quite a sight to see. We were put in the VIP line up which was 2 minutes to get through compared to 30 - 40 minutes for regular tickets. Standing out side in the humidity and heat is not for everyone and I am glad we did not have to do that. Up to 2nd floor we went and even though we had a seat, they pack you in. One person seats on a slight higher level and the next person in front of them. You had to get close to your spouse which is always a good thing. If you stood, like we did to dance, there was plenty of room. 2 large screens where the stage is showed old to new music videos with a count down clock on when the show would start. Staff danced on bar floor while everyone was coming in. The floor level was an ocean of people. 300-350 our server said, for a small area and if you include the 2 upper levels they can sit 1500 people. If there was a fire, not sure how all would escape if needed to. Impersonators were all very good and acrobats were amazing. Not crazy about the "little person" dressed as The Mask and Beetle Juice, he was quite rude in actions. William our server was on top of his game. When we had 3/4 of a drink left he was there asking us if we wanted more. Didn't matter if it was water, soda, shots or beer. He was there to please. 25 shows were done from 11pm to 3:30 am, with costume changes in between. Music videos kept the crowd going and you could go on lower level to dance on bar if you wanted to. I tried it, it was a fun and exciting experience. Floor was very sticky and you had to push your way thru to get to smoking balcony. I am very pleased we were on left side and not the right since the smell of tobacco was extremely strong. I am sure the club pipes in scented air freshener because at times I could smell cinnamon and citrus but no sweaty body odor. Bathrooms were so clean and had attendants making sure they stayed that way. Security was plentiful but as far as I could tell, everyone behaved themselves. Shooter girls with there whistles were annoying as well as the little person dressed up for pictures with us. They sell fro $20 US and we chose not to buy one. I have never been to a Vegas style show so I can not compare but it was in mind mind compatible. No matter what your age you have to experience this at least once in your life time. We went with the expectation to leave early but the show held our interest through it all and we stayed to the end. We walked back to the bus with less people than when we walked there because for some, the night was still young and they were heading to another party. Buses left on time, they didn't wait so if you were late you'd miss them and we got to do the "walk of shame" back through our resort to find our beds. Do your self a favor and pay the extra to upgrade and enjoy the show in the spirit it is intended.

Awesome 5th Anniversary Show!!. WOW! What an amazing show!! Went on a Thursday night and it was packed. First time there and we brought our 72 year old Aunt with us. We all loved it. We went VIP and so glad we did. I am so sorry, but I don't remember our servers name. We had excellent service all night (we left at 4am). The music and the performers were fantastic! During and in between shows, young girls dance on top of the bar. Between shows, staff picks a girl or two that can dance on the main stage front and center. Well, on December, 19th 2013, my Aunt was chosen to dance for the crowd. She was so embarrassed, but I think she looked great! The crowd really cheered her on. She thinks everyone felt sorry for the old lady (not true). Unfortunately, the battery in our camera died. I would love it if anyone reading this by chance, took a picture, or better yet video of her on stage that night. We would love to see it. Well, I would have given a 5 star rating however, we were angry when we first got in. Security took my hand held video camera and said we could not bring it inside. You would think when you purchase your tickets they would make you aware of this! I didn't see it written anywhere on our tickets. So I argued with security (cause they said filming is not allowed) and I told them that I discovered Coco Bongo on You Tube and there are TONS of video clips! But nope, they put my brand new, 3D, expensive camera in a small bin on the floor right beside the door to outside. Anyone could easily have grabbed it. Safe and secure? I think not! Good thing our condo was just 2 blocks away so my hubby took it home. Little did they know, my regular camera that they let my keep, also took video. So take that Coco Bongo Security!!!! And of course once the show started, SUPRISE! Imagine that, many people were running video on cell phones and cameras, (Just like I told you security!) So yes I did get some video (until the battery died) and I will post on You Tube (Laurpol1). Next time I will have a fully charged camera and both our cell phones with us! Just a little FYI for those whom also didn't know. So, if not for the stupid rule, it would have been a 5 rating.

not something i would do again. The bus was late getting there because people were buying tickets when we supposed to leave. Then when we got there we had to walk about 3 blocks before entering a line that was about a half hour wait. When entering they were upselling to better alchol after paying for an all inclusive which was crappy. once we got in we found it very crowded about 2000 people that would have been crowded with 600 people. The shows were about 10 minutes then 20 minutes of dancing then repeat. it was so crowded that even if you wanted to dance there was no place to do it. No place to sit down. Also they sell it as an express pass but everybody was express pass. Very poor value for 70 dollars

Loud, Crowded, Amazingly Fun!. Went on a Saturday, and while I don't know if it was a sellout, I do know it was PACKED. We were told to stand right at the edge of the bottle service area at the back, so I felt kind of bad for people who paid for that, as there were rows upon rows of people blocking their view. Our waiter Carlos was a challenge to flag down, which meant we were empty handed and dry mouthed for almost the entire time we were there. The drinks we did have were good. The show quality is outstanding, amazing dancers, amazing interpretations of popular movies. Phantom of the Opera + Meatloaf??? Whoda thunk, right? Enjoyed ourselves dancing, and being blown away by the performances. Will try out VIP next time, but being on the floor offered an experience like no other. Highly recommend.

Wow!!. What a night! Craziness in a square room! Amazing talent! The music was incredible! The dancers so good! Pretty glad we went on a Wednesday, ladies night? Our ticket was only $50. We only had 4 drinks from our server. One from a random server. But we were not offered shots by any of the waitresses! I thought the drink girls dancing up by the screens got a little old. And the air blowing their skirts up, very old after the... 5th girl?It was very crowded and as people became very drunk, the shoving was terrible. We were told to stand in our spot, one level down where the backs and sides of our legs were scraped and bruised from being pushed backwards by the people in front of us.Where we were standing a drink was dumped from above, not nice to be sticky all night long.But the most annoying thing was the little cleaners with sweepers and scoopers coming through to clean up the tissue paper from the floors, moving people around in an area no one could move. It was ridiculous! What a sight to see and I was glad for the experience! But would never pay more than we did and I would be choosing where I stood or sat next time!

The Copacabana of our age, and a club for the ages. This was my third time partying in Coco Bongo, but the first in the Playa location. What can I say about Coco Bongo? Do I believe this is one of the best clubs on earth? Yes (though I’m not a natural born clubber, I have some worldly experience with them). Have I left this place every time when the sun is in the horizon? Yes for the first two times, not for this one (you know, the age…).This is a massive partying venue, with three floors and a stadium-like layout that will allow you watch you the impersonations of great icons from stage and screen. You pay a steep priced all –inclusive cover and you have to tip your waiter in advance if you want to keep the drinks flowing. However, you end up spending roughly the same than in any other Mexican club a-la-carte (given that your table orders two or three bottles). The show is spellbinding, giving an old time cabaret-like feel to the place. You will be cast into a time machine and lose yourself to dance with oldies and newbies alike. You will enjoy like few other days despite the eternal crowds and the odysseys to the bathroom. It’s cheesy, campy and epic all the time.One minus point I can think of is that some acts look irrevocably passé. There are some that, though old, retain a certain charm because they are iconic (Madonna with Vogue, the Moulin Rouge Act, Queen, etc.). Others clearly do not: the Spiderman versus Green Goblin looked wonderful in 2005, but not anymore. I suggest they try something with the Avengers or something. And I’ve always disliked the acrobatics performed with the Passion of the Christ theme for being pointless, off-handed and potentially offensive to believers.

Fun times. This was an amazing experience-we went VIP and the service was amazing . Drinks were always full!!! Great music and the entertainment was fabulous. The girls in the bathroom doing traffic control were so awesome!!! Cleanest bathroom in Mexico!!

amazing!!!. i didnt experience anything more exciting and fun than a night in coco bongo :D if u like to scream out the popular songs, dance from 11pm to 3am and be surprised by turn of show every 10 mins that is place for u :) be prepared to be constantly pushed by waiters cos bar is open :) so better to have comfortable shoes on. dressing stile from very casual to mmmm some strip to undewear at some moments :)

Free entrance after 2 am - fantastic club experience!. We visited Coco Bongo in Cancun and it was a fantastic experience. We haven't planned to go to Coco Bongo again in Playa del Carmen as we were told that the shows are the same. We went for a night out in Playa del Carmen and on the way back to the hotel at 2 am were passing Coco Bongo when their staff invited us to get in for free. We happily took a chance to enjoy the show again! The Coco Bongo performance is simply great! Friday night was very busy especially on the ground floor. The drinks are expensive if you are buying them separately.

Ok...but prepared to be squished!. The actual shows and music at Coco Bongo are amazing, but being packed inside a sardine can all night not being able to move one bit is a little too much. I would hate to see what this place would be like if they ever had a fire. I am one who likes to go to night clubs, so the atoatmosphere was fantastic, but having to stand in one spot all night pretty much until closing made this a little less than desirable. Glad to say I went and saw it, but would not go again.

Excellent, but...... Coco Bongo was an experience not to be missed. However, I went with my 24 year old niece, and she was wishing they played more current music. They did a lot of music from the 80's and 90's, music she couldn't really relate to. I loved it anyway, the show was amazing, with performers, acrobats, singers, dancers, and confetti. Definitely splurge and get the gold seats, and tip your waiter $20 or so in the beginning. He will see to it that your drinks are always overflowing. He was by my side almost all night.

Goldmember vip pass first choice excursion Thursdays.amazing night!!!!. went last week while on holiday with my bf in Riviera Maya,done the Goldmember vip pass (first choice excursion on THURSDAYS). includes transport there & back,exclusive vip area, waiter service,all you can drink & entrance fee the price is in us dollars on the first choice excursion list but is about £78.00 pp or about 1720 mxn peso(you should tip server (receive better service than those who don't tip)& your glass will never be empty) (say 50 peso at beginning & 50 at end = £5.00 in English money) such an amazing night,music & bar dancing when you first arrive, then show starts at 11pm & finishes at about 3:00 am & club shuts at 4:00 am.get ready for an amazing time,music from 50's-recent releases, even if your not a big club person (I'm not) you will have a brill time. dance on the bar,dance floor or just next to your high table. Make sure you take a camera you WILL want to film this!!*** TOILETS: top level has a toilet attendant, m/f share toilets, two toilets so two at a time. wait outside toilet door & she will call you in OR you will get told off(i did as its not obvious you have to que & wait until she lets you in)*** not sure if this is the same down stairs. there is a small gift shop on left hand side just before you leave club. they take photos of you & sell them for 250 peso each (about £12 )
Wow! What a night. So much fun! Blows the cancun establishment away! Had a blast and service was great, the shows and entertainment was great. We all had such a great time!!!!

A Night To Remember. We booked this fab night out through Hector at the Occidental Grand Xcaret, who to his word definitely provided the best seats in the house. We decided on the VIP package that included short queue entry, VIP seating and waiter service. Boy are we pleased we did this. Our seats were situated centre stage on the 3rd floor. Drinks didnt need to be re ordered, as soon as you finished one, the next arrived. The atmosphere is electric and the show provided a multitude of singers from all eras. Our whole group danced from arrival at 10:30 to 3:30am. This unique experience is a must do whilst in Playa. Go all out and pay for VIP tickets, its so worth it. The best night out I have had in a very long time. Unpretentious and fun. Our group are still talking about it a week after returning from Mexico.

Go loco in Coco's. To get all you can drink, numerous tribute acts all in one night was unbelieveable for the price of the admission. Ok they lip sync (mime) to the artist but don't let that get in the way of what is a spectacular show, afterall what pop star does not lip sync during their own gigs. Tribute acts like I've never seen before and a credit to all involved for producing such high class entertainment. Great dance tunes in between the acts keeps the dance floor busy. Entrance fee covers drinks and the show around the dance floor, wereas VIP you'll get a seat at stage level and in first before geneal admission starts. Be warned it starts late 10.30pm and ends at 4am but oh "what a night"..

Must see. My wife booked to go to coco bongo whilst we were in Mexico, To begin with I was really dreading it and didn't want to go. I'm not really a crowd person, and had read some negative reviews on here. Let me say how wrong i was and how glad i am that my wife insisted. This place is without a doubt one of the best nights out I've ever had. You have two choices, either standard ticket or VIP, we paid a little extra for VIP and for us was definitely worth it. We went on a Saturday so was quite busy but with VIP we were in fairly quickly, inside is set out in 3 floors set around a large raised stage. Standard tickets will only allow you on the ground floor which is VERY crowded (not for me but the atmosphere looked fantastic) with a bar in the centre where everyone gets up a dances on. we were on the first floor directly in front of the stage, excellent seats with table service. Our server was Fernando, a great guy who made sure we had drinks all night. We got there around 10pm the music is great and people are dancing but the main show doesn't start until 11pm, once the show starts its amazing theres so much happening all over the place, they cover the bar and your see Spider-Man swing in and have a fight with green goblin, Elvis, queen, Madonna so much more, in between shows the bar reopens and the dancing starts again where you can get in a section of the stage and dance for a bit. There is also a few side shows going on down stairs with the mask or beetlejuice and a mini me. Me and my wife had the most amazing time, when we return to Mexico it will be first on our list to do again. It might not be for everyone and is very busy and bearing in mind I don't like crowds it was amazing. I would recommend Congo bongos to anyone visiting mexico, young or old your have a ball :-) Thanks Coco bongo

Great show. This is a very good show and the performers are some of the best I've seen (comparable to Vegas shows). Everything is high flying Pyro technics loud and exciting. It's very packed in there do if your going on your own go early and I highly recommend paying the extra for VIP so you get a table and personal server. Otherwise it's kind of a free for all and you will be standing 4 rows wide. Service is great and drinks are too and it's all inclusive until 3am. Show starts at 1030-11pm so it's a late one and they have a night club after the show until around 5am.

Great fun night. I had a great time with my friends. We had some VIP tickets, but we were left in the first floor because I have movility problems. I was given a place to sit and a table while my friends were dancing all over the place. The drinks were full all night long and the shows amazing. All of us had a great time even when our plans were different, some guys wanted to talk, I was there for the shows and the girls to dance like in a club.

AMAZING. It was fantastic! The best night out I have ever had and we wanted to go again the next night.The entertainment was fab and rinks are included in the ticket price. You are assigned a waiter who keeps you topped up all night! We booked through Thomson and got a gold member ticket which i would recommend as it meant we got a table. The club had such a great atmosphere which was completely buzzing from start to finish. The show starts at around 11pm and goes on until 3.30am so make sure you rest during the day before you go!!Literally loved Coco Bongo :)

Stay Away. They send staff to the hotels to sign up people for a bus ride to and from Coco Bongo. We were led to a table in the middle of an isle that was about the size of a big dinner plate for the five of us to stand around. No seating. Everyone had to stand the entire time. The place was so crowded that you could not hardly move. If you did have to, you had to actually push people out of the way. I've been to many college bars and just bars in general and this is the absolute worst I've ever seen. If they had a fire code, they surely exceeded it. You see the reports of some balcony crashing down or a fire in other countries at a nightclub with several casualties. Never could figure it out until I experienced this place. The "show" is the most pathetic thing I've ever witnessed. Sad part is there are lots of nice bars with bands all up and down the street that were not that crowded. But, we were first timers and didn't know that. My advise is to just get a cab and tell them you want to go to Coco Bongo and set off on your own from there. Very safe area. Cops at all intersections. They even close off the street so you can just walk wherever you want. I would not advise to get out of the mainstream though.

Excellent night out. This show was brilliant, a must see during your stay in Mexico. As the club can get really busy on the dance floor and as a result leaves not much room to move around I would recommend booking VIP tickets which are only £10-£15 more but you get a seat and waiter service all night. Also the stage is elevated so the seating areas give you a much better view of the whole show.

One of the most entertaining nights of my life.... We had a fantastic night at Coco Bongo, the atmosphere is electric and the show is like nothing you've seen before.I personally recommend going VIP its about $100 per person but its well worth it, we had transfers included, all inclusive premium branded drinks, a great view of the show on a balcony with a seat, our own personal waiter (he would never let your glass reach empty) and you get your own toilet so queueing is minimal.This is a late one with the show kicking off around 10.30pm and going on till about 3am. I would say this night out is suitable for all ages over 18.

Coco Bongo ='s Must See Show While in Playa del Carmen. We had a group of 12 and went to Coco Bongo last Wednesday night. The show was amazing!!! Seems more like a show you would see in Las Vegas. Our "lessons learned" include the following:1) This show is truely amazing!!! A combination of singers, dance, acrobatics, costumes, you name it. The show starts about 11PM and lasts until 3:30am. Be certain you take a nap beforehand2) Our group of 12 was mainly interested in obtaining the cheapest price for our tickets. Hindsight that was maybe not the best strategy (one person from our group did win two tickets during a contest at our hotel). I would recommend considering booking in VIP area (2nd or 3rd level) to avoid some of the crowds that cram into the lower level.3) our seats were on main level, about 10 feet from the center bar. We had 4 tables for our group of 12. We also went on Wednesday night which was ladies night. It was very crowded! I don't exactly know how many people were in the Coco Bongo but it had to be more than 1,000 people. So it became increasingly crowded between us & the bar as the night went on. The club does a pretty good job with crowd control during the show. Some people near us were escorted out by security because they were on the verge of passing out/or were interested in picking fights with guests. If you are clostraphobic in any way, I would recommend booking VIP tickets in 2nd or 3rd row.4) Because it was so crowded, it took about 10 to 15 mins. to make it to restroom and back. Another good reason to book in VIP section because you have a different bathroom to use. 5) Overall the show was incredible. Lots of acrobatics with bungy cords, etc. I would recommend that you check it out while in Playa. It was our groups favorite activity of the week.

Loved it. From the moment we got to Coco Bongo's, Even outside waiting to get inthere was energy. Upon Entering the energy and fun started. There was so much going on. Music Dancing,non stop drinks. Great Show.This is well worth the price. So much fun!!!

This is how a nightclub should be!. We almost didn't go to Coco Bongo because, well, I admit, we thought we were getting a bit old for the nightclub scene and the 11:30pm start time for the "shows" scared us a little. We are so glad we went. The energy caught us right from the start. We had VIP tables up top, but immediately knew we wanted to be on the bottom floor near the bar and all the action. We danced on the bar a couple of times. I got pulled into the show with mini-Beetlejuice. The time FLEW by. We never even thought about the time until it was over and we all wanted to go back the next night. Be prepared to get up close and personal with the staff and guests. There is a lot of dancing, jumping, and bumping, but it was all good.AWESOME.

BELIEVE The Hype!. I always stayed away from Coco Bongo thinking it would be way too "touristy" for me. Finally, 4 years ago, I was with some friends and I gave in and went to the Playa del Carmen location (been to Cancun too). The result? I have been back over 8 times now and it never gets old! Every time I travel to Playa or Cancun, I always make it a point to go to CB. I especially love taking new people and seeing the expression on their faces when they walk in. In fact, one the pictures I posted on here (with the balloons) is a picture I took the first time I went. Literally, it was the first thing I ever saw as I walked in.The atmosphere is out-of-this-world, the sound system and lights are world-class, and the show is incredible. If you took Cirque du Soleil, the best clubs in Vegas, and the most fun 1,000 party-goers you’ve ever met, then mixed them all into one…you’d start to get the idea of what Coco Bongo is all about. Does it get crowded? Yes. Does it get crazy? Yes. Is it loud? Yes. But you know what? That’s the fun part. They do a show / performance to every song (search youtube) and they truly entertain the crowd. To top it off, there's no lack of sexy and beautiful people around. A good mix of locals and tourists.I enjoy the Playa location better just because it seems a little cozier plus I like the surrounding bars and restaurants in Playa. Don’t get me wrong, Cancun is amazing too – just bigger and crazier.There are several levels of entry. It's not exactly cheap BUT trust me, COCO BONGO is worth the money and the experience! If you have the means, get a VIP area as you will definitely enjoy it more and have waiter service plus all drinks included in the price.
OMGoodness. A show like no other! Would go again! This is Vegas meets Cir del Solei. High energy, well done, you'll never forget the experience.

Health hazard! Warning.... Really great fun and we would have rated it higher, but we had an incident when there that we feel all participants should realise. They used liquid nitrogen (dry ice) on the stages and the bar area. When you arrive many of the women are pulled up onto the bar area to dance (reluctantly) during the warm up, before the main performance starts. Standing on the bar is not safe in itself (as its very narrow - and probably not legal in other countries). I was one of the females whom was pulled away from my partner to stand on the bar. I was not so keen but went along with it and as I stood on the stage the bar had holes in it that blew up liquid nitrogen on all the females. I guess the ploy was if you were wearing a skirt it would blow up. However myself (and other participants) had leggings on. The liquid nitrogen froze within my leggings and I now have a terribly bad permanent scar on my leg. I was shuffled out the back - when I told the waiter what had happened - to meet with the accident and emergency team who seemed to have quite a full book of incident reports (perhaps I'm not an isolated incident) and unfortunately a very rude head waiter (who pretended to be a Manager). They indicated I had a skin allergy (I dont as far as I'm aware). We asked for a refund, of which they were reluctant. After we insisted they said "then you must leave" and insisted we leave by the back door. After one hour of being in the club we were stood on the street (30 minutes from our hotel and to wait until 4am for our bus home) and my leg was now scarred. Thankfully a front of house member of staff overheard what had happened, informed us the waiter was not a manager (as he had posed) and was terribly apologetic. Thank you to him they came out to apologise and offered us a VIP seat and our money back and a place to sit before we got the bus home. We enjoyed the show in the end and a strong rum and coke numbed my pain of the leg until our bus got home. But I am concerned with the health and safety of this club. It is very busy and packed and I would use caution when visiting. Aside from this the show is good fun, and you will have a good time provided you dont get burned by liquid nitrogen (avoid the stage if possible). I hope this is looked into so no-one else gets hurt and also that their waiting staff (only some of them) improve their customer service skills. Given the owner of the club is particularly famous I think he would be disappointed to find out the way in which paying customers were treated that night.

Very entertaining night. High energy jump around noisy night out. Extremely well produced and choreographed dancers and performers mixed in with highly danceable hits to backdrop of superior videos and film clips. Very exciting and great atmosphere maintained over 4 hours.Strongly suggest anyone over 25 buys the VIP tickets or you,re in for a very long, tiring and probably messy night!We loved it Never been to a club anything like it.Beware of the club's own transport that can pick you up and take back to hotel which failed for us going and returning, because the road was too narrow for the coach. In our case, the club paid instead for our taxis after a bit of discussion
Birthday party. excellent show and dancing to celebrate my birthday, great time had by all the family with wide musical tastes catered for

busy place. busy place - way too many people packed into a small space (the fire comissioners and liquor inspectors would have a hay-day in Canada). Great stage show but the smoke that they blow give you a headache (just too much). Service was good, drinks okay. We were given a table on 3rd floor but its behind the banisters that people stand at so you cant see - must stand at a banister and even then it is difficult to see. if you are on floor level you cant see the stage as its elevated. Bathrooms on 3rd floor a total joke - sit on toilet and your knees are under the sink its so crowded. It was okay, but I wouldnt go back. If there was ever a fire - everyone would be dead - too crowded with small alleys and stairs to get anywhere near an exist - didnt feel safe. Tight security at the entrance which was fine but made me wonder why (pat down search).

Love it!. We have been to Coco Bongo twice and had a fantastic time on each visit. We had no problems getting into the club with the provided transportation. Our guides were great and we had great seats. We had no problem getting more than enough drinks all night. The show was fantastic and the crowd is full of energy. This is a place you must see. Take a nap before you go...the shows goes on until 3:30 in the morning. There were people there in all age groups.

Good for a night of fun. We purchased gold VIP tickets for a show, which provided express access, assigned seats and included your drinks for the night. I'd recommend buying tickets right at the box office, so you cut out the middle men and their fees/commissions. The show starts late (10:30 pm) and goes well into the night, so expect a late night out. Constant music and performances, lots of entertainment, dancing...it was all quite entertaining. A little pricey perhaps, but worth doing if you are looking for a late night party.

Coco Bongo a great venue for all adults. We loved the well organised prompt staff who looked after us all night.The pre trip info' on the coach told us what to expect.The venue was exciting for all of us young and old. The atmosphere was amazing and the acts were top notch. Drinks kept coming all night we never had a table full of empty glasses. We highly recommend this as a fun noisy night out.

Best Bar/Club in Playa. CocoBongo is famous , famous in Cancun and in Playa del Carmen. This is not a usual club like the ones we have in the Cities around Europe , this is a show with open bar and a club. To start the price tickests goes from $50 to $100 or more , the basic is more than enought for a experience there and always negociate to get it lower (I never paid more than $50)! You can buy tickets anywhere and everywhere from your hotel to the door at CocoBongo. CocoBongo is always full, so if you dont like to be around many crazy and party people just dont go.
