The shows are amazing , fantastic. The drinks are free (until 3 am I guess)but not premium. You must go at least one time , but if you are like Me , just go two :) . I recommend it.

Coco Bongo - New Years Eve. This night was the best! We bought an Express Pass ticket from Hector who tours the hotels to sell tickets. He picked us up, along with a few others from our hotel in a bus that had people from other resorts. It was worth the extra cost for the express pass as he led us right in down a hallway and directly to our table. We had a waiter who looked after us all night and the show was absolutely amazing. I was a little worried before we went as I am a 52 year old woman travelling with my 19 year old daughter but I wanted to do something fun for her on New Year's Eve. It was the most amazing night and the show was great with awesome songs to dance and sing along to. Drinking, dancing, singing and so much fun. The bus picked us up at 4:00 a.m. to go back to the resort. I would highly recommend this night of entertainment for anyone looking for a fun night out in Mexico.

Scam. While at our resort, gentleman approached us about New Year's eve show. Promised a lot of things like VIP access, Open Bar, Reserved Seating, but got NONE of that when we got there. Could have just been the guy that was working for them, but be careful when promises are made... because they are more about getting the ticket sold and not taking care of the customer.

Must do visit. Visited Coco Bongo during our recent holiday in Mexico.We went on the VIP ticket and although expensive probaly was the better option.The show was very good from start to finish and if you get a chance you should visit this show.Dont take your video camera you will be searched on the way in.But you can use the video on your phone if you want.

Party like its 1999!. Was not what i expected, was pleasantly better! Great entertainment a mix of Vegas, Cirque du Soleil and yes I'll say it Disco! We laughed, Danced and had a wonderful time. A must do!

Great Show. This was unlike any other show we have ever been to. Make sure you get reserved seating with chairs so you will have someplace to sit as the show was quite long. The music was great and everyone had a great time. It may be for younger people, but we still had a great time. A must see when in Playa Del Carmen!

loved it!!. amazing a must see!! First time to this nightclub or show make sure u get there early or buy ahead of time if you can line ups outside can be long!! light shows and acrobatics in a nightclub!! who knew!!

are you kidding?. We signed up at our hotel and would be picked up at 9:40PM and brought home at 3:30AM. We paid for an "Express Pass" which we were led to believe would mean no lineups and a table and our own waiter. The van that picked us up was late. The two women "guides" played on their phones until we got to Playa then they told us to come back to that location at 3:30 to get a ride back to our hotel. If we were late we would be left behind. They led us down to the end of a very long line up where we waited (in the rain) with other suckers that had bought the "express pass". The line finally started moving and we shuffled forward, shuffled forward. Our "guides" came to see how we were doing occasionally and our friends asked if indeed we were going to get a table. They take off and after awhile come back and tell us that we could have a table but it only seats two and we have to buy a bottle for $100US! We finally joostle in through the doorway and down the stairs in a press of people. We hand in our voucher and get our wristbands then shuffle along the passageway in the intense crush of people. We can hear music so the show started without us. Finally get past the bouncers who do a fairly thorough frisk and into a theatre that should hold about 400 but has a thousand packed into it and there's at least 250 behind us. The stage is about two stories up and there may be a show but it's hard to see as there is continual jostling as people and groups vie for a place to stand. The only entrance I can see is the one we came in. It took about 40 minutes to get in can you imagine what it would take to get out if there was a panic from a problem like a fire? We left immediately and were assured that they have a fire drill every six months and that they pass all inspections. No matter, you couldn't pay me to go back inside.

Fantastico show & party!! Skip the booze. Whatta a show!!! This was our 2nd & 3rd trips to Coco BONGO! Shows changed up each time - with some repeat elements. It's a crazy party house with lots of 20-something's - in our 50s & didn't feel out of place - there were people there older than us : ). Coco BONGO is Mtv, trapeze, dance show, Las Vegas, party show all wrapped into an amazing entertainment!!Went on a. Monday night withCoco BONGO reps from resort - recommend - as they got us in door, seated & hooked up with server. (Plus provided transport - all for the same ticket price that up an purchase on-line or on the street).From previous experience we knew to skip the booze. (Ok we're beyond the banging hangover age!!) Beer is ok.Be sure to take an early evening nap as you really WILL stay until the main show is over @ 3:30am.
Brilliant. Free alcohol all night amongst a great display of singing, dancing and acting all in one theatre/club. Tight squeeze though!

Feel good. Its all been said before! but as a couple we did think why on earth would we want to go to a club for?! So we weren't that excited to go but as it had been recommended by so many! We went we got picked up from our hotel and we made friends with other couples, other Londoners and other groups from our hotel- A MUST, so there was about 8 of us in a group which really really made the night! As im not too sure how much we would of enjoyed if it was just the 2 of us.Toilets were clean, but the attendants were rude and pushy and really did expect tips! And definitely no more then one in a cubicle- my other half took advantage of the all you can drink and it was coming back up! But I couldn't go aid him.. The show was great, you seemed to stop paying attention the more you drank- which we did..tequilas galore! The waiters did a great job and looked after you.. We started on the bottom floor infront of the bar.. some of the girls got up on the bar to have a wiggle but beware the air will blow up your dresses/skirts etcI recommend you ladies wear trainers or flats don't come in flip flops and don't come in heels! The place was packed but when we went up a level we had loads of space for the group to dance and drink and have fun.The music in general was fantastic such classic feel good songs that you all sing at the top of your voices the music suited everyone and was great.. Late night but the coaches took us back to our hotel for about 4am, was great.

VIP really adds to the experience. Booked this through the rep at the hotel and had a great time.The VIP package gives you a seat with a great view of the stage and waiter service for all your drinks,our waiter worked hard all night and kept the drinks topped up.The show started at 11 and finished around 3 am and was really good,this really is worth going too for a really fun and entertaining evening.

Amazing time!. We went to Coco Bongo when we were in Mexico and we had a fantastic time! The show is spectacular. We really enjoyed it. I recommend you to pay an extra for a VIP. You will have a sit upstairs, better view and waiter who will not let you wait for your drink. Also there are not queue for the toilet and entrance. We get there at around 10pm and left at 4am. Absolutely must do!

Incredible night of fun and entertainment!. My husband and I have been to Mayan Riviera Mexico many times and we have always wanted to go to Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen! Finally, on our most recent vacation while staying at the Royal Suites Yucatan with family and friends, we planned this as an evening excursion. We booked the VIP package through a Coco Bongo representative at our resort. The package included transportation to and from our resort to Coco Bongo. The package also included drinks for the evening. We would highly recommend the VIP package since you have your own private section with seating available, a great view, excellent service and drinks. Also, we have heard that if you don't pay for VIP, and you are on the main floor, people sometimes puke over the railings from the VIP sections - yuck! The music and entertainment all night are top notch - soooo much fun! I would do this night excursion every time we go to Mexico now and will recommend it to everyone! The only reason I didn't give it a full five stars is because we wished food was served in the VIP package (or even snacks available for purchase) - it is a long evening (10 PM to 4 AM). Also, the washrooms are in the basement - the total opposite location from the VIP section and it takes awhile to get through the crowds to get down there. These are by no means reasons not to go, justs suggestions for Coco Bongo Play Del Carmen for two areas that could be improved. Overall, such a fun night!

Perfect mix of a show and dancing!. We loved Coco Bongo! Went through our all inclusive hotel in Tulum, $60/person and it was the perfect set up. We basically had a chaperone who had a table reserved for us and made sure our bartender took great care of us. Thanks Adrian! The show was unreal and had enough dancing too. I recommend the lowest floor so you can interact with the show and get on stage and stuff!!!

Sensory Overload - Ridiculously Fun!. If staying in or near Playa Del Carmen this club is an absolute must see! It is absolute insanity (in a good way) from the moment you walk in the door. The only way I can describe it is like a New Years party that strike's 12 every 10 minutes for 4 hours!! It's basically shows alternating with dancing all night long. Drinks are included with your ticket -- and the servers are awesome... I don't think I was ever empty. Now, here's a disclaimer (and heed my warning if you're at all clausterphobic!) the general seating (cheap tickets) are standing room only on the dance floor. You will wind up jammed like a sardine down there. Seriously. This may be cool for the young 'mosh pit' lovers -- but not for me. Luckily the guys at our resort recommended the VIP tickets (which cost more -- but trust me, so worth it!) You get in earlier, your own seats, private server and can get up and dance whenever you want to and then sit down to enjoy the show(s). Also, the stage is raised so you get an awesome view from the VIP section. Don`t miss it - there`s a little something for everybody. We left grinning ear to ear :)

AN ATTACK ON YOUR SENSES!!!. Its all been said before, so keeping brief... An absolutely brilliant night out.... sensational sound, lights and non stop show coming at you literally from every direction...you are drawn into a party like carnival atmosphere which is simply great fun!.... if your on holiday in Cancun or Playa del Carmen, don't miss CoCoBongo.... its got to be done!We purchased the 'Gold Member' tickets.... well worth it and to be recommended... gives; easy entrance, guaranteed seat and table, all inclusive drinks with own waiter, so you'll never have a dry glass, positioned on same level as stage for a great view of everything going on! Had a great night out, only one problem, it was over too soon... despite being there for 4 hours... which speaks for itself!!!!

So. Much. Fun. Hit Coco Bongo to celebrate my sister's 30th birthday after a full day of touring. Had no reason to worry about staying awake till our 3:30am pickup! The ticket rep who sold us our passes met us at the door, whisked us past the line and onto the floor, and plunked drinks into our hands. We had opted for general tickets on the floor. Yes, it's packed. Yes, people will probably step on you. And yes, it's incredibly loud. But it's worth it - the show is fantastic, the staff are total pros, and the dancers are full-on gorgeous. Would probably spring for a VIP pass next time. But if the cost puts you off, go for the floor and embrace being in the centre of it all.

Too crowded to move. We were picked up by a bus from our hotel in Playacar. Bought tickets from the coco bongo guy in a booth on the beach. The VIP tickets were more than double so got regular tickets. I noticed the line was several blocks long. They crowded so many people in we could NOT move. I predict a safety hazard down the road for this place. We were so disgusted we left at 12:30. What a complete and total rip off.
AWESOME SHOW!. Been twice and was amazed ! So much fun! It is a little crowded , so alot of people bumping into you. I recommend buying the VIP package, you get your own booth.

AMAZING NIGHT - GO VIP. Booked this night through our hotel. We were booked on the "gold member" VIP and was well worth paying the extra. We were seated at 10.30pm and the night just flew by until we had to leave at 3.30am. The music is great but the shows are totally fantastic and leave you spellbound. We are all late 50's/early 60's and thought we wouldn't stay the course but we will never forget it.

I could have passed on this event. This place is crowded and super loud. More for the younger crowd. Its worth the trip but not for a repeat performance. The entertainers are very good. You must get table service unless if you are 20 something, in that case you can totally get wasted on the floor. Its a very long Vegas style show. Is it worth it? ..Yes. Is it for me? ..not really. Much prefer vegas for shows or cirque du soliel.

Excellent!. We booked with the Coco Bongo rep from our resort. He met us in the lobby and rode on the bus to the club with us. He gave us good advice and stayed with us until we got into the club. It was worth the $120 each for VIP. We were in a group of 7 and we all sat together. Our glasses were never empty and the waiter cleared a path for us to go to the bathroom.The show is fantastic and exceeded our expectations. We will definitely go back next time in Playa del Carmen. My only advice is for the girls that get up to dance on the stage and on the bar during the breaks, hold your dress down.We booked with Luis at the Riu Tequila, very helpful!

Excellent night out. Amazing night out... Really is ideal for all ages. We paid VIP on a friday which was 109$ worth every penny.When we first arrived for our table they tried to sit us at the back even though there were tables free still at the front after arguing with the bar man who got the manager over we finally sorted it an managed to get the table at the front. Don't be afraid to ask to the manager at the end of the day we all pay the same. Excellent drink choices and we didn't wait a minute for a fresh drink.. Shows are fantastic and all are very different honestly the night flys by...

unbelievable. After reading other reviews we were dubious of what to expect but having booked through Thomson's and not poolside guys the gold ticket is worth the extra without a doubt ,we had an excellent table and space to dance and near toilets. Waited was brilliant and we never had an empty glass all evening. What an amazing night and enjoyed by all ages , cant wait to go again have never experienced a night lime it just brilliantl
Worth every dollar you spend, really.. Worth every dollar you spend, really. Yes, it´s true it puts the Vegas in the shame. Everything is perfectly done.

Fabulous night out. We spent a month in Playa del Carmen and stayed in a condo just a half block away from Coco Bongo. Was busy every night so decided to see what it was like for my husbands 56th birthday. We were so very impressed. We paid extra to be a gold member and had just the most fun exciting evening. We were entertained the whole evening. Thanks to Tarick, Pedro and Adrian we were taken care of excellently. This show rates right up there with Vegas.

CoCo Bongo. Brilliant night out you wont forget but please please book the VIP package through your rep's at the hotel or you will not get the best seats & service and remember your tip money and the waiter will always be there for you, if you book this through the street vendors you will have to pay for upgrades when you arrive and this will be costly, I have been two years on the trot and love it, enjoy this experience and go in the middle of your holiday and leave the next day free as you will need your rest lol

Overrated!. I took my wife to Coco Bongo for her B-Day because she had been curious about it & wanted to try it. I kid you not, we were there for 20 min. tops before the cheezines and bad lip singing got to us & we left... We were expecting to boogie down & enjoy the shows but were very disappointed to see bad impersonators, party confetti forced down your throat, pushy coco bongo employees trying to get my wife to dance on the bar, and every 5 min a paparazzi asking to take pictures.It's not original when all you do is play top 100 songs from the 90's and drag the audience through all the cheezy classics we danced at our formals and high school proms... I feel the experience is overpriced, overrated, lacks originality and it would be extremely useful to get a table, otherwise you might as well be at a bad concert mosh pitting with the stand only room on the floor.What more can I say, Coco Bongo once and it was more than plenty to never go back again.

AMAZING!. wow, just got back from coco bongo, absolutely amazing atmosphere in there you have to go and see for yourself. Suitable for everyone of all tastes, bar staff are always on hand too. Loved it!

Off the Charts!!! Be prepared for your head to Explode. I now know that Australia does not know how to do Clubs properly, Coco Bongo has ruined it for me. The most amazing entertainment experience I have had and I have worked in the hospitality sector for 15years.Get Here!

Awesome night out. Went here last night, absolutely amazing, did not sit down danced all night, all credit to the producers of the show, amazing, the dancers in the show do not stop, they are all awesome and put 110% into it! well done guys, I went to the show in cancun about 12 years ago and can't remember it being like it was, service was brilliant, never had an empty glass / bottle shots were flowing for those who wanted them, well worth paying the extra for gold service, just make sure you are there early for a good seat. It is a very late night but for me was well worth it :)

Crazy!. Went here with my wife on our honeymoon. It was absolutely nuts! Batman fighting bane, Freddie mercury singing, people dancing on bars that turn into dance floors, confetti bombs, nuts! I'm not sure i have seen so many people in a place of this size. I suggest you do this through a travel agent,we did and we managed to get a space on a balcony with its own bar. Have fun !

ADVISE!!! . I just want a said that Coco bongo has one of the best shows i ever see in my life.Drinks and show is the best combination.Even in Las Vegas i never see something like this. Congratulations...Unfortunately i need to advise to all of you a very bad experience that happen to me and my family.We pay $65 USA dollars my wife, my 2 doters and me. Total $260 dollars but in Coco bongo is no seats to watch the show, 80 % of the people stand up for all night and we was in a very bad area full of people one next to another and many people pushing and bothering next to us and we can’t see the show.So after 30 min. we want a sit in a table and i ask to a waiter to find me a nice place to see the show and he tell me to buy an upgrade for $50 dollars more each person total $200 dollars more and i accept to pay and i can sit with my family at VIP area. Then after 15 min one man dress all in black came to talk to me and told me if i want a seat with my family and i said of course...He ask me where we was from and if we can pay the 200 dollars extra and i said yes, we can! and then he told me if I want a save $ 100 dollars and if i give him only $ 100 dollars! He can give me a nice table with premium drink´s in front of stage for all of us. Of course i accept to save money and I try to give him my credit card to pay the 100 dollars extra and he said that i need pay him in cash, no credit card. But i don’t take a lot of cash, so he told me to go to ATM outside of coco bongo to get the cash and then after i pay him he takes us to the good area to see the show.After this we enjoy so good all night the show with better drinks in better glasses and with very good service.But almost at the end, again another problem.At 2:30 am the waiter ask me for tip and of course i try to give him 5 dollars and he became mad at me and with very bad English he try to said that i need give him 10% tip minimum from total i pay and i told him that i pay 100 dollars tip to one man dress in black name Pedro in cash and that i don’t have any more money. He just turns and he doesn’t come back again to serve us. So i need go for my drinks to the bar.All of you need to be careful and buy VIP entrance and avoid this situation, because is a great show and drinks there. But people like this two guys is the worst i ever meet.  Show 100 pointsDrinks 100 pointsWorking Personal CERO points

go go go. it starts very slow then it just flies by with a bang a fab night plenty to drink and its so entertaining if you go no where else make sure you go here, only fault its a very late night we never got back to our hotel until 4.45am but well worth it

You just have to go. This has something for everyone, I have never seen a place like this before, the music, the atmosphere, the show, AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING !!! We booked the Gold members area, we went by taxi instead of taking the free coach as you don't have to go from hotel to hotel picking people up....... so get your dancing shoes on and enjoy ....... we gave a tip, but one was not expected

The best Night Club anywhere, hats off to Coco Bongo!!!!!. What an amazing place! I work in the entertainment industry and have seen many things. This place blew my socks off! The show was terrific, the staff were amazing and the party did not stop. Just make sure you rest up for this night because you will need the energy!!! VIP passes are the way to go. Talk to Marco from there sales and promotions he will hook you up! Thanks Marco!!!

Worst Trip and Night Ever. We booked with our Thomsons rep at the hotel being promised VIP seats as gold members and free transport to the club. The transport was 15 mins late and we ended up lost going to other resorts to pick up non existing customers! We reversed some way down a motor way and to a resort and was absolutely terrified! Once in the resort we were escorted by security because he got lost! A this point I wanted to get off and try and get a taxi. No one on the bus spoke English not even the driver and we didn't know what was going on. We eventually got to Playa del Carmen at 11.15 and we were the last to arrive and therefore got the worst VIP seat inmafinable. We were near enough right under the stage.when we asked multiple staff members to move we were shrugged off. It seamed that anyone and everyone were aloud to walk up and down the steps next to us and constantly had people blocking our view of the bar/middle stage. We requested seat and a table as I am recovering from a foot fracture and my partner has athritus in his knee and back. Needless to say we were both aching from head to toe from people kicking us in the back from the seats above and behind and people and staff pushing buy us. We were suppose to get table service as well but offetn found we had to go to the bar ourselves to get our own drinks we felt like we were forgotten about and the other tables were definatly recieving better service than us. At about an hour into what little of the show we saw we were offered tall bar stools next to a fire extinguisher and the WC with no table. We then left. So super disappointed. If we had got there in time this would have been a completely different review. The only reason I am writing this is for people to get there own transport and book directly with Coco Bongo's to avoid serious disppointment and over paying. We were offered to go on another free trip and was deeply upset at this to go through the same problems all over again. I think not. Waiting for a better reposnse and at the very least some of our money back and the 200 peso taxi fare back to the resort. Coco Bongo's so keen to get your money treat you like crap and not reimburse you fairly for their mistakes.

Party night. My wife and my self we have a good time on this place beautiful shows and our waitress don't ask for tips, l try to give him a tip after our first drinks and he say don't worry later that's estranged but we like it,

Coco Bongo ruined every other night club for me!. Just have to say that this was THE BEST club i have ever been to. Had a blast! The shows, the service, and the drinks, were extraordinary. Didn't think i would last standing up from 11 to 3:30 but when it ended i wanted more. DO NOT miss out on this if you go to the Riviera Maya.

Everyone should experience it !. Finally.... after wanting to go for ten years to this bar; A group of 8 of us went to Coco Bongos. We fretted over being able to stay up so late.......it starts at 11pm and ends at approx 3:30a.m. in one word......."Fantastic"! & everyone should try it once.If you are in the right frame of mind and ready to party, you will have the time of your life!. We all agreed it was an amazing well done show and we had a funtastic evening! It is so loud, you will feel your heart beat through your chest with the bass music. The mood and Vibe of the bar is undescribable, you have to go to experience it. We went Gold member VIP; and would recommend to anyone who likes a bit of space to do the same. It may be pricier, but all drinks and shots included, and we most certainly took advantage of the free shooters. Waiter service was quick and we were never without a drink. We had room to stand in our section and dance the night away in our seats.Well done Coco Bongo, you exceeded our expectations!

'Don't believe the sales hype. We booked VIP tickets from the Coco Bongo sales agent at our hotel - Ocean Maya Royale at a cost of US$120 (£75) each. We were told these would guarantee us a seat at a table in the VIP area on the 2nd floor but by the time we entered the venue (after a 30 minute wait outside in the rain as our names were not on the VIP list and having to demand to see the Manager to even get in) all the seats were taken. We had to stand for 4 hours and through the whole show. Once inside the venue no one would take any responsibility for the situation with the waiters and stewards just shrugging their shoulders. We were not alone in this respect. The sales hype gives you the impression the VIP area in quite spacious and this really isn't the case - they pack in as many as they can.We travelled to Riviera Maya with Thomson Holidays who guarantee you a seat on their trip to the venue and we understand this was better (but sold out when we wanted to go). As such my advice to UK tourists would be book through Thomsons and not through the Coco Bongo reps who do not deliver on their promises.We did complain to the management of the sales team afterwards and received no response. After threatening to give them a negative review on here we did receive an apology and an acknowledgement that they had 'issues with their booking system' together with the offer of a free visit if we returned which we rejected as we are not planning another holiday to Mexico. Our request for alternative compensation has not even received the courtesy of a reply.All this said the show is spectacular and great entertainment and the waiters do work hard and make sure your glass is always full. However our experience on the evening took the gloss of what should have been a memorable night out. We simply didn't get what we had paid for and been promised. Simon & Bridget

Amazing night of dancing and drink. For $100 per person we got a table and seat which is worth the money as it does get crowded in the pit below. If you don't mind being a abut squashed I think the other price was $65 ppThis also included unlimited premium spirits and shots in the price. We had a waiter bringing the drinks all night so no need to go the bar! We were on the second level so was eyeliner to the stage, amazing aerial displays. Cabaret and dance sequences! All the music and costumes were great.Show was amazing from start to finish! Defiantly worth the money as you would pay less for a good night out in London.
amazing night out. One of the best nights of my holiday.... never seen anything like it! Amazing show, ridiculously talented people.... definitely worth going!

A must see... as long as you don't mind crowds. This show was AMAZING!!! Our bartender must have had magical powers to keep our drinks straight and he kept 'em coming too without even needing to be asked. If you are a fan of your personal space, you may want to consider dishing out the big bucks to get VIP table... you sort of feel like a sardine on the general floor section. If you are like me though, I was having to much of a great time to care though =)

Terrible experience. We went to Coco Bongo on Playa del Carmen and we were sooooo disappointed! We waited another 40-50 minutes outside in order to enter, despite the fact that we already had tickets purchased through the resort. The only way to really enjoy this facility is to buy their VIP package and to have a reserved table on the upper floors.Unfortunately we were on the main floor and we were stacked like sardines. Absolutely no room to dance or even move. The show itself was average at most. We left half trough as we couldn't enjoy it.

Coco Bongo on Halloween night!. Absolutely fantastic from start to finish! Couldn't have been more entertained. The staff and waiters work non stop. Never had to ask for a drink our waiter had them coming thick and fast. The entertainment got everyone involved, loads going on, lots of confetti, balloons into the public areas. Brilliant! Just wish I could go again and again! Its a must SEE!!!!!!!

Surprisingly good.... Purchased this excursion through Jumbo Tours as our friend was really keen to go, having been four times before she said it's great - a nightclub and show in one. I'd only seen a brief video on youtube before so I had little idea what to expect, other than I'd be shattered since the taxi pickup was 10pm from our hotel and pickup to go back was at 3.30am. We had purchased VIP tickets which gives you access to a small table for your drinks but on arrival I was directed to the side of the building which is reserved for VIP Gold Members. This gives you a small table, stools to sit, toilets very close by and a waiter getting your drinks for you, who was brilliant, spoke perfect English and got you another drink as you're almost finished without having to ask. VIP Gold Members area is on the balcony which is directly opposite of the show stage so you have the best view!!We entered the building and it was packed out, a square bar on the ground floor was full of girls standing on the bar top and every square inch of the place was covered by people, it's relatively small for the amount of people they let in so don't expect to be able to move around much!Unless you want to be right in the mayhem on the ground floor this has to be my best advice - when booking, ask for VIP Gold Member tickets! It seems VIP tickets will get you on the a balcony but not necessarily with a seat as someone complained about on the way back.The shows start up every few minutes, mostly tribute shows like Michael Jackson, Madonna, Freddie Mercury as well as Chicago and some other stuff - all of which was highly entertaining and performed brilliantly. They also have what I can only describe as a gymnastic/cirque du solei type show suspended from the ceiling which was also good. In between shows two massive projector screens come down from the ceiling to accompany the loud music where everyone can dance (in the same spot all night) and they invite girls to dance individually or as two in a small railed area at the front of the main stage between the projector screens under a spotlight. When they go to leave a massive fan blows up their dress for everyone to see. As a summary I'd suggest this was more nightclub than show; loud music, lots of alcohol and cramped, therefore suited more to 18-30's who won't mind this and have a good time than someone looking for something more refined - I say this because there were a few 50+ couples/groups in front of me that looked like they weren't enjoying it very much and being 30 myself I had a good time, particularly after a few drinks but would have been a different story had I not had a seat!

A nightmare. March 2013: Heard the hype, saw the lineups and finally made it to Coco Bongo. Where do I begin to describe the nightmare. The show is canned music and lip synching by talentless amateurs. The few minutes of aerial acrobatics here and there are pretty good, but the show is not above hiring a couple of men with dwarfism and using them for cheap laffs. Pounding music, lots of fog machines, tons of confetti, balloons and streamers from the ceiling get repetitive and tiring really fast especially since cleaners are constantly getting you to move out of their way to get the rubbish off the floor but there's nowhere to move to because enough tickets are sold to make sure the floor is jam-packed. We bought standing room only tickets thinking we would be on the floor and dancing and having fun. But there was barely room to stand, let alone to dance. Customers are constantly pushed and jostled by Coco Bongo security staff, cleaners, waiters and women selling shots of some noxious house liquor. Getting in and out of Coco Bongo involves going through a long corridor and there appear to be no emergency exits. Washrooms are hard to find which is surprising given how freely the liquor flows. Yep, it's open bar all night long. Tables for two on the upper levels can be had for USD $225, and for that price there is a little more space, but given the quality of the 'entertainment', I'd definitely not recommend it. Go if you're young and and want to get drunk and haven't yet developed any taste. I went once out of curiosity, but I wouldn't go again. So many other wonderful things to do in Playa del Carmen. Did I mention Bar Fusion, La Bodega, La Parilla de Manolo?

Lots of fun, constant entertainment. We went last week and it surpassed my expectations. We arrived for around 11.15pm and were shown to our seats. I had read that you must keep tipping your waiter so they keep coming back so we ordered the first round but when we went to tip the waiter he told me to just enjoy my evening and at the end of the night if I want to tip him that was great. I never even got to 3/4 of my drink before he had brought another one! When we first got there a large screen said "8 minutes to the next show" I had expected that the entertainment was only every now and again during the evening but it was constant from when it began at 11.30pm. There was acrobats, tributes to Michael Jackson, Madonna, Usher, Freddie Mercury etc and lots of crowd involvement. Me and my friend went up to dance on stage with several others during a performance which was lots of fun. There is a "podium" in which girls can dance on and it has a wind machine which was very strong and blew up the dresses/skirts. I knew about this before I went and we had talked about getting up for some fun. However, on the night we went the girls who were going on this "podium" were (how do you say this nicely?) very tarty and were only interested in showing off their underwear before the wind machine even started! We had gone on an organised trip and we were told that the show finished at 2am and we would be getting picked up at 3.30am. In fact, when we left at 3.20am the show was only just ending. We couldn't believe how quickly it went and how much fun it was. Everyone was in great spirits and I was surprised that there was a big mix of ages (a couple near us where about 70ys old!) The toilet is spotlessly clean and there is a toilet attendant who cleans the toilet after each person.  There is a guy dressed up as "The Mask" and another dressed as "beatlejuice" who come around and take photos with you. If you like the photos they cost £12.50. I would recommend this night to almost everyone but suggest paying for VIP as we did as the main floor was very packed and not everyone would have been able to see the shows which are amazing. Also, you don't have to stand in line for drinks as you get waiter service which was great
Coco Bongo…Awesome. absolutely fantastic exciting entertainment !!…don't plan to leave early ….We did but the night just flew by !!

Excellent show. We had a great time and the show is amazing. Here are some tips! Do not go unless you are willing to pay for premium. It is so crowded that it is worth every extra penny to get the extra room. The wait service will only be as good as your gratuity. I was a bit turned off by server sneering about level of tipping per drink. However if you tip consistently even if not huge they still come around. All in all I would go back because the show is that good.

FANTASTIC. Went in november 2013. superb,wonderful,brilliant. What can i say? Just go. Its first class. Never seen so many balloons and streamers in my life. Good idea to go vip or gold as you have a chair and table. Also upstairs on the right hand side looking at the stage is a good vantage point. Also next to toilets that you will want with all that drink. ENJOY.

Super touristy but great fun!. At the beginning I wasn't very convinced about going there as it's a very very touristy thing to do but I have to say that the show was amazing and we had great fun. Very very high level of entertainment!

Great Party. We went to Coco Bongo's for my 50th Birthday. The worries about me being too old was quickly left behind. This truly is an amazing show come disco come party and we loved every second of it. As stated in other reviews, it really is worth paying the extra for gold member and VIP entry to save all the queues. The waiter service keeps you drinking all night and you won' t miss a thing. You also get a table and seats if needed. The atmosphere is electric, the sound system is amazing, the dancers are fantastic, the acrobats have you star struck and the dwarf has you in stitches and we purchased a great photo so that I could remember the evening 24hrs afterwards and for years to come. It is a great way to celebrate any occasion. (highly recommended as a must do when you are so near)

Non stop entertainment!. Went to Coco Bongo last Saturday night on a whim and was not disappointed! The amount you get for the price of the ticket is spectacular, the performances are amazing and the overall atmosphere is one of high energy fun!! From the show aspect to the dancing I felt like I was in Rio at Carnival!!

Fantastic nightclub/show. Staying at the Moon Palace but decided to go to PDC Coco Bongo's as we met some friends there. Had an unbelievable time, a trip to Mexico wouldn't be the same without seeing it. Really good tributes, Michael Jackson and Superman the stand out acts. Definitely worth getting the VIP as higher up and had a waiter on hand to supply all the free tequila.

Fantastic show! Shame about the waiter.. This will be the best show you have ever seen! We went as a group of four and were absolutely blown away by the venue, the atmosphere and the show.It is four hours of great entertainment which you will not be able to take your eyes off. One minute you are watching the great acts on the massive stage, next there are people flying through the air on wires then videos playing on the massive screen.Book the goldmember package as you get to see the show from the elevated positions around the club.The only downside to the evening was our waiter (Jesus) as soon as we got there both myself and my friend tipped him $20 usd and $200 Paso respectively, which is about £25, To me this was very generous. Then if his service was good we would tip the same at the end of the show. Then throughout the evening as he got our drinks he would continue to ask for tips so we gave him an extra $400 Paso has the evening went on. After that it got very annoying with him continuing the flap his top pocket for a tip after bringing us a drink, in the end we both got very annoyed and told him he had had enough from us and to not ask again. Considering we spent $108 usd to get in this was poor service. Don't let this put you off as the rest of the staff both service and security were first class.Sort this guy out coco bongo he is a joker.
amazing night. amazing gold member all the way drink as much as you like waiter service and own table. great show,entertainment,disco cant say more than that x

Amazing night out. Enjoyed this trip from start to end. It was just brilliant.The Show: Tributes paid to Beatles, Queen, Michael Jackson, Rhianna, Madonna to name but a few. The artists do a really good job, they have learned their craft well.Gold Member: Well worth it, at first it sounds quite a bit of money for a night out but going gold member is the way to go, yeah it's crowded but this adds to the atmosphere. We had a waiter and we had really good service from him. I cannot comment on what it is like, not paying the extra but note: 'it gets extremely busy'. Getting in as a gold member only meant a small queue, took very little time at all.Would go back without a doubt

A fun night out!. Very fun night out! Started with a drink at the door and headed down to the show area. We had a table to stand at. We made friends with some people in the line to get in so we spent the evening there with them! It was so cool how much variety there was! Lots of dancing with new and old favorite music from USA and Mexico. After a few songs there are skits. My favorite was the Beatles and Beetle Juice and Madonna! It rotated a few dancing songs, a few skits. Also things trapeze acts. Balloons and confetti fly out from the ceiling and every so often a cold blast of air will shoot out to cool off the crowd. I would've definitely gotten a VIP table next time. Standing the whole time is hard and sometimes you can't see good, so getting a table and a bottle service would be the way to go next time. Also the drinks are very sweet. I will definitely go back but just do things differently ;)

GO...nuff said, no GO VIP......so worth it!. Wet met Alejandro at our resort (The Royal). I don't know how Alejandro, ("like the lady GaGa song"...lol) is exactly affiliated with Coco Bongo but he know's how to get the best seats. We told him we like to be treated well and if we were going to upgrade to the VIP tickets we would like the best seats in the house. We promptly paid him $120 per person and were secretly wondering, is this going to be worth it?We were picked up at the resort and walked the few blocks to meet up with Alejandro at the club. He personally escorted us to the VIP line which was very quick and then met us inside to show us our fabulous seats and introduced us to our awesome waiter. I forget his name but I'm sure he's used to that. We were some plastered.... This guy didn't skip a beat and kept us well hydrated with alcohol. The pictures don't do it any justice. Young and old, you must go. Everything from Elvis, The Beatles, Madonna to Pitbull mixed with some Beetlejuice.I'm 40 and my wife is 33 and we had the time of our life. We've been to many shows and even a few Cirque shows and we had an absolute blast at Coco Bongo. The energy in this place is incredible, we had private seating front and centre looking straight at the stage and it couldn't have been better.Go

Great Nightout in Playa del Carmen!. We went to Coco Bongo on our last night (October 18, 2013) in the Riviera Maya. Had a brilliant time!One of the couples we met on a tour to Chichen Itza told us about Coco Bongo. A couple of days later, we decided to go. Ticket Purchase: We ordered our tickets the day before we went, and got the Gold ones (which they also call VIP) via their website. We weren't comfortable about giving our card details via chat, so we decided to forego the 10% discount they were offering. Would have been better if they were just giving a discount coupon out, rather than asking people to pay via chat. They were also selling tickets at the resort we were at (Valentin Imperial Maya), but they said they were out of gold, so we decided to try the website. Lines: We arrived at Coco Bongo around 10.45pm. The gold ticket entrance was at the side. Lines were long, but they moved fast. VIP/Gold: Thought that was a pretty good deal! We were up in the 3rd floor (which was a bit scary from the fire hazard perspective), but good because we didn't like to be in the middle of the dance floor. Guess if we went here when we were younger, we would have liked the dance floor area better! There was a dedicated server bringing drinks to you the whole night. Our server, Daniels Garrotero, was particularly attentive, and he kept the drinks flowing! Thanks Daniels for the amazing service. Only thing that wasn't free were the shots (ladies going around with bottles and neon lights). Don't think they cost a lot, but since we were staying in an all-inclusive, we didn't think we needed any more shots. Entertainment: I'm not a fan of impersonators, but entertainment in Coco Bongo is amazing! We enjoyed all of the shows: Brazilian carnival, Moulin Rouge, Beyonce, Queen, LMFAO, Tron, among others. Had a great time! There was a platform in the middle where girls could dance and have a couple minutes of fame! There was a countdown before the show started, and two massive screens that showed either images from the club or MTVs. There were shows and dancing or interactive activities in between. Been to Vegas, NY, Europe, Asia but haven't seen anything like this before... It was different/unique. It was a fun, fun, fun night! :) Washrooms: There was a washroom at the 3rd floor, which was not crowded, and had an attendant. The washroom was a bit tiny, but it was clean. Photos: They also had people taking photos (souvenirs) throughout the night. They are a bit pricey (around $20/25 a photo!), but thought it was our first visit anyway, so why not!Transport: Think they provided free transport back to your hotel, but we didn't take it, as we didn't stay until the end of the shows. We just took a cab back to the hotel. Lots of cabs outside, and if you go to customer service, they will even hail one for you. Had a great time at Coco Bongo! Glad we went there on our last night in Mexico :) Food After: There was a food place by the Gold Entrance that we ate at for the post-party snack. Cheap and good! :)

Fun Time. My friend and I went to this club because all the workers said that it was the place to be so we decided to go. We were standing in line for about an hour until we finally got it but it didn't bother me. As soon as we got in, people were giving out shots. Played good music and it was a nice atmosphere. We got to go on the top stage and dance in between the performances they had which were very entertaining. If you're young and looking for a fun time, this is the place for you.

They watch you go to the bathroom. Myself and my girlfriend went to coco bongo waited in line for an hour i then went to the bathroom in the stall and there where secuity guards peeking through the cracks in the door and one peeked his head over the stall on the other side they said they do it to make sure people are not doing drugs!!! Nice they watch everyone go to the bathroom to control drugs that is not right at all.... They have like 6 security guards in the bathroom they hide in stalls and watch people.

Unbelievable!! Best night ever!! . Surprise after surprise this night is amazing we sat on the main floor there wasn't a lot of room but the waiter service was worth every penny Going to the toilet was a bit of a effort because they were all they Way over the other side of the room but if you detour by having a dance on the bar / stage it makes it less of a effort this will be a night I never forget and one to tell everyone by far the best night I've ever had out!!

BEST NIGHT OF MY LIFE. Went to coco bongo last night with my girlfriend and had the most incredible night ever. We paid for the gold member entrance, for which we had a table for 2 on the first balcony, front and centre, private entrance, waiter service bringing us our drinks all night, I didn't get to the end of a bottle without a fresh one being on the table. It was nothing like anything I've ever experienced. Strongly recommend going here to anybody who is in playa del carmen. I wouldn't rush to get the VIP as the standing area also looked fantastic with the huge smoke fans that blow on the crowd. Brilliant night. Still got the hangover!

An experience like no other.... The best night out you could ever imagine to go on! Family & friends had previously been to Coco Bongo & encouraged me to book when I confirmedI was going to Mexico on my honeymoon. I booked VIP tickets because the experience was far better for only a little fee extra - drinks inc & express entrance.If you're going to Mexico GO TO COCO BONGO! I took my Nan that's 82 years old & she was made welcome & thoroughly enjoyed the evening. Various acts, music for all & entertainment for all people - all made to feel like they're apart of the whole experience.

Great time. Could not leave mexico with out visiting the famous coco bongos.Booked vip package with first choice rep(grand sirenis) $120,included transport at 21:45 - 03:30,seated area so your not down in the cattle market standing all night and drinks all included,we tipped the waiter about 20 pesso and we did not have to ask for a drink once,he was always there when the glasses was near to the end.

Best clubbing experience ever! Nothing like UK clubbing. This nightclub is the best nightclub I have ever been to. It is about 10 times better than any club I have ever been to in England, including London or any other country so far. You pay $50 to get in and near where you are, a waiter will get your drink orders so you don't have to go to the bar. There are different shows going on in the club, based on the film called The Mask, and the actors are amazing! There is a little box at the top of the nightlub which you can dance in for a minute or two and it will show on the big screen, then right at the very end a pressure sweeping wind will blow upwards on the box and if you're a girl with a dress, it will reveal your pants and that will also show on the big screen. Girls are allowed to dance on the bar, which was quite fun, although I was more worried about falling off as I hadn't had much to drink at that point! There are live acts dancing from ropes in the ceiling and others on stage, the atmosphere is always buzzing! We left at around 3.30am to get our taxi back to the hotel and the club was still packed and full of life as it was when we arrived. The toilets are so so clean in this place, everytime I went to the toilet, I always saw cleaners going in after you to clean up. Normally club toilets are filthy, so I was quite surprised at this. I would love for there to be a club like this in England! Anyone that loves clubbing MUST go to Coco Bongo without a doubt!
Super fun!. Everyone kept saying to go there and they were right! If you go after a certain hour you can get there for free!

I had a blast!. Go to the Coco Bongo show if you can! There's dancing plus theatrical acts every 25 minutes or so.We paid $45USD/each from our resort (we got a pre-sale discount). We purchased on Sunday for tickets on Wednesday night. The club was really packed - the service from bartenders/servers was slow, but if you tip them, they come back a lot more frequently!Overall the show was really good, it was like Cirque du Soleil. My main complaint was that it was WAY too packed. I was always shoulder to shoulder with some stranger... It would have been a fire hazard in the USA. I would go back, but probably pay a little more for the higher tier seats.

Coco Bonkers!!. One of the best nights out for a long time. Took the Thomson VIP package (pricey but would recommend). The evening is a mixture or Cirque de Soleil, dance club, cabaret, tribute bands, karaoke, New Years Eve party, theatre, with a healthy dose of audience participation. BRILLIANT!

Amazing one night, shocking the other. Went on the first night for the regular, all inclusive drinks night and were blown away. It was packed but managed to find a space and the show was amazing. Decided to go again on the following night and 'upgraded' to the VIP option. You basically have to stick with the same drink all night (for more money), get the promise of a seat and table just to be shoe-horned into a corner and share a table (without seats) with other unsuspecting customers who have the same deal to be told that your reserved table has been sold on (cash in hand) by the floor manager to the locals. 5 star for the first night, 1 star for the next one. If you go DO NOT get the VIP package. From speaking around we weren't the first that this happened to and certainly won't be the last

Don't know what the hype is all about. I always hear from family and friends who have visited Mexico, that the Coco Bongo show is amazing.However, I didn't find it that great (we paid $70-$80USD/each from our resort). The club was really packed - the service from bartenders/servers was really slow. We were served once-twice at most. The bartenders and servers gave priority treatment to the local residents and the spanish speaking visitors instead of equally distributing their attention to all visitors. Overall the show was incredibly good, it was like Cirque du Soleil, but too packed and service was too slow for my liking. If I could do it all over again, I would've paid for the second tier seats so we would have seats (instead of standing the whole night) and a better view. I wouldn't go back to watch the show again, once was enough.

What a night!. Whilst on our honeymoon we decided to for for a night out at Coco Bongos. We did pay more to be sat on the second tier. To be honest when we first arrived I was a bit disappointed with the fact the extra money we paid for better seats were only a couple of bar stools, however once I saw how busy it was in the main area I was glad we did pay the extra. The extra money included waiter service all night, our particular waiter was fantastic, unfortunately due to the alcohol I cant to this day remember his name. We never had an empty glass, about a quarter of the way through a fresh glass would be brought to you along with free shots every now and again. The entertainment was at times a bit random, there is no set theme throughout, just different trapeze artists, impersonators & acts etc but we both really enjoyed it and would go back.

Great show, once is enough though!. We enjoyed the show- lots going on and really entertaining... Won't spoil anything, so I'll just say... You won't be disappointed with the acts and surprises :)However, you are packed in like sardines and constantly being pushed and shoved, it kind of ruins the enjoyment... Our waiter and a nearby security guard were particularly rude ( the more you tip, the slightly better the service) however, my advise would be to upgrade to the gold member service so you can watch the show without constantly being pushed around. It was so annoying!! It's an expensive night out, but I would still pay double the amount on standard entrance to upgrade, particularly if you're going as a couple.Great show, but if you are claustrophobic or don't like your personal space invaded, you need to upgrade!

One of the greatest night clubs on the planet.. Non stop action. The show is great featuring Tribute performers for Michael Jackson and Beyonce. Plus tributes to broadway and movies. Great service and more fun that you can imagine.

the worst waiter ANGEL. We visit coco bongo on the 26/10/2013 and it was the worst night!!!! ANGEL the waiter he was racist to all the Mexican people he toll us to give him a big tip and he was going to serve us some drinks and we did give him a big tip we were 7 of us after we gave him the money he forgot about us and he was only serving American people them we all stared to go to the bar and the same thing the bartender ask also for some money if you want service. But he was not the only one asking for some money also all the waiter were asking for some tips and we decide not to tip anymore thanks to ANGEL what he did to us at the beginning. People if you are a tipper do it at the end of the open bar if they serve you good I don't recommend COCO BONGO It not for the 80 usd that we each pay there are better night club like mandala or coco maya. ANGEL this is for you "tip is earned not given" stop being a RACIST and if you don't understand ANGEL " LA PROPINA NO SE DA SE GANA"
"A MUST!!!". The best night out we have had in ages, with fantastic music, a show which could only be described as awesome and drinks on tap with our own waiter.

Fantastic night out. We as a group not knowing too much about the show but were all blown away with the performance ! Excellent show that shouldn't be missed by any one . Went as gold vip ticket holders so the Waiters keep the drinks flowing so you don't miss any part of show queuing at the bar , top nights entertainment all round .

Spectacular show !!!. We had a great night at coco bongos and it is well worth a visit. It's not cheap, especially if you go VIP but it is worth every penny. The show is amazing and goes on all around you. The waiters are great and my drink was full all evening. All the spirits are branded and they even have jack Daniels which kept my husband happy !! The whole evening was amazing and 4am came around very quickly.

out of this world. this was the most amazing thing i have ever seen its a must for anyone.My husband is by no means a club goer and he loved it i just wish we had went twice its awesome and the staff are fab Al our waiter for the night was fab he never left us and we were never without a drink the show was outstanding and the breaks gave you a chance to go to the loo and not miss a thing i would recommend everyone see this to believe it cant wait to go back xx

AWESOME~!!. 7 friends and myself made the trek from our hotel in puerto aventuras. totally worth it! we had a fantastic time.. the shows were incredible! The place was packed and we set up shop dancing on the bar in the middle of the first floor. Great view of the shows and the bartenders made sure our hands were never without a cocktail. The bathrooms were the best bathrooms i have ever seen in a club. clean , well stocked and smelt like cinnamon hearts.

Amazing. Great show recommend the balcony areas as I have never seen so many people in one place at one time they do jam you in but we were with Thomas Cook party so had own balcony and waiter . Show is jaw dropping can't be missed if ever go to Mexico

Good Show. The Show was amazing!!! The only thing I would have to say is try to get a table in one of the upper levels! The staff encourage people (only girls which doesn't seem fair to the boys who like to drop it like it's hot) to dance on the bar, which is fine when they are playing the music videos. I would suggest they have them get down when the actual performers are performing. If you are on the floor, you end up seeing more of drunk girls bums than the performers who are doing a really great job! It was much better when they had the acrobats so the girls could not be dancing on the bar.

Brillant night!. Great nightlife. We had a group with us and we all had a great night. We booked through a rep and got the bus he organised. Was a safe way to go to it. Would recommend to go to Coco Bongos for a good night out. No one should be disappointed as there is lots going on! Great place!
loco bongo. Brilliant!!!! what an incredible night!!! the stage acts are so good,spiderman,batman and tron are spectacular!!!

Greatest show. This is a must see!!!!! It's very crowded but it was so worth it. There's different shows put on like broadway type. In between sets there music playing dancers on stage. Be prepared it is an all night event until 330am you'll want to stay the whole time.

Amazing. Definitely the highlight of our holiday.
We were given a private table on the dance floor, had a great waiter called Adrian.
The show, music and atmosphere was so good, everyone felt like part of the show. Our glasses never got empty. I can't praise this place enough. Great value too
We all need a Coco Bongos in our life!

Great experience. Coco Bongo is a great place to go if you are looking to have a good time. The drinks are good and the staff is a lot of fun. The show was incredible and seemed like it lasted forever. At first we were apprehensive because we were going through a resort, and it was $70 a person. It was absolutely worth the money, and we will be returning on our next visit to Mexico.

Nothing like it, superb fun. We booked the VIP all inclusive tickets through Thomson, probably about £80 each which we thought was pricey but having been there, we now reckon it's really good value. As the show doesn't start till 11.30pm, we had a couple of Red Bulls beforehand but as soon as the show starts, the atmosphere, dancing and the lively crowd would keep anyone awake. The whole place just erupts as soon as your nations flag appears on the big screen. We plus a load of other Brits were singing our hearts out to "Vindaloo" and the same was said for most of the songs. The performers and acts were amazing, acrobats, fight scenes, duets, dancing, it was just the most amazing show I think I have ever seen, perfect mixture of show and club.Tip your bar tender reguarly, and you will never be short of drinks the whole evening. Our lovely bar tender, Eduardo, kept bringing us shots of all descriptions as well as beer and cocktails - the pina coladas were very drinkable.Don't miss the opportunity to dance on the bar in the middle of the dance floor!

Overpriced. Firstly, this place is obviously a must see when visiting Cancun or Playa Del Carmen because of its worldwide reputation so you of course should go and check it out. The first time we went we paid over the odds with Thomson for the VIP tickets which cost roughly £90 each. This included free drinks and drink service for the evening and seating in a VIP balcony area overlooking the club. Now, the reason we really felt that this wasn't the right package for us was because instead of having the fun we were looking at everyone else having fun from our seats on a balcony! There was no space (or room) to dance or to move from where we were as it was jam packed and our waiter was pushy for tips the entire evening. Eventually when we left we felt that we had paid over the odds for a so-so cabaret show, and as we didn't drink a huge amount (maybe 3 drinks each?) we really felt shafted. We may have drank more if we weren't just sitting in a packed out balcony and perhaps felt that we were in a club.But, one redeeming comment for this place: a few nights later whilst walking past Coco bongo we were offered free entry general admission; so, we accepted and thought we'd see how things were on the ground floor with everyone else. The show was already about half way through when we got in but the experience was fantastic. Drinks are VERY expensive with shots costing around 200 pesos each and when we ordered a round of 4 drinks we were told it would be 500 pesos before ordering and then when we got our drinks we were asked for 900 pesos. Only when we refused to pay because it wasn't the price we were told did the barman eventually give us the drinks for the quoted price of 500.Anyway, to sum up; I'd personally say the experience is much better going with general admission rather than the VIP package, you actually get to experience the atmosphere, dance, meet people and feel like you're in a club rather than sitting and observing everyone else have fun. My recommendation would be that if you're travelling all inclusive to have a good drink in your hotel before you go so that you don't spend too much on drinks because they cost over the odds.
So much fun!. There is so much going on and it's all so fun. Stage shows, acrobats falling from the ceiling, people dancing on the bar, balloons being hit around, dancing, singing - a blast!

Coco Bongo. This show was fantastic!! I was worried I would be tired but I was so into the lights, action, performances, and energy around me I could have stayed a few more hours. This was definitely one of our favorite activities during our trip. Our guides were also excellent that picked us up from Sian Kian. I cannot wait until we go back next year to visit Coco Bongo again

Never bored for a minute. I was really lucky as the shuttle for coco bongo was a little late so I made it on time. I took us right to the bus station only 2 blocks away. Since I was independence day it was really busy by makes it all the more fun. Our guide on the shuttle was great in getting us wrist bands and getting a good view from the balcony. The shows were great every 10 mins, people dancing on the bar and drinks a plenty you can even rent a bartender for the night. Best night EVER just make sure a good pair of shoes for standing unless you pay for VIP which can cost you almost double.

Loved it. The wife and I did the VIP for a friday night in early October. It was simply awesome! Loved every minute of it. Exceeding well done in all areas from the beer service to the show side of things. I'd recommend this to anyone!It's things like Coco Bongo's that'll make me come back to Mexico!

Fantastic fun. We left the resort and paid one fee that took us there got us inand paid for our drinks all night. The fun never stopped. There were acts going on everywhere, from Michael Jackson to numbers from different musicals in the upper balcony, Then there were things happening on the bar and above it .Dancing all night from 10:30 til around 6 am.IThere was never a dull moment.. As soon as I get back to Playa del Carmen I am heading there for another fun time!!!!

Brilliant. What a fantastic night this was great show would advise slipping one of the servers 50 pesos and they will make sure you never without a drink , your eyes have to be in more than one place as there is so much going on will go again when we go back .

Brilliant show and service. What an experience I would say go VIP for service and a seat looked like it got a little crowded on the dance floor.Staff were great constant supply of drinks the shows were amazing the time flew there was so much fun I wish we had a coco bongos in England.

A must on your to-do list while in Playa. I went on a Weekday Wednesday night and since i booked thorugh the resort earlier (Allegro Playacar) we had transportation to/from. We paid the 60.00 the basic- for all you can drink and entrance to the club. We got there about 10:20 and the line was sooo long but the guy from the resort was able to get us in quicker and as soon as you go in your offered drinks right away.I suggest if you do not have a paid spot for a waiter like i did not, then pick somewhere close to the bar The show started about 11:30 and it was AMAZING!! everyone in the club young and old knew the words to every song it was soo much fun. Since the place was packed it is a trek just to go the bathroom but after a while you get used to it. For Smokers you can smoke outside on a terrace overlooking the street it isn't very big but you not out there too long. All in all a great experience that evryone must do at least once.

A must when in Mexico!. The best experience that we have ever had. Go VIP, you will never be short of a drink because the service is fantastic. Would go back to mexico just to go back to coco bongos :)

not one of the best times i had. the shows were good but i wish i was able to see more! it was completely over packed and people all on top of one another. i had to stand on the bench in order to see what was going on because the set up where we were was so awkward, there was two rows in front of the vip area where they could only stand and if i wanted to sit to enjoy a drink or to watch the show it was impossible. not sure if i would try it again.

Cheesy, boring, rammed.. We paid $280 for 2 gold member tickets with guaranteed seats. When we arrived (well before the show started) we were told there were no seats left. The place was packed, it felt like a battery farm. I stood for 4 hours watching the very average show set to the lamest soundtrack I could have hoped for and swigging the included cheap booze until I could finally get the bus home. The entertainment is about as low brow as it gets, camp dancing and confetti cannons mixed with occasional bungee acrobatics. A Mecca for failed circus performers and washed up cruise ship dancers. Probably best suited to hen parties and your mum. She would probably enjoy it.

BEST CLUB SHOW EVER. Highly recommend! So so random and everyone is having a good time. One minute there are dancers the next someone is flying through the air then suddenly some acrobatics are there!! Love it! 4 hours of show felt like 1 hour. Time flies when you're having fun!TIP - PLEASE go goldmember! It's all drinks inc and it gets a bit tight on the bottom floor, where with goldmember you get a seat and a really good view!

Wow best night out ever. This place is absolutely amazing never had a night like it. Show with a disco what an amazing idea. The bar staff were spot on how they remember what you drink then find you in the crowd with a fresh drink. All the acts were amazing really enjoyed the spider man act. All the dances had it down perfect.Never been in a club like it by far the best club in the world. Only thing I I wish there was VIP available but we only booked the night before. If your in Mexico do this night

Great Night. This club is exiting, vibrant and absolutely full of life. the entrance fee may sound expensive but it's worth every penny. We reserved a table but you honestly don't need to, the action is on the danced floor and you get closer to the action this way. A must visit when in Playa Del Carmen or Cancun.

Pure genius! Best night ever!!. Excellent night out! All inclusive drinks so you pay for your band and drinks are free all night! We ended up going twice, the show then mix of music and a nightclub mixed together is such a fantastic idea!We didn't pay for the gold vip service, as we wanted to stand. Waiters were superb constantly refreshing drinks, toilets were kept clean. The atmosphere is out of this world!!!Suitable for ALL ages, there were older generation, couples, friends, young . Will be returning next year when we come back to Mexico with friends!!!!
Absolute Ball. What an amazing show, this place is something else.....We went as a gold member which I would definitely recommend as the club is very busy.

VIP is a must !. Fabulous night out , very entertaining from the minute you enter the place . Well managed , my glass was never empty , thanks to John our waiter for the evening . We went on Saturday 5th October , it was worth every penny . Even the toilets are well managed and kept clean all the time. I ve been to shows Vegas that aren't as good as this . I must advise do not be tempted by the food bars on the street after the show has ended no matter how hungry you are !!

BEST NIGHT OUT EVER!!!!!. Wow. Definitely the most amazing club I have ever been too. Don't pay VIP to sit down, you wanna dance. Tip the waiter when you go in and he'll give you a table, we went over the top and tipped $20 at a time, the drinks were mental, the service we had was outstanding. You only really need to tip $5 at a time and they'll look after you good enough. If you don't tip you will be asked to leave after around 2 hours. The show's were amazing, dry iced blassed, streamers coming out of the sky. Wow and wow again. Absolutely amazing. I don't want to give too much away, definite must see.Don't take camera's as they will be taken off you as your not allowed to video.

Fantastic night. This is a great night out, we were concerned we may be a little older for this club, but it covers all ages. The show parts are really good and the music varied. We went VIP which is a little expensive, and it is a bit of a cheek when we had paid £169 for the two of us and then the rep said to just book our own taxi to get there and back! (Come on Thomson - not good). We left this club on a high at 3.30 am and had one of the best nights ever!. VIP is a must as you will be packed like sardines and not have as good a view. VIP package means all your drinks are included except Red Bull and Champagne, our own waiter kept the drinks flowing free all night. We came out at 3.30am on a high (a non drug high) and some great memories.

VIP Essential. We went as a group of 4, on an organised VIP trip arranged by our in-resort rep. The fee included transportation to/from our resort and 'Gold Member' entrance, which is the VIP experience. This included seats at a table, waiter service, all drinks and premium location to view the show. I went to tip our waiter on the first round (having been recommended to tip well for good service). However, the waiter politely refused the tip! He said "Please pay me at the end, if you are happy with my service". Well, we certainly were happy and he kept our drinks refilled all night!The show itself is a mashup of broadway shows, tribute acts, dancing, trapeze artists and generally a crazy night. Very enjoyable. Easily on a par with Club Tropicana in Havana (which we did last year). Very camp, lots of colour and full of energy. All in all, great fun!

Do not miss coco bongos!!!. Amazing club!!!Get the goldmember VIP ticket so you can sit down and enjoy!! Plus u get waiter service which is amazing!! Shots without even asking!!!Trapezing Beetlejuice, dwarf Beetlejuice, Michael Jackson, Captain Jack Sparrow!!!

Coco bongo. Went to coco bongo for a night out well what a fantastic night out it was and me and my husband are 50 plus and really enjoyed it we got a VIP seat bit crowded at the bottom mostly young ones we was advised by another holiday maker to go VIP and glad I listened to them we had a really fab night a night not to be missed :))))

Great night ,. Good nights entertainment, music a little loud , pay the extra and get gold member tickets,you'll get a seat and a better view and amazingly attentive staff constantly getting you drinks !!

No age limit to a really fantastic night. Just returned from 2 weeks in Mexico playa del Carmen and one of our chosen trips was to go to coco bongos for a birthday celebration for one of our friends. 3 of us are in our 60's and had a fabulous evening, the drinks were coming fast and furious, the show was absolutely fantastic, but most of all we laughed and enjoyed a really great evening, we actually left there at 4 o'clock am, rotten stop outs that we were haha, never to old for a fab evening, with great friends, you must go.

AMAZING! This is a MUST DO!. We went with a group of 9 people for a birthday while on vacation. We upgraded to have two tables, bottle service, waiter, and all inclusive drinks. ALL WORTH IT! All the shows were spectacular and having the space at the table was a must! We stayed at the Grand Riviera Princess and booked with a representative there, Ramon, who was amazing! He helped arrange everything for us and even helped us get seamlessly through the door to our table without trouble. THANK YOU RAMON!
Amazeballs!!!!!. This is a must if visiting mexico, the show is absolutly out of this world...EVERYONE should go!!!! A night of fun and laughter that you will never forget! :o)

Once is enough. The rave reviews aren't necessarily wrong but they might be getting a little ahead of themselves. As someone who has been to many shows in Vegas, NYC etc etc, I can see the appeal of an all in one entertainment extravaganza. From that perspective, yes it is much more than any one show and it does go for 4+ hours. BUT, the individual performances and talents of the performers really aren't that spectacular. The acrobatics aren't overly remarkable and the performers all mime to a cover track while a video of the real artist plays on a huge screen in the background on the stage. Most of the time, I found myself watching the screen. The tracks are generally live recordings of the real artist with the crowd sound pumped up really high, adding to the atmosphere and making it feel like the crowd is going really wild. There are massive breaks between performances and in those breaks its just average pop music and the highlight is watching the girls from the crowd dance on the stage and then being surprised when the air vents open and blow their skirts up. It really is the highlight of the evening. It kind of feels like a new years eve theme night if it was new year every 20 minutes or so. It's a very festive atmosphere so you will have fun but I'd stop short of saying the show itself is the best thing you could ever see. We (2 girls) bought $45 tickets on the street a few hours before the show as we didn't want to go VIP. Got there at 10.30, battled the crowds on entry and went straight in and claimed a spot at a table in the corner just below the VIP section. You wouldn't want to be in the middle of the general admin section, it was chaos. At least we had a table to put our drinks on. We tipped our waiter $10 at the start and he brought us drinks before we needed to order them but to be honest we told him to stop after about 4 when we got tired of drinking watered down margaritas that clearly had no alcohol in them. I agree with previous posters re emergency exits, there is no way people could get out safely if needed to, there is one narrow passage. Crowd thins out fairly early though as people get fed up with crap drinks, crap drinks being poured on you and fat chicks dancing on the bar/stage getting their skirts blown up. No one needs to see that sh1t

Wow, WOw, & WOW... We went as a group of four the last weekend of September 2013. And I must say that it a thoroughly enjoyable experience. If you're looking for a bigger venue, then I would recommend going to the Cancun location. The majority of the performances were pretty good; I have no complaints. If I were to complain about anything it would be the cost of sitting in the VIP section. I definitely would not want to be standing the entire night, but the VIP section should include top shelf drinks and not trying to nickel & dime me for all the little extras. All in all it was a good experience.

Amazing. The shows were all amazing we went VIP and got free drinks all night but the only problem was we had a side view off the show if you want to experience the full force off coco bongo then don't go VIP.... also if your walking passed in the day time and there's a man in a Spider-Man's costume offing to poses for a picture don't do it as he then demands money from you

So much fun! . Get VIP tables . Spend the extra for that and to bypass the line... Plus u get free liquor all night ... Close to 5th ave. we stayed at The Royal and had a guy Alejandro that used to work there at the booth we bought our tickets . He physically took us there and checked on us all night. So much fun ..a must!
