Coco Bongo Playa del Carmen. Coco bongos is sold as a night club but I am sorry night club or Vegas Show does not do it justice, it is far better than both. You start to go in about 10.15pm and the show starts around 11.00pm. The atmosphere on the build up is amazing with staff dancing on the bar. As soon as you are sat your server is bringing you drinks and does not stop all night, at one point with shots we had three drinks each on the table. I must point out we had the gold tickets, these give you unlimited drinks for the night and the best seats to view the show and what a show. We were blown away 4 hours of themes set to music by far the best show I have ever seen from the Mask to Spiderman to Queen and Michael Jackson tributes. There are 2 Coco Bongos one in Cancun and one in playa Del Carmon we went to the latter which allows you to try the bars in 12th avenue. My advice don’t get to drunk before you go in as to miss the show would be quite simply wrong.

Amazing. We came to Mexico for a two week honeymoon and also to celebrate my birthday. We ended up visiting coco bongo twice in this time, I would love to give the venue 5* but for the following reasons I scored it a 4*.Our second visit (for my birthday.) almost never happened. We took the ticket out and placed on the dressing table at the hotel so it wouldn't be forgotten and went for something to eat. As we returned the ticket had been 'cleaned up' by the maid. The hotel reception made two phone calls- one to coco bongo, who said under no circumstances could we come without our ticket (even though they took our name at booking and we had ID) and then to the Thomas cook reps. Their 'manager' Claudia basically said tough luck and couldn't get off the phone quicker, which understandably, on the last night of our honeymoon and my birthday really upset me- especially considering we had paid to visit twice in one holiday and spent over a thousand pounds on trips with Thomas cook. My new husband was shain sent to make some phonecalls and really saved the day! We managed to get hold of our resort rep (Stuart and Kathryn at Gran Bahia) who basically said no problem and emailed coco bongo a copy of the ticket and suddenly we were allowed in?!? Which was great but understandably frustrating that we had been told no chance and were about to stay at the hotel.Secondly, the first time we visited, we were led to the very top floor as part of the tc project (Thomas cook bar crawl) where we were stood on chairs trying to see the stage and we couldn't- there was one female and one male cubicle and the bar was less than a metre wide- with one bartender.we managed one drink in the short 1.5 hours we were inside. The reason we visited again was the parts of the show we did see making our way upstairs were fab- the smoke mists, lighting and visual effects really added to the atmosphere and even though we were actually cramped like sardines, I left wanting more! The Wednesday when we first visited was a lot busier than the second day which was a Monday. Our rep explained it does look unsafe, but the place has lots of secret escapes and they can evacuate in 5 minutes. I actually get very claustrophobic, but felt surprisingly okay in here. You can definitely see Jim Carreys influences!I won't explain the show bit by bit as an element of surprise is what works with the show. It is not the west end, but for a nightclub it is amazing- trapezes over your head, Jackson acts that actually did him justice- humour etc etc. u found myself oohing and aahing at the next 'surprise' that would happen and before you knew it would be another. One tip- if you spend your time recording or taking photographs- you will lose out on feeling the atmosphere. When you look back or show photos to people, you cannot show the atmosphere so it won't seem as impressive! Maybe take one or two, go with an open mind and prepare for a good night.

Good fun night out. Really entertaining, was sold as trubute acts ( all miming) acrobats and party time. Constant explosion of streamers and balloons to make party atmosphere.Expensive night out, drinks included. Big queue for toilets, only 1 cubicle available at each WC which meant long queue and missing a lot of show and been moved on by bar staff or security whilst waiting.

Like nowhere I've ever been before. When visiting Mexico the only thing I knew I wanted to do was visit Coco Bongo and I've got to say I wasn't disappointed.After being told by our rep we couldn't go with them on their VIP trip as it was fully booked we were over the moon when someone from Coco Bongo came around the pool one day and offered us tickets to any night we wanted.While we weren't VIP we ended up paying the same price for 2 people as I VIP ticker would been and once we got there we were pleased we hadn't booked VIP and you're put up in the sticks and miles from the toilet.Not being VIP meant we had to queue to get in and it was a little confusing once we got in when trying to get out wristbands but after that the night was brilliant. We got our first drinks easily (after being told it's impossible to get a drink) and as we tipped the waiter he wouldn't leave us alone all night. He kept sending over different shots and different drinks which we couldn't complain about.It's hard to describe the shows themselves without spoiling them but they are a must see. We didn't stop dancing all night long and were gutted when we had to leave for the 3.30am pick up back to our hotel.

A must of your in Mexico. Was undecided if to go but so glad we did. Paid VIP which was 120 dollors about £80 well worth it. Transport there and back from hotel. Entrance straight in. Great seats on 1st balcony. Waiter brilliant never went without a drink and the show itself amazing. There was 8 of us and we had a brilliant time. Got there about 1030pm and it finished just after 3am. They kept getting me up on stage too which was fab.
Coco Bongo!!!!. Everyone has to experience this place at least once in their lifetime! Fabulous! It's a club, with theatrical and acrobatic performances! Even the wait staff can dance! Amazing!
BRILL !. We only had a couple of hours in there, but wow what a great show and experience !!!PLEASE BRING THIS TO THE UK !

Mental!. We did the VIP Gold trip, well worth it, as the place is mobbed. You don't have to wait in the queues you're ushered in a side door and you get table service, so you don't have to go to the bar and your drinks are included, you'd be hard pushed to get to the bar if not. I can't begin to describe the entertainment, as it just so random, there are acts on the stage, acrobats, dancers all kinds of stuff going on, but I've never been anywhere like it. If you only intend to go to Mexico the once - you must go here, its a brilliant night out!

Best entertainment, amazing a MUST see... We paid for the table service at Coco Bongos and we were more than happy with the service. We got a bottle of Absolute and drank the whole bottle, we did tell our guide that we wouldnt be getting the bus back as we didnt we would make it till the end but we could not have left this place as it is amazing, entertaining, enticing, enjoyment cant think of enough words to express my excitement.We didnt know what to expect, but on entering the club we were entertained from start to finish. Our waiter was fantastic and even escorted me too and from the ladies room (really lovely). There is acrobats, singing acts, dancers and just all around amazeballs.A must for any traveller and a must for us on our return. Wonderful and amazing.

Unmitigated disaster!. This is our 13th trip to Mexico and all have been wonderful. We have been on many Mexican excursions and side trips while there. Going to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen last night was the worst experience we have had. We paid for VIP tickets through the Apple rep at our resort, only to get a phone call at 5pm the night we were going saying they were sold out in VIP. We exchanged the tickets for Express entry and were told they were not going to be busy during a week night, so no worry getting a seat and drinks. We were picked up late and still had to stop at another resort. We arrived one minute before it started at 11pm and had to stand in a very long line 2 blocks down the line. We were told a Coco Bongo rep would greet us and escort us past the line to go right in. That never happened. We stood in line for over an hour and never did get to see the show. When we made it inside, we were pushed, shoved and trampled. We could not see the show at all, but only hear the music because it was packed and overbooked. We finally fought our way up to a doorway, and decided that was as close as we would get. Not wanting to spend 4 hours wedged between people and a doorway. We turned and left, as did others.We were misled from the start.Scam! We are going to complain to Apple and refuse the charge on our credit card.Are there any occupancy laws in Mexico? A fire at this place would kill hundreds.

Absolutley fabulous!!!!. This was our 4th time in Mexico and 4th visit to Coco Bongos and I must say that it never fails to impress!!! The acts were fabulous and there is something going on all the time. We knew there would be balloons and ticker tape but was still so exciting. We have noticed that this year there are more VIP dedicated areas but we chose to stand and found a spot where we were not pushed about or crushed in like others were on the ground floor. Our waiter was geat and refilled our drinks when he noticed that they were nearly empty. We are planning a return trip to Mexico next year and would again go to Coco Bongos but would look at the VIP tickets. Its a must for all ages (we are women of 59 and 60) and enjoyed the show as much as the younger audience.

Great show!. These guys know how to put up a show! Great entertainment, lots of people working to make sure everything works perfectly. Lots of cool shows in a fun night.Some tips:No need to pay full price! Find a way to pay less (ask Israelis...)No need for open bar! You will be too busy watching the shows...Also, they keep trying to sell shots... And also - the songs change every moment, which is fun but also a boy hyper...Have fun!

What a night!!. I've wanted to go here the last 3 visits to Mexico but never got the chance until now.We brought VIP tickets which I would say are a must.On arrival there are huge queues everywhere to get in and this was 2 hours before the general doors for the show open. With a VIP ticket, you get straight in through a dedicated entrance.Security is tight and you will be searched and frisked. No problem if you have nothing to hide I say!!We were then escorted to our area which no one else could enter. It consisted of a small table and a bench type sofa which you could sit on, but in all fairness you end up dancing on the back of it.The show is amazing from beginning to end. Cheesy pop, great tributes, musicals and aerobatics show. I had watched many videos of this before I went but still found it amazing. So much more happened but I don't want to give too much away and spoil it for anyone.We had our very own bar tender so didn't need to leave our table. Not once did we have to ask for drinks, our table was constantly being refilled with drinks of our choice and many shots of various colours!!Beware of the shot girls who work there. They walk round giving out shots, but these are not part of the all inclusive and they will charge you for them.Amazing night and I would recommend to all.The show starts at 11pm and ends at 3pm. It then turns into a night club where you can stay on if you wish.

Great night out!. My husband and I had a fantastic night out at Coco Bongo. The acts from start to finish were just fantastic, with lots of dancing to be had. We bought the standard tickets, however had express entry...if you get in there early enough there is no need to pay the extra for a table as we were in exactly the same spot and felt no need to put our drinks down! Waiters come round serving EVERYONE, not just the people at tables. Great night!

I think I enjoyed it?. We booked thos VIP table thingybobs. Upon arriving a queueing in the rain (so much for "express" pass). We were shown to out VIP seats with table... err... you don't actualy sit on the seat, you sit on the self behind and have to reach for you tiny table which you share between 4.Okay, not overly impressive so far!One very positive aspect is that our bar server was very, very attentive, and kept our drinks stocked up all night... I remember singing a lot, and dancing....but the rest of the night is a bit of a blur...I'm sure there was a Jesus being flung around on a giant elastic band, and a dwarf...I think it was great fun, but as I was so absolutely hammered, I barely remember anything! I did fall in a bush on the walk back to the condo - that was fun!What wasn't fun was how I felt the next day :o)

Not very VIP. Myself and two others decided to purchase VIP tickets which was billed as the 'Michael Jackson' special.Good points first, the drink server did his job well, I would for tips too.Ok that's the good points dealt with.Bad points, VIP section just means you get to sit on ledge, did I mention squashed into a space on a ledge, I think the owners of Coco Bongo should rename VIP as 'expensive ticket for little extra' tickets!The vodka I was served barely got me in the mood, and I tried my hardest to sink as many as possible, watered down????The show was at best average, the wire performers showing some skills. So many reviews on here that give the entertainment raving reviews.......either this is the first and only show they have seen or maybe a Christmas pantomime, it doesn't compare to the shows I've seen around the world. They like to quote the CNN broadcaster that said it was better than any Las Vegas show.....really? They even go as far as showing the TV clip in the middle of the show stating that, tacky. She must have been very drunk that night or got free entry and felt she had to say that. Now I know why so many shop traders in 5th avenue offer you cocaine and weed, it's to make a night out at Coco Bongo tolerable, so stock up before entering.The smoking area is a joke, it was raining that night and the area you smoked in leaked all over, it wouldn't take much to repair as it's the size of postage stamp, imagine how overcrowded it was, one day I'm sure it will collapse or set fire (CNN report that!)Anyway Coco Bongo wasn't for me, I would have rather have spent the money on drinks elsewhere.One last thing, Eeeerrrr Michael Jackson special, NO..........I might be wrong here but I'm guessing that it's the same show every night and it's randomly promoted as different specials, the only different is that the crowd claps louder at the point the feature act comes on and the confetti flows more (if that's possible, I'd love to be their confetti supplier, they must make a fortune!)If you have never seen bad mime acts with quick wig changes and bad dancers that are not greatly synchronized, this is the place for you. The best part of the show was Jesus on a wire act........oh how I laughed!

Very fun night.. Excellent entertainment. Just be cautious. Can get a bit wild. Keep track of the people you are with it is easy to become separated and difficult to find them again. Ladies... The bathrooms were bad! Like really bad!!!

Amazing.. After many people recommended coco bongo we decided to give it a go. It was a fantastic night the shows were awesome and the music inbetween kept me dancing all night. The only drawback was the quality of the alcohol I believe it was not premium bacardi as stated. But even so I still had a great night and would love to go again.

The Greatest Club in All Latin America!. The show is incredibly entertaining! It's been pitched to us every time we have traveled to Playa del Carmen and due to the rainy weather we thought we'd try it out. A pricey ticket but a high energy, fun filled night out!

Fab night out!. A must do if you are in the area, no matter what your age! Absolutely fabulous night out, we went VIP, so had seats on the first balcony, where drinks were bought to you all night and had a great view of the show, well worth a visit, highly recommend!

We had horrible VIP seats. We went last year and got the general admission tickets. It was very crowded and we had poor drink service. However, the show was excellent and we wanted to see it again. So this year we decided to get the VIP seating. Our seats were horrible in the VIP section. We were stuck behind a fake palm tree to the right of the stage. We had to constantly look around the trunk of that tree to see the show. When we complained, they of course had an excuse and said we could see everything and wouldn't move us. I felt like we spent a lot of money and still didn't have a good experience. They wouldn't let us spread out either to see around the trunk because they love to pack you in there.The drink service in the area was excellent but we paid to see the show. Very disappointed in our seats.

A great night !. Went on a Tuesday night but it was still very busy.We bought the tickets through the Thomsons rep but made out own way there and back.A fantastic show, went VIP, sat on the second floor on the edge of the balcony. Drinks and shots included all night. It finished about 3.30 am.Not been to anything like it before. Probably wouldn't go again if we went back to Mexico but it's something you must do while your there.Loved the music. A great night out.

fantastic night out. The night we had here was very unexpected and beat all my expectations.it was fantastic and recommend you going. It may be a bit pricy but the entertainment is well worth it. the drinks are included in the price and the staff really look after you have no need to ask for a drink they refreshed every time they saw that you were ready for another drink. I would go for VIP as seating in provided with this otherwise its standing only which can be very busy and not a lot of room. The place is run with precision engineering, which when you first got in the place its not what what we expected, but the staff ran it brilliantly. we had a fantastic night one to remember... :)

Biggest load of excrement I've ever seen..... Not worth it! You pay US$150 for an 'express pass' just to get in and avoid queues - then find yourself queuing up for ages. But the price includes an 'open bar'. This would be great if the drinks didn't taste like someone took a dump in my mouth with each swallow. The 'show' is about the cheesiest boring thing since the 1970's Swiss fondue craze-c'mon let a song actually play out so we can have a dance! The most pleasurable moment of the night was finding the exit-go somewhere else! (You're not missing anything). You're welcome.

VIP Gold member. Myself & my boyfriend went with another couple from our hotel, we purchased the VIP Gold member for $240 per couple from the CocoBongo's reps at our resort, I'm soooo glad we did as when we arrived outside the queue's we're huge!!!!! With our VIP we missed all the waiting & went straight in : ) inside the club is 3 tires, we were shown to our seats which were in our own little area directly over from the stage on the 2nd tier, this was perfect, we also had our own waiter who constantly brought us drinks the hole night (drinks were all included in the price) this place gets very very crowded & looking down at the floor level I was so glad we had paid more for our tickets as it was like sardines in a tin down there!! The show started at 11ish & finished at 3am it was amazing, I will probably never experience anything like this again & enjoyed the hole night, the show consisted of Queen, Lady GaGa, Beyoncé, MJ, Beetlejuice, Spider-Man, Tron, captain Jack Sparrow the Mask & so much more, as I stated before I would defiantly get VIP as you will see it will be so worth it : )

wow. Very crazy and fun night out. Packed night club with a mix of video and live tribute acts. Value for money and a true experience. recommended by a friend and not disappointed.Does get very full very quick and i would recommend leaving early (2am) ish to avoid the crush !!

Excellent show/TERRIBLE SERVICE. This is place it's quite expensive but after you see the show you can tell where your money goes BUT if you don't get the VIP you should just watch a video on YouTube it's WAY too crowed. I payed $80 for transportation and open bar and you just get a poor service from the waiters so much different to other clubs at the hotel zone.

Get the VIP. I have been to Coco Bongo twice. The first time was in 2010 and it was quite the show, but I was very sick with a cold and couldn't take it all in. There was nowhere to sit down and standing the whole time was exhausting. There was a long line to get in and out too. But we had a private server who brought whatever you wanted. The second time I went (2013) was with another couple we travelled with and we got the VIP package. There was no line. We went on a weeknight so it wasn't as jam packed. We had a small, private section off the stairs with our own server (Williams) who was FANTASTIC! He kept the drinks coming. The bouncer at the stairs kept people out of out section. We really felt like VIPs! The show was so great and the energy is so high that you don't even feel like you're there for as long as you are. I'd definitely go back but absolutely recommend the VIP package.

Awesome show, but terrible crowds!. My boyfriend and I went to Coco Bongo with 2 other couples we met at our resort. It was the one girls birthday and we had ungraded to the VIP section. When we arrived, it was a maze just getting to our VIP section, which was a small platform that barely fit the 6 of us. The server we had WAS AMAZING, there was not a moment our cups were empty ( we purchased the bottle service) but I was hardly impressed with our area. The place was so crowded, I can even begin to describe the anxiety I had. To get to the bathroom, we had to be escorted through the crowds which took about 10 minutes. The place was packed and all I kept thinking was how they HAD to have exceeded a capacity limit ( if they even have them in Mexico). Being involved with clubs my whole life, I know that this facility was UNSAFE. I kept my eye on the emergency exits. The 'Smoking' area was an outside balcony that could hold about 10 people. There was atleast 25 on it when I had attempted to smoke. It was very uncomfortable. The show was probably the best show I ever saw. They were extremely talented and I couldn't wait to tell my family about it. However, I was so uncomfortable, my boyfriend and I left about 3/4 into the show and took a cab home. I later found out, the show went until 3:30 am! For us who aren't used to staying up late, that was a bit extreme. The girl who sold us the tickets said it would end at 2. For the amount of money this club makes, and the cost of our tickets, I am extremely disappointed that the venue was so small and uncomfortable. If you do not like crowds I would definitely suggest NOT going here.
brill. very good but if you go by VIP you get a table and a bar waiter but get there for 10pm so you get a good seat!

Great show, dangerous number of ppl inside. The show is awesome, well worth the money, the music was great but they're are way, way, way too many people crammed into that place. I took careful note to be aware of where two emergency exits closest to us were. Amazingly, for the size of the crowd, the restroom rarely had a line.

1,000 Angry drunk people packed in a club intended for 500.. We bought a package at our hotel for $70 per person. We were promised admission, a space with a table, drinks and transportation to and from. The bus picking us up was wet and moldy, getting in took an hour in line and then the pace was so packed if a fire broke out everyone would die. Horrible horrible experience. The entertainment looked like it could be fun but everything else took away from it. Don't do it. A total waste of money.

Nice party place. We visited with a group of friends and had a blast, we would like to thank Oskar and Alex from the Ocean Maya Royale resort for helping us that much.We higly reccomend this place to all ages groups, the place may get to crowed but you will have a great time for sure.
brilliant brilliant. loved to music, the attentive service (VIP) the show was awesome danced all night till 3.30 amgreat!!

showtime. Book through out Thomson rep went VIP around 165.00 for two people, the only way to go and enjoy excellent seat plenty of drink and excellent server Fernando.. The show its self from the acrobats to the dancers is amazing sleek and slick changeovers from The Beatles to Elvis Lenny Kravitz to Queen.. the added confetti & balloon cannons adds to the atmosphere.. viva mexico

Don't miss this if in Mexico!!. Amazing night!! A club and show in one and they get the balance so right!! Great fun for all ages but probably most suited for 20-30 yr olds. Fantastic drinks service and great waiters. All drinks are very strong!! Book for VIP for a better service and view and go on the thomson night because The show is british themed. Don't be afraid to ask to change seats if you are not happy. Take some money for tips because the waiters really deserve it! Also have a nap beforehand because the thomson coach won't pick you up until 3.45am!
Great atmosphere!!!. Words cannot describe! Great music.. especially from DJ Falon!!! And good drinks! It was a bit windy but most of Playa is at night! Love love love the outdoor energy!

Amazing!. Visited Coco Bongo as part of TC Project - a Thomas Cook bar crawl which ended at Coco Bongo! I have never experienced a night club like it, it was fantastic! The dancers were amazing and the show was great - would love to see it again.

Fab Night Out. If your going to Mexico you need to visit CocoBongo's, it is absolutely amazing.We paid for the gold package which ment we didn't have to wait in the massive que, we had seats which were right next to the stage and a waiter brought our drinks to us. The drinks were included in the package.Was defo worth paying the extra for gold package, most amazing night :-)

Great night out for all ages..... We all had a brilliant time. We purchased our tickets from MARCELA at Riu Tequila.Marcela made sure all out party were seated and settled prior to the show and returned at the end to ensure we all got home safely.

Oh What a Night.... We went to this on the pretense it was an amazing nightclub, from what people had told us sounded to good to be true, but OMG this was the best night ever without a doubt whether you are 10,23 or 90 you will love it here, i think they should lower the age band to 16 because they would love it, we did VIP ticket and where on the balcony with a great view for the show, the show is truly spectacular with it changing every night it does great tribute act we saw (Elvis,Madonna, Beyonce, Queen, Bon Jovi, Lady Gaga and Beatles) they also do like mixed movie shows we saw (Chicago and Moulin Rouge) You would want to be at the bottom section because of all the action but you cant move at all, so i would defenitly go for the VIP section, in-between the shows they do a range of music which really brings some blasts from the past, get your dance shoes on because this is the hottest club in town (Next year we will go to the Cancun One)

All I can say is WOW. We went on the last night of our honeymoon and all we could say was WOW! We went VIP, booked through Olympus Tours, for $120/pp (included transportation) on a Weds night (it's cheaper Sun-Thurs). They picked us up and we went to a few other resorts to get some more people before we arrived at Coco Bongo at about 10:30 pm. We didn't wait at all and were qucikly ushered upstairs to some of the best seats in the house, just off of stage left, up in the VIP section. We had about a half hour before the shows started. And here I will ad..for the people complaining about tipping up front...we wanted excellent service that we didn't have to worry about. I wanted to be waited on very well on our last night so I grabbed our waiter as soon as we arrived, gave him $60 US dollars and told him it was our honeymoon and it was our last night and he SPOILED us ROTTEN all night long.He asked our preferred liquors, brought us shots of tequila and as soon as we were able to empty a shot glass, he'd have another,different one waiting for us. If our drinks got low (not empty..just low) he'd bring 2 fresh glasses of ice, the bottle of rum and he'd pour the rum until we signaled stop and then he'd just leave us the can of soda to add as we wished. We essentially were able to make our drinks all night long...from about 11:00 pm-3:30 am. You will also see ladies being brought onstage for backup dancing or to dance on the thrust out part of the stage above the audience. Well, after a few drinks I got brave enough and at the end of the evening..I asked my waiter how girls got picked to be onstage. He immediately grabbed my hand and I was handed off to another employee and they spoke and I was led down, backstage and told to sit on a stool and wait. I was called up for the last song of the night and able to dance with the cast and other patrons. As the curtain closed, a stage manager with a whistle was ushering people quikcly offstage and he pointed me out to the thrust to dance. I got to be out there dancing as the final balloons and confetti fell...it was the perfect ending to our honeymoon. So...feel free to be cheap and stingy and complain about tipping or tipping up front but you get what you pay for. Our waiter HUSTLED his tail off for all of us..all night long and considering he served us for 6 hours..earned every bit of our tip. This place is so packed and I am so glad we paid for VIP. We watched the insanity downstairs, standing room only, shoulder to shoulder, waiting forever to get a drink, people still coming in and for good reason..the shows were wonderful!The performers at Coco Bongo are some of the best performers, dancers, acrobats, aerialists and artists I've even seen. I've been to Vegas 3 times and Coco Bongo is in a class all it's own. We saw acts from Phantom of the Opera, Moulin Rouge, Chicago, Michael Jackson, Madonna, Lady Gaga, Queen, Elvis, Spiderman, Tron, Passion of the Christ, Beetlejuice and so much more. There were balloons and confetti and streamers and dance music too. All we could say was wow... I wish I could remember our waiter's name because he was excellent. If you enjoy live performances and don't mind crowds and loud music, Coco Bongo is a MUST.

Amazing show!. We went along with our Thomas Cook rep on a night out. We paid the fee and then the drinks were free all night. The Coco Bongos staff came to us with drinks so we didnt have to leave the area.What an unbelievable show, it was amazing. We had the balcony so we were able to see the entire club. The club was rammed with everyone enjoying.It is something you have to experience while on holiday in Mexico.Only giving it 4 stars as i'd hate to think how everyone would escape if there was to be an emergency as it gets so full.
Great show. We got the VIP excursion, we had AMAZING seats for the entire show right up at the top! Definitely a must see. The energy is totally different from your average nightclub

Not our best night. Waited in line for way too long to get in, and when we got in we couldn't move. We had a table that was blocked by the people dancing on the bar so we couldn't see the show. I'm not usually claustrophobic, but I felt like they let about 3 times as many people as they should have let in. I couldn't move, and getting to the washroom took forever. I can only imagine if there was an emergency, that many people trying to get out the limited exits would be a disaster. I can say that the music was awesome, and we loved the atmosphere with the confetti and balloons. Unfortunately our night did not end well. The person I came with and I were going to the washroom after being fed shots and drinks like crazy by the staff. While I was in the ladies room He stumbled ever so slightly and was immediately kicked out for being drunk (which he hardly was) and I was left in a very scary situation of being alone and not knowing where he was. No one could tell me what happened so I took the risk of checking outside, even though I was told once I stepped outside I could not return. Thank goodness he was outside, being alone in Mexico at 130 am does not sound fun to me. Overall- a very cool place but also very overwhelming and way too crowded. I'll stick to the more low key places.
Wild & Crazy Fun. The enterainment was unique and the place is very crowded, but overall I would reccomend going. See if you can book a VIP section if you have a group. Well worth it!
Wow....what fun!!!. This was quite an experience. It was like a Vegas show combines with musical theater. Throw in a great bartender and a rowdy crowd. ..couldn't ask for more fun!!!

Best night ever !!!!. Went to coco bongos for my Niece's hen night on Monday 19th August 2013 in a group on 9 people. Ages ranged from 18yrs to 60 !!! Night was loved by all. Went on a organised trip through First choice holidays which was booked at our hotel and the cost for the VIP package was £80 per person. This included coach transport both ways, priority entrance ( no queuing ) and a seated table with waiter service and unlimited drinks all night !!! We were given a section with seats and a table very near the stage and had a fab view of everything going on. The night was amazing and was so much fun, the entertainment started about 11.30 and did not stop until about 3.30 am there was something for all ages with tribute bands from the Beatles to Queen and Bon Jovi and songs from all the hit musicals with dancing girls, male trapeze artists and flying dwarfs !!! My daughter danced on the bar and on the stage with some of the professional acts. We didn't want the night to end and were very sad to have to leave for our coach at 3.30 am. The show had finished by then but I think you could stay and dance till 5am. There were also balloon cannons and confetti cannons going off throughout the evening and lots of audience participation. This is a night not to be missed and I would definitely go again if I return to this part of Mexico. 10 out of 10 for value and entertainment.

Great night out. Terrific night out, shows where amazing and well worth the money. Went on an all inclusive gold package with Thomson which gave more space to move and easier access to the bar which made the night even better.

A night to remember. Coco bongo was recommended to us before we left the UK & we were keen to go.We bought our VIP tickets from the coco bongo rep at our hotel pool. We pay $120 each. this included coach to & from the club as well as seats with a table and waiter service. Our waiter was Al and he was a fantastic waiter he didn't ask for tips he just provided an excellent service bringing drinks and shots even if we hadn't asked him to Well done Al. The show and music was spectacular.My partner and i are both over 45 and we were selected to go on to the stage to do our own "dirty dancing" we received a fantastic response from the crowd. When we come of the stage we were buzzing!! We stayed until closing time when we then tipped our waiter Al who was very grateful polite and respectful. All this added together made it a night to remember and when we will talk about for years to come. We would GO again and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Mexico. If anyone was there on 19/8/13 and have pics of us oldies on stage would love to see them please post them somewhere

Went under protest and had a great time. The family wanted to go, as they had heard good things about Coco Bongo. I didn't fancy a late night out drinking in a night club, so went under protest.What a great night, if you can pay for VIP tickets, this puts you away from the crowd, with free flowing drinks.Despite my reservations had a great time, so please go even if you think it's not your thing.
coco bongo. fantasic well worth the money . one fee, drinks free, apart from redbull .own waiter,great atmosphere.if in mexico coco bongo is a must ! for all adult ages

Great time with My teenagers. I took my 18 and 19 year old( along with my husband to Coco Bongo's.We went out for a late dinner and got there around 10:15. We had booked a table to ensure good seating. What a great night. It was combination dance club /show. The show was fantastic. Great Music videos and acrobatics. It was like Cirque du soleil but with a twist.We called it a night at 3 am but many people stay on all night.We would especially like to thank our server Adrian Dominguez Martinez( hope I got that right!). Always a smile and great service!

Unbelievably Good!. It exceeded all expectations! Waiters were really good keeping you topped up with drinks and everywhere you looked there were different things going on. Great atmosphere from start to finish!
Fantastic experience. If your going to Mexico you have to go to coco bongo's the shows are amazing the atmosphere is electric well worth a visit.

wow.....amazing!!. There really are no words to describe this place, i recommend anyone goes and sees it and feels the amazing atmosphere there!! Great tunes and great acts guranteed to get u singing and dancing!! Go and have fun :-)
Fantastic show vip. Brilliant for a great night out but do go vip. Show is fantastic and very entertaining. Dancers will get you up on stage in vip area great laugh late night too.

OMG..AMAZEBALLS. For anyone who is visiting playa del Carmen, coco bongo is a must see!! I was blown away from the moment I walked in until the very end.. The music was awesome (they played music all the way from lady gaga, beyonce, Michael Jackson, to queen); the dancers/show was phenomenal; and the service was exceptional! Our waiter Hector was amazing, he was giving me drinks before I had even finished the one I had in my hands..unbelievable! If you are going to be in playa del Carmen make sure you go to coco bongo.. You will not regret it!!!!

Loved it Loved it Loved it. We booked this through are rep at Thomas Cook - we chose to go goldmember VIP this was $120 each but we feel that this was well worth it.We got our own table and waiter service all night, he didnt let our glasses get empty.The show & music was amazing i'd say better than any nightclub you def have to go at least once :D

Great Night Out. What a show - booked with Thomson reps, Gold VIP. Pick up at 10.00am from the lobby of the Grand Palladium Colonial and taken by bus to Playas Del Carmen bus terminal, which Is a two block walk from coco bongo, but once in the queue you are soon into the party life. With the VIP ticket you are out of the pit and can sit, dance, drink and party the night away. Glasses were never empty all night as the waiters topped them up as soon as they were empty (take some money though as they will ask for a tip for there services before you leave). I was worried about not lasting the night, being of a certain age, but the buzz of the club kept me going all night. The show itself was amazing and catered for all musical tastes. Just one down side only two toilets big queues, but again drinks while you waited!Arrived back at the hotel at 5am, a few hours sleep and up again to sunbathing, what a trip :)If you want a fab night out then this s he place to go.
so much fun!. it was amazing experience, so much fun, great music, great visual effects, you have to do this at least one in your life!

BEST NIGHT EVER!!!. Simply the best night out I've ever had. This place is like a vegas show on NYE, Paddys Day and Mardi Gras, all rolled into one.Definitely take advantage of the Gold Member option that gives you your own private table, table service and all inclusive drinks.The entertainment is second to none in any nightclub Ive been to, with tribute bands, spiderman flying around above your head and a midget beetlejuice, what else could you ask for.Whilst the head was heavy the next day, this was a night we'll NEVER forget!

A Mexican must see!!. Not being a night owl I was worried I'd have had enough by midnight. How wrong was I??? The show was amazing and ranged from climbing silks to a Michael Jackson act. It was incredibly busy. I would strongly recommend buying the more expensive package that includes seats and your own waiter who was very attentive.When the show finished at 3.30am I was absolutely buzzing and didn't want to go home. This is a Mexican must see!!

Unbelieveable!!. We went here on our first trip to Mexico .. my friends had been before. It was loud, croweded and the drinks were flowing. The show lasted over 4hrs and was very entertaining! The lines are long, but once you get in .. it's a fun place to be.

Great night. Had a great night in Coco Bongo, the shows are very good. We booked a private table for four including drinks (bottle of spirit of our choosing and mixer) and the price was reasonable (about $60 each) The hotel we were staying in wanted to charge us a lot more than this as did the various ticket touts in Playa. We paid at the door. The place was overcrowded and I would recommend booking a table otherwise you may see very little.

Night out. Was just in Mexico 8/10-8/17 went to coco bongo on a Thursday night it was so crowded surprise it was so many people. Some advise go VIP no line wait get a table show was awesome drinks all around we could hardly finish out shots before the waiter was brining us more got to meet people from all over security was on point would I do it again yes in a heartbeat

Great show, rude staff. If it had not been for our extremely rude waiter, Brandon, I would've given this 5 stars. We paid $120 each and were told it was drink as much as you want. We had decided that rather than tipping the waiter after each round we would rather enjoy the show and give him a really decent tip at the end of the night. Service started off good and he even brought us surprise shots. Then he started asking for tips- we were disgusted and thought it was incredibly rude for him to ask for tips. Then he just started avoiding us and we didn't get any drinks for the last 45-60 minutes despite asking him 5 times. Very rude. We had paid a lot of money to be there and found this very annoying. We ended up giving the toilet advisor the waiter's 200 peso tip as she was brilliant all night and never once asked for a tip.It is just a shame that he had to be like this because the show is absolutely fantastic and the performers are amazing. The atmosphere was brilliant. I wouldn't have liked to have been on the ground floor as there are no seats and it was really crowded.Sort our waiters out Coco Bongo!!

Fantastic Night, but waiters are cheeky!!!. Went to Coco Bongo with my husband, we are in our 50s. We had a great night, we booked a VIP ticket through Thomson on Friday 9th August. My husband who is 60 was invited to dance on the stage by the screens and did a good performance, doing a strip. If anyone has a photo could you post it because my camera ran out of battery. The night was fantastic. As soon as we arrived we tipped our waiter 100 pesos which is about a fiver, we got two drinks, then no show from the waiter until we tipped again. We ended up tipping around £12/£14 and only had about 4 drinks. I consider myself a fair tipper, but I don't like being forced to do it. Apart from this, we had a great experience.

Fantastic night....would defo go back!!!. We bought our tickets from the coco bongo rep at our hotel, we got VIP tickets as advised by friends who previously visited the year before. We had seats and tables on the second floor facing the stage, a toilet for just our floor and a bar and waiter. Show and music were fantastic...would go back again. In our group who went, ages ranged from 18 to 50 and we all enjoyed it. We were brought drinks all night. Would not liked to have been on on ground floor as very crowded. Not a night to be missed!!

Crazy Time!. First time visiting this club. It was reasonably priced, especially if you drink a lot. Our fee included transportation and all you can drink (tequila, beer, mixed drinks, water, soda). Went with a bunch of friends....it was crazy (in a good way)! There was a long line when we got there, but that moves really fast. We were standing in line for less than five minutes. The security was very professional. I felt like I was in safe environment. As you walk into the club, there is a short path you must follow before you get into the actual club with all the dancing and music. They had drinks available for us along the path. Once we got into the main part, it was great. Performances were taking place: acrobatics, singing, dancing. There were movie and music video reenactments. There was a lot to see! My friends and I were able to dance on the bar...that was exciting! (Sorry, no males allowed on the bar top) we had our own personal waiter at a reserved table. He kept all of our drinks and water fully stocked. Our table was located on the floor which is where most of the action is. However, it was difficult to see some of the performances that were happening on the stage while we were down on the floor. Many of the performances took place on the bar top, so i was happy with our location. My friends and I also got to dance on stage with some of the performers! We had a BLAST! They allow you to take all the pics you want but discourage recording. The club has three levels and, in my opinion, the floor is the best place to be. I would not recommend this place for anyone who does not like being around a lot of people. It was packed! You can not move in this place without touching someone. As a matter of fact, I don't even think you could stand still and not be touching someone. Also, it is standing room only. You will be on your feet the entire time, so wear comfortable shoes! We had a great time! We arrived when they opened. Initially planned on staying for just a couple of hours, but we were having so much fun that we stayed until they closed! I would definitely do it again. I would probably try the one in Cancun next...it's supposed to be a lot bigger.

Tops Las Vegas shows!. Coco bongo is an absolutely must do in Mexico - I have been to lots of shows around the world including Las Vegas but none of them come close to this. The whole night from start to finish was out of this world! If you are booking through Thomson definitely book Gold on a Thomson exclusive night - they pack so many people in but our thomson group had our own balcony with lots of space and servers who regularly brought us premium drinks which were included in our ticket price. I can't choose a favourite part because it was all so good!
Coco Bongo a must!. Fantastic - has to be seen its impossible to describe but there's a brilliant atmosphere and something for everyone.

top night. go for the gold member section much better service. waiter spot on. he wears black glasses didnt have to wait for drinks any part of the night. only problem was the place was rammed full but of fire hazard - people standing everywhere even on stair cases ( not ideal ). show was amazing cant knock it.

Quite the Experience. This place was really fun, it was like being at a acrobatic broadway show with dancing and many, many drinks. As soon as you walk through thr door, you are greeted with a drink and a shot of tequila. I knew we were going to have a good time at that point. The only problem what so ever is that there are soooo many people in there, that it is hard to get around, but we were lucky enough to find a table on the 3rd level and a waiter brought us drinks all night. Definitely a place everyone should experience.

coco bongo playa no show. Hi I went to Coco Bongo on Wednesday 7th Aug and no show. The countdown started and we were well up for a party but the countdown finished but no show started at 11 waithed till 12 still no show so left and this cost me a packet for the 2 of us through Thompson was anyone else there that night ?
Amazing. Would definitely recommend this, but make sure you get in a place with a good view so that you can take plenty of pictures and enjoy the show
Amazing!!!'. Brilliant night out, would recommend to anyone that likes having fun and very good value for money. We complained about our seats and were instantly moved, they couldn't do enough for us

Most surreal and amazing experience of my life. Went to Coco Bongo as part of Thomson's bar crawl excursion. Which gave us a Silver VIP pass. We had the whole top level to ourselves with drinks all included. The club itself is packed but it just adds to the atmosphere and experience.From the shows to the confetti and the balloon cannons to the side shows of bartenders trying to slide down railings with a tower of glasses the whole thing is just completely surreal and amazing.Seriously can't recommend going here enough, its definitely one to put on the bucket list and cross off once you have been. Amazing.
Roller coaster. This place will have you intrigued, with people dancing for the ceiling and dancing like there is no to moor, this place is a must if you are in playa del Carmen

This is a MUST SEE in Mexico. At first I wasn't sure about this but we paid for the VIP section (86£!) with our Rep and off we went. We got in the priority queue - the normal queue was round the block -and we were shown upstairs to the upper balcony and our table. We had our own waiter who NEVER let our glass be empty and had our own loos (important as this place was packed and the steady stream of drinks!). There were some dancers on the bar and I thought that would be it. Oh how wrong I was the screens lifted directly in front of us and from 1130-330am we were entertained by an amazing show. I won't spoil it by giving g details but here's my recommendation - go to Carmen it's closer to the hotels, get VIP entrance and go with an open mind you will NOT be disappointed. Oh and make sure you tip your waiter he asks for a tip and the end not all the way through which we thought was great and he got a handsome tip too!

It really is that good!. My wife and I went to Coco Bongo in Playa while on vacation in July. We purchased the VIP (gold member) passes and it was absolutley worth the $120 pp. We had our own table and chairs, an assigned waiter/bartender who NEVER let our drinks become empty (as well as random "surprise" shots), and space to move and dance. Serioulsy - this is the only way to get the most out of the Coco Bongo experience. The show itself was fabulous. From the various acts to the thunderous amounts of confetti....it really is a cross between Mardi Gras/Vegas/New Years Eve. I can't recommend this experience enough. Get the VIP passes and have a BLAST!!!!

Fab night out Coco Bongo. 25 shows including Michael Jackson, Elvis, Beetlejuice, Cirque de Solei acts amazing. All inclusive of drinks and your own personal waiter who remembers your name and drink and always refreshes your drink when your empty! Show is performed above the bar up high so find a place on top of the stairs. Throughout the night they throw hundreds of balloons down and confetti. A real fun night and very safe. Everyone searched as they come in as drugs will not be tolerated and the bouncers are very helpful and kind. Brill night.!

Coco Bongo, Playa del Carmen. One of the best nights I have ever had, this is a must see. Be prepared for this to be a crowded place, this however doesn't spoil your viewing. Get there for 11pm, show starts at 11.30pm and finishes at around 3.30 am. Tip your waiter early in the evening and he will keep coming with drinks before you even finish the first !!!A must see, great experience, I hope we are able to go back again one day :)
Dancing and a show. It was very much like a las vegas show! It even broke up the show with dancing in between. My only complaint was that it was a little crowded. I would definitely go again :)

2nd Vegas. I have not been to Vegas.... but they claim they are going to leave Vegas behind. We went there in a group of 9 Indian young men. They left nothing for us to not AgreeingIt was one of the best Christmas night I have spent.Perfectionist -- This word is well suit here. Every moment is well planned . Starts at 11 PM and continues till you drop. Lighting , Graphics, Sound ,Disco, Themes everything were best.A MUST place to hang out at least once when you in CANCUN.Stags , get naughty, couples get sweety -- Its a crime if you wont visit CoCo BonGo when you are in Cancun.

Great nightclub. This is completely different to any place you would have been before. It is like watching a show with plenty of stuff continuously going on whilst also being in a nightclub at the same time. You definitely have to visit this place.
Brilliant!!. We went here for a night when on our honeymoon in a nearby complex. Totally worth the admission price. Atmosphere was amazing, acts were brilliant.

Wow!!. Not what I was expecting, they have shows going on throughout the night with breaks where the DJ gets everyone dancing.You can be as involved as you like, get invited up on stage to dance along or just sit and enjoy the show. MUST GO!!!!!

Superb. We weren't sure what we were going to get, but what a great night! We bought VIP tickets which are a bit more expensive, but the queue was much shorter, we had chairs and a bar type table and the same waiter all night.As for the show...........AMAZING.Don't miss it.

Best night ever!!!. This was really amazing!!! We were 4 persons and got a private table with a bottle of rum with soda for 70USD each. We had a perfect view of the stage. The show was amazing and even thoug it`s pretty big, it`s also intimate. Drinking and dancing the whole night and if I find this place somewhere else on my future trip, I will definitely go there!

Coco Bongo is 100% worth it! Spectacular!. It Doesn't matter if you're young or old, Coco Bongo is a show you do not want to miss!! 100% worth the price. Just don't look at exclusively as a club. It's been a great show way before Cirque du Soleil became famous!

Fantastic Show!. Worth every penny, it truly is like New Years Eve and Mardi Gras all rolled into one....the show is spectacular from start to finish and the music keeps you dancing all night long.....It is the party of all parties you just need to experience at least once....Every time I go to Playa del Carmen I make sure I go to Coco Bongos.

This is a party place to get drunk but has no cultural Value. Coco Bongo is a place to party but has no cultural value. If you want to be in a place which is packed, no space to move or dance and be surrounded by cheap booze than this is the place for you. I am sure other reviews will agree with me. Instead of spending the $ 60 per person select one of the many lounges playa has to offer and relax in a great atmosphere instead of Coco Bongo

Coco Bongo - with Best Day Travel. We wanted to experience some of the night life off resort while staying in the Riviera Maya and the Best Day agent recommended this tour. It was escorted so we were picked up from our hotel and bused to Playa and then back at the end of the night. Our Best Day guy met as at Coco Bongo and guided us through the process, can't stress enough how helpful he was! There was an obnoxiously long line outside but with our passes we did not have to wait in it as we went on a day that we could get express entry with our tour. I had 2 drinks and a shot of tequila before we made it into the arena (for lack of a better word) and at our guide's recommendation we tipped our waiter early and never lacked for drinks. The waiters participate in the show and there are a LOT of people packed together so he simply brought us more than one of whatever we ordered based on how busy he was and kept an eye on us for when refills would be required.The 'arena' was three stories on three sides and a stage on the second floor of the fourth side. We were a bit confused at first as the second and third tier had some sitting or standing room, but our group was shown to steps on the edge of the main floor and lined up standing like we were taking a picture. We didn't stay in place long but some members of our tour group stayed in place all night (I don't recommend that). When we entered there were dancers on the bar on the main floor and on the visible piece of the stage, it was already wild and crazy but not your typical club experience. Two screens/curtains in front of the mainstage showed music videos for the songs being played and had a countdown timer for the show. The show itself was brilliant. There were performances at intervals and inbetween the performances they would get members of the crowd up dancing on the bar and the stage and just generally going crazy. The performances were spot on, the Michael Jackson on stage was the spitting image of the original video playing behind him, and many of the performances included aerial stunts performed right above our heads. All the craziness was interspersed with confetti and streamer cannons, a rain of balloons (all constantly being swept up by careful staff members) and nitrogen cannons blasting plumes of cold air from the ceiling.Overall the party was double plus good, I would absolutely go again and recommend it to anyone.Words of warning: Ladies wear sensible shoes, you'll be on your feet for a good five hours and there is no where to sit. Also, know that if you dance on the stage/bar your skirt will be blown up, there are air jets built right into the bartop/floor. Be prepared for a high energy party and a late night.

Not worth the money, bad drinks & bad service.. My wife and I paid $70 each for admission last Saturday night-supposedly including a "free" bar. I heard you can pay anything from $45-$100 in depending on who you deal with.The positives - the show is entertaining and there is a great party atmosphere full of all age groups. The music isn't bad but its very commercial. That's it.The negatives - Cost - so $70 each for the show & a "free" bar didn't sound like a bad deal, but this is far from a free bar. Poor quality drinks - only a handful of local drinks are included and even they are watered down. I sank half a dozen rums and hardly felt tipsy. My wife loves Malibu (there was a bottle clearly visible behind the bar) so I ordered one, but it tasted nothing like Malibu. I asked what it was & a barman said "it's the same thing", I said it wasn't & asked for a proper Malibu - a $5 charge which I stupidly paid but again it was nothing like Malibu. Again I queried it with a barman, who then tried to sell me a bottle for $60 & then confessed there was no actual Malibu. Basically you've no idea what are in those bottles behind the bar - very poor from such a well renowned establishment charging $70 per head.Service - service is terrible, staff are rude & are only interested in how much you tip. A barman held back my drinks until I gave him a tip - you gotta earn the tips buddy.Crowded - the place was totally wedged, you could hardly move let alone lift your arm to take a drink. They pack you in like sardines. The waiters basically walk over you instead of around you. Most of our watery drinks ended up over our clothes & shoes. The layout is very poor with only a small entrance everyone has to go through.It was an experience alright, not worth the money in our view. We should have taken the locals advice & went to La Santanera after spending the day at Mamitas Beach Club.

Forced to pay tips. Paid usd 120 entry which covered the show and all drinks. Queued outside for ages despite assurance we could get VIP entry. Did expect there would be more room to dance but there wasn't any really as it was packed to capacity and over. Show was professional - in a nutshell performers miming to songs by stars such as Madonna, Beatles, Gaga ,Michael Jackson, pirates of the Caribbean and other shows. Well performed but it went on for 4 hours ... Just as you got into the dj playing good music they cut to the show again so in our view a bit disjointed.Left early as the bar staff started insisting we paid them tips before they gave us drinks. Happy to pay for good service but when we said no they refused to serve us so we left . We complained to the rep who spent some time looking into our complaint advised we could go again for free but as it was lashing with rain all night another queue for 30 minutes was not what we wanted Ok but a lot of money ....

My view. I'm 22 young and like have fun. To me and my partner this wasn't paid about $120 was made out was where the 'mask' was filmed which is the one in cancun.. Told is big and never that full.. And only hat to queue 10mins.. Well 10mins waiting was 45mins outside. Was packed to point people couldn't even move! And didn't even get a drink when was all inclusive drinks asked waiter and just blanked me and pushed through us! Now I was talking to others in resort who when different ages and they said the same!! It's not enjoyable. I then spoke to our concierge just to get them to explain it more as misleading! He said he is sorting something and they was coming to see us. We got a 'cheap' coco bongos top saying 'to trunk to dweet' ' which was insulting considering didn't even get one drink! Just be aware on what your spending!

like nothing you'll ever see again.... We wanted to go into Playa del Carmen one night on our vacation so bought two tickets to Coco Bongo. We dealt with Alejandro at Ocean Maya who was FANTASTIC! He met us on time to pick us up... gave us the low-down on the ride there, then escorted us in quickly and found us a table. He was very attentive.Coco Bongo is like no ither show we've seen! Think of Cirque du Soleil, live theatre, a concert and a night club all wrapped up into one, multi-tiered building. There was music for every age group, young and old. We will DEFINITELY be going back!!

Amazing experience. We had the most amazing night here! My wife was a sceptical when I suggested going here as she was thinking "its just another show" - never could she have beenso wrong! We were in the VIP area, which I suggest to all as you have a small table and seat are are not amongst the chaos of the "pit" which did look fab but crazy! The waiters at the table were great and I never had less than one beer at my table and my wife never had a empty glass at any give time - well worthy of the tip he got! The show had a bit for everyone - music, dancing & acrobatics. All in all a great experience not to be missed

Great Show - Go Midweek. The show was terrific. Lots of fun acts to a wide variety of great music. We went on a Wednesday night and were glad we avoided weekend. It was plenty crowded, but you could get from where we were standing to the bathroom and back without much hassle. We bought wristbands ahead of time from a Coco Bongo Rep on 5th street, it included express entry and a free TShirt for the normal $65 price. We couldn't find the Rep when we arrived, but I had a photo of him, and that was enough to get someone to take us to front of line and send us inside. We were standing on risers along outside edge of dance floor. A little cramped, and not much room to dance, but close to the action and easy to see everything. Waiter for our area brought out a variety of drinks during preshow countdown, it helped get drinks to everyone quickly. Once everyone had a few drinks, he started taking drink orders, when he could hear you.

Amazing. We had such an awesome night. Went along with the Thomson reps Monday night pub crawl. Had VIP tickets for the upper balcony. Tipped a barman who then kept the drinks & tequila flowing all night. Is a definite must see! Don't go to Mexico without visiting Coco Bongo. You won't be disappointed!

Don't be claustrophobic!. I had the time of my life at the Coco Bongo Playa Del Carmen. It is a show/party that I will never forget and will definitely live again on my next trip to Mexico! It is extremely safe and as a woman, I never felt threatened by anybody. A lot of staff members are there to break any kind of fight before they even start to happen. They come out of nowhere and grab the killjoy and kick him out of the club.The bathroom are the safest I've ever been to in a club. There's a big man opening the door for you and two women staff are waiting for you inside. One opens the door of an available toilet and the other one hands you towel when you're done washing your hands. I have to say I was a little scared before going to Coco Bongo having heard bad rumors about this Club, but after seeing the level of security they have in there, those rumors are busted!If you like to party and dance the night away, do not miss on the Coco Bongo!!!

make your own mind up !. if the venue held 500 then they sold 2000 tickets with a high ticket price promising a free bar but cant move or get near a bar then get pushed out the way by security when the show comes into the crowd with no room to move was there a hour tops

A very pleasant surprise. I was talked into going to Coco Bongo by a friend that really wanted to see the Mexican nightlife outside our resort. The way the excursion booth described this place left my wife and I with doubts, but we were very pleasantly surprised at the show. It is essentially a Cirque de Soleil show in addition to full on musical numbers of our generations greatest htis all taking place in an all you can drink bar.

Awesome show!!!. If you have never been, go! We booked a Coco Bongo outing with Alejandro at Ocean Maya Royale. What a party. We live in Phoenix and have been to Las Vegas many times. This beats all we've ever seen.

Best fun night out ever!!. We booked a VIP package through our tour operator Thomson/first choice. We were picked up on a coach at 9:30pm from the hotel (GBP Akumal). The bus trip going was very quiet. There was a coco bongo rep on board and the played the latest dance music. Once we arrived we queued for our bands and entered about 10:20pm. We were taken to our tables then after about 20 mins introduced to our waiter and ordered our drinks. There was a countdown to when the show began on a big screen and different music being played from the last 6 decades!! The show began at 11pm and it was worth the wait!I won't go into detail about the show as I don't want to spoil it for everyone! There was various different acts and acrobats throughout the night and again the music was very varied from the Beatles to LMFAO! The atmosphere there was amazing. We were given balloons and there was always confetti being blown down. You really have to go to experience it yourself!We tipped our waiter at the start and never had an empty glass. He remembered our drinks and would have new ones with us before we had a chance to finish the ones we had!! Every time we had a new drink we were having more vodka and less sprite! The time went so quick you would not believe. Most of the girls in the VIP area were dragged on to the stage at the end to dance with everyone in front of hundreds of people!!Needles to say the bus going back was a lot more lively with people singing and dancing!! We arrived back at the hotel about 4:30am and went straight to the bar with a few others to carry on the party. It was a great experience that anyone of any age should do if you can! We seen people from 18 to 80 and there was music and entertainment for everyone's taste!!
what a night. we had a terrific night there what a show brilliant tickets for vip a little exspensive but worth it ps take pain killers for your hangover the next day magic

Coolest club/show. Coco Bongo was such a unique experience and my friend and I had an amazing time. The show is so well done and I loved how they had balloons and confetti come down from the ceiling. We somehow ended up in a reserved section with a personal server who brought us drinks. I have never danced so much in one night!

RUBEN IS A LEGEND. Having thought about booking our coco bongo tickets at home with Thomsons In liverpool, i didn't have time which worked out better as there was a cocobongo rep called ruben at riu tequila not only did it work out cheaper st £40 transport to and from was included as well as drinks all night premium brands (gordons canadian club and much more then your escorted to your area ours was on the floor and in my opinion the best spec in the club as you see it all and are in the thick of it especially when the bus boys get you up to dance on the bar GREAT PERFORMANCES ours included The Beatles lady gaga Queen Michael Jackson Madonna pirates of the Caribbean a fight between Spider-Man and the green goblin all this whilst being served by francesco our waiter who kept the gin & tonics on free flow I would recommend this night out to anyone as you won't be disappointed A BIG THANK YOU TO RUBEN WHO MADE OUR TIME AT THE RIU TEQUILA MUCH MORE FUN THANK YOU FOR A GREAT NIGHT OUT X

A must do in Mexico. I went here with my partner thinking it will be just one little dance as a show and a disco after but no! It got taken to another level, the show was the disco! Everybody from rihanna, usher, Michael Jackson, Katy perry, elvis, superman, batman, the mask, and so much more! These are obv not the real acts but was so much alike I felt like I was at a concert singing away! A must do it VIP! All drinks waiter serviced to you while you watch the show or choose to have a little boogie on the dance floor! Please all go now! Wish their was something like this in England!
SO MUCH FUN!!. Brilliant music, shows were top, drinks were always full, Acrobats from the ceiling! What more could you ask! Fab night!!!

Two Words - Must Visit. What else can be said about the World Famous Coco Bongo? Always an amazing show. I would reccomend the VIP if you can get it. Otherwise tip your waiter 200 pesos from the begining and he will take great care of your party.

The best experience ever!!!!!. This isn't just any ol night club. It's a freakin show!!! From broadway to cirque de soleil! It's pretty pricey to get in... Around $65+ depending on group size. But it is well worth it! Unlimited drinking and the show is just soooooo amazing!!! I loved every moment of it! The seating... Well, standing rather is what you'll be doing unless you're VIP. But who sits at a club/show anyway!!!A must!!!!

Worst customer service of my life.. Let me start by saying, the show is great. But do not buy tickets online!! The whole system is a farce and they are unable to track any tickets purchased online. One cashier named Rosea accused me of using the pre-purchased tickets twice and initially refused us entry (yelling at us). This altercation completely ruined the night and the celebration of my partner's 30th bday.

not vip no customer service. after booking and paying for vip arrived at club to find no table and chaires as promised when booking , after raising point with staff recieved appologie but no seating, explanation given as being overbooked , requested refund and transportation back to hotel, was told all they could do was offer another visit for free, whitch we declined as it was near the end of holiday, service of the the staff was very good as was show from what we saw , first hour missed because we had no seates or anywhere to view the show, raised points mentioned above with manager when leaveing to no avail, raised point with booking agent the following day requested a partial refund fore the difference between vip and standard ticket some $40.00 he contacted the club , same offer of a free visit. would you want to go back after spending $110.00 per head or £70.00 per head stirling. not at all happy by the way we were treated even some small gesture would have been appreciate, Mr A Boden visited 20/06/13 with partner

Fun Fun Fun. went here as part of a bar crawl with thomsons. we had heard that it was better downstairs so we slipped away from the group and headed downstairs. I tipped the barman 100Peso and got drinks served or went to the bar and my drink was ready made and waiting for me. I wanted to get some others down and the bar man used a torch to guide me back up to the area.The club is mental and you should do it if in the area.Such a good laugh
Last Night of Honeymoon. Absolutely QUALITY! Brilliant night and a great way to end our honeymoon. A must do for everyone! We need a Coco Bongo in London!!!!!
Amazing. A must do. Was a great night. Lots of shows and if u upgrade to gold member waited on hand and foot a must

Good show but terrible experience DO NOT PRE BUY TICKETS. I went with a group of 4 of us. We had pre bought tickets a month before in Australia. They weren't cheap as we got VIP tickets for a Saturday night, needless to say we were expecting great service and show for that amount. Due to one of our party being sick we had to transfer our night to a Tuesday. Which was cheaper than the Saturday which we originally paid for, but we didn't mind losing that money as we all wanted to see it together. We went on Saturday evening to inform them that we couldn't make it, and they were very helpful and said it would be fine to come on the Tuesday night. Tuesday night came and when we went to get into the show. The ticket ladies accused us of cheating them and using our booking twice. I have never been treated so badly by any customer service ever. We ended up getting let in as they finally realised it was them that made the mistake. But not after being treated like common criminals in their eyes. Do not pre buy tickets if you plan to go, as they obviously have trouble tracking their own booking system

I had an amazing time!. Simply amazing! I have never experienced this. This club is a cross between a Cirque du Soleil show, Moulin Rouge in Paris and some of the best night clubs out there! Very little waiting time outside, very friendly staff, all you can drink alcohol and some of the best looking people I have seen in Mexico. What more can you ask for?!

Great Night. Loved this place, brilliant from start to finish we visited on a Monday night, we sore so many different acts from Katy Perry, Elvis, LMFAO, Pirates of the Caribbean, Spider Man. Drink service was great we got VIP tickets well worth the money. It does get packed, the atmosphere is great, one thing that gets slightly boring is while waiting for a new act girls dance on a small part of the stage and their dresses get blown up it was hilarious to start with but the joke was over by the 10th time because girls were just taking their clothes off instead lol! I would definitely go again and would only book the VIP package.

great night. went on thomson bar crawl great bars service in some was crap.ended up in coco bonga it was absolutley jam packed and no seats.what an amazing show pity there are so many people in.oh, by the way one of the staff brought us 2 stools.queing outside to get in for ages.def one place to go for a fantastic night out

Best party ever. Being the bride and groom, we were given extra special treatment by having our table set up in a pedistal with everyone in our group sitting around us one level down. The drinks were fantastic, the service was amazing and the show was one of a kind! Definitely pay the $110/person for Gold Member if you want celebrity treatment!

Go VIP. It is more costly but VIP lets you watch the whole show, but from above. No pushing or crowding, private waiter ( drinks included) and private bathroom.Show was great, well danced and choreographed.

OK - but really just an over priced night club. A group of 6 of us aged from early 20's to mid 50's went to Coco Bongo's Playa Del Carmen on Friday 14th June. We booked direct through Thomsons - afterwards we realised that it would have been much cheaper to book through the Coco Bongo reps or one of the guys on 5th Avenue - also when booking through Thomsons no transport to the venue is included to bare that in mind. Coco Bongo's is promoted as a 'show' as alot of the reviews state - it is not really a show but more of a night club. They put on a 'show' which is usually 1 song where they mime, then a DJ plays about 10-15 minutes worth of music between each act which was a little disappointing as we were expecting a show, The stage is level with the first floor so if you purchase the basic ticket which is at ground level you may struggle to see. We paid alot extra for the gold tickets - the difference being you get a seat and a waiter for your drinks. we were facing the stage which was good but 6 of us were squashed in a row beside the sound guy! Our waiter was a guy called Edwardo - when the first round of drinks were brought to us we tipped Edwardo as alot of the reviews suggested, Edwardo said he did not want a tip yet, to wait until the end of the night and if we felt the service was good to tip him then - fair enough. When we were ready to leave we tipped Edwardo 200 Pesos, he didnt check the money, said thank you and walked away. Not 10 seconds later he came back to us and said that he felt our tip was an insult to him as he had worked hard, feeling awkward we tipped him again. Having paid for Gold member tickets which had the waiter service included - we didnt HAVE to tip at all, so to tip about £12GBP and be told that is an insult to him is just rude! we Had 4 rounds of drinks all night - i dont think that £12 for 4 rounds of drinks is unacceptable! So if you are on the first floor and Edwardo is your waiter just beware of him. Staff come round and take pictures of you with the show people - these cost 20 dollars each but don't just buy the first one that you like as they will come round with 4 or 5 different pictures throughout the evening. If you are a smoker there is a designated smokers area on the first floor outside on the terrace but it took around half an hour for each cigarette break as it took so long to fight our way through the crowds on the ground floor. Doors open at 10.30 but get there early - we got there for 9.45 and there was already a queue outside to grab the best seats. The special effects are very good - cannot fault that at all, long balloons get thrown out for everyone to wave about, huge glitter bombs going off, streamers and glow sticks are all given out. As a nightclub this would be fantastic but as it is sold as a 'show' and the fact that i wouldn't pay around £100 a person to go to a nightclub i personally wouldnt reccommend it. All of the reviews that say everyone is rammed in like sardines, cant see and that its a fire hazard are spot on. In a nut shell it is more a night club than a show, the waiters are rude, the prices are way too high but if you are going to book, get the upgraded package otherwise you wont enjoy it. Glad we did go to say that we had been however, wouldnt go again.

Hot hot hot. Got this booking through the coco bongo rep at our hotel,got gold V.I.P so glad we did this as inside was packed to the roof,literally,we were three or four floors up&out of the way of a very crammed dance floor,there is plenty of room for dancing beside your table,our waiter was always there with a fresh round of drinks,didn't need to ask he just knew,a few dollars tip every few rounds ensured the service,the show was absolutely amazing,it lasted the whole night,about 4 hours,the costumes&the dancers were fantastic,they are on&off every twenty minutes or so with new costumes&acts,be warned it is boiling hot inside&the whole atmosphere is electric,try&include a few h20 on your drink list every now&again your gonna need it to keep up,there is also a smoking or non smoking side,smoking is only permitted outside only
