A Great Time but have had better at Coco Bongo. This was my 5th time to Coco Bongo (2nd in Playa Del Carmen). Our rep Jerry said we would get good seats as VIPs, but ended up with the same seats as last year (but on the other side of the stage) when we paid regular admission. This was disappointing but we made the best of it. As normal we had a fabulous time. Our waiter told us to tip him at the end of the night and he worked hard and gave us great service (and got a good tip). The drinks were good and he brought us lots of various shots. The only reason I am rating this a 4 and not a 5 is they seemed to cut back on the acts and had a lot more girls from the audience dance center stage. We came to see the acts and not the guests dancing. It seemed like many acts were omitted that we saw in the past. The 8 of us still had a great time, but felt Coco Bongo was cutting back on their show. Our rep promised us better seats next year but will believe that when we see it. Maybe if you go early and do not take the resort bus going, you might get better seats.

Never going on a Saturday again!. This was my second time going to Coco Bongo. The first time I had gone on a weekday and it was the final destination on a bar hopper excursion pack I got from the resort. This time around the bar hopping package was not available (which was disappointing) so we opted to go on a Saturday night thinking it would be more exciting... Worst mistake ever! Coco Bongo over sells admission tickets on Saturdays and then instead of turning people away when the club is full they forcefully squeeze people in until it feels like you have to keep your hands up just to maintain a little personally space so your hair isn't in someone else's mouth! And because it is so over packed you cannot leave your tiny ounce of a spot to get a drink because 1) you'll get stuck on the stairs trying to come back and won't be able to get back to your group 2) someone will take your spot! I drank nothing the whole time I was there, I had gotten stepped on multiple times, I missed half the show because tall people decided it was okay to stand in front of people who had gotten there first and I almost got into a spat with a woman who refused to stop elbowing me while she was "dancing". Go on a weekday and if VIP is available take it!

Never a disappointment!. As usual, CoCo Bongos does not disappoint! The staff were very attentive and ensured our drinks were never empty! We arranged our trip through our vacation service provider which ensured direct entry, highly recommend doing this as the line up to get in was over a block long! The show is fantastic. This place is always packed, our third time here, so I do not recommend it if you don't Ike crowds! Great time can't wait to go back!

Awesome time !!!!!!. Went to Coco Bongo 6-16-13. I must say this has been one of the most entertaining clubs I've ever been to- Paid VIP at the hotel - doors opened at 1030 and was in by 1045- You get drinks first thing you walk in and open bar all night- if you want to dance I suggest staying on the floor- it was the livliest there and I had the most fun- most of the time I didn't even have to tell the server I needed a drink- it was there for me already- this place is def for ages 21-30- older crowd will not have fun- I had a blast! I would recommend it to anyone in my age group (late 20's)
A Blast!. Glad we went, a ton of fun even though it got very packed.Make sure to eat at the taco place across the street after!

Supposed to be a VIP guest - does that stand for 'very ignored people'?. Bought four tickets at £70 each from Giovanni at the ticket box on the beach at our hotel - The Iberostar Tucan. He assurred us that as VIP members we would have a fantastic time, including the best seats in the house (eye level with the main stage), fast entrance through a different door plus all sorts of freebies. But the evening went like this: The courier on the coach could speak hardly any English, she didn't tell us where to go when we got off the coach so it was a case of follow the leader. We couldn't see a 'second entrance' so like good Brits we joined the only queue we could see which was very long. Eventually a Coco Bongo worker came along, saw our tickets and escorted us to the VIP entrance, so we felt relieved at that point thinking that very soon we would be inside the club. However when we got to the front of the queue we were told by the non-customer friendly girl on the door that she had no record of our names and couldn't let us in. She radio'd Giovanni who came along and tried to sort it out. I felt we were treated very shoddily and waited so long that by the time we were allowed in there were no eye level seats left.The show was good, though we felt it was better suited to the age of our daughters with us who are in their 20's. There were people in their 60's and 70's who were turning off their hearing aids and leaving early having paid large amounts of money to go, I think it is unfair to tell them it could be their sort of evening - the music is booming and you can feel the vibration through your body. the £70 per head did include drinks but if you are not a huge drinker I would suggest going for the lower priced tickets. We had to chase Giovanni for our freebies which was an oversized T shirt, and some other bits not worth mentioning. My daughters would give this 4 stars but we will go for 2 - much of the reason for this is the way we were treated.
Death Trap.. Total waste of money. All the bad reviews are true so I won't waste anymore time on this place only to say save your money and go anywhere else.

Very dissapointing... I had heard such rave reviews of Coco Bongo so was really excited about going.We paid extra for a table, however we were all packed in so tightly that I kept getting the guy next to me's elbow in my face!The show was enetertaining, however there was more time between acts than there were of actual shows. Whilst they were waiting they would get girls from the audience to dance on the stage for a bit, and then blow their skirts up towards the end of the song. Not really what I would have paid $200 to see.The service, however was amazing. Our waiter was extremely attentive, and even though he got us the wrong drink a couple of times he was extremely apologetic and got us the right one straight away.Overall I defintiely don't think it is worth the money at all.

Make sure you are a Goldmember for the best experience. Just back from Playa Del Carmen and went to the club last Monday 10th June. There is only one way to describe it and that is "incredible".First of all make sure you go VIP as a goldmember, we booked at the last minute on the door, but you can get tickets for the VIP area from your rep. This means you are seated away from the main dance floor with your own waiter and unlimited premium drinks. We paid 70 English pounds each for a show that started at 2220 and went on until 0300 - non-stop. You can stay in the club until about 0400.The show is jaw dropping, a mix of video magic and live performance which I have never seen before and it just doesn't stop for four and a half hours. So if you think about how much you pay for a West End Theatre ticket and then add non-stop drinks then it's amazing value as well as not to be missed entertainment. We were drinking gin and tonic and the waiter brought out the Tanqueray gin bottle every time, so we could we could see what we were getting. Your waiter definitely earns a big tip. It's a must!
Just ok. We visit cocobongo one night during our stay, we bought the vip package but it was not what we expected to be. I recommend the Palazzo club next door.

A bit disappointing. We visited this attraction as part of a Thomson excursion. We had to stand on the bench at the top side of the room and hardl got to see any of the show.The music was good and I believe that the show was excellent too.I think the problem was that we had gone with the tour operator and were all squashed into the area that they were provded. We were also restricted to the time we had there, and getting there when the show seemed to have been going on for a while already did not really please us.I would advise anyone to visit this attraction independently and this should let you determine what time you get there and what time that you leave and I would hope that you would also get a better view of the show.Saying that, I did still manage to do my fair share of dancing and singing and made the best of the situation.

Nice mood, amazing shows. We found this place crazy, like no other ever, just a litle bit over crowned specially for a tuesday night, the shows where amazing, not as the drinks which could be better quality.

AMAZING !!!. Do it, do it, do it!!Seriously, if you go nowhere or do nothing else on your holiday - GO HERE !!It's New Years Eve, Mardi Gras and a Las Vegas show all rolled into one! The atmosphere is AMAZING and the show is FANTASTIC !! Expect to see everyone from Michael Jackson to Freddie Mercury, Madonna, Rhianna, Spiderman, Phantom of the Opera, Beetlejuice and Batman appear in it!! (it's done in good taste but even 'Jesus' makes an appearance!!)Drinks are included in the price of admission as is your coach from and to your hotel.Best advice, get the gold seats but don't wait for the coach - get a taxi or collectivo into town so you arrive at Coco Bongo for 10pm so you get a great table. Then take advantage of the fact your drinks are included and wait for the show to start at 11:30pm (it goes on until 3:30am but you won't stop being entertained for a minute of that!!)WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!!

This place is unreal. I kept hearing things about this place and wasn't 100% sure but I took the plunge and I have to say I wasn't expecting to see of hear what I did.It was like an attraction, show, concert & night club all rolled into one and it was out of this world!!Drinks were included and you get table service.Word of warning if you don't like loud music and heights then you might want to give this one a miss.

Pricey but mesmerizing show. Do go to This amazing show! I'm sure it's worth paying $250 USD for a small table and a Don Julio tequila bottle. If one wishes to pay less you can always pay $70 USD per person and that includes entrance and open bar. My husband and I couldn't keep our eyes off the stage they have great talented performers. The atmosphere is so energetic, it's a pumped up place. Once in a lifetime. A must if you visit Playa.

The best 4 hours entertainment in the world. This is the best club I have ever been to!! I didn't know what to expect but it was 4 hours of constant entertainment by a great faultless crew! Felt like you wer eating a show in a nightclub! If you are going to go get a VIP table! You get your own waiter all inclusive drinks, our waiter brought shots and drinks as soon as you has finished he was there so good!!

The best club. This is my six time there what can I say I love the place I live in Miami and there is nothing like this here I will like to thank all the managers and waiters there awesome people there they will help anyone if you go to playa del Carmen and you don't go here you missing the best party in playa I miss this place already I be there next year popping bottles and making the party better than ever thank you again guys for a great service .

Sardines at small tables. First of all I would like to say that we enjoyed the show which consisted of entertainers mimicing the artists and their dancers on a screen behind them. We purchased the tickets through our first choice/thomson rep at the hotel and cost us around £80 each for the VIP ticket which included seats, show and drinks. First impressions were not good. We were told by our rep to get to the venue by 10.30pm and that we would go through a seperate entrance and avoid the queues, when we got out of our taxi and showed a member of the coco bongos staff our ticket he pointed at an entrance door and told us to go to it. We did as we were instructed and went behind a group of people who were also going into the same entrance. As we were waiting other groups were passing alongside us, we decided to follow those people as we were at a standstill and confused about which queue we were meant to be joining. As we were about to go down the steps inside the doorway a member of staff came out, checked our ticket and gave us our gold member wristband and directed us to join the queue (which had formed while we were waiting at the entrance). We waited in a hallway getting very hot and sticky and wondered whether we had made a mistake (already felt like a sardine). We were taken to a table where my husband and my son were instructed to sit on a long bench and my daughter in law and myself were directed to sit on the bench seat below so that all four of us could share a small table which was directly in front of me. Another group of people were then put next to us (when they all got up and starting dancing on the back bench I had visions of them falling on us, eventually they actually left their table and seating area and went downstairs to the people who were standing around the bar area (there were so many people down there that I don't know how they could dance, no wonder more of them tried to fit on the bar to dance), a couple then sat down at the table next to us and as they were only two so it was a better fit. There was a walkway in front of the table (only one person wide) then there was a row of stools which were up against the railings and overlooking the dance/bar area on the ground floor. The actual acts were perfomed above ground floor level so we were able to see them clearly which was good. We offered the waiter a tip to begin with (our rep told us to give the waiter a tip at the beginning and then another tip at the end), the waiter refused the tip and told us only to tip him at the end of the night if we were happy with the service he had given, which we were. When we were sold the tickets as a show we expected a table with chairs/seats around it and we expected artists to be singing, it was nothing like we expected but we still enjoyed it. It was a one off (expensive) experience and should have been better described to us by our rep.
Stay away. so crowed on a Monday night payed $300 for a vip table and was squished in with a bunch of sweaty people eww!! we left in 5 minutes

OMG. This is the maddest club you will ever go to in your life. Its like a club and a show all in one. we went as a family and frineds group with 10 of us our age range was 18 to 64. the older members of our group had some reservations about cominig to cocobongos but we had been a few years before so we know they would love it. If you are an older person please don't be put off of going to coco bongos it realy is for every one. there are acts from the betals, Micale Jackson, spiderman, biltal juice acrobats from the cealing, it realy is an asult on all your sences but probbily the best night of your life. the only down side is it is very buissy in there but the waiters take your orders and bring your drinks so no waiting at the bar.We didnt get in till 4am it's fabulos

Best Service EVER!! Yovani YOU ROCK!. This guy was THE best server i have ever had in my life. I can't believe how he could maneuver around all the copious amounts of people packed into this place like sardines!! Was an amazing show, amazing service, even in the bathrooms too! The one thing i would change is how many people they pack in there but the rest of it makes up for it! LOVE the blasts of cold mist that they do every few minutes...feels AMAZING! I think every bar should have this feature!

Party of my life. I went to Coco Bongo after talking to Daniel from our animation team. He told all about the show so I figured it might be something to check out. I am not as big of a party fan I used to be once, but I had a blast. The drinks kept coming and the show left me simply speechless: it never stopped, not for a second. Dancing, singing, explosions, and more... I need to say it was super entertainment!!!!

Ridiculous overhyped, overpriced, fire hazard. First things first, beware of the Official Ticket sellers outside the club. The lion’s share of their wage is obviously earned through commission, so they will basically have no qualms about lying to your face in order to secure a sale. The guy who sold us our tickets seriously mislead us about several things. Also, be warned: If you are expecting this to be like a proper show club where you are sat around a comfortable table with waiter service drinks watching a show before getting up to dance…..yeah, it’s nothing like that. Nothing at all. The inside of the club is basically a rickety wooden structure, almost in a sort of stadium style layout, with tables and people packed in like sardines (our table for five had enough space for two max). This is no place for the old, frail or claustrophobic. The place is so packed and so poorly designed that once full it’s a complete fire hazard. I have no idea what Mexico’s fire regulations are like but I would be absolutely astonished if Coco Bongo isn’t filling their venue way way beyond the legal capacity. If any sort of fire did break out pretty much everyone apart from the people closest to the exit would be totally screwed. Oh, and the Waiters will basically refuse to bring you drinks unless you agree up front to tip them HUGE amounts. Nice. The show itself largely comprises of people in tacky outfits (including a zip lining Jesus) dancing around and miming to cheesy pop songs. There is one very good act (the acrobats) and some of the effects are quite cool (ticker tape and glitter bombs) but it is mostly the sort of entertainment you would expect to find in a Butlin’s style Holiday Camp (except with a slightly larger budget). It may well be a lot of peoples cup of tea, but it certainly isn’t mine! And for Coco Bongo to claim that they are comparable to the top Vegas shows is laughable. It’s not even in the same universe. Honestly, If you want to go drinking and dancing ‘til the early hours there are loads of good bars and clubs in PDC to visit without having to waste £40/$60 of your hard earned cash on tickets for this overhyped, sweaty, cheesefest.

Absolute must if on holiday in mexico. This was the most amazing night of our holiday and is an absolute must for anyone visiting Mexico, no matter what your age is. I recommend booking the VIP experience it's only £20 more and is highly worth it!! With VIP you get a seat and private area. For each private area there is a waiter who gets your drinks all night. With VIP you also get premium spirits so none of the strange own brand Mexican drinks. If you decide not to go VIP you'll still have an amazing night, do however be prepared to get very squashed and hot. You can dance on the bars downstairs and so of the acts do go into the audience of non VIP which is an advantage. Expect to see everything from spiderman flying towards to acts from Chicago. There really is no other way to describe the night other than a nightclub with circus acts and Vegas show all rolled into one! The show finishes at 3( so a good 3 1/2 hours of non stop entertainment ) Don't miss out as you'll really regret it . It is cheaper to book tickets before you fly to Mexico or from coco bongo itself as opposed to buying them through your holiday rep.

Awesome!. We go to playa every year and Coco Bongo is a must! The show they put on is really awesome! They really try to help get you a good seat, but you need to get there early, the earlier you go, the better seat you will get. There is not a bad seat unless you get stuck behind a rail with people standing in front of you.

Best night club and show I have ever been too!. Defiantly a must see and we'll worth the money. We paid i think $60 or $65 for a bus ride there and back which was a half hour drive from our hotel both ways and all the drinks included. The show they put on was amazing best i have ever seen.. and i been to Vegas this blows Vegas out of the water to us. Our waiter Yovani was the best waiter we have ever had ANYWHERE! Our drinks we already waiting for us right when we got done with the first one and we had a big group with us and he always remembered what each person ordered and kept them coming. :) Also recommend to book at your hotel when the employees are there selling tickets its a way better deal and safer, plus if you don't you pay almost 40 for taxi to get there.

Outdated music and too crowded. Found out about Cocobongos from reps at the resort. We paid $35 USD for GA, and included one Cocobongo drink. My boyfriend and I went on a Monday. The ticket also included free transportation to and from the venue. We got there at 10 and left at 3:30 am. 'Im from Miami, where we have some of the best clubs and parties, so I was disappointed with this venue. They have a live show, which was somewhat entertaining, but the few times they did play music, it was very outdated. Like early 90s outdated. If you are not VIP, there is no place for you to sit. The cocobongo drink was purely juice. It is not a big place, so we were very crowded also. If you pay for VIP, it won't be any less crowded either. When we left the venue, we noticed there were other clubs down the small strip with much better music. But we had to go home, so we couldn't try another place. My recommendation, is to try another club for a better party then cocobongos.
love. went here this time last year and omg its the best club i have ever been to. the shows the music being able dance on the bars soo much fun if i return i will defo do this again :)
Awesome show. The shows are amazing. Be prepared for a long night and tons of people. Overall it's something you can't just see anywhere and is very entertaining

A great place for the young adult. Not for us but the show was fun, if you could hear it. Much too loud and all about the alcohol. Pushed the shots, which was included, at least in our price. We were on the second floor and it was tough getting to the bathrooms in the basement.

Must see. Defiantly a must see and we'll worth the money. The show lasted 4hours and wast full of entertainment. Buy VIP tickets for seated area and a waiter all night. Would return in the future. Try and book through a coco bingo promotion employee who works at hotels rather than Thomson though as you are looked after better and get a choice of more nights, its also cheaper and we got free t-shirts, cups and bags. (Don't pay extra for fri & sat night - it's the same shows as all the other nights)

To Be young again. Coco Bongo was not the night my wife and friends were expecting, we thought it was going to be a stage show like Vegas, sitting around a large table drinking all night, How wrong were weIf you book this night out go Gold member so you are let in first at 10:30 you are show to an area were the seating is more like a bench top and bottom with tables in front of you, the place has three floors and they cram the people IN.If you like load music this place is for you it’s a night club with a show thrown in nothing like you would have seen before.The drinks keep coming top marks for that, but we were not happy with the brands they were supposed to be named brands NOT, but the beer was good.The night went on to 4pm and after we got over the shock were we were sitting and how and the place was a night club, I have to say its worth going to see and experience it, a little over priced but HA your on your Holidays.
plan for a long night. The show was great and went all night (until 6am) Every hour had a new segment. Get VIP tickets if you don't like crowds.

Surreal.... ...is the only way to describe my experience and I loved every minute of it! It has to have been one of the best club experiences I've ever had. I admit that I was a bit sceptical beforehand because of the mixed reviews I'd read about overcrowding and expensive prices but it was worth the effort in the end.We bought our tickets on the night, around 9ish. There was a ticket seller just outside the club who told us about the different options. We had the choice of a table with two bottles of spirits for $95 or no table and unlimited booze for $75. As a group of a Brit (me), Aussies and Irish, we opted for the latter, knowing that the two bottles wouldn't get us very far! Plus I'd read bad reviews about the table service.Our $75 tickets also included two hours of free drinks at Señor Frog's, a quirky bar down by the beach (the opposite end to Coco Bongo). When we got to the bar we were told that we could order anything we wanted from the menu, so we girls loaded up on the cocktails while the guys chose to stick to beer. We headed to the club around 11.30 and there was no queue outside so we walked straight in. When we finally got to the main room (you have to go through a mini maze of dark corridors and security, but you get a free shot of tequila for your troubles!) we were amazed to see how busy it already was. We entered right in the middle of a show so we had performers in harnesses swinging above us. We didn't even have to go to the bar as they have waiters walking the floor. The guy asked for our drinks order and came back less than five minutes later. After about 15 minutes of dancing and acclimatising to the randomness of everything, one of the bouncers asked us girls if we wanted to dance up on the bar in the middle of the room. We had the best view of all the stage performances from up there, with the performers in harnesses within touching distance, and the drinks were pretty much on tap as we only had to crouch down and ask the barmen to make us another. There was a LOT of confetti (I feel sorry for the guys who have to clean up every night), endless streamers, very cold dry ice and colourful balloons in between acts and the music was a brilliant mix of current songs and old skool tunes.We left around 4ish (I think) and there were lots of taxis outside ready to take people home. We walked as our hotel was pretty close by and the streets were safe.I can't recommend this place enough. You need to go for the experience. The ticket price is quite steep but you make up for it with the open bar (and free pre-club drinks). I wouldn't recommend getting a table because they looked tiny and you still had to stand anyway. Plus the main action is on the dancefloor/bar. The shows are entertaining and everyone is there to have a good time. Oh, and they have the cleanest toilets I've ever seen in a club. The staff in there ensure the cubicles are in good condition for the next people.If you only do one thing in Playa, make sure it's Coco Bongo.

Amazing, a MUST in Mexico. What a fantastic night. It's exactly as the adverts say, and very under hyped. The show is amazing, the staff are superb and attentive and it's safe and fun. All inclusive drinks with a true vegas show, with acts such as Beyonce, Gaga, Moulin Rouge, Chicago, Tron, Batman, Spiderman, Madonna and The Beatles to name a few. 6 hours of pure entertainment. Can not reccomend more; i visted twice during my holiday!

Stupidly Expensive. I went to Coco Bongo because me and my boyfriend know about this place and were excited after reading all the reviews.I imagined a wonderful, surprising show, full of special effects.This place costs 60 dollars per person, in Mexico, where everything is nice and affordable.You have to bear a long long line to enter, and after spending one hour with people pushing you you just get a stupidly expensive DISCO. It's nothing else than a full, crowded disco. There are some shows going on between some songs, but it's just regular shows, nothing special. And you cannot enjoy them because you are pressed within people pushing you and staff asking you to move all the time. You cannot even dance if you would like to because the place is crazily crowded and you can barely breathe. TERRIBLE EXPERIENCE.

Unreal. I've visited many famous clubs and seen many shows including Ibiza, London, Miami, Vegas to name a few...this topped the lot. Top staff, very safe and secure and unbelievable show!! Suggest you go gold member. Thanks, hopefully see you soon

Don't go VIP. We were expecting great things from this place as friends had told us about the Coco Bongos on Cancun. This one is completely different, the dancers look uninterested, no one sings live they all mime and badly. We got VIP as we were told you get the best view, seats and waiter service. Just before the show began they let non VIPS in the row infront of us that was meant to be empty, which in turn blocked our view meaning the paid half of what we did and got a better view and waiter service. Not worth the money.

Best night in my life. Wow! This place is something else. We booked VIP tickets and had our own balcony in level with the stage. I did not expect what the night had to bring. It was completely something I had never seen before, I won't ruin it for u all, just go and see for yourselves. It might seem pricey but worth every penny by far! A night I will remember forever!

Best Show Ever Seen!. This was a great experience. I did not know what to expect. Only down side was that we had to stand the whole time. The shows were fantastic, would go back but try to get in the VIP next time.

Best night in mexico. we booked our trip to coco bongo through our travel agency, Thomson.We were given VIP seating area at the top which had a side on view of the stage which was perfect, I can imagine from the main area at the bottom it would be hard to see some of the acts on stage but I can only comment from my vantage point.We were also given drinks included in our deal with a dedicated waiter who was quicker than I expected him to be. The show itself lasts for hours, we got to the venue just before 11pm and the show starts at 11.30pm and goes on until 3.30am. All the acts were really good, our favourite were the acrobats and the batman spoof. The music was really good, all current club favourites and I was singing along to all of it. If your a bit older, they do have The Beatles and Elvis parts of the show so it suits all ages, we had a varied mix of ages in our tour group and they all seemed to enjoy it.Overall, if your going to this part of Mexico, I urge to DEFINATELY book at least one night here. We went on a Monday night and that was still mega busy, I can only imagine what a Friday or Saturday night would look like. The show is amazing and keeps you entertained. The music is current and the DJ does really good mixes.Only things I would suggest are to book through someone like Thomson, who will take you and pick you up, it includes a seating area {usually sectioned off} and drinks easily accessible with a good view of stages.Show finishes just before 3.30 (just a few mins) we left so we could go into the shop downstairs to grab a t-shirt or 2 as our coach was due to leave 15 mins later, so if like me you like to have a momento, just bear it in mind. I had an amazing time, definitely one of the highlights of my trip.

One not to be missed...amazing!. Absolutely amazing!It is an act (dancing) to great songs, excellent DJ, but just so you are aware they don't sing. It is all mimed but doesn't take anything away from how brilliant this place is. Vibe is incredible, streamers and balloons fall from the ceiling...worth every penny!

Brilliant night out. This was one of the best nights out I have had in ages. Booked through the rep at the hotel so we went VIP which meant we were got our own table with waiters to serve you drinks all night. We were on the second their of seats which was a really good view of the show and they close this off to everyone who didn't pay for VIP. The show consist of acts singing and dancing, acrobatic acts, scenes from musicals, the list is endless simply a brilliant night! The night out is so worth it as you get all drinks included in the price you pay along with a table and waiter depending on who you book with.

WOW!!! Entertainment like no other club. All the acts we say were brilliant, they really have mastered this performance and its money well spent. Riannah, LMFAO, Michael Jackson, Lady Gaga.Very crowded, but if you stand further back you get to see a great show and have some excellent music to dance to in between.The crowd can go up and dance on the podium, but beware, the fans will lift your skirt for the crowd to see your knickers at times :)Don't get confused with the queuing to get in like we did. There are 3 queues, they are all the same, they just rotate the order that people enter to manage the flow.

Mayhem, but in a good way. Went with low expectations (as the driver was looking for two of us rather than 4) and we were left to find our own way in which was the fault of the reps rather than CocoBongos. Got a VIP package which was definitely worth the money.We were on the second tier , good beer and close to the stage. The acts themselves are great, but there is a fair amount of filling in between. Lots of X-factor auditions on the stage but some real quality too. The quality would be improved if the length were halved but you do get a solid 4 1/2 hours of fun (and drum and bass),a good laugh and one ticked of the bucket list

My favorite new place!. I love Coco Bongo. This was definitely the highlight of my trip to Riviera Maya. I went down there for business, but wanted to experience this nightclub. The show was pretty amazing and there were so many characters. I danced on the bar all night long which is in the center of the nightclub. The bartenders were very friendly and brought us free drinks. There was a fight that broke out later in the night, but the staff handled it promptly. During my entire trip, I just wished I could go back and experience Coco Bongo again. Nothing else even compared to the amount of fun we had that night...

Awesome. Great club with awesome shows. Not as good as the Cancun location but still worth the trip. Liquor selection lacking, would love to see some top shelf brands instead of the cheapest of the cheap but the price of packages cant be beat.

Really does put Vegas night life to shame.... This is hands down the best night club I have ever been too. Be sure to ask about the package with the 2 hours drinking at senor frogs and the open bar inside coco bongo afterward. I felt like this bar never closed. Most fun I have had in a long time.
A MUST!. Amazing show & atmosphere. The house was full and although the drinks kept coming all night and the services was great, too....I'll be back!

Waste of money.. Terribly organized and layed out. Thought we were coming here to see a good Las Vegas style show and dance. Ended up having to watch random girls dance on the stage for half the time. The building layout is kind of ridiculous, they have too many tables that take up too much space for the amount of people they try and squeeze in. If you wanted to see the show you'd have to be lucky enough to get a spot by the railing, which they 'reserve.' If not, youre standing behinde rows of people who are also trying to dance at the same time, so you really can't see much. They really need to input a maximum capacity, it was really hard to enjoy the experience. I understand that it is a club, but it's not just a club, it's a show, that 3/4 of the can't see. Don't waste your money, you'll have a better time at any other bar on 5th ave that you don't have to pay for.

Get there early and buy the gold member ticket. Loved the show! Much more fun than anything I have seen in Vegas. We arrived at 10:45 with Gold Member tickets which get you a chair, table, and waiter service. We got really bad seats behind people and I had to wait over an hour for a stool. So, just get there by 10 and wait in line early. With that said, our waiter gave us the best service I have ever experienced. Our drinks were always filled before they were finished and we never had to ask him! Truly a great time!

What an experience!. High Energy. The show was very good, the music was good but no space to dance because the place was/is packed.4 stars because I think it's overpriced. To sit you have to pay for VIP $120. My feet were just starting to hurt (11pm - 3:30am).Open bar but that should be optional indicated by a wristband. I'm not a drinker so I paid for others to drink also.Left right before it ended as the entrance is also the exit (serious hazard) to avoid the rush.
Amazing show!. Little pricey, and usually very busy, but the show is amazing! Go on a week night and it's cheaper. Get a good spot on the 3rd floor across from the stage. Great views.

Rip Off Sales Team. Buyer beware. Be careful from Coco Bongo Sales guys they will try and extract as much as possible from you. We were ripped off to the tune of $130 per person, when most on the same trip and in the same VIP area only paid an average of $70 per person (pretty much the going rate for VIP). Wrote to Coco Bongo from the resort and by message on their Facebook page, as their email on the website doesn't work and not got any reply at all......customer service is extremely poor and reported this to our hotel, who were sympathetic but unable to interfere.The sales guys have a daily target to make bonus, and generally end up buying the remaining few tickets themselves to make bonus and then sell those around $70....after overcharging the earlier punters.....if you do buy from Sales guys on the resorts buy late in the day and dont get caught with the tagline..."we've only got a few tickets left before the night you want is sold out"The show itself however is well worth the visit.
Amazing night. Brilliant night! Deffo worth every penny would recommend to any age! Only thing I didn't like is the que to get in haha but hey get there early and it might help

Thomas Cook "TC Project" - DANGEROUS DEATH TRAP. We booked a party of 8 on the Thomas Cook TC Project, which ended with entry to Coco Bongo. The night was good up until this point. Coco Bongo is a death trap. The Thomas Cook VIP Balcony is the highest point in the building with one toilet for the ladies and one urinal and sink for the men. Despite promising they would only sell 60 tickets, Thomas Cook sold 120 and we were herded into the tiny balcony where we were crushed. I saw customers climbing onto scaffolding to avoid being crushed and ladies urinating in the men's sink. There was no "view", you could not see the show or even the stage from the height we were at. There were no drinks despite being an all inclusive night . The Coco Bongo leaflet says "show and disco". It is neither of these things. The show consists of dancers miming to show tunes, in tacky costumes and there is no way it can call itself a disco! There was no room to move let alone dance, drink and socialise. We left after 5 minutes of the show starting, although it took us 15 minutes to exit the building (people were stood on the steps to avoid being crushed). Upon exit there was a mele outside as other tourists complained to Thomas Cook. A lady was having a panic attack, a man was clutching his chest and another grabbed the rep by his throat and was screaming that he had lost his wife in the crowd and could not find her. Sammie-Jo the Thomas Cook rep organised transport back to the resort, she apologied and agreed that it was over full and told us to see her at 9am the following morning for a full refund. The following morning her Manager (who had approved the refund the previous night) refused the refund and would not even face us. I have lodged a complaint with Thomas Cook. They are bare faced liars who care nothing for the safety of their customers. Avoid... please... if there was a fire or fight in there Thomas Cook would have blood on their hands, you would not be able to get out. Terrible. Shocking. Greedy. Thomas Cook should be ashamed. The tiny part of the show I did see (I climbed up the side of some scaffolding for a few seconds to see what was happening on stage) was rubbish anyway. The free Michael Jackson King of Pop Tribute in our hotel was better!

Amazing!. Really did not know what to expect from this but WOW! what a night out!This really is a great night out, over 18 only, they really do put on a great show, so all type of music, its loud and in your face but great fun!

Great show. We went to the Coco Bongo on a Monday night, was filled but was not cramped. We bought the vip package through our Sunwing Rep, which was great for our first trip there. Unfortunately, we didn't get great seats and only seen the stage from the sideview. Our friends went down on the main floor to see better and the staff down there took care of them, didn't have to go to the bar at all. Security was everywhere and felt very safe. Never had a problem with getting to the bathroom and it was very clean. Overall I think we paid too much, but for the first time there we just wrote it off. If we went back wouldn't pay what we paid.

Our late night out but well worth it. What can I say such a fantastic night, stage show trapeze artists personal waiter getting you drinks all night, in the VIP area, what wonderful dancers, they all were was frightened going to miss something as all around something was happening got in there t 10.30pm never looked at time till 3am which is what we told would happen a must if you visit Mexico.

Good show, average nightclub. I had great fun there, the show was very good, it is what makes it worth going there in first place, most of the staff were very friendly, however everything else was a bit lacking. Overall I have been to far better night clubs (not in Playa del Carmen though). We got the VIP tickets with reserved table, when we got there we noticed that everybody had VIP tickets promising no queue. Apparently this can't happen as there is only one entrance so we were stuck in the VIP queue for ages while the normal one was going really fast. After an argument with the security guy we got in and surprise, surprise no table!!! We managed to find a bar which was 'reserved' - this got resolved by another argument and a few 1 dollar bills. The waiter was really good I must admit, however I would suggest that you give them the odd tip, really improves the service. They seem to sell VIP, Super VIP and Mega VIP tickets, therefore I would suggest that you ask a lot of questions with regard to what exactly is included before you pay anything. I saw a few people getting their money back and going home while we were waiting to get in.Enough about the tickets. The place is cramped, basically you can't get to the toilet (which is really clean) unless you are very close as it's a tinned sardines experience. People are constantly trying to move around probably to find some empty space which makes the problem even worse. I think that they overfill the place by at least 50%.The drinks are watered down as you might expect so unless you're underage or get drunk by a double whiskey, don't worry you'll be sober throughout the show. I usually don't attend night clubs which use plastic cups, it makes you feel as if you're drinking in the street, but after the initial problems with the entrance and the table this seemed fairly minor.Once you leave at about 3-4a.m. there are plenty of taxis to take you home.
awesome time. loved it all, pay the extra to get seats and your own waiter. the vegas feel and acobats was awesome to see. this was our 2nd time at coco bongo.

Must do VIP section!. Loved my 1st experience at Coco Bongo! We were kindly upgraded to VIP section and it was the only way to have drinks delivered and stand above the dance floor to see the show! The drinks go down easy! Great time, will be back!

Amazing time. We went to the Coco Bongo on a Tuesday evening and got the VIP tickets. It was a bit of a struggle as our resort said they were sold out, but upon going talking to the live chat people on the Coco Bongo website, I was told tickets were indeed available and got it sorted that way.Our shuttle was an hour late which meant we were sat right beside the stage, but that just meant we got to see all the people come on and off the stage and talk to them. The show itself was amazing and fun, the service was impeccable (I'd put a beer down with 1/3 left, look up seconds later to find a brand new one in its place. I swear I never even saw the server). Eventually once a better spot opened up, our server moved us without us asking so we'd see the show better. Overall, had a great time and would love to come back.

craziest night ever. Went to coco bongo after younger family members said it was meant to be the best night clubbing experience. They were right. It was the most extreme clubbing night , a full attack on all of your senses. Whenever you see films with club scenes and say "clubs are never as exciting as that" well this one is. The show lasted for hours, with a tribute to the beetles, Elvis, Michael Jackson, madonna and rhianna it felt like you had travelled through the history of pop with some show tunes thrown in. Bizarre rope dangling, balloon throwing and lots of tickatape kept us whooping through the night.We paid extra for vip tickets and I was so glad we did. Not only did we get seats and tables but an excellent view of the stage and personal waiter. We drank far too much and the tequilla served straight into the mouth was perhaps a step too far.The night ended when a member of the group hit the multiple shots brick wall and had to be aided by security (you know who you are). By this point it was about 3am and at 40 something it was way past my bed time. Taxis were outside and we were still buzzing when we returned to the hotel. The next day of the holiday was lost in a blur but it was well worth it. Truly a once in a lifetime experience.

Dangerous and small. I went to the coco bongos in cancun it was fantastic so we chose to go to the one in playa del Carmen. It was $55 a person all you can drink, the shows are awesome BUT it is extremely packed, like you are like a sardine! No lie! If there was a fire or fight. It would be your life on the line so good luck!!!!

A little piece of Vegas in Mexico. The best night you've never had. This place seems so intimidating until you get there. I've gone both with tour guides and without both times were amazing. You'll leave wishing you had one closer to home. Nothing else is like it. Me and my new bride are not frequent bar goers in fact this is on time you will be OK with being a bit crammed. There is no doubt this place is crowded but what would you expect from one of the best shows on earth. We went through the resort and it was $60 US for all you can drink, an express pass, and round trip transportation. good deal. Send time attending second time leaving with a big smile on my face can't wait to come back !

Great show. We when vip ,was reserve for us 6 by Alejandro ant the royal we had the best plays the show we saw all in front of us, but if you wish to dans in the crowd and on the bar you should be on the main floor the sow almost look like Vagas show, nee to see at leas onceIt starts at 10h00 pm and done at 2h30

What a surprise!. Everyone kept telling me to go to coco bongos, well we did and had a blast! To be honest didn't know what to expect thought it might be a show for an hour then just a dj but the show started at midnight and there were performances right through til it finished at 4am. Acts like elvis and the Beatles to scenes from films like batman and Beatle juice and some fantastic acrobats. We paid for the VIP ticket which meant we went straight in (and to be honest after seeing the que for the main door was very pleased we did) we had a seat with our own waiter that kept bringing us drinks, if you plan on sitting down all night then pay for the seat, as soon as the music started everyone was up and dancing! Ages ranged from 18 to 60 mostly young people though! Be warned they have a camera which if the light lands on you then you will be put on 2 big screens so everyone can see how badly you dance, don't worry you won't be the only ones! We had a great view of the stage we were 2nd row seating so really close to it! Taxi rank is right outside no problems getting a taxi! There are photographers that will come round and take your pictures but you have to pay if you want them, we had ours taken with a Beatle juice midget which was cool!

A********. Coco Bongo's, I wish I would have visited you twice not once when I came Mexico, what an awesome night it was, fantastic!!! You will have a spectacular night of trapeze artists being put on, amongst other shows and dances, it's a really good night! It's for people who love to drink, dance and have a good time, and it's also for people who love watching shows. It really is amazing! It can get pretty crowded in here though, as it does get really busy, so if you don't like crowded places and lots of people around you would steer clear.I would recommend just getting the normal express pass, do not go VIP unless you like to sit down a lot and not really be involved in the atmosphere. If you wanted be involved in the partying, this is where you need to be! Also a lot of ppl who went VIP whined, as they had seats on the ground floor (which was slightly tiered) but when express pass customers stood up they whined as they couldn't see because of all the people dancing etc. Some VIP's are also situated up on the balconies also, so they wouldn't have this problem, but I would still never go VIP to an event like this, too much fun to be missed in the express part if you do.We paid about £45 each for our express passes, if you go VIP you will be doubling that price pp. You can receive the same type of service if you do not go VIP, all's ya have to do is tip your waiter who greets you at the beginning 100 pesos, he will fetch you your drinks for the rest of the night. Bargain for the service you receive.A word of advice, don't let the female's who work at coco bongo's (in the toilets) try to dry your hands, as they do this so you will tip them.Next time I do eventually go back to Mexico, I need to visit this place twice, it really is fantastic. Deffo go here if you get the chance!

Amazing Experience. Amazing!! they are right they put Vegas to shame, The shows are well organized the music is great and al you can drink specials well worth the price and its a must place to visit while in Playa del Carmen or Cancun.

Expensive, but worth it!. We had VIP tickets to this - this included a seat in a specific location and all alcohol through use of a waiter. These were expensive, but it was worth it. The show was fantastic and our waiter was very attentive. Yes you should tip, but we did at the end and it didn't make any difference to his attentiveness throughout the night. Our seat wasn't brilliant - side view - but I definitely reccomend sitting down unless you're on a night out with a group. As a couple, this was perfect for us. It was a great night and I'd most definitely visit again.

3rd time to the Coco Bongo. Me and a friend bought our tickets (VIP) through our awesome rep at our resort. If you stay at Allegro Playacar buy your tickets from Dian, she is awesome. This was my second time to the Playa Del Carmen Coco Bongo and it was awesome...VIP is worth it but I didnt find our section to be in the best spot though. Also the Cancun version of Coco Bongo is much bigger and better in my opinion. The show itself is amazing and the bartenders/waiters were really doing an amazing job. Maybe in a few years I will go back and check it out again, but I do recommend t to anybody who has never been. Quite and experience...more of a SHOW than a "club". :)

Great Night out. I was so excited to go to COCO BONGO. It was defiantly a lot of fun.The atmosphere, the songs, the performances, the dancing the impersonations.All of it was definetly very very fun.I Don't mean to be a party pooperUnforgettably we had a bad experience that thank God didn't end up a lot worse then it could of. We let our guard down and let the very polite waiters bring us our drinks on trays (as people mentioned it is too packed to even move to head to the bar) by the middle of the night security guards kept shining torches on our drinks which I didn't know why. ( The only thing I could think of was someone must be having drugs near us) My husband started to feel very strange by the middle of the night and this was not a alcohol reaction we had hardly been drinking only vodka and cranberry. This was a very scary experience on our honeymoon and thankfully I wasn't affected and we got to our hotel safely. it just goes to show you cant trust anywhere even a sold out popular event.Just wanted to warn others to be very careful. After this happened i goggled other reviews and some things also came up on google about people drinks being spiked for their money etc.Considering what happened this is still a great attraction and worth the money paid.
Coco Bongo. We didn't actually go in. The line was too long and we didn't want to wait an hour to go in. We did get a refund from FunJet vacations the next day for that excursion.

Great night!. Mix of Cirque du Soleil, universal studios and nightclub. Me and my wife got the Golden Club ticket, it's expensive but worth every penny. Reservation must be made with 2 to 3 days in advance. If it's your first time in PDC don't miss it.

Amazing experience!!. Like most other reviewers have said, yes it is crazy packed in there and yes it is a fire hazard...but it is AMAZING!! I went with a group of girls and we bought our tickets from promoters at the resort at a discount. They were only regular tickets because VIP was sold out for the night by the time we bought them. YES we were shoved around but I still had the best time! The performers are EXCELLENT, lots of acrobats doing crazy stunts and the impersonators are not your regular lame street performers, they are really good and it felt just like watching the real thing! The music in between the shows was great too, I didn't hear a single song that I didn't like. The bartenders and busboys here are also very nice and friendly; even though we didn't have VIP they still brought us drinks and offered to help us take pictures, etc. And when we asked where the restrooms were, they would literally take our hand and lead us right there as it would have been impossible otherwise because the place is so jam packed.Overall it was an awesome night! Be prepared for lots of balloons and confetti!

The best night club in Playa del Carmen. I loved the atmosphere, great music, has a big capacity and still you are not bothered by people pushing you. Funny beautiful waitresses pushing you to buy shots from them. Everybody going crazy. Definitely it is the place to party with friends in playa del carmen.

spring break 2013. ok so we are in our 50s and werent sure about going but hey everyone we talked to said "you gotta go to coco bongo"! so we took the nap in the afternoon since we normally go to bed kinda early and decided to go ahead and go. HIGHLY RECOMMEND the golden package unless you are someone who likes being squished in a crowd or dancing on the bar.that being said..the show was very very good. great music the drinks were flowing the waiters were extremely attentive. we had great seats on the second floor but not sure upstairs there was a bad seat. smoky from the show but they didnt allow cigarette smoking. advertised to start at 1030 but I am sure we didnt even get into the door til then so it was at least 1100only one stall in the ladies bathroom upstairs so there was a line at times but they had an attendant in there cleaning and making sure no one left any mess for the next person.beautiful costumes great dancers we stayed til around 330 then it seems like all the music was latin and we decided to leave but I highly recommend it if you are in playa and WE WERENT THE OLDEST ONES THERE :)

Great time. We had heard horror stories about people prepaying for wristbands and waiting in line so long they give up and leave so we were pretty skeptical but we had a good guy working at our hotel and got in in about 10 minutes. We got the express pass which was $ 60 a person and included entry AND open bar. while youre filing in first thought is god I hope theres not a fire but they hand you drinks in line so you've got a drink and a shot by the time you are even in the bar area. They cram you in like sardines so forget about personal space. Think of the busiest dance floor you've ever tried to move through-that's the entire building. I was drinking my drinks as soon as I got them to avoid them spilling all over me for the zillionth time from people bumping into me. I was annoyed at first having drinks spilled all over me, but since I was drinking so quickly I got drunk pretty fast so quickly forgot about how sticky I was. they get tourist girls to go up on stage for a while and shake their booty then when they want them off they blow air from the floor to send there dress up marilyn monroe style and then the show begins. Very vegas and cirque du soleil styled. Dancers swinging from harnesses and silks, very entertaining. In between sets they have the tourist girls go up again and shake their booty. My bf found the drinks to be watered down (I hadn't noticed) and bought some drinks that weren't included. The service was great sending even have to go to the bar the staff brought the drinks to us which normally I'm paranoid and would not be cool with but none of us were drugged so seems pretty legit. Not that I would be the easiest target since our group of 4 consisted of 3 large men.. Also worth mentioning the service from the staff in the womans bathroom puts the bathrooms in bars at home put to shame. They open the door for you, wipe the seat and give you paper towel. And the bathrooms even after everyone is a mess is very clean!

Great time. We booked this directly through our hotel and we thought at the time that it was a bit expensive. It is all inclusive and you do have a really good time.The show is elaborate and it's really fun. You can buy tickets at the door too and I think it may be a little cheaper but you may have to wait a little more than if you come in with a group. You are free to move around and again it is all inclusive.
Must Visit. Worth the money and it is a MUST visit place!!! The performances were awesome and you are so close to the performers that you
Exceeded all our expectations. If You stay at Playa del Carmen, this is attraction Nr.1.We visited this show with group of scuba divers, and had a very good time.It's a high quality product.

COCO BONGO is a must see!. COCO BONGO is a MUST SEE!**Do NOT Skip going to the COCO BONGO! If you are staying at The Royal go with Alejandro, Jesus, Victor and Myer! Go for the VIP, "Gold Member" Package. It is worth spending the extra money. The price is very reasonable per person considering you can drink all the top-shelf liquor you want, you get a table w/waiter service and the best view in the house! The only thing that is not included is Red-bull. **Muchas Gracias to Alejandro from the Royal for taking us here and setting up such an amazing night! The show was out of this world! Coco Bongo is not just a nightclub it is an impressive experience! The performances and Dj’s do not disappoint. Thank you to everyone working at Coco Bongo.**

AMAZING!!!. My husband and I went to Playa Del Carmen for 8 Days and this place was a must do. We did the VIP Pass whch include all you can drink for 5 hours, our own table and waiter and a great view of the stage. As we entered they gave us a shot of tequila and another drink before we could sit down. They performed nonstop for hours and the liqour keep flowing. The standard pass was on the first level and had to stand shoulder to shoulder in a pack crowd. Def recommended the VIP for more room. Can't wait to go back again.

Awesome, can't Waite to go back.. Close to the most beautiful beaches in the world. 5th Ave Shopping was very cool. Some high pressure sales people but its an awesome time. I'm in beach withdrawals. Can't wait to go back.

Coco bongo= once in a lifetime experience. I was skeptical at first when I found out the prices- I'm very glad my best friend and I chose to go with the VIP passes!! The experience alone was worth the $112.50USD each. We had a server by the name of Abel. He was amazing, and each time I needed the washroom he took me by the hand and escorted me there and was waiting at the stairs to escort me back. Our drinks and ice bucket were constantly topped up. Has anyone else had him as server? After seeing what we would have got for $55USD I'm very glad we opted out for it- it seemed way too crowded and even though it was all you could drink for $55 good luck struggling through the crowd for a drink! This is a must see "night out"!! I still think about that night and wish to go back!

Brilliant night out - fun fun fun!!!. This night out was recommended to us prior to our holiday and after visiting we were so pleased we took this advice. Coco Bongo is an excellent night out - great atmosphere and good entertainment. We paid for VIP seats which meant we had our own little table and waiter which was well worth the additional money. The tickets we had were all inclusive night - the money paid included drinks. We were on the second floor of the club and had a good view of all performing areas. Our waiter was excellent - once he knew what we were drinking we didn’t have an empty glass all night. He brought additional drinks on occasions such as shots and bottles of water which was appreciated.The music in the club was brilliant – really got the night off to a good start. Everyone was in good spirits so lots of dancing. Then the show started – WOW! It was amazing! Very professional dancing, great sets and excellent to watch. They did different short shows to various backing tracks covering all decades and included sets themed to different movies (the Mask was obviously there, along with Batman, Moulin Rouge etc). You had the people on the stage, people on the bar and people zipping in from the roof – you didn’t know where to look next!We booked through our Thomson Rep which included a coach to and from our hotel – Riu Playacar. After speaking to other holidaymakers I think we could have probably got slightly cheaper tickets direct from Coco Bonga or from the hotel entertainment staff however we were still impressed with the evening for the price we paid. Would definitely visit again next time in Mexico and can highly recommend to others!!

Awesome party!. I went to Playa Del Carmen for 11 days and 2 of those I spent the evening/night in Coco Bongo. Great shows, great people and great drinks (also very good dj and music selection).The first time I had an open bar wristband for 50 euro and had to wait like 45 minutes until I could enter. But it was well worth it.The second time I went a little later and could enter right away. Again, AWESOME party, same show, but different acts.If you want to have a great time, Coco Bongo is the place to be!

BONGO-TASTIC!!!!. What a great time we had at this place. From the moment the bus arrived to pick us up in Playacar and then took us to the Express line at Coco Bongo where we received our wrist bands and within 10 minutes, we entered and were given our first 2 drinks, tequila and some other cranberry type cocktail, both ice cold and good... as we made our way inside the club to an open club where we choose the best seats in the house!! The show is an amazing experience as well as the atmosphere and electric energy of the dancers and performance crew ....that they are the best of the best in entertainment and definitely know how to satisfy all the are there to watch and take part of the party!!!!
Best night. Had a fabulous time here recently. Something here for anyone. This place really put an exclamation point on our vacation.
Fantastic show bar and nightclub not to be missed. Absolutely brilliant show. Rather expensive but should be seen. Go with hotel animation team for cheaper price., and not your travel company.

Fun place but huge crowds. We had fun at Coco Bongo, but were amazed at how many people were let in this establishment. Every inch was packed. The music, videos and entertainment were a lot of fun...along with the people watching. Don't wear your nicest clothes or shoes...they're going to get beer and other beverages spilled on them. Be ready for a wall to wall crowd and long lines at the bar and you'll have fun.

Good as the cancun one.. You better like a crowd if you go on Friday or Saturday. There are long lines outside to get in. Once inside you will have drinks spilled on you at least one time during the night. There will always be some one pushing you forward or back so they can get by you. You swim in people. we never found a place that night that people were not surrounding you. If you are claustrophobic don't go here! But let me tell you it's amazing!!! So worth all the pushing and shoving for. It really is as good as the show in Cancun.

Like no other club I've ever been too. We arranged our own transport and our taxi actually waited for us while we were at the club. We heard terrible things about the transport taking hours going around hotels dropping people off so decided against that. Amazing music, great show and good value for money. Wish I could remember more!

AMAZING!! YOU WONT SEE ANYTHING LIKE THIS ANYWHERE ELSE!. I visited Mexico January 2013, and visited Coco Bongos twice!!Even though the show was the same as the previous time I visited I still enjoyed it most amazing experience ever!! will be visiting again when I come back to Mexico!! Go VIP well worth the extra money!!You wont see anything like this anywhere else in the world! A must see!! :)

An experience like no other. Upon hearing about a nightclub that also features shows with super heroes, broadway musicals, and pops stars, I was a bit skeptical. But the combination of live action entertainment and club music actually works. All four of us had a great time and there was never a dull moment. The service was good, even though it was open bar, our waiter made sure that we always had a drink in our hand. We went to three nightclubs in Playa and this was our favorite.

A must see.. The show was great. The performers did an excellent job. It was very busy packed in pretty tight. The servers did a wonderful job. It was tough if you were not drinking as everyone else is. Lots of drinks spilling, very short skits and shot girls who won't leave the guys alone. Even with all of that said the show was so good that it was worth it. Ladies avoid the bathrooms as long as you can. Very challenging to get to and they seemed clean but the crowd was questionable.

THE ULTIMATE NIGHT OUT!. This night out comes HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! Do NOT visit Mexico without checking it out! An awe-inspiring combination of mini-shows and club night throughout the night to ensure you have the best possible evening. The shows are a mixture of celebrity and film tribute acts done very tastefully and cleverly and acrobatics on silks, hoops and poles - absolutely breathtaking! No expense spared here with - AMAZING night out! Go for the premium ticket as you won't have to worry about buying drinks. The staff are fantastic and won't let you go thirsty. We had advice to tip approx 50 pesos early on and another 100 at the end of the night and this stood us in good stead - unrivalled service bringing us our fave drinks and some cheeky extra shots, etc, never letting our glasses sit empty. This is only available in Mexico so make sure you go whilst you are there! ENJOY!

Great time with Friends!. Went to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen with a group of 9. Had a great time. If you have never been before it is a must do. Drinks and shots were never ending. Servers were full of fun and were always ready with next drink. Great Time!!!
Great evening. We booked the VIP area and enjoyed the whole evening, could do with more toilets but that was the only downside to a great evening.

Messy!. Did the Goldmember package booked through Thomsons, excellent night - tip the waiter a few peso's and he'll just keep pouring without you asking we got totally smashed I can only remember to around 2am!Small club but huge sound system great enteraintment sort of a miming variety show with some weird bits in it but we thought it was ace!

Beware The Banos. Worth checking out but find your own way there and back. The horror stories about transportation back and forth are true. 64US each with free drinks is awesome; shows are preemo but ... there's always a but lol ... if you can get close to a restroom. I only know of two in the whole place that is packed with people who, sooner or later, need to go. Do not try holding it back it will ruin the experience. Other than that; Coco your Bongo!

Best night out for years. Wonderful and memorable evening unlike any club I've ever visited. Get there early (queue up), get a VIP pass join in with everything and the next thing you know it is 3.30am. I can honestly say one of the best nights out I've ever done and the entertainment is spectacular (I did feel slightly less spectacular the following morning, but that was self inflicted!).

epic experience. We booked a standard ticket through our travel agent but once we were in resort we wanted to upgrade to gold package, which inc table chairs fast track entry n branded alcohol all night. Me (25) n my husband (35) went with another couple from our hotel (late 30, s) we all had an amazing time. A caberet show with a differenfe.The shows the music the effects were incredible.gotta rate it as one of the best nights ever, we had our own host/waiter between 3 couples and I'm sure the guys mission was just to get us all drunk as hell. We had shot after shot of tequila, buckets of ice cold beers for the guys, seriously this is one excursion not to b missed

WOW!!!!!. The best party, show and dancing that I have ever been too. Thanks to Sunwing travel agents for suggesting this.Any guessing about going? Just go and take in the experience, WOW great show and entertainment

Worth a visit!. Booked to go to Coco Bongos through our hotel Ocean Maya and the entertainments team. Cost was $64 US dollars each which included transport to and from......no queuing to get in......table and chairs for our party and all included drinks all night. All I can say is 2 out of 4 ain't bad!! Got there no problem but had to queue 3 times to actually get in. Our guide took us up 3 levels and as he went to leave I quizzed him about the promise of table and chairs. He then took us up another level where we got a bar stool and a ledge. Once it finished we waited over 45 minutes for our transport and got so fed up waiting we took a taxi back to our hotel. What I will say is the show is worth going for, however the drinks are so strong you can't drink them and there are only 2 toilets for all the boys AND girls!! Beware of the girls trying to give you shots......$5 dollars a pop but if you get from your server they are free. Glad I went and can say I've been however, the promises we were given never transpired and also took many people.....not enought toilets!!!!
Must do. Amazing show, we were sold the tickets at our resort, they run $65.00 each but the do have reduced prices for girls/women during the week
Nothing like I have ever seen before!!. Its much much more then a nightclub!! I have never been surprised by a nightclub before.... I would definately go there and watch the show, its so so good

Great experience -- time flew by. Get there early, opt for table service, and then sit back and watch the crowd filter in, feel the pounding beat, and enjoy the dancing. The show featured music relevant to 20-somethings as well as 40-somethings, and included trapeze acts, dancing, and celebrity impersonators that kept the entire crowd engaged. Between parts of the planned show, patrons danced on the bar (and a select few made it to the stage) -- and everyone in the house seemed to be having a raucous, great time.

A must see if you don't mind living on the edge. The performances are great although some were a bit outdated. There are 3 levels of standing room only balconies with very narrow stairs. If there was a fire I don't think everyone would make it out. The all inclusive alcohol was terrible but there is beer available.

A fun night, but very crowded. This is basically a huge nightclub with Vegas-style shows throughout the night. The shows are phenomenal - if you are in a section that you can actually see them. Be prepared to be squished in like sardines. When we were able to make it the dance floor, there was more room. THe service and security are very good, you are never without a server to assist you. And the shows themselves were just incredible!

UNREAL!!!. Best night ever! It was hot, sweaty, packed, noisy and the most incredible night of our 14 night stay in Playa! Shows were out of this world and the drinks were »FREE and awesome! If you want to have fun...GO!!!

really good night. we were a party of 6 ,it is a really good evening well worth the money .once you have paid its drinks all night .make sure you book a table and a waiter as its really busy,would be all full if you dont as everyone downs stairs are very tighty packed in .but we had waiter and table it was great ,coach there and back to our hotel,we were worried we would be bored but never had time to think that,it was 5 am allto soon ..ALSO the TOILETS are amazing

They were right, better than Vegas!. I visited Coco Bongo's as an excursion from my all inclusive. We payed for transportation and VIP service, and it was totally worth it! The show play from 11pm-3am, and it is spectacular! I couldn't turn my eyes away for a second! Its a Playa Del Carmen must in my opinion.

Better than Vegas? I was skeptical, but absolutely AGREE!!. We love Vegas. We love Vegas clubs. Excess, Haze, Pure, The Bank. All of them. All with table service. All have been incredible nights. Nothing like this though. The show started at 11:00 p.m. and went on without stoping until 3:00 a.m. and there was no way were leaving until it was over. If you are over 30 go the VIP route. Get yourself a table, tip your server (shout out to Aldo! The BEST) well and you won't want for anything all night. The regular admission is a sweaty wall-to-wall party, which looked like a blast but it's doubtful I would have lasted on my feet that long in heels. Speaking of heels, unlike Vegas, not neccessary. Definitely more casual which was refreshing. Confetti cannons, balloon drops, smoke, pyrotechnics, cirque-esque performances that span pop culture icons, bands and movies, a crazy good dj and a midget. It's dark, loud, tight quarters will be the BEST night of your vacation. We're 40 years old and wanted to keep going. Don't miss this. Seriously. Just go.

Crowded, weak drinks, huge risk of fire !!. When you have been to Vegas then this show is nothing like it. The show is all miming, the place needs a re vamp, only one toilet shared by men and women, fire exits only 1-2, you can upgrade to vip but people still shove and push you. If you are afraid of being closed in and especially if there is a fire then do not go here, inside is wood, could easily go up in smoke.Our friends went to the one in PDC, he said the drinks were thick and you couldn't swallow them, it was very hot. They said the show was ok but more like drag queens. If you are young and you are not bothered by the dangers then you will enjoy it, but being a little bit older my safety comes first.If you really do want vegas shows go to vegas, this is nothing like it.

Fantastic. Had a fantastic night at Coco Bongo. Not used to night club scene or such late nights.what an amazing evening though weren't sure if we'd be able to stay awake shouldn't have worried there was so much going on you didn't know where look. We upgraded to the gold which meant we upstairs looking down on what was happening or across to the stage. We'd previously read about the drinks not flowing even though they were in the gold price but we had no problem we had as many drinks as we needed. The show was absolutely and they all work so hard. The only down side was we got ripped off with taxi back to the hotel our fault as we were tired. We were amazed when he pulled in for fuel he got out and they filled it up with the engine running. Well worth going to.
Gotta Go VIP!. It's late at night and runs until the wee hours of the morning but completely worth it! You'll dance, sing, drink and really enjoy yourself!

Super fun time!. I was recently at Coco Bongo with my sister, cousin and his girlfriend and I have to admit it was a pretty surreal experience. Totally crazy! The music was awesome and the shows were beyond amazing! The acrobatics blew us away. The only thing that I would recommend to those who have not been before is that if you do not enjoy being squished against a wall and constantly bumped into, either arrive as early as possible or pay the extra money for the Gold Member Ticket. You get your own private section and are guaranteed seats which most people would probably enjoy a bit more! That was my only regret, but otherwise we had the time of our lives!

What a show!. We've been here three years in a row -- some parts of the show have stayed the same, others changed. This year we booked a trip through a representative who was at our resort. That was a big plus, as we had VIP seats. In the past we've never had a place to sit, just stood on the main floor. Our seats were up higher, and had a great view of the stage. A waiter kept bringing us drinks. The service was fantastic and so was the show!

Wow, What a Show!. My husband I recently visited Playa del Carmen during our stay we decided to go to Coco Bongo. We booked VIP (Gold Member) through our Apple representative at our resort. The cost was $120 USD/pp. which included transportation to and from Coco Bongo. I would highly recommend paying for VIP, because it gives you a place to sit and set down your drink. The show was well worth the money. We saw impersonations of Michael Jackson, Madonna, Rihanna, Usher, Superman, and the Mask just to name a few. The show started at 11:30 pm and ended around 3:15 am; between set changes it is a dance club. The wait staff is very friendly and the bathrooms are very clean (there is even an attendant in them). The only thing that my husband and I did not like is the shot girls. They would come around, blow a whistle and try to get you to take a shot. The shots are not included in the open bar and are $5 USD/shot. I wouldn’t have minded if they asked once, but every 10 minutes they were back and every time we turned them down. You think they would have remembered our faces and knew we weren’t interested. That aside, Coco Bongo is a definitely must do if visiting Playa del Carmen.

A Great Eclectic Mix. Great show a mix of nightclub, pop tribut bance ,cabaret theatre and acrobatics.Great service by attentive waiter staff, cockttails arrived without requesting them and were nice and strong.Worh getting there early (10.30p.m.) to secure best seats and paying for the drinks all inclusive. Also worth sorting own transport rather than being tied to a group bus- taxis outside waiting.Great mix of ages from teenagers to pensioners something for everybody.We left at 3.00 a.m. and still going strong.Had a fantastic time, couldnt recommend enough.
Best night out ever!. Went here valentines night with my husband, i am 30 and he's 28, we both had an amazing night. We had the gold band and loved every second we were there.
