Coco Bongo. If you want to have fun and be entertained, then COCO BONGO is a MUST SEE!!! Great shows. FREE shots!!! What more could i say. We all had a BLAST!!!!

I Heart Coco Bongo. If you are deciding whether or not to go, stop thinking and go!We booked our tickets in advance with Jozaphat. For $65 we got a ride to and from our hotel and a private table with a waiter and non-stop drinks. Once we got there, JJ was actually able to squeeze us into VIP so we each got a bar stool along the top row. While the guests are mostly mid-20s, the experience caters to any age (ie. our group ranged from 28-55.)The show itself is unreal. So much going on that it is utterly impossible to get bored. MJ, Usher, Katy Perry, Rolling Stones, Moulin Rouge, Rhianna, Madonna, Elvis and tonnnnnnes more. Although others have mentioned the safety factor, I wouldn't let that deter you unless you are very claustrophobic - that might be an issue for you.As for the service, as long as you tip your waiter, you will not have to wait for drinks. I would also highly recommend that you book through someone who works for Coco Bongo. Jozaphat stayed with us the entire night from the time he picked us up at the hotel until we left the bar. He made sure that we were taken care of and were enjoying our night - I've never experienced this kind of service before. I would imagine that without him and Victor (our resort 'babysitter' - as he referred to himself haha) our night may not have been quite as enjoyable.To summarize, if you are able to get there, absolutely do it - make sure you are rested, get yourself a host (Jozaphat if you can!) and make sure you have comfortable shoes :)

Over rated rip off. Packed in.like sardines. Even the vip tickets are a rip off. Squashed into a small seat that then gets surrounded by people standing. Dated videos and poor mime acts. Health and safety non existant. Stayed 1.5 hours and then had to fight way to get out. Expected a comfortable cabaret club and got a basic room aimed at squashing in as many 18-25s as possible who just want to drink and dance but do not consider the safety issues or surroundings. nothing pleasant about myexperience at all.

Coco Bongo is a must!. You see all the ads and hear all the tour guides talking about it but then the price turns you off. Let me tell you whatever you pay is very much worth it! You can get a better deal if you purchase in advance through the promoters that are roaming your resort and sometimes on very slow nights, Sundays it's even better. I've never been to such a fun place, they offer you free shots left and right when you walk in and the shows are phenomenal. If you have the money for only one thing to do, choose Coco Bongo!

Stunningly amazing night, Awesome !!!!!!!!!!!!. From start to finish a totally amazing night. We went VIP and after giving the waiter a good tip first round of drinks he provided non stop refreshments all night. The show was absolutely amazing and the most spectacular night I have ever been to. The whole atmosphere of the place was fantastic and I would recommend it to anyone who likes music and dance shows. Just one tip pay the extra for VIP as it did look jam packed in other areas and with VIP you even get escorted to the toilets and smoking areas for the smokers, Fabulous night out and not to be missed.

The amazing coco bongo's. You have to go to Coco Bongo's, it is an amazing show, well worth the money, upgrade to VIP, you are treated very well, as soon as your drink is half empty that staff bring you a new one. There is something for everyone in the show.

Vegas on Steroids!. Greatest show ever!Coco Bongo in playa del carmen was my second time to this incredible show. Cancun was my first. It really is a great great great time!! We were in the mayan riviera for a wedding and I had my work cut out for me to convince all the age groups that it was a great show more so past the bar/nightclub they thought it would be. Yes, there's that also! We paid $65 each to have the "direct bus" (only stopped at our hotel and two others) with regular floor standing.If you know you're going to be standing wear something more comfortable than 5inch heels. Couple pointers for females- The middle bar on the floor in front of the stage offers women to dance on it- as the night goes on they put rails up so you dont fall on the bartenders. It does get hot in there but they send out gusts of cold winds and LOTS of oxygen gets pumped in all night long. If you plan to dance on the bar DO NOT wear a super flowy dress. It will end up around your neck! The bathrooms are great! They have cup holders inside the stall so you never have to leave your drink unattended! And the show is AMAZING!! Doesn't matter where you sit or stand, you can see it all!

Fun, entertaining, amazing. There are already so many comments about this place, nothing much to put on. Though it is loud, it is croweded and it is hard to fight his was to the exit. Bsodes that... If you like to have a once in a lifetime night club experience you should not wait for next time with this activity.Great dancers, it is an amzing show, drinks are all inclusive, there is a smokers terrace, and for the ones who do not want to wait in line, well come at 11.30 when the show is starting. And you won't find any line anymore. You normally do not remeber the shows anyway unless you see the picturess the day after.have fun!

Awesome night!. Booked via Thomson with a gold member ticket. Rep advised to get there at 2230 to get good seats. Glad we took her advice and got a nice table near the stage. Waiter service was good and he kept topping up your drinks. Show was amazing and you couldn't help but dance along. After the show finished the music changed and was not as good but it was already 3am by then so we were ready for bed! Went midweek which was recommend as the weekend is even more packed and not sure we would've enjoyed it anymore busy. Great night!

Amazing Night - Defo go VIP. Went here on the VIP package which is that you get your own area high up and off the side of the stage. You also get waiter service and drinks included and defo recommend it as the floor and bars are crazy stuffed when you look down and think you would have to wait ages to get served.Tell your waiter also that you want a bucket for your beers, as that way he brings a bucket of ice and puts your beers into them and you dont have to wait it is cool. The show itself was amazing and soooooooo crazy. From Beetlejuice, Beyonce, Michael Jackson, Elvis, Britney Spears, to Spider Man v Goblin fights and so many other artists jsut cant recall them all, it is just the best show ever and sooooo worth the money. One of best excursions we did when on honeymoon in Cancun and defo recommend it.

Crowded. Our hotel arranged our trip for us to arrive at 11. At this time we had a long wait to get in and once in you couldn't even breath little alone walk. Everyone was pushing their way through, elbowing you, no where to even stand and watch the show. If there was a fire or emergency of some sort no one would have been able to get out, very poorly set up. We were told we would have free liquor service, which would be nice, but it was so busy we didn't even get served. Only place we could find to stand was in an emergency exit. Not a good night, we all paid for our bus to take us back early.
WOW!. This was the most fun my husband and I have ever had. We did not really know what we were getting into, but we are sure glad we went. It was an amazing time!

Best club/bar!. I have been to Mexico four times, and Coco Bongo twice! And both times have been AMAZING! Absolutely loved it! Even went with my mum and dad who are in there late forties and they utterly enjoyed it. First time we were on one of the upper floors and the second time we were on the ground floor. Waiter who served us, was very nice not rude at all and got the drinks you wanted right away, yes it is really busy, but what do you expect? Its a club. If you are going to Mexico then I think you should definitely visit here!

Too loud!. This club is disrespectful to the people in the surrounding area. There is no need to blare music that can be heard from blocks away keeping those in the surrounding area awake until 6am.They are also really expensive you can buy a lot of drinks at other bars for what they charge.Don't support this business that deems it necessary to have music this loud!

A Great Night. When we first showed up and saw the 2 block long line, we instantly assumed we weren’t getting in and where discussing how we would be getting our money back. After only about 20 minutes, we were in with a drink in hand!!The place was very well kept. Everywhere you looked, someone was cleaning up. There was even a woman in the bathroom cleaning each stall after someone used it! Men were sweeping the floors the whole time. My only complaint was it was a bit overcrowded for even my liking; however we were always able to get a drink and get to the washroom. After a few hours the crowd thinned out and it was fine. Keep in mind we also went on a Friday night. We enjoyed it and had we gone sooner in our vacation, we probably would have gone back a second time.

BEST SHOW!. Coco Bongo's was an experience my Husband and I will never forget! We loved everything about it. We highly recommend that you book a VIP package where you get a table to sit at. It's a long show to stand through, and it gets very crowded on the floor!

Coco Bongo was the best club ever.. Our guide, Addai, told us about Coco Bongo and everything he said was try. We partied so hard that I'll definitely go back. Thank you Addai for a wonderful experience and making my best friends 40th Birthday the best.

Death Trap. We really wanted to experience a great time for my husband's 40th birthday celebration but the Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen was a complete disappointment and we had to leave after 15 minutes. First, our tour guide from the Barcelo Maya Beach Hotel assured us that the LONGEST LINE we ever stood in would only take 5 (Mexican) minutes as we were in the "express line" - this actually took more than 30 minutes. Once in side you were handed a cranberry and vodka to endure the remaining line up to security check which took another 15 minutes or so. The perfect way to describe the process would be how farm animals are corralled into a small space. Once inside, the place is so packed that you can't move and everyone is pushing you one way or the other. We tried to move up to another level only to be blocked by security who didn't tell us that it was a VIP area, he just stood in our way as we tried to pass him until he yelled at us and finally told us that it was a VIP area. Then we tried to go up another set of stairs to find some room to breath, only to be ushered back down by security since that area was too full. The only place we could stand was on the main level which was so jam packed that you barely lift your arm to take a sip of your now warm drink, never mind trying to order a second one for the "all inclusive" option we paid for. The place made us all feel unsafe because if there was ever a fire, the place would burn down with many people in it. We would never be allowed that many people into an establishment in Canada. We paid $70 USD per person for one drink and 15 minutes of show before the four of us left because we couldn't even see the stage and had to pay our own way back to the hotel for another $23 since our bus wasn't leaving until 2:00 a.m. This might be a fun place for 18 year olds that enjoy crowded places for partying but for anyone else, forget it! The Coco Bongo reps at the hotel should be explaining what to expect so people can choose if they are okay with feeling like cattle or not. I've heard that the Cancun location is bigger and it might be better but we made sure to tell anyone thinking about the Playa del Carmen one to save their money and time. When I told the Coco Bongo staff at the hotel about our experience, all they could say was "sorry". No offer of a discount or our money back so we just chalked it up to our annual Mexico rip off - last year it was a Cozumel excursion that I never got around to writing about. If you want to do something really fun, go to Xplor Adventure Park. We've been there twice and would go again!

Ridiculously awful experience!!!. We went with high expectations and looking forward to a great night. After the long line up, which wasn't too bad, we still were looking forward to getting in. They had pre-poured drinks available at a few stops once inside heading towards the party, which was a relief cause we had waited over an hour to get in. However once inside there was nowhere to stand. We did have an employee lead us up a few levels promising a better view, but once up there, there was nowhere to go. The show started and none of us could see a thing (8 people), you couldn't even rest and just drink in one spot cause you were constantly getting whistled at to get out of the way by the waiters or being shoved by other customers. I also started to get nervous about a fire, or something happening that would require evacuation, cause there were so many people packed into this vertical space on every level and no exits! It was monumentally disappointing, cause my husband and I paid over 100 dollars to go and we desperately wanted to leave after an hour. We took a cab back to our resort with another couple in our group. A lot of people did this and it thinned out the crowd, so for our friends that stayed, they actually got a view after a few hours and enjoyed the remainder of the show. I feel like it was such a waste of money, a stupid spectacle, and a deliberate money grab. Don't waste your money!

Save your money and your time!. I will give CoCo Bongo this: The shows were great! They were well put together and enjoyable!HOWEVER! I will never go to another CoCo Bongo ever, ever again. Here are some reasons why:1. Someone had already mentioned this but, you are packed in there, shoulder to shoulder, face to your neighbors armpit. They keep shoving people in there until there is no breathing room left. You have to practically body surf to get to the bathroom, and while doing so, my purse was grabbed at twice - luckily it was zipped and draped over my shoulder! You are so packed in there that if a fire were to break out, you better hope you're at a table close to the exit or that is your death sentence. There is ONE exit to this place, it's set up terrible.2. The waiters will just bring you whatever drinks they can get on their tray and they will ASK you for tips even if you've already tipped the time before! All of the above complaints could be actually looked over for me, because hey, I was in college, I've been in college, I've been in packed bars, with bad drinks, however, my 3rd and biggest complaint will keep us from ever visiting a CoCo bongo again, I will be sure to make sure all our friends and family will never visit any of these establishments again.I went to CoCo Bongo with my Husband, and another couple, who happen to be gay and another friendl, so the 5 of us. We had a nice table close to the bar and in front of the stage for the shows. About 2:30am, 4 security guards walked up to our table with a flashlight, flashed it at my three friends and said they needed to go with them. After lots of confused looks around each other, I urged them to go with them and my husband and I followed after. Luckily our one friend spoke fluent Spanish and was able to try and talk to the guards, who at this point, 7 of them surrounded our group of 5 (the most non-violent group you could have!) It was first believed that we were kicked out because one of my friends appeared to be sleeping (impossible as we were all standing) or too drunk because we asked for bottles of water (so did the surrounding groups). Finally, after we physically left the building and were outside, our friend fought them enough and found that we were indeed kicked out because our friends are gay and were dancing. They claimed to be a "family" environment and that someone complained about their dancing - mind you, let me please be clear they were doing no more than dancing side to side to the music. How is the fact that they're gay and their dancing was any more "offensive" than the girls in short dresses and skirts dancing on the bar, or, oh wait, the girls they have dancing up on the stage and them blowing AIR up their skirts?! They discriminated against my friends and I urge you all to think twice before visiting this club!

A must do.. Well where do I start, this place is non stop from the doors opening at 10.30pm untill 3am. We were a group of 50-ishes and believe me this is not our normal night out, but I would recommend anyone to go, its great fun, go as a vip and your above the crowd, the show is really good please go.Our First choice rep Jason gave us great advice on how to get the best from the night, it was brilliant.

Entertaining show. Interesting and entertaining show worth a visit if you are staying in the area.The official website gives you a good description of what to expect and the current content in the show. Basically alot of imitators (Elvis, lady gaga), dancers etc.We bought the standard entrance tickets, came in early and talked to a waiter that provided us with seats on the middle floor with good overview of the place.The show is for 2-3 hrs and the drinks are good, somewhat strong. After the show the place turns in to a club with good music.

Better the second time. We visited Coco Bongoo twice in January. The first time the ticket sales guy at our hotel guaranteed us a great view, private area & table etc but didnt deliver. We were on the floor right next to the entrance. As others have noted they really pack the people in and its shoulder to shoulder. If you're by the door, you cant see much once they let people start dancing on the bar. Our second time, a week later, was much better. The fellow selling tickets was part of the hotels entertainment crew. We let him know we wanted to go but would hold him accountable for our seating (or standing position). This time we were on the second floor looking down at the floor and directly across from the stage. Alex came through and we were able to enjoy the show.The show itself was very loud and fairly long. It's a lot of dancing & lip sync to music videos with dancers sometimes suspened by cables or performing acrobatics somewhat similar to Cirque du Soliel. Overall very entertaining.  My tip is only buy tickets from someone you can hold accountable for your seating. Otherwise you'll be stuck on floor grinding & wreething with a mass of people - unless thats your thing of course!

Not all that!. When we went to coco bongo we had high expectations after reading the reviews. However, we were very disappointed once we got there. We had priority tickets however had to join a long queue, the drinks they had I had not heard of and the place was so busy it was difficult to see what was going on. We were also paranoid about how to get out of the bar if something happened, as there only seemed to be exits on the ground floor. This is even more of a concern since the fire in Brazil. Needless to say we made quite a swift exit. We have since heard that the one in Cancun is much bigger and better, so if you fancy it, I would try and go to the Cancun one.

Best Bar I've been to. Amazing energy thru the night, 3 hours flew by so fast. Not sure what I was expecting going into the night but was blown-away! Best bar / show I have ever been to. With the recent tragedy in Brazil, I do have to comment that there was only one exit - and the bar was very crowded.Over-all great night!

OVER RATED. I may be the one pessimist in this whole thing, but i thought it was over crowded and not really worth the money. basically it was what people did as kids... learn the choreography of music videos... but with really really loud music! lol. there was no singing and the dancers were actually off sync for every number. i can see why some people would like it? but it was not for me who would rather see the real thing or expects to see a real show... would have been the same if they just had a big movie screen playing... again, way way too crowded and not worth my money, should have stayed at the resort.

amazing !. This place is great ! the vibe is the best ! the shows and the dancers are more than beautiful ! we danced all night and didn't want to leave !! batman , spiderman , lady gaga , katy perry , full of great surprises !

Nightclub disaster in Brazil, a definite possibility at Cocobongo's. I wrote a review almost a year ago about the danger of Cocobongo's. The disaster in Brazil is making it imperative for me to comment again. The Playa nightclub is a 5 story wood shanty, overcrowded with patrons. It would be the exact same scenario as the disaster in Brazil. Cocobongo's oversells tickets for the space provided and there are only 2 exits for hundreds of patrons. It was a nightmare trying to get out of the club when there was no fire. In the U.S. this place would not be allowed to operate. My heart goes out to those in Brazil who were injured and those who have lost loved ones. If you want that kind of show, Vegas is a much safer bet.
BEST NIGHT EVER!. Shows were awesome, out of this world, and the drinks were free. Totally worth every penny. So good we went twice!
Weird but good. Very busy and quite pricy but you have to go just to say you have been! Was a fun night. Everyone is in such a good spirit and even the workers seem to really enjoy themselves.
Great time. Give a good tip and you will always have a drink without ordering. The shows were very entertaining and well done. They know how to provide a great show.
Amazing. This show has everything and more, had such a great night although it was soooooo busy i was scared to go to the toilet in case I lost my boyfriend.

Overhyped. This is really way over rated and hyped. It is alright to see once, but if you are expecting a Vegas style show, this is not it. It is more of a night club for drunk 20 year olds. It has a bit of characters swinging around on bungie type cords, but that is a small part of the show. Most of it is dancers or music video screen projection and lip sync singing. Not much different than shows at resort. Also audience (young girls in short skirts) dancing on stage and girls getting their skirts shot up by an air blast. Service for drinks was surprisingly good, but whistle blowing in ear every five minutes for $ shots was annoying. If you are not in front row on one of the upper levels you will not have a good view of main floor. We had to stand for the entire show from 11:30 until 3:30. Maybe have an earlier show some nights? Mixed washrooms with 2 stalls and lots of drunks was really gross.

Coco Bongo Sales Reps in the Barcelo Colonial Resort. 4 of us staing at the Barcelo Colonial Resort January 13,2013 got the tickets for the Playa del Carmen Coco Bongo Show through the reps walking around the resort. Jorge, Alejandro and Juan Pablo were very friendly and profesional. We were picked up at the resort and returned back safely in the morning hrs. no problem whatsoever!A Coco Bongo show is one you must to see at least once in your live time folks!!!!

Best party I've been to...hands down!!. This place absolutely blew my mind! Went with my hubby and three other couples we met at our resort so we were a little bit of a group which I think is the only way to go. Apparently Saturdays are the best days to go (accordig to reps) however, we went on a Friday. Paid $55 through Sunwing for the basic ticket which includes drinks, transportation, and admission on the main floor. I'd have to say being on the floor was the most live BUT it was at times extremely crowded...like rubbing up against the four people on each or your sides. Sort of gross at times but it is what it is at this place. Our bus picked us up at 10:30 for about a 15-20 minute drive from the Princess resort. Got dropped off at the local bus terminal at which point the entire bus gets off and walks through the streets (a tad scary...but I guess safe) for about 3 blocks. Your tour rep is with you at this point so its not so bad. When you get there you'll know it. There is a HUGE Covo Bongo sign, police cars parked everywhere and just hoards of people standing around the place. There was no line up. Our rep took us directly into the place, got our wristbands for us and walked us right up to our 'area' on the floor.Once in there, no way you cannot be impressed. The place is like a stadium with levels of standing areas and a huge stage which is elevated. Shows are amazing. Just amazing. Effects are awesome. Flashing lights, blowing air (like hair flies back kind of pressure), confetti and even glow sticks being tossed out into the crowd and oversized balloons from the ceiling. Just amazing.Safety tips: Go to the bathroom in packs. Watch your drinks. If you put it down, don't pick it back up. Drinks are free for goodness sake. Just get another one from the bar. We heard of some guy putting things in some drinks. Didn't see it ourselves and don't know what exactly he was doing but either way.... Dance on the bar if you can. Go up on stage and dance for the place. Probably experiences you will not ever forget. We left at 3:15 which is when we were told to meet at the front. Our rep was there but just told us to make out way back to the bus...on our own. This may not be the safest idea considering people are super drunk at this point and may not know their way back to the bus so I think this is when going as a group helps...someone always sober enough to know what's going on. Common sense stuff. Made it safely back to our resort by around 3:45-4 ish and completely buzzing with excitement still.Would I go again? Absolutely!!

Wow. We just spent an amazing night/very early morning with two couples from our resort, at Coco Bongo! We travelled by mini bus from our resort 30 mins away having independently bought tickets at Coco Bongo three days earlier. There doesnt seem to be any variation of price if you buy from rep or direct. What an experience. Recommend getting gold tickets if you aren't in to mosh pits! Fantastic show and really keeps you entertained throughout. All adult age groups catered for regarding music, from 50's right through to today's rap (an awful lot of that inbetween show stopping stage action) but for the most part highly enjoyable and watching the youngsters having a great time. Would recommend it to anyone as you will never experience anything like it!
brilliant show. loved the evening and show only downfall was we couldnt stay all night cause we were staying an hours drive away,

Coco bongo Playa del Carmen. We heard from some friends about coco bongo and they were right. It's a wonderful amazing place. The pick you up at the hotel at 10 pm and take you back at 3.30 am. The shows are excellent and you have free drinks all night. It's a must when you are at Playa del Carme. The quinta (fifth) avenida and 10 street are really nice place to shop and you find all kind of stuff overther. Nice weeke at the Riviera Maya.

Amazing- best nightclub ever!. We went for the full VIP all inclusive package booked through our travel rep- First Choice. This included seats on the top floor and drinks all night. We had a brilliant time, never been in an atmosphere like it, it was amazing. The shows are fab and show stopping, the music is great and it's a fab night out. We rolled in at 5.15am so a long one but truly amazing. Highly recommended.

Amazing Show BUT UNSAFE PLACE. Firstly what amazing performances they have put on here!!!We did a package with a Thomas Cook rep and we are so glad we did... here are the reasons.-It cost about 60$ All inclusive drinks transport and entry all night-The reps jumped in when locals kept pestering us to buy drugs!!!-We felt safe with them being there-We had our own balcony...The last point was the main reason we are thankful we had a rep... We entered with our wristbands and was hit by the heat and sweatyness of the place! When i say people are packed in here like sardines i am not joking. Health & Safety in the UK would have had a field day. This was disgustingly crammed. You could barely squeeze through people as they were squashed against the next person!.Eventually after climbing over fallen people we went upstairs to our balcony. This was such a relief as there was just a few of us up here and had a fantastic view of the stage!. Our own toilet and bar service.The waiters were top notch, drinks were filled at all times and i have never seen service like it when a drink was spilled. They were moping, drying and polishing! Amazing.The show is fantastic but we were scared to go back into the sardines and leave. The sight at people getting crushed on the floor was enough to scare us away.An amazing experience and definately worth if ONLY IF YOU THOMAS COOK IT!!!!!

If you want entertainment this is not to be missed!. It was definitely a highlight during our one week vacation. We booked through the hotel and they sent an escort with us as we were all ladies travelling together. It had the factors of a Vegas show, Circus Soliel, Dick Clark dance band, and Coyote Ugly. We had an amazing time and would think that is is something you should not miss the experience. Truly entertaining.

Spectacular!!!. Visited Coco Bongo in Playa on 11th Jan 2013. Must say, it was the best clubbing experience of my life, maybe because I had never seen anything like this before. The best part about Coco Bongo was the live shows which will blow you away, one after another. Madonna, Elvis, Gaga, LMFAO, Spiderman, Batman......and it goes on all night!! You keep getting entertained every second you spend there. We paid $30 each which got us a drink too, you can get an open bar ticket if you are a drinker, but drink or not drink, it's worth every penny. The only thing, and it's a minor put off, was the fact that it gets too crowded. But the celebrations presented before shadow that flaw by a mile. Must visit!
MUST DO!. Booked through our hotel and went with the staff and other guests. What a time!! Would do this over and over.

Be prepared. Just came back from Riviera Maya and visited Coco Bongo on Tuesday. We read the trip advisor before we booked to decide what package we wanted and opted for the basic, stand up and dance all night ticket....we chose right, what a place!! If your not into clubs, dancing and generally getting full on for 4 hours then choose the Gold or VIP package where you get seated on the first or second tear with a table. Our basic package suited us be be prepared to got for it from the moment it kicks off till the lights come on. We had our own waiter as we went with the crew from our hotel, the drinks came slow for the first 45mins - 60mins and then decided to part with some tip money...40 pescos which was around £2.40 and the drinks kept coming. All night I probably spent no more than £10 in tips which seems alot for a night out but you wont have to move from your dance spot, every time the waiter sees your glass empteing he's put another one in your hand. he even escorted the wife to the toilet as it on the other side of the small floor but without his help would have took her 20 mins and he gave us a bottle of water each when the lights went on at the end of the night to take away. Well worth the experienc.

Amazing. I don't like clubs and I don't party, but I decided to give this place a shot. After all, it was my first time in Mexico and I had an open mind. I was blown away. I felt like I was in Vegas. Not only were the shows very well rehearsed and performed, the music was great and for the first time, I found myself enjoying the environment and really having a great time!The crowd was mostly tourists and youngsters who were getting drunk and being slutty, but that's typical of clubs. Otherwise, the performances were very impressive and they had a variety of performances from James Bond, the musical Chicago to Michael Jackson and Lady Gaga. A great variety and I guarantee you will find it enjoyable.
Oh man..... The best show in playa del carmen, the most beautiful mexican senoritas, we got a deal with a girl friend and we had the VIP section.
Brilliant Night. Fabulous night club, atmosphere exceptional, gold member tickets well worth the expense. Shows were non stop all night and had a terrific night.

Good time but watch your purse!!. We decided to venture out on one of our last nights in Playa, and from all the promoters running rampant in our resort, we felt Coco Bongo was the place to check out. The bus picked us up from our resort at 11:30 and we headed to the nightclub. When we arrived, we were escorted to the "VIP section" - some cocktail table that accommodated a couple of drinks and maybe 3 people to stand around. Nowhere to sit, even though we paid premium price to be there. The show started, and yes - it was spectacular. Like nothing you'd find at home. It went from the show, to a full dance club experience. The waiters would guide you up onto the bar, and you'd dance and have a great time. The entertainment was amazing - from full cabaret to Cirque du Soleil type of air acrobatics. Just stunning. Around 3am - right when patrons are good and drunk - is when you get taken advantage of. I don't know whether it was the wait staff or locals hanging around for an easy target, but my purse got swiped right from under my nose. Yes, I'm the idiot for not holding on to it, and it can happen anywhere. But when we called the next day, all they had in the lost and found was a belt. Seriously?? When have you ever gone to a club - or even a restaurant for that matter - where the only thing in the lost and found was a measly belt. Clearly if it WAS turned in, the staff had their pick and choose of what they got to take home for the night. Anyway, it was a great experience overall I guess, but just be VERY careful and keep a watchful eye. Mexico is clearly corrupt - it doesn't take a genius to figure that out - so watch your possessions, watch your back and be wary of the shooter girls pouring booze down your throat.

its worth a visit. when you get to go here i would pay for the vip ticket as you dont have to wait with everyone else there is a vip entrance around the side we saw the mask lady gaga beetle juice spiderman and many other things the girls come around blowing whistles and selling cheap vodka and shots for 60 paseo

Brilliant night. 2 Adults in VIP section and two 18 year olds in regular section.This was an amazing night for all of us. The service,shows,music, drinks and atmosphere were out of this world.We all had a fantastic time and would definitely return. Though we probably wouldn't go VIP next time.

The best night club ever!. If you are planning to go to Cancun or Playa Del Carmen, don't miss out Coco Bongo.You'll be amazed of how good is everything with open bar, excellent performances, music and videos.It's like to mix LIV with Broadway.
Amazing night out. Don't know where to begin! Simply an amazing show and a great night out. This club is suitable for all ages!
Rockin' New Years Eve 2013. Fantastic time! Great entertainment! Kenia looked after us personally and delivered everything she promised... a class act all the way!
Superb. If you cant enjoy yourself in coco bomgo then you really do need a reality check. Place was buzzin from 11.30 Right through till 3.30. Great night. Do not miss.

Incredible nightclub experience. On our recent trip to Mexico, we went to Coco Bongo twice. The first time we were on the floor, packed liked sardines, but the party atmosphere was the best. The show from the floor was at times hard to see, but being right in the middle of the show and action was amazing. The acrobats and performers were close enough to touch, and flying right over our heads at times. The second time we paid the extra charge, and got seated on the second level. The view was better to see the show, but it lacked the nightclub party feel a little bit. We were amazed at the staff and security. Everything ran like a well oiled machine. The dancers are beautiful and the performers are very talented. The bathrooms had attendants. They were clean and safe. We were given shots before even entering the door, and were never without a drink. Even after partying all night long, we never felt tired. They continually pump in cool fresh air, so it was always a pleasant temperature. It is like the best nightclub experience, dance party, and cirque du soleil all mixed together. If you are planning a trip to Cancun or Playa del carmen, you have to include Coco Bongo. If you didn't, it would be like going to Toronto and not seeing Niagra Falls.

AMAZING!. Full of fun and energy, got a great deal and would go again tomorrow! I'm not a big club lover but this was a totally different experience. So many different artists, just loved it! If you can stand on the top balcony not down below as you get a better view and you're less cramped.

Fantastic!. We had such a good time here! This club is so well organised and the atmosphere they create is brilliant. Our waiter was great, before we finished a drink he would appear with another and the toilets were so clean, not something you expected to find at the end of a night in a club. Show was great fun and everyone was so friendly, this is the way to run a club! Go you will LOVE it!

Amazing experience. Coco Bongo is by far one of the best nightclubs in the world! It beats anything in Vegas and NYC. As soon as you walk in their handing you shots and drinks before you even go through security....what club does that? The vibe and energy is awesome and the lights, music , and special effects are unreal. We bought our tickets through our hotel and I highly recommend that because they put you in a VIP section with your own personal waiter. The ticket price includes all you can drink. We went their with 15 friends and everybody had an amazing time. It's a must see words cannot explain how talented the performers are and how awesome everything is in there!

Great time!. We paid the extra for the VIP seats and would do the same again in the future. It was around $100 per person but included seats with a straight view to the show, and open bar including top shelf alcohol and a seperate washroom from the rest of the club. You couldn't get show tickets and drink all night for that price in Canada so based on that we didn't think it was overpriced for the experience. The show itself was awesome, with a great variety of music from Meatloaf to Lady Gaga.

Very fun, very very busy. Was an awesome show, very busy, great atmosphere, don't go much on the all included drinks, (very cheap and nasty !) however show was fabulous and was super tired in the morning (which is always a good sign!)

Great Night Out. We went with a member of the entertainment staff from our hotel and had a small private area. Six of us went and we are all in our early 50's and everyone agreed that it was a blast. We had expected to leave early but stayed till the end of the show at 3:30.We paid $65 which included, transport, drinks and entrance and for the fun was excellent value.
Great fun!. Great night out! We had VIp tickets which were pricey but worth it as you get to sit down with your own area and drinks are brought to your table! Brilliant night out!

AMAZING!. This place was unreal! First when we got there and they were packing us in like sardines my friends and I were all a little disgusted but once the show started and the drinks started flowing we were all having a blast. I wuld reccomend this place to anyone. This is definatly a reason to return to Mexico, word cannot describe how amazing this place is for a music/musical show lover.
Very Crowded. Coco Bongo was extremely crowded and the show was just ok. Many people enjoyed themselves though, just wasn't my cup of tea

Coco Bongo ... what a night!!!. I can barely describe how incredible this place is. Coco Bongo reminds me of New Years every 15 minutes. It's a disco with a Cirque du Soleil feel. You can dance on the bar, watch the shows above you where you swear you've just seen Madonna, Usher, Michael Jackson, Elvis and a whole lot more. At the end of each 'act' there is flying confetti, balloons and flashing lights. While you're dancing to the music, you have people flying above you on a trapeze. It truly is an experience of a life time and I can tell you unequivically, if you haven't been to Coco Bongo, you haven't experienced one of the most spectacular evenings out ever!!!

Night Show. We were not sure what to expect, but the show did NOT disappoint. When you do book, pay the extra money and get a reserved table on the lower levels, well worth it. We did not, but were not overall disappointed. The music, the show and the people really know how to rock the place. Definite a young crowd, the great for all ages. A gentleman in his 60's made it on the stage and was the highlight of the mid entertainment.

Bear Pit For those with a short attention span.. It's owned by Jim Carey allegedly, it plays heavily on the mask theme. It is rammed full of people and the show is a constant trail of sound bite entertainment. It's not special all the acts are look alike not the real thing as the posters might imply. If you have a short attention span, don't mind tinnitus are and exhibitionist and like to get covered in split beer and booze it's just the place for you. But it's and 80's pastish at best.

A great night out even if you're not a huge partier. This is definitely worth doing on a trip to Playa... We don't drink or party that much but this was a definite experience. They literally bombard you with cocktails and shots from the minute you get in the door and there will be LOTS of young people getting their drink on but you can enjoy it even if you're not just looking to get sloshed. I think we stayed for almost three hours and left before the show was really finished (1:30 or 2am) but the energy and entertainment was outstanding! Line up early if you're not getting a VIP table to get a good place to stand. You may not get the full attention of the wait staff if you're not buying a bottle but like I said, if you're not just trying to get your money's worth in alcohol and just use your time to enjoy the show and bop around in between the skits you will NOT regret it! I totally wish they had something like this in the states. What a great night out, even for us old fogies. ;)

You obviously need to pay for more than VIP or go on a quiet night. We were a group of 20 .Tickets were bought at our resort & were not cheap at $60 each. We went on a Friday. We lined up at 11.00 in a "VIP" line & got our armbands. Finally let in at 11.45 pm .We were guided up several sets of stairs to the top balcony. Here we stood leaning on a rail about 4" wide, just wide enough to put a drink on. I've had more room at soccer matches in the UK in the old days when we had to stand in terraces. You had to twist & move slowly to pick up a drink, it was that tight for room.Drinks were included ,the caveat being the waiter could hardly get through the crush of people on the stairs ,no matter what we tipped him. We had to stand at a slight angle because the crush of people was so intense .Then they let even more people in to stand behind us .These seemed like locals who paid less.The show is spectacular & equivalent to cirque soleil . However our misery was compounded by watching the people below us & on the floor having fun, dancing & drinking at their tables.Like many who gave poor reviews we looked for fire exists , but these seemed to be the way we came in. Its no smoking, but way up at top & back locals were ignoring this & lighting up. The place was obviously way over capacity After 90 minutes we left & found a nice bar with live music.My suggestion is to some research , go on a quieter night & pay more for VIP gold , super enhanced ,whatever they call it to get a table , elbow room & a chance of getting out alive if there is a fire.

Fantastic night out. We bought the VIP all-inclusive tickets. We had a great table overlooking the stage and the show was brilliant. The atmosphere was electric. We could so do with something like this in London! We staggered back to our hotel about 3.30am (not entirely sure about the time given our waiter was very studious about refilling our drinks as soon as they looked low!). Great fun.

Amazing night. You have to go here to experience for yourself but is really worth every penny! Would say was not what I thought it would be it was much much more, we paid for the VIP seats but if you don't have these you wouldn't be missing out. Drinks are all included really worth it and waiter would never leave us with an empty glass. Amazing entertainment they need a night like this in London I would go every week!

great but could be better. Excellent show but we didn't find the staff especially friendly. We took the VIP package that included seats and drinks. View was not great from our seats and the drinks appeared to be heavily diluted. Glad that we went but only average value for money.

GREAT NIGHT IN PLAYA DEL CARMEN. An absolute MUST if you're staying in Playa Del Carmen. Don't bother getting a VIP table or anything because it's really not needed. We bought tickets right at the door around 10:15-10:30pm. We went on a Tuesday night. Something tells me it doesn't matter what night you go...this place is always busy. We paid 750pesos each to get in. Get there a little early because the line gets pretty big. My only recommendation would be find a waiter and tell him that you will tip him well if he takes care of you. I tipped him maybe $10US the whole night and had great service! Drinks kept coming and coming all night long. Once you're in drinks are included, but that little bit of extra money makes your evening much more enjoyable. If you can stay on the main floor near the bar and sit up on the stairs on the either the left or right side of the main bar. Great view, lots to see, great music and just an overall really fun night. All ages will have a good time. You can dance if you want to, but it's really more about the great show that they put on. I saw 18-19 year old, up to 50-60 year olds. Everyone was smiling and having a great time!!!

Its not worth the money!!!!. VIP means standing, no chairs and packed as if you are in a can of sardines. We were sold VIP passes, told we would have our own section with tables and service. We had a mini bar table, no chairs, no service, it was horrible. There was 13 of us and we all left within five minutes, requested our money back. We spent $780 US in total and received nothing. What a waste of time and money, We purchased this farse at Viva Wyndham Maya and are very upset that we wasted our time and threw away our money to these thieves!!! Thanks for nothing,. I have never seen a place like it, If there was ever a fire in the place, people will never have the chance to escape. Pretty scary. Shame on you Coco Bongo for the lack of service and false advertising.
So much fun. I've never experienced anything like it, definitely worth it! The energy is unbelievable, a mix between a club and a Vegas show. The entertainers were amazing.

Disappointing. Both myself & my partner (mid 30's) went here a few years ago & really enjoyed it, so thought we would try it out again. We paid £75 each for the experience & really wish we hadn't bothered. We were advised by our rep that Monday nights are quietier - that is not the case. We chose to make our own way into PDC to have a meal & some drinks which was very enjoyable. Arriving at the club it was a chaotic scene with various queues which was all very confusing. We eventually managed to get into the club but again it was confusing where we got our wrist bands from. Once inside it was heaving & I wouldnt recommend it for the claustrophobic type. The club is laid out like an Opera house so the only way to go is up, all the time looking for the nearest fire exit because if anything kicked off in there, well, you'd never survive! The only way you can see anything is if you're standing looking over the balcony, and that is where it all went wrong for me. Whilst my partner was queuing for the toilet (we're talking 10 fellas in a queue for 1 toilet!!) I asked a young blonde girl if I could slip in next to her so I could see the show. There was clearly plenty of room & although she seemed reluctant she moved an inch to the side. Now, anyone whos been to this place before knows it gets rammed in there so she probably went into overdrive later in the evening. Anyway, partner still queuing for the loo, this girl decides she really doesn't like me next to her. She turns to me & tells me I'm making her feel uncomfortable & to go away as she was there first. Typical playground spoilt brat. I politely tell her I was just there like her to have fun, see the show & I'd paid the same as she had. So then she starts banging into me, pushes me into the girl next to me on the other side. To which she encourages this other girl to have a go at me. I gave up & moved away, not before telling her boyfriend what a nasty horrid girlfriend he had, but for some reason I think he probably knows that already :0) Anyway, we managed to find a spot at the top where the people seemed a bit more friendlier. Then it turned into the "let's all laugh at the dwarf dressed up as a clown show" so we left! I'm sure if we had gone in a group, as we had done before & had strong bladders, it probably would have been a better experience. Alas for us, well we should have stayed in that restaurant!!

Pay for Goldmember!!!. Awesome night at Coco's - from start to finish, everything was great. Table right beside stage & constant entertainment. We were a group of six & had excellent service from Adrian. Rather than book via our hotel, we got our own taxi from Akumal & then home at night. In total - taxis were 50 dollars. Def the way to go - head to Playa first for a few drinks then straight home rather than waiting on a pick up from the bus

Oh my god!. We booked because we had seen the mask film! We are 49 & 50 yrs old, we nearly didn't go as it started at 11pm! I was worried it would be out of our league and we'd be too old.Ha ha ha I'm not going to spoil it and tell you all about it but just you go there, if you don't do anything else do that! We've had some awesome parties but this was most definitely the night of our lives, so fantastic, it's a show and a party. The $100 entry seemed a bit steep but that is all you can drink included and I mean as much as you like! We just can't wait to go back!

Amazing place, great show!. My company rented the whole place so I can't comment on what's its like normally but the show and sound system rocked the place and we fit about 1200 people in and still had some room to move around.

VIP. Paying extra for the VIP area is well worth it. You get somewhere to sit otherwise you will be standing for at least four hours on a very crowded dance floor. Also, the show takes place high up which is on level with the VIP area.
Fantastic!!. What a show!Well worth the money, Ideal for any adult no matter what age. I took my mum and dad (65 and 68) they were up on a podeum dancing to the music between the acts

Amazing!. I had been to the Coco Bongo in Cancun before, which I really enjoyed, but it paled in comparison to it's Playa Del Carmen counterpart. They are much more attentive here...the cost to get in includes not only admission to a fantastic nightclub, and open bar all night (with waiters and bartenders that actually WANT to serve you once you are in the door), but a spectacular floor show that is not to be missed!
Fantastic show!. What a great night. The show was great. We had VIP tickets and view was fantastic. Music was mixed, a little bit of everything for everyone.

Spectacular!!!!!!!. I was leary of the time frame of this excursion to Coco Bongo. It didn't start until 11 in the evening and was to end at 3am. WHAT? We would never last that long!! Oh, but we did! The show was OUTSTANDING and kept our attention the entire time. The drinks were great and our waiter was fantastic, always bringing back drinks. even before we were ready for them. The price so affordable for the ticket plus transportation. We purchase through best day travel and couldnt have been happier. The bus ride was awesome, in a new, well appointed charter bus. Our tour guide was amazing. From the Mask, to Madonna, to the Beetles...I just can't say enough! Very entertaining and well worth the price. Crowded yes, but Coco Bongo had extremely clean restrooms and there was always someone cleaning up. We ended up getting back to our hotel at 4:30 am and slept till noon. Best way to party in Playa!!! A must see!

What an Experience!. I have never in all of my 54 years seen such a place. What great entertainment. Bought tickets ourselves from the rep who walked around our hotel with a coco bongos Tshirt on. He gave us a free Tshirt and lanyard to keep your keys on. Bought VIP tickets and had great views of everything going on, and I mean going on. People climbing ropes, bungy jumping out of the ceiling, running aroung the club etc etc. It was really things happening all the time. The drinks were all inclusive and the waiter never let our drinks run dry all night. We were there from about 10.45 pm until 3.20am and the time went so fast. Very good entertainment throughout. It would be wrong I think for me to detail all the different things happening as it was better to expect the unexpected!

Know what to expect.... If you come to Playa del Carmen to enjoy the sun, surf and sky but feel the need to get your party on, then Coco Bongo might be the place for you.I see that most recent reviews for this place give it top marks. For me it was a bust but I perhaps went into it with different expectations.This was one of the excursions organized by our Transat tour rep. It's the largest, most popular night venue in downtown Playa del Carmen. Every night from 11:30 pm to 2 am, there is a 'live' show which is supposedly a 'must see' event.We arrived about an hour before the show time start of 11:30 pm. There was a bit of milling about in the lineup for about 20 minutes then we were allowed inside.At the door everyone was searched with a thorough pat down. My wife had to allow her handbag to be searched, and she wasn't allowed to take her Advil into the club. She had to leave those at the check-in for later pickup. So you can be reasonably confident that there are no weapons or drugs in the club.To get us into the party mode by staff, we were given a tequila shot and a mixed drink before we were even in the club.From the description, I expected a cross between some sort of Vegas lounge and a dance club. And that was the biggest problem with the club for me. It tries to be both and, as a result, does neither really well. The club isn't laid out to be dance friendly. There isn't a dedicated dance floor to speak of. Instead it's more of an opera house layout. There's a main floor with lots of closely packed tables. In the middle of the floor is a small centre stage. A higher main stage lines the back wall, and two levels of narrow balconies ring three sides of the club and overlook all of this.And boy, do they pack the people in there! There is no way in Canada or the US that they would be allowed to pack this many people into a night club. If a fire ever broke out in this club, lots of people would die, no doubt about it.All of our group afterward admitted that one of the first things each of us did when we got into the club was to quickly figure out where the fire exits were and make sure we were near one.And if you lose the person you are with, good luck finding them again in the darkness and mass of people milling about it.We were led to our reserved section in one of the balconies off to one side. It was packed with people and there is no seating in the balconies. Everyone has to stand.The show itself started at 11:30 pm. Til then we had to watch a half-dozen show girls on the two stages. They were all smiles, but they didn't do much other than shuffle from one foot to the other in time to some bland music being strung together by the in-house DJ.And how was the show itself, once it started?Kinda meh. It mostly consisted of club music and videos projected onto two screens lowered down onto the main stage. Periodically, the screens lift up and we were treated to imitators of the Beatles, Elvis, Beyonce, Lady Gaga, Queen, etc... They sort of lip synced to the songs, and moved in imitation of the originals with varying degrees of success. On the screen behind them videos played of the originals and all it did was remind me of how much better the originals were.Occasionally, some of the acts did some interesting wire work and floated off the stage and over the crowd below. And, at regular intervals, clouds of string balloons, confetti and streamers were fired off over the crowd to great roars of approval from the audience.For me though too much of the act was the video filler between the acts. As the music and liquor flow throughout the night, people started to dance... sorta. With no dance floor and little room in the aisles, people could only bounce and flail about in their confined space and obscure views of the show for the people in the back.I was very impressed with the patience and talents of the serving staff who had to navigate through this chaotic throng of people.There are some pluses...As I mentioned previously there was no smoking in the club although I thought I was offered a cigar by the staff at one point.The lineups for the mixed washrooms were very quick. The washroom attendant did a bang-up job of keeping everything orderly and clean within so we tipped her accordingly.Booze is free, or at least the simple drinks and beer that we were drinking was free.The rest of our group seemed to enjoy it, but most of them were pretty pickled from the free booze by the end of the night. Perhaps that's the way to best enjoy it.

Amazing night!!!!!. After reading the reviews on here we (2 couples) decided to try it out and purchased VIP tickets (also called gold member tickets) from the Valentin Imperial Maya Resort Coco Bongo rep Alejandro. He was in the van that picked us up from the resort, made sure we got in the right line, brought us to our seats when it was our turn and came back to check on us again before he left...fantastic serivce!!!! It definitely worth the extra money to have our own table/seats with a great view of the stage. The entire night was a blast..shows were great and every few minutes. Our server quickly figured out we were all drinking captain morgans and brought us our own new bottle for the table and would mix our drinks right in front of us as strong as we wanted and brought us some fun shots to try too :) Our husbands are not into clubs or dancing at all but both thoroughly enjoyed themselves. The driver who dropped us off was exactly where he said he would meet us at the end of the night and took us back to our resort. We would definitley recommend this to our friends and are planning on going again on our next trip!We did think to check for emergency exits after reading some reviews and found two exit signs close to where we were sitting with arrows pointing towards eachother but no visable door to the outside between...not sure if there was a hidden door or what but if that is a concern just ask your server when you arrive and they will let you know where the exits are.

What a night. Party, Party, Party, This place has to be done. The entertainment was excellent from The beatles to Lady Ga Ga to The Mask and Spiderman. Best night out I have had in years. Worth every penny. Go for the vip ticket, well worth every penny.

Best night of fun!. Paid for a VIP ticket, with table close to stage and our own vaiter. You'll have fun without drinking, but off course you will be drinking as they serve you drinks all the time! Great entertainment. Missed champagne though, not to be found on their menu.....

BEST nightclub experience EVER!!. We did the VIP Gold member to Coco Bongo's in Playa and would recommend the experience to any and all travelers looking for a fun nightclub/vegas show experience. The VIP status allowed for immediate entry, a specific section to be seated and waiter service. The club has GREAT music/lighting and the show is outstanding and wonderfully varied. Will DEFINITELY go back!
surprising. it was overly crowded, show was really well done, wait staff was attentive, dancers were excellent, no sitting down unless you pay for it, acrobatics were phenomenal

what a party. I was skeptical about going, but once we arrived i was happy we went. We were there for a bachelor/bachelorette party. They put on an incredible show. the drinks flow freely and often. There were points where everyone in the crowd were singing along. Everyone person in our party had a great time. Definitely something to check out if you are in PDC.

Freaking awesome!. This was the highlight of our trip!! My husband and I partied like rock stars! We splurged for the VIP passes it was well worth it the service was out of this world the entertainment was phenomenal! I danced on stage, no line ups to get in! For the people who didn't enjoy it were probably the ones who didn't pay for VIP cause I would not have enjoyed it if we were on the main level for sure..

Simply awesome, the best show/club night i've ever had.. We went to Coco Bongos and I'm not young any more but used to enjoy clubs and I like shows but not a real enthusiast like my fiance. We paid a bit extra and booked the VIP tickets. This was worth it sooo much. We got picked up in resort at about 2200 and on the coach given tequilla. When we got to Playa Del Carmen we were taken by the Bongos rep to the que and were given VIP bracelets. In the que we were given a large vodka and cranberry and then in the next part of the que waiting to go through security were given another tequilla. We were then introduced to our personal barman who said i'll be looking after your balcony tonight. There was us (group of 8) and 2 other groups of similar size on our part of the balcony and the barman said anything you want drinks wise let me know by putting your hand up and i'll get it. I asked for a couple of beers and promptly got handed a bucket of corona, coors light and other beers. My fiance asked for vodka cranberry and her glass would be refilled without asking all night with branded drinks. Shots, beers, cocktails, spirits all night as much as you want and even a complimentary bottle of water at the end. That was the service, EXCELLENT. As for the show, OMG it was awesome. It was like a mixture of a show come night club come tribute to music, film and theatre. Everything from rock to dance, caberet to blockbuster movies, reggae to r n b. Tributes to the beatles, Beyonce, Michael Jackson, Meatloaf, Bon Jovi, Moulin Rouge, Men in black, Spiderman, Tron, Katy Perry and sooooo much more. In between the acts and stuff there was club like music, dance n trance and club classics with amazing light shows and big screens and the best effects i've seen in a club. All i can say is if there's one thing you do whilst in Mexico go to Coco Bongos on the VIP experience. Give up the following day as you'll be as rough as you've ever felt but what a great night with everyone coming out blown away.

The place is a fire trap waiting to happen !!!. My husband and I recently went to this place, and we hated it, left early , and boy was it hard to get out of the place, I was very close to tears it was like a nightmare trying to find the exit, despite paying for VIP we was not allowed to slip out of the exit we at last found,neither was another very distraught couple also trying to get out ! We were directed to an exit in the corner ,to get to that you had to battle your way through hundreds of people packed so tightly they could hardly move in any way. It was impossible we tried to do as we were instructed, panic was setting in for me , we had to go back to the security man on the exit we previously found as I started to feel very unwell and was by then in tears, he reluctantly let us out , have never been so relieved to get out of somewhere in my life ! Obviously the Mexicans don't have the same fire regulations as the UK, but I couldn't see any signs at all in the area we were in the V I P area, or anywhere for that matter, and the place had far too many people in there, they have lots of electrical equipment in ther going at full pelt, if a fire broke out, in my opinion many people would loose there lives, you can't see the exits in a bit of light so no chance if there was smoke, people would be crushed in the panic. The drinks I had we're not good , I only had two, very weak better at the hotel we were staying at. And no the show was to us was disappointing, BUT that's not why I'm writing this, it's the lack of fire regulations in this place, and concern at the amount of people they pack into the place, making money comes before people's safety ! AVOID !!!!

Broadway show!. We had gold membership, so had our own waited on table up by the stage.
Was such a good atmosphere, wide range of stuff going on, would recommend it.
party time in coco bongo. Awsome club ...if you want good party dont miss this place, drinks are not so expencive also and if you don`l like your company, don`t worry , you gonna find there:)

You MUST go. I am so glad that I visited this club! It is such a great idea and I enjoyed all of it. We paid for the VIP package which meant a table on one of the many balconies and waiter service with unlimited drinks. The club has everything you could want. The shows are really great and the music was fantastic. I'm not sure about how much it would cost to pay an entrance fee and for your drinks individually, but I think that the VIP package is money well spent. Obviously it is more than a club with all the tribute acts and musical pieces. Unless you don't intend to drink-go for this package. Would go back in a heartbeat!

Fantastic Night!. Had a great night in the Gold Member Area. Drinks flowed thanks to Abel, my glass was never empty for more than 2 minutes. Serious, he was the that good! The entertainment was brilliant, the time flew. Simply, a fantastic night and I recommend to anyone of any age to go!
A must go!. Awesome club... like no other club Iv been to! Performers were amazing, great night had by all :) and at 40 USD per person (drinks included) great value too!

Coc Bongo. Booked the evening here while staying in Riviera Maya and went there with another couple who we had met at the hotel, all of us in our 40s.I wasn't really too sure what to expect for $35 each, but what a fantastic night, drinks included just trip the waiters each round and you will get great service.Give it a try but be aware that the show starts at around 23:00 and we didn't arrive back to our hotel until 05:20 so its a late night.

Crazy night out!.. But do they taint the drinks with M?. Went with a group of 5(2guys,3girls).. Everyone had an amazing night, but myself an one of the girls felt as if our drinks had bin tainted with mdma, there was no way the amount I drank that I would have bin standing after going that hard. Didn't stop dancing. Two people I was with didn't drink as much and wasn't as wired as the 3 others. I still had a blast and won't forget the night we had at COCO BONGO!!
Crazy night out. You have to do this, its the best party night out ever. Make sure you go as a gold member, just cant describe it. all i can say is 'awesome'.

Vagas Meets Mexico!!. The entertainment was alive and energetic. The entire night there was something going on. Everyone enjoyed themselves. The show was Great! it kept you at the edge of your seats the entire night.
Awsome. So much fun. You have to go. it was amazing entertainment. if you book through the hotel you can get the VIP package. Free drinks!

fantastic night out. we were undecided about going to Coco Bongo as we are a couple in our early 60,s but we thought what the heck ,so glad we decided to go ,what a fantastic night out, it is non stop entertainment , poeple dropping from the ceiling, streamers and ballons flying every where, unfortunatly we were not advised to take money with us, we only had a enough for tips, but would have loved to have a copy of the photo they took of us with the guy dressed as beetlejuice, also they come around with with special shots which have a charge as well, but it didnt stop us from having a great night, we booked via the hotel and we had a great table facing the stage and the waiter keep the drinks flowing all night , dont know what time it closes as we left at 3.15am and everyone was stiil dancing the night away

Fun evening out. This is quite a unique evening experience with a mix of caberet and club. We were part of a booked trip so we had a side view of the main stage and club floor. There are VIP spaces that give you more space and not so many steps :-)The show comprises of a variety of tribute acts singing parts of songs eg Lady Gaga, Michael Jackson, LMFAO, Men in black etc.From the floor view it can be cramped, i went twice and Wednesday seemed to be better day as there was more space. You can choose to party downstairs to stay upstairs, you will need to stand for the show in order to see the acts but there are seats available.Definately a night out for a group of you thats very different from the bars etc.

Only with a coupon!. Just seems out of place in Playa. More like a Cancun thing. Playa is a walkers place. You know, trust your instincts to walk by a local place, and see if you get the vibe. No vibe in Coco... just boom-boom-boom.

Great show but a bit pricey. Me and my partner went to Coco Bongo on a Wednesday night which was very busy but not too busy... we decided to upgrade for a VIP tickets truly to get a better view and to be able to get our drinks delivered to our table instead of us going up to the almost impossibly accessible bar...We both really enjoyed the show and would definitely reccommmend it however I was very disappointed by the fact that we paid $110 each for VIP to get a table and service at our table however this so called table service did not work unless you kept tipping the waiter who once shake his head after receiving a $2 instead of the usual $5 that I kept giving him... very disappointing behavioral especially if I count the fact that we have already paid a vast amount of money to sit in VIPFurthermore we did not have a proper table just a side bar with a high chair...

AMAZING. OMG!!! Not sure what to expect,Nice surprize I got to tell ya!!! The show was Crazy,Well organized!1 The Coco Bongo Rep from The Blue Bay Grand Esmerelda " Isabelle" was the best, I am telling you, the best !!!we are 6 women on our first girl trip... The rep from our resort walked us through, placed us in our spot inside the building, brought over our waiter for the evening... she set us up for a crazy fun night!!!! Thank you so much!!! EVERYBODY SOULD SEE COCO BONGO!!!!

Another amazing night at CoCo Bongo!. Amazing night yet again at CoCo Bongo!!Even better the then cancun show then in 2011!Do not go to mexico without going here its an amazing night, it really has something for everyone!Top Tip - Try and get in early, i am short and did struggle to see at times!!
waste of money not what they all make out to be. drinks were like water , no alcohol at all, show was good , if there was ever a fire no one would get out alive. Tippin again !!!!!
Fun Club. We had so much fun at this club. Not only are there people dancing everywhere, but they also have shows periodically. I'll definitely go back again!
best night out ever. If you like a party and enjoy a dance you cant go wrong here, just a fantastic night of live entertainment.
Amaxing!!!. We had a great time! once in a lifetime experience! We suggest going with your resort, this way you get to go with faces that you see during your trip rather then people from every resort
A must. OK, if you are in a remotely good mood, you cant help but love this place. Movie and broadway clips re-enacted in a club like setting. My absoulely favorite night out. Enjoy..........

Great night out at any age.. What a thrill, wonderful sights and sounds none stop for hours. We went on a Monday night and it was rammed. Recommend VIP tickets as you don't sit down otherwise. Ladies wear shoes you are comfortable in you will be dancing on the bar. Drinks get spilled as it is so crowded but not a problem. The action takes place all over not just on the massive stage. Gallery viewing is all around on 4 floors, never seen anything like it. An assault on all the senses.BRILLANT.

Great Night Out!. A great night out!! Fantastic dancing and performing and a very well put together show. Great drinks service. We had a fantastic time. Very easy to find and travel to but shuttle bus or taxi from the local hotels and the hotels further away in the Riviera Maya.

New Years Every night !. Was a little sceptical about going, with us being in our mid 40s, thought it was nightclub for twenty somethings with a bit of a show, wrong wrong wrong. Had an absolute blast of a night. We paid for the gold VIP passes which I'd strongly recommend, yes they are a bit pricey but well worth it, you get a great view, drinks included, waiter service, which was excellent (Thanks Abel) plus separate entrance so less queuing. As others have said it's a great show, really entertaining and goes on from about 11pm ~ 3:30 am the time flies by. The atmosphere builds as the night progresses and it's absolutely bouncing by the end of the night, it just felt like the best new years eve party I'd ever been to. I must agree with an earlier poster, I'd be a bit nervous if there was an incident in there, I don't think it's the safest place in the world but then hey walking across the roads not without it's dangersJust go, it's great, one of the highlights of our holiday.
Excellente!. Brilliant in every possible way, get the VIP tickets. Such good value for money, service was excellent, show was incredible! Fantastic night out!
the best night ever. a mixture of nightclub, tribute acts, musicals, Cirque Du Soleil, and movie clips - all in one night

great place. very entertaing and the rep Christina who came selling the tickets was very good, we had a problem when we got there where one of our party ended in hospital, she sorted that we were able to visit the club again at no further charge ( even though we went back at the weekend which is dearer) Thanks to her :)
Let Dance. all night long said Lionel Ritchie,so that the open bar place for young and old one.Stay alive until the morning.every one can dance to see the sun.Salute

AWESOME!!. This place is fantastic!! if you are in th rivera maya you HAVE to go, it is a cross between cirque du soleil and a west end musical.Definately upgrade to the VIP area as you have a better view seats and fantastic bar staff who bring your drinks before you have even ordered them!!If you book with the hotel, get a taxi yourself its cheaper, well worth the night out, we loved it!!!

Amazing. this club was amazing, the best one i have ever been to, the best was the tron scene they do acrobatics and all different artists like madonna, queen,elvis and many many more it has something for every one. I would recommend to go vip for just a couple of pounds extra you get great seats and and your own waiter who as soon as you have finished one drink he is their with another

Jungle Maya Adventure - Alltournative. My sister and I had a terrific time taking the Maya Jungle Tour with Alltournatives in Playa del Carmen. We were there in mid-September and had a wonderful day. Our tour guide, Gabriel, was the best. Very knowledgeable, low key but enthusiastic. And our tour was unbelievable. We swam in the freshwater cenotes under ground (very cool - snorkeling by flashlight and enjoying the cool freshwater). We went zip-lining through the jungle (and into a water landing in a cave) and had a really delicious authentic meal. The truck ride through the jungle seemed a little silly, but it was a small part of the day. Oh yes, we repelled into one of the cenotes - a very short trip, but still cool. I definitely recommend this - and I hope you get Gabriel.

Wow. My wife and I, visiting the Riviera Maya for the first time, and looking for something to do, were advised that this may be a fun way to spend an evening out of the Hotel.So we booked.Later when we found out that the attraction was a 2 hr bus ride away, and that the bus pickup was at 21.30, returning at 05.30 next morning! we started to get a bit twitchy.So off we went on a full - bus charge up to Playa del Carmen.Ive got to say that the whole deal, from transport, couriers, event staff at the venue and the show itself were fantastic.If you like music, enjoy watching a great spectacle, like to join in the fun, and get as many (included) drinks down your neck as you can, then this is a must-see.Dont worry about the timings, the show is so good the time flies by, we loved it, and consider it worth every penny.Tip - get in early to try and secure a table, but dont fret if you dont manage that as all seats are very well managed by the staff to ensure everyone has a good vantage point and that the drinks come quick and fast all night.Tip - Tip your assigned waiter for an even quicker service (you will be pushed to keep up the pace)Tip - Take good camera with plenty of battery life.Tip - Done arrange to be at breakfast at the usual time next morning LoL !!Review left by a member who at 60 should know better !! - love it.

What a great night!. Fantastic show. Worth every penny with a Gold V.I.P. pass! The acrobatics were phenomenal. The excerpts from different films co-ordinated with the singers and dancers were amazing.
best night club ever!!!!. this is thee best night club ever. our 1st time and definatley not the last time. this place was mental it ranged from ages between 22-80years old, i'm not kidding. amazing

Spot on. Great show, spectacular. H&S would never allow one in England more the pity. You have to go!! Younger ones do the cheaper on the floor option, us older geezers pay VIP to have a balcony seat!!

Amazing Show & Party Atmosphere!. Went here with my girlfriend on Wednesday 19th September 2012. When booking we were offered different packages, VIP, standard entry with unlimited drinks was £45.00 or $60.00 and VIP was £90.00 or $120.00. Also to go on a Friday or Saturday night in an extra £7 or $10 each. We tried to save some money so we could go on other trips and were originally going to go VIP on a Saturday night but saved £52 each by going on a Wednesday night an just purchased a standard ticket with drinks included. We were a little concerned with not going to Coco Bongo's at the weekend as we thought it might be really quite, but we had nothing to worry about, in fact we are so glad we didn't pay the additional £7/$10 each as the place was so busy.From the outside the building looks very small, there are different queue, but your travel rep will direct you to the correct line. As we purchased a standard ticket you get to queue jump, thank god for this as the queue outside is huge.
