You are given a shot of tequila at the main door, another downstairs and another inside the main area, doesn't taste the best but it's free so what the hell! lolOnce inside the main door it takes about 15 minutes then to get to the main area, long queues inside but you get through them very quickly. This is down to the security checks, metal detector machine and you also get checked, pockets, legs, top half etc. Didn't have any problems with that and it's a little intimidating at first, but would rather they checked everybody that comes in then don't.The security will also checked you for phones, camera's and camcorders, no camcorders or filming in the premises. I had a camcorder that looked like mobile phone so no problem getting it in. You are then checked another two times once you get through security that you have purchased a ticket.Once you get through all that then the show and party begins. You are greeted and asked if you would like a drink. All the brand names behind the bar as well as all the local Mexican brands. If you want brand names to drink the you need to pay for these, about $4-$5 for your brand names. But we stuck to the cheap brands as they were free.The place is very small compared to the Coco Bongo's in Cancun which holds over 10,000 people, the one in Playa holds about 1.500 but the atmosphere is still amazing and everyone is up for a good time.The age group in Coco's ranges from 18 right up to 60+, all different ages enjoying themselves. It's not a night club, it's one big show with breaks between each act. When each act as finished they put the party music on and you have a dance to one or two songs then the shows come back on. When the shows are not on there is glitter that drops from the ceiling, paper, fireworks and people are handed long thin balloon's to wave around to the music. Fantastic atmosphere and everybody is singing, dancing and smiling.The place gets really busy and can be very difficult to find a good spot were people are not brushing past you all the time or where you have to keep moving. Can get very frustrating but once you find your spot it's brilliant.We didn't go VIP to try and save money for other trips but got the same treatment as the VIP's if not better, BIG TIP if you are not VIP, when the waiter walks past you, ask for your drinks and tip him $1, when he comes back tip him another $1 bill and mention to him if he keeps coming back to you, you will look after him. The waiter came back to us within 10 minutes and ask if we wanted more drinks, again we did the same thing and said we would give him 200 pesos at the end of the night. We did not have to go to the bar and get one single drink, we were getting drinks all night every 10 minutes and the measures were huge. So we got the same service if not better then the VIP. So we saved £90 or $120, and all it cost us was an extra £12.50 or $20 in tips to get fantastic service and make a new Mexican friend. We danced with him and had talk, thank you. I'm not sure but if you booked VIP i think you get the brand names, but once you have had a few, they all taste the same! lolEverybody is really friendly, we met loads of different people from Mexico, Portugal, Spain, Canada, England etc. We got picked up from our hotel at 10pm and arrived at the club at 11pm and were picked up at 3.30, Coco closes at 4pm.If you go here you will have great time and it's like nothing you have seen before, well worth going. PS security told us no filming or photographs, but we saw people doing the both all night and they were not hiding the fact, so we just did the same and got some great, photo's and recording that we can look back on fondly.Go go go go, you want be disappointed.

Fab night out. I have never been to such a great night out. The entertainment, music it was unbelievable. The bar man kept bringing the drinks, the streamers kept falling as did the balloons. This is must do shoe for all ages

This Place is Amazballs. If your in mexico (Playa del Carmen or Cancun) this is a must see its large Nightclub come caberet ! If you buy it as trip from your travel rep then go VIP if its offered its well worth it, If your going yourself get there early as you'll be standing and you want a good spot for the shows and will need to pay for your drinks(not sure about there cost).If you VIP it you'll be picked up by coach around 10pm and taken to the club in Playa del Carmen shown to the vip entrance and provided a wrist band then you'll be shown up a set of stairs (steep) and seated around a table or two depending on how many of you there are.Once seated the only time you'll need to move is to dance, smoke or go to the loo. Your waiter or busboy as they call them (ours was Jorge) will ask you what you would like to drink then he will sort your drinks. (I suggest that if you tip the bus boy on your third drink just 100 peso's (£5) your glasses will never be empty and additional shots will be brought to your table.The show is amazing and very varied it goes from the Beatles, Beyonce, Madonna, Elvis and Micheal Jackson they also have loads of ribbon acrobats in the centre of the club they also do movie related acrobatics like MIB, Spiderman. During the brakes they play music videos on the big screen so your never really left un entertained. There are photo oppertunitys for you with some of the characters as they come round the club and they are reasonable priced.The only down side to this place is the stairs to the seated area once the show starts the stairs fill with people and it makes it very difficult to get to and fro from the toilet as you have to squeeze past them all not overlly safe but a small slur to an Amazing night !Dont expect an early night we left there at 3:30am to getn the coach home and finally arrived back at our hotel for 5am.Well worth the £70 a must seeeeeeeeeeeeeee !!!!!!!!!!!!!!X:@)

GOLD MEMBER A MUST !!!!!!. Awesome show, fabulous special effects but if you go go VIP, you will have an awesome view and if you tip your personal waiter the drinks will keep coming! Enjoy the show folks
Amazing!. Went VIP and was worth every penny! Awesome Club, out of this world show... Party atmosphere second to none!If you do nothing else, you MUST get a night out there!

Same as in Cancun. This place in Playa del Carmen is the twin club of the Cancun. Most of the show is the same but there are differences. I went with my wife and she loved it. Depending how close you are choose one of the clubs to go. Don't miss it if you are staying in Riviera Maya.
What a night. What a brilliant night out, fantastic shows and great music. Definitely pay the extra for a VIP place as its a great view of the stage and the drinks keep following!!!
WOW. what a club entertaining all way through didn't want it to end we did it twice go vip as its very busy

Coco Bongo - you've gotta go!!. Amazing show and great music. I loved the aerialists!!
The price seems high at first, but it is totally worth it!! :)
Amazing!!!!. If you dont do anything else! Do this! Go for the VIP seats to ensure that you get free drinks flowing all night and the best seats in the house!

avoid. i would not recommend coco bongos its like a night you would have at blackpool with the drag acts- no talent at all!!the place is far too full and frightening trying to move!everytime you use the loo you are being hassled to buy drugsjust an awful atmosphere - we booked through thomas cook and were on a balcony but you have to go along the floor to get to it whichh is hard work it is rammed and no one moves for you - if there was a fire you would have no chance of getting outfor the money you pay it is not worth it at all im afraid

DO NOT GO!. worst experiance ever! they had reps at the resort walking around selling packages. claimed that we would get a table. well...we never got a table. they ushered us in a line with a ton of other people up some stairs to a ledge and told us to stand there. when we complained they moved us to a table, but it was practically under the stage and we were standing the whole time still. you definately need to pre-game before. i think my drinks were all cranberry, no vodka. its a crazy time if your really young (def under 21's there), drunk, high, and dont care about being pushed around and squeezed like a sardine!

Thank you Ivan!. Great atmosphere, fabulous show, and although the tickets seemed expensive for gold/vip (£70 approx) they are worth it for the entertainment, waiter served free drinks for the whole show, with transport to our resort included.

Don't miss it!!!!. A must visit attraction for all adults of any age. We are a couple in our early fifties and did not feel out place among the younger generation. The music is fantastic. The show is brilliant and the service In the VIP is second to none as drinks flowing all night. Well worth the money. Xx

What a night!. After paying what we felt to be a rather hefty price for the VIP area, we went in and were seated where we had a great view of the stage. The show was very enjoyable and the atmosphere was electric. I was impressed at how everyone become so involved with so much audience participation - which made for a wonderful party atmosphere. The price included unlimited drinks which were served by an attentive waiter, but they were either too strong or oversweet. The daiquiries were not made with real fruit but a synthetic substitute. However, the drinks kept coming and the shots were quite nice. You do need to come here for the experience.

party!. fantastic! 50$ person with bus from hotel, full but not at total capacity (first week of sept) so little space to dance on the floor (even if i spend the night dancing on the bar inbetween shows) service was not a problem always a drink in hand... shooter rounds all the time.. everyone talk and dance with everyone. the show was really great!show from 10pm to 2am i thinkbest birthday ever!bathroom are at the front on the side so a little hard to go (dont forget to bring tips to bathroom... a woman is waiting with towel to clean your hand strange but funny when you drink a bit...)
awsome nightclub. very packed be prepared to take half hour to get to the loo!! but absolutely brilliant! the acts were very good and entertaining. the staff was very nice and helpful

Fun fun fun with amazing acts!!!. Loved this place it was colourful fun and entertainment was fantastic, upgrade to gold member for free drinks and personal barman!! What a great night and felt safe in taxi on our way back to riviera maya.

Brilliant. The show was out of this world, the dancers are very very good. The sitting area is poor i would advice to get VIP tickets for your own comfort. But once in Coco Bongo the show is amazing, I will return to watch another show when i return in 2 years.

You MUST go here, it's sheer brilliance will blow you away.. Paid $60 for entrance booked at resort through rep, included return transport. 9.30pm pick up at hotel, 3.30am departure from coco bongo's. Show from start to finish was awe inspiring, so much to see and all of the very highest standard. Music was pumping all night. Drinks are included & are free flowing, you will need to pay for shots from shot girls. Take I.d,but nothing else, they are very strict on what you can & cannot take in. VIP tickets offered no more than normal entrance from what I could tell. In all 12 of us went from 19 to 45 in age range, every single person rated this as the best night out ever.

out of this world. Brillant excellent. Coco bongos is like no other night club ive been to. Its a cabaret show. Someone said to me its like Cirque du Soleil on speed. Its just a must see for anyone over the age of 18.
Dont leave Mexico without going !!!. Brilliant.Puts Las Vegas shows to shame also go VIP! - own waiter all night no empty drinks. staff encourage customers to get involved. NOT JUST FOR THE YOUNG
Too cool. The show is amazing, you need ti look every where at the same time with had such a great time! You need to go there!!!

Theatre, night club and circus all thrown into one!. Wow, we had an amazing time here! We bought tickets online before going to Mexico, as I was out there previously that year and people telling me that I need to go to Coco Bongo.And I'm so pleased I did. It was an absolutely fantastic night, lots of entertainment, the music was out of this world, and the circus shows where spectacular!If I'm in Mexico again I will be back to Coco bongo in a shot!

Best night out!!. We booked to go to Coco Bongo through our Thomson tour rep who recommended we visit Puerto del Carmen rather than Cancun as its better laid out for a good view, she warned us it would be busy and to arrive early to ensure a good seat allocation (with VIP tickets). We were not entirely sure what to expect but hoped for a good show given that it's owned by Jim Carey! We were not disappointed in the slightest, in fact the whole experience exceeded our expectations, it was thoroughly entertaining and the staff looked after us throughout the night - I would recommend Coco Bongo in a heartbeat and would go back if we visit Mexico again.We read some negative reviews before we went but I have to say, as long as you arrive around 10.15pm you'll be allocated a good spot. The drinks just keep coming and they definitely contain alcohol so I'm not sure what that complaint was about...All in all if you're looking for a party atmosphere with plenty to see, this is the place to go!

Fantastic night!. We didn't know quite what to expect before our trip to Coco Bongos as we are both in our 30s and don't really go to clubs in the uk anymore. We had an amazing night and at times were mesmerised by the different acts.Prior to the show beginning there was a DJ playing some really modern dance style music, but then the actual show kicked off with the Beatles, then on to Queen, Lady Gaga, Madonna, Michael Jackson, a spider man dual in the air with a baddy and so many more I could mention! The performances, lights, streamers, acrobats and music made it such a unique experience.We arrived at 10.20 on the advice of our rep and paid for the VIP ticket as the seating included is on a first come first served basis up in the balcony area. We had no issues in getting a seat for the night arriving at this time. Our ticket included all of our drinks which were delivered by waiter service to our seats and were branded spirits and bottled beer - we were never without a drink. The toilets were immaculate as a poor toilet attendant cleaned them after every use. We got a taxi from our hotel to the club and I would recommend this as we stayed until 3am - much later than we had planned and later than the organised transport would have returned.

Vegas comes to Mexico!!!. Show is fantastic amazing, bit worried at first as they do pack you in there but completely forgot how busy it was when it started, brilliant. Paid $100, free bar until 3.30am
A Must Do. A club a show into 1 like nothing i have ever done defintaley do the gold package you get a table and seats and your own waiter who brings you drinks all night. Great fun
fabulous shows. The shows were fab and one you paid your ticket everything was free all night. Downside a long late night as it did not start til 11pm.

Crazy - Amazing!!. Busiest place we've ever been!!! Highly recommend Gold Member ticket to get out of the crowds, get served drinks (all included in ticket price) all night and have the best views of the show. Get there early (between 10pm and 10.30pm) to get best view and seats/table. The show is music/cabaret/music theatre/club type mash up!!! Most amazing all in one show we've ever seen. All ages go - it's a great experience. You have to go just to experience this at least once. It is crowded and loud and they shoot all sorts of stuff like confetti, balloons and what seems like indoor fireworks - it's a complete illegal health and safety hazard for England. But seems to be fine abroad! Well worth a visit, you'll never see this anywhere else in the world.
Best Nightclub in the World. Wow! What a night! Lucky I took lots of photos to remember it all! 25 shows in one night really can happen!
Amazing Nigthclub!. No words too described this nightclub, definitely putting Las Vegas to shame, a little bit crowded this time around!

Overly Crowded and Terrible Bar Selection. This place is over-hyped. It is the most over-crowded place I've visited. The place has an open-bar, but the drink selection is terrible and cheap. The bar tenders were attentive, though, and kept the drinks coming. The show is Vegas style, and I'd rather watch the show sitting down as it is not suitable for dancing.

Stay Away!!. we were staying at a resort and was offered a package for $65 all inclusive with a table. The guy Robin told us that we would bypass the long lines and not have to pay for bottle service in order to get a table. Well when we go there, the place was already packed, they walked us up to the second floor and said this is your spot. It was the ledge not a table and no chairs. We complained and they moved us to the first floor to a "table" and still no chairs and we had absolutely no view of the upstairs show. The drinks did not have alcohol in them. It was pure cranberry juice we were drinking. There were obnoxious drunk teenagers everywhere. We had to keep reminding ourselves we were in another country and didn't want to end up in Mexican Jail. Probably the worst night I have ever had...waste of time and money!!

I wanted out before the show started. They treated my daughter so disrespectful , she gave them the receipt and they shoved a flashlight in her eyes and told her to get her license out, they said : how much did you pay and when I went to go tell them , he told me to shut up I want to hear it from her? I let her tell them, then I said i am the one who paid with my card. Then we were promised presents shirts. They told me i could go in and use the restroom and the crazy disrespectful people in the showroom were to much. i walked out and said" Im done I want my money back and I would never be in this mad house. They said they would get us the floor seats and alex would take care of us, then they made us move then they came up to me on the first show and said you have the wrong wrist band on and i told him to talk to the manager because they said not to worry about it. then he flashed his light and told me i had to go out and by this time it was jammed packed you could barely move, be careful to wear clothes that you do not mind getting spilled all over. As I went out again they said they would move us to the VIP seats and get my daughter. Then they told me they did not have the seats once we got back.... talk about getting the run around. A lady actually grabbed my arm and said" I thought you were going to use the restroom. then a man told me to sit at the vip and this couple went biserk cause they had a party of 8 and it sat 10 people. we could of sat next to them but i cant stand to be around bitter grapes, we did not get the presents they promised us, just harrasment..... if you go to cancun coco bongo and dont want to drink" all you have to do is pay 10.00 or 15.00 to congo and get all the free drinks , then you can go to coco bongo directly across the street with no charge. its free.............................. cancun congo is better , and also the bulldog nightclub has it going on. people wore glow in the dark bunny ears, and had all kinds of fun stuff. playa de carmen had one to many rude girls , but the men were good. I went next door to the coco bongo and had a better time dancing with good people ..... my friend paid for a vip section for 110.00 and she did not get the section and they ripped her off

Will never get my business again.. Two of us bought tickets at our hotel through the salesperson on site while the other four paid her on the bus. Upon arriving there we were told we weren't allowed in because we didn't have ID. None of us were told to bring ID just "some money and a smile". After a huge ordeal we were abandoned on the streets of Playa and they basically told us to find our own way back to the hotel. The four girls who paid on the bus were able to get their money back because it hadn't been given to Coco Bongo yet but the two of us who paid ahead of time were given no refund. Not only were they so disrespectful to us but they were also extremely disrespectful to our representative who was trying to help us out. We were also told that four of the girls would have got in no problem but because two of us are shorter we clearly could not be legal (BTW the two shorter one happen to be the oldest in the group you idiots) . Thanks for ripping us off and booting us to the street. Coco Bongo will never get business from us again which is a shame because we were planning on doing it on our yearly trips.

A VERY MAGICAL PLACE BUT.... Be careful do not buy a ticket off coco bongo from Christina. She'S the saleswoman representing coco bongo at the hotel Gran Bahia Coba. She lied to us about the tickets . We had problems with the ticket that she sold us. She was passing on front off us and she never stop to help^us to get in. We had to deal with the manager '' capitain'' whogave us an good service after.

best night out. great place to come for an insane night....worth paying extra for the table and waiter service which saves hassle of queuing at the bar. just brilliant night time fun.... don't have any trips booked for the next day though !

You have to go at least once.. Great time to be had at this show/nightclub. They put on a show every 5 minutes and in between these shows its a nightclub. Buy a ticket from the hotel lobby tour desk and go on a monday. It's cheaper and no lines to get in. (40 minute wait to get in on a saturday). Drinks are included in your ticket price but are made with local liquor and are watered down. Besides this we still had an amazing time.
Had a blast.. Coco Bongo is like Las Vegas, Broadway, Cirque du Soleil and disco wrapped into one. I'm 51 and partied like I was 21.

It's a bomb!. This place is absolutely awesome! The entertainment is non stop and quality! Time went by so quickly when I was there which is saying something since it was late! I would probably go back again and again the next time I'm in Mexico! It's a must do!

great night. was a bit apprehensive being closer to 50 than 40 but i tell you what the best night entertainment we have ever had just go and experience it you will not be disaponted a special mention to our bus boy (alherando) i think his name was it got a bit blurry later on just go and try it

VIP Hung with some stars too. Cogo Bongo was good. Great shows we did VIP was pretty small area and place. Thank goodness we were in our own little cramp space better than being bumped into down below. Also seated next to us we were lucky to of hung with a pretty famous couple. All in all good time to say been there done that, but wont go back.

High Energy. what an event.. I was a little intimidated upfront - going to a club from 11-3am.. but the show was such high energy - it felt like 2 in the afternoon.a couple of suggestions - order tix on-line before going - order VIP - its a extra 50$ per tix but definitely worth it - take a small camera to take pics - no video taping allowed - Get there by 10:15 - the earlier you go the better your viewing/seating locationWhen you get there you will be corralled like cattle into the building. bags and body searchedbefore entering - you are escorted through a number of hallways - givin a shot of tequilaand ultimately "placed" for the remainder of the evening. If you are a smoker tell your "handler" there appeared to be only 1 section that had access to the smoking section outside.Once the show started it was now stop -- great time.. if you get the VIP- you will have a waiter that will get drinks for you.. never had a empty glass all night..The environment does not appear to be disability friendly nor will this environment appeal to anyone with claustrophobiaEnjoy
Great!. Loved the show, and had a lot of fun. But it took the waiters an hour to bring a beer, and sometimes they wouldnt bring anything at all.

Insane Party Place!. Lots of fun, show was great. Note that they do fill this club (they did at least when we were there). There are a lot of people. That being said, felt safe while we were there and had a really great time. Had done a package with transportation from hotel - it included drinks all night and VIP seating (which was definitely necessary with all of the people there). Cost was approx $60-$80/person. Great place for a great time!
Fab night. Entertainment was awesome, drinks supplied by waiter on The Gold member ticket with seating was a bonus.

happy 50th. wow 12 of us went here on a friends 50th went vip a must great nite show was never ending constant entertainment carnival atmosphere plenty to drink only thing is they need more loos while ladies queing you miss lots of the dancing. but great nite and great memories.

Need to go VIP. This is an expensive night out, but as it was my birthday we decided to go all out and buy the VIP tickets. We're so glad we did as some friends from our hotel didn't buy the VIP passes and they said they really wished they'd been up on the higher level with us. They got neck ache and hardly got any drinks at all. We bought our tickets from the Coco Bongo booth at the hotel swimming pool and again we're really glad we did this rather than going with Thomsons on their bar crawl as we wouldn't have seen the whole show then. Neither would I have wanted to buy our tickets through the Thomson reps at the hotel and make our own arrangements to get to/from Playa Del Carmen by taxi on our own as the reps suggested. The back streets of PDC at night isn't the best place to be if you're a tourist.We were collected from our hotel at 10.30 pm by Coco Bongo staff and driven to Playa Del Carmen by mini bus (return transport all included in the price of the tickets) When we arrived in Playa Del Carmen we were then taken to the front of the queue and with our VIP tickets we were inside straight away. Once we'd had the bag check we were inside and escorted straight through the crowds inside club and up to a higher level where we were given front row seats and our own table. We had our own waiter for the whole night who kept our drinks flowing in abundance - whatever we asked for he served us immediately. We had a brilliant view of the stage and the floor below. The waiters and security staff were constantly checking everywhere to ensure nobody was in any danger. We had huge respect for how hard all the staff worked throughout the night. They were also keeping a sharp eye for drugs of any type and to ensure nobody was smoking. There were dedicated VIP toilets which were very clean and well managed.The show was spectacular. I can't praise it highly enough. I loved the way it was so three dimensional; by this I mean it wasn't just on the stage, but it was all around, in the air and there was always something new and exciting happening. The best acts for me were Tron and Spiderman, but having said that nothing was really poor or disappointing. The show finished at about 3.30 am and we left the club shortly before 4 am to find our mini bus home. It was waiting exactly where the driver had told us it would be when he dropped us off earlier and once everyone was on board we set off back to our hotel in Akumal getting back about 4.30 am. A totally brilliant night and we thought great value.Yes, it's very crowded in there and yes, I couldn't help thinking how dreadful it would be if there were a fire, but I'm so glad we went and it was a fantastic way to celebrate my birthday. It's an experience I won't forget and nor do I want to.

A great show. The show was great but you are smashed into the club like sardines. We were in an upper VIP area that we paid extra for and we were on top of one another. Also some people get so drunk they were falling into us. Someone fell into our table and spilled all of the drinks into my friends lap. The service was good as we had our own waiter making us drinks. The show was amazing. I might go back on a less croweded night.
Great Place!. Crazy club that was a great night out! A show and club combined that provided great entertainment! Want to go back NOW!

Nice, but over rated. We have a nice time there, since we knew that this is "the place" at P.D.C we decided to go with high spectations and it were just fillfulled due to that there were so much people inside the place, more of what we think they can handle i hope this is leagal beacuse it could be a problem if some issue happens and the place is over full. . .The drinks are the cheapest ever so we suggest by bottled service.

Very goo entertainment. We went to Coco Bongo as part of the Thomas Cook bar crawl. They have their own balcony which has a good view (if you have fairly tall). The show was amazing! You really feel like its Beyonce / Queen / Moulin Rouge performing to you.

Amazing night.. Book a gold pass its worth every penny. Amazing show and great service. You will be put in a VIP area,have table and chairs and be looked after all night long. Hector was our man and he was great!On a previous visit we were out in the main club-it was good but alot of pushing and shoving. Needed to keep an eye on bags.

Awesome show, open bar.. Great show, very fun to watch! Interactive, great stage, dance music, open bar. If you've been to the one in Cancun, this one's exactly the same, only a bit smaller. Very recommendable to go once. 2 times is too much in the same week. It'd be too repetitive.

So much fun!. My husband who was celebrating his 65th birthday and I really enjoyed the fun at this club. The music was great and the crowd was so energetic. We felt completely safe while we were there, as well as coming and going to the club. It was like an awesome New Year's Eve party. The waiters were pretty amazing and kept the drin ks coming. All the performers were top class. Highly recommend it.
Excellent!!!. Brilliant night out, organised chaos! The staff are excellent, we booked VIP and didn't have an empty glass all night. Amazing show!!
Brilliant night out. Fanatstic entertainment- great show. Brilliant party/carnival atmosphere. Be prepared for a late night- backt o hotel about 4.30 am

Fabulous different night out. Mixture of nightclub and theatre- look alies singing one minute, then blasting some great dance sings then sort of trapeze artists dangling from the ceiling. Everyone waving long gallons then steam pumping out then confetti. It was great. We were in the VIP bit great waiter service with international brands. Great evening
Just do it!. You must do it! The most fun, crazy, exciting thing I've ever seen! Be prepared for a big night out!!

Go on a week night. The rep at our resort was trying to sale tickets for $65 and since I never hearld of this place I thought they were crazy! But when Monday rolled around the cost was only $50 and boy was it worth it. I had a BLAST and recommend it but only on a weekend night. The place was packed the music loud and fun and the drinks were flowing. I stayed the whole time and loved it! It was non stop the whole night.

Coco Bongo "lite". My husband and I went to Coco Bongo in PDC from GBP Tulum in Akumal July 2012. We're 48 and have been vacationing in the Cancun area for almost a decade. We have been to and LOVED Coco Bongo in Cancun. Compared to the original, we both have to say that this was not nearly as good. We did the VIP, which was good but not worth the $120 per person price. The show was good for the most part, but the smaller venue really diminishes the experience. Choreography for some numbers was less than stellar. We saw their "Broadway" show. My daughter and her bf saw the same show in Cancun the week before. In comparing notes, the same numbers my husband and I were rolling our eyes at, namely Masquerade from Phantom and the Chicago numbers were performed extremely well at the Original Coco Bongo in Cancun! We were SO disappointed and felt ripped off. If you've never been to Coco Bongo in Cancun, you'll probably enjoy it. If you have, don't waste your money at the one in Playa del Carmen! Go back to Cancun!

Electrifying experience oh wow. Tip - book VIP tickets through your rep. This gives you air con coach travel to venue, VIP entrance. You bypass all the long lines and are treated like celebrities. You get the best seats in the house and a very attentive waiter. No one had to wait for drinks, all this for one price. Its suitable for all age groups over 18 yrs. its a spectacular carnival of pure entertainment, a feast for wildness for both eyes and ears like you've never seen. The music, the dancing and the vibrancy is amazing.We were collected at 10.20pm and arrived back to our hotel very tired but happy around 4.30am.The best moment- probably being pulled up on the stage to dance - with girls half my age!! I've so still got it...

50 years old and loved it! Just go.. Wanted to visit CB since we missed out last time we were in Mexico. Booked the VIP package through the Thomson rep - same price as everywhere else $110. Arrived at 10,30pm, queued for fifteen minutes and we were in. So glad we went VIP. Great views of the show and waiter kept the free drinks flowing all night. Ground floor looked a a bit crowded and hectic and we were glad we were upstairs. Great night out, a unique experience. Expensive but worth it. Just go!

Fabulous night of entertainment!. Well, I don't even really know where to begin when describing a night at Coco Bongo! If you buy the package through the hotel like we did, you get free transport, free drinks with waiter service and private bar and seating area that is at the same level as the main stage.It was not what we expected; it was a million times better!! We have been a couple of times now, both on Brit night and the shows were fantastic and sooooo different each time! Would recommend that everyone who stays in Playa del Carmen makes at least 1 visit here!!

Don't buy the cheapest tickets. We bought two tickets on 5th Ave of Playa del Carmen from a guy at a Coco Bongo stand. I really didn't know much about the tickets other than reading reviews of people saying get the VIP because you get drinks delivered to you. I thought I didn't need VIP because I was staying at a resort where top shelf liquor was included therefore I wasn't going to Coco Bongo to drink. So I bought two of the cheapest available tickets, 1300 pesos / $100 USD for two. Even the cheapest ticket includes open bar. We were not sure what day we were going, either Wednesday or Thursday, but the guy told us we didn't need to know what day other than it wouldn't be good on Friday or Saturday (maybe other days too) when the prices are a little more. The guy seemed a little sketchy because I got a receipt while my boyfriend got a wristband.When we arrived at Coco Bongo there were two lines of people, regular and fast line. We got the in "fast line," got up to the bouncer and was told we were in the wrong line. We then got in the regular line which seemed like the line for the locals, not many people were in this line. Once the "fast line" died down another bus of people kept coming and they kept going in, but the regular line was just ignored like it didn't exist. After seeing people keep coming and coming and us not moving, who knows how long we would have been standing outside, I went to a woman at the information booth and asked her if I could pay extra to get in the fast line. She agreed and I got my boyfriend out of the regular line. She took us through to the ticket booth, we paid $15 USD and were finally in.The place was packed! They stick as many people as they can in there which is why the tickets we got were good for any of the non-peak days. I would hate to see this place have a fire because everyone would be dead. I tried to enjoy the show while being bumped and pushed. The acts were excellent, I just wish I could have enjoyed them more by not being bumped into and having someone put their big gut right onto my back! Too close for my comfort. I kept near the exit / back bar and then when I asked the security guard where the bathroom was he told me it was on the other side of the crowd. I didn't bother going to the bathroom because I didn't feel like squeezing my way there and back.I would NOT recommend Coco Bongo for all ages like many reviews state. I could not see my parents who are in their fifties enjoying this. If you can't stand top 40 music, this is not the place for you. This is a night club too, so if you're easily offended by a twenty something girl with a dress with no panties showing her privates because she was dancing on the balcony and they blew air, then this is not the place for you. There was an older couple that went on the balcony and danced but most of the crowd was 40 and under. One must be 18 or older to enter.If I had to do it over again (#1), I would buy my tickets outside Coco Bongo as opposed to a guy on 5th Ave at the Coco Bongo stand. The receipt and wristband he gave us worked but the wrist band was out dated, everyone else's wristband was blue while the one we got was brown with a name written on the back of it. He was just a sketchy character, it still doesn't make sense why one of us got a receipt while the other got a wristband.If I had to do it over again (#2), I would have bought the most expensive tickets. Even though I didn't care about drinking it would have been nice to have some space to myself and not being bumped into, shoved into, stepped on, etc. I know I would have enjoyed it a ton more if I wasn't packed in a crowd like sardines.

Vegas does Playa del Carmen. What an amazing night! Something is going on all the time, spiderman whizzed past us at one point after Lady Gaga, Madonna and Michael Jackson had done their bit Pay to go as a gold member and you will get a seat on the first floor with a premium view, drinks included and your own barman

We had a great night!!. The show is incredible we had so much fun dancing and drinking. They have a full bar and the quality of the shows are comparable to some of the best in Las Vegas. The only problem is that there was so many people we could barely move. The service is great the bathrooms are super clean although the place was crowded. We enjoyed it a lot!!!
The Best Club. The best club I have been too. The music was quality and the atmosphere was outstanding! The staff are a bit rude, but who cares get wasted and record the madness!

Best club ever!. This was our third visit to Coco Bongo and it just keeps getting better! We paid for VIP tickets so had seats on the first floor and a waiter who constantly brought us drinks. We have bought standard tickets in the past and would really recommend spending a bit more on the VIP. The queues to get in can get really long if you are not there early but you get to queue jump if you have a VIP ticket. It also gets really crowded on the main floor so it was good to have a seat and a table (although we were up dancing after the first 20 minutes so didn't actually use the seats much!). The show is fantastic and is a mixture of tribute acts and acrobatics with a real mix of music and different movie themes. Some of our favourites were Michael Jackson, Lady Gaga, LMFAO, Chicago, Pirates of the Caribbean and Spiderman. After each section of the show, they play a few songs so the entertainment is non-stop. The atmosphere is electric and there were people of all ages having an amazing time.Overall, the tickets were a bit pricey ($105) and we were staying in Puerto Morelos, around half an hour away, so we also had the cost of the taxi, but we felt it was worth every penny. We were there from 10.30 -3am and you get unlimited drinks - fab night out!

Fab Night!. What a amazing place, we visited on a monday evening, brought our VIP gold member tickets through first choice rep for $110. He recommended to us to get the collectivo into playa del carmen and be at coco bongo by 10.15.He told us, that the people who book the vip tickets with transportation sometimes dont leave there hotels till 10.30, and time they get there, all the tables are taken!Anyways back to the show, was a absolute great night, its not just for the young, for people of all ages, theres music for everyone in the show! Our waiter (believe hes name was edwardo or something like that) was amazing, getting us drinks before we had even finished the ones we already had.Anyways shall defo be visiting coco bongo again if am in mexico again!AMAZINGGGGGGGGGGGGGG
must see. Fab night, continuous drink and non stop entertainment!! Great seats, only bad thing is lack of toilets in the vip area (only 1)!

Fantastic night out!!!!!. My husband and I went to this in July 2012. Wow, what a fantastic night out. We brought VIP tickets through our hotel rep, and I would highly recommend this to everyone. For VIP tickets, you get a table and chairs with a good view to all the entertainment, You also get unlimited drinks all night. You get a waiter, who just continuously re stocks your drink throughout the evening. Not once did i have an empty glass in front of me. I was 5 months pregnant when we went, and I would not normally go to a club when pregnant, however i was told by my rep, that I would be fine here, and wow, was I looked after. The staff made sure i had the table closest to the toilets. Also when I left, they took us through an emergency exit, so that I would not risk getting crushed in the crowds. The club is more of a show then a club. You can go in from 2230, and the entertainment starts about 2300, and goes on till about 0300-0330 in the morning. There is not really any room for anyone to dance in the standing area, as there is so many people there, however it is not really a dancing club as such. There is a main stage which is a few levels up (but great viewing from everywhere in the club). Every 5-10 minutes, there is a tribute act on the stage, or some kind of entertainment going on. This includes Michael Jackson, Elvis Presley, Lady Gaga, Madonna etc. There is also entertainment acts that take place on the ground floor (again everyone has a good view of this) which includes comedy acts, acrobats and mock fight scenes between spiderman and his enemies. I could not recommend this place enough. I obviously wasn't drinking, but I had such a fantastic night out, and would defiantly go again if I was ever in Playa del Carmen, The entertainment was amazing, the staff was very attentive, and it was just an amazing night out.

Extreme.Fun.Sexy.Entertaining.Music. Best Club yet !!!!. Offers a variety of concerts real look alikes (not actual singer/artist) !!! Definitely the best shows all kind of acrobatic crazy shows while listening to great variety of music. TourguideTourists and different party habits and culturefrom around the world makes coco bongo.a unique partying experience a must upon arrival. Servers are great just.stick to one though tip about 100pesos and they'll be loyal all night . Would move to.Cancun just to party here every night !!!****

Wicked Place!. Went as a couple and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves!! Nothing else like this place anywhere! One off! Wicked night! Went VIP, excellent waiter service all night, every time you looked you had a new drink! Bit expensive but well worth it! Highly recommend a visit!!

AMAZING!!!!!. My boyfriend and I recently stayed in the Grand Sirenis hotel where we bought our tickets for CoCo Bongos from Yair. We went VIP which was the best decision ever. Yair made sure we had great seats and looked after us well. The show was amazing and so was the waiter who kept us well stocked on drinks throughout the show!

BY FAR THE BEST NIGHT OF MY LIFE!. I went to Playa del Carmen in December with my best friend and we had a blast. It was a little squishy on the floor but we ended up dancing all night on the bar so we didn't mind. The money was worth it 100%! The staff was amazing, my glass was never empty. We got free VIP passes for another night so we came back again. I would love to go there again no questions asked and it's an appropriate place to go with your parents as well. When I went there were people from 18 to 65 all having a blast. If you get a chance to ever go I highly recomend it

Don't miss it. If you aren't a drinker, 65$ is a lot, but it's really entertaining. Be prepared for a late nite, club opens at 10:30, shows start @ 11, our bus wasn't returning til 3:45, so we grabbed a cab at 2.
wow. just a full-on visual, action-packed, noisy night!
Party!. This is a great show and you don't see the time going. You have to go there at least once in you life!

The Party of Your Life In One Night!. Just imagine Mardi Gras, Cirque de Soleil and New Year's in Times Square all rolled into one night at the Playboy Mansion. This is the party of your life and like nothing you have ever seen before. All-inclusive drinks but crowded - find a waiter, tip him good (US$15-20) and he'll bring you drinks all night long.

Coco Bongo, a must see. Coco bongo is truly an experience. Music and fun for all ages of people. My girlfriend and I went together. The show starts at 11:30 and goes until 3:30. I expected it to be a night club, but they play main stream music for ten minutes and then there is a musical act for ten minutes. The night goes by so fast and there is never a dull moment. Amazing experience!

brilliant night. what a great night we had. glad we paid to go with thomas cook as we found that it had to best view, wouldnt have like to go without them as the whole lower floor people were crammed in like sardines and can imagine that it would have been far to warm

Fab night! A must!!. Excellent show!! The performances and routines are just amazing and keep going for hours. Costumes etc are all amazing and I was so impressed.The music between each act is excellent and the party atmosphere is fab! Loved every moment! You get waiter service wherever you are so don't miss a thing and the only problem is the time goes so quick!!

Definitely go! But bare in mind.... If your in Cancun/Playa area then you must go here, appropriate for all ages! It's not a club as we're normally used to, it's a show so most of the people are just there to watch. The performances - Tron, Spiderman and Michael Jackson - are really good. Definitely add it to your to do list, it's just off 5th Avenue in Playa which has a great atmosphere and very safe - hundreds of shops/restaurants open til late!Few things to note:Don't fall for reserving a table unless you actually want one, this is the VIP area. You do get a seat but everyone stands anyway, you will have your own waiter but every time they give you drinks you'll need to tip and you already pay for open bar anyway so save your money. The bars are never that packed - the bar an actually tapped me on my shoulder asking if I wanted a drink! Also, I would say the better atmosphere is in the lower section, VIP areas are high and views from ground are just as good.The drinks, according to my wife, are watered down and i wouldn't be surprised - they were shooting Jim Beam out of a water gun!

AMAZING !. We take the VIP places , its 120US$ /person , normally it's 55$ but its better to pay for the VIP , we have a big places , we were like 20 persons for 2 barman , a lot of service !
The shows its really good , everyone should like this !
Don't hesit ! Just go there :)
excellentay. brillent fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! must go and see its and absolute great night out with so mny shows to see and great atmosphere!!

Brilliant Night!. Really enjoyed our night at Coco Bongos. 6 of us went in total and we all had a superb time. The acts were fantastic and the dancing inbetween was just as fun!The only thing that really really ticked me off was how many people that they cram in that place. You COULD NOT move!!! I went to the toilet and didn't want to go again for the rest of the night. I am quite little and people were pushing shoving and stamping on me!It surely can't be safe to have that many people in there at one time.Luckily I was up on centre stage dancing so managed to avoid the chaos on the floor below. If it hadn't have been for that then I wouldn't have enjoyed it so much! But all in all the atmosphere, the music and the shows were fantastic. I would go again but next time I would go VIP!!
Fab. You must visit this place. It's unlike anything in the UK. Very crowded though so wear shorts ans a vest, it gets v hot. The entertainment is amazing.

Crowded is not unique!!!!!. Payed 65 bucks each for VIP tickets. Had to stand on bleachers crowded by a lot of people. Could not move. Some people had tables to sit at which is what I am sure I payed for but we got to stand in front of the tables. I am 45 years old, I do not want to stand up all night. Maybe my expectations were higher than they should have been. Now, do not get me wrong entertainment value was great. The show was awesome. Fun! Fun! Fun! Our waiter JJ was perfect kept drinks coming. The environment left a lot to be desired. For the money, I would have rather parasailed or spent additional time on a jetski.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G night out!!. Definetly worth to do "VIP".. we went with our Coco Bongo REP and it was brilliant he took good care of us, better than our friends gone with Thomas Cook (VIP as well) because they got there later when the best seats were already taken, what a shame...Every one should go to Coco Bongos! It's a one in a lifetime experience!
all night long. our adult kids enjoyed this establishment, they thought it reminded them of a cirque de solie type show.

Must See!. My boyfriend and I went two nights in a row, we had SO much fun. A little pricey but well worth it, when you get there! Music and performances and amazing, and the service was AWESOME! I never saw the bottom of my glass. It's unfortunate if you get a bad spot because it's hard to see. We went a second night because Jesus, our Coco Bongo rep from our resort promised he'd get us a good view, and he did! Try and go to the second or third floor for better view, better service, and easier access to the bathroom. (tipping works if nothing else does). Going to make this a short review, but basically, DONT MISS THIS!

Wow! Best clubbing experience. Period.. I have been to the Coco Bongo in Cancun and now also Playa Del Carmen and it does not disappoint. it is a bit pricey (especially from Thurs-Saturday ... I believe Monday - Wednesday are cheaper) but well worth the price of admission. Its like a club meats theatre with audience participation. Awesome experience. Strongly reccommend getting a table as then the server is constantly coming to you for drinks - we tipped our guy $20 at the start and gave him another $20 at the end and he was very dilligent in making sure no one at our group was thirsty! In Cancun when we went it was a group of six - all in our twenties and we had a blast. In Playa Del Carmen we went with a group of 8 and the ages ranged from 23 to 57 and everyone had a blast! It really is good for all ages --- as long as you like music and dancing! Two thumbs way up!

One-of-a-Kind Experience. Take the most over-the-top Vegas night club, add a dose of Rio de Janeiro, mix in a sing-a-long with a couple thousand people of every great rock and pop song in history, and then drop a Cirque du Solei performance in the middle and that comes close to describing Coco Bongo. I would recommend this is something you must do at least once in your life. Hint: Take a 5-hour energy drink before you go. You'll be partying very very late.
This is a must. Fab fab fab, like nowhere you have ever been, fabulous entertainment.

You'll either love this place or hate it. You'll either love this place or hate it. We hated it. The place feels like a live circus rather than a night club. The lines to get in are very long despite paying extra to skip the lines. The open bar had cheap-quality drinks. The place was packed to the point that it was impossible to maneuver around or even dance.

FUN!. Get the VIP package so that you are near the stage and get to see everything. the VIP package also includes open bar and you don't even have to ask for drinks, they keep them coming. My husband and I went with our 20 year old son. The show was a fun lip sync style show that was well choreographed and costumed as well as some cirque style aerial work. In between each act is great dance music, confetti, balloons and more....the staff is attentive, fun and take pictures of you and the characters for you to purchase if you like them, It is sort of like a theme park experience for adults.Worth the money and unforgettable fun

Amazing show - go VIP so worth it. Had a amazing night. Great dance music and an AMAZING show. Picked up from our hotel at 9.45 Was in Coco Bongo's by 10.30pm ready for the show We had our own table in VIP area, we had a great time.

Good fun. Felt a bit uneasy walking in here - dark corridors, not many happy staff, but once inside the entertainment is captivating. Tribute acts mime medleys of popular songs on stage with decent choreograohy - there's everyone here from Elvis to Freddie Mercury to Lady Gaga to Spiderman!
fantastic night. vip service a must ...no queing own waiter all night best seats the show is fantastic
a couple of old wrinklies. Fantastic night out , even for a couple of old wrinklies like me and my wife, what a great party.Pay that little extra for V.I.P. member, well worth it

Be warned! Pay your money then hope that you get what you paid for.. What a hassle. We arranged transportation and express entry with a representative from Coco Bongo for 18 people. The transportation to/from was as described. When we got to Coco Bongo we were first put at the head of the line, and then unexpectedly relocated to the back of the line. We were told not to worry, but this was not the express entry we were promised. The person that sold us the package was fired that day, and guess what, the manager that we had originally spoken with had started a two week vacation that day. We were eventually escorted to a very nice area, but I did not like the hassle of being promised something, then having to raise hell to get it. Buyer Beware!!!!

An experience you won't forget!. My husband and I went to this club and it was an awesome experience. We purchased a package which included transportation there and back, admission and drinks for the night. This club is such an experience. There is high energy music and dancing in between great shows. From 11:00 - 2:30, there is no-stop partying. The performers were phenominal, the drinks were great and the music was hot. Do take a nap before you go, if you don't go out much. There's so much to see and you don't want to miss a bit of it!
What a night !. Great place - every city should have one. Make sure you get a VIP ticket so you have a seat - gets so crowded on the main floor area.
Great. Loved it, been to the cancun Coco Bongo and thought this one was just as great! Loved it.

Had the most amazing night ever. Just returned from Mexico and visited Coco Bongo, jam packed full of entertainment from start to finish, the show, costumes and atmosphere were fantastic. We went gold member and it was worth every penny, great seats and drinks topped up all the time. I honestly feel every big city back home should have a coco bongo it was like a tonic...BRILLIANT x

Fantastic evening. Now this place had it all great place to watch everyone swinging and dancing around My wife got took up on the stage and had a great time. I even ended up on the bar dancing also xPlease dont miss this place as its fantastic x
Fantastic nothing like it. Great prepare for big night do VIP pass well worth it
Show increible!. best show ive ever seen at a club!Crowed, good music, good performance, good cocktails, i loved it!

AMAZING!. This club is amazing. I'm not sure why we don't have one here at home...it would make a killing!Non-stop entertainment, great music, great party atmosphere and lots of dancing.... A must see!
AMAZING!!!!. CocoBongo is a MUST SEE!!! The place is packed, expensive to get in, but well worth the money!!!!!

best night in Playa!!. if you're in Playa you should definitely go there!! the shows were amazing & they played varied genres of music!! that night i went is unforgettable!! definitely stop by and get a blue hawaii!! best one i've tasted!!
Wow. Been to clubs all over the u.s. coco bongo was the best club by far that I have been to.

Like the grand final (last 5 min) of great show, just never stops, till 3AM, and always as intense!. I had not been in a disco for almost 20 years. My sons are still going out so they are the knowledgeable ones here. I was blown away first by the "cover charge" of $140 for First Class or VIP whatever they call it. Its not a cover charge, its the price to see the show. It is not a disco, its non stop live entertainment, with fascinating light show, with "Cirque-du-Soleil" style choreographs, with dancers, with thousands of people thrilled by the intensity of the sound and experience, and all of that with hundreds of security staff and cleaners that keep sweeping the floors and managing the place so it keeps going.It is the most intense party place we have ever seen or experienced. If you go to Playa Del Carmen or Cancun, do not miss that. Looking at reviews, it looks like the price to get in does vary a lot so perhaps we paid too much. I would try to get in at a lower price the next time, but I would go back with their VIP passes. Less wait and you get to be higher with a small table so you get some space. Downstairs the regular tickets get squeezed together and wait long before getting in. And the main show (because it pops out from everywhere, walls, ceiling, etc!) is staged on the second floor, so you will see better with a VIP and a bit of elevation.Oh! And the music? Just top hits from Elvis Presley to Elvis Costello, Michael Jackson to Queen, Bee Gees to Frank Sinatra, Black Eye Peas, all top hits, all the time, fireworks, dancers, acrobats, confettis, lasers, you'll get it all!Just go, its an experience not to be missed.
Best night out I've ever had!. There is nothing to not like about this trip. Make sure you do VIP or gold member as all your drinks are included and they just keep on flowing!!!
Fun and a great show!. Loved it! Wild and fun show. Love the visual effects, then music and the dancers. Waiters work hard too.

Amazing. Great night. Real fun. Good choice of drinks. If don't want to be caught up in the crowds pay extra like we did for gold members where you get a table raised up on a balcony. Nothing bad to say a must see show

Great night out. Must say that I was not particualrly looking forward to the evening, but throroghly enjoyed it. The place was packed creating a good atmosphere, even with canned applause. A personal bar man ensured value for money from the free bar.
The show was really enjoyable and would recommend people visit.
Must visit. You have to visit, excellent night great fun, book VIP area as the service and views are the best

The best disco!. The title above summarizes it all. It is simply the best nightclub/disco I have ever been! You go in thinking you will be visiting a great disco, but Coco Bongo is much more than that. Just be aware of the promoters outside selling the tickets. If you are in a group, don't go for their first price on offer. Try to get a discount - you will get it! Also, try to be 100% sure that the table/VIP area they are selling you is for real. There are no places to sit down except if you go for this option. But if you stand up for a couple of hours (or more!) is well worth it anyway!
Fantastic!. Amazing shows and structure. Fantastic place !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Amazing Evening!. We booked an evening at Coco Bongos through Thomson on their VIP package and it was really worth it.The show starts at about 10.30pm and continues until around 2am. There aren't any intervals and they just play music etc between the different acts which all adds to the party atmosphere! The drinks were included in our package and we never went without one!

Great show, but definitely way too crowded!. I had heard so many great things about CocoBongo, yet when we arrived it was completely different. We got our tickets from a promoter on the beach, which was supposed to include drinks and a table. Shorty after we arrived the server moved us to another table, only to have us kicked off of once another group had arrived. We were left in the middle of the crowd (which definitely was over 1000 people) to get shoved and hit by the staff. The show was great, and so was the music, but the amount of people, and the constant shoving and people sweeping over my feet was unbearable. I arrived in a great mood, and had to leave early due to the crowd and staff. The crowd was also very young ( by young I mean no more than 18 year olds). They seemed to enjoy it without a doubt. Definitely not my cup of tea!

Only in Mexico.... Where you will find yourself at an awesome show-stopping nightclub where acrobats are hanging down just a few feet above you and you feel like you have front row seats to Grammy*s. Didn't know what to expect and don't want to spoil it for people who have not gone but it's so worth it to check it out!!! We paid about $55 US at the door of the club (but get there before 10 pm, they raise the prices if you buy tix when the line opens at 10:30). It includes free drinks but drinks are pretty water down. No need to get seats--if you like music you will be dancing all night anyway! The show starts at 11 pm and ends around 2:30. You dance btwn the shows and during the show. Performances were so fantastic. Try to go on a non-wknd night though so it's not so crowded! Also, a 'table' is exactly what it means--u just get a table but u're still standing. We didn't get a table and was fine being on the sides of the floor in the standing area. Better than any Vegas show I've seen (and even beats some NY stuff too!)

Best Night club!!!. Here you can dance drink, ear and enjoy wonderful shows Circous De Soulei style. They have about 50 shows throught the night!!! The all last for about 5 to 10 minutes and they are showed in set of 5 or 6 presentations at the time and you can dance in between shows or even while the shows are running. Excellent concept and experience.

Awesome!. Highly recommend. This place is awesome! We go every year and it gets better each time. We went with a group of 18 people and they got us the best seats and service we could ask for. I will definately go back.

Unbreakable!. I normally Break place, see jack Daniels, but CocoBungo is Unbreakable. Will not bend, will not break. Seccurity is tight, bottle service attentive, if a bit pushy...Shot girls out for blood - watch out!This place seriously rocks!

Strange experience. Coco Bongo, what is it? A discotheque? A show? live entertainment? It is a bit of all and yes the entrance fee is quite high, but the show is fantastic. The service of the waiters was fast and acurate! So one hell of a crazy party!! Just friendly people, everybody has the same goal! Having fun!If you like to go out and are in playa del Carmen, you need to try this once!

Great fun. CB is basically a big nightclub with a stage at one end. It has dance floor where it's standing room only and then VIP tables on the raised sides which give a great view of the stage and the dance floor. We chose to go for the VIP package which certainly wasn't cheap but in hindsight certainly makes life easier and considering how packed the dance floor got a darn sight more comfortable! As part of the price it was unlimited drinks served by your own waiter. If you intend to have a good drink then the VIP is the way forward.CB is billed as being a "show" but please don't think The West End or Broadway!! The show starts with a random Beetles medley type thing which didn't really work and in my opinion was a bit lame. After this the show consisted of people in dodgy wigs miming (they all mimed, there's no actually singing) to acts such as Madonna, Katy Perry etc. Mixed in with this are music videos being screened whilst the next part of the show is being prepared.A lot of the show seemed very random and we looked at each other several times and said "WTF"!!! However, the atmosphere was absolutely electric and when the music was pumping and the drinks were flowing there's no doubt that most people were having a great time. If you want a fun night out then this is the place to be.

Wow, what to say about this place.... We visited Coco Bongo in May 2012. I wasn't sure what to expect to be honest but this is perhaps a good thing as you can't imagine what this place is like.We got express tickets so all drinks included and apparently a shorter queue (though I didn't notice to be honest). I'd definitely recommend these tickets though as I can imagine it'd be a pain having to keep going to the bar for drinks (you get waiter service).The place was smaller than I'd imagined but was really busy (we went on a Thursday night) but not too crowded.The show is a mixture of shows with acrobats and dancers, and music with videos showing so it's like a nightclub with live shows mixed in.I would highly recommend a visit, there's no way you can imagine what it's like unless you go!

Choose VIP section. If going, go for the VIP deal as you get in a bit earlier than the rest and you have your own table and waiter service. It is a bit more expensive but it is worth it as the place can get very very full and busy. Plus you get an amazing view of the stage.
JUST FANTASTIC!. Fantastic night!!!! That is all I can say! You must see it to believe it. Only advice - pay for VIP - get table and waiters. We will be doing this again next year!!!
One off experience. Just an amazing original club! Very entertaining and great service with unlimited drinks!

Coco Bongo fun night out. This place is great if you want some drinks, dancing and a show - it really is slightly bonkers but really good fun. We had Gold member tickets, avoided the VERY long que, had reserved seating and as many drinks as you can handle!The show was great! Excellent music, acrobatics and dancing, we tipped the waiter at the start of the night and our drinks were never empty. We were a little dubious about going but it really was a great night out. Would highly recommend to all.

Best club EVER!!!. This is THE place to go!!!We went to the coco bongo with 14 of our friends, and EVERYBODY LOVED IT. This is a mixt of cabaret, show and dance club. The performer are so good, the music is perfect.We went with Diana, the organizator of our hotel, we paid 40$ usd each for entrance bar open. We had reserved place right in front of the stage. It was the best night ever!

Fun Night!!!! Pay extra for VIP. We went to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen in April 2012. The club was packed (we went on a Saturday night on a bus leaving from our resort) We did not pay extra for VIP which includes a table and waitress which was a huge mistake. We did not have a great view of the show and getting drinks from the bar was difficult. We still had and great time (made the best of it). On our next trip we will pay the extra and really be able to enjoy the show.

This place is amazing - but you have to see it to believe it!. A_MAZ_ING!! But seeing is believing! It puts Vegas to shame. Definitely recomended for all ages too as its not your typical nightclub its more of a showcase of tribute acts and shows -- Want to return for sure it was incredible!
just as good the second time!!!!. The show is fantastic. The service is great and the drinks never end........althought the headache the next day doesnt either.....lol Really is a must see !!!

Coco Bongo a must do.. We went as a group of 24 with VIP Express tickets to the upper balcony (not as crowded as the main floor with a great view of the whole club). Once the show starts it's non-stop music and dance with various characters flying around (such as Spiderman & Captain America) our waiter kept the drinks coming after we told him what we were drinking at the beginning of the night.What a great show with music from Queen to Madonna.
Incredible. I've never seen anything like it! Brilliant night out, a real experience not to be missed! Fantastic music, packed arena, just a thoroughly enjoyable evening.

Fat Cat Catamaran. We used the Fat Cat service for a group of 5 families and had a blast. From the gentle rocking of the boat to the kids and adults alike laying on the net hanging between the front portion of the boat to the snorkeling we had a blast. The rum punch was good and potent. We took an afternoon outing and rented the whole boat for our group of 23. This was perfect and we did'nt fight any crowds.

Amazing showw. Never imagine to can see a show like that inside a disco! A really entertaining place, amazing show, a lot of people, open bar. A little too crowdy but we passed the best Night in Playa.

best wedding reception!. After going to coco bongo in Cancun I wanted ot return. This time we went as part of our wedding reception. We got a great group rate through our hotel (sandos) and my husband and I got vip bands. We were in a section that had decent views, but our tip is stick together when a group as some other people got "Added" to our group area which made it very crowded adn some of my guests were squished back quite a bit. Service was excelllent, show was better than I had anticipated, as it was better than Cancun I thought, and we bought the souvenire photo and frame they took of us. Best part was tossing my bouquet from the stage to the thousand people!TIP - If you have back problems ask for a chair (As my husband got one). And try to get a babysitter until late as you wont want to leave (our sister in law and her husband left begrugingly at midnight)

Do not miss it!. I read a lot of reviews of Coco Bongo and was on the fence about going because of the crowds. I cannot stand being in a packed club where you can't even move, and that is what I was picturing. We ultimately decided to go on a Monday because we thought the crowd might be more reasonable. I am not sure what it would have been like on a Friday or Saturday, but the Monday crowd was nothing more than any other popular bar/ club would be. Not a problem at all. We purchased the speed pass ticket (I believe it was $5 extra) so that we could wait in the shorter line. That got us a spot in front of the room; we did have to look up at the stage but really didn't mind. We did not have chairs, but we were allowed to sit on the steps. It was a seriously amazing time. The shows were all fantastic, the drinks were free-flowing, and everyone around us was super friendly and having a similarly great time. Our waiter, Jonathan, took great care of us - we always had a new drink when needed. I tried to explain Coco Bongo to a friend who asked if she would like it; I told her I couldn't imagine anyone not liking it. They played every fun song you could want and the shows were high quality - lots of talent here.A few random tips/ facts: I am sure other girls will be glad to hear the bathroom was very clean and there was never a line! They had all kinds of drinks - the people in front of us were doing shots (some you have to pay for with the "shots girls" coming around, but some are included), I had wine, and my friend had piña coladas. And be careful you don't slip on the confetti which is in abundance by the end of the night!

FUN is the only way to describe Coco Bongo. The atmosphere in Coco Bongo hits you as soon as you get in. The performances are well rehearsed, varied and enthralling. There are constant surprises - balloons, confetti, pyrotechnics. The night seems to appeal to all age groups.It is crowded and loud and fun, but if that's what you're looking for then this is not a problem. It's not a place to meet people though but good to go with a group.

Very cool and unique show!. This was my second time at Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen, Mexico and I enjoyed every minute of it! It is an awesome place to party and watch live shows with all different types of music. The first time I went was better because I got there earlier and I had a better view from the very top. This time I got there around 11:30 at night on a Monday and it was super crowded and there was not a lot of space to move around and I was stuck on the lower level where I had to look up to watch the shows. I would recommend getting there before the show starts to get a better space to watch the show and dance. Overall, this is one cool show that everyone can enjoy!
Lots of Packed Fun. Loved the feel and show. Over crowded and suggest not going on a Friday or Saturday night.
love this club, it is out of this world. Were there in January and I went back in a way in April and absolutely liked it again.........

Fun, fun, fun. Stumbled upon this place one late night after having been in other bars in Playa del Carmen. This was the most fun by far. At 2:30am this place was packed. There is a bar in the middle of the floor, with balconies overhead where professional performers sing, dance, etc. They have some great shows where they interact with the patrons. If you happen to be standing close to the bar do expect to be pulled up onto the bar to dance, especially if you are a woman. This place keeps on going with music, dance, performances and drinks until the early hours of the morning. I think they stop letting people in around 4:00am as the next day we could not get in at that hour.It deinitely is worth going to, even if for an hour, if not for the whole night.
Even kids enjoyed it. Managed to take kids to a kids party to give them a flavour for what it's like, only dislike was too many in the place, wouldn't be allowed back in UK

Coco Bongo, Playa Del Carmen. Absoluting amazing and unforgettable. We bought the VIP pass from the sales rep at the resort. The bus picked us up around 10 pm and brought us back to the resort at 330am. Getting into the club is a bit overwhelming because of the amount of people..it holds 1400! The sales rep literally took us through the line up and and then a rep inside brought us to our section and table. We had our own waiter and he was constantly checking on us. Liquor was included in our VIP package. A few members in our group are smokers and he even took them outside to have their smoke and came back to bring them back to our table. There were constant performances. They were great! I would definitely go back. It cost us 130 US each but we were walked though each step and well looked after. After you get over the initial shock of the place, you will have a blast! It's a definite must see.
great night. would have to back a second time went with rep pub crawl before and vip too much slamming before hand so a clear head next time the show was stunning visually

AMAZING!!. I have been to this amazing establishment twice and I loved it both times! I was there in March 2010 and loved being asked to dance on the stage and having VIP spots to the right of the stage gave us a spectacular view of the show! The second time I went, April 2012, I danced all night on the floor stage, the upper stage and I WAS A PART OF THE SHOW!! I loved the attention, the energy in the room, the show was SPECTACULAR and the MUSIC was amazing! Will I go again? HELL YEAH!!! You bet I would! This is a MUST SEE for people wanting to dance but have something different than a 'traditional' night club setting. I wish we had one in Vancouver! Be prepared to have the time of your life but be aware of your surroundings at all times. And it is loud!! So if you don't like loud music, lots of laughs and free flowing tequila, this probably is not for you :). THANK-YOU FOR YET ANOTHER ENJOYABLE NIGHT!!!
A great time!. This show was so much fun. We especially enjoyed the Spiderman and Michael Jackson performances.

A must!!. This club is unbelieveable! If you visit playa del carmen you must go here!
$55 entry and all you can drink. Best club ever!
Amazing!!!. Great show/disco bar! amazing place! Worth a visit!!!

Fantastic!. I started the night feeling a little tired but couldn't believe how fast the time flew by. We had a group of 20 in a section and our waiter had us with at least two drinks at all times. I had heard that the bathroom line was long but I never saw a line. I would go again in a minute!

amazing!. no words to describe this place!!!we booked this through our holiday red - got a table which i highly recommend! free drink all night - but they charge TEN DOLLARS for red bull!!The waiters are brilliant! the show is amazing and i cannot wait to go back!!

Worst night ever i wish i never wasted the money. We had heard that coco bongo was totally amazing and we had to go, well we went and they give you a drink whilst your bag is being checked int he queue, the drink is vile. inside it is like being packed into a tin of sardines, the staff have no respect and the security physical kick and hit you as you walk past. It is impossible to get to the bar for your all inclusive drinks. The security wouldnt let us up to the floor that was reserved for us so instead threw everyone down the steps so that we couldnt see the show. The toilet attendant looks under the door whilst your on it. There are clubs far better in England I would not recommend this, save your money and do the captain hook dinner cruise instead, now that is entertainment.

Show was great. The show was great, and the price was OK considering it was open-bar, but the place was WAY too packed and everyone would probably die if ever there was a fire in the place. We were stuck standing in the way of the busboys and kept getting drinks spilled on us so make sure you go EARLY if you want a good spot.

past it!. If you were 18 you would have a great time....too loud and people packed in like sardines......the rep took us to 2 bars before for cocktails but they lacked character and we were just herded in and out!

Different. This is a night club meets cabaret show. Food entertainment and all-inclusive drinks included in the price of entry but we went as part of the Thomson Playa Bar Crawl which is a must do for all ages. I would advised booking a VIP table as the Mexicans don't seem to have any concept of safety. The inside is tiered with floors on top of other ones, where people are rowed too, so you cant move once your in place. The toilets operate on a one in one out system, so you can end up waiting 30 mins for a pee.

Its worth it. Loved it here, had a blast my monster wife and i went with a representative from the hotel.He took us to our seating which was not VIP but the third floor amazing view you could see everything we went during the week wasn't that packed got excellent service well worth it.

Best time of my holiday. Until coco bongos i had seen nothing like this it was amazing really cant recommend it more than im about to. my partner and i paid for the vip gold member which means u get your own table and free unlimited premium drinks like smirnoff and sol. not the cheaper watered down stuff. my partner doesnt drink and even he was amazed by the night. the shows were spectacular and there was about 25 different ones a night. my favorite was tron. they did scenes from the film and were flying about the roof was amazing. I am that determind to go back me and my friend are planning to go in august i loved it tht much. shud be way higher on the list of attractions.
