Wow! Totally unexpected!. Don't miss it! Gold package well worth the money, otherwise you'll be standing in tight quarters for the entire 4 hour show. Really a lot of fun.

Wow, Wow, Wow...... Possibly one of the best nights out we have ever had. 4 couples (over 40 - but still think we are 21!) Go for the Gold Member VIP entrance - more expensive but worth every penny. Your own tables and barman who keeps your glass full all night. The shows are just fantastic. Would recommend the entertainment spot to any body. You just cannot miss a visit.
What a Night. Fantastic, if you go get the VIP package, well worth it, great service, great views, great atmosphere, just a great night

Brillant Night Out. This show is brillant loved every minute of it and stayed to the end which was sometime after 3am. We got VIP tickets for about 105 USD dollars which I recommend as you get great seats and a great view although some people may prefer to be down on the ground floor amongst the party goers. Can't comment on transport as we walked from our Hotel. Loved it so much we nearly went twice.
Fantastic!. Great entertainment, great security, drinks kept coming all night, fantastic fun!!!

Incredible!!. Absolutely blown away by Coco Bongos!! Did not know it was open until 5am...unfortunately our taxi was taking us home at 2am....did not want to leave! Pre-wedding night out, got to dance on the actual stage and on the bar :D The show was amazing!! x

WELL WORTH A VISIT. Good fun was had by all! Really definitely worth visiting Coco Bongo! All i would say is to pay the extra few dollars for a table/waiter service because otherwise you spend a LONG TIME getting drinks at the bar! We went with a family group and all members were aged between 20 and 55! Everyone had a fantastic night though and we really can´t recommend it highly enough!!
Night Life. This was well worth visiting even if your are over 50 lol. A night to remember.

Did not help my ADD. Coco Bongo is EXACTLY like a fancy theatre, except it's not stuffy and dull, you don't have to wait until intermission to get a drink, and you don't pay $150 for tickets.Coco Bongo is EXACTLY like a nightclub, except for the music doesn't suck, you don't pay $12 for a beer (as a matter of fact, it's open bar!), and you don't have to wear stupid pointy shoes and a blazer.It was actually so fun. They do 25 short (5 minute-ish) shows that are actually really well put on. They did the Beatles, Grease, Madonna, Lady Gaga, LMFAO, some acrobatic thing where guys hang from some ropes, some latin music, Tron, and a bunch of other stuff. Awesome A/V. So good! Just go!
get the gold member section. gold member is more expensive but really really worth it.

Crazy Fun. This show was a great time. We purchased tickets from an individual working at The Royal so I am not sure what tickets we had but it included tables and a personal waiter. The drinks never seemed to stop coming and the music/shows seemed to go on forever. The shows were all the perfect length to keep your attention and entertained. Its pretty hard to describe so you just need to experience it yourself. Best money spent on the trip.
excellent show,highly recommend this. great service and shows were very well done.definitely go vip and line up goes faster and better seats and personal bartender for wuicker service.

Coco Bongo madness. What an experience! This place is a must do! The show was awesome and the drinks continuous. I personally wouldn't be eager to go again as if you've done it once, that's enough, but its an experiece of a lifetime. It consist of a show with a difference, lots of lighting, smoke, drama and old time 70's and 80's music. A little tacky but great fun, especially after drinking tons of Tequila. Your given at least 3 alcoholic drinks on the way into the venue, which sets the scene for the remainder of the night. Drinks flow all night, which is all inclusive in the price. A memorable night, especially after dancing on the stage. One small issue though, throughout the night I kept feeling something burn me literally, it was only noticed the next day that I had burn marks down my front and on my arm from the extractor fan above our head, spitting out some sort of electrics.
What a place!. Likes - great show, great experience!Dislikes - none!Worth every penny, stop thinking about it and just go!

GET THERE EARLY!!!. We went on a Saturday night and everyone was SO packed in there spilling drinks on your feet. Funny how things are different down there...the fire marshall would shut it down in the states! We didn't stay for the whole show due to the fact that you couldn't move...literally! They say it's all you can drink...if you could even get to the bar maybe you could drink! It was a pretty entertaining show though I must say. If I would have done a little more research I would have definitly spent the extra money fro VIP table service and gone on Tuesday night! I do wanna see it again and just plan it better!!!

I had no idea what I was getting myself into.... Coco Bongo was the best thing I ever did in Playa del Carmen. When I first got to Playa Del Carmen we stayed at the Playa Palms Beach hotel, I got the impression it was a very party like environmen and became skeptical about this town. It felt like Bali + Koh Phanagan - very touristy and commercial if you have been there. Coco Bongo was fantastic!!!! I generally don't go clubbing but I love good music, the opportunity to drink and the opportunity to watch a wonderful talented fun show. Coco Bongo is a club + concert + a Circ du Soliel show all in one.* For $65 we got cover with unlimited alcohol and an express entrance to avoid waiting in line. * They gave us an alcoholic drink on arrival* We arrived at about 11ish and got a standing spot on the side corner - It was good for me since I am short and had the opportunity to climb a couple steps up when my view was blocked by a tall person.* It would have been nice to have seats at the beginning...but after a while it didn't matter because I was having the time of my life. Overall it was the funnest thing I did in Playa!!!!!

The best night we've had in a long time 5*. Me and my boyfriend decided last minute to go to the coco bongo club everyone was telling us to go but we Wernt to sure but were glad we did it was amazing. Pulled up in a taxi and strait away there were staff asking if we were VIP or open area we were VIP so we went strait through got our wrist band and got a shot of tequila and a cocktail!!! We were then shown right to our table introduced to our waiter for the evening. We ordered our 1st drinks as it was open bar we tipped the waiter 100 peso after that our drinks were never empty we even got bucket full of bottled water on ice didn't even ask!! Music before and between the shows were awesome got us up dancing I loved everysong!! It started to get really busy downstairs and I need the looI was abit worried a woman going down on my own but I asked the waiter where it was and he personally took me down to the door perfect gentleman. The show were amazing also good music the dancers were good and the acrobats all the same we didn't leave the club till 4.30am that's when the shows finished but it doesnt actually shut till 6am I think could be 7? I definatly recommend this place we went on a weds was still busyish for the better and I'd also say go VIP its totally worth it and tipping the waiter goes a long way!!! Hope you enjoy it as much as we did !!
What a brilliant night. High quality cirque du soliel type entertainment. Fantastic acts and music. Pay extra and go VIP - better view, open bar, own waiter and own toilets. well worth paying extra.

Best Time Ever!!. We went after hearing so much about this place from others. Let me tell you it is worth every penny to go here! We paid the lowest price you could for the lower level seating and it was still awesome. It is vegas style entertainment meets club. Drinks are all part of the price you pay and it's worth it. If you don't like being crammed into a club and like your space though, I would suggest paying more for the higher levels as there is seating and more room.

amazing shows. there is a very good atmosphere, but this is a bit expensive. but don't go every night as the shows are always the same. the staff is very friendly, the place is very nice. go for VIP and you will be the king or the queen of the night. well placed in Playa Del Carmen, there are many other beautiful places around it.
Fell Short of the one in Cancun. Smaller.. bad drink serivce .. great entertainment

Big expectation but very poor results. they over sell the entries, double of capacity. People couldnt enjoy or dance because its not space at all. Show is good but people is pushing between others, not comfortable. Price its too high consider all this facts, you could pay $65 but not wait in lines is $80 per person, to stay stand up all show long.
Had a great time. Had a great time here! Great atmosphere and I would definitely come here again. I would recommend anyone traveling in that area to go check it out.

the best night out i have evr had!!. this has got to be the best night out anywhere in the world. It has something for everyone. All beer included in the price and waiter served to you. Mine was rum and cokes. Danced the night away. As a tourist from the uk I felt so safe in the VIP area and so well looked after. Defo again next year!

best night out in playa del carmen, mexico. club/show. starts at 11pm. we had table service, which included your own table with seating, a litre bottle of your choice of spirit, mixers and ice, and our own waiter to keep our glases topped up all night. great shows included, queen, madonna, michael jackson,beyonce, the mask, spiderman, moulin rouge, phantom of the opera and many more all alternated with classic and up to date club music for dancing. we left at 3.45am but night still young for the locals in there when the show had finished.

Wow, I wrote a review and you returned it saying I needed to make it about one thing.. I was about one thing. About how dangerous Cocobongos is. Did you return the review because you have some kind of deal with them? Can your staff not read? It was about one thing. Sad. I'll never use Trip Advisor again. I can't believer the b.s. you've pulled here.
worth every penny. Fun! Fun! Fun! if you go take the V.I.P. pass....Better view, less crowded

A MUST GO. Coco Bongo is both a show and disco. The shows are themed from the Beetles to Elvis to even Pirates of the Caribbean. Everyone did a fantastic job. The music and the drinks were great. You can stay for the whole entire night or end it at 3 like we did. As we went with out hotel rep we didn't have to wait long for drinks, they kept on coming. Also stand upstairs, its not as crowded and hot as it is down below in the mosh pit. We also went on a Tuesday as well and the price was much cheaper ;)It was truly an amazing night! However, we were told to stay away on weekends...I believe it LOL

Totally Amazing!!!. my husband & I just got home from our trip to Riviera Maya, our 1st time there & it GREAT!!! we had an all inclusive resort so he was content to stay there the whole time, I bought the ticets for Coco Bongo thru reps at our resort...so glad that I did, it is nothing we had ever seen & it was totally amazing from start to finish...the staff is great, even the ones in the bathrooms handing towles & opening the door...the show is beyond words. if you get the chance to go, don't pass it up...so glad we didn't!!!!

the most entertaining show ever.. VERY crowded but so amazingly entertaining you do not want to miss. Most hotels offer a premium package so that you can be in the balconies and not be in "general population" on the main dancefloor.

Fantastic Experience. Really enjoyed the shows. Great evening
Would have been even better if we had a bit more space as rather crowded
Incredible. Great place, not stop excitement for all ages. It goes for 4 1/2 hours. Very Vegas like.

Best 4 hours of extreme adrenaline you will ever have!. Cautiously went to this club knowing I would be amongst the "older" crowd there but had the time of my life! I wasn't sure if this was a bar, a dance club, or a theater. IT'S ALL OF THEM! Pricey to get in but worth every penny. Open bar, generous wait staff. Very good security. Lots of employees cleaning up confetti out of walkways. Worth the extra money to go VIP and have seats, table, VIP designated bathrooms. Amazing performances coming at you one after another and then again! All night long! Trapeze artists, imitators, comic book heros, WOW! Very dynamic 4 hour show! GO!

Outrages. Coco bongo is a must see while in cancun area. The show and facility is first class operation . The entertainers are unforgetable and the staff, from security to the waitiers, they will take care of all your needs . I recommend the VIP pass you will be glad you paid the extra few buck. Why not you're on vacation. I'm glad I went and will return when I'm in Mexico again. Thanks COCO BONGO!!! Troy L. in Virginia

Hands down the most fun nightclub. We visited Coco Bongo's in February and had no idea what to expect, except that it was going to be a late night. We booked into an excursion from our resort for $65 a person and that included your admission, drinks all evening and transportation to and from. We were at the Bahia Principe so it was about a 1/2 hour ride in. We couldn't believe the energy in the place and the fact that it kept your interest and attention for the full time (our bus dropped us off at 11:30pm and picked us up at 3:30pm). The performers and entertainers were first class and the music selections were varied enough to appeal to all different people. They didn't play the entire song, just enough to get people going and to add interest to the show. All in all, great time, don't miss it!
FUN!. An absolute blast! The VIP pass is the only way to go!
AMAZING!!!. Words can't express how amazing this experience was!! I would pay double what I paid ($60) to see it again!! Well worth it!
Coco Bongo Experience!. Superb night out! Music, dancing, confetti excellent night with a group f friends

Lots of excitement,would go back and take friends!. Wasn't expecting everything we saw! Our friend told us about the place and suggested paying the extra for the vip pass which was definitely worth it! They treated us awesome,never let our drinks get empty all night!!!!

Amazing!. I have never seen anything like this! The show they put on was so much fun and such high energy! They make the BEST Pina Colada that I've had in my whole life!! Went here with my BFF for her birthday and it was the best time we've had on one of her B-days! A truly great way to celebrate your vacation and recommend everyone go here! Upgrade to the Gold so that you get your own seat and private balcony! Totally worth it you don't have to be pushed and shoved around on the floor and you have a perfect view of the show!
Great time. Crowded but a great time, we bought bottle service so getting other than that was a pain
INCREDIBLE. I have been to a lot of the most popular clubs in the best cities and this one is definitely at the top of the list. A completely different experience and definitely worth the money.
The most exciting club ever.. We didn't expect too much but it was sold us as a must so gave in. Good job we did, we were amazed from start to finish. Would recommend to everyone!

The Best Club I Have Every Been at!. the only dislike is the thousands of people but you forget that once the party starts...a party unlike any other, with amazing music, acts, acrobatics, best waiting staff, confeti, balloons, shier craziness.....a party unlike any other

Well worth the late night. If you like a combination Las Vegas style show and Cirque Du Soleil, this show is it. The show starts late, about 11:30 and goes to about 3:00 am, so be prepared to stay up late and do some partying.We bought the VIP tickets, which, in our estimation, were well worth the extra cost. The stage is on one side of the facility, but is raised about 15 feet up in the air. There is a central area below, where all the heavy drinking and partying is happening, (and so packed you can barely move) but unless you are at the back of this central area it is hard to see all of the stage.The VIP seats are located at stage level circling the facility and looking down in to the central open area. We sat just to the left of the stage, and with VIP you get your own seats, a good unobstructed view and dedicated bar service. The waiter never left our glass empty and was always there in a moment’s notice.The age group ranges from 18 to even some I saw who were probably in their 60's. Great time, well worth it, and I can see it would be amazing if you go with a group.

Superb. We splashed out and got gold tickets,worked out at £75 each but that's taxi,whatever you want to drink and 4 hours of great entertainment.Superb show,great atmosphere. The only downer was one half of the big screen sometimes stopped working,but it was still superb with that glitch.

Awesome Time, Worth Every Penny!. This destination is a must-see! Seriously, the best show/party I have ever been to. People aged 16-70 can have fun in this place. Be prepared for loud music, but if that doesnt bother you, then great! The show is the best I have ever seen. Starts at 11:30 pm and the party doesnt stop until 4:30 am. There are people swinging all around the place (like at a cirque show) singing, dancing, video clips, ect. I was very impressed. Everyone was having a great time! We booked through a person at our hotel, paid $60 for open bar and we bypassed the entire line, got the best seats in the house, it was excellent!

Awesome place. This is a must see when you visit playa del Carmen. Just be prepared for it being very crowded & hot in there. We left before it ended & I didn't want to leave but our ride back to the resort was scheduled at a certain time. I will go back again on my next visit for sure!!!Rogerio Naranjo is awesome I believe he works in their PR department.

High Energy. Went to CB in Feb with a group of 8. We were 4 adults over 45 and 4 young adults 20-23 yrs of age. We went on a Tuesday night which is cheaper than weekend nights. It is also Ladies night, so the girls paid $45 and we guys $55. This prices includes entry and unlimited bar drinks. You can buy a VIP ticket which gets you Brand name liquor and Red Bull etc... but the price is over $100.... in my opinion, not worth itThe show starts at 11:30pm and we were picked up at 10:40 by shuttles bus. We stayed at the RIU Yucatan so it was about a 10 min bus ride once we got going. You will stand in a long line to get in BUT it goes very quickly once it starts moving. As you enter the building, they are handing out drinks including tequila shots (totally optional). You will also go through a security check and be prepared to be patted down and have all purses etc thoroughly checked. This is a good thing.We were escorted through the crowd and made our way up to the top level. The place is always packed and music is very loud and the crowd is energetic (meaning drunk..lol)We stood right along the rail on the left side of the stage, so had a great view of the stage and the crowd below.The show is non stop for almost 3 hours..... Live entertainers singing (most lip syncing) and between performances they run video on the massive screen and the music is constantly pumping...It is infectious... You can't help but not get into it.There are servers for each section and I tipped our guy early (not mandatory) and he really took care of our group. We were never without drinks and most of the time were double fisted. I tipped him again mid way through and he was instrumental in getting my daughter and her friend onto the stage near the end during the KISS tribute... How cool....I think the show ended around 3:30 and we were back to hotel by 4:00.... It is a late night, so rest up prior and sleep in the next morning..... It's a great time and a MUST if you have never been
Awesome!. Siiccckkkk Club! So much going on and the shows are veryy cool. They will give you free booze if you book with a group through youre resort.
OMG what a night. This is a must do in Playa. What an amazing night. Great shows and the waiters were also pretty cute :-) yumm

A Must-Do!. This was a third time going to Coco Bongos - but the first two were to the one in Cancun. The Playa one is definitely smaller, but the show was still just as awesome! We never had any trouble getting drinks. Yes, it does get crowded, but we went on a weeknight so I think that helped. We went with our resort so we had transportation provided both to and from the club. This is also the first time we managed to stay until the end - 3am! I definitely say that you must visit Coco Bongos if you're in the area!

Most amazing club I have EVER been to!. First things first - if you are staying at the Catalonia hotel in Puerto Aventuras, DO NOT book at the Coco Bongo hut stationed in the resort beside the snack bar! Marco (I think was his name - the guy we bought tickets from) was a total liar! The experience he described was that we would not wait in line, we would have a private section in a balcony, we would have our own bartender and bottle service, and we would be taken care of in terms of having "guides".This was total BS! First - the bus was late by about 30mins so we missed some of the show, we had to walk some of the way because of the street closure from Carnival but they did a terrible job of making sure the group stayed together - this could potentially ruin the trip for someone afraid of leaving the resort in Mexico! Once we finally got the group together - we waited in line for at least 30mins! We got into the club and went through the line-up and it was complete chaos from there. We had to push through tons of people and the spot they showed us to at was NOT a private balcony, it was the main floor right at the front of the club so you had to look straight up to see the show, while still missing what was happening at the back of the stage because we couldnt see it! Our bartender was terrible even with tips! People were constantly pushing through us, it was like being in a moshpit. Did I mention "Marco" LEFT! After the show, the bus picks you up at 3:30am and we were told they leave by 3:40 if we weren't there so we left at 3:00am to make sure we didnt miss it. He was once again late by about 20mins. So we waited a long time for him. Marco also didnt tell us where we would be picked up so we had to ask the ticket sales booth at Coco Bongo!NOW aside from our bad experience with the booking company - this club was INCREDIBLE! After getting over the fact we had no personal bubble, we had a blast! They would do different shows such as Lady Marmalade, Queen, Tron, Beetle Juice, Spiderman and Green Goblin, Chicago (which we missed!), Samba Dancers, Trapeze, etc. They would do a show for about 15mins and then play music for dancing for another 15mins or so and it alternated like that all night so we were never bored! They also would randomly blow out confetti, bubbles, balloons, etc. They would also blow the audience with Co2 every once in a while to cool everyone down! It was so crazy and awesome!!! The performers are so talented an we would have gone here twice if we had the time! The only thing I would warn the ladies of, if you are planning on dancing on the bar (which was a blast!) I would not recommend wearing a flowy dress, I would even say wear pants or shorts instead. This poor girl was taken up on the trapeze bar with one of the performers and her dress came up, she was wearing a thong so she was trying as hard as she could to pull her skirt down but the guy playing Beetle Juice looked like he was holding her skirt up so she couldnt cover up. I thought that was a pretty jerky thing to do.Other than that - we will definitely go back here!

SAVE YOUR MONEY. We went through our travel agent at the hotel for reservations - paid for VIP - 130.00 open bar and a table to watch what the representative said was a Las Vegas show. Transportation was 30 minutes late - drove so crazy all 12 passengers in the car were motion sick had to pull over. Once we arrived at CoCo we waited in 3 different lines to get in but our DeltaVacation rep said we would not have to wait in line. Once we got in, we could not move - this clearly is a fire hazard our seat was in the corner by the stage workers and we could not see anything. We were so sick from the ride we only had one cocktail and switched to water. We were so terribly disappointed we decided to leave 2 hours earlier than our bus ride back to the hotel. This was not a Las Vegas show as us Americans know it as - it was a DISCO tech with some acts inbetween the dancing. Upon leaving the area slipped due to overcrowding and broke toe. I would strongly suggest you save your money. We are still disputing this charge with Delta Vacations as we have requested a full refund.
Wow!!. Great night. So much to see. Service was incredible. Would go again.

Brilliant. I have never experienced a night club like this before live acts Elvis Freddy mercury & moreacrobat's falling from the ceiling drinks that just kept coming...We organised this trip withour hotel rep and Coco Bongo's was the last of 5 watering holes we visited and all ourdrinks and admissions were in the up front price of $25John & Bernie ....Newcastle upon Tyne England
Best place in town. This is the best & hottest place in town, don't miss it

Great show - definitely a must see!. We went to Coco Bongo with our group of 6 while visiting Playa del Carmen. I would definitely recommend getting the VIP tickets. We got ours through the concierge at our resort and paid $100 each. The VIP gets you a table, all your drinks & your own waiter. Be sure when you get there that you find someone to trade your tickets for a black VIP wristband to get you in the door ahead of the line. At first we were told to wait and if we hadn't sought out someone else to ask, we would have never gotten in in time to get a table. You should not have to wait in line if you have VIP tickets. The show is fantastic, better than anything I have seen in Vegas. Some in our group were worried about being able to stay awake until 3:30 am, but once you get there, that is not a problem. There is so much going on and the entertainers are so good, there is no way you could get sleepy!

Amazing Coco bonkers. What a fantastic night out, we had been urged to go by friends that have been and we were NOT disappointed. Staff were lovely, show was brilliant and the atmosphere was electric.
Great music shows. The shows are super, service is good but you have to give a good tip ( 30-40$). was a great experience but won't go back, to crowded, no place to dance except on the bar.

Too crowded!. Performers were amazing but the overcrowding was overwhelming. We could not move and those that could bumped into us spilling our drinks. It would have been nice to have a seat so we could have enjoyed the show!
Amazing Experience. Great time with friends. All-inclusive. Waiter was always coming around with trays of shots for our group. Very attentive.

Amazing show, good for a fun night. I always heard about amazing shows at Coco Bongo, but when in Cancun we did not enter at this place because of the rows for buying tickets… However, when walking at Playa del Carmen we found it and consider entering. I was not very sure; I was tired of a long beach day… Before buying tickets my husband take a look in the place and finally entered at VIP section. Our location was excellent; we could watch the extraordinary show and could dance comfortably, but we were the exception.Positive: Show was amazing (starts at 11pm until 330 am), production was very good and artist and acrobats performance was excellent. It is hard to find a show of this kind at a disco. Liquor supplying is included in your entrance.Negative: Tickets are pretty expensive. Place was very small and people without VIP tickets were crowded around the dance floor, what made difficult to walk through to go to the toilets and exit.

Excellant night out!!. I would recomend waiting a untill you meet a group of friends or holiday/friends and go as a group. A fab night out and defiantly need to go. We went twice it was that good and the shows where different

3rd time to Coco Bongo. We have been to the Royal in Playa del carmen for the 5th time and this was our 3rd time to Coco Bongo's . Now the first two times we went with the hotel and now the hotel does not take groups, but ask the entertainment crew and they will set you up. We got passed the line and got given a great reserved seat every time... You will never be disappointed with this Las Vegas type show.
Insane :). what can i say.....party, girls, fun. from age 18 up to 50 :))) 10 out of 10
we actually went to the one in cancun. best nightclub in the world - you can dance, drink and be entertained all at the same time.

playa del conmen. selling fake tickets for coco bongo .5th avenue. I purchased 2 vip. tickets to coco bongo from a bonafide booth aprox 100.mts from the main office monday for wednesday show.my wife spent time unlimited getting ready wed, night.we waited with 2 friends for the taxi .10 minutes overdue i get phone call from booking agent Carlos Rodriegos to say the seating area was closed that night .appoligised and promised seats and compensation for the next night.our friends having booked through the main office went alone by local taxi......night spoiled. the following night same get ready time etc and wait for taxi 10 minutes late another phone call another cancelation.another promise from carlos.next morning we went to coco bongo main office to verify the tickets.the tickets were useless.we explained we bough at acoco bongo both around the corner .no offer of a refund.we requested the police.they came and after much protest agreed to investigate via another police officer a wpc after a long talk she said this was not their problem but said we could a report and incident number.we went back to coco bongo asked them to solve the problem and invetigate the scham.they phoned several people and gave reasons for this and that but no refund not even a visit to the carlos Rodregos booth. I went back to the booth to look for carlos ..no carlos but several of his clan were there we explained the situation and that the police were involved and so were coco bongo and they agreed to refund our money.they did so later that day meanwhile back to coco bongo to ask what they intended to do to protect other tourists from this booth sales con...the reply was ----nothing it had happened several times before.So i told them that i would put this information on the internet .this did not please them at all but did not alter their attitude so i feel it my duty to tell the world about coco bongo con men. Yorkshire.

The best nightclub for any legal aged visitor!. I had been to the Coco Bongo nightclub in Cancun 4 years ago with several girlfriends and had an aboslute blast. This time I suggested that my husband and I go out for the night. We were staying much further away (about 45 min bus ride from Playa del Carmen). We booked a bus tour through our hotel which came and picked us up and dropped us off. We were able to get VIP service and a great spot/view on the second balcony. The bus then picked us up at the same spot and brought us home to our resort.The show is absolutely phenomenal filled with impersonators of different musical talents. The Freddie Mercury impersonator was unbelievable! They also have all kinds of "cirque du soleil"-like acts from the roof. I think that not just young people but also older generations would love the show also if they could put up with the loud music and drunk people around them.We had a blast and would recommend it to all who visit the area!

Truly amazing, must go to event...outstanding performers. Words alone can not describe how great this is! Yes it is in a club setting and quite packed, (1500+people) it's for all ages. Amazing performaces which range from acrobatics, music videos with full costumes and exactly like the video which plays in the background, streamers and confetti, and involvement of the audience.A must see to truly appreciate it...
Wow. Amazing time , worth the money $120 VIP , with transportation to and from the hotel
amazing. is one time experience, buy the unlimited drink packaged

Not for the faint of heart!. On my honeymoon, my husband hated Coco Bongo (sensory overload), but with my 3 girl friends, it was a hoot! We had a blast, dancing on the stage and all over the place. The table service was unbelievably fast and the pace and energy left all of us happy and exhausted by the time we got out at 4am. Totally worth it if you're not claustrophobic, epileptic, or don't absolutely love pop music! An indescribable experience!

Never seen such a show in a dancing club: just great…!. I had my doubts about entering here…my wife and I had had a long nice beach day and I was kind of tire…We were offered 2 options: regular entrance for 800 pesos/person...which I thought was expensive for a dancing club; we were also offered the VIP option for 1250 pesos/person…the guy let me entered to take a quick look and I decided to go on the VIP option to have the chance to have a better table with unlimited international scotch supply (black label in our case)…Well…No regrets…on contrary we had great time dancing and having the chance to see a great show that is perfectly combined with dancing music and is a great combination of video, music, sound and performances carried out by dancers/acrobats.

Good show good time. Hic!! Lots of booze, great show, lots of dancing.In our 50's, drank and danced the night until 3 or 4 am.Not sure exactly what time we left but the bus the resort had arranged was there. Place is a firetrap waiting to happen. Had good time, enjoyed the show had good seating and a good time.

Best Death Trap I've Ever Been Too!!!!. Coco Bongo is an amazing experience but is definitely a death trap. It doesn’t take a psychic to see that someday a lot of people will die in that building. Coming from a country with health and safety codes, it doesn’t take long walking down the streets of Mexico to notice that at minimum, their electrical standards alone are quite different than ours. The building of Coco Bongo should maybe hold safely 500 people but the crowd packed in shoulder to shoulder must have approached, if not exceeded the 1000 person mark. This place is not for the claustrophobic!! On the bright side, they do have a couple emergency exits that with some luck you might make it to in the event of a stampede resulting from an emergency. With that out of the way, tickets are upwards of $130 USD. The more you pay, the quicker you get in. The quicker you get in, the better chance of obtaining a table. If you don’t obtain a table, you will find yourself standing between many sweaty drunk people from the time the club opens at 11PM until the end of the show at 4AM. Of course, you can choose to leave early but did I mention how much those tickets were?? Ourselves, we didn’t pay any money for the tickets. We were approached by a timeshare rep and decided to sit through a 2 hour presentation for a hotel and served breakfast. We read many horror stories about these but found it very easy to get our ‘no’ across effectively. Later that night, we were at a reserved private table waiting to see what Coco Bongo was all about. It was truly an amazing show with all the bad I’ve just said. I do not want to overlook that at all. It was AMAZING!!! Las Vegas meets Broadway meets Hollywood meets the nightclub scene. The performances were very entertaining and one I do not regret seeing. Our tickets would have cost close to $200 USD each. After being there, I am glad we did not pay to see the show and would not pay for it again in the future BUT I am glad we spent the 2 hours listening to a weak sales pitch for a substandard resort to have the opportunity to see what Coco Bongo was all about.

Best night ever. No matter your age, Coco Bongo is amazing. Its more of a show than a night club. Its the same show every night, and what a show it is! There were seniors to 18 yrs of age there. From flying confetti, to outstanding acrobatics, singing, choreography, flying ribbons... audience participation.. just go.. at least once. The stimuli and singing talent is exceptional!
AMAZING. If you get the chance to go to Coco Bongo you MUST go as it will be once of the best experiences of your holiday and one of the best clubs you will ever go too.Dancers, acrobats, music....

Wow just wow. Went to Coco Bongo towards the end of our trip. We went through the hotel which cost $65 for shuttle service, open bar which included entrance and our own VIP table and waiter. Shows were absolutely incredible!! Music was sick!! Atmosphere and people were very fun. Light show amazing and streamers came out every 5 minutes. Plus they had this awesome smoke which was very cold and chilled you off when it got too hot. Place wasn't to packed and was able to dance comfortabely. There are just too many shows and performances to list. Trust this is something you don't want to miss if you go to Playa. Don't miss out you will regret it I promise!!!

Awesome Worth Every Penny. We had a fabulous time. We don't really go clubbing but this place is for almost everyone. It was so entertaining we had no trouble staying up till 4 am.Also bathrooms were very clean, surprising for a night club.

Better than expected!. Not generally a club person but this place is awesome! We paid around $80 us to go which included 30+ minute transfer from our hotel, cover and drinks. There are almost constant shows happening on the stages or in the air. It's like cirque du soliel but above your head. The drinks are probably very weak but they pump oxygen in and you will dance your butt off. I'm sure that they are breaking every fire code in Canada, but it's still really fun. Just a warning if you don't like really crowded places, or trying to shield your drink from confetti all night this may not be the place for you. That being said from what we saw the patrons were pretty friendly and the waiters very nice!

WHAT A NIGHT!. This is NOT a nightclub and NOT just for the young. It's an amazing multi-media show, with 25 'acts' in four hours. Where else will you see Lady Gaga, Madonna, Elton John, The Beatles, Beetlejuice, and acrobats throughout - all in the same place with the drinks brought to your private table by your own waiter all night. If you can afford it, go for the Gold VIP package at $100, but if not, you'll get a whole night for c$60 which is still a great price for the experience.

Funny show. This very good show club where you can either dance or just watch cool show. Very exciting. Take the VIP lounge, you dont have to wait big line, you have private zone with all-inclusive drinks. Costs 110usd instead of 65))

Great night out!. We went on a Monday night - was expensive...paid $200 for VIP which i'd personally recommend. No queue, taken straight to private table with great view of stage, table service with wide range of drinks. Fantastic show!!

Wow, Loved it. Coco is hard to explain, but we loved every minute of it. Music,acrobats, dancing, light, confetti and at one point, I had a midget dressed as Beetle Juice sitting in my lap.This is a must see!

PARTAYY. Well what can one say if you like bars and night life this place is off the chains! And best thing is if you don't like it they've got other bars all around, beach bars and so forth. The other bars around are only busy on weekends so keep that in mind.
Amazing. Definitely a place to go for night life. Amazing entertainment

Not your typical nightclub!. We bought a VIP pass, so we got to go to Carlos 'n' Charlie's, Senor Frogs and Coco Bongo without waiting in line, paying for cabs, etc. Coco Bongo is very different than what I expected... First off, the place is HUGE!! Secondly, the club is all about these shows themed around the music they're playing. It's not about you dancing. You can dance there to the music, but it's mostly about what's happening on stage. That said, it was definitely a GREAT show and worth the money, thought I'm not sure I could stay the whole time. It's a LONG night, so either arrive at 10-10:30 and leave by 1, or come later and stay later.

Gorgeous, great athmosphere, very relaxing!!. Playa del Carmen is 45 minutes drive from Cancun. its worth visiting for an entire day, as there is a long 5th Avenue Street that you can stroll after after spending a few hours on the gorgeous beach. Its not not crowded, inspite of the popularity, yoou don't get to see huge high hotel building blocking the access to the beach, so yes, it is different than Cancun....5th Avenue has phantastic restaurant, piano bars, art galleries, stores you name, very original and different, and the prices are competitive, we got our presents in one of the stores on the 5th Avenue and the selection was unbelievable. Its just fun to sit at one of the cafes, eating a nice delicious lunch and drinking a cold bear while watching peaople strolling on the street, you hear all kind of languages, its really very international athmosphere.....After all, we spent a great day at Playa del carmen, not having to spend a lot of money or drive for a very long time. If you in cancun, you have to visit Playa del carmen!! vale la pena !!

Entertainment and Music. I guess the thing to know first of all is that it is not your typical nightclub. The club is set up as 15 minutes of music with a show going on with popular music. You can dance during this time but its more about the show. Then its another 15 minutes of music and back to the show so on and so on. My boyfriend and I were hoping to go to just a nightclub so at first we were a little disappointed but then we started having fun. It's kind of expensive so look for the best deal. What it really is is a mix of entertainment and dancing, 3 levels high so there are a lot of people and it does get crowded. It's nice to get a table but even then it gets crowded around you but at least you get an area. Waiters keep bringing you drinks and drinks and the show is pretty interesting. It something for people of all ages to go and have a good time we saw what looked like parents going with their 18-25 year old children and they were enjoying themselves. If you're looking for just a club to go dance probably not the place because there is not really a great dance floor but if you want something of entertainment, music and drinking this would be a good option. Around that area there are various options that are just clubs. We heard Mandelas is a good one but we did not have the opportunity to visit it. Hopefully next time!

Amazing. A show not to be missed. Lots of Fun. Our server
Jonathan made our experience so great.

Unbelievable Great Show!!!. Absolutely fantastic! The best club ever!!We went there during our holiday in January at Ocean Maya Royale just outside Playa del carmen cause several people told us we have to see it! And yes, you have to see it! It is brilliant! Half dance club, half musical and circus. Its great to see different performances on the stage such as Madonna, Lady Gaga or Kiss and its even more brilliant to see people attached to strings flying through the whole place performing Spiderman, Pirates of the carribean or Tron.Service was excellent, a waiter passed us every ten minutes cause once you paid entry all drinks of the open bar are included till 3.30 in the morning. Only afterwards you would have to pay. It is a place for every age, however i do believe that under 40s will enjoy it a bit more. For the elderly i recommend a Gold upgrade. With this you get access to a special floor with more tables and opportunities to sit, relax and enjoy the show.This club is definitely worth the money!!!!

Good experience overall.. Me and my girlfriend heard this was the spot to be and we bought a ticket through our resort which costed $140 us dollars. We were given a shuttle to and from the club, we were ushered past the long lineup to get in. I guess this made it a good value compared to hopping in a cab and going it alone. We were given a waiter William, he brought drinks, and I tipped him $10 us bucks, maybe it seems he is not used to getting tips because he kept drinks flowing for us even when we didn't ask when we were walking around. On a nice note: my girlfriend lost her camera, and bouncers handed it back to her at the end of the night, was really not expecting to find it again. We were situated just above the general floor area. It was extremely uncomforable, I've been in packed venues before, but you just had your space to stand on the sides and that was it and hope you didn't fall into someone. I was disappointed in that it wasn't really a dance club that you could unwind, and get loose, it's more a show (which was amazing to see). Due to the bar in the middle, there's little if any room to dance. There's no real actual dancefloor like a lot of other nightspots out there have. It was a good overall experience but I probably wouldn't return.
Gold Member is worth the price!. Brilliant! The experience here is like no other. From the staff that take care of you the moment you step inside, to the performers, to the music, it was spectacular!
For everyone. its a treat not to be missed, I am 37 and my partner is 50 and we both enjoyed it. Would also go back again

Would stay there for 2-3 days,not more.. 5.Avenue. nice,.good stores. except the people is unfriendly and they take tourism as a industry. Waiters are rude, they ask for tips even for free welcome drinks. Where i come from, always leave a tip, because they are nice and deserve it,not because i must.
very good. the music was very good and there was a lot to drink.

Wow fantastic show a must see. This is just an amazing night but I would recommend getting the gold member tickets and arriving there no later than 10.30 pm. We were shown to our seats and our waiter kept the drinks flowing all night. Downstairs in the 50 dollar area it is like a cattle market and you are very squashed, but where we were was great. The show is amazing and the acrobats are the best part they are spectacular. I do agree with other reviews if there was a fire it would be a nightmare but I still would have not missed this night.
a must do!. what a great night...be prepared to stand...its a mix of a concert and club....i went with my mother and my cousin and friend....we all loved it! from the elvis show to madonna AMAZING!!!

Awesome night!. We went on Jan. 15, we had a fabulous night. We went there with a couple we met at our resort and the place was packed!The show is awesome, the staff comes to see you often to get us new drinks.Tip, if you go there with a bus tour from a resort, you might want to get there earlier as we arrived a bit late and had to on the 3rd floor with our backs to the wall.
lots of fun. Nice place, good show, go with others more fun, make sure you buy the express line tickets.

WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY. So we booked with hotel, for what we thought was going to be a fun filled night.. safe is the key word here. We bought gold member tickets, were informed that we would have a guide and that security would be very visable. We were assured that this excurtion was safe. What a joke...Soon as we get on the bus, the little guide named Isabel, whom only introduced herself when I insisted she provide her name was nothing but a b..... you could tell she did not want to be there and she did nothing to ensure that we made a good decison. First thing she says is ... who is gold member... what did you pay for you tickets... nice... than she informs us as we arrive that the bus will be parked two blocks away from bar.. get to know your bus drivers name because he is the one taking you home.. and you better be here fro 0330 or else ..you can find your own way home... nice.... than she states if.. you get sick on the bus be prepared to pay $25... nice.. than she hurries us to the line up and starts to walk away.. I ask her.. are you not comming in with us?.. She turns with a scoul and says NO.... WHAT THE HELL.... no one is informed of where we are to proceed too... the couple behind us could not even speak english... my god what a start to a night.. so we get in and we are directed by security with flash lights to our seats.. the place is hopping.. suddenly the a large crowd feels what looks like a sink hole ... they can barely move, but are so intoxicated that they put up with it... needless to say... as much as i wanted to join in.. i did not because i was so concerned that we would not be able to find the bus.. i have a hard enough time when i am sober.,.. lol.. the only thing i could think about was.. god if there is a fire in here.. we would all be dead.. this place definetly breaks all the safety codes and its just a matter of time... We ended up leaving early and thats when we were introduced to our security guard... nice... eh... he assured us that the guide was wrong to tell us that we had to find the bus, that he was going to escort the group... well that was a little to late assurance.. nice.. so we end up taking a safe cab that he arranages., cause if you take a city cab... although cheaper .. you might get ripped off.... nice... I definetly do not recomend this place and I am not surprised by the above claim that two woman were sexually assaulted.. this is no place for woman to be .... they dont care.. they just want your money...

Excellent, must see!. 2nd time, totally new show from the previous year. Great vaue all inclusive 4 hour show for $50 including drinks. Very loud and crowded but non-stop entertainment, well worth it.
WOWWWWWWW. absolutely the craziest most amazing thing ive ever done you HAVE HAVE HAVE to do this!!!!!

Amazing!. Coco bongo was the most amazing night club ever!!!! I have never been to a night club like that before. I recommend buying the tickets thru the resort because it's cheaper and it includes transportation nd drinks all night ! So worth it.

cocobongo what a nite. Did not like the way we had to queue up to get in, it felt like we were on a convayer belt being shoved in. Once in the night club the drinks were flowing pretty freely, one of our party got seperated, it took us 2hrs to find her, she was outside crying as she thought she would never see us again...too much shots .. the screens,shows and the acrobatics were fantastic, its was well worth going apart from the crush, cant go to Mexico and not go to Cocobongos
A MUST when you're in Playa. This is a must night when you're in Playa. They'll have the best time ever. Non-stop fun all night!!!!

Sping Break all over again!. Go for the show~ Very professional and entertaining!No seating so be comfy the show is long and the party goes on.Its a raunchy looking place and filled with sping-break type vibe. Not a classy venue but again the show is good.
Fab Night Club. Best nightclub I've ever been to! Full packed entertainment from start to finish, unlimited free drinks and excellent waiter service all night. The shows were amazing! Loved it!
Must do!. It is one place to be! Go there! There are 30 shows in a sequence that you don't feel bored. Actually, you feel excited all the time. The price is right.

Show & Fun. Fun show, great drinks, very good service!
I'll come back anytime!

Be Aware - Sexual Assualt!!!!. If you are selected to go on stage to dance between the perfomances.. BE AWARE that sexual assaults have occurred behind the stage by the Coco Bongo security staff on the female patrons. On Friday, January 6, 2012, two female patrons were sexually assaulted by staff at Cogo Bongo behind the stage. The curtain comes down bewteen shows and female patrons who were dancing on the stage are left in the dark surrounded by security personnel with flashlights. These male security personnel, physically restrained these two ladies arms and hands and proceeded to remove clothing and fondle their breasts and even succeded in penertating one lady with their fingers. The ladies resisted as best they could but could not see in the dark and were unable to be heard due to the loud music. These employees of Coco Bongo were extremely aggressive which makes me believe this pre-planned and is occuring on a regular basis. Each lady had three to four security personnel restrain and sexually assualt each of them. This occurrence has been brought to the attention of Coco Bongo management and we are awaiting the result of their investigation. Please be advised that these two ladies are mature (41 and 43 years old) business professionals from Canada who were NOT intoxicated. This makes us wonder... what is happening to the young 18-25 year old intoxicated feamles who from the majority of the feamles on stage every night? By the way, male patrons are not prohibited on or behind the stage just the security staff. Please be careful.

Not for everyone but WOW. This is a once in your life Must Experience. If you are claustrophobic, hate crowds, detest noise. Do not go! but if you are willing to just go with the flow and enjoy the experience then you will have a great time.Try to pay extra to get a table up on level 2 of 3, the main floor is just a mass of humanity squashed in like sardines. They pack as many people as possible into the joint and I'm sure they break every fire code and capacity code ever written in North America.The show they put on is worth it, tributes to many artists, the Rolling Stones, Elvis, Michel Jackson. Skits like Spiderman vs the Green Lantern and Beatle Juice. Cirque du Soleil type shows. The night is one sensory overload followed by another.The entry fee includes all drinks and the waiters are amazing, they just kept filling our table with drinks, how they manoeuvred through the crowds is beyond me.Despite the masses in the club, the bathrooms were spotless all night long, if you could get to them.This place is not just foe the young my wife and I are over 50 and if you can make it past the first hour you will settle in to the flow of the club and have a ball.

seen better high school musicals....waste of money. There is no where to sit and enjoy the show. Then again the show is horrible. The people lip sync and dancing is not that great. I have seen better high school musicals. What a rip off. Servers were rude and pushed you around. They sweep after every performance, nearly sweeping your legs.

great night out, awesome place!!. we have been to mexico 5 times and to coco bongo in Cancun a lot of times, and this one twice, its so much fun, a bit smaller than the one in cancun which has its pro's and con's but feels more personal and you are closer to the action at this one, wouldnt go to mexico with out a trip here, it is a must, have been with friends and just as a couple and we always have a fantastic time

EPIC NIGHT! The BEST STAGETTE YET!. We went as part of a stagette. The maid of honour made arrangements for a tour that left from our hotel. For $50, we each had transportation, express line privileges and open bar. The bus left at around 11 pm and would have taken us back at 3:30 am...we ended up all cabbing back to our hotels at various earlier times. The show was INCREDIBLE! The performers were fabulous! It was a combination of a revue and circle du soleil... We were all girls so we ended up being invited to dance on the center bar...much better than on the main dance floor which was like a sardine packed mosh pit. Definitely worth it! I'd highly recommend this for anyone celebrating a special occasion in the area...or just to see it in any case! This was better than any of my Vegas experiences... I'd suggest bringing lots of small change to tip the excellent bartenders and staff...

Wow what a show/party/ night out. This is an experience that describing doesnt make it sound as good as it really is, freddie mercury,Spidey fighting the goblin, glow sticks fired out of guns baloons from ceiling, beetlejuice, tron, dj Drinks all night. Go for the gold guarenteed seat with unobstructed view waiter service, premium drinks We were really tired and didnt fancy it but its too good not to enjoy and get in the spirit for Go now!! Thats an order maggot
Fun. Fun, Fun!. Excellent shows, continuous entertainment, upgrade to the "Gold VIP" section unless your young and adventurous.

HORRIBLE!!! STAY AWAY FROM EDUARDO (Sales Rep). He works as a rep at many hotels so BEWARE!!!! he promised 16 of us a table ( two of my family members were handicap and needed a seat) when we got there no such thing for us. This resulted in my family members having to take a cab back because they could not stand for a 5 hour show!!!!! Then the icing on the cake is that he arranged for transportation for all of us back to our hotel ( included in the $100 we paid to go) and NEVER showed up. Left us (12 people) now since the others had to leave stranded in the middle of now where to find our own way home!!! This guy is a SHARK and we wasted a ton of money! Do everything you can to stay away from these Reps at Coco Bongo, just book through your hotel tour companies!
Fantastic. Great night, get gold membership.You have a table in the VIP area, a waiter keeps the drinks coming and it's all included in the price. The shows are fantastic well worth the visit.

best Birthday ever. Went there on a friday night to celebrate my 30th birthday. I loved the place.... never seen anything like it... Its a mix of a show and nightclub and cirque du soleil and the atmosphere is amazing. We had our own table on the main level close to the bar. Recommend to anyone both young and old...very cool and unique experience.

Amazing show. one of the best live entertainment shows I have ever seen, try the VIP service.Booked through one of the resorts and wish they had made sure their representative would have given us a heads up on when to leave for the travel back to the resort.Would highly recommend this show if you are in the Playa Del Carmen area

Better than expected. I went here with a large group of co-workers and did not know what we were in for! Wow! Our CEO upgraded all of us- what I expected was a private, roped off section with unlimited booze. Not the case; we were packed in like sardines with the rest of the crowd standing on a very steep set of stairs (not easy to stand on after a few shots of tequila). After the show started and I began to understand what was going on it was a very memorable experience. The acrobats, singing, dancing- it was amazing. We had such a great time and still talk about our Coco-Bongo experience to this day!

Amazing Experience. This was such an amazing time!!! Like nothing you'll ever do again, except maybe in Vegas!!! A fantastic mix of dance music and entertainment shows!! Our waiter Enrique was the best!!! and our Coco Bongo rep Omar was awesome as well!!!!Fantastic entertainers!!!!!!

Great music and so, so shows, but overall good to see. We were packed in a very little space in this club. Lines were long and security tough, many checking points made you feel like you are entering some important area. You got a first drink which made you dizzy straight away. I am not sure if why that happened. I drink hard liquors all the time and one cape cod (vodka +cranberry juice) doesn’t get me drunk. I felt dizzy after 5 minutes after drinking it. Was it spiked with something? I will never know, but my friends felt strange about it as well. Main club area was over packed, we barely found any place to stand. We could not focus on shows because constantly there were people stepping on my feet. I ordered couple drinks from the bar, but they were very bad. I didn’t not order anymore, I was not going to drink that s..t. I asked for Kahlua, but barman looked at my bracelet and said something in Spanish which I didn't understand. Never mind. I liked the music, it was great to dance to. Shows were so, so. nothing really special. I deffo didn't like that Jesus on Cross show. I think it was some stupid art-misinterpretation. We left about 2am, had enough.I recommend this show for people who wants to get drunk and dance to good music and don’t care about anything else. We expected little more than that with that price.
Great Shows & Staff. What a place brilliant nightclub includes all drinks its a great night out!! Prices around £40pp well worth it.

Had a blast. In febuary I stayed at Sandos caracol eco resort & spa for week, our rep said there was two options, I could go to Coco Bongs though the bar itself (it was $100 and ride was not provided with the price) or I could go on the Party Hopper. This was $80 ride to and from the resort you go to 3 bars Carlos & Charlies, Senoir' Frog, and Coco Bongos. It was all canadians on this party tour. The guys that did the party hopper were very good the drinks were included in the price so they would get you your beverage for you (so no one could put anything in it) if you needed to go to the bathroom they escorted you. It was a blast all around!

More than just a night club. It was a full blown 4 hour production.. Once inside the Coco Bongo, we were taken to the upper level, but found it very hard to see what was going on around the club. We decided to wander down below to the floor area between the two bars. Well... suddenly , we were in the middle of the show. Everything was happening right above us. What a show!! Spiderman swooped over our heads, what seemed like only inches above the crowd. We could not see much of the stage above us, but most of the show was out over the crowd , so it was worth being on the floor. It was much faster getting drinks served to us on the floor too. It was very crowded inside, but well organized. The sound and light show were second to none. We picked the Mayan Riviera again for this coming January (2012) mainly so we can return to The Coco Bongo. Last year we paid $50 each for our bus ride and it included the bus ride and admission... including... all you can drink while inside. Well worth the price. Can't wait until we go again.

Fantastico!!!!!!. Don't miss Coco Bongo!!!! We had an amazing night. When you first walk into the club you can be overwhelmed by the amount of people that are in the place, let's say it's a bit crowded. Don't let that sway you from having a great night ,settled in find a place to watch the show, and have a great time. The drinks don't stop coming, and the staff couldn't be more friendly. You never have to worry about going to the bar, your waiter will take care of you all night. Don't forget to tip your waiter, they work hard. It's a great place for all ages you have people in their 20's to 60's, it's non-stop fun. I never wanted to go to the bathroom because I was afraid of what I would miss. Next time we go to Mexico we're going back to Coco Bongo!

Best night EVER!. Wow this was my 5th time in Mexico and had never been to Coco bongos.It was one of the best nights of my life. We paid $110 per person VIP and it was worth every penny. Loads of different age groups also. Its a must!

Uh - MA - ZiNG! Best nightclub in the world!. This club was definitely worth every penny and more. In fact, I would have probably paid double what I paid (I paid $65) had I know how much fun I was gonna have. I went with three friends and stood the whole time up on a 3rd level which had an amazing view of the shows the whole night. We each had two drinks each in our hands and the waiters kept asking us if we were ready for another. Needless to say, alcohol is limitless. I've seen tons of shows and gone to a bunch of clubs in LA, Vegas and New York etc. etc....and this tops them all. If you love to dance, drink, party and see an amazing show while you do all of that this is the place to be. So much bang for the buck. I definitely hope to go back soon!
November 2011. Way too crowded.. shows were good, but very hard to see. Couldn't move around at all because it was so squishy. Kept getting stepped on and drinks spilled on me.

Amazing night out, deffo not to be missed. I was keen to go on this trip if not a bit sceptical because I didn’t think I would be able to stay awake long enough to justify the price for the gold ticket, however we still decided to go to it, and we are so glad we did. First of all we booked the trip and the gold ticket via our coco bongo rep at our hotel Iberostar Quetzal. Before I booked I made the point of asking the rep to guarantee us our table after reading previous reviews I had read I wanted to make sure, he said this was no problem. We were picked up promptly from our hotel lobby at about 2200 with us falling asleep as we were struggling through jet lag, and my partner and me both said that we would leave the show about midnight as we were both knackered....ha!!! We arrived at Coco Bongos and initially were given a standing area with a small table, but we had a word with our rep that straight away without any fuss moved us to a private area with a private table overlooking all the entertainment and with hardly anyone there. What can I say we were served drinks without asking and before we had even finished (the tickets are all inclusive so all drinks are free) intermittently we were given shots also. The acts were amazing and as were all the balloons coming down and streamers ectr, we looked around during part of the evening and our section was the only section that wasn’t crowded! Someone came round offering photos too throughout the night, and we left after a fantastic evening at about 0445, so much for falling asleep! What I would say is I’ve seen on some other posts that they couldn’t see a fire exit, well we saw them clearly from where we were although these were written in Spanish, and I would also suggest getting the gold member ticket. When we do go back next year we will deffo go back and will do it earlier in the trip as we felt it helped us get over the jet lag!

Not sure we would do the Thomson tour again.... Coco Bongo itself is amazing! It is a show like you would never see again. The acts are fabulous and you'll see things you'll never see anywhere else. The cheesy getting girls up to dance on stage and screen inbetween acts is a little rubbish but ignore that and you'll have a great time. The tour we did with Thomson's included two bar trips before coco bongos and to be honest they were not up to much. Boasting all inclusive drinks was not advised that they were only on a selection and the venues themselves were not that great. But it did give you free drinks inside coco bongos for around £40 each so def worth a trip.

What a night!. Brilliant night where all the drinks are included in the price. We paid $65 to get in quickly, you could have paid $100 for VIP which means you get a table and get to sit down and also you could have paid less then us and be on 'the floor' as such. The show was briliiant and you will be missing out if you dont go.All the drinks are waiter service - tip your waiter a £5 or so and he will just keep bringing the drinks to you. It is heaving and it would be nearly impossible to get your own drinks so use your waiter. Great night and great fun.
great night out. I have visited this area 3 times and had hoped each visit there to get to Coco Bongos. SOOOO glad we made it this time. Go enjoy you are never to old for this great show

O M G. Oh my God, the best cabaret and party atmosphere I have ever experianced. The cabaret acts including, Maddonna, Queen, Beyonce, Pirates of the Caribbean, Beatle Juice, Moulin Rouge, Gladiator, Katy Perry, amazing place well worth all the money, dont book it through thomas cook though, as you only get 2 hours there from midnight to 2am, where as book it direct through you hotel and you will get the whole show from 10 til 2

Too Much Fun :P. We bought our tickets from the agents at the Iberostar Quetzal, no problems what so ever, were picked up by a bus and dropped off before the show began. Once in after a short wait we were shown a spot to stand , had a really good view from there. I felt good knowing they take they're time checking people on the way in, as I was out with my daughters. They had no problems that night at all as they opted not to drink but just to dance and have fun. I always tip and did which may not have been to my advantage in this case cause I enjoyed a few too many :P The shows were really good and fun was had by all people of all ages around us. The girls loved the music and danced the night away. Because the service was so good we missed the buss back to the hotel :P and had to gab a cab, it was very late and the girls were a little uneasy with a group hanging out near the cabs, but no problems we couldn't handle. I would go back in a heartbeat, next time switch to pop half way through the night lol. The shows were good for people of all ages, a really good variety!

Beware. We booked this club poolside at the Valentin Imperial Maya from the Co Co Bongo rep and paid 110.00 American for the entry to the club, drinks, seating area and bus ride. Several of us from the pool booked together deciding it would be a interesting activity. The rep that sold us the tickets said we would have our own table and waiter for the night with all drinks included. The bus arrived on time to pick us up but then stopped at another Hotel to pick up other guests as well. We arrived at the club 15 minutes after the show started because it took so long for the bus to load at the second stop. We were then jammed into an oversold club, could not see the show, as people were standing in front of us so we had to stand on our chairs if we wanted to see, and as far as getting a drink, you drank whatever the wait staff brought around on their trays, as the club was so packed it was impossible to get to the bar to order anything. We got there at 11:15pm and were back (via a 25.00 taxi ride) at 12:55am (the taxi ride is approx. 25 minutes) Needless to say we did not stay. The rep that sold us the trip disappeared and we did not see him again at the club or at the Hotel pool all week. I feel because we were late our seating was gone and he just stuck us up on the 3rd level in the back because that was all that was left. He made no attempt to better our seating or explain anything, he just told us to: "stay here" and left. I don't know if you booked through a tour operator such as Apple if the experience would have been any better, but this club was definitely oversold, had poor drink service, and virtually no way out if there was a fire or fight.. They say Cancun is a better place to see the show, as the club there is larger and more organized, but we did not go there personally, so I can't vouch for that.

Pumped Up. This was the most visually and audible stimulating Vegas like show I have ever attended. I was worried that the time of the show was from 11pm to 3:30am. I had no idea how I was going to stay up that late. No worries my friend. You lose track of time. The only way to see this show is by VIP pass or diamond pass. This includes all beverages, bathroom within 100ft and reserved seating!

You have to visit coco bongo!. Myself and my partner visited coco bongos on our holiday. We had the best evening either of us could have imagined! It’s hard to describe just how good it is! I had been told about many times before actually going and you really do need to go for yourself! Something for everyone and great value for money. The staff are very efficient and we were NEVER left without a drink! Make sure you go because you will have a fantastic night!!!

Fantástico! Parece Cirque du Soleil. Nunca me diverti tanto em um lugar.Eu não sou o tipo de cara que gosta de baladas. Na verdade eu não gosto. Porém, o Coco Bongo é diferente. É uma mistura de Cirque du Soleil com balada. Muito, mas muito, muito bom!Adorei e voltaria outras vezes, com toda a certeza.Eu paguei U$ 70 para ir, com bebidas inclusas.Valeu cada centavo.Vá. Você não vai se arrepender!
Must see. Amazing amazing amazing!! didnt know what to expect and was blown away! Danced the night away
good show, fun!. The show was great, mood was fun and lively, - VIP pass was not worth it.
Sardines. $65 and you need money for tips, crammed in like sardines but the show and music is amazing

Cheesy lame tourist money grab, do not go to the CoCo Bongo.. This place is not fun if you actually like to party.There is no where to dance and the music is highly offensive if you have any real taste in music.First off the cover is $60UDS per person to get in, more if you want to be on a higher level inside the club.The cover gets you open bar access for PART of the night.When you first arrive they say drink drink and so you drink, then they get rude and refuse to serve you.I don't know if that is the type of service everyone was receiving but we certainly were.We were tipping and everything!The entertainment was crap, lame songs lip-synced in-between terrible top 40.There was one good act but it was certainly not worth the money we paid to get in.You might like this place if you don't get out much or if you are into cruise ship entertainment.I strongly dislike the CoCo Bongo and do not recommend going there.
Excellent!. Great party & show!A bit anoying waiters offering drinks and shooters, but excelent show and party!Too bad I didn't visit Cancun! :(
What an Experience. I visit alot of night clubs and this was amazing. the music the show and for the price. ITS A MUST SEE old and young

The Best Party Night Out!!!. We booked this trip through our resort. It was $65 a person. I knew you could pay more for a table, but the price did not seem worth it to me. We were escorted to the balcony and were right up against that...we could see everything and we are young so we didn't have an issue standing the whole time. It was the most amazing show I've ever seen! We had a really fun time. At first my boyfriend was going to the bar everytime we needed drinks but then we tipped the server well and he kept the drinks flowing!! I would love to go back and hope to go back again!!I was able to get on the stage to dance and that was fun...I was glad I did NOT have a skirt on because they have air blowers and we saw lots of ladie's undergarments!! There was one person who kept going on the stage and somehow at the end of the night she wound up in ONLY her undergarments and they escorted her off the stage...so although it's a big party place and people get crazy and drunk, it's not an anything goes kind of place!!

WOW!. Mindblowing show! Never seen anything like it.Pay the extra 40$ for the VIP pass. 2nd level viewing so you are eye level with the stage. No better place to be, and the bottle service rocks. Make your own drinks as they just give you a bottle and the mix!

Coco Bongo VIP Pass. We paid 110 US Dollars for each of us for a VIP Pass. The reason we did this was because we were told that there are only 10 tables sitting 4 each table and that no matter where you sat in this section you would have an unobstructed view. The ticket also included all drinks all night inclusive of International brands. We were also told that the VIP ticket guarantees early entrance. This was not our experience. When we got there which was around 10.20pm with the show starting at 11pm, the club was already crowded. The table we were promised did not materialize. The section they mentioned with the tables had just 3 tables towards the front which were crowded. There was no way anyone seated at the back tables would have been able to watch the show without standing. We were advised to sit in the corridor where we did have an unobstructed view but people kept bumping into our stools all night on their way to the washrooms. I felt ripped off as we could have had a cheaper ticket for 65 US and had the same experience. The bar service was good and the show was excellent.

Good show but the same all over again. We been here in Coco Bongo Cancun and now Playa del Carmen but we were disappointed to see almost the same show as one year ago, also they should do something about the overcrowding somebody will get hurt someday. If you haven’t been there I recommend it but I also recommend to go during the week since its less expensive and "less crowded" (still couldn’t walk though lol) and do not buy the VIP package is not worth it at all. Enjoy!

Get VIP if you can. Went to Coco Bongo with friends and was very excited as I've been to the one in Cancun a few years back and loved it! This is pretty much the same layout, same show.. The show is AMAZING. Yet I did not enjoy this visit as much as the Cancun one because..For some reason the entrance to the club seems disorganized. There are multiple lines of people waiting on the street to get in. If you don't have your tickets at this point you can still get them on the street as there are a number of people out there selling them. Once in you will be directed downstairs where the lineup continues. All in all.. Takes pretty long to get in. We had a general ticket, I'm not sure if you get in faster if you're VIP.Once in.. The place is packed.. I mean packed. Almost impossible to move, the only place we found to stand was close to the bar which is good but so close that you can't see the stage or you can see but your neck breaks while doing so and you only see the front. You can not sit anywhere unless you have VIP then you can go up to the other levels where seating is available. I recall having a very dedicated waiter in Cancun, here not only no waiter you had to squeez through to the bar.. And back every time you wanted a drink. The show is really nice if you get to enjoy it seating down and you can get up to dance when you feel like.. As this is more of a show than a regular club, you need VIP tickets to do this. For this amazing show to happen there is the staff working hard to deliver. Confetti would cover the whole club ever 10-15 minutes or so and while you're standing there trying to have fun cleaners will constantly excuse themselves to sweep around you. With no space to stand in the first place it gets tricky. We did see one waiter drop a tray while trying to get up on the stairs filled with people. I'm not even sure how they manage not to drop them with over 10 drinks and no space to move at all. Long story short, the tickets are expensive, but if you don't like to be pushed around and stepped on for hours then consider getting VIP to enjoy your night out.

Like nothing I have ever seen!!!. This was booked through the hotel and classed as a bar crawl, no fibbing there. We went to Tye Pink Elephant club all inclusive drinks, the on to the Mandalaya, which was all inclusive drinks again woops, good bars though great fun, and then on to Coco bongo, packed to the rafters, waiters serve you with drinks which were all inclusive as part of the package, awesome show, acrobats, confetti and balloons flying everywhere brilliant night out well worth the money

must go fabulouse !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. it was amazing the shows were brill , the waiters were excellent and could not do enough to help . i would advise to upgrade to VIP you get your own seat and waiter your glass is never empty and you dont have to que outside and is allinclusive when you get in

over rated. there are to many people in there in one night if there was a fire you would not get out there are 3 floors to it and your packed in like cattle you cant even turn round it took us 40mins to get out and it wasnt even closing time show not worth the money
