Fantastic Place - Well Worth a Visit. Absolutely fantastic a must when in Mexico. Even if you don't normally go to night clubs you wont be disappointed, non stop action all night, seems expensive at first but if you compare what you would pay for a night club and a show then the added advantage of all inclusive drinks its good value.there really is so much going on you dont know where to look next.
Very different from what i expected. Brand name drinks if you pay extra well worth it, very good night!
AMAZING. Would live here if I could! Shame there were no seats and you had to stand all night, but the shows, music, and atmosphere was fantastic! Never been to a better club before!

Brilliant Club! Nothing like it in the UK!!. This club is one word.....AMAZING! Liverpool now seems boring. Myself and my boyfriend visited as part of a bar crawl organised by Thomson, it was the last stop and we enjoyed it so much!The staff were also great, everything you finished your drink they were there with another, truly a night to remember!

A Wild Time, Worth the Price. I decided to go to Coco Bongo after seeing footage of the show on video kiosks on Avenida Quinta. It was fairly pricey -- there are three price levels: $30, $65, $100 (in US dollars). With all three options, drinks are included, but only the top ticket price will get you a private table with a dedicated server. We chose the $65 tickets, which gave us express entry, and seating in the communal table area. When I say seating, I actually mean we were seated on steps -- long benches really -- and shared our server with about 20 other people. This, however was no problem. Drinks are included in your ticket price, but be sure to tip your server. The cocktails are well watered down, so we switched to beer after a couple of sickeningly sweet margaritas. After all, you can't cut beer. The real attraction here is the show, which is really, really something to see. It features terrific dancers, celebrity impersonations, and acts based on popular movies. Oddly, some of the movie references were quite old -- Beetlejuice, anyone? This does not dampen the festivities, however. There were also aerialists and trapeze artists. The club is extremely well organized and when you see the amount of staff that is constantly and vigilantly keeping the club moving all night you cannot help but be impressed. Every 15-20 minutes confetti canons filled the air with paper and streamers. At one point, balloons were shot out over the crowd. Video projections, live camera work, and the energetic, terrific cast make this a feast for the senses. Highly recommended. We left wondering why this doesn't exist in NYC or New Orleans -- two towns that seem perfect for this hybrid is disco and high-level entertainment mahem. Wear comfortable shoes, as you'll want to get up and dance.

No words to describe - the best!. 4 of us went to Coco Bongos after hearing nothing but great things and I have never seen anything like it. It was like a fusion of cirque du soleil, a concert and night club lol You don't have to be a night club person to go here and have a great time. There were people of all ages (over 18) and whether you want to wear shorts and a tshirt or a cocktail dress with heels you'll fit in. You will be entertained ALL night long and well taken care of by your waiter. Don't even think about it...just go! You won't regret it
amazing!!!!!!!. just go!!!Best club in the world. The show is unbealivable and the first time I went was just blown away!Pay the extra as you get better seats and arnt squashed in
Tiny version of the one in Cancun. The one in cancun is 10x bigger and better. The staff is horrible at both locations.
Fantastic venue. Absolutely fantastic a must when in Mexico. You dont know where to look loads of fantastic shows.

Most amazing show ever. We were not sure what to expect when we went to this show but wow what a great surprise it was!!!From the amazing strength and airiels show to the tributes to the dancing girls to the staging it was crazy energy so much to see.My husband and friends and i were completely stunned by the show and definately recomend it to EVERYONE we talk to no regrets.The venue is packed but u feel part of the show,They have cool air blasting on u every 20min to cool u down.Bring your camera and dancing shoes.Oh and the alcohol is included in the admission ALL NIGHT.Get some sleep cause the show starts at 11pm till 4am but sooo worth it!!!
Awsome!!!!!. But you need to try the GoldMember, best service, VIP spot.
Amazing. If you're looking for a fun night out you need to visit Coco Bongo!!!

Absolutely Brilliant!. We were given the tickets for this place as a wedding present, we were a bit apprehensive about going night clubbing, usually not our thing being in our 40's , However, It was one of the best nights out I have ever had, did not want it to end!!! Entertainment was superb, our glass was never empty, very well organised, would highly recommend going, only wish I could go again very soon.

awesome time!. it is more than just a night club. they put on a great show each night. great vibe and people. i highly recommend paying $60us, which is the vip package that includes transportation, vip entrance and all u can drink!
Best club on earth. This place is a must see. We go every time we are in playa. Do not miss out on going to this club
Great entertainment. Entertainment was great once you make it in. The only hassle was trying to get in. It helps to book it through your hotel, that is if you are in Mexico on vacation

The best club experience we have ever shared!. This was the highlight of our whole trip! We hated our resort but came back home just constantly talking about Coco Bongo! My husband is far from going to clubs but this is the first time I actually heard him say he had a blast! For the amount you pay to go you will pay for 2shots in Toronto! And the beat part is that the drinks keep flowing! You don't even need to get them because there are servers that always keep you refilled! You don't even need to be drunk to be there because it's such a blast yo wanna remember all of it! Just writing about it gets me excited! This place is a blast for all ages(minus kids). I will always recommend this place to anyone I know going to Plya del Carmen! The entertainment was so great you never want to leave! The party doesnt stop and you never wanna leave! Hands down the best club environment I've gone to!
Wild and Crazy Fun!. It is a Vegas style show of music impersonators. A lot of acts from 11:30 PM to 2:30 AM. Really had a great time!
Amazing. the shows and expeirience are incredible, I have been to Playa Del Carmen twice and have been to Coco Bongos 3 times! So worth it!

SOOOOOOOOOO fun!. First of all, I must say I am not a regular nightclub goer at all, but if all clubs are like Coco Bongo then I might very well become one!!! All the shows were fantastic! The organization of the servers and bus boys were impressive!!!! We bought the regular ticket that includes drinks and cover, but if you willing to pay a bit more, I would definitely get the gold member package which offers you premium drinks and more importantly- reserved tables/seats! We were there from 10:30pm until 03:30 and not for a moment did I feel bored! The atmosphere is fantastic and everyone is there so dance and have a good time! I am especially impressed with the cleanliness of the the washrooms- no vomit, no urine, no sticky floors even at the end of night with more than 300 people inside the venue! Must goooooo!!!!
Great night out. great show and atmosphere! drinks were flowing all night thanks to our waitor. deffinatly recommend the gold membership as you get a table,

A night to remember, pure exhilleration from start to finish!. We went to coco bongos on an organised trip through our hotel.I wouldstrongly advise this, as it could be a little dauniting on your own. We were well looked after all night, with priority seating, our own personal waiter, and transport there and back.From the minute you join the queue outside it is a feast for your senses. The colourfulness, the stilt walkers, the balloons, just a general buzz of excitement which is infectious.Once inside it is just the best night out ever.The show is jawdroppingly good, the acrobats and dancers superb. The costumes and makeup are wonderful. It is non-stop mayhem and madness!Coco Bongos is not for the faint hearted or anyone wanting a relaxng night out, it is mad ,mad, mad, and I LOVED IT!

Every Nights A Club Night!. Have visited Playa del Carmen several times and it wasn't till our last trip diid we patronize this night spot. We regret not having gone there sooner! We paid extra for the Gold access which I recommend as it gives you early VIP entry, top shelf open bar service to you VIP area, and complimentary shot upon entry. We booked through our resort so the price was discounted and included transportation. Gold level guest can interact with the lower stage performers when the VIP bar is converted into a stage at various points in the show. Upper stage performances are top notch as are the aerial acts. Expect 5 to 6 hours of non stop entertainment and partying. Considering what we pay for night clubs here in New York, Coco Bongo is not only a bargain, it is the best experience we've ever had in a club type atmosphere. If partying, drinking, and dancing are not your thing there is the half priced option to sit on the upper level and simply watch the performance which is well worth the time and money. The only negative is that you will have to sleep in the next morning to recuperate! Let loose and have a great time at this bar / dance club / theatre!
NUTS - MAD - BRILLIANT!!!!!. Loved everything about this club - Although go with a VIP package - Its the only way to do this club.
Way too fun. Get a VIP ticket! Get thereabout 2 hours after it opens and avoid the lines. Drinks are pricey but it is a great show.
an experience not to be missed. i thought i was to old to enjoy coco bongo but still went and glad i did it was a great experience so much more than a club so much happening time

High Intensity. This Disco Theatre style club was more than entertaining. They miz the night club scene with showgirl style performances and theatre acts. The atmosphere is intense and there is always something to be watching. I was skeptical at first but as soon as the show started I was amazed. I would defiantly go again if given the opportunity.

Awesome time. We attended Coco Bongo night club through Party Hoppers. Wow fabulous time. Great show at Coca Bongos and the Party Hoppers were very attentive to our every need. They took great care of us. It was everything they advertised it would be and more. They ensured we got service all night long and made sure we had a safe ride home. We tipped them well which I am sure helped ensure we got special service. We were given the royal treatment. We were let into Coca Bongo's ahead of the line up which was extensive. It is a very popular place here and if visiting do not miss it!! It as a life time experience
Wow!~!~!. If you love theatrical shows, good music, all you can drink, amazing ambience - then JUST GO. Dont think about it, just go!

You wont be dissapointed!. I traveled to the Mayan Riviera for the second time this summer with my boyfriend and having not been able to go to Coco Bongo the previous year we made sure it was a top priority this year as trips off the resort went. What an amazing time it was! I would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a great night out. You can take a taxi into the city and just pay at the door to get in.. but you'll be on the bottom floor and will have to look up a lot for the shows. I think the best bet is booking with someone on the resort, it just saves you a lot of hassles and is a lot more safe than trying to get yourself home in the middle of the night drunk as a skunk.There is definitely a trick to getting a good Coco Bongo experience for the lowest cost. First of all don't let the Coco Bongo Rep at the activity pool of your resort con you into spending double what you need to for a VIP ticket. Our girl was trying to sell these at $140/person and all the VIP people were getting was a little bit higher view in the club and tables to sit down at. They try to tell you a bunch of other crap like how you'll get line bypass and your waiter will be around to serve you more than anyone else. We booked with our onsite Travel Rep for $65/person plus $5 for the line bypass and ended up a couple of steps down from the VIP people.. so they paid $70 more per person to have a table to sit at. That might be worth it to some people, but definitely not for us! As for the waiter coming around.. no matter what you've paid to get in this place its busy as hell and these guys are pumping out drinks and bringing them to people as fast as they can. The first time he comes around give him your tip for the night and you've done about as much as you can as far as getting him to come back often. We went with 4 friends we met on the resort and we gave our waiter a $30 tip ($10 from each couple) and we never went very long without seeing him. He would bring us multiples of what we ordered at a time along with little shots and other drinks choices that we didn't even ask for. There is a little ledge where you stand where you can line them up so you don’t have to worry about holding all these cups. UNLESS when you arrive you don't try to be the first ones from your bus into the club. There were people that were positioned behind where we stood from our group so they were kind of just back there and didn’t have anywhere to lean or put their drinks because of it. These are the people who either didn't pay for the line bypass so they had to wait outside for 20 minutes or so.. or they just took too long getting from the bus to the door. My biggest suggestion is to get off the bus and make your way to the door as quickly as you can so that you're the first in your group to be put into place there for choosing where you want to stand and how much room you want for yourself. Throughout the night it obviously shifts around as people go out for cigarettes or to the bathroom but for the most part where you get first is where you'll be for the night.The show is amazing! Not even worth trying to explain just go and see it for yourself. They alternate between the stage and acrobatic shows and just regular music with something playing on the screen. Confetti and balloons flying, bright lights, and people going nuts. It's a very involved place.. I think my favourite thing about our time there was how involved everyone is with each other and the people putting on the show. You feel like you're a part of it. For the more daring ladies you can go stand on the side of the stage and ask to go into the center on the little platform when the regular songs are on and they'll let 2 or 3 girls go out at a time to dance.. Never guys. I'm not sure what time they stay open until, but we arrived at 11 and had to be back at our bus for 3:30. When we left the place showed no signs of stopping anytime soon, so if you go independantly I'm sure you could be there until the sun comes up.Overall it was a great experience and I would definitely reccomend going if you're looking for a memorable night out in Playa Del Carmen. We will definitely be back next year!

vip treatment, top club for great entertainment!. went with adults and teenagers,paid $50 for all inc. entrance to club and free drinks all night long inc taxi. Jumped the Que to get in and felt very safe as booked a return taxi from hotel, same driver back. 2 hotel reps came with us and stayed with us throughout the evening, looking after our every need! Vip treatment, same waiter remembered our drinks and gave refills without asking.

Incredible!!!. I had never heard of Coco Bongo so I went with a clean slate and not expecting anything. I was totally blown away by it all, I would definitely recommend it for anyone in the area. You will NOT be disappointed!

Amazing NIGHT! (from what I remember). We love Coco Bongo! This was our 3rd time at Coco Bongo, our first time in Playa Del Carmen. Our first 2 were in Cancun but Playa Del Carmen was the best! Playa Del Carmen is a little bit smaller, but it has all the same shows and fun as Cancun. This place is basically the craziest club you've ever seen confetti, balloons, lights, arial performers, dancing on stage, and drinking your face off. They play everything from new dance music, classic hip hop, and rock, something for everyone. What made this time the best was our server, Eduardo. Our reserved table was front and center in the heart of the action. I don't think I've ever had so much to drink! First drinks came 1 for each of us, then 2 at a time, then shots, then more drinks, then more shots, etc. all night long! I think one round we got 30 shots, for 4 of us! Not only was Eduardo great on service but he was friendly, and fun. When he wasn't getting drinks he was dancing right with us. Hopefully we'll be back to Mexico soon. We will definitely go to Coco Bongo, and request Eduardo. You should do the same!

Worst experience. What a shocking experience. We bought the VIP tickets, as we were told we could queue jump and be given a good table. None of that was true. We queued for half an hour out the front on the street and then I had to beg and plead for a table. It was so packed and service was very slow. The drinks had hardly any alcohol in them. You had to tip your waiter well to get good service. The shows were good, but didn't make up for the whole experience unfortunately.

LAS VEGAS, CIRQUE DE SOLIEL, RAVE AND A FANTASTIC CLUB ALL IN ONE AMAZING!!!!!. We went with our teenagers. Had a blast. Best club in the world. We never had to ask for a drink, our glasses were always full. We booked through our hotel Grand Sirenis Simply amazing. We were treated like VIP’S. Everyone should experience Coco Bongo at least once. My niece Amanda rocked the joint at Coco Bongo. Thank you Grand Sirenis and Coco Bongo for making our trip to Mexico a memorable one. You guys Rock!!!!!!!!

Best Night Ever! Great party atmosphere a 'must do' experience!!. If you are visiting Mexico you must go to Cocobongo's! It is a Brilliant club that offers 100% party satisfaction! it's not just for young party goers it is for everyone couple's families (over 18's) groups, we even saw a bride havin her reception there!. We went on a Saturday Night and it was Brilliant! Don't let the fact that the show only starts at 11.30 put you off as you will not look at your watch once while there as they constantly entertaing from start to finish with party music smoke machines, wind machines streamers glow in the dark band's you name it! We booked with the Coco bongo Rep at our Hotel who provided an excellent service they took us straight from the hotel showed us our spot and then brought us straight back! Don't book with Holiday Reps as you will miss some of the show especially T C project with Thomas Cook! Get in early pick your spot (Don't just accept first spot rep offers you) and stay there waiters will bring your drinks for you without you even asking. Never once felt scared as it is one of the safest and fun clubs I have ever been too! If you tip the waiters you will get a brilliant waiter service especially if you have Edwardo! Yes you are reserved a standing spot there are seats but anybody who wants to sit down while in there have gone to the wrong place as you will want to Dance! Great Value for Money and a Night to remember!!

Party Central!!. This is by far one of the best clubs I've ever been to. It's a club with an amazing show. A must see! Our guide, Jose was very helpful and did what he promised. Best seats in the house with an outstanding server. He kept the drinks coming all night!

If your in Playa you have to go once. Its a great night out and did not disappoint .... try to get in for $50-$60 US and get a place on the floor level.The show is fantastic, drinks keep coming all night, tip your waiter please

Sketchy server. Went with a group from our hotel and had a really great time at this club but our waiter told my boyfriend that he would cut us off if he didn't give him a $20 tip. This was after about an hour being there and we hadn't had much to drink so I'm not sure why he did this. We probably would have given him at least that much at the end of the night and none of the people we were with had been tipping after each drink. My boyfriend went to the bar instead and drew the attention of a different waiter who started bringing us drinks and shots (which we didn't even order). I had to cut myself off at that point but he made up for the awkward encounter and we ended up having a blast. I am not a club person but the show was great and I had so much fun!

Don't go with Thomas Cook. Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the show was amazing. I'm in my mid fifties and loved the music, noise and the fun! However, we booked and went with the Thomas Cook Project. This offered visits to other bars too, but meant you missed over 2 hours of the show at Coco Bongos which is where you really wanted to be. We arrived at midnight when it started at 11am. They told us it finished at 2.30am so to miss the crowd to leave at 2am - reasonsable but found out after it actually finished at 3.30am. The reps seemed more bothered about catching up with their colleagues than making sure the guests were having a good time.Don't miss going to this on your visit to Mexico! And check out the pizza place next door when you leave..mmm.......

Amazing, loud & funny, crazy party!. We heard about Coco Bongo's before we went to Mexico and decided that this was the place to go to, to celebrate our sons 21st Birthday. He had never heard of it and thought that we were taking him to something like a broadway show! We booked through the coco bongo rep who was selling tickets in our hotel. If costs $60 each for transport there, fast entrance, own area balcony (standing only) with open bar, waiter service and bathrooms.We arrived before showtime and there was music playing with the countown clock on the screen. We were also given balloons?!? You watch the shows through balloons, streamers and bubbles all night and it is so much fun.The shows last about 10-15 minutes each and are AMAZING. We were on the top balcony facing the stage, so most of the acrobatic/flying dancers started from there and are so talented and brave. In between the shows they play party music, it is crowded and loud but everyone dances on the stairs, balcony's with some on the podiums - be aware if you do this make sure that you are wearing decent underwear as blasts of air blow your clothes above your head (saw a few sights!!!). Because my son was 21 (we had previously informed the club) - they put the cameras on him, so that he was on the huge screens and they played 'It's my party' then 'happy birthday' to him. They also gave him a few teqilla shots to drink while everyone sang and the cannons fired the confetti on him! He loved every minute of it.Michael Jackson is not dead because we saw him here and he was fantastic!!!!! Beetlejuice is really good and sooooooooooo funny and we had a group photo taken with the main guy.This is an over 18,s club and does not finish until 3.30 a.m. so be prepared for a late night.
superb. fantastic night,place was jumpin from the minute we got there,if you go to playa del carmen then this place is a must,one in cancun is even bigger though
Great party. I had the best time, great music, excellent show, awesome time, best disco ever!

Could have been more enjoyable. Well the show seemed like it would have been awesome but our tourguide who brought us there completely misled us. If you like an insanely crowded place with non reserved seating and no guarantee of any seat than this is for you. Basically in a nutshell we paid 60 a person for an express pass to sit on the stairs where people are constantly walking up and down bumping into you, my wife had a drink poured on her. Sitting in a walking path was no fun so the wife and I lasted about 30 minutes max. The next fun part was leaving, we had to fight the crowd by pushing everyone in sight to get out only to find out that you can only go out the way you came in again fighting the crowd, or you could go completely to the other side of the place and again you had to push your way out. Complete fire hazard. After reading other reviews the only way it seemed people really enjoyed it was by paying 100 plus to get a seat to really see the show. Like I said earlier the show seemed as it would have been awesome but seating was rediculous and it seemed no concern to our tourguide or anybody at the facility itself. As of now I will try to get the money back or just chalk it up as a loss.

AMAZING SHOW!! just beautiful!. trust me when I say i AMAZING! a must do - is worth the money - it is a bit expensive cuz i took the VIP package!
For a perfect holiday you must visit this disco-bar-show etc etc!

Amazing Vegas style show in a club. Almost identical to the Cancun Coco Bongo. I actually think the show is better in Playa. There's more to see, less downtime in between acts. They're a little different, but not much. Either way, don't think I could tire of it.

wow. 25 show with a break of great music... the ticket cost is not cheap but is not important because in coco bongo you' ll pass a amazing night!!!fantastic the dancer and the acrobats...me and my girlfriend was for all time disbelievers for the evolutions of the show!!! it's impossible be bored...

Very entertaining, but way too crowded. The shows were very good and the music was great. Lots of confetti, balloons and bubbles. I would have enjoyed myself more if they would put a limit to the people they allowed. There are clearly no fire codes enforced. If you have issues with crowding, not having any space between you and the person next to you don't go. You are are on top of each other, literally. We paid $55.00 for the ladies and $65.00 for the men. That included transportation from Riviera Maya, express entrance, drinks, table with chairs (not all tables have chairs), and our own waiter. We booked it through a congo rep. and she stayed with us the entire night to make sure we were taken care of which was very nice.

OMG it is so crowded and I had so much fun. CoCo Bongo is a talent filled show with all the free drinks you can hold down. A cross section of music is covered by some very talented people. It was Cirque du Soleil meets the best club you could imagine. If your hotel offers tickets and/or transportation, this is the your best bet. It gets packed and the express line helps get you in quickly. Once you are in, it is up to you to find a spot and stay with your group. BEP, Michael Jackson, Madonna, Gaga and Queen are among the great artists that are covered. The aerialists, dancers and little person put on one hell of a show. Take a nap, get there early and enjoy the show.
VERY ENTERTAINING!!. Nice show and great music!! Love It!! I don't recommend it for claustrophobic people.

A must do experience. Coco's is exactly what the title says, a must do experience. The show was amazing, the atmosphere equally so and the waiters really on the ball. Any visit to this area of Mexico would be incomplete without a night out at Coco's. One of the high points of our two week vacation.

what an amazing show. i have been to many shows in London, Broadway and Vegas so I have high expectations when seeing new shows. This show was nothing like i have ever seen. It is a show / club so it is interactive. Open bar with the cover charge, if you are girls going alone, ask for half price tickets. I would never of would gone if my friend did not tell me about it as the advertisements in the streets do not do it justice.

Great spot, but.... We absolutely loved the show and everything about it! We went on a Tuesday, and there were around 900 people, not too much like in the weekends. So we would recommend going during the weekly days. There is just one big 'but' (as you see in the title). We bought a 10 dollar ticket from a guy called 'Robert' (he's around 40-45 and he said he was from Canada) at the beach. He promised us that with that ticket you pay 10 dollar at the beach and 45 dollar at the door. And because you pay a small amount in advance, you will be VIP and get the same as the people who pay 100 dollar at the door (your own table, free extra drinks, fast line to get in etc. etc.). We just had to ask for him as soon as we would be at the Coco Bongo door. When we where there, all dressed up and wearing extremely high heels, since we would be VIP and that meant that we would get a table so we could sit and watch the show, there was NO Robert. The people from Coco Bongo knew him, but said they could not do anything for us. He is working for them, but makes up his own story at the beach while he sells the 10 dollar tickets, so he will sell more and get more commission. Anyways, we left and went back an other day (without high heels). And we had a great time! Just do NOT buy your tickets from Robert at the beach or anywhere else in town, cause his stories are not true!! But def. visit Coco Bongo and you will have a great time!!

If you don't go to Coco Bongo, you've missed the best part of Mexico. We just got back from Mexico yesterday. We stayed at a resort in Playa del Carmen, and I listened to the pool DJ talk about this place for 6 days before I decided to inquire about more information. We we just looking for something different than the resort entertainment. We decided to pay the $100 per ticket for the VIP experience. It was the BEST part of our vacation. If you do not go, you've missed out on the best experience you will ever have entertainment wise. I am 43 years old, and was afraid it would be just for the younger crowd, but it is geared toward entertaining everyone. It was well worth the $100 VIP pass. I would have paid double that. I have paid more than that for concerts/shows in the U.S. and they weren't even half as entertaining. It was jam packed with fun! I highly recommend it if you are in Mexico!
The Best Show In Town!. This show is amazing, it is worth very dollar. We were able to see Michael Jackson, Madonna, Beetlejuice, Tron, The Mask and John 3:16. All are awesome, great club

AMAZING EXPERIENCE. We went on the party hopper excursion June 16. They pick you up at the hotel, & several vans meet in a parking lot near the ferry in Playa del Carmen. Wound up being in a group of ~95 with 5 tour guides, who are also double as your waiters in the bars. We paid $85 each on a Thursday night, which includes all drinks. Before they start, after the briefing in the parking lot they do ask for an additional $5 a head to tip the staff in all the bars. Didn't seem like a lot & the bar staff do help out the tour guides getting drinks & serving etc.  I thought it would take forever to get a drink, but it was very well organized, they had a counter full of drinks ready when we all filed in and our first stop was Senior Frogs, lots of fun, got good seats & the drinks were coming as fast as I could drink them. Had to slow down & pace myself actually. Carlos & Charlies was next, nice balcony, drinks ready when we arrived, not quite so entertaining as senior frogs. Then it was back to the busses for the short drive to Coco Bongo. We got there around midnight. When we first got there it was a little intimidating as it was so packed. The place holds 1800 people (at least) & 100 of us arrived and the show was already in progress. The problem was the floor was so absolutely jam packed it was hard to cross the floor to get to our "area". My wife lost me briefly & was getting a little panicky. At this point I was thinking the review from May 6 who complained abourt the crowds was right, but after 15 minutes or so my wife found me & we found a place to sit. The show(s) were amazing. There is no other way to describe it. There was never a dull second,Elvis, Michael Jackson, Maddonna, Black eyed peas, Lady Gaga, even Beatles (before we got there), a little something for everyone, even an old fuddy duddy like me. I thought it would be a sweat box with all the people, but every 10-15 minutes 4 huge jets from the ceiling flooded the place with dry ice fog, cooling you off by 10 deg C in about 2 seconds. Again the drinks just kept coming & coming 2 at a time & I tipped the server an extra 100 pesos for doing such a good job. In no time it seemed it was 0230 & time to head back to the bus & hotel.  My wife dragged me to this & I'm glad she did, we had a fantastic night we'll remember for a long time!!

OMG you must go!!!to Coco Bongo!. what a great night ,so much fun and excitement,I have been to M,exico many times probably 20+ and have always wanted to go but just couldn't work it out,well this trip we went and it was fabulous!! they pick you up at your resort and bring you right to the door ..make sure you pay the little extra for the express pass..well worth it ,unless you want to stand on line behind a couple of hundred people.the show was unbelievable..25 different acts ,they have confetti and baloons etc fall out of the ceilling this cold air shoots out ..people just go crazy for it..you have your own waiter that gets your drinks for you so you never have to leave your seat if you don't want to .and your drinks are included with the price of admission..this was better than almost any concert or nyc play that I have seen..you must go ..loved,loved ,loved it!!! we didn't bring a camera as we thought we wouldn't be able to use it ..we were wrong so bring your phone or your camera ..so much fun..I could go on for hours about it..

great night out - just too packed to see the full show. We went here as a party of 9 ranging from 20 to 50We booked as part of as an excursion with Thomas cook which included a 3 bar tour prior to entering the clubCannot tell you the bars we went to, but for the older members of the party we had to sit outside the 2nd bar due to the strobe lighting and ended up moving onto the 3rd bar before the rest of the group.Got to coco bongo at about 12pm (I think) all I know is that the show had already started and we were led to the highest level of the club, although had to go back for missing members of the party a couple of times.Being a little on the short side and not being able to see over everyone's shoulders as the club was rammed to the brim before we got in I really didn't get to see mcuh of the show, however what I did see was very good.The music is fantastic, drinks available very quickly and you could have what you liked.Only negative is I wished we had got to the club a little earlier not sure what time the show starts but I know we missed some of it.As a part of the tour with thomas club the coach picks you up at 2pm, which is just when you are getting started with enjoying the music and enjoying yourself. You can stay on and make your own way home but having already paid £90 dollars each as a party of 9 would have hated to think how much it would have cost us to go home by taxi.I would recommend this night out to anyone, but consider a trip that gets you to the club before the show starts, that way you may get a better view.

A Must See!. Coco Bongo = 2 thumbs up! One of the highlights of our trip to Riviera Maya and Playa del Carmen. Best show I’ve seen since Vegas. It’s a must see, but pack your patience for crowdedness. We paid $60 each on Tues. 5/31/11 which allowed us access ahead of the $50 general admission and closer to the stage. The drinks were good, considering they were included, and the bartenders were attentive. The shows are awesome and suitable for the younger and older audiences / party goers. If I revisit Cancun or Playa del Carmen, I would definitely go back to Coco Bongo, but better rested to fully enjoy the shows and dancing beyond 2:30am.

Awesome entertainment with great waiters & bartenders!. All drinks and entertainment are included in a $55 USD cover charge which was well worth it. The line outside may be deceiving as we arrived around 10 pm and it was about 3 blocks long. It took less than 20 minutes to get in and as soon as we were in, our waiter was right on top of things and had drinks for our whole table of eight in less than 3 minutes. The entertainment portion started at 11 pm and lasted until 3:30 am with a couple of intermissions allowed for stage/costume changes in which great songs were played & they allowed customers to dance on the bar located at center stage. Huge range of entertainment with music of all decades and genres, great dance moves, movie skits, acrobatics and so much more. I would recommend a camera with a quick shutter and allows night shots. Also, although this is considered a club and club wear is appropriate, I would recommend comfortable shoes as we stood the whole time (our choice).
A Must See. This is the est nightclub i have ever been to. Drinks are included in the ticket price between 10:30 & 03:00, we had amazing service which made the night even better.

Good Times, fun to try once. We had a good time at coco bongo for our first experience. I think the prices are ridiculous though we paid $75.pp which allowed us to not wait in line which was good because the line out the door was insance at least an hour wait. The $75.pp included unlimited drinks (the drinks are horrible - stick to the beer) I also didn't like how crowded you felt while inside we had a space on the second floor reserved when we got upstairs there were about 100 people the person who coordinated this said to stay in our reserved area because 700 more people were going to come up to our area -this drove me crazy as I do not do well in crowds. My husband and I found a nice spot downstairs next to the exit. lol This place is huge - I was impressed with how organized this place was - and bathrooms were really clean. All in all we had fun, but I won't be going again.

VIP tickets. If you are short or don't want to stand for 3 hours get the VIP tickets. We got them at the ticket booth around 11am the day of. The key is to get there that night around 10:30 or 10:45 pm and get into the vip line. They will open the door for you at 11pm. You will then get a great seat but it will cost you 100 a piece but for us it was worth it. And you will get premium drinks also.

TOTALLY AWESOME!. Have you watched the mask? yes this is a club based on that film (the original club from the film is in cancun) .............If you do nothing else while in Mexico make sure you visit the Coco Bongo club! its the most amazing party and show. it cost about £30 but this gives you express entry (always go express as the queue to get in is huge if you dont) the beer is all in and they get refills to you quicker than you can drink them. You have to be over 18 to get in but its suitable for people of all ages. If your outgoing get up and have a dance on the stage or if not sit or stand back and watch the delights of the show which lasts about 4 hours....the club then continues until 6am if you fancy carrying on the night after the show. The dancers and the quality of the show is fab and partying at home will just never compare.

Nolitours/Transat,what are you thinking?. We bought 3 tickets from our tour operater Nolitours/Transat while in Playa Del Carmen for $85 each for their "party hopper" tour.The young french lady told us we would have our own guide to take us to 3 bars in the V.I.P. sections etc.It starts with a van picking you up at the resort and taking you to a parking lot in town where first the 2 "tour guides" want $5 cash from each person or they won't take you!There were a bunch of vans there with 126 people(V.I.P.'s......lol).They took us to senor frogs which was lame,then carlos&charlies which was more fun with some dancing,then off to the "nightmare,coco bongo's"!Once you get to coco bongo's everyone goes down to a long basement hallway and waits.Next you follow everyone up a sloped hallway to this tiny,loud,muti-level room that's wall to wall people.Out of 3 of us,only my wife made it to the section they were trying to get us to.Once she got there,she was given a cup of fruit punch,later one of the guide's dumped a full tray of beer on her new dress,then gave her a dirty look! The info. about the place was it held 1800 people but there must have been double that,as you could not move,see anything,get drinks. All I saw was a guy in a beatlejuice costume once and we spent the next half an hour trying to find each other.Even after I found her,I quickly lost her again as we were trying to get the hell out of there.When she found the exit the guy at the door refused to let her out and she had to get angry with him to get out.It took me 10 minutes to find the exit and while looking for it,I'm sure I sent dozens of drinks flying since the only way to move in there is to put your shoulder down and push your way through!(sorry to those people,I'm sure that was the last drink you saw that night)Once we found each other outside there was a couple from Ontario talking to one of guides.They were in our group behind us and he fell on the stairs and made a hole in the drywall(we heard the crash while in the hallway),and the coco bongo's people wanted $100 cash and he refused and they kicked both of them out before even getting in!We left them there arguing and took a cab back to our resort. We're really shocked that Nolitours/Transat has no regard for their customers safety,a place like that would never be allowed in any town or city in Canada(fire).Also still waiting to hear from them for our request for our money back.So if you think you're going to see a show,dance and have a good time.......NOT!

Best show on the Riviera Maya. Just returned from a gorgious week in Mexico, which included Coco Bongo in a party hopper tour.I can confirm show super,people nice ! You should know is jam packed so advantage if you go organized with express pass ! -no awaiting at the entrance, place to dance/see the show,waiters,bodyguards included!If you tip you get good drinks if not you'll get what you deserve!- but you wont remain sober 100% guaranteed! Definetely would go back anytime !

Its OK to do it once!. Its a nice show but its not a nightclub, so if you want to go see a show while you dance and enjoy the music perfect. If what your looking for is more of a bar nightclub experience, visit the clubs and bars on 12th street, have fun you guys!

Funnest night out in a long time. my husband and I were at first very hesitant about going to any bars in mexico, but we were very much proven wrong when we went to coco bongo. It was entertaining, loud, everyone was dancing and having a good time, no pushing or fighting. The entertainers were very good, and were continuously shocking and amazing us. We had an open bar pass, and the waiters were never slow with the arrival of new drinks. The music was loud and made you get off your butt and wanna dance. Even my husband who never dances got up and was dancing with me! Would go back in a heartbeat!

INSANE!! A MUST!!!. Traveled to Playa with 3 girlfriends to celebrate our 40th birthdays. We were a bit hesitant about going because of the 10:30-3:30 am time frame....didn't know if we could stay out that late anymore! The minute we walked in we knew we made the right decision! The party started the moment you walked in and kept you entertained until the very end. We were amazed at the quality of the production - like nothing we had ever seen before - sort of a mix of a big new year's party at a giant nightclub, a crazy rock-concert and cirque de soleil. Never a dull moment. Something new happening every time you looked up! I saw people say how great the drink service was, but we had quite the opposite experience. We were turned over to our server by our host from the hotel who brought us to our reserved area right along the rail next to the stage - awesome view!! We gave our waiter $10 with the first order so he would keep coming around and we never saw him again! We ended up getting our own drinks and got stopped on the way up twice by other waiters who took care of us. I think he may have forgotten we were with the group, as another couple that was with us (same age range) had full drinks everytime we looked over. Must have been a fluke though as other reviewers say how great that part is, so I won't let it affect my review....If you do not like to stand for a long time or don't like loud music, this might not be for you - but if you like to have a good time and dance, you need to experience this show! Also, we were a bit nervous when we walked in and were herded downstairs into a long hallway and no fire exits in sight. Made us mom's a bit nervous thinking 'what if there were a fire?- we would all be screwed!'. It seems codes in Mexico might be a bit looser than in the US.All in all a fantastic show!!!!

It's like being in Vegas in teh middle of Mexico.... The shows are amazing.. beware teh open bar though I don't really trust the quality of teh alcohol. Just ask for beer not for liquors like Vodka or tequila.. The shows are mind blowing ! My favorite are Spiderman and Queen ! It's definitely a club you pay a visit to when you are in Playa dle Carmen. Try to call in a reserve a table in advance so you can get the best spots and views :)

Never too old to feel young again!. As this was my second trip to the Mayan Riviera since January, I wanted to go out and have the time of my life and I danced the night away until 4 am. My wonderful group of 4 women - ranging from my old self at 50 to the youngest at 30 - and our friend John spent THE BEST night out at Coco Bongo's!!Barbie, one of the fab staff at the Ocean Coral piled us in a van and for $50 each we had a private section, space to dance, a great view of the stage and dance floor, and a bartender who kept us in drinks all night! I don't know what was the most exciting part of the night - the musical numbers, the rocking music that had us dancing all night or the acrobatics of the performers! I haven't been out to a night club like this ever and I can hardly wait for my daughter is old enough to come along with her old lady!To sum it all up: I felt like a kid again!

Awsome!. What a night!!!! as I'm getting to old for night clubs what a great way to feel young again . This was one of the best shows I have ever seen It does start late and it is crowded but that aside it is worth the $50 to get in!

So much fun! Worth every cent!. There was a rep in our resort selling packages to go to Coco Bongo. We chose the cheapest one at $50 USD/CDN. This included shuttle there and back from the club, entrance, free drinks, a dedicated bartender, a reserved area. This was the best option. The party hopper is just a waste of time since the reason for it is the last destination - coco bongo. We went on a weekday so it was a bit cheaper and less busy, but I will say it was still busy! We waited in line but only for 20 minutes, our rep came with us the entire way, inside through the check points etc. and took us to our spot and introduced us to our bartender. He recommended we tip him $5 on our first drink and after that he would take care of us. he was not wrong. our bartender was great! he just kept coming, drink after drink, I lost track. We were down on the lower level, on the steps which was fantastic. this was a great club/cabaret experience. The shows were fun, the music was fabulous. They played the best music and from all years. We just danced and sang all night! The next thing you know its 4am! The bathrooms were clean, very impressive with the number of people there. The security was excellent. if you needed them they were there instantly to help. We had our space and no one invaded it, it was just great. I would definetely go here again.

Stupid. Completely NOT worth the money!!. When signing up to go to this club I was given a completely different idea as to what it was. The shows put on were poorly executed and badly lip synced. There was no rhyme or reason to the choices made. When the DJ decided it was time to dance, they would only play about 30 seconds of a song at a time, so just when you were getting into a groove, it would stop. The busyness of the club was almost unbearable - they pack you in like sardines so good luck doing anything but standing for 4 hours. Probably the biggest rip off was the drinks! I actually asked the waiter if he forgot to put the alcohol in my first drink because it was so weak. I've never in my life tasted such weak, watered down drinks! At our resort they offered a standard admission of $70US an express $80 which gets you in faster (not worth it as we just stood in line and got pretty much the same spot as these people) and finally a VIP admission of $110 which would guarantee you a table and seats. Regardless of being able to sit, I would NOT waste your money. If you do choose to go here, book through your tour group and NOT the resort you are staying at as it will be cheaper, and they were tell you of all the scams.

Crazy! Fun!. We went as part of a party hopper tour. I only found out afterwards that we were supposed to have a reserved area on one of the balconies, so I was on the main floor right near the bar, which I personally think was great. Who wants to sit down anyway? I came to dance! The show was amazing... I was impressed. It was totally crazy... loved it. :) Probably not the place to go if you don't like crowds and need to have a seat, but great for those who want to see a great show, party hard, and dance a lot!

Great idea but dangerously busy. Our group of friends went on a "Party Hopper" trip which took us to two bars first, one of them Senor Frogs, which were awesome! When we arrived at Coco Bongo it was already passed their capacity it seemed at midnight. Our "reserved seating" was beside the bathroom and not in view of the stage. More importantly, we were scared. The place was completely packed and emergency exits were not easily attainable. If you are single and twenty, this is the place for you. Definitely no sitting, dancing or moving around easily. I wish we would have known ahead of time how crazy it gets because our rep did not let us know. about 10 of us from our group left early because of this. 80 bucks per person!

Loved It. Coco Bongo was our last stop on the Party Hopper Tour and I thought it was great. All the shows were great and the place was packed. Because we went with the Party Hopper Tour ($80 per person Trans, VIP entrance & drinks included @ Carlos & Charlies Senor Frogs & Coco Bongo) we had a great spot on the balcony and didn't miss a moment. The only thing that creeped me out is that we were standing at the rail and I set my drink down and almost dropped it into the crowd....that would have hurt. We are going back to Playa in March again and will def do the Party Hopper Tour again and can't wait for Coco Bongo.

Not worth the money!. Coco Bongo well we don't totally recommend this to anyone. The show they put on is good but no there is no place to sit unless you buy a bottle for $100 and it already cost $50-$60 to get in. Hundreds of people packed into a small space = scarey situation if there was a fire, we only stayed for 2 hrs of the 4 hr show. We were happy to get out alive.

Totally Wicked Awesome!. We also did the bar crawl. The bar crawl started out at Charlie's. This bar is a total waste of time. They try, but the bar is very small and with the non-stop referee whistles and the clowns honking horns, etc. this bar was just plain annoying. Avoid this bar at all costs...From there we went to Senor Frogs. This bar was great. It's right on the beach, there is a trampoline out on the sand, that several customers were out jumping/laying on. They had a live band playing that sounded awesome. Given a chance to do this again, we would walk the 1/2 block to Senor Frogs and skip Charlie's altogether, and just hang there waiting for the rest of the ground to catch up. From Senor Frogs, we loaded up and drove over to the COCO BONGO CLUB!!! This club was the whole reason we signed up for this tour and it didn't disappoint. It's like a night club/dance club, add Vegas shows and throw in New Year's Eve with a dose of steroids!!! We had a great time and will definitely be going back. The advantage to the bar crawl is 2 fold, you have round trip transportation from your resort, your drinks and tips are all included and you have a reserved area at the CoCo Bongo Club on the upper level, near a bathroom and right next to the stage. It's wicked awesome and worth every penny.

Las Vegas party in here everynight.. Hahahha where to begin with this club ? It was awesome except its not really a club more like a cirque de soliel ? Show hahah it was interesting way overpriced 50 bucks ? All you can drink maybe 35 the most it should be but stringer and baloons and god knows what else is shot out of the roof but it lands in your drink hair and clothes. Its like a crazy over packed stadium.. Its crazy if there was a fire it would be jumanji and half the poor souls would die .. Its way to packed good air conditioning tho, ppl flying around the room, don't ever sit on the first floor or under the stage because you'll have to crank your neck the entire night to catch a glimpse of the show. Not much room to dance and you can't mingle with anyone except the people around you... Drink service was great always had a refill and shots were poured every min.. If you wanna get effed up and be crazy obnoxious and enjoy your vacation this is the spot for you ! Its like a new years party everynight !

Coco bongo - nice playback show, disco and stunts. I went to Coco Bongo last day I had stayed in Playa del Carmen. I went with my hotel animators (from Sandos Playacar). There was a lot of people in the queue but we had special entry. I recommend entering with the group from the hotel because you got special price, suvenire and very good place. Our steward were very friendly. He brought the drinks faster than we were able to enjoy them ;-)

LOCO COCO BONGO!!!. Crazy partying!!! :) Just DONT DRINK AND DRIVE!! Was there for NYE. Lots of fun, too much drinking.. They show you the countdown from timesquare, although I doubt its live hehe , great place to get drunk and have a good time!

CRAZY but way fun. Can we say "fire hazard". LOL I hear there are sometimes about 3,000 people, and I'm sure a building of this size in the US would allow about 800 people in, but they make it work. Unless you're the nervous-Nelly of the group, you'll love this. We were a little concerned if we'd get our money's worth, and that we would be "stuck" there until 3:30 am. Well worth the money, and we were NOT ready to leave. We had to tell our new friend "Guillermo" that he could call us tomorrow, but our ride is LEAVING NOW! LOL Free drinks, all you can drink!! It's true, no catch. We were even given a free shot of tequila w/ lime at the door. Crazy.The impersonators were not the best at lip syncing , but the costumes, dance, and special effects were top notch. Confetti every 15 minutes!! Literally! My friend used 1 of the 5 foot long balloons to help assist a fellow from across the room to get a piece of confetti out of his hair (without ever first talking to him or warning him). Hey, we're here to help out. LOL Never mind the fact that he didn't care for this, and grabbed the other end of the balloon, which caused our drinks to be knocked over onto Mr. & Mrs. Rodgers sitting next to us. ooops.This place is a MUST GO.

Fun for awhile, and then boring.... I went with a group as a package deal for $65, and we were told we are VIP's etc, fun show, dancing etc. We finally get there, and we are not VIP's, everyone is a "VIP" You are given a shot of tequila as you enter, then our guide "hector" took us up 3 floors by stairs to our VIP section with all the other VIP's, and it was packed, standing room only. One washroom for men with 2 urinals inches apart. No toilet, so forget the other stuff.The show starts, and it's good, but it becomes obvious pretty quick, there is no dancefloor, unless you count standing on the bar top, and having about 18 inches of room to dance. So my group within 20 mins all moved down to the main floor to dance. However, of course the bar dance tabletop is full of women, and us men end up watching the show, and the women dancing. And every 15 mins, they would clear the bar top dancing, put a top on for the performers, then 15 mins later, open the bar again for dancing. This went on several times throughout the night and it got really boring.The show is all pop culture references, beetlejuice (how current is that?) the Mask of course, batman, spiderman, pirates of the caribbean, madonna, lady gaga, frank sinatra, and on and on and on...Oh and LOTS of paper being shot out all night, I mean LOTS, cover your drink. If you go once thats all you need, they do the same show every night, it's highly choreographed...

Who Designed this Place!?. I went to Coco Bongo with a group of five people two nites ago. I really had no idea what to expect as I didn't look at their website, etc. First off the entertainment is great. I only stayed for 3 hours and I liked what I saw for the most part. There were a couple acts that I thought could have been improved, but I realize I'm not going to like everything. I would have like to have stayed and seen the rest of the performances, but my negative comments below should explain why I didn't.When we got to the location my group and I got in the "Express Line" for those who had bought tickets in advance. We were only the second in line! As we stood in the humid heat, we watched as "VIPs" repeatedly just walked into the doors. When we got into the building, we were escorted to a step. Literally, a step! Our group of five had to basically sit on the floor! There were a bunch of "Reserved" seats at tables but we were told we could not sit there. Right away we were so disappointed but it only got worse! As people kept filing into the club, our visibility of the stage was diminished. My 61 year old mother had to ask twice for people to stop standing in front of her. As we looked around, we saw that 80% of the people in the club WERE STANDING! This is not a place to go if you can't stand for long periods of time (I have a problem with my knees). Our "seats" had no cushions and my back was in extreme pain after my three hours there.This club is so crowded it's insane. About every 5 min. confetti is blown out into the crowd. Every time this happened I saw people either covering their drinks or fishing out the confetti that landed into them (ew!). After the 20th time of this when the confetti was on the floor about 6 inches deep, a guy went around cleaning it up! He asked us to move repeatedly. The waitstaff and others crammed into the club kept asking us to move. It was hard to enjoy the entertainment with the horrible seating and standing arrangements!The female restrooms were clean enough but there were only three for a large capacity. And when you read signs saying "all those using illegal substances will be sent to the proper authorities," you feel like the place has a past with drug use.I think more people would attend the club if there was proper seating. Perhaps tables where people could sit and a dance floor below? This experience was definitely interesting, but I honestly don't think I would go again. How can you enjoy such a place? I'm starting to think the only people that can truly enjoy this are those that drink heavily to the point where they don't care about the enjoyment of others but only getting their money's worth from the free booze.

Coco Bongo, good but..... Ok, I went here in Playa del Carmen twice, one in March with a broken foot thru Party Hoppers and had a FABULOUS time. Then I went last week thru the club itself and was disappointed. The second time we stayed til 3:30. but after 2 it's a reg club and fights started, I did not feel safe!I think the key is the night you go. In March it was a Thursday, this time a Tuesday and the club was at half capacity and there were more videos than performers.My advice: worth seeing, go thru Party Hopper Tours (Jimmy is great), do the other 2 bars first, and def go on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday. I give it an excellent on prime nights and a fair on non.

Yikes, too many people for me!. This place is fabulous, very cool bar, AMAZING entertainment BUT, too many people in the space for me, I couldn't do it. I felt like I was going to suffocate. My friends that stayed loved it though so if you can handle crowded, hot places, you will love this place!

Happy New Years Every 5-10 Minutes. Wow, this place is absolutely insane. Words cannot describe it. I went into the situation thinking that it was going to be a dance club and I wasn't going to have a good time, but that was FAR from the case. Right from the get go I was like oh my goodness this is going to be crazy, but awesome. I started off the night in our little vip area, but quickly made my way down to the main bar to start dancing on top of it. Within 3 seconds of being on the bar, i had the bartender tap me on the foot and hand me a shot. This happened LITERALLY 5 times in the first minute and the rest of the night was dancing history. The shows itself were pretty cool, but the confetti and balloons that fell every 5-10 minutes made my night. It was just mayhem and I loved every moment of it. My fiancee(now turned wife) and I were quite intoxicated(understatement) and we left the place without her purse and didn't realize it until the next morning. After checking with our friends who went with us if they had it, we quickly realized that she had left it there the night before. We talked to Rosaria(sp) the person from the Royal who took us down there and she told us to head back there that night after 8 hoping a manager would be there. I'm thinking, great, in Mexico, a packed bar, and a girls purse... we have NO SHOT at getting it back. But, we figured we'd give it a shot, so late that night we head over there and get taken to the side door. We talked to a gentleman who took the description of the purse and told us to wait one minute. To my astonishment he kept opening the door telling us they were checking. I thought they were going to wait 30 seconds and be like, 'ehhh i don't care about you at all, oh no sorry we couldn't find it'. WOW was I wrong. After waiting about 15-20 minutes the door opened and there was her purse. What a relief! Inside was everything that she left including an iphone, cash, camera, her makeup etc etc. I was so elated that I took all the money out of my pocket and fanned it to the employees thanking them and wanting them to take the cash as a thank you. But they simply said no no no, it was no problem, keep your money and have a good night. I was absolutely floored and what went from a potential disaster really gave our wedding trip a new momentum. So, to the workers of Coco Bongo, and to the gentlemen of the side door... thank you soooooooo much, it was an experience that I will never forget, and you can be damn sure that when we return to Playa next, you will be seeing my smiling face!

Coco Bongo can NOT be missed. A girlfriend of mine and I went to Coco Bongo on a Tuesday night. We got to see everything from Lady Gaga to The Matrix!! I had to keep reminding myself that I was in a bar in Mexico ~ FANTASTIC show, would go again and again. The staff work hard to make sure your drink is always full and that you are smiling!

Its a great place to go I loved it so.... Its a great place to go I loved it so much i cant wait to go back again!! Be nice to the waiters and make sure you give them a tip and you will be taken care off!!! People stop complaining and have fun!!!

Spectacular, Spectacular!. We went the VIP route to be on the main floor, and I would go back in a hearbeat and pay whatever they asked to do it again! This was an incredible place. PIcture the club in Moulin Rouge with modern technology, and you're getting close.First, the place is built like a colosseum. For the $55 basic admission, you will be in an upper tier, which is good if you prefer to sit, drink, and watch the show and the people on the lower levels dancing in between acts. I don't know if there's dance space on the upper levels.If you go on the main floor, Yes, it will be extremely crowded--like clubs in Vegas, Miami, or Chicago. But if you're into clubbing, you want to pay the extra. You will be able to dance, and if you are wearing a tight dress, the bouncers will probably pull you up to dance on the bar. They even let guys up there, which I haven't seen in the states (actually, I've seen guys be very rudely kicked off platforms, etc. Hooray for the friendlier attitude in Playa!)There will be a Vegas-quality productions that lasts for about 15-20 minutes followed by an interval in which the DJ plays dance music (the night we were there, it was an awesome mix that would appeal to everyone there: Black Eyed Peas, current pop and lots of 80s, Bon Jovi, Mana, Ricky Martin, stuff people knew and were singing along to rather than heavy techno.) Meanwhile, there are periodic balloon drops, confetti releases, etc.I was astounded by the lavishness of the shows: video screens, light shows, aerialists, good dancers, flashy costumes. The sets featured celebrity impersonators doing sets by artists such as Austin Powers, Queen, Elton John, The Mask, and Moulin Rouge. Drinks kept coming faster than I'd have expected considering they were prepaid and the waiters had to navigate through a packed crowd. I don't know if there were any options besides beer or tequila...but do you really need more than that? ;-)My husband and I are in our 40s, and the friends we went with were all in their late 20s-early 30s, and we all loved the music and shows and decided the night was the highlight of our trip. There are two reasons I'm not giving it all 5 dots: * the length of the line and pretentious attitudes of the bouncers outside--all that Vegas junk about making passersby want to come in because they see a big line outside--I hate that* the cost. It's a good value for the money, but it's still more than a lot of vacationers are ginog to want to spend.

AMAZING - Just as good as Cancun!. We have been to Coco Bongo in Cancun 4 times, and were excited to learn that Playa Del Carmen now has one too! The club in Playa is a bit smaller, but still an amazing show (that is a bit different than the one in Cancun!) and completely worth the money! The staff were all very nice, and our drinks were never empty! As soon as our drink was about half done, the waiter was bringing us new ones! We are going to Playa Del Carmen again this year, and we will definatly be going back to Coco Bongo!!!

kind of fun. open bar show nice to watch for a few hours but not very funwe kept getting pushed around by waiters and other staffs as the area is very cramped so it was actually had to relaxed, dance and enjoy the show

Coco Bongo was a complete blast!!. My husband and I stayed at Grand Sirenis Riviera Maya from 11/20/09 through 11/30/09. We went to Coco Bongo in Playa Del Carmen. We weren't too sure about this because my husband and I aren't really into shows, but it ended up being a lot of fun. It was really entertaining. We loved all of the shows and the fact that they brought you your drinks. It is hard to explain in words, so you really need to go and experience it yourself.The only thing we didn't like about it were the seats. They had us bunched in like sardines, but you could move around wherever you wanted to. Also, our waiter tried to bring in another table and sit it right in front of us with a group of about 6 guys. We already had an area of about 5 feet for 12 people and 2 tables!!! Then, he wanted to bring this other group in our space. My husband took care of that right away and we had a blast after that!!! :)

Coco Bongo is a must!!!. We went to Coco Bongo in the beginning of June on a Monday night. Two 18 year old girls, and a 20 year old boy. When we first arrived outside Coco Bongo we were told that we could get in for $40 a person, we then talked with the employee and got it down to $20 a person, but we only had $50 and needed money to get a cab back to our resort. We (the 2 girls) left and went to Blue Parrot which was nice, and then were walking back to Coco Bongo when the same employee told us we could go in for free. We were really skeptical and thought it was a scam and that we might get arrested, but after he confirmed it was free. He said all we had to do was drink and dance, which we agreed! It takes a couple of minutes to walk inside and they check your wristband several times. When we walked in we got some shots at the bar, which were pretty good, but definitely not very strong. We were amazed at how big it was. Flashing lights, smoke, and confetti was falling from the sky. It was a stadium style seating with different levels that had standing, seats, and bars. We made it to the middle and got onto the stage where we could dance with people below us. I jumped onto the trampoline, but was immediately told I could not go on the trampoline by the employees. After 10 minutes of dancing to strange techno music the show came on and we went up to one of the stadium seats. There are some areas that say "reserved" and we accidently went onto one of these floors, but it seemed like the girlfriend was jealous that her boyfriend was talking to us and told us to leave. We found a seat and watched the Lady Marmalade show which was great. Then we watched the Acrobats where people were hanging in the air from large drapes. After about 20 minutes of watching the dancing continued. Overall the safety is pretty good, there are safety officers walking around everywhere with flashlights. My friend and I held hands the entire time to make sure we wouldn't get lost, and we covered our drinks at all time. I would recommend not bringing purses or cameras because they could easily be stolen. Overall I highly recommend going to Coco Bongo either by paying the $40 or getting in for free!!!!

Good entertainment, but can be dangerous. I was very surprised by the show, never expected to find that quality of production in Playa de Carmen, kuddos to the owners and producers. However, there is no control of the number of people coming in, and the place gets overcrowded, and regardless of all the security measures to get in, crooks make their way in, and some naive people bring purses and other valuables and leave them unattended. Me and I my family got escorted out of the club by security because an idiot next to us got her purse robbed, and took it against us, even to the point of making contact to search my daughter. I was amazed that when we got out the exit door, they had already caught the thief, and handed him over to the police, but the damage was already made to my party. The careless couple who got robbed, and the club manager came to us with apologies, but that did not change my daughter's breakdown, who ended up in ER until we could calm her. or get back our reputation, lost when hundreds of people stared at us leaving the place escorted by a few security guards.All in all, if you want to see a good quality show, go to Cirque du Soleil, and if you want to have a drink and dance, go to your favorite joint, Coco Bongo is a corny mix which does not justify the risk taken by going there. Even if you have made reservation for a "private" table, people will be running over you, and careless idiots will take purses and get robbed,

Words just cant Describe it!!!. I dont have enough words to describe Coco Bongos and how fantastic it was!!I went twice whilst staying in Mexico as I thought it was that good. Even my husband who does not like this sort of thing thought it was amazing.It does cost around $55 to get in but your drinks are free and they just keep coming and coming. The show starts at 11pm and goes on until 3.30. You have impersonators (Beyonce, Michael Jackson etc.) and they also recreate scenes out of films.There are people flying through the air on wires, hanging from the ceiling it is just ace!!Every now again a siren would go off and paper, bubbles, streamers and even balloons fell from the ceiling.Coco Bongos was absolutely the best part of my holiday and I cannot wait to go back!Have fun xx

Waste of a time. Dont be suckered into going into this tourist trap...this is not a club, unless you think standing around in stadium type setting while there corny re-enactments to popular movies going on and being served drinks in dirty cups is your thing. It's dingy and smells, we stayed all of 5 mins before booking out of there as soon as we could. Shouldve expected as much when you have 10-15 of their staff trying to sell you tickets outside.

An experience NOT to be missed!. You cant really describe in words what this place is like - mardi gras meets Las Vegas I think is how they try! Its fabulous! Approx $55 to get in but that includes all drinks too - and they dont let you go thirsty! Much of it is waiter service as its difficult to move but the staff are amazing, balancing drinks and making sure you are refreshed throughout the show. Try and get a table up on the side so you dont strain your neck watching the ents but wherever you are, you are guaranteed an amazing time.This place is for ALL ages, yes its crazy but the music is for everyone and the shows are incredible. If a Coco Bongos came to the UK, I'd be there every weekend - its non stop!We chose to go twice during our holiday and we werent disappointed. Thursday was just as busy as Saturday. Would highly recommend this place, if its the only visit outside of your resort that you do.

I was surprised on how much I LOVED IT!. It's a hard experience to describe...kinda like a Cirque de Soliel show and a dance club all in one. But it's better than that even. I was skeptical on going especially since it starts after 11p and lasts well past 2:30a but never once was I bored. It was a fantastic experience!!!

If you like amazing entertainment, music, dancing, lights... this place is for you.. This place is the best entertainment place for a night out with friends for drinks. If you like music, pop culture, movies, you won't be disappointed. I highly recommend you book ahead of time, make a VIP reservation with tables. Otherwise, you'll be stuck in the sweaty masses.Not sure if this place would comply with North American fire codes, but it's the best for a crazy night out with friends.
Love it. i had sooo much fun here, love everything, really worth the money

Crazy unbelievable place!!!! Everyone should go at least once!. I don't even know how to describe Coco Bongo. It's like a Las Vegas Show combined with a dance club on acid! I don't know that I would go again, but I'm sure glad I went this time!!! If you don't like crowds or loud music, this is NOT for you. Also, you might end up standing a good bit of the time (or dancing!), so if you're not up to that physically, again it's not for you. Barring those considerations, no matter WHAT kind of music you like, this place and show has got to be seen to be believed! LOVED IT!

Don't Blink...you might miss something !. Wow...Las Vegas should be jealous! Just went to CoCo Bongo while I was in the Playa del Carmen area this past week. The club had a representative Jaime at our hotel who informed us about this disco/show and sold us the tickets and accompanied us on the ride to the place and well as escorted us in and to the section where we would be sitting/standing. There are 25 plus shows with impersonators ranging from Frank Sinatra to Madonna and in between these shows there are bubbles falling or confetti, they even have acrobatics similiar to those in Cirque Du Soleil. We danced the whole night and would definitely recommend it ...you won't be disappointed.

AWESOME. I would recommend this club to all ages over 21.Didn't really know what to expect but was plesently surprised at how organized everthing was and the service was excellent! Music for all ages and the shows & performers certainly wouldn't let you nod off!! Being 55+ I was a little hesitant but went with my 22 year old daughter. I honestly don't know who had more fun.When I get back to Mexico I would definitely go again.

Tourist Trap...most expenisive mistake. Absolutely terrible. I will say one good thing is that this place will not gyp you on your drinks. There staff works very hard and you will not be without a drink or near an empty cup, clean-up and refills are impeccable. Now for the trap part of it. This was more like a vegas show without any organization. They picked terrible songs and didn't stick to any theme. I think if they stuck to a theme I might have been able to have a good time. You want a decade theme...fine. Soft rock theme... fine. Festival theme...even better. But instead they chose a boring sinatra song to play, they had a guy dressed like Austin Powers dancing to Wooly Bully... really? of all the 60's songs? They picked Tom Cruise's movie Cocktail and tried to replicate setting the drink on fire with actual aerosol cans which two of the performers dropped! Despite this one of the performers kept trying to light as he was covered in flammable liquor until a staff member ran up and took it from him! They played Meatloaf's "I will do anything for love"...I was just confused. There was no space to dance. 90% of the crowd was completely still not knowing what to do. They didn't clap or dance... we were all confused. They only people dancing with what little space they had were way too drunk. Beware of the spot lights the shine about 10 directly into your eyes. I left within an hour of being there and waited in line for 30-40 min. Waste of money.

Crazy!!! The best club I have ever been to.. I contemplated going to Coco Bongo because it is around $55 per person and very crowded, but I decided to go and the experience was well worth it. It was CRAZY!!!! WE had such a great time. The staf fwas great and the drinks are all inclusive all night. The show is amazing. This is a must see attraction!

largo Coco Bongo vivir. pros: So much fun, Very entertaining. If you don't dance your legs will begin to move on their own (like Weekend at bernie's). If your legs have cement in them, your eyes will pop out and move. Pre-shows while waiting outside. a small stage out front on second level will entertain occasionally. The service was amazing. I don't know how they got everybody drinks for 5 hours. We had a male server around 30 years old and made the experience that much better, I wish I knew his name. He was very grateful for our group and looked out for us with extra chairs (even though we didn't use them) try to get stadium seating so get there early.(Pro to me) they will not serve drunks that cannot control themselves so control yourself and friends or they will be escorted out.Tequila Shots upon intrance (Two spots)You can go again and see completely different showsCons (not really) : Cost is $50 to $70 usd. If you have a group coco bongo rep. may offer a free ticket to the group. however, Drinks are in included in this package so it will pay for itself (Also take care of you server and bartender and they will take care of you and your group (pull your tips together and give half up front and half at the end) Tempting to look at the website to get an idea, try to avoid doing this.
