The surprise of the experience out weighs doing that.Bathrooms are few and far between and attendants will expect to tip (so use pesos)No food that I saw so eat before. There is a Taco bus right outside of the bar in a scooby doo van. Really good but they had the hottest hot sauce I've ever ate. (I was even warned by a very sweaty american that said if you don't like hot don't have the medium, so I had the mild) didn't matter they were all amazingly hot - Great after experience though.Advice: Try not to sit under main stage cause you won't see the shows, tables by the center stage are cool at first but after an hour the stage is transformed into a bar and movement becomes limited, unless your a hot chick or (really drunk guy) then you can dance on the bar all you want in between shows. Get there early if your not getting express entrance. Do not do this as part of the party hopping package because you will want to stay at coco bongos and the other 2 bars are free to get into on any day (Senior frogs and Charlie's up the street)go with a hotel and group and begin to discuss options and prices early. also they may provide transportation if you are in resorts further away (we were in the Palace spa 15 miles away) so we got a $60 round trip for free (tip not included) We went on a thursday, still packed and easier to get in then friday or sat. closed sun. but they do open it if tourism is high.I may sound more like a promotion but I'm just from North Dakota so I see this stuff much. My wife says it was like 50 vegas in one.

Awesome must see. Highly recommend going on the Party Hopper Tour ($80 per person). You go to three bars, Carlos and Charlies, Senior Frogs and VIP at Coco Bongos. You get all your drinks, transportation and awesome tour leaders. We got the best view at Coco Bongos on the balcony, because there are big screens in front you want to see from a distance and entertainment with people on ropes from the ceiling. All of the bars were so much fun, staff was entertaining best with the big group because the bars filled up when our tour got there.

Fun, but know what you're getting into!. Coco Bongo can be summed up by these two "fun factors":1. Are you 21 and ready to party? You've come to the right place! (21 at heart counts too)2. Did you sign up with a good tour group? This is make or break!My wife and I (27 & 26 for reference) were the only 2 in our shuttle that weren't given entry bracelets ahead of time. We had to go through a line to get ours before going in (though not as bad as we thought it would be.) We had no 'special treatment' whatsoever. When we walked in we had "bench seating" on a narrow step surrounded by other party-goers. The others from our shuttle at least had a reserved table, but they too were slammed into the middle of the action.We were expecting something more similar to a Vegas show and at first it was setup like a dance club with a bunch of employed dancers "clubbing it up" on the center stage. Add in the staff & their irritable whistle-blowing and we weren't feeling it at all! We didn't think a show was actually going on that night and it was just a dance club. After immediately debating leaving, we instead tried to get a more comfortable place - but with reserved seating everywhere and balconies "closed" to non-VIPs initially we were stuck among the masses and feeling like sheep! We couldn't even move back from our step to a corner or wall where we might avoid getting stepped or spilled on (more 'reserved' area that we weren't "exclusive enough" to access..)Fortunately the actual show started and we were relieved that we hadn't been hoodwinked into paying $55/person for a night of clubbing. The show really is a combination of spectacle & full blown audience participation (dancing) - and since weren't much feeling the dancing we were only partly enjoying ourselves.Our saving grace was the open bar (mai tais and rum & sprite - no martinis.) After a few drinks we were finally alright with a bit of grooving & the staff let up on the herding - we could finally go upstairs and into some breathing room.I'll admit that it is a great place if you're ready to party. They really do a great show with acrobatics and costumed dance performances (our favorite actor was the shorter of two Beetlejuices - quite comical!)I mentioned that your amount of fun will depend on your tour group. I'm pretty sure we signed on through the club's own shuttle service and it is not recommended! They told us to be outside to leave promptly at 3:15 AM and were something near 25 minutes or more late! They also didn't take care of us whatsoever inside. We talked to others that went through 'Olympus Tours' (staff in orange shirts) and they had a tour guide from their shuttle that stayed in attendance with them the whole time and made sure they had fun, getting them drinks and providing full service. They were also able to go into the best of the reserved areas. I think they did a trio-package where they went to Senior Frogs and another place before Coco Bongo. I'm not sure if Olympus offers as much service for a smaller trip of only going to Coco Bongo. Whatever you go through I would definitely ask exactly what to expect in their services!

Not exactly what you'd expect...but absolutely fun. Coco Bongo is billed as a night club, but it's not your average club! It's more of a spectacle or attraction. It's a very very busy club, that has an elevated theatrical stage with impersonators, dancers, 'shows', and in the middle has ropes and fabric hanging from the ceiling on which performers perform ala cirque du soleil. The show starts at 11:30 p.m., and goes to 1:30 a.m.. Our resort had a shuttle which leaves at 10:30 and returns at 3:30 a.m. After the show is over, it's a dance club filled with 20 something-ers dancing for another couple of hours. It's an 'all inclusive' type place. You pay a fee to get in and your drinks are included all night. We went with our resort, and I felt safe with our 'handler'. We had a spot to stand, you really can't move around until after the show. You can't really even sit, so be prepared to stand and dance for a couple of hours. I knew just about every song, and sang my heart out (no one can hear you because it's loud!). The night we were there, the impersonators did Michael Jackson, Rolling Stones, Freddy Mercury, Guns n Roses, Madonna, Frank Sinatra...and a few more I can't remember. The cirque du soleil type people were amazing, using the fabric to swing through the place, and lift up to the ceiling. There were also ropes on which other performers flew around the place. Pretty amazing.

AWESOME. I had the chance to be in Coco Bongo (Playa del Carmen) for Chistmas and.... it was the bestime ever!!!!! Music, people and show was amazing! plus I had the chance to met the sweetest person on earth. You Should GO!!

An amazing night out .... .. and perhaps one of the best shows in the world. Okay so a big claim and I have obviously been to bigger shows in the likes of Vegas and New York. However for a really fun out this simply cannot be beaten. It is utterly nuts and from 11.30 to about 3 it is a festival of fun. The show itself is a mixture of Cirque de Soleil (although not to the same skill) and every tribute band that has ever played. The performance is relentless and with a free bar which is served continuously at your table (recommend that you pay that extra $10 for the express tickets and get there 15 mins before opening to get a good table), you are going to find it very hard not to have a fantastic night.

Great Time. This was our 1st trip tp Mexico and we had read about the Cancun Coco Bongo and were super exctited to find out about the one in PDC. I started readign reviews though and I saw alot of complaints about over crowding long line etc.................didnt see any of that when I got there. We deicided to go when we walked by and the ticket rep. gave us a deal savinf us $20..we thought heck why not. When we got there the line was just forming, the rep said be sure to get here early to avoid the line..so we did. The ladies a the fron door made us balloon hats, we were let in made to take 2 shots of tequilla along the way and then we were in the club. It was tons of fun, I danced on both stages :) and enjoyed every minute of it. It was so hard to believe that it was 3:30 and time for us to start going home. Through out the night our waiter kept the drinks coming, the atmosphere was party party party confetti everywhere, balloons oh and my favorite the cold bursts of air that was so strong it would clear everyhting off the floor and cool you down instantly. Definitely reccomend !

Must Visit Coco Bongo!!. Recently went to Playa Del Carmen and visited Coco Bongo while there. It was phenomenal!! At first seemed just like lots of dancing and loud music, but after the shows started... it was amazing. Can't wait to go back!!

One of the best bars I've ever been too. Coco Bongo was one crazy experience. As soon as we arrived they took us to the front to the line. We paid $50 per person, which included all your drinks. As soon as we walked in the doors, they’re giving us tequila shots. They sat us down immediately, and we had our own waiter. Our drinks were never empty; they would give us another glass, even when our drink would only be half empty. The entertainment was the best. It’s more of Vegas-type shows then a dance club. There were lots of people around and it was packed, but I didn’t feel unsafe, and it never got hot. The bathrooms were clean as well. We will definitely be going back next time were in Playa. You Should GO!!

Best Bar EVER!!. We went to Coco Bongo in Playa del Carmen last week while staying in Mexico and we absolutely LOVED it!! We didnt want to travel all the way to Cancun from our resort because we were an hour away. Playa seemed like a better choice for us because it was much closer. It cost $50 a person for entrance and unlimited drinks. You were greeted with tequila shots upon entering the club.The shows were amazing and entertaining!! We had a waiter that brought us drinks all night. A new drink came as soon as the last one was almost empty!!There were sooooo many people there...but we never felt crowded!!The bathrooms were clean and easy to find.I would go back again in a heartbeat!

I hate myself for loving it. It is so cliche, it is so not "real" Mexico, it is so "Spring Break" but is like an infectious laugh. If you are even in a reasonably good mood it is practically impossible not to have fun here. If you are in a bad or contemplative mood this is not the place for you - you will be pestered until you have a good time.

Live Music, Great Food, Great Souvenirs. When you see beach bars in the movies, you probably wish you could be there, sipping a margarita or a cold beer. Guess what, there is a place like that in Playa Del Carmen - Senor Frog's. It has live bands, beach front tables, tons of awesome souvenirs, great food, a festive environment. It is definitely worth checking out if you are in Playa Del Carmen, going to or from Cozumel.
Cocktails and fun . Well located on the quay of the Ferries going to Cozumel, this is place is quaint and has a nice view on the ocean and a perfect, friendly service!

Not recommend. Very bad food, as burgers fan I could not eat one I ordered there because it was awful even though very expensive. My friends' dishes were bad too. Automatically charge you 15% tip aswell... Location is good but I still don't recommend it.

fun and delicious. we were here with a fairly large group (about 16-18 of us) and had a preordered meal complete with all the trimmings. It was well presented, smoothly transitioned and seamless in every respect. Not one of the party later had a bad word to say about the experience...not too shabby!

Stopped for the view. We'd heard about this place and decided to give it a try. The food & drinks were decent. The nachos with guacamole were my favourite part as the guacamole is made right at you table on a cart they roll around. We found the service slow and when we asked for the bills to be divided it royally confused the waiter! He was really put out by it. The chairs at the bar are cute, my daughter loved them!
Great entertainment. Food was excellent! Loved the nachos. The servers are entertaining and hilarious! The tardy drinks were amazing.
NACHOS and COCKTAILS!!!!!. the Nachos were apparently the best according to my wife and my mocktail was HUGE and really good.On the beach in and out of the water… perfect!And it was very quiet too
Last supper. Great food with awesome/hilarious servers. The yard drinks were amazing. Servers are really interactive and entertaining.

Delicious but was pestered the whole time. We sat down and we're bothered by all sorts of people wearing Señor Frogs clothes. That was a bit annoying. The food was delicious. I had the taco salad and one of their very large strawberry frozen drinks.

A great experience on one of my cruises. I always wanted to visit this establishment on one of my cruises and did so this particular time. Just getting off the ship and addressing my curiosity developed into a well deserved memory. I enjoyed the little printed messages on the life savers, the popcorn in the dog bowl, the dois xx time two and the cheese enchiladas. They were not the best I have ever eaten. However, I really enjoyed the scenery, the time I had there and the moments I took to have that experience. Would I go there again. You bet.

Good place to sit and relax. After a long slow walk around the town in the very hot sun there is no better place than Senor Frog Bar to have a very refreshing drink, people watching and watching the ferries coming and going from the Ferry Terminal next door. Only thing I have against this bar is that the music was a little on the loud side, or that may just be me not to fond of loud music

Great place to spend at the beach. This place is just next to the port to Cozumel. The sand is clear and water is blue. You can order a drink and they let you use all the facility (chair, shower, wifi). We took the cruise shore excursions and we had 2 hours to chill here. The only con is this is right next to the speed boat dock and we can smell the gasoline.

Good view, 'meh' service. Stopped here to say we've been. Drinks and food are pricey as imagined, but we were approached by numerous people selling things. We said no politely, and they left, only to send kids back with the same items. So yeah, that kind of ruined the experience we were looking for.We paid by credit card, and the server puts in their own tip prior to passing the credit card machine. Not sure if this is normal in Mexico in general, but I made sure after she clicked off the 50% feature to cancel the transaction. 50%. Blew my mind.

Always love to come back here. Been here several times over the years!! Great place to kick back and play or just hang out!! join in a volleyball match, swim or kick back in a hammock. Always consistent food.

Vibe, trashy. Food, mediocre. Drinks, weak & expensive. Staff, rude scammers.. My visit here was terrible. The drinks are made with pre-purchased mixers, the food is mediocre, and the service is dismal.I came with a group of friends who were visiting from another part of Mexico that I used to live. I live in Playa Del Carmen, and I was the only "gringo" at the table. I ordered a beer, and an order of nachos. Simple enough.The waitress came back with a pina colada. I told her that I ordered a beer, but she insisted that I ordered a Pina Colada. I said, "ok thats fine, I'll take it." Not a big deal. I finish the Pina Colada, and I again, ask for a beer. She comes back with another pina colada. Again, I tell her, "I didn't order a pina colada, I ordered a beer". Again, she gives me a hard time, so I just take it. For a 3rd time, I order a beer. I was so unequivocally clear this time. I even had my Mexican friends speaking spanish for me, ensuring that I would get a beer, not a pina colada. I also asked about the nachos that I never received. At this point everyone in my group was ready to leave, but I had still not eaten. I asked,"Can I get the nachos to go, because I won't have time to eat them now".The waitress comes back with ANOTHER pina colada, an order of nachos on a plate, and separate order of nachos togo. I tell her, "I'm not taking this Pina Colada. I did not order this (or the previous two), every one at this table heard me. Are you serious"? I also told her, "I'm only paying for one order of nachos, I did not order two plates of nachos". She instantly became angry and proclaimed that I did order the 3 pina coladas and two nachos, and I was going to pay for it all. I requested her manager. Surely he would correct the situation. Wrong. I was told that I'd have to pay for it all, or he was, "calling the police". Really? This was before he even heard me out. It all made sense when I realized the pina coladas were 4x the price of the beers (which I was fine with paying for the first two). But not 3, and an extra order of nachos. SCAM ARTISTS! I haven't ordered a pina colada since I was a 12 year old (virgin of course) The manger got aggressive, and had his entire team gang up on me, and try to beat me up, after they scammed me. I don't believe, I was misunderstood, I believe I was scammed into a drink 3x the price. However if something was unclear, a waitress at a predominantly tourist restaurant should know to ask someone for help if she doesn't understand an order. Furthermore, a manager should have been an advocate for his customer. He should have calmly asked the waitress, "Is it possible there was a mistake?" He should have gotten to the bottom of the frustration.I live in Playa Del Carmen, so I know how to effectively communicate, and order correctly here. 12 months in Mexico, and I have never had this problem.Moral of the story: Don't go to senior frogs if you're from abroad! They will take advantage of the language barrier. Senior, of senior frogs, do yourself a favor and fire your overly aggressive, and under-qualified manager.Vibe, trashy. Food, mediocre. Staff, rude scammers. Why spend hundreds of pesos on pre-mixed drinks? Don't. You have other options. Go somewhere else!
Drinks with an ocean view. Place is on the beach next to the ferry dock going to Cozumel. Good place out by the beach to have drinks, get in the ocean, and food was pretty good too.

Had a blass with my friends. Food and service was really good, We didn't have complains about it. All of our group decied to take a souvenier with us and some of the group go for the yarda oders for the palm tree. In my next visit to Mexico, Im definitely coming back.

Ny Mexico connection . The restaurant is right on the beach so the views are amazing. Right in the heart of downtown so shops and activities abound. The food is very basic selection with the burgers helping friends after they drank all night. I don't know why the fries are cut to crumb size though.

Lots of fun but expensive.... This place is right on the beach next to the dock where all the boats leave so it's pretty view but the bar needs a bit of tlc. The drinks are massive and quite pricy but they do taste nice, food was reasonable and they had a massive trampoline on the beach for he kids to play on. Worth a trip...

Night Out. Our group booked two night trips to Senor Frogs for time off the resort. If you go, keep your group together, it is easy to have someone wander off as it is crowded and dark. The drinks flowed, and everyone had fun, but for the extra money, (70 a person) I think staying at the hotel and going to the dance bar on the grounds is fine.

Fun on the beach. Great beach location, beware food sizes are enormous, we ordered nachos they came on dinner plate covered with cheese, refried beans,guacamole, salsa etc, we thought we were ordering a snack while having a beer, would feed 4persons easily as such!! Girl was offering shots, live music great vibe to watch sun go down!!!
Fun time at Senior Frogs. While on vacation at Riu Playacar we went into town to have dinner at Senior Frogs, it was great we had a great time food was great staff were great Glad we went

Fun place. The guacamole was great- had coconut shrimp & yard drinks were strong! Great service but everyone working there were after tips & it got monotonous after an hour of it. Oxygen bar, etc is not free. the food was much better than expected & well-prepared. Fun, party atmosphere.
good for frozen drinks. This a theme spot. go for the drinks and laugh with the waiters. Food is below average. so many great restaurants along the path as you walk down. enjoy that first.

Daytime. We went there about 5pm after walking the length of 5th Avenue. We only went in for drinks and they were pretty pricey, we guessed it would be a different experience in the evenings but was good fun to see it and have a drink

Playa del Carmel experience. A very different experience, getting offered some very random combinations "come into my shop, would you like a leather bracelet, tattoo, protein shake", very random.All friendly but the amount of people trying to get you to buy something from their shop does get a little frustrating very quickly.Definitely worth the experience.Senor frogs is next to the ferry port which means to get there you need to walk through most of the shopping area.The food was great the atmosphere was welcoming, I wasn't a fan of the "I like tips badge being shoved in my face", it was made a little frustrating as I had planned to tip, then made to feel like I had no choice.Once the food and drink are done you have to get back through the shops (that everybody wants you to go into, even if you done).Not intimidating, more amusing as the offers seem to get more random as the day goes on "you want a hair cut, drugs, cigars", a simple no works fine, trying to ignore them seems to make them more persistent.If you've gone all inclusive, turn your wrist band over, or all you will hear is "remember me, I'm the waiter that served you in your hotel".Great experience, good luck.

Loud. We went one afternoon for dinner as we had been to the one in Cancun before and really enjoyed it. The music was so loud we could not talk to each other. The food was not good and the bathrooms were not clean. I would not recommend this place.

Good atmosphere, ok food. Senor Frogs is a great tourist trap in Playa del Carmen. We revisited here after 15 yrs since we were here last. Nothing has changed. Great location. Great upbeat atmosphere and staff. Average burger joint food with tourist trap inflated prices.

Si Senor Frogs!. Hands down one of my favorite bars in Playa Del Carmen! The views of the ocean are spectacular, the décor is fun and the atmosphere is very energetic. If you like to have a good time, make sure you visit Senor Frogs!
Fun place to people watch. My husband and I ate here after a day at the beach and it was a great place to relax and do some people watching. Food was pretty good and the staff was fun.

Beware of the oxygen bar scam. My family and I stopped here for lunch while waiting to take the ferry to Cozumel. A waitress came over and offered a pass for two of us to visit their oxygen bar. We weren't really wanting to do this but she pushed and so we pushed for my daughter and her boyfriend to give it a try. It's free or so we thought. Once over there they gave them a shot with no mention of cost. After giving them the second shot they showed them a price list to pick types from they said no and reurned to our table. After they returned to the table the waitress came over to them with a $28 bill for the shots! I explained that we thought this was a free sample and at no time did they mention they were going to pay for anything until after the two shots and they refused. We paid for them but will not return. I caution anyone else who goes there to say NO when they come around offering free services!

Standard Fare, Fun Atmosphere. Located immediately on the shore outside the Waterjet terminal, it is very conveniently located and has seating on the covered patio or even directly on the beach under big sun umbrellas. The food was tasty but standard, a big draw seemed to be the travelling Guacamole cart. The location is directly on the beach, with loungers and beach "beds" for rent. They also had a trampoline, but it was entirely too hot to try it out! Overall, a nice place to have a bite to eat and check out the scenery in a relaxed, fun atmosphere.

Lovely food and fun atmosphere . We had lunch, the food was great. Best Pizza my son had had whilst in Mexico. Quick service and fun drinks containers which you can keep, good music. There is a Beach club and trampoline for guest use. I'm sure this is party central at night but good for families during the day.

Just ok this time. Senor Frogs changed from our last visit. Not quite as exciting. We ate on the beach, so that was awesome! The restaurant seems smaller as they took the bar out of the middle and shoved it in the corner, then took out the merchandise store and located them throughout Playa. The food was good, but the experience was lacking.

BE CARFUL. While my family and I where waiting for the ferry to arrive to take us to Cozumel we stop at the bar for a nice margarita and beer. After waiting for several minutes at least five, for the bartender to get off his phone I ordered the margarita. A number of minutes later I got the drink that I was very much looking forward to. I took a nice big drink and was very unhappy to find that there was more salt in the drink than liquid. Yes I know salt comes with it but dam, that sucked. I told the still phone distracted guy and he ignored me. I was still in happy vacation mood so I just pay and left the drink behind. Bad service and drinks that day

PRICEY but alot of fun. The staff here are awesome !!!!! They really make sure you enjoy yourself, from silly signs they move to your table when your not looking, to their great senses of humor. It is right on the beach by the ferry so it is a busy place to be. The staff dances on the bar in the evenings. It seems a right of passage, you need to splurge if only once, let your hair down and have some fun.

second trip to PDC. The food is ok but the loud music during the afternoon and the staff that constantly bothers you during your meal is not for me! For the cost, of the food and the aggravation, I will find somewhere else to eat!

I was wrong, the party died. I was sad to see the place has fizzled out. It has been there for years and I have been there many times. They have taken out the main bar and now it looks like an old warehouse. As for the drinks they suck. I'm not much of a drinker these days but I have been and they were known for pouring a good drink I'll bet the 16oz daiquiri didn't have a full shot. I suspect the booze is watered down.Stay away, not worth it
Birthday Fun!. Remember you are not going to a 5 star environment, you're in Mexico. That being said the staff was amazing, hilarious and so attentive. They made our visit well worth every dime
nice. This is like most Senor Frogs in Mexico: a big bar with good music. What I liked about this one is the beach area. The beach area is not that loud and it has a pretty view.
Nasty. Drinks were horrible, food was horrible, service was horrible. The view of course was nice. Everything else was nasty compared to other Senor Frogs.
Just a got to. Just a short walk along the marina from the cruise boat. Loved the fresh food. Authentic and hand prepared. A must anytime porting in Cozumel.
Food n drink stop. Great place to stop eat drink sun yourself. Fun drink items, good menu staff very friendly. Just off the ferry stop so you can people watch.

Fun place. This place was like the one that I had been to in Cozumel. Balloon hats and shots where they put their hands on places that I would not appreciate them. It wasn't as good as the one in Cozumel but the friends we were with had not been to one before. The food and drinks were good.

Beautiful View. A little for everyone to do, you're paying for the location more than the food and service which was fine. I still enjoyed the sample platter we ordered and the free margaritas our hotel gave us! Would recommend.

Fun Food & Drinks. Friends & Family trip to this place recently let to having some very good values food and drinks with a lot of fun into the bargain, did see some kids present during the day but at night this is not the place for them as its a big lively and more adult orientated fun.

Primo Location, Not so Primo Service. If you're looking for a nice place to poach some seaside lounge chairs without buying a drink, Senor Frog's in Playa is the place for you. No one will bother you.Honestly, this was the only bad experience of our week in Playa. Yah, I know this is a legendary chain and a proven fun spot, we just didn't have that experience.Having missed a ferry to Cozumel, we were ready to just kick back with a drink on the beach for our hour wait. Well, we tried. Despite being a very slow weekday lunch time, we couldn't get a waiter for over 40 minutes. There were plenty around, just really lazy and more into conversations with fellow staff.Maybe another time.

One of my favorite spots in Playa. Evertime I go to Playa on vacation I make a point to stop at Señor Frogs for my first drink. This place kickstarts the vacation feel for me. Beautiful beach view with a fun atmosphere. There is a trampoline on the beach as well as hammocks. I def recommend stopping here! Order a frozen drink and watch the Cozumel Ferry come and go on the turquoise blue sea= "my heaven".
My birthday bash. First time there and had a BLAST!! The staff was so much fun and had great surprises for all!! Will go again!!
Cozumel, a day for shopping in the port. Our stop in Cozumel was very laid back, shopped in the port, then spent the rest of the day at Senor Frog's. Happy time there, balloon hats and all.

manager lied about refund. we booked a trip to their for 16 people and the booking agent through lomis lied about it being a club. after arriving the manager asked for 62$ to get the vouchers back for travel to the bar. I paid him and he gave the vouchers back. he said he called for transportation back to our resort, after wasting another 20 min we walked back. we asked for a refund and the refused. I would not recommend this place due to management.

Never again!!!. My best friend and I went to have a few drinks and some fun and ended up being treated extremely poorly!!! Our waitress, Adrianna, was ignorant! I had to ask to get a drink, ask for a menu and then when I asked for a check she refused my American money. I gave her my credit card that is an Adventure Master Card and she told me she couldn't take it. I told her to turn the card over and see it was a Master Card. She gave me the dirtiest look and then went to run the card. The workers there were either on their phones or hanging out with their friends. When Adrianna came back she asked me how much should she add for a tip. I told her nothing and she got pissed. Why would I tip someone who didn't even look my way. We couldn't get out of there quick enough!!!

Good food, annoying environment . The food is actually pretty good, but I didn't like the overall experience. Everything was so loud (waitresses with whistles and noisy music) and over the top. It is so forced to make the place look typically Mexican that it comes across as phony and tacky, in my opinion.

Great food and service . We visited a couple of times during our recent trip to Mexico and still love this place. You get beers in interesting glasses and varying sizes. A great range of cocktails again in various sizes, shots as well if you really want them. It is decorated well with a surf shack style. We ate here twice and I have to say we enjoyed it both times. The chimichanga was fantastic. Well worth a visit after a hard days shopping.

An entertaining lunch. 6 of us walked from our resort (Riu Palace Riviera Maya), about a 25 minute walk to Senor Frogs for lunch. We had free lunch vouchers from purchasing a few tours from Lomas Travel.Everyone enjoyed their food and the entertainment was fun for all of us. Music was good. We also enjoyed the open air lunch experience on the beach.

Would visit again.. We went on a very hot humid day as May would be, and we sat in a shaded table that we had our pick of. The drinks were very good (coconut daiquiri) that I had in the palm tree glass that we kept for souvenier. Had the wings that were excellent. Crispy to perfection with the side of dips. Could have spent a few more hours there if we had the time. Plan on coming to visit again on our next vacation to Playa Del Carmen!
drink stop off. we stopped here for a drink didn't have food. service was great had the biggest nicest margarita i've ever had.
Great Spot with the Mexican Touch. We chose to meet up with another holiday making couple at Senor Frogs and had an evening full on enjoyment in true Mexican style.

Very Fun. This restraunt is very fun, it replaced the old Carlos and Charlies which was the same kind of atmosphere. You can eat inside with all day entertainment (great for kids) or outside at the beach. It is also equipped with its own section of beach with beach loungers. The staff speak English and are very friendly
Fun place. We enjoyed Senor Frog. Food was good and staff excellent. The view of the ocean added to the enchantment. We would go back again.
Worst dinner in history, bad margarita, insane price. Worst food in my memory, lousy margarita at very high price. Nice young serving staff almost saves it from pathetic.

Worst meal ever!. Wow....I've dined all over the world and I have to say that my meal at Senor Frogs last night was the worst meal I have ever had...Saved only by the young and attentive staff and the beautiful beach.We spent twice as much as with any other meal and had soggy over-cooked tasteless meals with the $ 20 drinks that I'm certain had no alcohol . We went there expecting good and consistent options and left feeling ripped off completely never mind the upset tummy I have today! My advice ....don't have anything other than a bottled beer by the beach if you must go..
Fun, entertaining spot. American type food , great drink deals, and the most entertaining servers. They made balloon hats and took our picture. Dancing throughout the restaurant. Go and enjoy.

Great food. We ordered the platter - chicken, ribs, shrimp - great tasting, enough for three people. My only concern was the music being so loud. I understand it is Senor Frogs but not that loud early afternoon.

Great Atmosphere. We visited for dinner in April 2016 as a couple, and were so impressed.We looked at the menu and booked online using the official website prior to our visit, but when we arrived they had no record of our booking and the menu was completely different...but it was no problem as we got seated at a great table straight away and loved the menu!The food and the cocktails were great, we really loved everything. The atmosphere was fantastic, with music playing as we watched the waves as the sun went down. There was a variety of people there, with different ages and different sizes of groups...everyone having a fun time. There are tables and chairs on the beach as well as hammocks, trampolines and a volleyball net....I can imagine it would be a fun place to spend the day!Overall, great place with amazing food/drinks and a brilliant atmosphere.
Fun!. Best chimichanga I've ever eaten! Fun atmosphere, decent service. Great location overlooking the beach. One of those things you kind of just have to say you've done in Playa.

A great beach front restaurant. Me and my husband stopped in for a beer one hot day and ended up returning two more times! This place is an ideal location. Beach front restaurant with tables, hammocks, loungers and sunbeds. The atmosphere was fun and relaxing. On our next two visits we ordered their chicken nachos. They were fantastic. I will admit you get your money's worth at this place. Huge portions and great food.

Rip Off. Was in Maya for Spring Break. Went to Senor Frogs with a large group, Parents and High School Seniors. Purchased the $25 wrist band for unlimited drinks. I never got 1 drink! Anytime I would finally get to a bartender and ask for a drink they would see the wristband and walk away. If you go with a group, just pay as you order.

Great lunch stop. We have frequented for lunch many times – a must after a morning of shopping in Playa Del Carmen. Excellent food and service. Great location – beachfront, open air concept – we really like this as you can people watch, see the ocean and feel the breeze! We have taken our children here – the staff are quick to entertain with balloon art and some individualized fun/entertainment. We have also gone with adults couples having just as much fun. We like the daytime trips better – they seem a little more “lively” (especially if a cruise ship docks- then it really rocks!) Night time we find quieter – not nearly as lively as throughout the day.Overall – good food, great drinks, excellent location and service!

Good experience. came here during our holiday for a change from the hotel. Drinks were quite reasonable and the atmosphere was good, lots of spring breakers having a great time. Music was good and there was a live band. Worth a visit
Great food. Went to Senor Frogs in PDC and it was awesome. The wait staff took care of us right away and it was nice to have some good ribs by the beach. Would highly recommend.

Not much happening. We were staying up the coast at an All Inclusive. Our daughters just had to go to Senor Frogs. We arranged for transportation there and back.When we got to Senor Frogs, there were a few other groups there, but not much in the way of nightlife. We were seated at the bar in the swings, which were uncomfortable.This is an open air bar, so it was very hot. The only Air conditioning in in the restrooms, and there was an attendant so you were obligated to tip to use the bathroom.We ordered drinks, which were a bit expensive for Mexico. The bar tender went out of her way to ignore us. When I finally flagged down another bartender, he had difficulty taking our order and when we asked for refills on our beers, wanted to get us more expensive drinks.Thankfully, they had an English speaking cover-band playing music.

lunch and fun. Went to Senor Frogs for lunch had very good food, very good drinks, fun with waiters, excellent view of the ocean and beach. you can eat in open air restaurant or out on beach. Picture with all 4 of us wearing sombrero's was cheap but fun and nice pic. would recommend for all ages. Say families with young kids and also older families enjoying their lunch. Guacamole can be made right at you table very good

Great night!. Met up with friends that were also vacationing in the surrounding area. We had a definitely had a fun time. The drinks are very tasty and the environment was fun! You could drink and dance or even do shots with the bartenders walking around. They did have a food menu which you could eat inside the restaurant itself or outside on the beach watching the waves crashing in. Its located right next to the dock for the ferry that comes/goes to Cozumel. A great place to party or just people watch. They have a small trampoline along with a volleyball area. The food was really good with big portion sizes. Prices were very reasonable as well.

Definitely a Fun Place. Located right on the beach near the ferry to Cozumel. My wife and son split the sampler platter and they enjoyed everything, especially the chicken wings. I ordered the ceviche and quesadilla. The ceviche came out in a huge bowl and was delicious. The quesadilla was a large portion. I also ordered the "big beer" and was shocked when it showed up to the table! A 32 oz beer is one big drink! The shot girl was fun and joked with us and the views are gorgeous. It was really entertaining going here!

Nice anchor seats :D. This became our favourite bar after one visit. We were very tired after daytrip to Cozumel and went to Frogs to sit down for a while. The athmosphere is very nice and relaxed and staff is friendly and it was nice to sit on the bar in anchor seats.We never ate there but I´m sure the food is good too.

Best Guac we had in Mexico!. Great drinks, food, and entertainment. BEST GUAC WE HAD WHILE ON VACATION!The shrimp tacos were delicious as well as the drinks. It did take about 20 mins to pay because we were using credit cards. Avoid this by bringing paper money!

Great lunch and laughs!. Great food, great service, great laughs! Need I say more? Just a heads up though, there are a few Señor Frog stores on the 5th Ave so if you ask a local or someone for Señor Frogs they may give you directions there and not to the restaurant, which is at the far end by the ferry to Cozumel. We learnt the hard way but still was worth the walk!
Great Dancing. Had an absolute blast at this Señor Frogs! We had a huge group that went for drinks and dancing. I can't speak to the food, but the drinks were great!

Fun fun fun. We had drinks here while waiting for the ferry back to Cozumel. It was loud but happy. The bar is right on the beach next to the ferry docks. Drinks were cheap and wifi was free. Nice way to kill a copy of hours.
Always fun . Senor Frogs is right on the beach. The view is fabulous, the food is good and of course the beer. The fun never stops there. A very busy fun place.

A must in Mexico! . If you are interested in having a good time then this is the place! The atmosphere is incredible, all the employees are there to make sure you enjoy your time and to also bring everyone in on the fun. There is music and dancing going on all the time, it's just a great place to let loose after a day at the beach.
Hilarious atmosphere. what a crazy spot......lots of fun!!!!! Definitely party mode.......wonderful employees........good food.....good view....right on the ocean.

Senior Frogs. Had a wonderful lunch at this restaurant while visiting Playa del Carmen. Service was very good, Nice. location next to the pier to go to Cozumel. The decor is mucho entertaining so be sure to visit them.

Ripped Off. Love the atmosphere. Food was good. Review your bill carefully because we got stuck paying for drinks that we didn't order that they included in our bill. After fighting with them we gave in and paid it just so we could leave.
Quirky and fun beach bar. Live music all the time, great food and drinks make this bar the funniest spot on the beach of Playa!

Great atmosphere but don't get the large beer !!!. We stayed in a hotel along the beach and on a few occasions for a change of scenery walked the beach to visit. 1st time we ordered beers and the choice of small medium or large was offered . We thought large would be a pint . Oh how wrong . I could not lift the stein but I would advise go medium ha ha . Good service great people watching with the shot and whistle girl going round and a generally good place to visit. Only had nachos but they were excellent .

A staple in Mexico. It's just one of those places that no matter which one you go to it's consistent. The food is good, the entertainment fun and the drinks are well the drinks!! The staff is always friendly and remember these kids make their living doing this so don't be shy to tip them.

sat here while waiting for the ferry ride back to Cozumel. great views from the restaurant , the beach sitting area was clean . service was not the fastest I've encountered .Waiter wasn't in any hurry to replenish drinks .

Awful. Went here with a large group of parents/teens. Having been here once before, we tried to warn everyone what was going to happen - mass confusion with the bill as server after server bombarded our table with drinks, shots, guacamole, tattoos,etc. There was no way to keep track of what was being ordered, and when presented with the large bill afterwards it was impossible to know what was actually ordered compared to what was on the bill. My advice would be to stay far away from this place - there's lots of other fun places to get food and drinks that won't try to take advantage of you.

Never been so disappointed with a resturant. We had a group of ten people that went for lunch. Pretty well the whole time we sat down someone was bugging us trying to sell stuff. The portions are way too big. They told us that they couldn't separate out our bills and they lumped the total all together. They made it so confusing and hard to figure out just to make it easier for them to rip us off. We tried to figure the bill out but didn't have enough time because we had a taxi waiting. I have never been so pissed off after leaving a resturant. If you are a tourist do not go near this place.

Stopped in for lunch and drinks. We stopped in for lunch and drinks. The drinks were good, and they seemed to be better prices if you bought a bigger glass. The food was okay. The server was fine. It was irritating that there were people that kept coming up to us trying to sell us something (Balloon hats, photos, etc.) while we were trying to relax.

just leave me alone. had to stop by for old times sake, but wished we hadn't. The staff just wouldn't leave us alone, always wanting to sell us something more. You know this is the deal going in, but this felt different than years past

SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE!!!. We first visited Senor Frogs in Playa in 2006 I FELL IN LOVE! Went back in 2008, and loved it MORE! We have gone out of our way to visit EVERY Senor Frogs in every city we visit that has one. We returned to the Playa location a few days ago, and can promise you... YOU DO NOT WANT TO GO HERE! The service was the WORST SERVICE we HAVE EVER received, ANYWHERE!!! I have had better service in bathrooms!!!!!!!!!The drinks are good, the food very good, but obviously the manager at this location has fallen back on the name instead of the service.There are WAY better places to go in Playa. Don't waste your time or money here. They don't appreciate it or you!!!

Senior Frog. Our server was spectacular. The atmosphere was great-wonderful visit. We ordered both drinks and food and both were awesome. The food was delivered to us quickly and warm. The selection of available beverages was excellent and there were many items on the menu.
Senor Frogs. What a ray of sunshine, excellent service, excellent beer and right on the beach just right for the walk in from Hotel Tequila

Only interested in selling you one more thing after another. Sub par bar food. You are constantly interrupted so they can sell you a shot, a photo, guacamole on and on. Everything is gimmicky and overpriced.
Always a fun place. Excellent atmosphere for adults and families alike. Staff was amazing and food even better.... Love how you can dine on the beach...

Fun place to grab a couple drinks on the beach. Walkable from the Playacar resort area, this is a great place to come to for a change of scenery. A really fun environment where the employees will make you have a good time - selling you shots, making balloon hats, and getting you drunk (for a price!) But the drinks are tasty and the decor is fun.

Definitely don't go there for the food. . The food is awful. The margaritas are awful - and we're in Mexico!! The only good thing I have to say is the atmosphere is great and the wait staff is awesome.

over priced hoop la. Will not go back, over priced and just not worth it. food was good but food is good most places in playa. $90 canadian for two vegetarian dishes, one veggie appy, 4 beers, and a fancy drink for the lady.

A day on the beach.. If you ever wanted to sit by the beach and just enjoy drinks and lunch with your friends, this is the place for you. A great variety of local and imported beers. All kinds of mixed and fancy cocktails, and tapas to munch on.
Funniest place to eat!!!!. Funniest place to eat!!! Great people great food. No pressure from people outside trying to sell u stuff. Super helpful.. Great prices.
Senor Frogs Rocks :). Lovely food, fantastic atmosphere, beautiful setting looking over the beach had a great afternoon chillin in senor frogs :)

Great Place!!. Great experience as in past. We thought the value was decent for what you got, it's nothing fancy but they entertained the kids with musical chairs, and accommodated my sons allergies. :)
Great. Absolutely loved all the food and drinks! Dancing on stage, they had couples games and balloon animals, too!Wonderful everything and I couldn't have asked for more!

Touristy, but great view!. Not exactly a local place, but we had a great time here! We ordered the chips and salsa, and fish tacos. My boyfriend said they were the best tacos he's had.We ordered the tall margaritas in the take home cups...why not. It was my boyfriend's birthday, so they took him on stage and gave him shots (and some other stuff haha).They also gave us a free dessert for his birthday, wasn't expecting that.They let me behind the bar to make my own to-go drink! Beautiful view of the beach, and ferry dock. Great, attentive service. There's someone selling pictures, and someone selling balloon animals (seems like a good idea after a few drinks).I'd definitely go again!

Not as much fun as last time. We went there in May, playa Del Carmen, and had a blast. Good food, lots of laughs, the staff on the stage with the customers, balloon hats, my lunch served in a kitchen sink. By his past visit last week....boring! We got our picture taken, my husband got s shot and that was it.
Loved this bar!. Had lovely drinks and lunch at senor frogs. The drinks were reasonable and the food arrived in giant portions. Really lovely fun bar right next to the beach.

Nice pizza!. We arrived at lunch, were met & seated by a friendly young girl. The waiter was over straight the way to take the drinks order. The location is right on the beach and next to the ferry terminal so it does get busy but it was no problem, why rush when your on your holiday anyway! We ordered a pizza between the three of us and didn't have to wait too long.The atmosphere was great and the guacamole was too! The waiter was very attentive and made a fuss over our 12 year old daughter! They put a "drunken tourist " sign on the back of her chair! She saw the funny side of it so that was ok! We enjoyed our visit & would go back again. We've been to Señor frogs in other locations so knew what to expect.

Busy Busy Lunch Boat Rush. Place was bustling during lunch/early dinner 3:00pm. No hostess for seating even though sign was posted with pedastal at front. We got waved in to sit anywhere. We got a waiter that was kind of confused and often missing. We had a pesty shot-woman bug us three times even though I said I don't drink. We sat near the Beach Rail and watched people disregard any safety on the trampoline. The food was franchise average. The bill was reasonable but took forever to get.  The gathering of people for singing and dancing is annoying during a lunch atmosphere.
Nice place to be. very good foods. Good prices and nice persones. Look i took some nice pictures wen i was there in feburary 2016

Family visit on a break from the resort. Six adults visited mid week for lunch and a drink. It turned into an all day adventure as we had so much fun. It can get real expensive real quick though as the staff are there to up sell eg shots, photographs, home made guacamole and even balloon animals! However it was one of the last days of our holiday so we just went with it. The shot girl and her routine were funny and she definitely surprised the 60yr old Dad in our group but he loved it! The food was tasty and the drinks were cold, blended and lovely. We bought a group photo as a memento too. I couldn't recommend the place highly enough for an afternoon of fun by the beach. It was expensive but worth every penny as we laughed about it for days after!A special mention must go to our waiter Hugo who was fantastic!
Fun place, great band!. We stopped here on the Bong Tour. The band was playing great 80s/90s songs. Drinks were strong and very good. Cool atmosphere!
Great atmosphere. The atmosphere, staff and view were amazing..the food lacked in quality for the price. Would go back at night for drinks and skip dinner next time!

Overpriced . We were told by friends that we HAD to visit senor frogs although having been twice I really can't see why? The drinks were wildly overpriced in heavy thick glasses that made you think there was more drink than there was, we seemed to upset the barman because he didn't think we tipped him enough although when I tried to apologise by saying we wasn't sure about the currency as we had just got there he just waved me away! We went back another day at a different time to see if the 'entertainment ' was better unfortunately it wasn't neither was the drinks

We won't be back. Great location right on the beach, excellent guac, and an attentive waiter give this place 2 stars. However, beers were warm, food/drink was way overpriced, restrooms were filthy, and they pooled our tab even after we specifically asked for separate tabs, then made a huge stink when we asked to have them separated for us. Frog's is lucky to have the great view and good location for foot traffic, because they are lacking in every other aspect.
Good food. Went for lunch and the food was good, good atmosphere, great view. The service was good as well. Would not have to go there again, but I wouldn't tell someone not to go there either.

Loud and a fun place to have drinks.. It is what it is intended to be--a night club. Service was poor. Drinks average. The men bought "yardas", went to the oxygen bar to recoup! We made our own fun!There is opportunity to sit on the beach to eat and drink. It is lit up out there at night time and is quite lovely. The ferry to Cozumel is right beside Señor Frogs which can be handy if you need to wait for a ferry.

Great night out!. Although my review is a little late (4 years to be exact, doesnt time fly by!) I wanted to share my experience. I absolutely loved this place! The food was amazing as were the cocktails. Not your ordinary bar/restaurant! Loved the swings at the bar and the entertainment from the cheeky staff members. Visited here twice in our two week stay and would love to go back!

An excelent experience. We ate deliciosus food! Presentation was nice, taste was fantastic. Service was good, people were nice. We went twice, we usually don't repeat retaurants, unless we really enjoy the food.
used to be better. Getting a little too touristy for my tastes. It used to be a lot of fun but now every thing is so much more expensive for less.

Lot of fun. This is a noisy venue, but is a whole lot of fun.The staff are always in full party mode and very friendly. The food looked good, but we didn't eat there. The drinks were reasonably priced.The entertainment was fab with more than one act on per night.

Still there, even if now hidden!. 20 years ago, this restaurant was all there was to see on the beach next to the ferry port. Now, it is sandwiched between a resort and lots of multistory building! It has it's own beach hidden beneath it too. We enjoyed the foot and the staff's efforts to get people excited about partying, even at 11 am, when travelers are grumpy and lugging suitcases while waiting to get onto the ferry to go to Cozumel.

fun. If you are looking for fun go there. The chicken wings are awesome. A few times someone bought us free shots. They put funny signs behind you without you knowing it. This place is right on ocean. If you sit on the bar they have swings or stools with bikini bottoms. Since we come here often in our two weeks stay and for the last 4 years all the staff signed a tall plastic glass for each of us. A great

overpriced tourist trap. the couple we traveled with just had to have a shirt and drink. ridiculous pricing. drinks 10.00 US mimimun. Food at US prices also. I had a margarita, they got a shirt and I convinced everyone to go in town to a local joint. Ate and drank like kings and 1/3 of the price. What a joke.

Great Place. We had a blast at this place!! If you like loud music, dancing with the staff, drinks and food, this place is for you. Drinks and food were wonderful. Prices very reasonable. The staff is very friendly and fun to be around. Would go back next time in Cozumel

Great day in Playa. After walking the main drag from one to the other, this was a great place to kick back and have a couple drinks and eats, and all were great. My second time here and we were not disappointed.

Family vacation . 1st time visit go Mexico !Very very cool place to go for a sandwich, a drink and some cool fun !Beautiful waitress comes around and gives you a shot at your table and a little entertainment !!Food was great and Guacamole was made fresh at our table !!!
Great. We had a few drinks here. Have a drink in a fancy glass and you get to keep the glass! A fun place on the beach and not expensive, although we did not eat.

Poor value and very ordinary. Very poor value received for money spent. A lot of the pricing information on menus not visible w surprises at end if the night. Establishment would not provide individual billings for each party in a large group other than presenting (surprise) one bill at end for entire group (plus 50 people) and asked to figure it out ourselves. Very noisy place. Food very average at best.

Expensive, Lots of Tourists but Great Location. We went here after checking out some sights in the area. It is definately a tourist location so it is very expensive! We paid $40 USD for drinks for 5 people. Considering our lunch that day was only $20 USD for 5 people, we thought this was expensive. They have a great location with beach volleyball, a trampoline and other activities. Definitely a cool spot with lots to do but you are paying for it!

Nice. I enjoyed going to this shop but the area was too snobbish for me. The outlet mall was okay but in one store, a female worker was very rude. I would say to shop in Cozumel. The island is much more laid back and the people friendlier.

Beach time. We have been going to Sandos from it,s opening day. Love the property, beach, and all the staff. They do an outstanding job from check-in to check-out. We are beach people and it's a wonderful place to relax,swim and read. We will be back for our spring retreat.

Overrated!. this place seemed so cool in my 20's but now 20 years later it is just ok and has way too many kids in it now, the balloon guy in here making animals for the kids was so annoying almost like I was a Chuck E Cheese then the balloons kept popping and scaring me! All I ordered was the Shrimp Cocktail and a beer and it was weird, all the shrimp was dowsed in cocktail sauce in a mug - weird!

Massive portions!!!. Popped in for a snack and was amazed by portion sizes, had nachos which was a starter and it would have fed four people happily! Burgers and chicken was also good, good music, right on the beach. A good place to try.
lunch. great place to have lunch and watch the ferry and the people our order of food was served in a kitchen sink and on a skate board pretty funny
Nice spot!. We stumbled across señor frog. Across from the beach can't get more relaxing than that.We had a few refreshments and kicked back with the music. A good pitt stop!
Ole'. You can't go to Mexico without a visit. My tween, teen and young adult kid loved it!!!! Lots of fun, great food and big drinks!!!!!

Too many people trying to sell things in the restaurant. Food was great but in Mexico you are harassed enough to buy things and sign up for excursions. It would be nice to dine without also being harassed. First they try to sell is an overpriced picture of us in a frame then there is an h2o bar for a "free" 2 minutes but want a tip THEN someone giving out shots also asking for a tip and selling shot glasses. Too much.
Great Food and Service. Been here year after year because we enjoy the views, food and service. They have a really neat restaurant - fun to see what they do.
dont bother. keep walking...overpriced and poor service... waited over 30 minutes to have service for drinks.. on a hot day... owners should be embarrassed...spend your pesos somewhere else...
Just stopped for a drink. Fun atmosphere, but rather expensive. There was not as much party as I expected but this could be due to the time we were there. Fun to stop in but not a must see.

Not as good as I've been told..... I was actually quite disappointed in my trip to senior frogs. There were the typical party balloon hats and such, and the food was ok. but the big thing that really turned me off from going there again was our server. We were a larger table, and they wouldn't separate the bill (no big deal) but we were all beginning to start figuring out our portion of the bill and putting our portion of the money into the little folder they put the bill in, before even all of us were done, he was hassling us that there wasn't enough and hassling us about wanting a tip. The server was honestly the biggest turn off there. Hopefully if you go you have a better experience, not sure if I'll bother giving it a second chance as its quite expensive and playa has so much more to offer.

Day trip to Playa del Carmen began with Senor Frogs. Before venturing onto 5th Avenue Norte we had lunch at Senor Frogs. Always reliable good food with generous portions with drinks to match. Beautiful view of the beach and ocean while sitting inside. Hard not to have fun there.

Senor Frogs. We went here on a very quiet night when the staff outnumbered the guests. The staff also seemed to be more wrapped up in each other then the few guests. Maybe it's different on a very busy night, as I'm sure people wouldn't go there otherwise. Cocktails were expensive, so on first impressions I possibly wouldn't visit again. Again, if it was busy, it may be a different experience, so maybe mine is just jaded.

great food. We stayed a the Grand Riviera Princess and went to Playa De Carmen for he day and stopped at Senor Frogs for a bite to eat ...food was great ..one more beer and we would have had to stay the night ..I would go back
Not what I expected. Food wasn't that good and it was expensive the only thing I liked was the staff they were fun and the service was really good
Good Entertainment and products. visited senor frogs bar in playa del Carmen, staff very helpful and amusing.visited shop and purchased tee shirt from a vast range.
Good fun!. Great fun place, good music, and the bar staff get up on stage and do dance routines. A good night out.
Great food. We went on Thursday evening around 7pm and it was not busy at all. We got the waiters undivided attention. We had several food items on the menu and all were great.

Great place. Went on vacation with my husband. Walked into town from the hotel and found Senor Frogs. Had the fish tacos and my husband had enchiladas. Beer came in a plan tree...super hilarious. Music was on point. The staff was excellent!!! Had a great time at the Senor Frogs in Playacar. Definitely will go back!

Low quality food and awful service . 6 of us visited Señor frogs after a bit of shopping the place looked a little dated but we gave it a go. Food was awful you can tell they use very cheap produce.Safe to say we won't be back even if they were giving away free meals.

Ok place.... Amazing cocktails & friendly bar staff, waiters. However the food was expensive & awful. The ribs had no meat in them all all. Another thing that was quite annoying was all the people pestering you selling stuff. Would never eat there again.

Lunch at Senor Frogs. Well I did not get a chance to go there at night when the place is really hopping, but when I'm back in late January next year I will give it a go. I did go there for lunch and the food was very good, beer was cold, servers were super nice and fun, so yes I'd go back and I am. Some people feel it's a little on the pricey side but you only live once and I don't feel I over paid for what I got.

Special treatment. Every time we go to Playa del Carmen we try to stop in at Señor Frogs, this was no exception. We had a large group, I spoke with the manager, and they went to great lengths to take care of everyone. The extended beach was tremendous as well.

Meh - very underwhelmed.. Seriously, I don't get what the big deal is about this place, but their merchandise is awesome. The pub was alright I guess. Probably not for me and my wife as we're a bit old for the place. I'll bet the parties here at night are awesome, but I'm too old now to appreciate the parties :-)
Large volume low quality. Large volume, low quality, you can drink enormous amounts of beer or cocktails here and eat hamburgers or pizza. Everything is huge but quality very limited
All good here.. All good here went for lunch time drinks polite staff great area right on the beach,drinks a little expensive though.

Yummy fish tacos!. We loved the swings and the "butt" seats at the bar. The waiters were fun and very catering, their signs they put on the chairs are hilarious too. The fish tacos and guacamole were delicious. Our hotel gave us a free margarita so we wanted to check it out. They get you with the paparazzi and the oxygen bar, trying to get more money out of ya, but it was fun and we couldn't complain. It was very hot inside tho. Muy caliente.

Great place for a drink -- but that's it. There are many great restaurants in Playa but Senor Frog's is not one of them. It is very overpriced for the quality of the food. It is a great place to stop for a drink, or two, but your money is better spent elsewhere on food.

Know what your getting into.... Know exactly what you are getting into when you are going here. This is a spot to draw in tourists who want to get drunk and party. My husband and I ate here immediately after traveling on a plane and a bus from Cancun. We were starving and this was the first place we saw. Upon arrival the first question is, "want a seat at the bar?" The goal is to get everyone to drink a lot. The food is surprisingly quite good for a place like this. Everyone walking around was only wearing bathing suits, drinking drinks out of those foot long cups, and yelling and screaming a lot. The waiters were all walking around the bar getting patrons to take shots while blowing very loud whistles. For what it's worth, if you are looking to get a bunch of drinks on the beach, this place is for you. It was clearly a lot of fun for the people looking for that type of experience. They take credit cards.

Senor Frogs never disappoints. The service was great, all staff friendly. The menu had lots to choose from and a good variety of drinks. Reasonably priced.The location is beside the beach and next to the pier for the Cozumel Ferry.It has a good vibe and there was a person going around making funny balloon hats.....he was pretty creative!!!!

So Much Fun!. My husband and I celebrated my birthday at Señor Frogs on Friday, August 7. We had the best time! The food was amazing!!!! Must better than the resort food we had been eating. The service was great and they really made my birthday celebration special! I love how they come by and take pictures of you and then you get a frame to go with it. Traveling just the two of us, it's hard to get a pictures with both of us in it. I highly recommend visiting Señor Frogs when you travel to Playa! We had a great time!

Great night out!!. If you're looking for a great night out in Playa del Carmen this place is a must!! Though we didn't eat here we spoke to many who had and they were very complimentary ! We visited a couple of times and both times we were made to feel very welcome and the bar staff are great fun! They had a great band one night and the other time they had just a disco but we enjoyed it all! It has very relaxed atmosphere and perfect for a night away from the hotel entertainment !!
My new fav place!. Great drinks, great food, great staff, great decor, great locations, great entertainment - LOVED IT!!I would say its a must visit :) Super fun
graduation trip. staff was amazing and friendly. food and drinks were great love the entertainment in a perfect location
Pleasant rest during shopping. Took a break from shopping for the best lemonade I've had in ages! Staff was friendly and entertaining.

So Fun.. I know it's a chain but I just love Senor Frogs. It's a fun place to eat for kids and adults and the food is great. Though I always try to find the quaint places to eat when I travel, I also like to make a stop at Senor Frogs if there is one.

Great staff AMAZING COCKTAILS. The only bad thing about this bar is it is very warm and sweaty. The drinks however were fantastic. I strongly recommend any of the frozen cocktails. I did not eat here but from what I have heard and seen, it looks and smells delicious. It is definitely worth coming here for a night out.

Fun place, good food!. We've been to Senor Frogs several times and were a bit hesitant to go in with our two almost 18 year old daughters but they ended up having a good time and a decent dinner. It was early, around 5pm so we risked it. They were offered alcohol, as were we, but as soon as we made it clear that was not our intent the servers left that alone. I wouldn't take children any younger than ours in there as it's pretty sexually oriented and alcohol driven.

The place your mother warned you about.. Here the party never stops. As much as it is a chain it still has plenty of adult refreshments and decent, but not great, food. It is excellent for people watching and just letting loose.

fun atmosphere. wife and i went here for lunch.the bar wasn't too busy at this time but was still a lively joint due to the energetic staff.perfect location and the drinks were great. food was decent albeit a little pricey.we really enjoyed it and will go back if we are in the area.
Love Senor Frogs!. I always visit Señor Frogs when I go to Mexico! It is fun and right on the beach. The drinks and food are great - the service is great and I love the decor!

Fun place. Had a few cheeky drinks whilst in PDC. Drinks reasonably priced. Fun bar, lots of things to look at and good tasting guacamole. Sat on the swings around the bar, went on an afternoon, bet this place is great at night
Great Time, Great Food and Great Music. Our group went here after exploring Playa del Carmen. The local band that was playing was outstanding. Food and Drinks were excellent. Had a great time!
Party place. Lots of fun in the sun. Decent food and quick service. The music and MC make the party exciting lots of dancing and some drinking games.
So much fun!. They go around and make balloons and have fun with the guests.Drinks are large and lots of alcohol!
Grab a t-shirt. I went to Senor frogs restaurant in Cozemel a year ago but didn't manage to get a t shirt, so i visited the local one in Playa to get my reminder from a previous trip.

I love Mexico. So listen, my background is cruise ships, and because of that I've been to Senor Frogs, Carlos & Charlies, The No Name Bar and a bunch of others just like them. If you're coming here looking for a romantic meal for two - you WILL be dissapointed.I love this place here or over in Cozumel you know exactly what you're getting.Good food, good drinks and people wanting to have a great time - oh yeah and welcoming friendly staff too.Seriously you cannot go wrong with this place.

Mike. A very nice beach bar. Engaging staff, quick service with good bar type food and a beautiful beach view and a look at Cozumel in the distance.The staff interacts appropriately with guests, getting them dancing on the stage at times and pulling light pranks with some of the female guests. An enjoyable dinner.

Just Drinks. We were strolling down 5th Avenue and needed a drink, so we stopped in for 2 margaritas but we did not eat. I have to say they were SOOO good, on the rocks...It is a tourist trap but we had a good time. We just cooled off for a bit and enjoyed the view of the beach...If you want a good drink this is the place.

Over-Hyped, and Over-priced. We went with a large family group of 16. The staff was fun and entertaining leading groups in dancing the “Chicken Dance”.However, the crowd can get rather rowdy and aggressive in the competitions. Several people, including myself got bumped into the crowd and into furniture as people had to run up from their seats to the microphone during the “Name That Tune” session.After all was said and done, we were shocked at the prices of the drinks and our tab which had been run up in our group. Bottom Line, this is a VERY EXPENSIVE place to have fun. If you are in a group, it is best to do separate checks so you don’t get stuck paying for the freeloaders in your party. We will never go to a Senor Frogs ever again.

Fantastic if your up for fun and drinks!. I would not recommend eating here, it was'nt the greatest, however the menu is big. 4 of us ate there, and none of us enjoyed our meal. However the staff are great, there fun, lively and exciting! The drinks are great and again, there is a huge variety!Its located in the town right on the beach, perfect if your up for fun and drinks!

So much fun!. I went to señor frogs with a group of 11. It was amazing. The staff were so much fun. Between dancing on stage, excellent food, wonderful entertainment. It was all around a great night for everyone :)

Decent cocktail but overpriced. Met up with some friends for a pre-lunch drink here last month. Plus side was it was easy to find and was on the beach so our kids could play, whilst we had a drink. The cocktails were decent size and tasty but have to say it was well over priced!!
Wedding Party Blowout. Such fun for a large group. Didn't like being harassed by the local trades. Food was good and drinks excellent at Senor Frogs. Wonderful staff.
stay away!!!. Was there in february, 100$... for burgers ans beers (3)...no way!!! plus check your bill, they were adding stuff we didnt have!!!Tourist trap!!!!

Delicious Food!!. The food was outstanding. It cost each couple about 50 USD and we all had drinks, Guacamole with chips, and a main course. Try the fish tacos!!! DELICIOUS!! The service was great too!

Big rip off. Must say I was really looking forward to my visit but all I got was over priced drinks and sub standard food. To finish my frogs experience I was totally ripped off by the waiter. Bumped my change. About 10 pounds British money/250 mexican. Really needs sorted. Big disappoint

Amazing atmosphere and good yard cocktails. such a funky place to have a drink by the pier, décor is so funky with life buoy swing bar chairs and yard long cocktails, and the band on at night plays some great music :)

Fun for a drink. Stopped in for an afternoon cervesa and had the coldest beer all week. The place is loud and you can have some fun here but it's really just another bar. Not a bad place for a quick stop but there's plenty of these places in Playa Del Carmen.

expensive for what you get. Came here for apps and a few drinks on a family trip. Service was good, but overpriced for what you get. My father and husband split chicken wings and they were literally the smallest wings I have ever seen in my life. The drinks were pretty good, but expensive. Great setting, right on the beach.

A very delightful visit. Very cool tourist attraction. We ordered a couple drinks and an entree each. They played really cool music had some hilarious signs on the ceiling that I discovered when leaving. The service crew was a little slow to start but were very attentive. It was a very cool exoerience as everyone in the place was having such a great time. They have an outdoor area on the beach to sit too. with umbrellas over the tables.

Great Vibe and Views, Ok Food. The food is basic, I didn't think it was horrible or fantastic. The restaurant is worth a visit though just for the views of the ocean and the displays.We saw a few dishes being served in a kitchen sink shaped plate complete with faucets. Cute things like this make it worth a visit at least once during your visit to Playa Del Carmen.

Fun and Food was great.. Stopped in the later afternoon for one beer and ended up ordering Supper. Enjoyed the fun atmosphere for the young and old. Ordered the fish Taco which was really good. So glad we stopped.
Great meal Great atmosphere. We had a large group its good food and a nice atmosphere right on the beach beside the ferry to cozumel. Nice shopping area around as well.

Okay experience.. Senior Frogs is a restaurant located just off Fifth Avenue near the ferry terminal. The best feature of this restaurant is the view of the ocean and beach. I have been here several times and don’t need to go again.The menu is okay with a large selection typical of Senior Frogs. The food is okay but not exceptional and not very consistent. They have a large variety of drinks to choose from but they full of sugar and more likely to give you a stomach ache than a buzz if you have one of their fish bowl size glasses. The staff are typically friendly and the service is okay though again it varies from night to night.The guy in the bathroom selling candies is a little off putting, especially when he offers to sell you something other than candy… He is also typically pushy for a tip and just generally gets in the way. If you haven’t been it is okay to visit once but there are far better places to eat and drink along Fifth Avenue in my opinion.

Short Visit to Senor Frogs. Maybe if I was younger ! Ha! Ha! Very loud and did not appreciate the waitress blowing her whistle every time someone had a shot...Clown making balloon hats was a funny touch... Guacamole made at the table was cool and delicious..
Fun place. Senor Frogs is a fun, non pretentious beach front bar. Don't expect gourmet food or over the top service. The staff is friendly, the beer is cold, the music is fun.

Dont waste your time and money... My wife had been before years ago and said it was great..but now it's just terrible....it's over priced, the service is abysmal..not in a great location anymore with new ferry port next door..dont waste your time, obviously just living on it's reputation.

Same as always. I guess somewhere along the row Sr. Frogs lost it they try to be the same at 10 years ago, besides that the services is lacking people trying to get you drunk acting like clowns to make you laugh and having a good time, o yes and the prices are very high. The location does not help as they are far from all other nightlife action about a 15 minute walk.

Very entertaining. This was a great choice to dine right before going out as a couple or a group. We went for dinner and stayed for a few drinks to enjoy the craziness going on with the whole staff. The food was great, they offer a small section with Mexican food if you wish to try some real local food. There was a band playing and a host to entertain everyone. The waiters are very friendly and always trying to make everyone laugh and make sure they are having a good time. We came back several time to enjoy the pre party.

Good food great view. me and my wife had the ceaser salad really enjoyed it and you get lots of it my daughter had chips and they were good she also had a strawberry milkshake that was huge also good great atmosphere awesome location on the beach nice an airy
Fun, fun, fun. What a great place to spend a day in Playa Del carmen, staff were fun and it's a great party atmosphere!
Over Priced. Way over priced and none stop kids and adults begging for money, selling stuff or showing lame magic tricks. Save your money and don't go here!

No service.
