I'm very disappointed about the service we received, we were put at tables on the beach that was fine, but we sat there for 20 min's or so and no one came to see what we wanted, we go up and we're looking around and found the photo guy and we took a photo mind you this was our 2nd time here and we were here on our Anniversary and to not get any service sucked, we stood around and took some pic's then left, no body asked if there was something that we wanted, nothing I'm very upset to be treaTed like that, your lucky I'm giving you 1 star you don't even deserve that, then we walk up to the store and they were on my like crazy, mind you there was nobody but a handful of people in the bar at that time Feb 6 2015

Its not the same like all mr frogs around the world!. The view and music its ok but the yards are expensive and taste ugly, they use the blended with a lil ice, the yard gets hot and taste ugly! If u want a good yard, iced, with no blendedgo to 5 avenue they sell by machine , the pina colada, margarita, coco loco its frozen. Dont go to sr frogs

Afternoon Drinks. We had a great time visiting Señor Frog's one afternoon while shopping 5th Ave. We had drinks (4 people total) which added up to being around $80usd. Pricey yes, but we had a great time listening to the live music, the staff was very fun, and a great beach!

Keep walking.... We decided to visit Señor Frogs after a day of shopping. Bad idea, the food was cold and not a lot of flavor. Not that the menu had much to offer. We paid $60 for 7 drinks and those where bottles of water or sodas. Getting someone to focus long enough to get the check was a challenge. Which was odd seeing as the place was practically empty. Maybe 2 people at the bar and one guy at a table. I suggest going up the street to any other restaurants....

Bad or no existing service. My wife and I ended a long walk at the beach at Senor Frog. We did wait at our beachtable with no reactions from the personal. After half an hour I went to the waiter and asked for 2 cervezas, we did wait another 20 minutes then I went to the personal and expressed my frustration with the situation. Almost no reaction at all. This is the worst place we did visit during our 10 days in PDC- and we NEVER come back to any SenorFrog again. Stay away, this is really really bad

Fun and tasty!. We stopped at Senor Frogs to get a drink and to take a break from the shopping. It's always a lot of fun, there's a dj, good music, good drinks, we ended up having a bite to eat and it was really tasty (a bit pricy but it's a tourist spot so we expected it) and even a clown who made balloons!

Great but Watch Out. We went with a group of friends and we were given the VIP treatment from when we walked in, we had balloon hats, sombreros and a table on the balcony looking over the sea. The photos cost extra but if you're quick you can take a group selfie before they take the sombreros! It was great the entire time until we came to pay! DO NOT LET THE WAITER WALK OFF WITH THE MONEY!!! We payed all together and had all of the money on the tray to pay! We all counted it to check and we left a $200peso tip, when the waiter took it he disappeared and came back saying that we had underpaid, after a bit of an argument struggling against the language barrier we shelled out more money! It ruined the trip which was a shame, either pay upfront or don't let them out of your sight and your night will be amazing! Don't let it deter you I would definitely go again!

Food is delicious. Definitely more expensive than most other places in the area but worth it...the food was excellent, especially the guacamole and taco salad as was the super fun staff...thinking of heading over there again today

Always fun for a few drinks!. It's always fun at Sr. Frogs! Beers and drinks that are made in a fresh coconut.....yum! There's always a fun vibe going on and great music(except the techno crap they played on NYE).
***LISTEN TO LORA***. Hi folks. Its all hype this place....$60 for two drinks and nachos. Poor service and a woman in the bathroom wanting tips for giving you paper towel...
Awesome location. It is right off the ferry pier, has its own awesome clean beach. Food is great, drinks are great, environment is awesone!

Lunch at Senor Frogs. The food was very good, service was excellent. Waiters are very entertaining. Great location right on the beach. It was a great place to go to relax and have a couple of drinks and lunch after shopping on 5th Avenue.

Great night! Great food. We celebrated our friends daughters birthday in señor frogs, we had a great night, the food was lovely and plenty of it, the drinks are LARGE lol The children played on the beach whilst waiting for their meal, it's safe, you can see them from the restaurant/bar and there is a trampoline too for them to use.We all wore silly balloon hats for a small fee of pesos or usdAnd the birthday girl was sang to and foam pied

Good place for drinks and bites!. At the end of 5th avenue just to relax, have great drinks and good bites! You can go alone, with friends and fsmily. The service is very good and the margaritas are awsome!

Overpriced waste of time and MONEY.... I had never been to a Senor Frogs before, but was certainly aware of the brand... I am certain that their other locations DO NOT reflect upon their Playa Del Carmen location... If they DID - they would NOT be in business...The ONLY thing they have going on is their location which is right on the beach in PDC... Other than that, expect to OVERPAY for food, and definitely drinks... For what we paid we could have gone to a TGI Fridays here in the States and gotten the same food quality and overpriced everything... In other words - DO NOT waste your time at Senor Frogs.... In PDC, apparently, it is about their name recognition... Next time we are in PDC we will just go to one of the local bar/restaurant and, hopefully, get better food / booze / service for a MUCH better price... If you want to get overpriced EVERYTHING, I would suggest eating / drinking at a restaurant in the airport on the way home.... Pretty much the exact same experience (without the view of course)...

Frogs do it well. Great bar, drinks can be a bit pricey but you know that before u walk in, the set up is great.The band and DJ were good, it's slap bang on the beach if u wanted to go sit down and chill.Inside the decor, bar seats and staff make the place great. Shoddy mens toilets were a surprise after seeing how well the rest of the place is done up.Good place to start ur night as u walk/stagger up 5th to get to 12th

Nice Bar, good music and what a view. Afternoon in the town and stopped by this famous bar for a drink, middle of the afternoon with live band, people dancing and all right on the beach. I have to come back here with a bathing suit and towel and spend the day. Not many places you can sit at a table on the beach and listen to a live band while enjoying a ocean view. Recommended stop while in town. Food looked good but we had already eaten so just drinks this trip
Excellent food. The food is great here and the cocktails are tasty. Not that expensive and on the beach with lovely views. Love the theme bar and the staff are not too imposing.
Great. Only had drinks BUT WAS a lovely place wish we'd not eaten at Karen's (rubbish ) all the food looked amazing. The service was great couldn't do enough to meet ur visit amazing

Honest review from fussy couple. The food was absolutely gorgeous tasting, it was by far the best tasting Mexican I had and our hotels Mexican wasn't great! The food is a good price and quick and the service was great too. I had the chicken fajitas as did a friend and they were amazing! My partner had the pepperoni pizza which he enjoyed but couldn't finish and our other friend had a full portion of hot wings which I tried and they again tasted amazing. Highly recommend this restaurant for authentic food which tastes great!

So disappointed.. Last time in Mexico, our group went to the Senor Frogs in Cancun and had the best time. Tons of people. Dancing. Drinks. Great Atmosphere. The Senor Frogs in Playa Del Carmen IS THE COMPLETE OPPOSITE. We had made reservations for a night out. We were going to buy the all-inclusive package for drinks when we got there. We saw the vibe of the place and decided to leave after 10 minutes. The location is cool as it's right on the beach. However, transportation cannot take you right to the door. It's a bit of a walk. And if you're in heels, it's torture to walk the stone streets to get there.The bar was completely dead. There were maybe 10 people there. BORING.We should have gone to Coco Bongo. It was a few blocks down. They had a line that went on for blocks to get into there. Lesson learned.
We go every time we are in Playa!. We were there in March and went back in July with some friends. Great staff, always fun. Get in on the conga line...there's always a shot at the end!
swing at the bar. I had heard so much about senor frogs.....kind of a disappointment. But friendly service and the swings were cool

Always a winner for us!. Came back to this place after a five year gap. We've been to the Cancun one and I've got to say this one is much better, the beach and the dock are a great place to chill with a nice cold beer. Always a great place to take teenagers and older kids, or just to hang with family and friends. I would say, if you just, like us, want to chill with a beer and take in the music and scenery be aware you will get people coming up for photos etc. We have done all this before so not for us. But if you would like photos and balloons making for you...lap it up!
typical senor frogs. be careful going in to these places in mexico, and getting sucked into paying for $10 dollar shots..

Slow Service but fun. Went for a drink in the middle of the day as always wanted to visit. Non of the staff seamed like they could be bothered to do any thing. One bar man running around and then 8+ servers just standing about. Once we had seated ourselves and ordered a few drinks every thing was forgotten about due to strong drinks what's always welcoming.Overall if we had more time would have grabbed some food or had a night out. I'm guessing it can be crazy !

Overpriced but Fun. We went there in June 2014 and had a good time. The drinks are very overpriced but the location is great, right on the beach next to the ferry. It's a fun place to have a drink or two at but I would not dare spend all day here in fear of the bill at the end.

Everyone loved this place. This place is amazing! We have experienced it on our first visit in the evening with out children and also in the day time for food with our 3 young children! It is so good! The views are amazing! The children loved all of the novelty props in there and the atmosphere is great! The staff are lovely and very good with children! We also went to the one in Cancun! It is just amazing, I wish there was one in the UK

awesome. What a fab atmosphere! Very upbeat with great live acts on. Swings at the bar, and a sit out area on the beach. Can get a bit too loud late on if your not feeling like partying, but a great night out
Good but pricey. Pretty decent food, good views of the beach but expensive drinks and food. The decor was typical, the music was a bit loud at times given it was the early afternoon.

I enjoyed the ocean view more than the food.. The food wasn't all that delicious. Very bland. It was also quite pricey. I only ate here because I spent a day on the beach & this location is right on the beach. The ocean view is marvelous!

Fun Evening. We visited in late July. We had a group of twelve people. Everyone of us enjoyed the food, drinks and entertainment. The service was great. Our waiter was super friendly and quick to bring drinks. It may have been a bit pricey but it is what you would expect in a resort town. I would return here if we were in the area again.

Lots of Family Fun. We had a great time eating at Senor Frogs after shopping. Kids had a blast and the food was excellent. We had a problem with the waiter leaving on us because the workers played a joke on him and he got mad so he left after taking our order and never put our food order in. Needless to say, they took care of us and provided a discount to compensate for the issue. I would definitely visit Senor Frogs again!

Good Food, Great Staff, Awesome Drinks. This restaurant was a little pricey, but I think it was worth it. I got a Bahama Mama in a long yard cup and we also did a shot of hypnotiq for $4. The staff were very fun and friendly. They were congratulating a couple who had just got married. They put a slow song on and let them dance to it on stage. The waiters asked myself and my cousin to dance. It was a great atmosphere. Anyone who is in the area I recommend going to check it out.

DONT USE YOUR CREDIT CARD. I've read several reviews about credit card scams at this business. The same thing happened to me and I emailed the company directly 4 or 5 times and never heard a thing back. They didn't even respond to my last trip advisor review in Dec 2013 but they responded to all the other reviews around it. PAY CASH !!!!!!

Good food. After visiting Mexico many times and also eating real Mexican food in California and in London it was the first time I had ever seen refried beans mixed in with the nachos, which I didn't like, it wasn't genuine. I couldn't see much chicken the few little bits were cut into very, very small squares and tasted nothing like chicken. The portion was huge but I wasn't impressed, I ordered a margarita which had very little tequila if any in it, when I pointed it out to the waiter he had it refilled and this time I could certainly taste the tequila. Later on I actually felt quite sick the way the beans had been fried and mixed in with everything instead of being brought separatety. I thought it was very expensive and I wouldn't recommend it. Good view of the beach though.

Super pricey, but they do a lot of work to make it worth it. We went to Senor Frog's on a rainy evening, and had a fantastic time. The swinging life-preserver bar seats were really fun, and the staff never stopped making sure everyone had a good time. The bartenders flirt with everyone (in a happy way, not in a creepy way), they pass shots around like water, they moved funny signs in front of people (like putting "Easy Lay" in front of a grandma), and had conga lines and dance competitions all night. The house band was really good - very upbeat and the song selection was awesome.The food and drinks were good, but nothing to really remark about. Our bar tab, however, came out to be $400 for four people. Which is INSANE. Yes, we had a lot of cocktails, but we were in no way inebriated enough by the end of the night. We left after three hours and went to other bars.

Danced all night! Then ate and went to bed!!. An open air dance hall-bar-restaurant..great music with mixed in music from all era's. Food was good but the people watching was better!! very good prices on bar drinks and munchies..Their gear was good but found I could purchase the same at the airport before we left and better prices!!

great location nice bech. bar stools are shaped like life preservers so cool seating, set for a young crowd sat at the bar and service was SLOW. just had an appetizer and probably the worst 5 dollar margarita i've had in 5 years great location though

Good tourist bar for a younger crowd. Good mix of music/live band, yardstick drinks, and a great location right on the marina/shopping district. Definitely a tourist hangout. Bartenders give change in $US if you pay with smaller bills. Would not recommend for families/kids -- decor is a little risqué but all in good fun.

Great time - Great staff!. We spent our vacation in Riviera Maya, but spent a day in Plays del Carmen and ended it at Senor Frogs. We went to have a couple drinks, and ended up having dinner there as well. Our waiter was Louis and he was absolutely great! actually, pretty much everyone working there was great! it wasn't very crowded while we were there, but the staff interacted with us, had no problems keeping our drinks refreshed, and the food we ordered (burger and fajitas) were really good! We will definitely go back if we are in that area again.

Smiles for service. Went to senior frogs several times during our recent visit to Playa Del Carmen. Terrific atmosphere and location. Great service, food and drinks. The bartenders and waiter staff were the absolute best. Shout out to our favorite bartender Oso. We miss you and will be back to see you soon. Love, Daniella and squad

Was only there a short time. I arrived at Senor Frogs at possibly the wrong time ( and for that reason when I go back to Playa del Carmen will visit the place again.) We arrived towards the end of the night, however I felt a sense of fun around the place from guests, and waiters. Family's were there, and therefore it seems as though it caters for mixed ages. I will definitely go back as I sensed as though I had missed out on something.

Wrong choice !! Don't go!!. Pitiful service . The waiters are just pending of the big parties (more tip) had to wait for 10 minutes to order a beer. The food was gross . French fries fried on very old oil. Same as the chicken wings . High prices for a cheap meal. It's just a name . Don't waste your money .
Excellent food and service. We had the combo beef/chicken nachos, chips/salsa and guac and it was delicious. Beautiful beach view as wel.

Nassau. This was our first time. We were celebrating our anniversary and Tia our waitress and some of the other Señor Frog employees made it a day we will always remember! Tia was awesome! Thanks to her so much! Robert and Josie

Had a great time.. This was probably my 5th time going back to Senor Frogs in Playa Del Carmen.We had a great time as usual. The food is really good, and portions are very decent. Drinks are large and reasonably priced. The best part has to be the private beach area in front of the restaurant, water there is amazing, super clear, not one rock.The only disappointing thing, was I had left a t shirt on a chair in the restaurant, returned a couple minutes later to grab it and it was gone, and no one working said they had seen it, my own fault for leaving it there I guess.

It's Hard to Find More Fun Than This!. My wife and I have been coming to this Senor Frogs since 2003 and we absolutely love it. Senor Frogs is a must stop for us on every trip to this area of Mexico. I almost don't know how to describe this place...it's a bar, it's a restaurant, it's Comedy Central, it's balloons; it's swinging seats at the bar or nasty buttocks stools...and it's just plain old fun, fun, fun! Let my pictures show you. This most recent trip (May 2014) we dragged two additional couples along with us and they loved it too! If you get anywhere near Playa del Carmen, Mexico, you have to go enjoy this place! We love it!
Enjoying a drink . Great spot to have a drink before entering the Cozumel ferry. Friendly people, great drink menu and not so bad pizza. Enjoy the energy before you get on that 45 minute ferry.

Fun Place Great Vibe!!. Had a few drinks here and the atmosphere was buzzing. Really good feel about this place. There was a clown doing tricks and making hats for everyone out of balloons. Wish I stayed for food cos it looked really good. They have seating on the beach too and if your brave enough to use the trampoline after a few beverages then go for it!

Amazingly Fun, Best food. Discovered this place in 2009 on an excursion called the "party hopper" and was impressed enough to go back every time we are down in Mexico (once a year). My wife and I have gone just the 2 of us several times but this time (April 2014) we were in Mexico for a wedding. We brought groups of 6 people with us for the 2 times we went here. Both times were as expected. Excellent! The second time really stands out. We had 2 little ones with us (one 2 and one 6) and the staff did everything under the sun to make these little girls smile and laugh! We had balloon hats, crazy sombrero hats and they even let the 6 year old use their "air cannon". The signs hung on the roof are hilarious so are the signs they move around the restaurant. My wife was "silicone free" and I was a "mommas boy". Didn't even notice them placing them. The stage and DJ make for a great time. They found a bunch of girls from the beach (best beach in Mexico) and had them preform Wrecking Ball on stage, waiters with napkins in their ears applauding them. It was just a blast. I ordered the fish tacos and my wife had the coconut shrimp, both are Delicious!! A lot of reviews on here say it's touristy. But being a resident of Canada means I am a tourist! I love it and will return here every time I am in Mexico!

Great time but credit card numbers were stolen. This review is going to be a tale of two experiences. While we there there, we had a fantastic time. You can't beat the location right on the beach in Playa. The food was good, service was good, and the drinks of course were great. It's smaller than a lot of SF locations, but again you can't really beat the view and location. Spent a lot of time hanging out, enjoying the view, sitting on the swing seats at the bar and having a great time. Until we got home. There were 3 of us that used our credit cards, and all three of us had our numbers stolen and charges of thousands of dollars were attempted at local Playa businesses and stores. Discussing with each other, we know it was here that our numbers were stolen because it was the only place in common that we used them and it was the only place in Playa I even used mine. So sadly a great experience was marred by the staff stealing our credit card numbers. Thank goodness for fraud departments who catch stuff like that. So always be sure to call your card companies to tell them your travel dates (the charges happened after we were back in the States) and watch your statements online closely after you get home.

40th Birthday. Couldn't have chosen a better place for our friend. Keep in mind, you have to have a good and open sense of humour for this place. It's not for everyone. Tourist trap yes? A little much at times with them coming to your table to sell things, but just say no. Food was great, you are right on the beach, weather is amazing and the atmosphere was different than any other restaurant I've been to. Ontario needs more places like this where you can just have fun.

Tacky Tourist Trap. Everyone who goes to Mexico seems to go to Senor Frogs, so of course we had to check it out. Please don't waste your time. I enjoy bars and clubs and dancing, but this was bordering on pathetic. We walked in, made one loop and walked back out. It was about 9:00 at night and there was no one over the age of 18 in the place-obviously the "older" people (I'm 29) are smart enough to know how ridiculous this place is. The scene reminded me of a bunch of children getting wasted for the very first time and trying to prove how "grown up" they were by grinding and flailing around on the bar and dressing as cheap and skimpy as possible. I was embarrassed to be seen walking out of the place. It was so packed with hammered kids we could barely work our way back out. It could be perfectly fine during the day, but I got a terrible impression at night. Not necessarily the bar's fault-they just happened to have really tacky clientele the night we were there.

fun but tourist trap. On a cruise, we a party of six stopped at senor frogs for a drink. The place had a fun theme, but you need to watch what you are getting into. None of the drinks have prices on them and they try to sell you senor frog plastic glass. Another person comes around with balloons and before you know it, he is looking for a big tip. When our bill came for six, with two beers and four drinks in their glasses, it came to 94 US dollars. I don't believe our group will frequent their place again

We enjoyed it!. My sister and I were visiting Playa del Carmen the first week in April, and after a day of shopping, figured we'd just check this place out (maybe it's the frog in front that drew us in ;-).I've read the other review saying it's 'tour-isty, etc.,' and yes, maybe it is, but what the heck! We were tourists! My sister and I had no idea what to expect, but we had a ball! Granted, it can get a little bawdy, at times, with some of their signs and the way they serve the drinks (especially the one in the palm tree). But we found the food to be quite good (I had shrimp fajitas, and she had a burrito) and the drinks were good, as well. Our waiters, Julio and YiYo are what really made the visit the most fun! These guys are off the hook, LOL! I thought the staff seemed to cater to those at the individual tables, and probably took advantage of the fact that there were two women (me and my sister) at our table, so it might have gotten a little crazier. But there were people in there with children, and they all seemed to be having a good time. We were there on a weekday, probably at about 4 or 5 pm. Would definitely go again, and recommend it to others.

It was ok....nothing special. The hubby and I have never been to a Senor Frogs so we thought we'd stop in for a beer and an app. The ceviche was really good, the salsa and chips were average and the decor was crappy college bar expected. I wouldn't recommend unless you go later at night maybe to party. We went Friday afternoon in April so nothing happening but a beautiful beach!

Revolting...don't go if you're over the age of 18.. We walked in and out of Senor Frogs one evening...and will never return to one again. Now, granted, we were in one during spring break time, so maybe its not as bad other times. But still...we knew it was a touristy crazy bar, but yuck! It was packed with 18 year olds on what seemed to be their first drunk binge in tiny cropped tops and mini skirts grinding on top of the bar...falling off of the bar...breaking things. I felt like I needed a vaccination when I left. Now, i'm not old, i'm 29, I can deal with loud bars and clubs...but this was gross. I can't speak for the food for anything, or what its like during the day. But based on this, I will never go to one again. I try to stay away from stuff this touristy anyway.

A haven of sanity in the hussle and bussle of a tourist centre. Down by the jetty is Senor Frogs. Don't be put off by the notice that states "Beyond this point clothing is optional". They serve cold beer and good music. When I say good music I mean they had a band on stage playing decent rock music. ALL the staff entertain the customers and it is absolute fun.It surprised us when we entered the place and a swift pint lasted an absolute age.Just do it as Mr Nike would say.

Fun time. Went their as part of our visit to Playa del Carmen. Over priced for sure!! It's totally geared to tourist. The food was good and drinks were great but again, overpriced.Great party place for a younger crowd.

Fun Afternoon in Playa Del Carmen. We went to Playa Del Carmen to check out the sites and after walking around in the hot sun we decided to grab a bite to eat and some cool drinks at Senor Frogs. The food was very good (shrimp tacos were great) and we the drinks come in various sizes. The service was great, the atmosphere was fun (I imagine at night it would get pretty wild) and the view is gorgeous. The restaurant is right on the beach and you can watch the surf and the Cozumel ferry coming and going.

Best part of our spring break trip!. Last week, my daughter and I, along with 4 other daughters and moms, went to the Cancun area for spring break. I was a little wary of going to Senor Frogs. Just didn't know what to expect and wanted our girls to be safe.Oh my gosh - best time of our spring break trip! (the whole trip was pretty awesome too!) We were warned that the drinks and food was expensive, but you also get the fun atmosphere, the location right on the beach and the wonderful service. ** The food was very very good. ** We had "Mother Margaritas (we thought it was fitting...). They were awesome... and strong!** The wait staff was absolutely the best. We got there a little after another large group (from our same high school) and they were already dancing on stage. Our girls were a little more apprehensive, so we asked the waiters if they would bring our girls up to the front and dance with them at some point (tipping them of course). They did so willingly, and the girls loved it!You have to be prepared that this is not a quiet, typical family sit-down restaurant. If you want to have fun, get loud, get in the Mexicani-vacation spirit, this place is for you!

Waiters steal your credit card information!!. March 21st, 2014 I along with three other adults took eight high school seniors to Senor Frogs in Playa del Carmen. We had a great time and everything was very nice until we returned home three days later and found that all of our credit cards had been copied and over $3900 was charged to my card. How low can you go? We spent over $420 at this place and also tipped the waiter very well and he showed his appreciation by stealing our credit card information! If you choose to go the this low rent place make sure you pay with cash.

Nightmare on Playa. I was unfortunate enough to stop here to pick up some wifi in order to communicate with my next accomodation. Little did I realise what was in store for me...... Costa del Sol/Benidorm circa 1990. A revolting place. Music too loud and played by an over enthusiastic DJ who's nauseatingly awful jokes had me near projectile vomiting. Over priced and watered down drinks. Entertainment akin to a childs fifth birthday party and obnoxious clientele. Avoid like the plague.

Fun place to stop for a drink while waiting for the Cozumel ferry. Our balloon hats were fun as we sipped delicious, perfectly crafted daiquiris on a super hot day. The atmosphere was friendly and fun, the band was fantastic, and the drinks icy and tasty as heck. We will stop by again when we are back in that neck of the woods!

Fun Fun Fun!!!!. I was a little leery of going here due to the reviews I read. I am glad I followed my gut instinct and decided to try it out! This place was so much fun......yes a little pricey in food and drinks but having said that.....the drinks were strong and the food was delicious!! The staff is fun and over the top but laughs aplenty......the balloons on the head were fun and she did not bug for a tip...we offered and she took but she did not ask.......it was my sister's birthday and they brought her up on stage and the whole bar sang Happy Birthday in Spanish and English! The view of the beach was great. I would certainly go back here!!!! Gracias Senor Frog's for a great afternoon!

Somewhat overpriced. Food is okay, drinks are a little overpriced. They can charge more because of name recognition. Fun, but cheesy. A lot of people bring their kids here. It's kind of a fun place to bring kids before it starts getting late and turns more into a club atmosphere. Overall I'd say it's just average for the price you pay.

Perfect ..has a beach club!. We drank and ate here and it was perfect. After we pulled up some loungers and went swimming. .beach was nice water was awesome. .food and drinks are a bit expensive but worth it for what u get. They have entertainment going on there all the time. Have been to this location twice and would go back

Spring Break. Staff was fun, drinks were strong! Just a good party place nothing else. The staff worked hard to keep everyone involved with the fun, nobody gets away with sitting in the corner. We went with a group and had a good time. Right on the beach , and basically an outdoor patio.

Great Time. Stopped for lunch with my family (including grandchildren 4 and 6 yrs old). Everyone had a blast. The food was good, it was a little basic, but what do you want from a quesadilla :). The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Next time in the area, we will definitely return.

Great fun! Great drinks!. We ran in here to grab a quick drink before catching the ferry to return to our cruise ship docked at Cozumel. The staff was welcoming and attentive. Great selection of fun drinks. Lively crowd this is a great spot to relax after a hurried day and enjoy people watching!
Very nice lunch on the beach.. Nice food & drinks,The service was good some people consider it pricey but we feel average prices for the area.

All about the fun~. The food here is decent, not great, but you go more for the fun atmosphere than the food. Mexican style pub food. The service was great, our server Julio was amazing, he spent time chatting with us and making jokes. Not a family place for sure- lots of stags/ bachelorette parties etc. For what it is, the place is good.

Really??????. We stayed on Cozumel and made a day trip to Playa del Carmen. While waiting for our ferry back to Cozumel, we decided to stop in at Senior Frogs for a drink. We ordered a beer and a water. The beer was not very cold. The thing that really was a joke was when we used the restroom, there was an attendant there that would tear off a piece of paper towel for you to dry your hands and then expect you to tip them! My husband's attendant even outright asked for the tip! And, to top it off, our bill came to $10 US for one beer and one water and the smallest bill we had was a $20 US….our waiter asked if we wanted change back! I guess so!!! Our first, and our LAST time going to Senior Frogs!

Great beach out front!. We were in Playa del Carmen on a cruise ship stop and we sat on the beach in front of Senor Frogs. A waiter came out to ask us what we wanted to drink. We all ordered drinks and he quickly came back with our orders. We never ventured inside, but the waiter kept checking on us, but not enough to be annoying. It definitely was a great day!

Introvert? Stay away!!. We stopped in at Senor Frog's while exploring 5th ave. Being from Canada, I had always heard of this chain, but never experienced it personally, so wanted to give it a shot. I was totally unprepared for the experience, and assume that persons more extroverted than I would have a fantastic time. The restaurant overlooks a beach and the ocean, so try to get a seat near the balcony overlooking the view (if you're ok with watching drunken vacay make-out sessions, and smoke wafting over your dinner.) The food was only so-so, standard for a chain restaurant, nothing special. The decor was very interesting with kitchy little details all of the place, lots to look at! The waiters were very involved with the diners, walking around pouring shots directly into peoples mouths. They would also pull people onto the dance floor to dance with them regularly. I'm not at all into either of these things, and managed to wedge myself into a corner where they couldn't access me (thank god.) It was very entertaining and hilarious to watch, but as an introvert, was terrified they were going to seek me out at some point, as it was mostly women they were going for. There were clowns onsite, making balloon creations for diners. They were pretty funny, and requested tips for their work, but I don't believe they were employed by the restaurant directly. There didn't seem to be a limit on the alcohol, as there were multiple visitors who were completely wasted. One woman passed out in front of us, smacking her head on a table on the way down. Seeing someone bleed profusely from the head wasn't exactly the highlight of my trip. I wouldn't go back, but if you're into the party scene, it seems like a relatively safe/fun place to get drunk.

Another great time! . Well you see it on TV and in movies and it is the exact same.... Tons of fun! If you need to let loose from the resort or condo here's your place. Day or night you can and will have a blast! But beware of the signs haha you may be posing with friends but the sneaky waiter will put hilarious signs behind you. Such a good time. And if you go during the day, the beach and view is to die for! Food and drinks are great and delious (a bit pricey but very very good). Try the fish tacos FYI

Patina of "cool", but expensive and deafeningly loud. After several trips to Yucatan Mexico, and hearing about how much fun Senor Frog's could be, my teenaged daughter asked if we could go there during a daytrip to Playa Del Carmen. We decided to try it out for lunch on a very rainy day during Christmas week 2013.And... meh. The atmosphere is classic "Caribbean Beach Bar", with open sides and swings at the bar, a large stage and a thunderous sound system. We were seated after a 10 minute wait (1pm, though whether the wait was longer or shorter because of the heavy rain falling outside, I couldn't hazard a guess). Our table was pretty much dead-center in the not-very-large dining area, which was also probably the epicenter of the excruciatingly loud 70s-disco music track. My ears started to hurt almost immediately (and I left with a splitting headache from a sound-hangover).The wait staff are actually quite attentive and pleasant, and the menu is "Gringo-approved" with safe Tex-Mex and "Amurrican" choices including burgers and familiar Tex-Mex standards. The food wasn't actually BAD, it just wasn't particularly good or authentic. It was also on the expensive side (not just by local standards -- the prices are state-side chain restaurant +50%). My family tried a few different dishes: my wife ordered the appetizer cerviche, which was a heaping bowl of solid tilapia-based cerviche (a little salty but decent) with a cone of tortilla chips. My daughter had cheese enchiladas (similarly large portion, pleasant but undistinguished). My son had "Andreas tacos" -- beef and vegetables, the most flavorful thing we ordered. I had a Cobb salad -- once I got the forgotten dressing, not bad.Similarly expensive -- and this could be an issue if you're going to Senor Frog's to party down -- the booze list. As you'd expect, the menu is heavy with fruity concoctions in souvenir cups, but even basic beer is expensive ($9 for a 20-ounce schooner). You'd have to be pretty determined, and pretty unimagininative, to get drunk at Senor Frog's.Overall -- the "cool" factor wore thin very quickly even for a 14-year old. The food and beverage options were thoroughly average and expense, the music was deafening and stopped all prospect of conversation, and -- at least when we visited -- the crowd seemed to be going through the motions of having fun, more than actually having it. Pretty sure you can do better in Playa Del Carmen.

Beware!!!. We ate at Sr Frogs Christmastime 2013. Food was good, the staff was fun. Here is the BEWARE part. We STRONGLY suspect the photographer who is not affiliated with Sr Frogs of stealing our credit card information and using it to rack 900 dollars worth of charges. If you get the photo, PAY CASH!!!! Or better yet don not patronize this person at all.

FUN PLACE BUT. This is my 3rd time coming to this establishment and this time was fun again until I got my bill. I tried to pay with my Visa and the bartender said that my card wouldn't process for some strange reason so I paid cash since it was only $19. I even gave him a $6 tip. A couple days later I checked my Visa statement online to find out that my card did go through. I emailed the company to ask if this was normal practice and I never got a response. I guess Im to assume that this is normal. I go there everytime Im in Playa. Not anymore !!!!!!!

Beware of the extras. This place left a really bad taste (pardon the pun)! Upon being seated a waiter asked if we needed Guacamole, to which we agreed.Another waiter then approached us for our 'main' order. Little did we know that the first guy was an 'independent' contractor who charged us separately and at a much higher cost than the menu. When I questioned the fact that he had a señor frogs uniform on, they said I should have asked before I placed the order if he was part of the restaurant. Secondly, they offered us "free" oxygen therapy for 4 minutes. We asked them twice if it was indeed free and was reassured that there was no charge whatsoever. Once you sit down they pour you a drink without asking you and then demand $8 + tips for your "free" session. To top it all off the drinks were overpriced (averaging $15/drink) and the food was average at best! There are much better options on the strip.

Money Hustle. Cool atmosphere, more of a college party than a restaurant even early in the day. Nice location. They try to take your picture with stupid hats on for $15 the second you walk in. Then a clown stops by and basically asks for a tip. The food was mediocre and very expensive for the quality. It's a place to get drunk, if you're looking for a meal go elsewhere. Also when it's time to pay the waiter bluntly asked for a tip and then wrote on the bill "please tip". Very tasteless.

Fun Atmosphere. We ate dinner here before loading the ferry back to Cozumel and we had surprisingly fast service. The food was good and the drinks were delicious, but the one thing that annoyed me was the guy walking around with the sombrero taking pictures. My husband and I didn't want to take the pictures to begin with and when he came back to try to sell the pictures to us he looked upset that we didn't want to buy them. Other than that...our waiters were amazing and entertaining!

Disappointed. After hearing great things about this place, I have to say we were disappointed.There was no atmosphere, staff weren't particularly friendly - They even had the cheek to send a bloke with a sombrero over so we could pay to have a photo taken, just to show what a great time we weren't having.The starters arrived promptly but we obviously didn't guzzle them down quick enough because our mains arrived before we'd finished. The food was ok, usual chain stuff.The bill arrived before we'd finished our mains with a 2 minute explananition that it DIDN'T include a service charge, did you get that? It DIDN'T include a service charge, he also made sure we understood that by underlining and writing ' service not included' on the bill. We should have wrote on his forehead 'SERVICE NOT GIVEN'.The toilets are disgusting too

Just another chain!. As with any other chain, it is what it is. If you've never been to a Senor Frogs and you're on vacation and looking for someplace upbeat and fun, than this is the place for you. I've been into this particular Senor Frogs multiple times and have had the same experience each time. It's a louder restaurant with over priced food and drinks and normally a lot of drunken patrons. Yes, I have been one of them at one point. SO if you're looking to PARTY this is the place for you, even though there is a bunch of eager staff waiting to get you drunk and get you to spend your money and of course...there are always children present. Apparently it's ok to take your kids into bars when you're on vacation. ;) During the day it is more quiet and it is right on the water so you can people watch and relax with some chips and salsa and cold beverage of your choice.

Great Pizza and very cold beer!. We stopped in for a drink. I was accompanied by IHBtoledo and had an excellent experience. Sure the clown was annoying, and the guys walking around putting sombreros on your head and placing goofy signs by your table were not entertaining. Who cares...that's what you expect when you go in! I had the coldest beer and the best pizza I have ever had that afternoon! And IHBtoledo picked up the tip. I would definitely return.

Food okay, but annoying staff. We stopped in for a drink. Within 5 minutes a "clown" came to our table, asked us where we were from, put a few balloons on my head, and asked if I thought he deserved a tip. Then I went to the men's room. A man stood at the door and watched me relieve myself. After I washed my hands, he handed me a paper towel and then looked at a basket with a "TIPS" sign on it. Evidently I was expected to give him money for his services. These incidents soured me on the place. I will not be returning.
Brilliant Cocktails. Loved the swing chairs, cocktails and atmosphere. A souvenir picture is a must!! Beautiful setting on the beach! Can be found by the ferry terminal to Cozumal.

Very much for the tourist appeal. The only thing to complain about at Senor Frogs was that the music was so loud at we had to move tables to chat with our friends. It was lunch time so we were suprised it was that loud. The food was good, and the drinks were better. The set up is fun to look at as well.

A must!. Wow, this place was amazing. Great food, service, beach and ocean views, drinks, and fun. Yes, you will spend well over $100 for two people if you drink, but it was one of the highlights of our trip. The staff is very energized, and always playing pranks on you. The only reason I didn't give an excellent rating is because the shot waitresses are very direct and don't really give you an option to have a shot, even though you pay $4 a piece.
Yummy!. Food and drinks great. You can't go wrong with the Coconut Shrimp. A bit expensive, but par for the course in a resort town.

beach front. bus dropped us for the day by senor frogs. we should have known there were very few covered areas available on the beach there and they were quickly taken over by the first people to show up. Our waiter was great and took good care of us. Nice beach. Would have been nice to have a secure place to put things when we went in the ocean. easy walk to walmart! for gifts for folks back home

Right across from the Ferry In Playa del Carmen. We had been on a day trip to see the whale sharks. We missed the 3 pm ferry and there was not another one until 5 pm and we had not eaten much of a lunch. This is a very touristy place that we would normally not go to, but it was hot and it had a beautiful view. It is right on the beach and honestly it is on one of the prettiest beaches I have seen with the white sand and beautiful turquoise waters. The staff seems to have a good time. They also do the best they can to have you buy "extra" things. They took our picture with a sombro and then framed it for us to buy. (honestly it is one of the cheesiest things we have ever purchased, but we do laugh when we see it) Just be prepared to say "no" to several things unless you want to spend twice the amount for your meal.The live band they had was terrible. I think they murdered several songs that we both really like. The people watching is interesting. It is amazing to me as to what people wear on a beach. My husband was enjoying some of the outfits. Ha!I understand that this is supposed to all be in fun, but they have a women's bathroom door that says to slide and it is bolted shut. The women's bathroom is on the other side of the wall and is out of sight. I suppose there could be some entertainment value to watching drunk girls try to get into the bathroom. The food was average and kind of expensive. However, it was better than I thought it would be. I realize that you are paying for the location and "fun" of it all. I did get the guacamole and they come and make it on a cart at your table to your liking. We got the pizza.It is a fun atmosphere and the location across from the ferry gives it a little boost.

OK - a bit pricey. We went to Senor Frogs on Monday 17th June. There was only a handful of people in the bar so not much atmosphere in the bar due to lack of people which cannot be helped. They have a wide selection of drinks and cocktails in lots of different sizes and you can keep the glasses if you want to. we paid around £10GBP each for a 'Palm sized' cocktail. Just be weary as each time they give you your bill they include a 60 peso tip in the total, as we were all paying separately this added up - it is not compulsory so just pay the cost of your drink and tip as you see fit. Some good souvenirs and worth a visit if you are in the area - enjoy
Fun for the kids & better food than Iberostar. Kids had a great time with staff, dancing, getting fun drinks and balloon hats. Food was good, what you would expect.
average. average food, average service, nice view. good place to people watch and wait for ferry to Cozumel, within walking distance of my hotel so convenient location
More expensive. More expensive for drinks, 1 bottle of Sol/Corona 55 pesos, but it is on the beach and good atmosphere.

Rocking - even at 6pm. We went for an early cocktail at the start of our holiday. This is one crazy place.The staff are there to make sure you have a great time. There was even someone making fresh guacamole on a cart which was moved around the restaurant for people who were eating.We ordered some chicken nachos as a snack and it was enough to feed a large family. We had great fun even in the short time we were there one evening,

LOVE this place!. My friend and I called in Senor Frog's after walking down to Playa Del Carmen from our hotel in Playacar... I'm so glad we did! We only meant to have a quiet drink but we ended up being dragged up from our seats and made to do silly dances with the staff. This then turned into a conga line with everyone in the bar being roped in and we all had free tequila poured down our throats at the end of it! I got dragged up to dance for a second time and ended up being taught how to salsa! I really didn't expect to be doing all of this at 2pm on a Tuesday afternoon! The staff are so much fun and genuinely want to make friends with their customers.The cocktails are to die for - so refreshing on a hot day. The only reason I'm not giving 5 out of 5 is because they were a little overpriced but if you don't stay long then it's really not a problem! I didn't try the food but the table next to me had fajitas and they smelled amazing!If you're in the area I really recommend you pay this place a visit!
...great place to start a beach bar crawl!.... ...great staff, lots of fun, and great photo opportunities...don't forget to stop at Senor Frogs in Playa del Carmen!...
nasty.... not very clean, place smells like stale beer. Im no fan of this place. Probably has the best location in Playa, right next to the ferry.

Amazing. You MUST visit.. This bar is so worth a visit! I was there for 2 hours at 1pm and had a fantastic time. The staff are great and i love the drinks choices. I had a fantastic 28oz cocktail for a great price.The music and atmosphere was great and really got you in the mood to party.Would seriously recommend when visiting 5th avenue

Big Time Overrated. There is so many nice places to go in Playa to have a good time. Unless you with a big big big group of people and want to party until you puke there better places to go. My teenage kids and i went there over Easter break

Alright on the night. We had free drinks here before going to Coco Bongo. It was quite empty and had a karaoke night on. Not the greatest atmosphere but it is right on the beach, which may be better earlier in the evening. There are entertaining messages on the ceiling and walls that make you laugh.The drinks were good and the bar staff friendly. Not sure if I would choose it again if I was a paying customer though.
High prices good service. Me and 2 friends had a great time great bartender but a little high price for us just go and have a couple of drinks and be careful you might spent too much on drinks.

Fun, but not what I expected!. I had a lot of fun at this restaurant for a variety of reasons, and the food that I ordered was good.However, the prices for quite high for that kind of establishment. I had an excellent dining experience elsewhere in Playa del Carmen for almost the same price that I paid here, if not less.In addition, the service needs improvement.

Expensive, tacky and in your face. Not my thing really, as the title suggests - we spent 900 peso on 7 drinks (about £45) by far the most expensive round of drinks of the whole holiday. Much better places for food, drinks and night time fun. Go if you must but don't stay long is my advice. Main attraction is the location super location pity they charge more here than in most places in the UK.

Fun to hang out. Lots of crazy action at Sr. Frogs - going strong for many years, located at the Ferry Pier which is where 5th Avenue ends going south. A little pricey, but fun to see and experience. They have a volleyball net (needs tightening) and a trampoline for the kids or adults who want to hurl (lol), outdoor and seating are patio tables and full loungers with umbrellas, indoor seating are swings to sit on at the bar as well as regular tables and chairs for the tipsy.

Not what I expected.. My boyfriend had been to Senor Frogs in a previous location a few years prior, and he had rave reviews. From the way he had described it, I had envisioned a quaint and eccentric little restaurant. Unfortunately, it's just a club. I am sure it would have been more enjoyable if I wasn't expecting a quirky taste of Mexico. My expectations were much too high! If you are looking to get drunk, though, it looked like a fun place to be! Grooooss bathrooms though. Yech...

Touristy. We visit Playa Del Carmen every single year. I have never before stopped into Senor Frogs as I've always thought it a touristy location. We decided to stop in for a cocktail while strolling the streets of Playa. I have to say I would not ever recommend this place to a seasoned tourist. It's completely cold and dirty feeling. The bathrooms were very dirty with tissues all over the floor. The bartenders are less than appreciative of your business and would rather joke with one another than pay attention to paying customers waiting for a drink. There are way more authentic Mexican eateries and bars that are more focused on service and appreciate your business. This place is not on the revisit list. Will never go again.

You have to go party here. Amazingly good fun.Not the prettiest of clubs, but the music, the crowd, the glow night, the water slide, its the best night we had.Go for a good time without feeling u need to wear a short little number to have a good time. Wear what you want, and have a great party.
Awesome time!. A group of us went to Señor Frogs for lunch. The staff was super friendly, the food was great and overall it was an awesome time!

Great Time with a Great View.. Everyone has a great time as the bartenders get everyone involved doing something. Great music, embarassing you or whatever. Great view of the ferry to Cozumel and all the people coming and going.

So Much Fun!!. My friends and I recently went to Playa Del Carmen, and I'd like to say that the staff at Senor Frogs made our trip! Everyone is so friendly, and the service was great. The trampoline on the beach is a great added touch. The wrist bands are a good idea if you are going to drink for a few hours, and get unlimited drinks. But I can't say enough how amazing the staff are! Great place!

Spring Break at its Finest. I’ve always wanted to visit Senor Frogs to have my picture taken with the Frog. Well in PDC….the store is several blocks from the bar (makes no sense at all). So after walking for what seemed forever. We found Senor Frogs. I was there on a Wednesday night and it was full on spring break. Took about 30 min to get a drink and I was so annoyed. So if you are older or like me and not wanting to deal with craziness, I highly suggest going during the day. I must day I received my Senor Frogs fix.

Great Views. My girlfriends and I sat at a table looking at the beach and enjoyed some Dos Equis. We shared an appetizer (the sombrero, I believe it is called). The food was okay... Average. Our server was great. Extremely polite and attentive. Would come back to enjoy the view of paradise and some beer again. FYI it is right next to the ferry to Cozumel dock.
Brew. Just stopped in for a brew everyone was having fun. Next to the Cozumel Ferry and good place to cool off.

Fun as usual. great staff, so much fun, great place to people watch and relax. Love the local on the beach and the staff like to tease and have fun. There is a section out on the beach as well with a trampoline if you dare after a few .

Horrible service..... We decided to sit at the bar my boyfriend and me. This place looked like a nice place to get a few drinks and spend a part of the night but we were chocked by the waiter's attitude, which was rude and impolite. I don't remember his name but he was wearing a black t-shirt that night. Definitely not worth the price and we won't go back!

NEEDS NEW PERSONAL THE BAR !! TERRIBLE SERVICE. Here I go last Friday nite me and my friendz went to señor frogs ! We hear that waz good place to go nooo true! I sit by the bar and we order beers ! The barman look at us like aliens some like that 2 service to slow when waz like nobody there 3 he just give me the beer and my ticket like go away !!! we waz waiting for like 20 persons group but with service like that we left 5 minutes later !!!!!! -10 (the dude have black shirt ) you really need hire some good personal señor frogs !!! Barbel tequila service 100 %

Location perfect and good start for the week. We arrived here by default on our first day! Best way to start our week : got introduced to lovely friendly Mexico with constant flow of Cervesas and a showy lesson in gaucomale. Had a lovely time. Mexico here we come. Yeah!!
Senor Frogs. Fun night. Great staff, great music, super location,big hangover! A bit pricey in my opinion but I don't do a lot of bar anymore.

Your first stop out of the hotel zone onto 5th Ave. This place is world famous. They are one of the first bars located right by the ferry dock. They have swings all around the bar and at night have live music sometimes. During the day it is a beach club and the view is spectacular. Drinks, tequilla, music and friends make this a good start when coming out of Playacar to walk down and explore 5th Ave.

Great view, bad service. First, I don't complain much at all about simple things, I understand and appreciate retail in all platforms. But we go there and wait to be seated by the host podium and no one comes to ask us if we would like a seat, they just kept walking by us? So after a couple minutes I looked at my wife and said OK, let's sit at the bar. Then the bartender did his job but there was a person I believe maybe a waiter? Wearing aunglasses inside amd that may have been a factor?! That waiter brushed up against me with a large box of some sorts carrying many bottles if beer that actually cut me! I didn't want to make a scene so I just kept on talking with my wife and let it go, but then when he again walked by and bumped into her, that was enough and I had to say something to the person, and I did and left. So we spent $30 instead of $100, and then went to the Tequila Barrel which truly gets and appreciates your business. Service is everything, this place has the perfect spot, no doubt but when you get to the point where the people that are your business aren't held as priority, they will disappear. There's 100 bars / places like this with just as wonderful views as this and I will go elsewhere. Food was good, beer was cold but service on 2 out 3 opportunities failed and that's horrible.

Great location poor service. I have been to this location more than once. Generally this staff is pretty good. They added gratuity onto the bill automatically when the service was poor. I was a bit disappointed but overall it is an okay place.
Staff was great. We went three times in a week because we had so much fun. If you sit at the bar you are more involved then the families eating at a table. The staff was awesome!
Great!!. The food was far better than the food at our hotel! Everyone was very friendly! Very fun atmosphere! Great music and dancing!

Bad service. I stopped here for some drinks and some food. I sat on the beach for some drinks to start and the staff seemed annoyed I wasn't going to eat. I had intended to eat but after they were really rude I didn't bother. They seemed to be annoyed when I wanted to pay at the bar and kept passing me to one another like nobody wanted my Money. I was pretty gutted as the food looked really good.

Fun to stop in for a little Craziness!. Stopped here while visiting Playa del Carmen. It is directly on beach with beach service and a fun trampoline if traveling with kids. You can always count on decent bar food and massive drinks at señor frogs. This one is no exception. Had the fish tacos which were fresh and yummy and an even better 30 ounce speciality margarita. Husband collects tshirts while traveling and this one was cheap at $19 bucks. Go enjoy the crazy atmosphere but don't expect 4 diamond dining etc and you'll have a great time.
Fun place to visit.. Good food and entertaining. Stopped for a Senor Frogs special drink in a special palm tree cup. Great place to visit!

Nowt special. We had walked from our hotel and saw senior frogs right where you catch the ferry over to Cozumel. We were extremely thirsty and ordered a beer and a lemonade. The price was £8 ! Very OTT prices and the service was not exceptional as it was day time it was fairly full, i would have expected better service.We would have left a tip but no one came to serve us when seated, so my husband went to the bar and a mardy faced girl served us without a smile.We didn't go again, i was very disappointed as i was looking forward to going since arriving in PDC. There are better bars and also a lot cheaper.

Terrible Service. Asked for separate bills, said no problem but then did not do it. Took for ever to get drinks, pop was flat. Took again ages for food order to be taken. Food came at all different times some of us were finished when others were just getting theirs. When we paid they bill they asked for more tip.

trapped by hawks. After being seated, there was a constant parade of people trying to get us to by their buy their wares...mysterious concoctions for shots (in open bottles), pictures, balloon hats, stickers, etc. This was all apart from the wait staff taking orders from the menus. We had some laughs, but felt pestered as time went on.

Great place to eat. Every time we go to Mexico we stop at a Senor Frogs restaurant. You will never be disappointed with the food and if you're with people that don't want Mexican food there's options. My friend had a burger that was the best he's had. We had the Mexican Platter and it was really good! The Caesar salad with chicken is huge!  Of course they are always good with the entertainment! always have your camera ready! Great view of the ocean while you eat and excellent service. Don't forget your 22 ounce margarita!

We had fun!. This is coming from a perspective of a very young couple.We went to dinner around 830 pm. I was surprised at how few people were here. There were a few families, and some other couples; but not to much going on. I had a pasta dish, and my boyfriend had a hamburger. The drinks were good. We felt very forced to buy a senor frogs souvenir picture, but after all, we were glad we did.It is a beautiful location, and we will be going back. Maybe at different times.

Had a blast at Senor Frogs!. The food was excellent and the wait staff and clown were very entertaining! We had such a great time. If you want a stronger drink...just ask! holy cow, did they deliver! haha

It is alright. We went in a group of ten, and it was fun going because the staff really tries to get you moving andarticating in their activites. Food was not bad neither, so however it was pricy and we everything was too hectic. Anyway if yorfer for instance a fun fast food restaurant which serves alcohol this is were to go!

pary. we went rhere three times thenext two times they knew what drank. it is fun place we usually went around noon. they have lively music sometimes all the staff gey on bar and dance. they have funny signs they put above your head
Great location to people watch, check out the cruise ships and beach. Food was ok, prices a little high but do get enough. Service was good. Neat decor. Right on the beach.
Fun for a laugh. You'll see servers do things here you'd never see anywhere else. It is apparent they are trying to get you to laugh and have a good time. Try a drink or two in a yard glass.
Night funn and drinks. Music, drink and fun...meeting friends from all over the place that doesn't cost to much compare to Coco Bongo....

Witnessed a tourist get injured. Came off the ferry with my family and witnessed a tourist crying on the step of the restaurant. Stood by, appears something fell on her from workers above. Poor gal! Bad safety.
Disappointed.. The food and drink are way over-priced. When we got our food, it was cool. Our waiter was prompt and courteous.

Horrible Service. I didn't mind that it was loud. I just wanted to stop in for a quick drink and snack before boarding the ship. But unless you are buying shots, don't expect to get very much service. They'll be by every few minutes to ask you if you want a shot, but don't expect a refill.

Disappointing, only interested in big groups!. After a long days shopping we went to Senor Frogs for our dinner. I had been really looking forward to going after reading the reviews but I was so disappointed. The staff seemed like it was a chore to be there. the girl who showed us to our seats gave us the drink menu and told us our waiter would bring the food menu, without so much as a smile. The waiter came about 10 minutes later, placed the menu on the opposite chair (they're huge wooden menus) and told us he'd be back soon for our order, while we placed our order he didnt even look at us, then brought our food without saying a word, just placed it on the table and left. I needed a knife and after trying to get someone's eye contact or attention for a while I decided to go and look for a waiter.It was just me and my partner and we did notice that the bigger tables of 4 and 6 people were getting lots more attention, getting balloon hats, silly signs to get their picture taken with etc but we got none of that. The portions were HUGE so although the prices are quite high compared to neighboring restaurants you do get your moneys worth, the nachos (starter) could easily feed 3 people and my burrito could easily feed 2. We got a portion of chicken wings as a side and they came with chips which it doesn't mention on the menu, I'd have had the chicken wings alone as a main course. Overall I was very disappointed after looking forward to it for so long.

What a Fun Place - Huge Servings!. We have managed to avoid Senor Frogs (maybe if they had a Senior Frogs we might be more attracted) on all of our trips, but after a rainy day of touring Tulum and with an hour to ply away before our ferry back to Cozumel, we were drawn into this fun restaurant by the laughter (not so crazy) and the music and the thought, quite frankly, of just sitting down and watching our ferry come in (I mean, have you seen those ferries load and leave? Don't blink and don't miss your ferry!). We ordered drinks all around and a plate of nachos to share since we weren't really even hungry. What great drinks! And what a platter of nachos! Nachos to knock your socks off! We were initially dismayed - how could we possibly eat that mountain of nachos? But, not to fear, the amazing eating team chewed and sighed their way through to victory. We saw lots of families bringing their kids in, who LOVED the activities, the music and the fun, not to mention balloon hats! There was a great beach with lots of seating and you could choose to be as close to the fun and action or as far away as you wished, even though it was packed. The service was great and friendly and we loved their tee shirts - quite a bargain at $25 since we expected $45. We want to go back!

Great place to stop after shopping in Playa!. If you are in Playa shopping - I would recommend going to Senor Frogs! What a fun, party atmosphere and the food is great! Our kids (12 and 14) enjoyed going there! It is a bit of a walk and a little hard to find if you don't know where it is, but it is definitely worth it!

fun in the sun!. Yea, well its a chain, a bit of a tourist trap, but we had fun! Drinks were huge little pricey. The photo was fun, The only thing I didn't care about is a waitress kept trying to squeeze my husband's boobs, and my Daughter and I were kinda puzzled. But I would go again, they sure have got it down on how to sell souvenirs we left with the senior frog photo frame and pictures and shot glass! Chips and salsa were great and drinks were good.
The Frog rocks. Good food and drinks right on the beach. Watch out for the party saver girl. She'll shake you head and rattle your brains. Oh and twist your nipples (guys).

Great location to enjoy after a day of shopping. We went at sunset just after the ferry left for Cozumel. Great view of the water at night fell and the lights came on. The service was excellent and the washrooms were clean. The staff entertained us on stage and created a party atmosphere.. but we paid for it . 4 drinks and a plate of appetizers were $38.US.
Fantastic!. Myself and my wife had a great night here! Lovely food, good atmosphere! All in all thoroughly enjoyable experience. We went back several times.

Party Hardy @ Senor Frogs Cozumel. Wow, what a happening place...Fabulous music and tom foolery. baloons, tatoos, dancing, and the biggest glasses I've ever seen. Waiters are fantastic. Special shout out for Jessi. You made the girls experience exceptional.

THE WORST NIGHT OF MY HOLIDAY, DON'T GO!!!. I have visited Señor Frogs in Cancun twice on my four visits to Mexico. This was my first visit to the one in Playa Del Carmen, and it will be my last. It's like the family black shep that's hidden away,and indeed it should be. This is a Disgrace to the Señor Frogs brand. We went around 8pm on a Saturday night in June, and we're told there was no entertainment. We got a table for four, 2 adults, 2 kids. When we were shown to our table, we waited ages to be served. I think this was to do with the waiters concentrating on a group of girls at the table next to us. When we did get served we ordered our meal. They then brought out the starter which was nice. We were sat at a tiny table which really should have been for two. Halfway through the starter they brought out four mains. There was no room for the plates. When the mains came the quality of all four was awful. All dishes were loaded with salt. We could have taken my sons pizza down to the beach and used it as a frisbee. When I complained to our waiter that he had brought out the mains before we had finished the starter, onto a tiny table, he could not understand my complaint. He was American so it was not anything to do with language. My family were very upset, as on previous visits to the Cancun Frogs we had a great night. In fairness to the manager Carlos, when I spoke with him he said he felt bad. We had hardly touched our meals. At first he offered to buy me a beer, but soon got the message that want good enough. He then waived the bill. We left bitterly dissatisfied with the whole experience. Please save your money and time and look elsewhere. As for Playa Del Carmen, for the British readers, it's like. Mexican Blackpool full of tacky souvenir shops. This coupled with he pushy shop owners trying to entice you in made it an uncomfortable experience. I was offered cocaine by a shop owner.

Overpriced & Obnoxious staff. We stopped in Senor Frogs for a cold drink and lunch sandwich.....what we got were bothersome staff wanting to nickel and dime you for extras that we could care less about.They tried to charge us for drinks that we didnt have and the people next to us were charged for food they didnt get. If you dine here check your ticket !!!!!The food was so-so but to be charged $16 for a coke is ridiculous to say the least.The whgole time we sat trying to chat and eat the staff kept coming buu trying to sell us crap or balloons or pictures.....i mean come on already when i get my food i want to eat not play games with your staff dressed as a circus clown selling balloons ! To loud and to small a place to enjoy yourself or relax....they treat you like an assembly line at a factory.STAY AWAY AND SAVE MONEY....eat at a local taco joint and have a better time !
Awful!. dirty toilets and tables, obnoxious staff and overpriced food and drinks. This place should be avoided like the plague
Mr Venezula in the beachstaff is a beauty sorry i missed you last night! Back to Sweden tomorow. ;). See you next time! Holy 50 characters must i fill this up whith!

Meh... My review title says it all. I was not impressed. Maybe because I was too spoiled by the fact that my resort that I ventured away from was all inclusive, and I did not have to pay $15 for a margarita. The waitress came by and somehow sold us 5 weak shots out of the bottle she was carrying around; I was only going to buy one but somehow she "convinced" us to buy 5, haha. Then a clown guy came by and made us balloon hats; then asked for a tip. I get it - that's how they make their money. I just really wasn't into it. If you want to have a drink on 5th avenue, go to one of those classier looking places. They didn't seem to be cramming drinks down people's throats to get tips.

I don't see what the hype is. I really don't. Its like a caribean dave and busters. Some obnoxious stuffed frog hounds you with pictures and a creepy clown makes balloon hats. We asked for a menu 3 times till we finally got it. I think its more of a tourist trap than anything. the only good thing was the view.

Very "American". We had never been to a Senor Frogs before, and found it very gimmicky and "American". Like a Hooters, but without the women. The drinks were flowing, and the food was very good, and all-in-all had a great time!
Fun Place. Very high energy and fun place. We have gone many times. We go around 6:30 PM with family. People dance all over the bar and the stage. Crazy! Fun!

Had item STOLEN by staff member!. My friend and I went the the SF in Playa Del Carmen and aside from the high prices of drinks it had an ok vibe. We liked sitting at the bar on the swing chairs and chatting with the workers. The workers asked us to go to another bar and we followed along, they seemed friendly enough. One of them kept telling my friend that he'd carry her hammock type chair that she just bought earlier that day for $45CDN. When it came time for us to go, we left the bar and within just a 2-3 minutes realized she forgot her chair and went back inside to get it. The bartender said the guys "took it" and were gone already, but that they are in all the time and to come back tomorrow to get it. This went on for 4 days. It was always a different "friend" who had the chair and we should "come back tomorrow". Day after day after day, always a different story, always someone else. Pretty pathetic that they feel the need to STEAL tourists possessions and play silly games in an attempt for us to come back everyday and spend more money on drinks at the bar waiting for the return of the chair? Deplorable. One thing to note, there is a bar/pub just down the street from SF is called Carlos & Charlies and is owned by SF, all the same guys work at both places and they are straight up thieves and liars who cover for each other. Steer clear.

“Definitely number 1 on my list of things not to do in Mexico!” (ditto). Wonderful location, right by the ferry pier with views out over the sea...but...piles of food with little flavor...constant interruption by Frog staff trying to push tequila down your throat or put sombreros on your head to pose you in a picture with a large stuffed frog...loud poundy music....Right after we agreed we'd never go back, even if they PAID us, we got a call from the TimeShare Survey group saying we'd won money to spend at Senor Frogs. Needless to say, we passed it up -- any property using Senor Frogs to identify buyers is not for us!

Time share scam !. I'm in Playa right now and I wanted to pass this along if some one comes up to you in Senor Frogs and asks you to do a survey DON'T DO IT they say you win 4 nights 5 days at a luxurious hotel WELL thats 6 hrs of my life I'll never get back I got a call in my hotel room and they said I had won I thought it was great but not so much they said they would pick me up at my resort and take me to pick up the prize well I ended up getting sent to Cancun and wasted part of my last day of vacay. and we didn't even get all the stuff. they promised. So just beware.

meh. you know, I didn't want to go here, but we met friends there that happened to be there at the same time as us. The foor was good, but expensive. There was alot of "fun" going on with the staff, and they were constantly joking around with customers....too much as it was difficult to get service or even our bill.Senor Frogs is great fun, but I didn't go to Mexico to go to a place that was a "chain". I wanted authenticity, and I didn't get that here. I'd go back, if friends insisted.....but if I were deciding, I'd rather go to a quieter, more traditional Mexican place on 5th ave

Senior Frogs - Cozumel. I stopped here while on a cruise and I'm glad I did! There was a small group of us and we wanted to grab something to eat and have a little fun while in Mexico. What we didn't know is that we'd have A LOT of fun. From the food, decent prices and free shots, we did not want to leave. I don't like that fact that you have to go through their gift shop in order to leave (in an attempt to entice you to spend more money), but who cares?! The waiters and DJ were super friendly and made sure we had everything we needed and then some.Con - the menu lists pesos instead of U.S. dollars so you have to be careful and make sure they don't try to trick you with the conversion when they bring your bill, other than that though, it's a cool place to hang out.

A ribbity good time!. I ate here over Easter break. Yes, the menu was Americanized, but for someone afraid of eating at the local places and getting sick, that was what I wanted. And the tacos my friend had looked just as mexican as at our resort. The food was great for a chain restuarant (obviously this is not fine dining...that's not what we were looking for anyway!), the drink were good. I especially like the bbq shrimp and blue hawaiians. Yes, it was not as cheap as local places too, but I did not find it expensive. I paid the same for my meal and drinks that it would cost if i had the same meal and drinks at home. I think people just expect to get things cheaper because its Mexico.The best part was the fun atmosphere and the amazing location. It was right on the beach, we had a wonderful seat on the patio looking at the ocean. Great view and breeze. Everyone was having fun. There was a guy making balloon hats, girls passing out shots, the waiters did a dance routine on stage. There was music and laughs. Even the decor was funny. I had a great time and I would go again to that one or one in another location.
Hernando and staff rocks. Great time. Was here on my own one night and they made sure I felt comfortable. Can get very busy. Hernado rocks.

What a joke...bad food, terrible service, over priced...need I go on?!. The Senor Frogs in Acapulco made me want to check this one in Playa out...the one there was pretty descent, cool atmosphere at least. This place was just a joke. We had a great meal the night before, lobster and kabobs and our total price between the four of us was only $10 more at the lobster place. The drink are ridiculously priced here and the dang "shot lady" that forces shots down your throat and charges $5 a piece was the icing on the cake. We felt bad leaving a terrible tip, but the service was terrible.
