We had three different waiters come to our table, all at different times because we asked to order, then asked for drinks, then asked for our bill....that was the only time they came to our table. Oh, and the food....wow...brutal is giving it too much credit. DO NOT GO HERE!! You want a cool atmosphere with better food and better prices check out La Parilla (or something like that)

Definitely number 1 on my list of things not to do in Mexico!. This place is a serious joke. It's pure hustling! Seriously, make your own mexican food at home or go support your local Mexican restaurant instead of waisting your money in that corporate money sucker! I highly recommend that you try out some other small local place instead while in Mexico. You'll get some more authentic food and a less drunken Disney-like athmosphere (and price!)!  We went at Senor Frogs in Playa del Carmen on a Sunday afternoon, the place was half empty. There's about 20 people working the floor(clowns, photographers, etc...). You get the feeling your at a McDonald's party for adults that never got one while they were kids. Anyways, we tried 3 different meals (Burritos, enchiladas, and some kind of mixed salad), plus some appetizers(nachos with the most plain salsa I've ever had, and a fish ''ceviche'' with some fish that was already cooked; it was still warm when they served it!!). Another bad thing about SF, if you order something to drink, make sure it's not a soda. A Coca-cola tastes worst than the bubble-less and cheap pop syrup you get at McDonald's and it cost about 50 pesos. The staff is continually harassing every client around the place to make them buy more booze, or some souvenir photo in a SF dollar store frame they wanna sell you 15 bucks! Finally, if ever you decide to go anyways, and that what I wrote turns out to be true for you too, I've got a little tip; when the waiter asks you if everything was good, just be honest and say no and old 'em what we thought about there food. Our bill for 3 people came up to almost 800 pesos without tips (and we didn't even get a beer!), I paid the full amount, and the waiter came back to me with a new bill where he subtracted 2 meals from it(-300 pesos). Sometimes it's worth it to complain! Definitely number 1 on my list of things not to do in Mexico!

A must go to.. but watch your wallet.. I agree with some of the other posts about Senior Frogs! We have been to a number of Senior Frogs, Puerta Vallarta, Cozumel and Playa. When the cruise ships comes in it gets packed and it is super super fun! But the prices are super super high! We were paying $10 Canadian dollars for a Marg!I would recommend coming to Senior frogs to experience the fun for a drink or two because it is a fun place to be. But your also in Mexico and shouldn't drinks be cheaper? I mean, i don't even pay $10 for a mixed drink anywhere here in Canada! geesh! and I feel the same way about Charlies, up the road as well.We found that the Tequila barrel was a great great place to be in Playa.. It was packed with tourists and they had great deals on buckets of Corona and two for one margs! The crowd was fantastic and you were right on the main strip! It is more wallet friendly and a good time to be had for sure where a buck goes much further!

Ask the prices first!!!. I felt the need to write a review on this tourist trap! We headed down to playa on a Sunday evening for some shopping and drinks. We passed up lots of cute patio seating authentic mexican restaurants and headed down to Senior frogs. Big mistake. Yes we danced and the staff were completely trained to have fun and rack up your bill. Our party of 4 ordered 4 beers and I asked for a goblet for my beer and they brought out these senior frogs big glasses. I would estimate it was equal to 1.5 beers. One in our party ordered another smaller beer later. Then we were in the spirit and thought that maybe a tequila shot would be fun. Luckily my husband asked how much they were and the guy said 9.00. We settled on one that was 5.00. Long story short... 5 beers and 4 shots later our bills was 95.00usd not including tip!!!We all agreed this is how spring breakers get into trouble and we fell pray to there marketing scheme.

A lot of Fun!!. We stayed at the Gran Porto Real from April 10 to 24, 2008 and the entertainment team from the Resort brings us to this Club 2-3 times a week. We went every single time with them and had such a great time! The best night was for their 69 anniversary!!! We plan to go back in few months and hope to have a lot of fun again!!Thanks guys for everything!!!

Rubbish - why go here?. This place was rubbish. I mean, you're in Playa Del Carmen, a beautiful place on the Caribbean coast of Mexico, surrounded by lots of nice, cheap restaurants selling Mexican food.So why bother going to a place that tries far too hard to get that US "Spring Break" feeling, where the food is mostly American, isn't great, and costs three times as much as anywhere else?Try somewhere local instead.

Pompous little rip off. Okay, there is a girl with a bottle filled with some form of shooter, once she dumps it down your throat, shakes your head and massagers your breast, all the while blowing a Fox whistle in everyoneºs ear, you will find there is a $14 charge on your bill. Way Way over priced for the fun. Food was terrible and the noise and pompous staff were gross. I would only enjoy Sr Frogs if I was 19 and drunk going in. What a dump.......what a dive......what a rip off"!

July 5th- I want 2 go back. Being that I am a home body"" the family got me out of the houseand we had the most fun here .. The food was so good!!I think if you visit Mexico , Its a must see.. We will miss our Luiz""

Senior Frogs is OPEN!!!. I was there on Friday April seventh. They are still working on the building with reconstruction. They opened early that night. But they actually are suppose to open today. I recommend you go there and check it out. It is right on the ocean near the ferry to Cozumel.

Fun for the whole family. Our family visited Playa del Carmen July 11-18th and had the chance to go eat dinner at Senior Frogs. It was so much fun for all of us. They have a great entertainment staff that did a great job keeping my 4 & 7 year olds entertained. They even had a balloon artist who made them a power ranger and ninja turtle. I'd highly recommend. The food was good too. We've been to Senior Frogs in Cancun late at night to party when we didn't have the kids with us and it was a blast but I wasn't sure what it was like before the late night.

Love this place. For me there is no better place then La Vaquita to have a wonderfull night out. Service superb! Music superb ! Just great all over, I might have spend a little too much of my nights there this year
Great Club!!. The drinks are inexpensive and tasty plus the music is super fun to dance to. Always have a great time at this club. Nando made our time here even better, his service rocks!!
Best club! Great service. Had an awesome night out with my friends, im a local for 8 years now. Attended by the best waiter Jorge! Very attentive and on it!
Bar hopping . The little cow is a 2 story open bar scene with great music and some cool shows. The music is good but dancing is almost impossible as this place gets packed.

Excellent service. It was a wonderful experience, Roman did an amazing job. Service was on point. Definitely going back. The only reason they got a four star was due to the heat. Was really hot....but enough drinks and it's soon forgotten.
Vacations. Roman was the we had. Vaquita had all the music we could have and dance. Let me mention about him. He was polite, kind selfjoking..:. We can never complain with this guys

Fun, good music, but hot. Party doesn't start here until late. At around 11:30 PM it was still empty, but quickly filled to capacity within the hour. It is an open concert club so no A/C, they have fans running but it gets VERY hot in here. No need to dress up, casual attire will do, and dress light. Music was good, lots of reggaeton which I enjoy. Electronic music began later in the night around 2am. Drinks - watch your bar tab. There were a few inconsistencies. First round of drinks (2 large vodka/cranberry) came to 400 pesos, second round of the same drinks was 160 pesos.Overall a fun time.

Same music. They just play one kind of music reguetton all time! The people who go to this place is not the most polite. They have a twerking contest and the winner have 100 bucks. Nothing extraordinary in this place

Great Dance Club. Had an awesome night dancing here. They have a great mix of latin, reggaeton and popular music perfect for dancing the whole night away. The hours fly by as you are dancing. There was no entry fee the night I was there but the drinks are pretty high-priced. A beer will run you $80 pesos and a mixed vodka drink was $195 pesos. But what makes this place really shine is the music and fun atmosphere. Definitely recommended.
Loved this place . I loved this place, it's music, the environment and everything! Plus our server Diana she was amazing and kept on checking if we were doing ok, I really enjoyed my time there

AMAZING!!. My friend and I were in Playa during the months of June and July for a total of 2 weeks. We went to La Vaquita just about every night we were there. The atmosphere and music there is simply amazing! We loved it!! Our server DANIEL did an awesome job! He was very attentive and always on point making sure we had everything we needed! The club itself and the service received is definitely 5 stars. I would recommend La Vaquita to anyone wanting to have a fun night!!! We will definitely be back!!!!!!!!!

The BEST club in the world. The vaquita has a combination of latin music and electronic music and it is just waay too fun. I loved it. Never got boring, has great activitied. Definitely loved the Wet Tshirts tuesday. If you are in Playa, you can't miss it.

It used to be a better place. It was one of my favorite places to hang out, however the music is not as dated as it used to be. Reggaeton is ok but two hours of it? Sometimes they charge you what they want for the drinks, in example, if you ask to a waiter for one beer and then to anohter, they will provide different prices.It used to be amazing!

Great for dancing. Came here twice with my wife. Dancing was great and the waiters always made sure we had drinks and a table. I only give it 4 stars because there was a couple times when I had to make sure I got change back when using US dollars and I even had to chase down a waiter who never brought me drinks I had already paid for. Could be that they were just busy but, felt I had to keep on my toes when ever buying drinks.

Best night out. We paid for the open bar service here on a Tuesday night and went in a large mixed group. We had a great night, the music was perfect for us and the waiter kept the drinks flowing all night. We went around midnight and stayed until 4.30am. For the price we couldn't go wrong it worked out about £26 for everything which couldn't pay our taxi fare back home. Great atmosphere and definitely worth a visit.

Good and bad.... Not sure if it was a promotion or if it is standard practice. I was with a group of 7 people, 4 girls, 3 guys. All of us girls had free entry and free drinks, the guys on the other hand had to pay to get in and had to pay for all their drinks. I didn't realise this until I went to the bar to order 2 drinks and when I handed the second one to my male friend I was told off and had to give it back. The guys had different coloured cups to the girls to make sure you could see if they had paid.As a female I had a fantastic night! Enjoyed my free drinks/entry, good music and had fun dancing. The guys on the other hand maybe didn't enjoy it as much!
great. great srvice for server sosa music girls and evriting great magnifico lugar muy recomendable para la fiesta
Alcoholics in da house . Great service! Mario was amazing . Thanks so much for being so attentive and making sure we are being taken care of. Best bus boy, and server. ☺☺
Best club in Playa! . Every night I went to Las Vaquitas it was super live and always a good time. They played the best music & Mario was the best waiter!
Amazing time! . Jose' Colorado was fabulous and took wonderful care of us!! Looking forward to coming back in the very near future. Great music, drinks, and awesome service.
vaquita playa. awesome I love aurora's service, good place to go! nice music, party place, buen ambiente, lugar para bailar

Love it!. I went to La Vaquita in Cancun and had a great time so thought I'd give the one in Playa del Carmen a crack! It did not disappoint. Our waiter Daniel was great! Really accommodating and attentive!
If you want to have a good time in playa come to la Vaquita
Very nice discotheek. should go there and drink a cool beer or something. 👌 very nice bar tenders en they are really fast. you don't have to get your own drinks. They wil bring it to you!!
Amazing . This place is the hottest place. Diana is amazing we had such an amazing time ! The music is great. The people are great ! Everything is great

La vaquita. I found it astonishing that I couldn't get into the club without leaving a 5* review, which I have now changed. The staff come and check to see your review, which they see as invalid unless it is in Spanish. I would not recommend to anyone looking for a good night out in Playa

Great atmosphere. We were recommended 12th street while eating at a restaurant. We walked past coco bongo and mandala and entered this place. It was amazing. The music is great, plentiful seating and very attentive staff. The drinks are great and reasonably priced, definitely not watered down like other places. My girlfriend and I loved it and I'd recommend it to anyone who want to chill out and have a great time. Also, great area to dance a bit.

Just chillin! . Mario is hands down the best server! Came from LA with my girlfriend and was looking for a cool place to have a couple drinks. Awesome atmosphere and service! Thanks for everything Mario! :)

#CrazyPartyPlayaLovers. We are 3 girls who goes here almost every night, and we LOVE it. The guys always takes care of us whatever what, especially Alberto the capitan, and Mario, he is the best waiter ❤️ - Gracias de Noruega

Just drinks. Came from Los Angeles just to party here. Great staff and great drinks! The music is up to date and nothing else beats it on the street. When you visit ask for Mario. He will take care of all your needs when it comes to partying in Playa. Enjoy!

Absolutely Amazing!!. We've been coming here for quite a few years and can't get enough of this place! Highly recommended! Make sure you ask for Mario.. He is the absolute best! Thank you for always taking such good care of us! - Much love from a bunch of Canadians

Great time. My friends and I visited this place. So fun and great music. Loved the cow mascot dancing all night and the cow suspended from the ceiling lol. Def will visit this place when we go back to Playa Del Carmen.
Big drinks big fun!. Went to Vaquita and my waiter Mario spoke perfect English and always got me a drink asap! Nice job Mario and Vaquita! Visit them both and tell Mario I say hi!!!

AMAZING PLACE TO PARTY. I went twice to this place, recommanded by some staff at the hotel me and my friends were staying. We had a lot of fun! The party is nice but it might get crowdy. We paid for the open bar so we were on the second floor and it was not so bad. The service is awesome. There is a contest for guys and girls... A must! :)
Para mi compleaños/for my birthday . I went there for my birthday, with my boyfriend and some Mexican friends and it was great, really good music, a private section and a bottle of rum...

Let's have a great time!!. The first bar we went into and my friends and I fell in love! The cow themed was awesome! We got VIP seating right away and ladies got free drinks on the first! Music was awesome! Drinks were cheap! The first night there was a long table which of course we danced on! Came back again on our last night and the music was even better! They even had a cow mascot dancing! haha i'll be back La Vaquita!

Some of these reviews are silly.. Everytime we go down la vaquita is our base of operation , cheap drinks and even if they are watered down its because there is ONLY 2 or 3 shots in a whole liter cup. Math folks, math.I think the one guy is vip manager he always takes care of us makes sure we get to a table and make sure to set us up with a waiter, so if you wanna skip past the reviews of whiney americans on here who are too entitled to just have a good time maybe try him out "Mario" najera I think is the last name, he gave us a trip advisor card but just ask for Mario and ignore this silliness.

Fun night . Came her with local friends wasn't sure what to expect but the staff was friendly and helpful not overly pushy to buy drinks like the club across thr street this club lets you enjoy your time and drinks without smothering you i recommend this club

Great cheesy 90's pop bar.. Loved our time at La Vaquita. A cow themed bar that plays cheesy 90's pop music, exactly what everyone loves after a few drinks. Lots of sing alongs, huge drinks and fire shots. Was a great night.

DANCING ON BARS . My 1st night in playa set the bar very high for any trip to come thanks to, La Vaquita. I honestly don't even remember walking in; I simply have a vivid memory, of me pushing my friend up onto the bar. Had such a blast we weren't mad at all when we ended up there again. Sunday night, thanks to Arthur (a very nice gentleman) we (my friend, Arthur, & myself) had a very memorable evening w some of the best mojitos I've ever had! The drinks are huge by the way, so be careful haha

Capitan Alberto makes sure you have fun!!!. I visited Playa Del Carmen in January 2015 & June 2015!! I always head over to La Vaquita to party as the service is the best especially Alberto!!! He makes sure you are taken care of especially when you order bottle service, ask for him!! I have been to many clubs in PDC and Cancun, but I keep coming back to La Vaquita because of his great personality & service!! Never disappointed!!

Went here for New Year's Eve w/ family and had a great time!. Calle 12 was PACKED with shoulder to shoulder people on New Year's eve but we luckily popped into La Vaquita right before the whole place filled up!! We purchased a bottle so that we can get table service and the staff was incredibly great! We were there in the club with 7 people including my mom. They were nice enough to get her a chair to sit at the table and they took great care of us! The place was packed however they didn't pack it to the point where you couldn't move. It was comfortable to drink, dance, and have a good time. The most amazing thing was how ON POINT the staff was! There was never a dirty/wet napkin, water spot, or empty drink on the table and the second our drinks were low they were over to ask if we wanted more. The bathrooms.. OMG THE BATHROOMS! This might sound weird but the bathrooms were crazy clean! I've never been in a club filled to capacity with bathrooms like these. The bathrooms were air conditioned (the rest of the club was not because it's an open air club), they had an active attendant keep everyone in order, little bathroom amenities, etc. Super clean, comfortable bathrooms! We were there during the New Years count down which was really fun and exciting to experience. The club put the clock up on the big screen and did a count down and then played music. The DJ was great, good music, probably the SMOOTHEST New Years night I've ever had out at a club. ZERO incidents, no idiots trying to be tough guys, just a bunch of people happy to be in a place together celebrating the new year. Also, the cow on the ceiling is weird as hell.. i like weird.

Terrible Service. I been there first weekend on December, we were a 9 pax group, we were celebrating a friend birthday and we ask for a promotion for it or a simple discount for the number of people, some of the waiters and security people give us a "promotion" paying some extra money an we will get a 2 bottles of vodka and a table reserved, to be honest that was a really good deal (something like a $160 usd) and yes we had a table and the bottles but only 5 mixers ??????... we ask for 3 more and after 20 minutes we received a charged for $150 mxn ($12 usd) so it's really tricky the deal, I don't like this kind of frauds, after that.... the waiter never go back so is really insulting in my perception

Fun place with good music. I went here with my girlfriend. We were looking to go out on 5th street around 10pm and they didn't have a cover so we went in. Within an hour it got packed and it was pretty fun. The drinks are expensive, I paid $40 USD for 3 of their big cups of beer which is a lot, but I bartered with the waiter and ended up getting two more cocktails which evened out.

Cheating bartenders. We visited the place last night. The fun was good, but the bartenders were trying to scam us all the time. They always said higher prices than the ones on the bill (we had to ask for the bill). Also they brought us draft beer full of ice!!! We asked them to get us normal beer, they took out the ice and added some beer and brought us the same glasses.

FUN Place!. I visit Playa del Carmen often and always have to make a stop at La Vaquita. Inexpensive drinks compared to other clubs, nice bottle service, open-air environment, great music, lively crowd and fun, attentive waitstaff. Twerk contest on Sundays is extra entertaining!!
Crazy cool club. Went there with friends for a fun night and I had a great time. The drinks are not to expensive compare to others night clubs around. It was crowded, music is allright, great times.

Fun. This is a little place but honestly i think is one of the best places on the 12th av in playa del carmen and is so cheap.... U can get open bar for like 25 usd or a liter for 5 bucks.... The music is so good and the place is packed!!! If u are in playa u must go!!!

Fun Spot. Found this place by accident the other night. We had just left another nightclub up the street and were invited by the staff. Of course, we bought half of their tequila supply! The DJ was great and the vibe was super fun. Lots of pretty people. We had a table by the street so we got double the view - I highly recommend going by and having a good time if you are in PDC.

Cracking stop on a bar crawl. We booked a bar crawl with our rep (First Choice) and this was the second stop on the crawl. Music choice was great for us fortysomething oldies and drinks always flowing. Most of the bar was reserved for us so can't speak for what it's like on other nights, but it was our favourite stop of the tour other than the end (Coco Bongos).

Abusive staff, Scam artists, Fake alcohol. I am a veteran of PDC and visit this town a few times a year. If there is one place i can tell you to stay the most away from, it would be here. We came here as a group and asked for a table and a menue for their bottles. The waiter refused to give us a menue and kept on saying the bottlea start from $250. We managed to get a menue and to no surprise bottles were much cheaper listed on the menue, another sad reminder that we were in mexico. We selected a bottle pf don Julio which was one of the more expensive onea and it was listed at $200, although the waiter still wanted $250... So we order and a few minutes a bottle of Standard tequila shows up... I asked the waiter for an explanation, he tries to convince me that its a better tequila to my amazement... Again a sad reminser that we are i mexico and some people see you as walking $ bills... So back and forth with no success we decide to just drink the cheap tequila and call it a night... But our misery did not end there... The bottle turned out to be fake... And we were asked to pay $270 for it or "else have risk our security" needlwaa to say we paid and got out... I will never go back here and will tell our story so others can see. We hace the right to support businesses that take care of their clients and reject ones that scam their customers... regardless of where in the world they are.

Your Typical Club. La Vaquita is on the smaller side in terms of nightclubs and it was very, very crowded, but this is expected on a Saturday night. My friends and I didn't have to pay a cover (this might have something to do with us being females though) after 11PM. There are two floors, the top floor is a balcony overlooking the dancefloor below. The DJ was spinning Top 40 dance music as well as Latin music. The crowd seemed to consist of twentysomethings, the vibe was great, and everyone was having a good time. Nothing too spectacular, but no complaints. Have a few drinks and you'll have fun here.

STAY AWAY. TERRIBLE service and staff. Long lines for any service and AWFUL abusive staff members. In the midst of celebrating with our friends a flaming tequila tower of glasses exploded. I had a big cut from the shooting glass on my foot which required stitches the next day. The bouncers and staff not only offered no apology, but physically restrained my wife and I when we tried to leave - extremely inappropriate and pretty much ruined the night. Go somewhere else, this place is shady.
Expencive, doesn't offer much. We had fun night in Vaquita, but honestly club doesn't offer much and entrance and drinks are expencive.
Fun and games :)). We spent a great night at vaquita!Went there with some friends and had a great time.Service was ok, not amazing, but nothing bad to say about it.

Fun place. This is a place to get loose and have fun, the music is not the best but it seems to pull a lot of clientele. They serve litters of alcohol with makes them a little different than other clubs down the street. Is not very upscale but is a good place to let loose and have some fun.

Last one standing. La Vaquita is a known brand her an is part of a bar chain (franchise?) and has also other brands connected to it.Going to Playa this is THE place to end your night out at. Depending on the weekday, crowd and time of season it will close between 5 and 7.30 AM.The music is a mix between latino pop hits and and international mainstram club music.The prices are high for Mexico, and even Playa, but if they recognise you this will pay you back in service (and probably free you from the entrance fee).They have girls nights (free drinks for women) some weekdays which gives a steady flow of people, no matter what day you might go out. You have not hit the 12th street in Playa without visiting La vaquita.

Expencive, cheap fun. Bad choice of mainstream music, getting drunk seems to be rather the goal than the side effect of a cool night. I was not able to, so I was very careful about where I put my bag and who was around it but they made it still to steal a quite cheap scarf I was wearing as I left it for 5 minutes in the table area I was sharing with a few colleagues...
Horrible experience. Me and the guy i was dating got kicked off of this club just because we kissed, I don't recommend it at all, of course if they smell money you are the king, don't go there
super cool. i loved this place i think we partied here every night, good music, good vibe, good drinks at decent price
Beach Vibes. Only went in the daytime - a little oasis on the beach with amazing Pina Coladas. Nice relaxed vibe with chilled Balearic tunes and a plunge pool and a view to due for. Worth a visit 👌🏼

I. My friend and I went there in a Sunday night. There was that foam night party. The dj playing was horrible. People were not dancing then they started with the foam part..It was quite fun if you don't mind be wet after that experience. The floor got slippery and all wet and besides it started raining but the place is cool and the drinks are not expensive.

Best Night out. Our Riu fun guys Oswaldo and Mario took us there on a Sunday night, it was Foam Party night. It was a night to remember dancing in the foam was a little wet and slippery but that was the best part at one point i found myself in the back of the club and i found myself a beautiful view of the beach with the waves crashing.
Cheap and ok. The place wasnt the best, the girls enter free with a very bad open bar, and the guys pay 450 pesos and have an ok open bar. Not alot of people inside, but ok music and places yo sit..

Pooped on by the Parrot. Swindled at the door by official ticket sellers - "the girls can get free entry & have open bar if the guy pays $45usd". We accepted (3 girls, one boy). The open bar for girls was absolutely undrinkable so we were told we can upgrade to the 'nicer open bar' for $20usd. When we agreed to the upgrade the official ticket seller then wanted $20usd each for us girls. We offered him what we had in cash at the time ($50usd). He took it. This put a bad taste in our mouth for the rest of the night. We were then chased down the street when we decided not to tip. The one positive: the foam was fun.
Cool plave. Cool place right on the beach. We sat on the cushioned chair/beds on the beach - had some drinks & enjoyed the view

Table service flop. The place is huge and outdoors. There is a lot going on and the fire show is one to be watched. This place got crowded around 1230 am and continued till closing. The table service vodka was Smirnoff (so/so) but extras were add ons. So know before hand what your purchasing.

Good food, good service and swimming pool . Excellent choice for a beach club in Playa del Carmen. Fun music, good facilities, friendly service and yummy food. I had the spinach quesadillas (65mxn) and they were pretty tasty. Our young kids had fun playing in the pool with us. We spent a good few hours. Enjoyed he happy hour from 1-3pm.

It is a NO. If you find the cover is expensive, wait to order a shot of vodka. We paid for 2 shots the price of 1L bottle of vodka (Smirnoff,on the top of that). Barmans are nice but service is just ok. They were a lot of people behind the bar but talking between them about the hot girls and we had to wait. Foam party!...it was a silly night to forget. No beach acces, no pool acces, it is the most expensive ordinary place i've ever been.

Not a bad place to have a couple expensive drinks. Another thumping club, generally busy, expensive drinks. The layout of the place is cool, would be nice without getting hassled to buy coke every time you went to the toilet. Otherwise decent place although I prefer a couple others on 12 to the Blue Parrot.

The best . We went to this club and wasn't let down it is amazing the staff are frendly .It has two lots of music one just music the other all the latest and some old stuff .It isn't expensive. It has a small swimming pool and is open air right on the beach .We didn't leave untill the end what a fantastic time .shame I can't say the same about coco bongos that place is a death trap .so just walk past coco and the blue parrot is down the end

Blue Parrot - Playa Del Carmen. Love the location although night life can get loud so if you go to bed early you may want to bring your headset. So much to do nearby, Cozumel acrosss the water, Tulum, Coba. If you havent been GO!

Blasting sound system! . We went to Blue Parrot as it was one of the main venues for BPM festival. It is a huge venue with an amazing sound system. If you love a good rave, this is the place in Playa del Carmen!

Night Club. Went to check out the night club. Bar tender and staff were great, but DJ was HORRIBLE. Didn't play many popular club/dance songs. We left after about an hour of boring music and almost falling asleep. only a handful of people bothered to dance at this club. The two clubs right across the street were "off the chain", DJ's were playing popular hip hop/pop club music. Blue Parrot night club would be a nice spot with a better DJ. P

Would give'em less but I can't. Security guards threw me out without asking or any kind of communication. I still don't know why they kicked me out... I got no refund or any explanation since I was inside for just a few minutes; maybe they confused me with someone else. BE VERY CAREFUL AR THIS PLACE.

Beach club and night open club beach front. This place is legendary in Playa del Carmen. During the day is a beach club with food, sunbeds and pool with ocean to swim and beach. Price is average, good music. During day is not crowded as other places. At night seen full of people start mid night, is fun and dance floor is huge, mixed crowd international and locals. The sound and lighting was great and also the foam party. I really liked they are beach front, few places in the world you can dance and go and contemplate the ocean. Price per drinks depend since there are options just for open bar, normal cover and personal drinks and other promotions. Price of bottles are not expensive as other clubs in the area and not small like others small clubs people are packed. Always they have available tables for groups.

Nice place . Have been here before, not a bad place. Last year that I came I was at a DJ event so it was full, last night it wasn't that full, everybody starts coming in at around 1 am, so don't be scared if you're there before 1 and you're alone. The drinks are cool and the best part, we ended having the open bar until 5 am. I recommend this place for going with friends.

Disappointing. This bar sounded great when we talked to some locals and read reviews. We had a party of 6 (3 parents & 3 girls 18-21) who wanted to have a "spring break" like experience for our kids. The description sounded great.When we arrived they tried to hook us into some deal where the two men pay $40 each and all of us would get free drinks. The catch is we could only order house Vodka, Rum, Tequila, or Whisky. No beer, not even draft beer. We started to walk away and they said we could just come in for free and pay regular price for drinks. When we go inside the fixed us a table right in the front center, I think because we had 4 ladies. The place was DEAD!! We just sat there for about 45 minutes. There was no dance floor that we could see. We finally left to visit the other bars, thankful we did not pay the $80 cover. The waiter told us the place really gets going around midnight, which was 45 minutes away, but we left anyway. I did return at 1:15 as the rest of our group was having a great time at another bar, just to see if the scene had improved. It was still dead compared to most of the other places you see on the strip.

We were hungry . how many times can u eat next to the beach? ...that is how they get the 4 stars. Not the fastest place but portions were huge. Imho margaritas were not "memorables". Tip little bit confusing, equivalent to 18%, depending of the dollar exchange. Anyhow, we ate tons, octopus and ceviche are amazing. Try it, at least the ceviche.
Ok. Arrived at PDC and we were starving and ended up here. Staff was extremely attentive and great. French fries are great. Other food just okay.

Just ok. Place has potential but the service was pretty slow (and when I tipped 20% he was so rude, expecting more). Dirty ocean water out front. Aging infrastructure and dirty pool that needs a facelift.

Just as great the second time around!. I travel to Playa a lot and although I don't make it to blue parrot every time, when I do, I know it will be a good time. I went to their foam party and it was a blast! It is actually the best of both worlds because they limit the foam to the dance floor, so if you don't feel like getting into it, you don't have to. I really enjoy the open air concept of Blue Parrot as well and definitely be back on future trips!

cool beach club. My husband and I went here on a Thursday night with some other couples from our resort. The music and lights were great and the waiters always made sure our bottles were full. we definitely had a great time. The only thing I would have hoped for was it to be a little busier so we could meet more people to hang out with. But overall it was a good time.

Hit or Miss. recently visited Blue Parrot while some friends and I were in Playa Del Carmen, overall we had one great night, and one so/so night, are first night had a really good atmosphere with OK music, the 2nd night was a little dead, and the Music selection was not the greatest, i would recommend visiting at least once, but maybe try and so some research to see if they have anything going on that might to maybe get a better crowd.

Disappointed!. Okay so lots of things have changed since the 90's but this beach bar was such a lovely gem and now it just seems a little sad. There is almost no beach - not their fault, I know - but no atmosphere either. We had a drink at the bar - nothing to write here about - and decided to leave and try further up the road for a place with a better vibe. Sorry Blue Parrot, you just couldn't match the memories!

Went here 4/6 days of the trip. I went to Playa del Carmen with my friend, (we are 25 year old women), and we loved going to the Blue Parrot. We went there the majority of our trip during the day. They had amazing beach lounge chairs, a good sized pool, perfect music for the day, and great service, all on the beach. The minimum spend to stay for the day was very low. My friend and I would each get an entree and a drink and we were good for the day. The food is amazing and the portions are generous. Try the crab tacos and guacamole! They have all different flavored mojitos that I would suggest as well. The people are wonderful that work there, we were sad to say goodbye.

Great Vibe. Stumbled upon this place late on a Friday Night. What a great atmosphere, with a beachfront pool and dancing in the sand. Had a great time and the music was awesome. Drinks were reasonably priced and the crowd was young & trendy. We had a great time and look forward to checking it out in the day time. Must stop and see when in Playa del Carmen!

Great beach bar!. Found this place whilst roaming the beach and looking for a place to sit. I belive it was a minimum spend of 200pesos per person to enjoy the facilities which wasn't a problem for the 2 of us!Chairs and loungers on the beach, hammocks and chair swings up top with full bar and cocktails; good service to boot. Happy hour was 2-1 and they had food and snacks too. Big bonus for a nice waterfront pool which i didn't notice at too many other establishments that weren't hotels. Looks like it gets pretty bumping at night too.
Awesome place. Went there with some mexican friends and it was really fun. Half the club in on the beach and there's a dance floor also. Staff was awesome and the music was spot on for a good party!

Beautiful beach club with good vibe. We spend many days in the Blue Parrot Beach Club and visited different ones while staying in Playa d. C - this one is def. our fav.! +good vibe+next to the beach ! +happy hours mo-fr 1pm-4pm +delicious food+ drinks+clean +attentive, professional and funny staff (our favs. Oscar , Bersavid ) +good wifi +not too crowded +plenty of different sitting possibilities to chill/relax+comfy area at the pool (which is always clean )!300 pesos p.p is an average price in Playa d. C for a beach club and we think it's absolutely fair. LET'S GO .... and spend a beautiful day at Blue Parrots.You won't regret it !

Hmmmm...did you think I ordered that??. I paid upfront $25usd and $20 tip upfront as well for my son his buddy and my friend that showed up later...was great until...they served us a ton of food...which I did not order...instead of taking it away..they left it said ok....so much we decided to share with gals next to us...then they wanted to charge them for the order they messed up on. Would have gone back...would have had great review up until that time...then it took forever to get drinks...then forever for their attention to even order...bad move! I did tip the side server...and the main waiter took that tip from him! That's awful! Won't go back. Been going to parrot for over 20 years.
Vacation . First day great. Second day a ripoff. 20% mandatory tip with substandard sevrvice. Check out Kool beach club, way nicer pool,bar and beach....still with in walking distance...

Awesome music, great food. Spent the day with friends. Had front row beach chairs facing the ocean. Beautiful views. Blue Parrot is known of course for bringing the best in House and Techno so naturally they had some amazing music playing. Had a decent breakfast BLT and a very delicious smoothie. Finished with (several) beers. There was a minimum of course. We didn't totally break the bank but it was not a cheap day at the beach. Would recommend this place and come back again.

1st day was nice, the 2nd day not so good.. My husband and I travel a lot and have been to many beach clubs. On the 1st day everything was nice, a bit expensive (600 pesos minimum charge for 2 chairs), but we felt it was worth it. We enjoyed our day with pretty decent food and ok drinks and when the bill came we gave a complimentary 20% tip and went on our way.Day 2 is another story all together. Still paying the 600 peso minimum for 2 chairs but the food was lacking and the drinks were very weak. When presented with our bill there was a "mandatory" 20% tip charge. When I inquired and told the waiter there was no "mandatory" tip the day before, he laughed and said "well today is mandatory." I am not one to not tip, but when someone expects to be tipped at 20% for substandard service, well lets just say I WILL NOT BE BACK!!! BUYER BEWARE.

Day and night this place wowed me. I got the chance to experience blue parrot during the day, enjoying the beach front and infinity pool. We ordered some appetizers which in my opinion was the best food I've had in Mexico, the service was on top form as well. I also got to enjoy blue parrot during the evening. We had a booth not too far from the stage, again the service was great and the place had an amazing vibe. I honestly danced the entire night away, definitely have some great memories of this place and would love to visit again.

Great day on the beach was fantastic food. Surprised by the excellent food the service was superb, and they let us sit out a rainstorm at the bar. We spent the whole day and watched the ocean very enjoyable

Nice to party but food is not good. Do not go there for the restaurant !! the food is really not good !But if you wanna have good party on the beach during night ... it s the place to be !!At the end of Calle 12 .. do not hesitate to try !!

A Delightful Lunch. We stopped here on our beach walk for lunch. I ordered fish and chips and my partner ordered rib eye tacos. The fish was delicate strips of white fish lightly battered amd chips were potato wedges. Home made tartar sauce. The rib eye tacos came wrapped in blue corn tortillas with grilled cactus . Delish. Not cheap eats, but but very high end for a beach restaurant, well prepared . Service was congenial.

Awesome Foam Party. The foam party was so fun! Included in our price was transportation to and from our resort, own table with personal bartender service. Unlimited drinks including bottles of vodka, rum, beer etc. The music was jammin' and everyone had a great time! It was awesome too because this was at night and you could see Cozumel all lit up!

Great margaritas on the beach!. My hubby and I spent National Margarita day Feb 22 in Playa Del Carmen and stopped in at the Blue Parrot for a drink. Wow the best margaritas we had found! Also had the fish and chips...highly recommend them too! Great area to people watch!

Fun Beach Club!. We came here when we got sick of being crammed into Coco Bongo. We actually didn't intend on going to another club and were just walking down Fifth Ave to see what was around but then one of their promoters approached us and asked if we just wanted to take a peek inside. I figured why not and we took a look. It was awesome so we stayed. They were having a fire show and drinks were free for the ladies. It was 150 Pesos to get in so not bad at all. It was so spacious, the music was good, and it was so neat to be right on the beach having a big party. You could dance the night away or you could also just relax in a beach chair in the sand by the pool. We would definitely return here next time we are in the area.

expected more.... For being at that club for the first time it was a dissapointment, the waiter, despite that there was not a lot of people didn´t pay much attention to us, the drinks took probably 20 min to arrive, so we decided to move out, im not really glad about the experience.

Great location, however prepare to pay during BPM. AMazing sound quality, one of the best sound system's ive ever heard in a club. Great music, Bartenders are friendly, however I was not a fan of the increasing prices of the dance floor real estate. You pay big money for a 10 day pass already, you expect to be able to find a good spot to dance, but you probably wont, unless you are prepared to buy the spot. It was kind of insane near the end of the BPM festival. I would still reccomend it if you are travelling with a big group, or if you are rich.

My favorite nite club in playa del carmen . After visiting just about every club on 12th St this has to be hands down my very very most favorite dance club the vibe is awesome the music is amazing and you can hear it with out no interference from other music from the other clubs those are all next to one another and right across a short street so its a big jumble of base and rackit but blue parrot is set at the end of the 12th St along the beach plus its huge like really huge the others are small and jammed packed plus they have another dance floor way on the other side with another live dj yes they have 2 djs plus dancers and fire dancers they had bboys dancing and just a great time lots of seating too plus theres a pool in the center cant wait to go back

Great beach club. We went to this beach club , last week ,and we had a wonderful time ...The day was cloudy and cold but the place was fantastic, Is not very busy , much less than others clubs , We order shrimp tacos and i recommend you to try it Thumbs up for blue parrot

2nd visit and still amazing as the first. had a nice and relaxing time under the sun. no loud and blaring music. the shrimp rolls and shrimp tacos were tasty. oscar provided excellent service from start to finish! a great place to unwind and spend the day. this place has come a looooong way and can only get better.

Nice beach. We went to Blue Parrot beach club for a day and it was lovely. We found this beach club less busy than Mamitas which we liked. We ordered some food and drinks at Blue Parrot and it was all good. There is a small pool here as well but we did not use it. We used 2 beach chairs with umbrellas and the chairs were comfortable and nice and close to the water.

Beach Club. My friend and I decided to go into town for an evening from the resort. We caught a cab and he took us downtown where we found Blue Parrot. At first we were a little confused because they only took pesos and we have USD. We figured all of that out though and ended up really enjoying the outdoor dance floor right on the ocean. It had placed to relax after some dancing, great drinks and a fun crowd. They did start playing songs we had never hear, nor liked, so we decided to leave. The locals were a blast though and got us whatever we needed!

Afternoon ruined by rude employee. Myself and my husband have spent a lot of time and money at the blue parrot, during the day and at their night time moon parties. We were met with very aggressive rude employees a few times there. We had lunch at the blue parrot then massages at their beach, as we were leaving a very aggressive rude employee who was blocking the exit saying go out the other way ( through a weird narrow type exit from the beach ) we were completely shocked. The second time we were approached by another aggressive blue parrot employee at a moon party telling us to stand somewhere else. Both these employees were loud and shouting at us very disturbing. Not nice to be attacked while trying to relax on holiday. Be careful, it's a nice facade until you are the next victim.

Great night out. I visited this venue whilst on holiday for a night out with other hotel guests. I had a fantastic night out, it was great value for money, the service was great and the entertainment was extremely entertaining! If you are in the area I would definitely recommend a visit!

Superfun Saturdays!. Thurs is Edm I believe, but Saturday I can´´t help but dance at least 4 hours in the night! Old school commercial + popular Reggaetton & WHOLE LOTTA DADDY YANKEE. Also it´s packed then. I like that it´s outdoors as well...And the fire shows are spectacular!! 130MXN entry or guestlist.

New updated Beach Bar/Club. This was not here 18 months ago and the NEW BLUE PARROT is an excellent choice for your daily beach club needs. A small beach is the only downside to this new addition to the beach club scene. Much smaller than most & even a hair smaller than Lido next door but a good choice non-the-less. A nice clean refreshing pool is a much appreciated benefit for the Blue Parrot. Food is also OUTSTANDING. Very fresh & delicious. The ONLY complaint is that there is a minimal amunt of choices on the menu & they are NOT FEXIBLE when ordering. For example we wanted a Fish Tempura taco & they said it was not on the menu..The next day we ordered the fish & chips which essentially is fish tempura & French fries --?? Strange! Be more flexible & extend the menu a hair & this place is an A+ Had two great days here last week!!

Teen hot spot. If you are in college or younger you will love this place. We use to go when we were living in Playa back in the 90s and we were in our 20s. Now we are in our early 40s - so we still hit it for old time sake but its a YOUNGER crowd and hot spot for the BPM festival every January in Playa. It now features a "foam party " dance floor in which you get sprayed with real soap suds about every 5 min. It offers a awesome pool near the back bar - if you wish to take a dip ...most people do. LOL. It has 3 bars, and 2 dance floors. The drinks are over priced and watered down - but your paying for the experience, DJ and being directly on the BEACH people! There are many clubs on the strip - this one is fun because its all outside. Cons : not much seating - so wear flat sandals that you don't mind getting wet when on the foam dance floor -lol. There is always a "cover charge' but all clubs in playa have a cover - so...it is what it is folks! Its normally $60 per person all you can drink with a wrist band and about $100 during a festival for a well known DJ. Check it out - its fun ! They also serve food till about 10 pm in a small restaurant area and offer a motel style lodging - but the motel portion is only voted a 1 star and is SUPER NOISY....LOL. VIVA MEXICO!

Fab Food and Music...very chilled. We spent Xmas day and Boxing Day here this year. The food is great, the service is slick and the location is fab. We like our beds up by the pool area looking out onto the ocean. We also love happy hour and the lounge type Buddha Bar music they play all day. Our children happy on the beach and in the pool and fab time had by all. Highly recommend!
Happy Hour 1-3pm. Superb food and 2-for-1 happy hour drinks with great tunes and a beautiful beach chairs, a great place to stop after a Morning of Scuba

Blue Parrot is a must Day or Night. I have enjoyed many beautiful afternoons, a few wild evenings and some incredible events at Blue Parrot. The venue is gorgeous, the staff are incredibly professional and THE FOOD; OMG the food is amazing. There is nothing I love more then enjoying a cold glass of bubbly and the shrimp tacos seaside at Blue Parrot. Whether I'm looking for a day with my girlfriends or place to entertain clients; Blue Parrot is always my go to. I miss it already and can't wait to go back!

Daytime beach bar (we didn't visit at night). This is a nice beach bar with good food and a nice pool and deck to hang out. It's in my opinion much nicer than places like 'Mamitas' that is much bigger and very open. I liked the 'intimacy' of a smaller place like this.Neither drinks nor food are cheap, but I think it's not more than other bars around here. It's Playa.... We thought the food was worth it, though. Mixed drinks were so-so, pretty weak for the price. Only recommended during happy hour, but going with beer ensures that you know what you get.They did a little trick with the bill (and they did the it on both days), they print a receipt with your items but show you a number on their calculator that is significantly higher. I asked the waiter if this included service, as I found the amount a little high, but he lied and said 'no'. So I gave him some 15% tip on top of the amount he had shown me.The next day we carefully kept track of what we had and realized that the discrepancy is 20% and is obviously a hefty, non-obvious service charge. I essentially got tricked into a 35% service charge the day before. My fault for not questioning the bill, but I don't want to be the 'nasty, suspicious tourist' - and paid for that...

Perfect day beach tanning spot.. Drink service, beach frontage, small pool, clean restrooms, central location, intimate setting, decent restaurant, massage parlor or beach side, sun chairs. We spent 3 days here.

An All-Round First-Rate Beach Club. My husband and I have been to a few other beach clubs in the area on other visits to Playa del Carmen, but found this one to be so exceptional that we came back every day of our trip! Note that we were not there at night, so I am writing about the day experience. Most of the beach clubs require a small minimum coverage for food and drink. First, the beach had great access for swimming, and the lounge chairs had big comfortable cushions. We had one server, Martine, for the three days, and he was exceptionally pleasant and attentive. There were two days of stormy weather, driving us to the restaurant area for lunch. The food was also high-quality. We had the crusted fish of the day, fish ceviche, shrimp soup, spinach salad and all were delicious! It was just an all round terrific experience and we will be back!

FUN FUN FUN. I loved it! Nice friends, great music! All you can drink... dance floor just amazing! You dance in a pile of soapy foam that comes from the ceiling...My shoes were still foaming the next day! I will go back!
Oh What a Night!!. My Girls and I danced on the beach and in the cave sections. Did shots while sitting on the bar swings. The music was incredible too.

Great way to spend a day relaxing!. My wife and I got a referral on Friday to visit, and after our first day Saturday we returned the next two days too - spending most of the day lounging on comfy padded recliners by the sea.Our server Martin couldn't have been more attentive or helpful! The pool was nice for a refreshing cool down when it really got hot, and the food was fantastic: we had the fish tacos two days, and a tuna appetizer and fish of the day the last day - all were delicious.Rest rooms were spotless and well cared for, and the place just has a nice vibe - clean, cared for, and the staff looks like they are happy to be there.We were in PDC a year ago, and visited two other beach clubs, and Blue Parrot was by far the best place.

Nice view for cocktails. We had a couple of drinks here while exploring Playa on holiday. Our beach party/bikini contest days are probably behind us so we weren't sure it would be a great stop for us based on the signs as we walked in.It ended up being a welcome break from the hawksters on Avenida Quinta. The happy hour prices were reasonable and the service was good. We didn't eat but the food looked and smelled good as it went by our table. The view was lovely.

BEWARE! Attacked by aggressive staff. Not safe for tourists.. The bar/club is in a great location and I enjoyed going there previously. However, my last visit was a nightmare. A staff member in the street approached us offering a 2x1 special. I agreed, and he put a wristband on me- then demanded 650 pesos (about 40 USD) for the privilege. I said no, that was a terrible deal and please take the wristband off. Instead, he got several buddies (other Blue Parrot hawkers in uniform as well as security) together and threatened me. I refused to pay especially as I had not even gone in yet. I said I was leaving. One pushed me, I pushed back, and all the staff standing around me started punching me at once. My date was thankfully uninjured. I will never spend another peso there again, and I advise all tourists to avoid this place like the plague.

Great atmoshpere in day!. We came across this by chance when walking along the beach. The staff were very fun and friendly, the food was great too and of course the cocktails! The pool was clean and a perfect touch!We came here on ladies night and didn't rate it to be honest - better in the daytime!

Open Air Nightclub. Stumbled into this place during a lads holiday after a few tee many martoonies. Needless to say we returned many times. Uplifting music, beautiful people, and an enviable backdrop next to the beach makes for a very memorable venue.

Lazy day by the pool. We visited Blue Parrot on a couple of days after our daughter recommended it. It was perfect for us on really hot days because we wanted a pool, shelter, drinks and food on tap by the beach! The food was great - we had ceviche, guacamole and chicken wings. We also loved the margaritas during happy hour 2 for 1. I recommend the mint and lemonade frozen ice as well - it's really refreshing. The staff are friendly and the pool is perfect!
Cool Beach Bar. Tucked away at the end of a little street off the main drag is a very cool boho type beach bar. small pool, lots of sand good service & drinks...believe this place rocks at night!
Amazing beach bar/club!. I happened upon Blue Parrot one night and had the time of my life! It is an outdoor bar/club with amazing music and atmosphere. I will definitely return on future trips.

Good chill place , amazing team!. We came here to relax near the beach, and the place is beautiful! There's a nice small pool to relax in with a great view of the beach. There's a lot of drink options , and good music . Good vibes in this place and the team is super nice! Say hello to Bersa for us! Great guy :)

Best Beach Club in Playa. Best spot on the beach to spend the day, and even better at night for the party. Staff is all very attentive and friendly. Went twice in one day and it was like two different places. Food was also excellent, I highly recommend the ahi tuna steak. Would definitely go back and would also gladly recommend to anyone looking for an ultra cool spot to spend the day and night.

Once was the best...........No longer. Our first visit to The Blue Parrot Inn , it was truly an "Inn"! They had six palapa rooms on the beach, and four rooms in the main office bldg. next to the Dragon Bar and a three bdrm. house 100 feet north of the palapas. Now granted , this was in the early 90's and Playa Del Carmen was very small, all dirt roads and small population. We stayed there three years in a row...in the 3 bdrm. house. With each year, the service was great but the surroundings got worse...a lot worse!! Hoards of Rude, obnoxious and down right unacceptable tourist's , treating the locals and seasoned travelers like "they" were the only ones that mattered!! Our last stay, I had a Knife pulled on me at the Dragon Bar, by a guy from Cancun, with no clue as to why he was pointing this switch blade at my crotch, I informed my wife and friends "it's time to go"!! We loved Playa Del Carmen.....but once the word was out about this beautiful ,quiet , sleepy little fishing village , as far as we are concerned, it has been Destroyed!!! all night parties on the beach, prices through the roof and way to many people!!

Mostly hits, a couple misses. I attended BPM 2015, and attended the Blue Parrot for the Cadenza night, Tanaglia night, and closing with Marco Carola. I wished to attend more events there, but BPM is all about living in the moment, and realizing there's only one place one can be at a given time. Onto the club, a typical response with the typical reviews here, yeah it's a nice place, drinks do cost more by 10-20 pesos compared to other venues, though there's staff walking through the crowd every so often taking drink orders (and returning reasonably quick), and picking up empties. I read a review where someone mentioned Europe, which I spent a decent amount of time partying in, and one thing that drove me nuts, dancing with empties littered on the dancefloor, which Blue Parrot addresses properly. Bars on both sides of the place, so if you can't wait for the fellow (they were constantly around, I picked one and stuck with him when possible, threw him a $20 for a drink last day and told him to keep the change, should've seen how his face lit up, very thankful. Javier was his name if I recall). Line-ups for bathroom breaks to a port-a-potty left that part of the evening to be desired, but hey, not to be unexpected. The sound was good for all the nights, though during Luciano one side started to cut out. I wear earplugs, so the gauge for sound quality for me is, after a couple hours, take the plugs out for 10 minutes at a time a few times to enjoy the main acts, and if I find the sound unpleasing, I don't give it the 10 minutes, room isn't tuned to the system, plugs remain in. Sunrise was picture-esque (even more so one of the first nights, which I only saw the photo), during Luiano's set. Club thinned out after sunrise, which is always welcome for a more comfortable dancefloor experience. All in all, I'd return for non international headliner night if I was there the rest of the year. Which says a lot, as I will not attend Marco Carola next year there, or any other place/time, but there's little relevance of my interactions with him and his bunch in respect to Blue Parrot, which runs a solid establishment.

beach club bliss. after 4 years of walking by and all the mixed reviews, i finally decided to spend the day with them. i was impressed by the level of attention from bersavid in making sure everything was perfect for my visit. aracef, was always around and i didn't have to get off my lounger when i needed something. the atmosphere was relaxing and no blaring music was a plus. the renovations are beautiful. thanks guys!

Don't miss! . My boyfriend and I met a local that showed us around and took us here. I am so glad I didn't miss this! We are in our mid-twenties and everyone there was around 18-30 I would say. But it was great! They played a variety of music from hip hop to techno. The people there are very friendly and there just to have a good time. It's located directly on the beach and does have a small pool and dance floor ( with occasional foam pouring down from the ceiling) I will be back !

Amazing nights. We spent the first night clubbing there and I can tell you that the environment is awesome: lots of mexicans and foreigners from all over the world gathered in one place. Drinks are well served, and the price is worth it. The place is just next to the beach and it has a small pool where you can refresh yourself. The music is good: electronic, pop, hip hop, reggaeton.... but do not ask for a song to the DJ... he won't play it.

Great music. We went to Blue Parrot for the BPM festival. The renovations were excellent. The Palapa and the DJ booth were awesome as well as the LED wall. The new pool was really cool. There are now more bars and it feels much more open.

Comsi Comsa.... Blue Parrot beach club advertisements are all over Playa del Carmen, primarily because they seem to host a lot of events, beach partys and concerts. I went there on two occasions, one was during the day to enjoy the beach club itself and the other was to see DJ Sasha at one of their events. The day time beach club is a bit underwhelming, especially if you have visited beach clubs in Europe, Vegas or the like. Now, not to compare because as we know... Europe is Europe. BUT nevertheless a beach club that presents and advertises itself in the fashion in which they do so should at the very least have a day time DJ, cool music and a totally different atmosphere. It wasnt what I was expecting, although if you just need somewhere to veg out after a long night this may be what you are looking for. On the other hand, the service is great and staff are very friendly and do the best that they can. The DJ Sasha night event, not really sure where to start. First of all the event was way over hyped by promoters who suggested that there would be between 3000-4000 people there, there were maybe 700.. not that it matters. Table service if you want it was reasonable, the purchase of two moderately priced bottles for a table. I highly recommend doing that for an event at this location as it is VERY crowded and VERY hot and you will want a place to sit down after a while. One major annoyance was the local DJ who continued to spin an hour and a half over his time and totally exhausted the crowd, not that he was bad but by 3am you kind of want to see the talent you came to see.Overall, if you are looking for a posh experience, this may not be the place for you. However, as I said, the staff are great and its not a bad place to wind down.

Great Place. This place has a wonderful atmosphere. Open air with the sound of their waterfall make for a very relaxing dinner. Don't get one of the tables on the sidewalk by the street though, our dinner got interrupted constantly by street musicians, flower sellers and beggars. It was not any fault of the restaurant but really hurt the quality of our experience dining there. The coconut shrimp were the best coconut shrimp that I have ever had.

Best night of my life. My new husband and I got married at Blue Parrot on April 13th, 2015 and I have to say, hands down, Blue Parrot went above and beyond our wildest dreams at making our wedding day the best day of our lives. The service was EXCEPTIONAL, the venue was INCREDIBLE and the way that they interpreted everything we wanted was beyond what we asked for. Let me also note here that we had booked at a venue just down the street (Kool Beach) who had made every mistake you could imagine, so much so that we actually canceled the venue 3 weeks before our wedding. We contacted Blue Parrot and within 3 weeks they put together what we thought was impossible. I can honestly say from the bottom of my heart the people at Blue Parrot are exceptional and really go all out with their customer service. They heard everything we said, they made all of our wishes come true and by far were the easiest people to get ahold of. They were attentive and responsive, they were timely and on the ball. They went over and above what we asked for and truly made made our wedding a night to remember not only for my husband and I but for all 50 of our guests. I have never written a review before but Blue Parrot truly deserves this review. I hope that anyone reading reading this who is looking for an incredible venue (ESPECIALLY if you are getting married), you honestly can't got wrong with this place. The food (my husband is a picky eater and we both loved the food),the venue, the atmosphere, the service, the decor...I still cannot find one fault in anything they did. Thank you Blue Parrot!! I can't wait to see you guys again on our one year anniversary!

Quality night out in Playa. Went to the Blue Parrot with a large wedding party having just met them....What a night! Great club, awesome tunes and layout (2011). Banging house on the strip next to the sea...best club since I last went to Ibiza!

Good party life!!. Ok so I went here 2 times in my stay in Mexico and really enjoyed it. I payed 40usd on a Wednesday night and 50usd Friday. I'm not sure if that was to much or about the right price? Unlimited drinks which wernt as strong as you would think had quite a few shots of tequila. The music was good and easy to dance to played a lot of Spanish music too. There are a few bars and never took to long to get served. The lady in the loo was so friendly and always zipped up my Playsuit. One thing I wasn't to keen on was in the evening they did a bikini contest which the music stopped and everyone huddled round the pool.Overal had a great time here and will definitely be back when I return in November.

Mala educación . The most disrespectful waiters I've seen in my life! Disgraceful!!! I send them a lot of guests of the hotel every week and I just realised how they treat the people. There disappointed. I'm never gonna invite my guests here again, I have received many complaints because of their lack of respect.

Foam Party Sundays!. I had a lot of fun at Blue Parrot! I came on a Sunday when it was Foam Night and it was incredible. I had no trouble getting in and upon entering they gave me a wristband for open bar privileges all night for FREE!! (The drinks weren't very strong though) The beach club is very spacious so it never got too crowded. Bathroom facilities were clean. There were seats all around so you can sit and chill if you wanted. The dance floor at the front of the club is where the foam was pouring, and honestly I can't remember what type of music they were playing. No complaints here!

Sad demise of the parrot !. When I first visited Playa I visited The Blue Parrot. It was my favourite place, cool, different, fantastic beach location, fire eaters - the place to be. On a visit for a wedding The Partot was top of our list for a hen night. The strip - in the last 10 years - has changed no longer dusty and quiet but vibrant with clubs and bars lining both sides of the street, The Parrot is at the end of the street it's entrance insignificant, you are jostled by sellers trying to sell you wristbands we should have turned away! Despite the Facebook page offering 'Free Drinks' for Ladies you are still 'persuaded' to pay 25 USD admission for Free Drinks. Once inside it has the charm and personality of your garage. No pretty twinkling lights, cute swings, dancing fire eaters instead pushy staff watered down drinks and curiously a small pool ??? Empty dance floor music so loud your eardrums ring. How sad. Bring back the Partot of the past, cooler than school, beds along the beach, free entry, dancing fire eaters, haunting music stop trying to compete with the new bars you are better than that! Get rid if the intimidating entrance crowded with pushy salesmen if your club had the personality it had you would be packed with people who want a fantastic trendy beach bar - that's what you had and you are destroying your own venue :(

I LOVE the NEW Blue Parrot!!!. I’ve been going to Blue Parrot nightclub for years. But since the remodelling of the venue it is more than just a nightclub. Now that they have added a pool it is one of my favourite places to go hang out with the girls; and the food at the restaurant is amazing!! The octopus taco, the hamburgers and the smoked marlin are mind blowing!!! The service is excellent and the staff always makes you feel right at home and what I love most they always remember your name when you go back!!! And thanks to the new remodelling of the place whenever there are 1000’s of people during large events, there is still enough room to move and dance unlike before!If you have never been I highly recommend it and you should definitely look into the different events they hold throughout the week from movie nights, to live bands and Sunday BBQ’s. It’s Great!!!

Good Eats and Good Beats !. This year was my first time in Playa del Carmen, and although I had heard many good things about Blue Parrot before , I had no idea what to expect ! The venue is definitely my favorite, as it's very open and I love the fact that the water is so close ! Everything on the menu is amazing - their tacos and their guacamole are definitely my favorite ! The BPM parties that took place there hosted many of the globe's best DJs - it was always the place to be. The BP staff was always welcoming and by far some of the hardest working people in the industry :) I can't wait to go back !

Blue Parrot changed for the better!!! GLUTEN FREE OPTIONS!. I have been coming to Playa for years, and was INCREDIBLY impressed with the new remodeled Blue Parrot. They layout is beautiful, with pool and beach beds. My brother and I lounged on some bright colored bean bags which were super comfortable. They also have a array of gluten free items!! Which can be hard to find on the beach - but Blue Parrot has it! The octopus tacos and chicken salad are my favorites. The staff is friendly and makes you feel at home. If you haven't been here since its been remolded, go! You wont regret it.

guaranteed fun time. I've been lucky that I've had the chance to go to Playa del Carmen a few times and I gotta say Blue Parrot is my favorite go-to place for parties and more. They have always provided the best nightlife with good music and since they renovated the place, it's also been a good hang out place during the day. The club is right by the beach and they have a pool which makes it a great spot to relax, tan and listen to music. They also have a great menu for the restaurant and everything I've tried has been incredible. I think one of my favorite dishes was their Mediterranean ceviche. Hopefully they will still have it next time I go.
Love blue parrot ☀️❤️. Really loved it here!! The staff we all so friendly and the food was so good! And atmosphere was so enjoyable! Will be back as soon as possible.... five stars all the way!

Blue waves at Blue Parrot. Have been there several times. The renovation is great...love the addition of the pool and the beach vibe.
Had lunch there a few times. The food was delicious. Always nice to enjoy your meal on a patio, beachside.. The night club provides a mixed bag of music to please the crowds. Club was full of energy. Overall, a positive experience.

No kid friendly . No kid friendly at all, they lied to me saying that they have a family environment, and no kid menu, no changing tables, so? What it's family environment for them idk. Super bad service and price outrageous for the food and quality.

The perfect location but that's it. First I have to say the shows, the location and the location is super well done. If you are for a longer time in Playa you should go and check it out once. The drinks are bad and the 50 dollars open bar is a ripoff.
Brilliant. The blue parrot is really good the music is good it's right on the beach there loads of entertainment it's just brilliant and the drinks are Amazin

Beautiful new venue!. I was very lucky to visit this venue a few times on my most recent trip to Playa Del Carmen. Love the gorgeous renovations, love the friendly staff and love the party! I have suggested it to numerous Playa visitors since! Not to be missed :)

Amazing Food, Beautiful New Space. I recently visited the Blue Parrot, and was pleasantly surprised to see the immense change this place has undergone. I have been coming to Playa since 2001 and always visit the Blue Parrot just once each trip. The place has been completely demolished & rebuilt and is just stunning now. The food was delicious - super incredible & ambiance during the day was great, staff/service was friendly and welcoming. A great addition to the Playa experience.

Blue Parrot 2.0 (NEW). I have been to Playa Del Carmen and Blue Parrot several times. Since it's recent renovations and restaurant addition - it is the perfect venue for day or night. The food was incredible...all of it, I tried a bit of everything!!! The staff is super friendly. Depending on time of year, the tide washes up a lot of seaweed, so the beach is not always the best place to go - but with the NEW pool addition, (right in front of the beach) you can still get your tan on and enjoy a beach day + have food and drinks readily available to you. The nightlife at Blue Parrot is second to none. Definitely a bigger venue to fill but when a big act is in town , this is the BEST place to party. Whats better than being on the beach, drinking booze with good beats? ;-

Best Club in Mexico - Beautiful Place!!!. Luckily I have had the chance to visit this gem more then once. As someone who has been to Mexico plenty of times, and has a soft spot in my heart for Playa specifically - I highly recommend checking out the Blue Parrot!! The setting is beautiful for both day and night parties. The pool addition is amazing, gazing right into the beautiful Aqua ocean while sipping on delicious Margaritas.The sound system in the space is exceptional for those who are looking to go out and have a good time dancing! Don't leave Playa without a night at The Blue Parrot, do yourself a favour and stop in. I know Ill be going back :) Danielle

Best Club in Mexico. Blue Parrot is located right on the beach with water just steps away along with an open roof so that you can look up at the stars after you have just finished dancing your butt off to the best sound system south of New York. The renovation that was completed was first class and the service was excellent. Look forward to returning next year for BPM. Mario J

Fun times at the Blue Parrot Beach club. I had 2 fantastic days at the beach club sitting on comfortable chairs and soaking up the sun. My boyfriend was in Playa with his 2 teenage daughters and I with my 11 yr old. We had great days on the beach there and had an authentic Mexican lunch. SomeOf the staff did not speak English well but they did everything they could to accommodate all of our requests. Washrooms were handy and clean; and this section of beach was not as bombarded with spring breakers as the other beach clubs were.Highly recommended!
Pleased. Just stopped in for drink. Really good margarita (without mix). Please place to watch the ocean and the nearly naked beach ladies. I don't know about the night but it's wonderful @ 1 pm

Blue Parrot Hosted a Local Charity Event March 21, 2015. I am so grateful for the support the Blue Parrot has given to Coco's Animal Welfare for SIX YEARS straight. The event was wonderful. The staff was amazing, the canapes were yummy and the atmosphere was great. Thank you for all the work that went into the evening and helping a local non profit. Your generosity and hard work made it a wonderful night for all. The feedback from guests was excellent! Thank you!

Good times. We where pleasantly surprised at the look of the place after the demodulation, they did a great job it best a very be achy feeling to it as is suppose to be for a Beach Club. Although the dance floor looked some kind of empty because is huge, but after people start coming into the club at later hours the dance floor is filled with people dancing and having fun. We had a great time by the end of the night.

BEWARE! "Mexican bottle service". We were looking to have fun dancing though after our horrendous treatment, we will never go back here. We were quickly ushered into what appeared to be a fun club though with an empty dance floor. Our waiter ushered us to sit down on black sofas and assured us that we'd pay for only the drinks we ordered. We ordered our drinks at the bar, got them, paid for them and returned to the sofa. Later, 4 margaritas and 4 shot glasses of tequila appeared on our table and he wanted one of our friends to pay for them. He politely told the waiter that he didn't order the drinks. Long story short, Blue Parrots' staff bullied & forced him to pay up.
