We now believe that sitting on those black sofa was associated with bottle service of which no signs werWe were looking to have fun dancing though after our horrendous treatment, we will never go back here. We were quickly ushered into what appeared to be a fun club though with an empty dance floor. Our waiter ushered us to sit down on black sofas and assured us that we'd pay for only the drinks we ordered. We ordered our drinks at the bar, got them, paid for them and returned to the sofa. the NEW blue parrot. We spent the day at the blue parrot on 12th and the beach. The pictures here do not look like the place that we visited, but I am assuming they moved or something.This was one of the best meals we had our whole week in Playa. DELICIOUS fish tacos and soft shel crab tacos. We loved the option of lounging in the pool all day rather than the rough, sea weedy ocean.We were told that we had to order 600 pesos in food and could stay there for the day, which we did, and then some. Drinks were not very strong, but that was the only drawback.
Great Bar on the Beach. This place was so relaxing ..we had a table right on the sand. The staff was friendly and the prices were great.

Nice chilling Beach Club. Nice music, and chilling beach club, and nightlife... we enjoyed the service and everything... Its just for chilling, and the nightlife party was comfortable because its wide open and not to crowded which is good for get the party started...

Good times at the Parrot. Blue Parrot is nicely done and by far the largest venue in Playa. The club setup is nice and has multiple bars so even when it is jam packed you can still get a drink fairly easily. Parrot always holds the biggest parties for BPM and did not fail in doing so this year either. Definitely would recommend and look forward to heading back again.

Amazing. The Blue Parrot of was great great. Had the beach vibe and great music for the BPM festival but the renovations are amazing. Love the bigger area for the dance floor and the view of the ocean. Staff is great and they work fasssst! The system is QUALITY! love Blue Parrot

BPM 2015 - Brilliant venue and people. I have been clubbing for too many years to mention and have been lucky to travel the world and visit many different clubs. Blue Parrott is up there with the best and a fantastic venue for listening to your favourite DJs. We went twice, once to a daytime party and once to an evening party that went on to the early hours. Both were a fantastic experience. Drinks, although more expensive than the rest of Playa, were still reasonable and compared to Ibiza were cheap! £2 for a bottle of water, £2 for a beer and £4 for a spirit and mixer. The view of the sea is fantastic and the club attracts a real good mix of people who like to party. Security and staff are some of the nicest I have come across in a club. Security and waiters were apologetic when trying to get through the crowd and the staff behind the bar were happy, smiling and really enjoying themselves (what a difference from the likes of Pacha in Ibiza!) All the staff they have working in Blue Parrott really make this club and it is obvious they have been trained to a high standard and respect the customer – well done and keep it up. The sound system is stupidly loud, but luckily I had my ear plugs or you could dance further away from the main dance floor. However this meant you could really feel the music and this in turn made for a great atmosphere. The only downside to one of my nights were the Canadian security who were involved with the BPM Festival. I won’t mark down the club because of them, but I have never met such a bunch of arrogant and condescending people in my life, complete idiots who hopefully won’t be back next year. Replace them with the Mexican security from inside next year as they were far more professional and customer focused and they obviously know how to treat paying customers well and with respect.

BPM 2015. This is a place where you can start drinking on day time and go all the way through dinner and breakfast. Make sure you take a lot of money it is really expensive, but its worth it. Great place to meet new people and pretty faces, great body, and magical drinks. The new bar is nice but i really liked the old blue parrot with their swings at the bar. Cheers

Very nice place. Amazing party for new years everything was perfect to the drink to the end we really had a blast nice people the renovation they made are really looking good wish we had that in quebec :)
Daytime Visit. We popped by here in the late afternoon and had a blast. Good drinks, good food and because it was a little empty, the staff really went the extra mile for us.
Nice bar during the day, beach nightclub at night. Sunday NFL games. Comfortable breeze if the town is sweltering. Secured Wifi. Not cheap but worth it.

South beach Miami feel. Very similiar to my favourite bars on South Beach in Miami. Party atmosphere, talented breakdancing show. Loved the cold CO2 that was sprayed into the crowd!Fun times! Great staff...Will be back :)

Worst club in playa del carmen. If you like obnoxious, rude, lying, staff then go to this club by all accounts but for anyone expecting a great fun night out, this is certainly not the place! The staff con you into paying 1000 pesos claiming you get free drinks all night. This is not the case at all! Do not believe a word they say!! 2/5 of us got 1 drink each which is ridiculous. We went to complain and spent the following 2 hours arguing with these horrendous people with horrific attitudes trying to get our money back. They refused over and over and over again. They were so unhelpful, knew they'd lied to us and stolen our money and just said they couldn't do anything. All we wanted was either what they'd promised us or our money back. We are a group of backpackers and are obviously on a budget and just want to have a good time in different parts of the world. We will not be returning here ever again. It is over priced as it is and the drinks are extremely watered down. You will spend a fortune and not even have a good night. The bar staff are no better and the whole atmosphere of the place is incredibly unenjoyable. We have been travelling for a long time and never experienced such disgusting behaviour in an overrated club which may have been popular a couple years ago!

All you can drink syrup with a hint of alcohol. Music was great, foam was annoying and slippery but a lot of the party animals liked it. The fee we paid included open bar. My boyfriend basically got pure syrup in all his drinks while I got heavy loads of alcohol on mine (the bars were split up with a ladies only bar and and open bar... i guess for that reason). We would have to trade drinks half the time so he could get a bit tipsy lol. I mean it was the only night we partied... and it was a great night over all pouring into bed around 7 am. that just pissed me off... that they were really nasty and cheap with their alcohol after paying a hefty price to get in. Walk and ask around all the bars around 12th street to see where you get the better bang for your buck. For us, it was this one on that particular night.

Nice place for fun. It is a nice bar and drinks are good, budget friendly also, well as almost everywhere else in Playa, nice music and friendly staff. Good choice if you are looking for a nice afternoon/evening with a drink and great sea view

Amazing time!. I had an awesome time at Blue Parrot! The staff was friendly and even the owners went out of their way to make sure I had a good time. I would definitely go back to this bar next time I'm here and recommend it to friends!

Best massafe at Blue Paradise. We had a relaxing therapeutic massage today with Blue Paradise on the beach at Playa dek Carmen part of Blue Parrot beach club. Thank you to Gaby and Lucia our one hour massage was one of the best ever abd we were both thoroughly relaxed afterwards. Would hughky recommend. Very professional and clean and friendly.

Great time on a sunday night. We went with a group of 10 people, got bottle service (very reasonable prices) and had a nice section roped off and we had a great time. Not as nice as Mandala, but on a sunday night it was pretty crowded and we all enjoyed ourselves very much! I would return next time I am in Playa Del Carmen

Not what is used to be :(. I recently went to Blue Parrot in February on a Saturday night, and it has changed since I visited several years ago. It is mostly (except for one small area) concrete now, and only had one dance floor in operation. The place wasn't very crowded and even by the time we left it was still pretty deserted. The old Blue Parrot was nicer, with more sand floors, more swings at the bar, and the multi-floored lounge-y building is gone :( I also liked that it used to have different dance floors with different types of music (pop area, techno area), but all that was there was loud techno. If I had never experienced the old Blue Parrot maybe I would have liked it more, however the nice Playa feel of sand, dancing and swinging by the bar is long gone. Now you sit in chairs in the middle of the concrete, can enjoy 2 swing chairs, and dance on one small concrete floor to techno. It seems like Blue Parrot tried to move toward a feel of a large techno club, but lost the appeal of being open air, right on the beach, and in downtown Playa del Carmen. I won't be back
Charming Mexican club. Very nice ambience and lovely music ( a mix of house, electro & Latino). It's the place to go to if you want to feel the charm of Mexico and enjoy the moonlight over the sea.

Large place, great late night spot. Blue Parrot has a really great location.. With some of it's property being the actual beach.. As well has having a large bar and a decent sized dance floor.. I was there on a Friday night and it was pretty packed.. but still had space to fit more people... Bartenders are decently quick, drinks are pretty good.. And it's located right at the beginning of 12th making a great starting or ending spot.. It was a 40$ cover.. debatable whether it is overpriced compared to other bars, but still had a good time.

Expensive. Atmosphere isn't what it used to be.. My wife and I went to the Blue Parrot on a Friday night to drink, dance and party. We got two chairs and a table on the sand, but at night they put up a barrier between the bar and the beach, so even though you are on the beach, you don't really feel like it because you cannot really see the water or beach. We wanted to pay cash for our drinks as we went, but were told that we would need to have a credit card and start a tab. What? We did open a tab and at the end of the night our bill was about what we expected but I can see how it wouldn't be hard to end up with an unpleasant surprise at the end of the night with your bill. Also, we paid a cover (I think $10 each or something like that) and drinks were fairly expensive. Two beers and a tequila shot was around $20. There are several areas within the club to party, but things don't really get going until after midnight. After our first night at Blue Parrot we didn't plan on going back but the next night we were standing outside getting a sausage sandwich from a street vendor (awesome sandwiches for just $5 btw) when our server from the Blue Parrot the night before came up to us and said we could get in with no cover this time. So we thought what the heck and went back. Had two beers and a shot of Don Julio, this time for a whopping $40! Needless to say we left after one drink. I doubt we will ever be back. There are much better choices along the beach.

I don't recommend this club AT ALL. I just want to say that im not a picky guys , I really enjoy everything but this night was horrific to me . Where do I start , We started to paid 40 US for the open bar , 40us ? that is good if I have the service that go with . When I enter one of the waiter came at me and ask me what I wanted to drink , he brought me a Rhum N coke it was watery but it was good . This is where it get worst after this drink , I was with one of my mexicain friend and all the drinks that he brought me after was so bad , I mean SO BAD i can't even drink it because it was really bad . So my mexicain friend explain to him that the drink wasnt good and I didn't want anymore drink because I was feeling bad . 15 minutes later he came back with 2 glass of absolute vodka and orange juice and im like I told you that I dont want to drink anymore and he told me that this one was good . So i tryed it and yes actually it was really good until the guys talk my friend and she said that is gonna be 18$ US for this . She loose her mind and she was really pissed about this guys and the guys keep telling her that I asked for this but i didn't said anything because she was the one speaking because she speak spanish . So i didnt have the choice to pay since I already started my drink . To finish we left this BAD club and the next morning , each time I was drinking something at my hotel , I just wanted to puke because I was feeling way too bad . DO NO GO THERE PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY

A GUY PUKED ON THE BEACH!. I was partying my face off, enjoying an incredible night with friends, then things went awry. During the famous fire show, which was about to blow everyone's minds with awesomeness, this drunk dude ran directly through the middle of the show to get to the beach to barf. Instead of getting my mind blown by a sweet show, I got to see some left-handed guy blow chunks on the beach. Despite the short guy tossing his cookies into the gulf, it was an unforgettable night.

WARNING!!!. We just got home from a trip to Playa del Carmen. On Wednesday, October 9, 2013, my husband went to this bar in the evening. The bartender asked to see his credit card and driver's license/identification. He ended up paying cash and his license and credit card were never returned to him. They were stolen from the possession of the bar and were immediately used at nearby ATMs and establishments to steal approximately $1,900. That is dollars, not pesos.

Ladies night. Went to this club twice while in PDC, purely because it was FREE drinks for females until about 3am. Same music each night, but can't complain about the free drinks. Made it a fun start to the night

For your health...STAY AWAY!. I went to this club for a night out with friends. We payed for the open bar (that was $400 pesos) so I was drinking and I couldn't even get drunk or anything, very watery drinks, but that's not the problem, the problem was that around four hours after I came to my hotel, I started to feel pretty sick, I was dizzy and I had to throw up, not once: 5!I had to go to the doctor because I couldnt controle the stomach ache, the vomit and the movement of my hands.I dont know what did they put in those drinks but deffinitely made me sick, THAT'S NOT ALCOHOL I dont know what it is, but my brother had THE SAME SYMPTOMS. I'm mexican, I live in Playa and I've heard that people get sick after going to open bar clubs like CocoBongo or Blue Parrot but I said to myself "its just a myth"... well it's not!I cant go to the authorities because they wont fix it, there's so much corruption that this will never change so there nothing else I can do but warn people not to go/drink there. I hope people listen to me because my brother an I had a ber bad night.

fun night. My friends & I went for a fun night out. We paid $10 for admission & paid for our drinks. The music was good. There were lots of people on the dance floor and we had a great time. The drinks were good. Our server was very nice & although he didnt speak much english he found someone to translate if needed (I can speak a little spanish so it worked out fine). We would go back again!

Awful, stay away!. We were on a night out in Playa del Carmen and this place was recommended to us, oh dear!We were charged $25 each with an all in bar, not too bad we thought, what they didn't mention was the fact it was shutting in an hour!The place itself was empty, drinks were watery and the staff asked for a tip upfront - very cheeky.Take my advice and stay well away, there are much better places to visit.
club on the beach. you can always negociata either pay for the open bar or pay for your entrance and buy your own drinks.

Not what it used to be -- avoid!!. Just to be clear, this is a review about the Blue Parrot bar and not the hotel. I wish I had checked out other reviews before I took friends here a few nights ago. When I had visited in previous years I loved this place, the staff, the casual beach vibe and the nightly fire show.Well the fire show is no more and has been replaced by different "shows" that rotate through the week. The night I was there it was a bizarre Brazilian theme. What really p1ssed me off is that I asked twice (2 different staff members, one outside and one inside) when the fire show was starting and they both told me "soon". Clearly they lied to make sure we went in and spent some money on drinks while we waited for a fire show that was never going to happen.The new décor above the dance floor by the DJ booth is also very weird bordering on creepy with what look like aliens and venus flytraps hanging from the ceiling.When it came time to pay the bill the waiter leaned over and said "Just a reminder, hon, but the tip is not included.". Rude! I worked in the service industry for years and always tip very well. The staff there should be reminded that getting a tip is not a given and in no way is it ok to ask/demand for it.I will NEVER go there again and will make sure to let all of my friends know that there are far better options in town where they can spend their money and have some fun.

Extremely rude staff. I have been at the Blue Parrot club a couple times 2 years ago and it was OK. As I am again on holiday with my girlfriend in Playa we were planning to go again but after today's experience we will keep away from this place: We were lying on the public beach in front of Blue Parrot under one of the few palmtrees a few meters away from the deckchairs of their bar. As there were no guests and the bartender seemed to get bored he entertained himself driving us away from the shadow. He argued that the Blue Parrot had rented the beach in front of their club and we would have to leave and place ourselves somewhere else. I wonder what the strategy of Blue Parrot is to distribute flyers for their club on the main streets behind the club and abuse tourists at the beach side!? Anyway we will never go there again.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I will try to convey how crappy this play is by making a list. I fear that without making a list, my review would become an angry, unintelligible ramble. To add some context, I went here March 2013 with my 5 girlfriends and 2 guy friends. Our group of 8 was solicited outside of the Blue Parrot on 5th avenue. We had wandered here after thinking about going to Coco Bongo and deciding to skip the line and price. The ticket handlers came up to us and told us $25, all drinks included. We all bought tickets in the form of wrist bands. They gave half of us red bands, the other half green. Then the crappiness began. 1. "Tequila" is actually sugar water.The red banded people were allowed to get mixed drinks, while only the green banded people were allowed to get beer. We had all paid the same price and no one thought the colors of the bands meant anything. After an hour of drinking one "mixed drink" (mojito, margarita, etc) after another, we all felt completely sober. My girl friend and I asked the bartender to make our next drink stronger - he looked at us, poured HALF THE GLASS full of "tequila", all the while nodding and grinning in a "you're gonna get sooo drunk" way, and the drink tasted exactly the same as the previous sugar water drinks. There is NO WAY the tequila they use is pure - I doubt it's alcohol at all. 2. Waiters/bartenders shamelessly demand tips.The bartenders will barely look at you if you don't give them tips. And I'm not talking about a packed night, they don't have time or whatever. We got there at 11pm at the height of spring break and there were MAYBE 5 other people there. The bartenders stood and chatted with eachother right in front of our face, ignoring us. We gave them a few bucks in their jar. They glanced over at us and pointed to our wallets and said "more". After every drink that followed, they would say, "don't forget about us at the end of the night, we gave you BEST drinks" (false - see point 1).3. Place is DEAD. Our group went there on a Thursday night. We stayed there from 11pm - 3 or 4am. We kept waiting for the scene to pick up. Nothing. At most there were 20 people in the whole club. 4. All around sucky time. Please don't even consider going. I can't think of anything else but this place deserves to be put out of business, they blatantly rip off their customers through the bracelet all-you-can-drink deal and then simply don't put alcohol in the mixed drinks. They do this because they know people will go there once and not come back - that's why there is no one there, ever. They survive off new tourists who don't know how crappy their establishment is - do yourself and the country of Mexico a favor and let their business die a natural death of bankruptcy.
Lunch on the beach~!. Great guacamole! The location is sweet, watch the waves while drinking a yummy margarita or mojito. Food is usually pretty good.

Outdated and overrated beach club. When you're a night out in PDC you better avoid this club. It cost you a 100 pesos to find out it's almost deserted, wille all clubs arround are crowded. A beer, that in all the bars and pubs on 5th av. will cost you 35 pesos and comes in a bottle with a part lime in it, here will cost you 40 pesos and you'll get it in a can. Not even to mention that when you pay with a 50 pesos bill, the guy behind the bar automatically assumes the 10 pesos is a tip. I'm not a cheap tipper (some day even have been called crazy for over-tipping ;-) ), but I hate it when people take tips without asking. The club exists since 1984, and according to the smell there's never done any maintenance in the toilets or sewer system. I do not want to know how it will smell during the summer when it's getting really hot.
Lost in drunks and drugs. Not qas it used to be anymore. It is just about money and its fancy beach party flair is gone. What a pitty used to be the best nightclub in playa del carmen.

Rip off. New owners have destroyed the blue parrot. Feels like a concrete prison yard now. Rip off prices and watered down alcohol. So called "all you can drink" admission deal which is MEX 500 limits you to one bar which sells watered down spirits. All members of your group have to go to the bar together as it's just one drink per person when ordering. You feel like a convict getting your wrist band checked every 5 minutes. The nights of dancing on the beach with table service are over. Playa del Carmen is beautiful but stay away from this money racket

Dance on the beach but poor service. Loved the idea of dancing on the beach and had fun with the group we went with, but the service was poor. When I asked what type of alcohol they had (as I am allergic to gluten) the lady rolled her eyes and told me it was cheap vodka or cheap rum. I strayed away from this as there was no way of telling if it would make me sick and the lady was quite rude about it. I was going to stick with their no name brand sprite, but was turned off from this when one employee used his hand to scoop the ice. The bar smelled gross... like puke.... The dance floor was the best part along the ocean and the music was pretty decent.. had fun but was disappointed with the bar.

Disgusting.. "all inclusive drinks" was an option of the four cheapest liqours and when we asked for no ice, the bartender scooped it out with his hand and handed us the drink.The whole place smelled like vomit, and was asked about alcohol that my sister could drink as a celiac the barteneder was very rude and pretty much told her there was nothing but this one vodka and when my sister said she couldnt have it the bartender acted like she was being a huge pain. I will never return and i would not reccomend wasting your time or money.

Blue Parrot 5th Av. HORRIBLE. I booked for the Blue Parrot. They took me to one on 5th Av. a Horrible, old, dirty, crappy place. Not a single service, not hot water, not phone, no even good lighting, horrible room, not room service and the ONLY window was to the aisle!! Dont pick thiis hotel. Can ruin your nice time in Playa.

If you like to dance dance. Popular with the younger set- really liked the walk over. Drinks were fine and reasonable group rate open bar available. If it is not raining some kind of fire show happens here. I heard it is cool
Fire show. This place was fun for the fire show but a lot of people offer you drugs and seems a lot were doing them. The setup is great and the music was a lot of fun.

Great Night!!!. Great service at Blue Parrot!!! Our bartender was a super friendly girl from Agentina & she made great recommendations & suggestions. Love the swings at the bar of course :) & there was a foam party & fire show on the night we went. FUN FUN FUN!!!

Open bar free for females. Fire show was really good! Open bar for ladies was pretty good! The nights I went it wasn't that busy but went with a group from the hostel so had a good time! Might be busier during peak season? But for free can't complain!

Disappointed. This spot could have gotten higher ratings because the music was great and I surely danced my butt off but I walked away from there several other nights because I couldn't rightfully patronize. I would be standing outside and observe the men out front approach all the women and never once me , not sure it was a black thing or a solo thing but either way it was a great turn off and the surrounding business got my money instead. The night I did make it in unlike the others I had no problem getting drinks but it must be the cheapest liquor ever because I don't get hangovers or headaches and the next morning my head was throbbing. So the next time I just stuck to beers. The swing bar seats were pretty cool and the dj can spin his butt off , and fireshow very awesome but definitely need for improvements as a whole.

Miss the sand under the swing chairs.. Blue Parrot has been ruined- completely lost it's charm by new owners. Used to be the place to meet for a drink all ages. Laid back atmosphere enjoy your cocktail with your toes in the sand. I remember seeing an awesome band from Belize on stage in the sand. It was a incredible place in 1996 and I will hold the memories dear to my heart. It is a crying same how the owners from New York ruined the charm and turned it into a cement slab night club. Playa deserves to keep its charm. Now the entire block next to the Blue Parrot has been ruined by other night clubs. I'm at a hotel 2 blocks down the beach now and I can hear the pounding from the music which goes on till 4 am nightly. Very Sad. Ps they even drove out the Reggae bar next door cos of the loud techno music they play. Ugh!!
amaizing beach club. that was one of those diferent and exclusive beach club i definitely recomded blue parrot

Had a great time, didn't experience anything negative. I felt compelled to write a review about Blue Parrot, since based on all the horror stories I read on here I almost didn't go! I went with a group of friends for the BPM festival and had a great time, the club was busy, fun and well organised given it was a huge party.The bar staff were spot on - one girl in particular had multitasking skills second to none and was running around serving at least 4 people at once. We were never short changed and our group had plenty of drinks over the night.I don't know what blue parrot is like on a regular day/night, but I'd certainly go back for a another BPM festival party - it was a haven compared to some of the kitch, sleazy bars that you need to walk past to get to it.

Worst experience ever in Playa del Carmen. This was the worst experience ever from te beggining:- i made my reservation 3 months prior to new year weekend, i asked for a double bed room for 3 people, i got a 1 Bed room for 3 adults- everything in the room was given for 2 person from towels, water, etc even though i was charged for persons- the room was dirty even with the prior guest trash, and for a 300 usd per night room its not worth it- the first night they told they werent going to give me the double bed room i reserved, that they only had the one i got and that i could do whatever i wanted and "wished me luck finding hotel on new years eve"- the last night finally they got a doubled bed and they moved my things to that room, and when checking out they charged me 100 usd for a key/lock lost in the move from one room to the other (move done by the hotel staff)Hotel reservaton problems may happen but this hotel never worried about helping us, or to even apologize for the inconvenience,I'd rather not have any vacation at all than reapeting an experience like this at the Blue Parrot Hotel.

Drug Dealers, lies, scams, and thiefs? About sums it up. Do not go here. We were recommended by locals as its the best place to party because it's on the beach, and you can party on the beach at night. This is a false truth. Part of it is on the beach, but it is boarded off. We were looking for an all inclusive drink club, and were approached by promoters outside the entrance saying girls can drink for free if the guys all pay 40$ for all you can drink. Sounds like a great deal no?We went in, no matter what we did we could not get a drink. They screwed the guys around like no tomorrow. We were told that only one part of the bar did all inclusive drinks, so we waited for a drink. Got to the bartender and he told us they didn't do the all inclusive at that part, it was at the other end of the bar. So we waited at the other end, surprise, he told us it was at the other end of the bar not there. So we waited at the other end, only to be told" you didn't listen? i told you its at the other end of the bar", i told him the other bartender said to go to him and he said well that's the only place we can get drinks.Now after 3 times of trying to get drinks we get a drink, i order 4 shots of tequila in a glass (ya kinda filthy but i was wanting to drink!), what do i get, a dixie cup of watered down orange juice?!So no drinks, this happened to all of us guys, and the girls got nothing but water. Asking for a vodka and 7up, got a tiny bit of vodka and water. WTF!?Now to the other part, you will get harassed for cocaine, non stop, everywhere you go in this bar. It's obvious that the management is associated with the cartel, or this would not be allowed. I mean i must have been asked if i wanted cocaine maybe 10 times in the hour we were there. The worst part? I go to the men's washroom, and as i go in 'im asked if i want cocaine, i say no gracias, i got to the urinal, while peeing, i get a guy on either side of me very close, asking me if i want cocaine, one being the one i already said no to, and the other being the bathroom attendant(useless person). I told them to get the *#&$ away from me, i was enraged. They left me alone, i go to walk out and the bathroom attendant tries to give me paper towel i said no thank-you, then he stood in front of the door asking/demanding a tip, i said no and squeezed past him. Walked out of the washroom and all my friends, 8 of us, were waiting for me a the exit. Worst bar/nightclub in playa del carmen by far.

Total rip off!!. My husband and I went to this club because it was free cover.. Once inside it was almost completely empty and were told the night show would be at midnight instead of 11pm(like the advertisements said), which was fine. We were seated and asked if we'd like a drink. They have NO drink menus so prices are unlisted anywhere. I ordered a sprite/vodka and my husband ordered a rum punch. Once the drinks cane out they were tiny and very weak. Guess how much they charged us for those 2 drinks??? $18 US. The fire show was neat but not worth it.

Rip Off. Stay away! We bought passes for 10 dollars each and were told the ladies drank free. When we checked out they would not honor that program. We had to pay 135 for drinks. When we complained they were not flexible. STAY AWAY FROM THIS RIP OFF BUSINESS. This was the only bad experience of our trip. Bathrooms were filthy and half of urinals did not work.

Loved the fire show. We went to the Blue Parrot to see the fire show. We got there around 10:45 and got a front row seat which was awesome. The show was amazing. Trying to find our waiter when we wanted to pay an leave was difficult...no one seemed to know who he was, and since it was dark we couldn't identify him either. I would definately go for the show.

Worst Manager Experience EVER!!!. I stayed at the blue parrot before, and lets face it, its a nice beach 3 or 4 star hotel, you cant ask much for what you are paying for. The hotel has a night club by the same name, and here is where my problems began. I paid $25 for an open bar until 5am, unfortunately i had to discover while in the club, that the information i was given was completely inaccurate. When i called the manager to express my frustration i found a displeasing surprise, at first i thought this guy Juan Pablo wasnt the manager because he was drunk and not polite at all, but i was assured by the rest of the staff he was the manager of the club. After arguing for over 20 minutes whether i heard wrong or what the policy of the club is, or the laws in Mexico i wasnt given any option....lets be honest i could had misheard what the lady who sold me the service or that actually i was misled, but the last thing i was expecting was to be told "take it or leave it", the whole issue could had been solved by confirming the information with her sales employees, but he was not willing to do so. I had the most amazing time at Playa del carmen's night clubs, and Blue Parrot club wasnt the exception until that night. My recommendation for all clubbers....beware of the very rude management at Blue Parrot night club, i hope you dont come across any inconvenience or a reason to speak to the manager there....good luck if you do.

NICE FIRE SHOW...BUT BECAREFUL WITH CHARGES. as you enter they push to charge you a cover....i told the guy i'm going to sit down and have a few drinks and watch the showso, he says forget about the cover, but you need to spend a min amount.the drinks were at least 7 bucks u.s., not to mention they are watered down...they keep coming back to sell you more drinks.the fire show was nice, though i just didn't feel comfortable there.i go to use the bathroom and some guy, that had a blue parrot shirt on pushed to sell drugs in the bathroom.the late night streets have many drug pushers...so use common sense

Fun place but yes will rip you off if not careful!!!. This is a really fun place and the fire shows are great. But, some are right on when they tell you about pushy waiters who overcharge tremendously, lie about your bill and take away your full beers. Do not let Ramon wait on you! It's a shame because it could have been a really memorable experience until right at the end when they tried to rip us off. My wife and I both are over 40 and did not drink enough to lose track of what we had. We settled for about twenty dollars more than what we actually spent just to get out of there but left no tip. You would hope that a place that enjoys this level of popularity would not act like some off-the-road hole in the wall. Do NOT keep an open tab but buy only one round at a time. Lesson learned but I won't go back to a Blue Parrot again.

Legendary ...on the Beach. I Know A Guy - that always shows me the best places in Playa Del Carmen - but we always end up here - Always. It's just an incredible place to be and the best place to see 'The Fire Show'. Wide and open - you can always find a table in the sand - feel the breeze off the ocean, see the lights of Cozumel across the water, feel the full moon and still be part of the heat coming off the dance floor. And there is heat, this is party central. Service is great, the people friendly and you meet others from around the world on a tiny little piece of sand. 5 Ave is home to many awesome clubs and bars but night time here is special. This strip of clubs on 12 Norte is really where it all revolves around - right up to Cocobongo on 10 Ave- party central. The Blue Parrot is the anchor, the heart of it's end of the road. And it's the best place to view the Fire Show - the world famous, best kept secret in Playa. Do not miss it. I love it so much I shot video and posted it on YouTube Blue Parrot - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YfQ0zKuF3wkFire Show - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MhtD3k72gMMWhen in Playa - if you didn't go to the Blue Parrot - then you didn't go clubbing

What once Playa's institution has gone down hill. We stayed here two previous times in the past 10 years, this was the most expensive, most disappointing stay. Stayed at a suite, no extra sheets for pull out, AC not working, no water pressure. Stayed beachside, but not exactly a beach view. Bar was overpriced and loud.

Blue Parrot offers you the best massage from the private terrace over looking the ocean. Martina has been giving therapeutic massages, reflexology, Reiki and aromatherapy since I started visiting Playa in 2003.I head straight to her to book a massage, probably two while I am on vacation.Martina's massages are far superior to any you will get on the beach. She is a licensed professional unlike many on the beach.Martina is very calm, her gentle manor is relaxing and her massages are wonderful.She is situated high up above with a view of the beach and the only sound is the lapping of the waves. I highly recommend a visit to her while in Playa, you will be glad you did.

Awesome fire show!! Good music starts after it!!!. The music is cheesy at first but then the fire show starts around 11pm and they do it to good music and after that the music and energy in this place on the beach is awesome! It is 100 pesos per person to get in after 10 pm.Had a great time dancing until 4AM on a Saturday night!!!

Great Fireshow, best location for dancing. We were a group of four (2 couples) and were told by our Concierge that Blue Parrot was the place to go for entertainment and dancing on the beach. We got there a little early before the fireshow and had a table near the dance floor where they perform -- it was AMAZING!! No cover charge because we were early. Drinks were good, priced the same as most places in town and we danced all night!!!

Gone down hill in only two years. Went to the Blue Parrot Beach Club in September of 2008. Had a great experience with our new friends. Staff was great and cost of drinks weren't bad. We went back on Tuesday, September 21, 2010 and had a lot of disappointment. When we got there we thought it was great that there was no admission fee. We were with the same friends as we were with two years ago. We got 4 shots of tequila and there couldn't have been a little more than a tea spoon in each plastic cup. We than ordered four bottles of beer and a bottled water. The waiter was trying to charge us $65 US dollars for the shots, beer & water! One of our friends went to a bar and was told she didn't have the correct color band on her wrist, so he couldn't serve her. When I went to the bathroom, there was no toilet paper. A lady was handing out paper towels and then there was a tip jar on the counter! The music wasn't too great. We were really looking forward to spending several nights at the Blue Parrot, but the only thing we enjoyed the one night we visited was watching the fire show that was put on on the beach.

Stay Clear, Avoid at all Costs!. By all means this bar truely is terrible. 10:00PM - We show up to the bar after it being recommended to us by a stranger on the beach (looking back, HUGE red flag). Cover charged was waved because we had such a big group (11), all we had to do was dance. Deal, done. At this point, everything was perfect10:20PM - Two buckets of beer were placed on our table. Awesome service, right? (again, looking back, HUGE red flag) Well, we were felling good and these cold beers couldn't get any better. 10:45PM - We powered through the first two buckets and order a second round. The buckets were at our table before our converstation was finished. We decided to take advantage of this excellent service and ask for a couple of waters. We asked, they delivered. Four luke warm bottles of water. No worries. The beer is cold. 11:00PM - First bathroom break. I was greeted by a gentlemen in the restroom asking if I was interested in some drugs. This is Mexico, didn't think anything of it and ignore the guy. Upon leaving the restroom the man wouldn't let me leave until I acknowledge his presence. That was a close call. But, I've got beer waiting at the table - I'm not too worried.11:02PM - Get back to the table...where's our beer?! Come to find out, it started raining, lightly, so the bartender decided upon himself to take our beers out of the rain. Kind of funny, but I guess he's just being nice...11:10PM - I find our beer. There's only 2 left in each bucket..odd, we didn't drink that fast. I confront the bartender about it and he replies by telling me that's the amount of beer that was in the bucket when he moved it. 11:15PM - We didn't appreciate being lied to, we asked for our tab and we'll be leaving. 11:30PM - At the least, 15 minutes later the man comes out with the tab. $140.00. 20 beers & 4 waters. We confront the man and ask how the total reached such a high number. He points to the menu, which lists the beer at $4.00 dollars. But, because we opened a tab with a credit card, there was a $2.00 surcharge for each beer? At this point, we simply say we're not paying that amount. He leaves only to come back a short time later with two large...very large mexican men. We stay strong to our word and say we're not paying that amount. He tells us that there's nothing we can do. The card's been run for the amount on the receipt. Looking at the three men, we figured there's really nothing we can do at this point. 11:45PM - Left the worst bar in Playa. AVOID THIS BAR AT ALL COSTS!!

Blue Parrot will rip you off. I went with a group of ten couples to the Blue Parrot last week. We were initially happy because we were let in without a cover charge and they took us to a large table near the dance floor. We asked for some buckets of beer and the waiter insisted on keeping a tab for us. We should have been suspicious but didn't think anything of it. We drank and danced for a couple of hours and asked for the bill. We knew we had 5 buckets of beer with 5 bottles in each. The server brought us a bill for 38 beers, 6 waters, and 2 mixed drinks. He was trying to claim that there were 8 bottles of beer in each of the buckets when they clearly wouldn't hold more than 5. We also caught him twice trying to walk away with one of our buckets that still had a beer left in it. After arguing with management they ended up charging us $200 US instead of the original $250 that they asked for, still a total rip-off and ruined our night. DO NOT GO TO THE BLUE PARROT!!!!

Be prepared to get aggressive and fight with these people.. You will have to fight to get what you want. After having read and been told earlier that day, that is was 30 dollars for guys and girls drink for free, we get there and get told there is no open bar. After fighting with the guy for 8 minutes the open bar suddenly becomes available but for 30 a person, women are not free. After ending up so pissed off, I couldn't even enjoy the fireshow.

A good place to start, but don't stay. Went to the Blue Parrot with two 18 year old girls, and a 20 year old boy. While we were on the beach we saw that it was ladies night so we went to Playa. It was a Monday night and was still hustling and bustling. We went to the Blue Parrot and got drinks for free while the boy with us had to pay so he ending up leaving and getting free drinks elsewhere and then coming back. The Blue Parrot is mainly an outdoor club, with one covering over the bar. I'm not sure if it was just because it was ladies night, but only one section of the bar would serve to the ladies. This side was very busy, and full of young girls who had never been to bars before or even drank. They said there was a single file line, and I told them that's not how a bar works. I finally got a kamikaza drink, which was decent, but probably only had about 2 shots in a full red cup. Then I got another drink from a group of girls which tasted like sugar and rum, which I ended up giving to a stranger. The dance floor is a tiny stage where you can dance which was fun. Keep in mind most of the club is made of sand, so flipflops would be preferred. We went to the bathrooms which was a very small room, and not even worth it! Blue Parrot was a fun place to start the night, but wouldn't stay there all night!

RIP OFF ON DRINKS. Wats up guys. I went to Blue Parrot yesterday. I saw a great fire show with girls throwing fire at each other. Everything was nice before I ordered a bottle of beer, $4USD. Four dollars for only one bottle, thats is very expensive, true rip off. In New Jersey, USA, I can get a bottle of beer for only $2USD in all bars and free peanuts. In the rest of Playa, if you venture out and find a local bar that will serve you two or more bottles of beer for the same price. It is trully a great rip off which spoiled my mood for the rest of my night. I left the bar after the show. I would never go there again and will never recommend to any one to go there. This bar does not deserve for me to post a picture for them.

Great show!. Hi guys, if you are looking for great show on the beach, you should see the fire show in Blue Parrot! I cannot say its perfect and it is really good and very romantic! You get this vibe of romance, Caribe breeze and warm atmosphere! I really enjoy it every time I see it. Performance is really good and especially when it is done on the warm Caribbean night, with the sound of waves- it becomes real magic! So, if you are in Playa, please visit, the show starts I believe around 10-11pm! You will not be disappointed and will definetely enjoy every minute!

Dont waste your time or money.. Rum & Coke's are $7.50 US and all the drinks are under pored. The DJs play songs off their computer and think its DJ-ing.The music is the same 12 overly played songs that have already been burnt out like: Tonight is gona be a good night, My poker face, Sexy girl, etc.It seemed like all the employes think its cool to be an dicks to the costumers,It's been like this every time I've gone and finally I've had enough and will not ever go back.

Great spot if you are looking for a bar on the beach with good music and dance floor.. I went with some friends here and had a good time. There are tables on the beach, as well as a big dance floor with lights and good music. A nice evening out.

Great day staff, snotty night staff. The day staff and security at the Blue Parrot were great. I felt like a valued guest of the Suites and safe walking at all hours...with a security staff around 24/7.My room in the Suites was as indicated on website. Cleaning and front desk staffs were very accomidating. Close to beach, nice continental breakfast.Great location near the action. However the night-time beach club bartenders were rude..and not just once. All three nights I was there, and another night I visited with friends.

Still In Two Minds. The first time we went there, it was ladies drunk for free night and there was an amazing fire show. We really enjoyed this night although the free drinks were pretty weak and there was a limited option to choose from. Fire show not to be missed though!!The second time we went there, there was no offers or shows on inside but as we enjoyed it the previous night we wanted to go just for some drinks. On arrival we asked the bouncer at the ropes (the beach area is cornered off by ropes to stop people getting in for free) if they were still open and if there was a charge to get in as it was pretty late. The bouncer seemed really off with us, he wanted 70 pesos each to get in and told us we had to walk all the way around the front on the building to get in (instead of him just letting us in under the ropes as they normally do every night). We decided to give it a miss after talking with him but as we walked off a member of staff run up to us and asked if we'd like to come in, it was free of charge tonight. We explained about the bouncer, the member of staff seemed really annoyed by this and asked us to wait while he cleared things up with the bouncer. We could hear them arguing for a few minutes and then they both walked over to us. The bouncer looked really pee'd off and was still asking for money from us, so they started arguing again... after a few more minutes the bouncer demanded ID from us all or we werent coming in (we are two couples in our late 20's). In the end he let us in but we felt uncomfortable with the constant stares all night so left after a drink.Im really not sure if I would drink here again. Fusion Bar was just up the beach from this, which also have a fire show. I found this beach bar to be much more friendly and no cost to get in.

Favorite Beach Club to Relax. I really enjoyed this laid back beach club. Until the hurricane they had one of the best spots in Playa del Carmen to swim. The swings are fun and the food and drink package with lounge chair is an excellent deal.

okay...but the schedule was a bit off. We went to the Blue Parrot after walking up and down the beach looking for two other bars that had been recommended on Trip Advisor that were supposedly nearby. We found one, but it was either closed or empty. Never found the other at all; anyway it was after 10 when we finally decided to just go to the BP tio see the fireshow. We ordered beers and got front row seats. Drank the beer and our waiter assured us the show would start in a few minutes. Well at about midnight, it finally did start. It was good and we were close enought to feel the heat from the fires. A girl came around to collect money for the performers during the show, but oddly enough only to our table??? Atr the last minute a large group of people came in and sat on the ground in formnt of our front row table and ordered nothing and gave no donation....oh well. We paid 2o USD plus tip for three beers and a coke. Been there- done that.

Cheese....cheese....cheese!!. The blue parrot reminds me of one of those cheesy clubs down in Tijuana that is packed with either middle-aged tourists or teens not yet old enough to drink in San Diego. All the same ultra-cheese pop songs like "Electric Slide", "Whoomp, there it is", and others of the same ilk. On top of that, the staff seems rather snooty like they work at the hotsh*t place on the beach and won't even look at you while they take your $10 per drink. Gimmie a break! This place is so full of tourists, its absolutely laughable. The highlight of the 20 minutes my wife and I spent at this establishment was looking at all the middle aged losers make a complete fool of themselves on the dance floor. Alas, even that little amusement turned from funny to sad rather quickly. We high tailed it out of there to find a place with a little more "local appeal".If you want an authentic playa nightlife experience, stay away from this place. If you want to order a "moe-heetoe" next to a group of tourists from the midwest US, that just got off their cruise ship, then head on down to the Blue Parrot.

Fun swings, great dance floor, amazing fire show, but a bit expensive!. Blue Parrot is located right on the beach which makes it a great place to hang out. The drinks are some of the more expensive in town (yet still nothing compared to america!) and it's fun to sit on the swings at the bar. We went to the fire show our last night in town and it was absolutely incredible. The dance floor has great music and I can be quoted for saying "This is where the locals come to watch how bad the American dancers are!!!" Regardless, it's still a fun place to hang out for a bit and you can't beat being right on the ocean.

Playa is changing. Over the years Blue Parrot has owned various properties near their current location. Their hotel is now located a block from the beach, with ocean views if you climb to the rooftop terraces. It's two blocks to their beach side restaurant and club. We found the lodging to clean and well maintained. Our unit had a kitchenette and a wonderful private balcony overlooking the small pool. There is construction across the street, but that should be done this season.Playa is changing. When we first visited 10+ years ago, it was a small, quaint town. Now it's becoming overgrown, with huge condos and immense all-inclusives. Fortunately there seems to be a height restriction. So it won't look like Cancun. The beaches are becoming crowded. We miss the old Playa del Carmen! Never the less we had a marvelous time.

Never Go To The Blue Parrot!!. Never Ever will i go back to the blue Parrot!it was a waste of money!the drinks have no alcohol even though they charge you 5 bucks a drink; alcoholic or non.They charged us for 12 beers for a bucket of beer; so the waiter brought out 12 beers and he had to carry them and they were over flowing out of the bucket, and they told us that is what we ordered.which was NOT TRUE!in a bucket there is about 10 beers and they took all the bottles so we couldn't tell them we only had ten in the bucket!so they kicked us out,worst service; they rip you off so horribly!Blue Parrot in Playa Del Carmen is the worst NightClub i've ever been to.

WILL Never go back!. My group also had a similiar story as others. We went there for 2 for 1 night and ended up paying 4x the correct amount. Marco-our waiter not only took advantage of us, but charged us too much and would not even give us a written bill. This after we bought him a shot! Then when we went to leave-Marco ducked out.I don't recommend going to this bar-it is not worth it! There are other spots on the beach that have the same view and are honest and don't take advantage of their customers.

don't waste your time. We went to the Blue Parrot after a delicious dinner and good margaritas to have some fun (drinks and dancing) on the beach. We ended up infuriated and completely sober. The margaritas were the worst I have ever had in my entire life-- it tasted like sugar with a dash of lime juice and a spritz of tequila. We were there early which meant there were not a lot of people. We attempted to get our waiters attention so we could exchange the drinks. He failed to appear even after another waiter was told to get him. Finally we went up to the bar and returned the drinks and got beers. 5 minutes later our waiter arrived at our table. He then claimed that it wasn't his or the bars problem that the drinks tasted horrific and that becuase we did not exchange them through him, if we didn't pay he would be paying for them out of his pocket. I kindly explained that we had waited 15 minutes for him and he said he had other tables to deal with. He then disappeared for another ten minutes and came back with a round of margaritas. Not on the house. He insisted they were a different recipe. They tasted the same. He didn't care. So we forked over the money (overpriced drinks at that) and left. On our way out we passed his waiter zone. There was one table. Of two people. Laziness and disregard for the quality of service and drinks makes me warn all against this place. Oh, and the bars promotion of dishonesty and disrespect by their staff to their customers. It's a shame places like this exist. Go to Fusion instead. Fun relaxed live music good drinks.

Be careful what you order. We spent one night at the Blue Parrot after dinner, and for the most part enjoyed the music and atmosphere, but there always seemed to be a problem with our drink order. There were four of us at our table, and it was not busy since we were there early. On two occasions we were given double the beers that we ordered (normally not an issue for us Canadians) and it wasn't 2-for-1 prices. I guess they figured they would save time and bring us twice as much as we wanted, but only two of us were drinking beer so they go warm after a while. We had one round of tequila shots which came in those tiny plastic sample cups, and afterwards we figured they charged us 70 pesos each. My advise would be specific to the waiter what you order, and if you order any cocktails or shots ask them the price first. Lastly, some guy by the washroom asked me if I wanted to buy some drugs. In our two week stay in Playa with many trips into town and other bars and disco, this was the only time I was approached.

2 for 1 Sundays/great beach bar. Don't miss out on the 2 for 1 drinks every Sunday afternoon. At night there are 2 different DJs. One plays music we typically hear in New York City clubs (techno, dance, etc...), and the other DJ plays a mix of popular music from the 70s to the present. The fire show is very entertaining and worth seeing. You can also schedule a snorkeling trip and dive trip at the Blue Parrot. Jerry is a great waiter and works on the beach during the day. We frequented the Blue Parrot for 3 weeks and did experience 2 slimy waiters. One tried to cheat us on the bill (restaurant waiter) and another grabbed my butt (night waiter). However, ask for Jerry and you will be taken care of. We will return!

Will never go there again!!!. What a rip off!!!! They charge a $10 per person cover at the door and we found out after we left that we were supposed to get two beers with that admission. They never told us that and someone took our beer tickets, that we didn't know they were, up as we walked in the door. We ordered three vodka and red bulls and one beer and were told the bill was $50. After we complained, he then said "no, I'm sorry I made a mistake, it is $45". Instead of using one can of red bull, they sent three cans to the table, as an obvious way to increase the ticket. So in review, four people, in the bar for ten minutes with one round of drinks = $85. Upon talking with other guests, we found many similar stories about visiting the Blue Parrot bar. I started going to the Blue Parrot in 1997, and it used to be a real cool place to go, but I plan on never returning. It is now a tourist trap that obviously the main goal is to gouge the patrons. I recommend you avoid the Blue Parrot, and go somewhere your business is appreciated and you don't have to worry about getting ripped off!!!!

Could be fun....but sketchy. Okay...given the right circumstances I would love this bar. It's a very cool layout. I noticed they had space to do private parties which I would definitely do. But on a Saturday night it was a little too Spring Breaky for my taste. We personally saw and heard employees/bartenders blowing coke in the bathroom. So I would watch out for that. And during the beach Fire Show, they tried to pull the one person bumps into you and while you're distracted the other guy picks your pocket. So there's just quite a bit of sketchiness going on. And it seemed like they had no real set prices for cocktails, and no drink menu.Just with any place you're not used to, be careful.

great fire show, decent priced drinks. great bar, it really gets going around 12:30ish. they have a $10 cover charge sometimes, but don't be daunted by that, it comes with 2 beers or 1 "national" drink. they have swings by the bar for you to sit on. the music is good, but is a bit repetitive. i dont know why blue parrot is always crowded, and the coco maya across from it is not ..the coco maya has a better ambiance and larger area, has better music, but no crowds. the fire show at blue parrot is really nice, we went back 3 times and enjoyed the show each time.

See and be seen, get lost in paradise!. We were eating at a the terrace one night and we saw all those trendy well dressed, European style people passing by and going down the street. We were wondering where they were heading. We though there was a special event or a big party down the street. Turns out they were all going to a place called The Blue Parrot. It is a beautiful hot spot and I was invited to go there the night after by a man I meet at my resort. We spent an amazing evening talking while sitting in the swings at the bar (and sharing few kisses). It was very romantic. The bar and the dancing area on the beach are beautiful. The music was great, everyone was having a good time. It's a great place to meet people from around the world, for singles and couples who want to dance and party in a paradise setting.If you go to Playa, you must go at least one night.

The best. If you want to have fun , blue parrot is the correct place I was there during Christmas time and the place is really cool, the staff was very friendly and helpful, much better than other clubs , you can dance while you admire the night at the caribean sea. I just think waitress at the bar should be more polite, maybe they had a bad day.

Wedding Rehearsal Dinner at Blue Parrot - Excellent. I had the rehearsal dinner for my wedding at the Blue Parrot in November 2007. I could not be more pleased. We rented the VIP terrace for our small group of 25 guests. The location was perfect for our group. We had a private bar/bartender and served plated fajitas. The food and drinks were fairly average, but the location and the service were absolutely excellent. The wedding itself was not on the beach, so it was nice to have this event right on the water. I made all the arrangements over email with Paula, the events manager. She was promt with replies and provided everything we needed (menus, contracts, etc.). They were able to meet our budget, which was about $40/person. We met Paula at the hotel a few days before the event to look at the location, the final menu, and final payment. We decided to use the free wooden furniture/chairs rather than rent fancy white ones. The free ones are just fine. They are very rustic and look great in the candlelight.Paula reserved the entire group ring-side seats at the fireshow which occurs every Friday. The only thing that I think could be improved, was that we were told the fireshow started at 10:30, so we moved everyone from our private area to the public beach area at 10:30 and the show itself did not start until after midnight which was a little hard on the old folks. But, it was definately worth the wait. The fire show is one of the highlights of my entire week in Playa.Immediately after the event, my fiance and I went to the hotel office to settle the bill. Everything was as we had agreed upon - there were no extra charges, or charges which we doubted (unlike at the actual wedding!).I would highly recommend planning an event at the Blue Parrot (there was another group celebrating the actual wedding there and it looked very nice). The planning is up to American standards in terms of response time and all charges being on the table at the beginning (another big difference from my hotel wedding!).

Scandal. Our waiter tried to rip us off and then threatened to call the police on us. Although the experience was entertaining -- the waiter was a complete snake. Luckily the bartender came out and told the truth, that we had paid for certain drinks at the bar - otherwise they may have called the police on us. Which they had threatened over and over. Very slimey waiter -- but the view was great and the food was good too. I guess we did provide good entertainment for the locals and tourists but it was a real shame that they tried to manipulate us because we were tourists.

Worst bar in playa. My family and friends were in Playa (our 13th trip) and we always try new bars...This was the worst we had ever been too, the drinks were served to us WITHOUT alcohol, and when I asked the waiter for a different drink, he physically pushed me and grabbed my arms for accusing him...Very poor service and no method to speak to supervisors. There is a bar just to the left of this one and next door named, "OHM" that are really good and we ended our nights there after the horrible time at the Blue Parrot.

Great bar, fun music and dancing. So, if you're looking for a fun place to party on the beach, this is it! We came here one night after dinner and it was pretty full. They were playing typical american club music, and I assume most of the patrons were american or european, but it was tons of fun! We stayed for the fire dancing show at 11 PM and it made our evening. I'd recommend that anyone looking for a beachside club in PDC at least stop in and see if it's what you're looking for.
Very Private and Romatic. Very nice... clean and quaint. Close to everything. Nice rooms, very nice staff. right on the best beach. Great Bar!

Blue Parrot Blues. After reading all the rave reviews about this bar, I convinced my sisters we needed to go there one night while visiting Playa del Carmen. What a tourist trap! The actual bar itself is beautiful and very big. It had big wooden swings for seats, but so do most other bars on Avenita Quinta. The bartenders were very nice, and that's where my compliments end. Our waiter wasn't very helpful when we asked him about drinks and he was hard to find. If you are loyal to a brand of liquor, chances are they don't have it at the Blue Parrot. No top shelf gin or vodka. And forget about mixing it up with locals or European visitors. The bar was filled with Americans dancing to music that an adult contemporary radio station would play. We left after the DJ started playing "Oh What a Night!" If you are under 40-- chances are you will not like this place.

Nice place to stay. I have read all the negative reviews and would like to let you know that our experience at the Blue Parrot Suites was great. The room was clean, nice and large (one-bedroom suite), and all the grounds area were always nice and clean. I didn't have any problems with the internet reservations but I did email the hotel to confirm my reservation since I do this no matter where I stay in the USA or International. We have stayed at many hotels or small hotels in Playa and each and everyone has been nice. You just have to remember that things are not like the US. The four & five star Mexican hotels don't match the USA stars. The kitchen was stocked with many dishes and pots & pans. The only complaint that I would have is that the refrigerator was not big enough to hold any thing but the liquor, etc that the hotel wanted you to purchase.

Blue Parrot Hotel, one of the worst I´ve ever bben. This hotel have the worst service I had ever received.I have travel a lot of times to Cancun and Playa del Carmen, and it’s very disappointing to see that a beautiful hotel like the Blue Parrot suites have the worst service ever.I made my reservation by internet and they just didn’t booked it.After my arrival to the hotel I talked with the reservation people by phone and they told me that they had my reservation on line and there was no problem with it . They’ve even described me the room that I asked for BY PHONE.When I arrived to the hotel the receptionist told me that they had mi reservation but in a more smaller room that the one that I asked for by internet and by phone ( and for the same price!!!!.... I mean the expensive one), after a lot of problems and discussions, I told them that their were giving a very bad service and all, they told me this exactly….. SO IF YOU ARE NOT HAPPY WITH OUR SERVICE OR THE ROOM THAT WE GAVE YOU, YOU CAN LIVE THE HOTEL RIGHT NOW BUT WE ARE GOING TO CHARGE YOU ALL 4 DAYS BECAUSE WE HAVE AN OPEN BOUCHER OF YOUR CREDIT CARD!!!!.I’m really very disappointed with this hotel and I do not recommend it at all, and in this comment I’ am just giving you one of the many unpleasant moments that I had in that hotel.

Overpriced, poor service. I live in Mexico city and have traveled to Playa and the Riviera Maya several times. I have to say the blue parrot was a huge disappointment. Of course I have had poor experiences with hotels but this time we paid US$160 a night so our expectations were set a little higher.The reason is very simple, VERY POOR SERVICE AND TOTALLY OVERPRICED, OVERRATED. Our reservation was not respected; service is slow and they just won't care cause they are always fully booked; really loud. At our checkout they were even trying to charge $100 extra. And a very important factor, the reception and restaurant are a block away from the rooms (yes, at a different location), so every time you ask for something you can sit down and see your day go by.Believe me, it was not just me, the reception was crowded of unhappy people complaining everyday. Do yourself a favor and stay at a different, much cheaper hotel. This is absolutely not worth it.
Great Location by the Beach. Fantastic location and the staff is awesome. Would recommend to anyone.

No mas Charm at Blue Parrot...Loud Musica!. Blue Parrot used to be a charming hotel. You could sit at the swing bar and stick your feet in the sand. Now they have cemented over the sand and play annoying techno music all night. I could not sleep in the evenings....Music plays extremely loud until 4 am...I had spoken to other people who stayed next door at a different hotel and said they couldn't sleep either. Between the Blue Parrot and the Pirate bar competing against each other with thier LOUD Musica don't plan on a good nights sleep. I like to party like the next person, but for some reason the city of Playa Del Carmen does not have any laws on noise control on the beach in the evening....The city fines the businesses on 5th ave for loud noise, but at the beach they seem to not care....Be very careful on this choice! Bring ear plugs! You can't find them in town!
Great place.... Don't miss the fire dancers on weekends!Bottom line playa del carmen Rocks!

Nawlins give Blue Parrot hotel a Thumbs Up !. We were there week of Sept. 9th 2006 - Hotel transportation pick up was great, greeted us and off to the hotel. Victor and Carlos checked us in, studio was great. Great view of water and gardens room 213. Service was excellent. They called us every other day to see how our stay was going. We had family in 2 other rooms and they enjoyed there stay just as much as us. No problem with noise from clubs, security always on duty at hotel. Clubs were popping, location of hotel was great, walk to dinner every night. Finding NFL football was a bit of a challegne BUT we found it !!! There is a little bar next to hotel next to us that was 2 for 1 after 1p.m. they had good food and drink specials! We walk to Wal-mart that is quiet a walk about 7 blocks( taxi back for sure). We bought stuff for lunch and sodas. Went snorkling with one of the boats Capt ED. did some fishing it was okay not the season for fishing. Overall Blue Parrot was great, We will return again coming from mid aged folks too. Loved the convenience and location. We were there for Mexican Celebration of Independence that was fun too. So all you people concern about Noise from clubs and Construction - didn't effect us at all. Hats off to Blue Parrot and Staff !

Review of the club not the hotel. We stayed in Playacar but came here twice on nights out. The first night was a Sunday and was very quiet but we still had a good night. We went again on another night (I can't remember which sorry!) and it was really busy and we had an amazing night!No problem getting served at the bar and the bar staff were friendly. We went later the second time and had to pay to get in but you are then given a voucher for either one free drink or two free beers so it really works out the same anyway!As you come in there is some stone semi circle seating areas and then there are some TINY tables and chairs - think of a reception classes furniture at primary school! These are on a sand floor and infront of them is a sand dance floor, there are a few rugs laid down to dance on if you find it easier. There were also four large speakers you could dance on in this area.Behind this was a few steps up to another seating area with stylish but no so comfortable seats. This was just near the DJ booth.This area played proper dance music, we enjoyed it here even though this isn't our kind of music.There was a large bar in the middle with swings as seats round it, the novelty didn't wear thin on us we loved them! We have about a thousand pictures of me on them. lol it's like "theres me on a swing, theres another of me on a swing, oh and thats another of me on a swing, a few more of me on a swing" lol....The best bit of the club was the wooden dancefloor on the beach...we danced here even in the rain. The music was RnB and hip hop which I love but even though my boyfriend doesn't love it he still had one of the best nights of his life.It was crowded enough to have a great atmosphere but not so much that you couldn't dance/find a seat etc.Brilliant night out! Highly reccomended!!! Best place in Playa Del Carmen that we went to easily!

Can't wait to go back!. We actually traveled to Playa Del Carmen and stayed at the Blue Parrot twice this past summer. Once in July for a week and in August for 3 days. Needless to say we love it there. There was some consturction noise, but it didn't effect our trip. The second time we stayed in the "rear studio" it was louder there. If you are concerned about noise, don't take that room. Otherwise, the rear studio is the best deal in Playa. Its the same as the other studio's and opens up to the same courtyard that you see on the website, except that it is the first unit as you walk into the courtyard. I thought it was worth the $50 per night savings to be only 10 feet further from the beach.

Great Memories at the Blue Parrot. I went to the Blue Parrot twice (23rd and 25th) during my stay in Playa Del Carmen in August. By far, this was the best place to go and party. Not only did they play great music, but the beach setting just topped things off. People were super friendly. I danced with people from all over (Israel, Italy). There were security guards all around the perimeter of the beach to ensure that clubgoers don't run off into the ocean intoxicated. However, they were the most respectful and allowed lovebirds to go about their business without any interference. If top 40 music isn't to your liking, then there is a second room that primarily played techno/house music. I never danced in there, but from watching, the room seemed like fun as well and catered perhaps to same-sex couples and gays. Overall, it was an incredible atmosphere in the club. I would most definitely go back the next time I am in Playa.

Blue Parrot still the best.. I was at the Blue Parrot earlier this year and had a great time. Staff was courteous and helpful, room was spacious and clean(although we weren't in it much), and guest services totally rocked. If the hotel is booked up you should still check out the beach bar anytime of day. It has the best people watching during the tanning hours and the best club after dark. I've been to Playa many times and have stayed at the parrot when I could. Only when its booked solid have I stayed elsewhere. Other places in town where fine but as far as location, services, and entertainment go you can't beat this place.I'll be returning in September and am hoping to get a room.

great place to party. We didn't stay in the hotel part, but we did come out for the Beach Club which was excellant. It was so much fun and very energetic. I totally reccommend coming out on Fridays around 10:30 or 11 to get a get spot. One of our best nights in Playa del Carmen. i highly recommend coming out for a night here. But beware, if you are use to your resort being all inclusive and ordering up like that, your bill very add up fast.

muy bueno. My husband and I just returned from a terrific week at the Blue Parrot Hotel. Our room was at the beach end of the regular hotel section (room 311 - I highly recommend it), and we absolutely loved it. It was a good size studio (with kitchenette) with charming, cozy decor, excellent air-conditoning, books on the shelf, lovely, clean bathroom, and a fantastic little patio with an exceptional view of the blue sea. The beautiful architecture of the hotel building makes for a really wonderful backdrop and great feeling in general. We never had any problem with noise from the beach bar... I'm surprised to hear that people have that problem. I just never heard it loudly. We did have a lot of banging from the next-door construction project, starting as early as 8 am and lasting all day. But we generally got up and out of our room at that time anyway, so it really never became a big problem. I could see it being one if you sleep late. We're more of the late afternoon nap types, and by then it had generally quieted. There is an enormous amount of construction going on all around the hotel, but it didn't really bother us. The beach was great (once again, lots of construction noise as they rebuilt the beach bar palapa that burned down, but what are you gonna do? It looked like they would be done with that project soon so it shouldn't be a problem much longer.) Otherwise we enjoyed the beach a ton. Drink service was good, nice music at perfect volume. Chairs are very comfortable and were always available. Nice people around us, not loud jerk types. The waves are very minimal at the beach here, and there are a number of fishing and diving boats at water's edge, so it's not quite the unspoiled ocean beach that some might be looking for (just up the beach at Shangri-La area the beach is a liitle more like that type; Tulum even more so), but the water was lovely clear blue, sand was soft and ambience beautifully relaxing. We just loved being in the middle of everything but still in a beautiful, relaxed environment.Our only real negative opinion of the Blue Parrot was the restaurant, mediocre at best with very spotty service, which was strange because service everywhere else throughout the hotel was excellent. We didn't really care, though, because it was fun to go up to the main drag for coffe/breakfast (Java Joe's and Hot Bakery were excellent), and Playa Maya restaurant just down the beach was terrific for lunch. Oh, one more thing: The guest services guy was annoying, trying to rope you into wasting some of your vacation time at some sleazy property sales pitch/time share presentation. He kept approaching us by name, and called us at our room, to try to convince us of what great free incentives he had to give us. Ugh. I can only imagine how disturbingly aggressive the sales-pitch people are at the actual presentation if the hotel guy was this bad. It just seems so crummy that they disguise it as "Guest Services." The only service we got was lip service. Advice: Stay away!All in all we thought the Blue Parrot was wonderful and a very good value. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, especially in that exact room which we felt was ideal for us. The hotel is just so pretty, and the location simply can't be beat for those who like to walk around town and feel like they are part of it rather than set away at a big resort.

I liked it...but don't stay in the Suites section!!. Me and my boyfriend (late 20's) stayed at the BP for new years for a few days. We booked the Suites area of the hotel thinking it would be nicer than the hotels right on the beach.
